review: Perfect place to stay in Barcelona.. We spent 9 nights there. Clean spacious rooms, good service. The staff were very helpful and spoke good english. I recommand definitely worth the money. We will visit again
title: Perfect

review: We are a family of 5 we stayed at Casa Camper for 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a suite which has a double bed, sofa bed and hammock which slept 4 and then a standard room that had a double bed and a separate 'lounge' which had a single bed/sofa in it. The 24hr buffet worked a treat the kids loved it. There is a basement area with a bar, seating and pool tables. The roof terrace has an outdoor seating and honesty bar and a rainforest shower. Having never been to Barcelona this waste perfect place to stay.
title: Excellent

review: It truly felt like coming home when we came through the doors of Casa Camper! We were just a wee bit afraid that things might have changed since the marvelous Susanna Martin had left the helm BUT she had trained the staff well and our beloved Georgina was there to welcome us and show us that Casa Camper was just as FANTABULOUS as ever. Having been in the air FOREVER with 3 layovers all I wanted was FOOD and PROTEIN and Georgina led me right to their clever 'automat' set-up where I scarfed down a yummy sandwich wrap, etc. Feeling revived, we headed up to our lovely room and then out the door to get our first glimpse of Las Ramblas which is SO close. Casa Camper is beautifully located and the staff goes out of its way to give you info on wherever to want to go and whatever you want to see. And the chef! Well, words can't even begin to describe the breakfasts but if you go away hungry then there is something seriously wrong with YOU! All I can say is that if there was a Casa Camper in EVERY city where we travelled and Georgina could clone herself then I would never have to research our hotel choices again. This is a no-brainer in my book!
title: SO SO Happy to Be BACK!

review: This hotel is ideally placed within reasonable distance of all the major attractions and just a stones throw from Las Ramblas. The hotel staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. The facility of a free help yourself refreshment facility for most of the day was very welcome after a hot day's sight seeing, and the rooftop terrace with "honesty bar" was lovely and a great place to relax with friends before and/or after dining out.The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and all room equipment and fittings were in good working order.Will definitely stay here again of we return to Barcelona.
title: Nothing was too much trouble

review: Casa Camper Barcelona is a lovely hotel. It is centrally located, the rooms are very comfortable and the staff are extremely friendly and can't do enough for you. The breakfast is varied and you can help yourself to soft drinks and snacks at any time during the day. On the roof terrace they have an honesty bar which works very well. We only stayed three nights but would happily have stayed longer.Our only criticism is that there are only two of these hotels, the other being in Berlin and there is definitely room for many more of them.
title: Definitely Worth Recommending

review: Our room was lovely, comfortable and clean. We could walk almost everywhere. Breakfast had many options and was delicious. There is food and drink, complimentary, available a good portion of the day, and the desk was knowledgeable and friendly. Very consumer friendly and well worth the few extra euros for all the convenience and comfort.
title: Fabulous location, great hosts, delicious and plentiful food

review: We stayed at this hotel and will never stay anywhere else in Barcelona again! Service is beyond, rooms are beautify and rooftop is to die for. With only 28 rooms this is genuinely a boutique hotel bliss
title: The perfect hotel

review: Casa Camper is truly special and unique. I spent 8 nights here and it became home. I had the Corner Suite and it was incredible. Space, comfort, light filled, and the most heavenly bed. Did I say the bed...yes, that bed is the best I have had in all my travels.The team is amazing and they make a stay at this property feel full of warmth. Just incredible...Enzo, Francesco, Valentina, Morgan, Isa and so many more. I cannot remember everyone's name, but truly the team here is a gift. Plus, the Pepe (Manager of the Hotel) is so wonderful.The breakfast is excellent, and the wonderful team member from Argentina who prepares the meals is so so kind and will get you anything you want -- eggs, pancakes, whatever...The rooftop terrace of this property, honest bar and 24 hours snack area really make Casa Camper feel like it is your home. This is my new "home" when I return to Barcelona! Thank you Casa Camper team!
title: Home in Barcelona!

review: The location is very convenient. You're only a short walk to La Ramblas. The desk staff was nice but the manager was useless. The air conditioning wasn't working but no one came to fix it the first night. I tried to open the window for air but it is so loud all night long from the foot traffic below. When the manager finally came to my room 24 hours later, after I complained a 3rd time, he was rude and tried to insinuate that it was my fault that the AC wasn't working, as opposed to a dead battery in the wall switch. I would not stay there again.
title: Small and loud

review: Having booked this hotel as part of a package and then looking at the reviews in detail we were very apprehensive before we went regarding the comments about being unsafe. However, we really loved our stay in Hotel Alba. The hotel is 3* in that it is a little tired in its decor in places however the room was of a very good size, there was a fridge, chairs, suitcase stand and a comfy double bed. The bathroom was also of a very good size. Everywhere was neat and clean. The rooms were cleaned every day with new towels and new bedding every day which was unnecessary but lovely all the same! The cleaners and reception staff were very friendly and helpful we even got a little present of turrón as we left. The location is superb - 2 minutes from the metro Liceu and from Las Ramblas. Yes this does make it loud outside at night - but if you do the same amount of exploring and walking as us in the day- you will sleep regardless. Plus the room has great air conditioning that we didn't even open the windows or use the balcony even with the weather being 30/31C. Yes, the side street is probably used for certain indecent activities but this is Spain and the streets, even this one, is busy at gone 11:30, and there are plenty of people walking about. The hotel is keycard access only and there was always a friendly smiley face at the desk to great you when you were heading out or coming back. You need to be safe around the whole of this area for Pick Pockets etc, but there is no reason to be too concerned about the area for it to ruin your holiday. All in all we loved out stay and would stay here again
title: A really good 3* hotel.

review: This hotel promised a lot, however we had a few hiccups. The front desk ladies were lovely and extremely helpful, however the owner (?) is an elderly gentleman who got involved in a dispute we had. I was unable to pay with my travel credit card (loaded with Euros), as it came up on the payment screen with the option to pay in my jo currency. I said no as I didn't have any of my home currency on the card, just Euros, but they wouldn't accept it. I had to go down the road and get cash out (costing me fees) instead of using my card like I normally would (in every other place). It seems like the owner runs his business before the computer was invented, with piles of folders behind the desk with all the paperwork. I felt sorry for the girls working there! Another issue we had was that our room was in another part of the building, so we had to pass through two locked doors (with difficult locks) to get to our room. We also had no way of looking outside, as we had double windows (open one to reveal more frosted glass), which was very claustrophobic!! The room itself was fine, although the handheld shower was a pain.
title: More hassle than it was worth

review: I stayed here last week and can't fault anything about this hotel. It's incredibly basic and you get what you pay for. Me and my partner knew we only wanted a basic hotel as we'd be out exploring most of the day and night and didn't want to spend a lot of money on a hotel we would hardly be spending time in. As as said, very basic room but nothing I can fault at all. Beds were comfy, room was a reasonable size and always cleaned and tidied, large doors which opened onto a balcony. Only thing I would criticise is the size of the bathroom but then again, we got what we paid for. Shower was never one temperature but that was okay for me as it was so hot I couldn't decide if I wanted a cold or warm shower! If you want a good night's sleep then take ear plugs! The hotel is located on a busy street in the heart of the city and you can hear drinkers and people on nights out until the early hours of the morning. All in all this is a nice little hotel perfect for those who, like me and my partner, just want somewhere to put their head at night and have a shower.
title: Lovely little hotel in the heart of the city

hotelLocation: C/ Simon Oller, 1 Principal, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: hostel in itself was clean and tidy and the night manager was lovely.however what i can only imagine was the cleaner as he was the only one with keys decided to use my bank cards (which i stupidly left in the room) and do some online shopping!! the day manager refused to accept this was the case even though i had messages from my bank and told me no-one had been in the room- although the room was cleaned and the bed made!!! so they try and rob you but at least they clean your room!!! would not recommend as this ruined our whole stay!!!!
title: Room was robbed!!

review: We decided to go to Barcelona at the last moment. So it was almost imposible to find a room. The Hostal Paris solved the problem although they only had a room with a shared bathroom everyday the bathroom was clean. We never had a problem with a busy bathroom. The checkin was good and the employees were very helpful and attentive. The hostal is close to everything and public transportation is very accesible. Near food, shops, pharmacy, bus stop, metro station, important site seeing everything is close.
title: Spur of the moment booking!

review: This is a one-star hotel and it is clean. The rooms need a little update but the bathrooms need a redo. There is no coffee/tea maker inside the room. Near to the Valldaura metro station and the bus stops just outside. The breakfast is included and it is enough to start the day. The staff is very friendly and helpful.
title: Nice enough

review: Good things: good location ner subway and la rambla, quite cheap hotel, bathroom quite fresh and they cleaned the room everyday. Friendly staff!Cons: our specific room had a not so modern design with old furnitures and had not been renovated for many years. Also, very noicy from the streets outside and the other hotel rooms (not soundproof at all), but this mainly bothered us during the weekend and not the weekdays. When you use the bathroom there is zero soundproof for the rest of the hotel room.You get what you pay for, and we think it worked quite well since we wanted something cheap and central.
title: Cheap hotel

review: We slept five nights, it near the main touristic street La Rambla, good public transport, close to the beach. Its very clean, very very kind and friendly staff:) We have a wifi all time in the room. Only thing i don't understand is that room has balcony but you cant step on it because you only have big window but no door :D maybe its because the safety.
title: Small, but nice and clean :)

review: This was an answer provided by hostel after arriving to the spot with booking confirmation code and pin received from Booking.com Maybe it is not entirely hostel's fault that overbooking occurred - room was booked ~an hour before arrival (due to missed flight), but still - it happened around the midnight for super tired person. Or maybe it is a policy of the hostel?Anyway - not the experience I would wish for anyone.When traveling I wish to believe, that confirmation of booking means that I have a roof over my head, otherwise we're screwed...
title: "Sorry, we are overbooked"

review: I searched in booking.com for a reasonable price hotel in Barcelona and one of those oprions was "HOTEL" Barbara!I booked it as a hotel but when i entered to my room i felt i decieved!!It was not a hotel but was just a hostel and a very dirty, noisy, smelly one!I never had a quite time there and the smell of cigrattes was in my room all the time.I never recomend it because if i wanted a hostel i could choose too many better options in the town...
title: It is a dirty noisy hostel not a hotel

review: Clean, friendly, very central, wifi was great, our room was newly done, only one thing was our shower had a shower curtain, not a train smash. We already booked and paid for another 5star hotel otherwise we would've gone back there after our cruise. Since you are only going to sleep there, it is great value for money!
title: Great hotel for location

review: The location is good but the services are very poor. The air conditioning was not functioning only in our room, the smell in the bathroom was awful. The receptionist told us we will have the AC repaired but it remained the same for 3 days. So they told us to just open the window...the cleaning service was very poor
title: Poor services

review: I would like to leave a comment about your hotel. I have to say that I am really disappointed. We are the very first room in the hotel as soon as you come up the stairs for the reception. I can hear every single conversation in the reception and doors slamming all night long. It says in your website that we have Air Con and hair dryer. That's not true. The Air Con if you need to adjust it you have to go to the reception and they would change for you. During the night I was hot and then cold and I didn't want to go the the reception at 4 in the morning to change my AC, as you can imagine. The Hair dryer we have to go the the reception and get one that is shared with at least 5 or 6 other rooms. There are no windows at all. Nothing was saying in your website about the absence of windows. There is barely a door between the room and the toilet which is very uncomfortable. The shower is awful, the doors barely close, is very small and some of the functions are not working. The TV is literally so high (almost on the sealing) that if I am in bed I can not see anything. I can already tell you it's the first and the last time I will be staying in your hotel.
title: Avoid this place

review: Can here for a 4 day break before my husband undergoes surgery and wont be able to travel. Awful hotel. Dirty and dusty room. Hairs in the bathtub mould on the room wall and bathroom and worst part the AC in our room doesn't work!
title: Awful

review: Stayed here en route to Benecassium music festival and had a day to see the sights of Barcelona. The hotel was clean, very basic and with air conditioning. The location was excellent and a 5 minute walk from segrada familia. There was WiFi and a luggage storage facility. If you are just passing through then I'd recommend staying here. If you are staying longer then you may want a few more luxuries. The only downside to the hotel was that it was lacking in sound proofing and you could hear people outside and upstairs.
title: Basic Hotel

review: Very good hotel i would rate it 5 Stars if the wall wasnt so thin u can hear every single world happen next rooms and specially if you are in the ground floor in addition there is no refrigerator in rooms
title: Nice hotel

review: Good location with easy access to metro. All staff were very friendly and helpful from start to finish.However there was only 1 flat pillow per bed. We stayed four nights and old towels and rubbish wasn't taken out or toilet roll renewed for the whole time we stayed. I had to go downstairs to reception twice to ask the receptionist to get us towels and toilet roll-two very basic things in my opinion.She seemed annoyed when I went down the first day that it hadn't been done by accommodation staff yet it happened again the following day again. Nice,clean,basic rooms. Great power in the shower.Building work nearby acted as alarm clocks at 7 o'clock most mornings and people coming in an out of other rooms on the corridor could be heard.
title: Okay for the price you pay

review: Awesome location right in the center of barri gotic and close to the metro station jaume I. Rooms are basic and windows not that well isolated, we were still easily able to sleep in our room on the 4th floor.
title: Good location

review: A clean compact room no luxuries but great bathroom.Room six floor quiet no view couldn't open window but air conditionedBreakfast dire lots of choice but unfortunately none that we would like to eat. It was the staff that was the biggest issue, half were helpful and the other half particularly those at breakfast were downright unpleasant and rude.A good location .
title: A tale of two halves

review: We visited the Gran Hotel Barcino early July 2017 for three nights. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of the Gothic quarter. We had a room on the second floor, it was simple and clean and had floor to ceiling windows that opened to a small balcony - gorgeous! We did not pay for breakfast as there are so many local cafe's. The staff were really friendly and the safe only costs 2 euros a night to hire. Other reviews mention the noise, yes it is noisy at night, especially Friday and Saturday night, but after a few Estrella's and Mojito's I was flat out so it wasn't an issue! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be going back.
title: Absolutely fantastic location but don't bother if you like it quiet!

review: Visited for 4 nights as a group of 3 females in mid July. The location of this hotel is absolutely excellent & cannot be faulted; right in the heart of the Gothic Quarter with numerous cafés, bars, restaurants and shops all within a stones throw. Within walking distance of Las Ramblas, the beach and we also walked to the Sagrada Familia. (The latter took about 40 minutes but was a pleasant walk through Barcelona.)The room was basic with 3 single beds but was clean, spacious, had a large bathroom and a small balcony. The safe is €2 a night and is payable on departure.The staff on reception were extremely helpful when we struggled to check in for our flight online. (Also a taxi to the airport from here is approx €35 and takes 15 minutes) There is one downside to this hotel and that's the noise. If you sleep well like us then this will not be a problem but if not then remember your earplugs!All in all a basic, clean hotel in an excellent location with fab reception staff. Would highly recommend
title: Location, Location, Location!

review: Booked through Hotwire - big mistake this time since hotel's web had better price and included breakfast. We got a nice room almost on top floor. Not very big, but nice and clean. Buffet breakfast was good with a perfect choice for us to. Staff in the reception very helpful with all kind of information. It's not situated that close to 'Las Ramblas' but we like to walk and "feel" a city, so it was ok.
title: Close to train station and nice hotel

review: I stayed for 2 nights in this hotel. Great location on the corner of La Rambla. Many restaurants and shops. In front of metro station, and 2 min walking to Aerobus.The room is old and dusty. the AC is too noisy. the bed is hard and not comfort at all, and the staff is not friendly.
title: old and dusty hotel in a great location

review: I am delighted i booked the Monegal. It is right on the Plaza Catalyuna only steps away from the Ramblas. This is the area you want to be in. The hotel is basic, no frills, small rooms butperfect ofr me for a 4 day stay. It is clean and quiet at a good price. There is a very generous breakfast offered as well. I would certainly stay here again as I hope to visit this glorious city again.
title: Location! Location!

hotelLocation: Ronda de Sant Pere 24, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Since years I was staying in your hotel. After opening it was really good value for money in a perfect location and really im the centre. Location is still great, but despite of that everything else worsen. Neither the rooms or the Hotel has undergone any renovation or replacement. The walls are dirty and full of spots (in the Restaurant as well), need some new paint. The furniture is partly broken and need some paint or replacement as well. The included breakfast is a great idea and used to be really nice,but now, the area for breakfast is dirty, nothing is refilled, flies everywhere, the handle of the breadcontainer is broken etc. Why did you stop it, that the guest select one pastry or sandwich from the bar? Why did you stop that the guest orders his coffee from the bar and serve now bad filter coffee in a thermos? During our 4 days stay the bed linen got changed only once, probably, because we asked. The floor in the room and bathroom was not cleaned at all in those 4 days! The staff working at reception was not really helpful, Neither interested to make our stay and time in Barcelona to a good experience. Also I booked a double room and we got a mini tiny room. On the evacuation plan this room was asssinged as a single room but reception said it is a double room and showed again no effort to give any alternatives. I am really disappointed, that after so many years and stays your hotel is now like that.Maybe a change in the management? Probably this will be my last stay in your Hotel ever and i will stop to recommend it, like i did for years now.
title: Disappointed - After many years and stays

hotelLocation: Ronda de Sant Pere 24, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: We spent 1 night out of 6 intended on this hotel, because it was so noisy and very dirty. The ceiling in the batroom was moldy, the bed mattress smelled of vomit, and the drinking glasses were not washed at all from the previous guests. After one night we cancelled the rest of our stay and moved to a different hotel. Disgusting place.
title: Terribly dirty and noisy hotel

hotelLocation: Ronda de Sant Pere 24, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is located near the Place de Catalunya which is just a walking distance from La Ramba, marina, Sagrada Familia and many other tourist attractions. You can leave your luggage at the reception and the hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. They borrowed us a phone charger and gave some paracetamol late on a Saunday evening when shops were closed. There is a restaurant next door where the breakfast is served. It's basic but good and includes tea/coffee, water, milk and cereals, croissant, bread, ham, cheese and fruit.
title: Great location and price

hotelLocation: Ronda de Sant Pere 24, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed in Barcelona for three nights with our family. The hotel is in a great location, just steps away from a metro station. The staff in the hotel was friendly and helpful. The rooms are very small (no room for luggage/kids stroller) and a bit worn out. Luckily we had a small balcony and a bit more room there. If you're staying in Barcelona for a short time, want to be in a central location with a budget and you're planning to stay in your room for just the nights, I quess this is an ok place for that.
title: Great location and helpful staff - good for a short stay

review: This hotel is in a perfect location with a a very modern & stylish building.However, the rooms are small & claustrophobic ...made all the more difficult by very poor lighting design.On this occasion our refrigerator did not function & our air conditioning was below par......Management offered no solution......except by sending a supervisor up to see us , who could not speak English.Stains were evident on the lip of the bath...suggesting a poor level of cleanliness.Due to not having a functioning refrigerator , we requested an ice bucket for our wine.......This hotel does not have an ice bucket.Ideally one should have the capacity to communicate in Spanish in order to make any level of communication ( ie, complaint )successful......All in all one had the impression that guests were secondary to managements expectations....in other words the guests did not rate.Of all the places that we have stayed in, around the world, THIS ,was the worst.A very disappointing end to our holiday in Spain,leaving a bad taste in our memory bank.Regretfully,John . E.
title: "Faulty Towers"

review: Booked the hotel because of its location whIch is OK .However the rooms were v small for the price ,in our first room there was black mould around the bath,The view from the window was a brick wall there was construction work going on. Room service was poor ,pillow case changed in such a way that it was not put on properly causing crease and discomfort,.Alternative pillow in cupboard hadn't been cleaned and were smelly and unusable bathroom accessories not replaced ,towels not changed , room window left open during day,presumably to save on ac costs, letting in mosquitoes that bit causing considerable discomfort. AC itself was weak and ineffective.Staff were hit in miss some grumpy some helpful
title: 2star treatment at 4star hotel

review: At arrival we got some confused information that the first night our booking had been changed to a nearby hotel. If we accepted these changes we were promised a compensation for this inconvenience. The hotel also assured us that everything was taken care of, no need for payment etc. at the “spare hotel”. Despite the assurance from Sansi Diputació we were requested to pay at check out from the spare hotel, both for the stay and the breakfast, both already payed for. At return to Sansi Diputació no one had any knowledge about the compensation.All the discussions, additional check-in/check-out, packing/unpacking, transport etc took significant amount of time and energy. Despite repeated contact from both our side and hotel.de the hotel has not responded or given any additional explanations or apologies and we never saw any refund/compensation.The breakfast that you can add to your stay is not worth the money. Save this and buy your breakfast at some nearby café instead.I also recommend to avoid this hotel due to the customer treatment.
title: Bad treatment

review: I had booked this hotel a few months before the visit. Once I arrived, they told me there were no rooms for me as they'd accidentally overbooked. Now this is annoying but I know all hotels do it, so I can't fault them for this. They did give us free drinks and taxi'd us to another hotel relatively close by. They had told me to get a receipt from the other hotel for breakfast so that they can refund me too. This was all sounding great. Even gave me a card with a number to call in the morning so they could arrange a taxi to take our bags back over and put them in the room for us.So morning comes around. I get my receipt, call the number on the card and i'm met with "This number has not yet been assigned to an agent". The staff at the Illunion hotel were fantastic and helped get in touch with the Sansi hotel, only to find out that they had no record of me needing a room, or for them to pick up my stuff. After a bit of back and forth and the Sansi staff calling a manager, they realised they were supposed to give me a room and pick us up. We dropped our bags off and headed out for the day. The Sansi Hotel is in a great location (25 minute walk to the docks). Upon returning to the hotel, we checked in and I asked about the refund. The person on the front desk told me they had heard nothing about getting a refund and would need to talk to a manager, then they would get back to me. They then went and got our bags out of a back cupboard (the bags we were told would be left in our new room). The guy then told us to wait in reception whilst they checked for a room. It seemed as if he was searching the bottom floor for a room that was vacant, as if they didn't know where they'd put me. We got in to the room. Got settled and went to sleep. The room itself seemed very modern. I've seen a lot of complaints about space, the room wasn't huge but fine for what it was. Very nice bathroom. Overall very clean. The only downside was the view. All we could see was a concrete courtyard and directly across from our room was the breakfast area. So we needed the curtains closed at all times otherwise people could just peer in. The aircon doesn't really work. It keeps the room at a solid 23 degrees. At least it turns on though, I can only imagine how unbearable the heat would have been without it. Also, the wifi is terrible. I didn't go on holiday to sit on the internet, would have been nice to be able to load up maps or websites for things to do though. Ended up using my own mobile data which was only getting a "H+" signal, which was still faster than their wifi. We get up and head out for our second day of barcelona sun. When we get back there's a new person on the desk, who when I ask about the refund says the same as the first. It's as if the staff just pack in their shift and head home without leaving any notes for any one else. As we headed towards our room on the ground floor, we noticed our room door was wide open. So I head back to reception to ask when the cleaners were in because they've left our door open. The staff member came down to the door and starts to open and close it to show that it works. Clearly not understanding what I meant. After a few rounds of the door being opened and closed, he finally understood that someone had left it wide open, potentially all day. Their only response was "Do you not use the safe?". Well yes, but I don't put everything in there. Anyone could have came in to the room, it's just off the reception so staff would have thought nothing of someone walking in and out.They said they'd speak to the cleaners and ask them to be more careful. After overbooking my room, not being able to give me a refund. Forgetting to come get our luggage and then our room being wide open, we were just done. There was clearly no point in talking to the staff as they just didn't care to actually follow anything up. Any other hotel would have offered some compensation but it was struggle to even get them to say sorry. Every time we went past reception there was someone complaining about something. I feel very bad for the staff, as someone of them seem great. The majority are disinterested with very poor customer service ability. It wasn't until we were checking out that we finally got our refund. They actually asked for the receipt which I'd already handed in a week earlier. Then couldn't find it. We only got the money back due to simply waiting them out. By far the worst hotel experience I've ever had. It may be in a great location but the price would warrant a nice relaxing time. Instead we were stressed from start to finish, with no confidence in the staff. Really, reaaally look around before booking here. There's plenty better hotels out there with less stars.
title: No Communication

review: Hotel staff were very friendly and helped us out when Expedia cancelled our booking without our knowledge! They found us a room and kept the price of our original booking. The room was great and included air con. It is a bit far from the city so Iif I was travelling to Barcelona again I'd probably stay a bit closer to las Ramblas.
title: Ideal

hotelLocation: Arc de Sant Ramon del Call, 4, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Nice and cosy, small hotel at Barri Gothic. Nice and helpfull personnel. 24 hours of reception. Close to Rambla. Clean but small rooms. Just in the midle of the best of Barca. Old building with ancient athmospere.
title: Nice and cosy hotel

hotelLocation: Arc de Sant Ramon del Call, 4, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Had a lovely 3 night stay at Hotel Call. All staff very friendly and helpful. Room was small but plenty big enough for sleeping & getting ready (who wants to be sat in a hotel room when you're in a place like Barcelona?!)...the room was clean and had everything we needed. Works are going on in the hotel, not that we noticed, so all good.Location was fantastic for Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter. Easy to navigate our way around. Would definitely go back to this hotel.
title: Great Location, Clean Facilities

hotelLocation: Arc de Sant Ramon del Call, 4, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: I really loved my stay here, friendly desk staff, spacious room with equally spacious bathroom. A great place to stay, located behind the Barcelona Cathedral in the center of the gothic quarter a two minute walk to La Rambla.Awesome!
title: A great place to stay in the middle of the Gothic quarter

review: We booked our room at the hotel through secret rooms and were promised a 4 star hotel in a central location.This hotel is definitely not 4 star. The rooms are very dated and small and are desperately in need of refurbishment. What was supposed to be a double bed was 2 singles pushed together.There are a few positives, the staff at the hotel are very polite and friendly. The location of the hotel is excellent, within walking distance of the beach and most major attractions. Unfortunately this doesn't compensate for the hotels faults. Our room wasn't cheap for the 4 nights we stayed. I wouldn't stay here again.
title: Disappointing hitel

review: I stayed here as a business trip, and can honestly say that Barcelona is a fantastic city, this hotel really is only to be used as a base to visit the city.Rooms were OK, breakfast was OK, all just OK.Clean and good value though so I'd go back in a heartbeat.Overall perfectly serviceable..
title: Business Trip - nothing special

review: This is a very nice hotel on a reasonable price! The location is good in terms of interesting sights and metro stops. Although the hotel is located on the top of a hill which might be an issue for people with difficulty walking there is a flat walk to a metro station about 5 min away. I would recommend this hotel of a nice quiet stay.
title: A very nice hotel!

review: I was visiting Barcelona for 3 nights for a conference.This hotel was down from £300(approx) a night to approx £100 a night so I went with that despite it being a bit further from my conference than I'd have liked.On arrival I was pretty pleased I hadn't paid £300 a night. There is nothing wrong with the hotel inside etc but it certainly wouldn't have been worth that price.The staff member on reception was friendly enough.Having dropped my bags off an popped out for food I returned around 10pm hoping to get some sleep ready for day 1 of the conference.1 am I was still trying!!! The hotel is based on the corner of a busy road with 3 junctions and a set of traffic lights.The city is very busy with mopeds which are of course fairly loud and with the lights you get them pulling off with the noise of the acceleration.After 2 nights of this and upon my conference finishing I decided there was no point staying for another bad nights sleep before flying home the next day at additional cost to myself.With the wasted nights cost of around £100 and the additional £80 to change my flights I was left out of pocket. It found be fair to say the lack of sleep impacted my conference.Was a little bit narked that when I went downstairs to tell the reception lad I was leaving a night early because of the noise from the road he just nodded and said OK.Don't like leaving bad reviews but given the location alongside the road this hotel would be worth avoiding, especially at full price!
title: Re-arranged flight to come home early due to noise from road

review: We stayed here for 1 night before starting off on our summer vacation. We are regulars to Barcelona and know the city pretty well. We booked last minute and didn't want to spend a fortuneIf you want a great location in the middle of all the classic sights, restaurants and nightlife at a cheaper price this is a good choice. The hotel is clean and the service adequate.That said, the hotel is dated, and you will hear street noise. When we were there the Wifi was really bad and pretty useless. Annoying for 2017.
title: Great location, good price but tired

review: We looked at a dozen hotels before selecting the Regencia Colon. Located next to its upscale sister, "The Colon", for a fraction of the price.We took a taxi from the airport for 29€ and were dropped off at the square, steps away from the front of the hotel. I was concerned about other hotels located on closed narrow, hidden streets, and was relieved to see the Regencia so close and visible from the street and square.In fact, that is the beauty and genius of this hotel, it is 25 metres from the main square. Within 60 seconds you are in the middle of everything that is Barcelona. We arrived and walked straight down to the beach (15-20 mins). But it felt even shorter as we wandered through the Gothic Quarter, down past the pier, and onto sandy beach.The Rambla and lunch at the Boqueria were 10 mins away. So is the open public square, Placa Reial, where we had dinner. It was a longer walk to the Sagrada the next day (30 mins), but time passed quickly as we strolled up Passeig de Gracia to view the architecture and visit the shops. Next time, we'll take the Metro back from the Sagrada to Placa de Catalunya. The location was key, as we came back to the hotel for late afternoon siestas before heading out for dinner.But, this is a review of the hotel, not a travel guide. And so, let me say that check-in was made very easy and welcoming by Anselmo. We were in room 155. Right above the Hotel Regencia sign. It was comfortable, clean and quiet. See attached picture.I was travelling with my young daughter and safety was a key concern at night. We felt very safe and regularly sat in the square with a gelato watching public performances and dancing with 100's of other tourists before crossing to the other side of the square and retiring to the comfort and close proximity of the Regencia.Price was important to us, and we were able to secure a fee well under most comparable hotels, for such a prime location. And as you can see, wifi is critical for young guests! And allowed me to plan each day on Google maps.If you are looking for a roof top pool and super fancy, modernistic rooms and gym facilities, then this may not be the hotel for you. But if you are looking for very friendly staff, an excellent price, and the best location in the city, you may want to consider the Regencia Colon.I would recommend this hotel to my friends in a heartbeat. I hope that you have a similar good experience as we did and enjoy the beauty that is Barcelona.AlainCANADA
title: Location, Location, Location !

review: I have stayed here a couple of times and never disappoints me. The staff is very good and very helpful at recommending restaurants or sorting taxis and other arrangments. The rooms are a bit dated but clean and comfortable. A quiet hotel even though is very close to the cathedral, Las Ramblas, and all the great eating, entertainment and shopping streets. Breakfast is basic and could be improved with a better selection of pastries. I would bring my family here. Is also close to the airport bus which is a very effective way to travel to the airport.
title: Nice no-frills hotel in the gothic centre close to the cathedral

review: This hotel is the perfect location and it was not too expensive. However, the rooms are incredibly dated. They look like you walked into the 1950s and this really brings down the vibe of the stay. The AC worked great, which was a big concern for me since it was so humid. The water pressure was amazing in the shower and the staff was SO friendly and wonderful. They delivered champagne and chocolates to our room since we were on our honeymoon. Honestly, I loved the location and staff, but if I could find something comparable in price nearby, I might try that next time. If they would just change the window drapes, bed cover, and the old fashioned little arm chairs (horribly stained), even just those changes would be a big upgrade!
title: Location is key!

review: While the location of this hotel is right in the middle of everything, the price is still expensive for the type of rooms you get. The hotel was always clean - a positive. But the staff and breakfast are very sub-par.
title: Good Location but needs updates

review: The hotel offers adequate rooms in a good location (central, close to transport, shopping and various sites).The big minus: we were charged twice for our two night stay. We paid cash upon checking out and then our credit card was charged a few days later. We are now $360 AUD plus $10 card fees out of pocket. If staying here be careful re payments. Also, breakfast was crap.
title: Ripped off (charged twice room)

hotelLocation: Av. Portal de l'Angel, 24, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel was a great find in the city of Barcelona. We were so well located---close to shopping, restaurants and bars, city sights, and the beach. We took public transport to and from the airport which was so easy. We were also able to walk a lot, which is a great way to discover the city. We felt nothing but safe throughout our stay. They have a 24 hour desk and you have to buzz in during the late hours. If you wish, they can keep your passports in a safe free of charge. While the furnishings are older, the hotel is very well kept. The room was clean. We stayed in a private room with a full bathroom. Our room was basic--two towels, two bars of soap, and a fan. What else do you really need though?All staff at the hotel were more than helpful! A special thanks to Marc Antoni---he was so kind and friendly!On a future trip to BCN, I have no doubt where I will be staying.
title: Fantastic stay at Hostal Lausanne!!

review: A good value for money indeed . Rooms are big enough , yet not very modern ( there is no fridge ! ) . Bathroom are big too , just bring your shampoo because they dont provide any . Bed is very conformable and AC works properly . I tried their buffet breakfast only once ( it was fair enough for the 10 euro price they charge for it ) . Just ask for a room that does not have a view on the street for less noise in the morning . Location is good and close to all touristic attractions . Recommended if you are on a tight budget in Barca
title: A good value for money

review: I was not happy with the lack of cleanliness for this hotel. The cleaning staff did not change the sheets or pillow cases once in my 3 night stay. Even when I pulled the sheets off the bed and put them on the floor with the dirty towels, they were put right back on the bed each time. The bathtub was moldy and wouldn't drain the water, neither did the sink. The elevators did not work much at all. I ended using the stairs for fear I would get stuck. Our window view was of a dirty alley and brick wall. The breakfast was decent enough. I would not stay again at all.
title: Not a comfortable stay at all

review: This hotel is well located, clean and adequate, so long as you're not planning to spend much time in your room. Beds hard. Bathroom fine. All very clean, staff friendly and helpful. I had a lot of trust BoE with room keys not working, but staff always helpful about it.
title: Good location

review: This is just a follow-up to my previous paragraph on Serennia. All went well. The person met us with the keys on time. We had a great week. The apartment was spotlessly clean. The balconies gave a lovely view of Barcelona street activity. We have already booked Serennia for next year.
title: Great Appartment in great location

hotelLocation: Calle Nou de la Rambla 50, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: GOODLocation. Good bakery next door for breakfast. That's it.BADThe room was tiny, little bigger than the double bed. There is nowhere to put your luggage, let alone unpack.The sink had a large flat bottom and drained very slowly, so anything in it, like toothpaste, settled on the bottom and would not rinse away. The same for the shower in the shared bathroomThere was no hot water at all at times, sometimes it was cool, or moderately warm. never hot.There was only 1 electric socket and it was over the sink! In a room for 2 people? My phone is not waterproof, neither is my camera. There was a 1 to 3 adapter, but...The electricity supply was unreliable. My camera was not fully charged after hours, the same with my phone. At first, I thought it was the 1 to 3 adapter causing a bad connection. But it was the same when I plugged direct into the socket. I could see the power light going off on my camera. Then I thought it could be the charger, but it did not happen at all when I plugged it into a socket in a nearby bakery. So it was the socket in the room!The "lift" was very slow and was blocked from use by the cleaners in the morning. I needed the use of the lift as I cannot carry heavy weights for long distances I had to carry my luggage down 5 flights on check-out because the cleaners were using the lift.The cleaners cleaned the bathroom at 8:30 on a Saturday morning and were VERY LOUD. It sounded like they were cleaning with a hammer or a pick axe.One bathroom was shared with 5 rooms, more than I've seen in other places.WIFI was very patchy and slow, not good.There are better places for a much better price in the area. Never again!
title: Great location, everything else terrible!

review: Everything about this hotel exceeded my expectations. The location is ideal for exploring (walking distance to the Gothic area, the medieval synagogue in the Jewish quarter, markets, Las Ramblas, Gaudi's Casa Batlo, fabulous restaurants, cafes, the big plaza, and shopping on Passeig de Gracia); the building beautifully renovated and chic, breakfast superb, and the room had all the comforts of home plus. What really makes it special however is the amazing staff. Everyone--from the front desk, doormen, bell hop, and waiters to the manager--went out of their way to be beyond helpful and genuinely kind during our four night stay. If I am lucky enough to be in Barcelona again, I will definitely stay at the Grand Hotel Central.
title: Exquisite hotel and staff

review: From the moment we walked thru the doors, our stay could not of been better! We arrived on their opening day. Everyone was so friendly and kind. Marjorie at the front desk was great. Check in was smooth and fast. We got a great last minute deal on our room. We loved all the small details in the room, from the pencil and notepad, the to-go coffee cups & the pillow menu! If you want a specific pillow, not a problem! We took advantage of their continental breakfast. Great way to start the day. One of the servers Paola gave us some great recommendations on restaurants and bars, Thanks again Paola! The hotel is in a great location, we walked everywhere. The beach was about a 15-20 min walk. The rooftop pool was a great way to cool down after a day at the beach. The ice cream floaties were a nice touch as well! We can't wait to visit Barcelona and Yurbban Passage again! Thank you for a GREAT stay!
title: Well done Yurbban Passage, well done!!

review: This excellent hotel has a great location and a very helpful staff. The swimming pool has an amazing view. I wrote down my room-preferences when I made the booking and the very friendly man who checked me in, made a successful effort to make me happy. Someone else whose service stood out was the doorman, Alonso, who gave me some good suggestions for exploring the area by foot on the night all the taxis in Barcelona striked. One suggestion for improvement: I was not impressed by the quality of the food and coffee at the breakfast buffet.
title: Excellent service

review: What an incredible experience. I could not fault this hotel - the location, the room, the staff, the breakfast and the amazing roof top pool made it the best hotel I have stayed in, anywhere in the world. There's not a lot I can add apart from, I will be back!
title: Perfection. The best hotel I have stayed in

review: 1 week really wasn't long enough in this hotel. We were greeted so warmly by all staff. When we checked in we were offered cava, coffee and water. Our bags taken to our room for us and staff explained all that was needed to know about the room. Rooms were spacious com and clean. Every staff member went above and beyond their job. Asking about our day and certain staff recognising us each day. Breakfast was beautiful and amazing buffet selection perfect for anyone and enough variety to not get bored after a week. The city restaurant offered amazing food service was excellent and food amazing. We felt like we ordered way too much food. But the value for money was incredible. And finally the sky bar, a beautiful pool sun beds and fresh towels. A large range of cocktails and the tapas option in the evening was perfect for a light nibble for 2. Would definitely recommend to anyone and we hope to return in the future
title: Beautiful hotel

review: My husband and I stayed at this amazing hotel for just two nights but we were made to feel so welcome. It was our wedding anniversary and chose this hotel for the central location and rooftop pool area, nothing disappointed and everything exceeded our expectations. Friendly staff throughout the hotel, we were greeted with a glass of cava, a room upgrade and champagne on ice sent to our room. The pool area is breathtaking and we enjoyed our evening set meal too. I would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Barcelona that are hoping for a central location with a sophisticated touch. Thank you Grand Hotel Central you helped my husband and I make some wonderful memories on our anniversary ❤️
title: Superb

hotelLocation: Avda. Cardenal Vidal i Barraquer, 15, 08035 Barcelona, Spain
review: At the end of July 2017 our choir traveled through Spain and we stayed here for three nights. It is relatively inexpensive and a good option if you are traveling in larger groups to save on costs. RoomsThe rooms we stayed in were definitely in need of some refurbishment. The room was quite dated and it had no air-conditioning. This is a bit of a problem because Barcelona is really hot in the summer, even at night time. On the positive side, the rooms are very clean and they bring fresh towels. LocationThis is not the best location as it is quite far outside the city center. There is however a metro station within walking range from the residence. The Residence grounds are kept really neat and they have lovely gardens to walk in and the overall experience was that the campus is quite safe.
title: You get what you pay for.

review: Can't beat the location of this hotel .. right in the middle of the heart of Barcelona. Walking distance to everything. The beach is 15 min walking. You got everything you need in the La rambla. Room was clean and spacious. The guy at the reception was funny and tried his best to help us out planning our trip in terms of sightseeing and what to see. Good value for the money
title: Very decent hotel

review: This hotel it nice enough, very clean. The room was ok, all you need. The bathroom was small.If you are a light sleeper I WOULD NOT recommend!!! We slept here for 3 nights, my husband is the deepest sleeper and even he struggled with the level of noise both from the outside street and also the hotel guested themselves seemed to be of the livelier crowd shall we say. I understand there is going to be more noise with the location of the hotel however the windows are the thinnest iv ever seen and you can hear word for word what's said on the street below. I myself slept with earphones the whole stay.Just do the your research - however if you are a couple looking for nice bars and restaurants I would highly recommend the harbour area!If your looking for a lively non-stop location morning, noon and night this is a great place.Also DO NOT EAT OR DRINK ON RAMBLES. Extortionate prices and poor quality everything!
title: Nice enough, not the best value.

review: I stayed here for two nights with my fiancé for a break in Barcelona. I couldn't fault it one bit. The hotel is in the heart of Barcelona just off La Ramblas down an alleyway. The hotel staff were very friendly and welcomed us on our arrival. Our room was very clean and modern, clean towels were also available. The room was very comfortable!Outside the hotel was slightly noisy as there appears to be a pub/club outside the hotel, which could be a problem for some guests.There is a restaurant service meals and snacks, we attended the restaurant for our breakfast and had two cooked breakfasts and coffee costing approx €13.50 each. We both enjoyed the breakfast. The hotel is situated in the heart of Barcelona and we used the nearby underground station just a couple of minutes from the hotel on Las Ramblas and we got around quite a bit of Barcelona and saw some very famous landmarks. An all day ticket costs around €7.00! The underground service is fantastic!On the day of departure, we still had a full day left in Barcelona. Hotel staff were very accommodating and kept our luggage at the hotel for us in a safe place. We came back and forth that day and they allowed to access our luggage at anytime without any problems! All in all - we were very happy with our stay at May Ramblas Hotel and we will definitely be coming back here to stay! Thank you very much to all the staff who made our stay enjoyable!
title: Fabulous hotel!

review: Like in many other industries, lack of skills and improvisation do not bode well for hotel success.At 300 eur / night without breakfast (in line with some of the cheaper but real 4-5 stars..hotels for the same dates ) rip-off is around the corner and bingo!you would expect :- a proper hotel management not some mi-casa-es-su-casa type of experience (in the evening reception closes and check in is delegated to a clueless nice night guardian who only speaks Spanish and takes pictures of your passport with his mobile phone ...ops. Also he has no idea whatsoever of the hotel facility, room features, etc)- some work done to remove the persistent sewage odor from the hotel modest lobby- air conditioning in the room only works while you are in. So, when we arrived, we were greeted by room temp of 31 degrees C. How nice. - no minibar. If you are thirsty during the night you have to convince the night guardian to sell you a bottle- no gym- the usual low pressure water from shower head- icing on the oddness-cake: they close the nice roof terrace + small pool when they feel like it, with no real reason. Very light rain in the morning of July 8, it then stopped at lunch time and in the afternoon and weather turned to sunny spells. At 6pm no chance to access the roof terrace. When asked, the receptionist said they keep lounge chairs covered with plastic to avoid them getting wet. And he told me it reopens at manager's discretion, likely the next day. Likely...Furnishing a roof outdoor terrace with pool lounge chairs that get damaged by water is doubtlessly an intelligent decision, but closing the nicest feature of this b&b until a lazy manager ends his siesta and trudges across the stairs to re open it...this is really the stroke of genius.It is a pity because at more reasonable rates (available during the weekdays at 170 usd/night for the smaller rooms), this "place" could offer a cheap-ish cozy stay in a less touristy and more authentic part of town, yet close to a lot of shopping districts and the city nicest neighborhoods. It looks over a plaza buzzing with young locals drinking in bars. If you like minimal design, room is clean and bed is comfortable. But, as always, the human factor can break the deal. Ask the sleepy manager who took the brave decision to close the rooftop pool, saving the paying guests from certain death in the stormy waters up there (it was sunny...) PS.I have been to this beautiful city hundreds times. Stay at Olivia Balmes or Ohla exeimple (ranked a few hundreds positions above this b&b) or if you want to splurge, casa fuster.
title: Clueless improvisation of hotel management

review: This was my first visit to Barcelona. I booked the hotel and hope for the best. It was okay!Just for a over night stay. I dont want to say anything bad but just stay there for one night if you have to. Breakfast was okay. Everybody was very friendly and they helped me a lot but if I can I would choose another hotel. There where a lot of noise.
title: Not to bad for over nighg stay

review: Lovely hotel close to Main Street, markets and shop, even the harbour, amazing bakery a couple doors down. Very clean staff helpful. You could get breakfast but we just went off on our own. Hop on hop off bus best way to get around.
title: Clean comfortable and close to everything

review: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night due to us booking a cruise. It was perfect for us. View was lovely from our room , we had a balcony where we could sit and chill. Room was lovely, clean , staff friendly. Breakfast included and was plenty of choices. 100% book here again
title: Holiday

review: The location of this hotel was brilliant for us. There is a square just outside the hotel that does get busy, as other reviewers have mentioned, but we didn't find this intrusive and were pleasantly surprised by how clean it was again by the next morning. Lots of little streets to explore with a wide variety of bars and restaurants.The room was nicely finished in a contemporary, if slightly minimalist, style. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we both slept well. There were a few minor niggle points in that there was no fridge, iron, or tea making facilities within the room. In fairness, they were not listed within the amenities but we felt the room would have benefited from having them. The biggest problem for us was the sliding bathroom door. This had obviously been fitted as a space saver which would have been fine except we really struggled to get it to slide across and couldn't get it to move at all after our first day so it possibly needed to be a higher spec. This left us a little compromised in terms of bathroom access! We did mention this problem at reception but unfortunately it was not resolved for the rest of our trip.We didn't use the ground floor bar or dining room but both looked pleasant. The rooftop terrace and pool were lovely for relaxing in the sunshine. Drinks and snacks were available from downstairs but would have benefited from an order system down to reception.Staff were friendly and for the price this was a good little hotel but could be excellent with a few minor adjustments. We'd be happy to visit again.
title: Great spot

review: We checked in for one night at this hotel. At about 930pm, the A/C just went off. When we called the front desk we were told the technician was at home and would not be able to attend to the issue until the following morning. When we asked to be moved, we were told the Hotel was full. When we asked to speak to the manager on duty, we were told she is not answering her phone. We ended up suffering through the night at 40 C or 92F degrees. Beds are saggy and WiFi weak. What a terrible place lacking any sense of customer service. The only saving grace is the location. But for the money, I am sure we can do better.
title: horrible, unreliable, no customer service

review: For its location, we found this place to be a total bargain. Right on La Ramblas heading towards the beach end. Me and a friend stayed for 2 nights - the staff were so friendly, breakfast choices were great. The only thing I would change is possibly modify the building - the reception area is slightly modern with a touch of rustic Spain, but the rooms could do with updating. We did also specify twin beds and were left with 1 double (in a room obviously meant for a family as there was a cot by the wardrobe). Other than that, it's a great little hotel in a perfect location. Barcelona is a wonderful place, would definitely come again!
title: Great place

hotelLocation: Carrer de Lope de Vega, 4, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here with a group of friends for an end of school holiday.Had 3 rooms for 7 of us all, rooms were clean and fine. Bathroom was ok. Breakfast was good, but I've had a lot better.Hotel reception and lobby is very nice and modern. Location is perfect, able to walk everywhere in the city, right next to the beach, McDonalds nearby was a lifesaver, lots of near by restaurants with good value and choice.Would stay again, but only because of how cheap we managed to stay here for.
title: Good enough

hotelLocation: Carrer de Lope de Vega, 4, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is located in a very nice zone ,close to the beach. The rooms are clean,big with clean bathrooms.the staff is friendly.I recommend this place also for families with children.It is quite.the breakfast is international.
title: Nice room Nice view

review: Room: The room itself was basic. The bed was very comfortable and clean and the shower worked as it should. A/C was also very effective. The safe could be rented with a deposit of 10 euros which was returned. WiFi wasn't particularly fast but it was alright and connected easily enough. We were happy with this.Staff:Almost all (apart from one) were really helpful and friendly. You had to give in the key when leaving and collect when returning - the staff were casual and friendly unlike many hotels I've visited over the years. Breakfast:Very basic. Bread (which you could toast); cured meat; ham; cheese; shrink wrapped croissants and cakes; yogurt; limited fruit (oranges and bananas); orange juice; and tea and coffee. Sometimes there was less of a selection as the guy who was looking after breakfast most mornings didn't exactly rush to fill things up. We did get a bit bored of this but it was ok for a bit of something to start the day.Location:Great location. About 20 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and the Sagrada Familia 50 minutes to the beach. Metro Station wasn't too far away for those journeys where we didn't want to walk as much. For us it was ideal. Not in the touristy bit and in an area where you saw real citizens of the city.Overall it was a basic hotel with helpful staff and in a good location. We didn't really hear noise from other guests either. We would stay there again.It's in a sort of apartment building so not easy to find but the entrance is next to the Italian restaurant (La Rita)
title: Basic but great location and comfortable

hotelLocation: Carrer de Lope de Vega, 4, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for vacation. The hotel is in a good neigborhood right next to the beach and close to restaurants, stores, and public transit. We lost our connecting flight so they adjusted our stay with no extra charge. They were very kind at the front desk -- they charged my iphone for me as I did not have an international plug. They have a good breakfast -- it does have pre-mixed, sugary juice as someone pointed out but the coffee is good with buffet of eggs, meat, and yogurt and cereal. There are some specifically spanish sausages and flan :). I found the rooms to be clean and the bed perfectly comfortable. Since I had read the warnings about hot water I used the lukewarm which was fine. Room had good mirrors, closet, drawers, television.
title: Good Hotel

hotelLocation: Carrer de Lope de Vega, 4, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel was just what we needed for our long weekend in Barcelona. Rooms are fine with air con and safe - although I did miss tea/coffee making facilities!!5 minute walk to the beach (just be aware it's near the nudest beach!!)Nice buffet style breakfast was welcome in the morning. Wifi was fine in our room on 5th floor. 10 minute walk from the Metro. Reception staff very helpful. Great base for lots of walking and exploring the city and the beach.
title: Pleasant stay

hotelLocation: Carrer de Lope de Vega, 4, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
review: First off I've been to so called 5 stars in England that are alot worse than this.. So spent a week here with family. Staff are very friendly room was always cleaned fresh towels provided daily. Proximity to the beach was amazing it's literally across the road. 2 minute walk to the bus stop into the city and an 8 minute walk to the metro station so the location is excellent. Plenty of nice restaurants nearby and a large shopping centre about 15 minute walk away so it really has everything close by. Never had breakfast so can't comment on it at all. Bad pointsThe bed was creaky too creaky every movement was met with loud creaking which was annoying that is the only major gripe. The bathroom was clean but needs upgrading toilet paper rack almost fell off. The shower went warm to boiling within seconds which wasn't pleasing. However any issues we had the staff were more than happy to help. Worth it's price.
title: Decent hotel

review: Stayed here for two nights at the start of our trip. Positives: air conditioned rooms, 24hr bar, cheap, close to a metro station (approx. 700m away), close to a street of bars/restaurants, 24hr check in/out, staff able to speak English Negatives: quite far out, lack of mini bar/coffee facilities/no fridge in room, ants through the bed and on the floor(!!), elevator only goes to 2nd floor (we were on the fourth level)
title: Get what you pay for :)

review: Hotel price was very reasonable. Not a bad base for heading into Barcelona each day. Beds not terribly comfy, street noise, Windows opened all the way and I didn't like that as we were on the third floor and it seems unsafe. The window sills were very dirty and seemed like they had never been cleaned. But bathroom was cleaned every day and beds made. No bin in bedroom. Very glad of the air con. Wi-Fi didn't always work. But for the price it was fine. If you aren't fussy and don't intend to be in the hotel much then it's a fine place to stop.
title: You get what you pay for

review: The rooms are clean and comfortable. Our room was a little warm. we could not control the air conditioning. The elevator was a little scary as it bounced when it approached a stop. They have a really nice breakfast which was not included in our reservation. It is 10 a person. We bought it and we're very pleased with it. It had fruit, pastries, eggs, cold cuts & cheese. It is far from the old town and most attractions. We had to take the metro to get places. It wasn't bad to take the metro, very easy. The metro.stop is two blocks down the street. There are also lots of restaurants in the area. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful. One or two were not.
title: Pleasant accommodations

review: We stayed here for 5 days, the room was clean and spacious with a big bed. The hotel is very well located, there are lots of shops around (supermarket, carrefour..), the metro "Maria Cristina" is 5mins walk from the hotel, which is very good to get to the city center (15-20mins to get to Catalunya). The reception of the hotel were very kind and nice. The only bad point was the isolation of the room because we could sometimes hear our neighbors but only when they did scream or laugh loud.I recommend this hotel and will come back for sure for my next Barcelona trip :)
title: Good hotel, very good location

review: The hotel was nicely situated in the city closer to the mountain than the cruise port. The staff were friendly and quite accommodating as we arrived early from our flight and were let into one room for storage of our luggage. We found the room to be typical of European hotels a bit small compared to US but nicely situated. The bathroom was rather open with frosted glass surrounding it rather than actual walls. The power points (outlets) were European so converters were needed for us. Taxi fare to the cruise port was 30€ from here. The breakfast was good and open at appropriate times, offering both hot and cold options. The front desk staff were very helpful at arranging rides and providing directions for us. Clean and comfortable accommodations. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Great visit

review: Our family group of eight people stayed at this hotel for two nights (four rooms). We used our Visa cards to get a free breakfast (which was wonderful). The front desk staff was so friendly - Especially Rebecca. I accidentally left my sport coat in the closet of my room as we went on a cruise ship. Rebecca found it, and saved it for me to pick up two weeks later when the ship came back to Barcelona. I ran in on the way to the airport and she had it ready for me. Outstanding service! The hotel only has about 36 rooms and is reasonably priced compared to other Barcelona hotels, but with the service expected in a Marriott hotel (great service by the English speaking staff). It is only a few blocks from the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus, and you can get your tickets at the hotel's front desk. They have internet (Enhanced Internet is free for Marriott Gold members). Even if you are not a Gold Marriott member, this is a great hotel. It is a couple of blocks from a nice park - great for the morning run, or in my case a place to relax and smoke a cigar. I highly recommend this hotel when in Barcelona.
title: Great Small Marriott Hotel

review: Arrival without booking at 10:30 pm dying for a bed. A slow finding out if there's a room starts. Booing.com said there was, but in a 35-room hotel they don't know and need to check. The price he offers is higher than in Booking.com and when I suggest that I can instantly book it there he says no. 5 more min typing in the computer. In the process the only guy takes two long phone calls. After the second he says he needs to go to attend a room service and that we should wait. When 15 min later he is back, after my comment of "I hope now you're paying attention to us" he answers back that we can look for another hotel if we want. We certainly did. We left and found other much nicer, faster and warmer receptionist.
title: Disgusting customer care

review: Possibly one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at in my entire life. I have been to motels in thirds world countries that are painted better than this. There is about one advantage of staying at this place - the hotel is within walking distance of shopping centers, a few good restaurants, and public transportation. Now let me tell you everything that was wrong with this hotel during my stay in Roon 202:1. The sink would not drain properly. We brought our baby with us and it was incredibly tough to wash bottles in the sink when the water won't drain (pictures attached)2. The shower space has mold all over the place (pictures attached)3. No clock, safe or iron box/board available in the room4. Room is extremely small but rates are comparable to other better hotels 5. The hotel staff are all nice but tend to either give you bad information or information that contradicts other staff members (more on this later)6. There are two phones in the room, which makes no sense because the room is extremely small and doesn't need it7. Some hotel staff may tend to argue with you about the quality of the hotel (more on this later)8. The AC isn't as powerful as you'd expect it to be9. Being a Marriott gold member means absolutely nothing here10. Supposedly there are no upgrades for rooms at this hotel (more to come on this later)Every time I asked for a better room, I got one of 4 answers:1. There are no upgrades available right now2. All 36 rooms that this hotel has are exactly the same 3. All the "superior" rooms are taken (even though I was told that there are no room upgrades and that all rooms are built the same)4. Room 202 (the room I was in) is one of the best rooms in the hotel (which I find hard to believe)So I basically had to suck it up and live in hell for a week during my time in Barcelona. I did have one instance where I tried to explain to the staff about the condition of my room, and he had the nerve to argue with me. I was told that the rates were lower in this hotel, which is why they don't have things such as clocks/safes/iron boxes and boards. I was told that the AC works and that I need to give it time to cool the small room (I sometimes had to wait upwards of 2 hours). I was told that the sink was functioning even though it backed up constantly. I was told that my complaints would be relayed to the manager once he got back from vacation on Monday (still haven't heard anything from him).All in all, my best possible recommendation is for you to pay a little more and stay at a better hotel than to experience everything I did. Stay away from this hell hole.
title: STAY AWAY!!!

review: The staff is super friendly, helpful and warm. They work really hard to make this place great. The room was very clean, bed very comfortable with very spacious bathroom. Once we got into the hotel, we felt like we are leaving the chaos of the big city to enter a really peaceful place.We really enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it to everyone!!
title: Great hotel to stay in Barcelona

review: The hotel is small and modern. Great breakfasts. Excellent shower. I stayed for a conference and brought my teenage daughter who enjoyed the hotel very much. The reception team were extremely friendly. Cyrielle in particular went out of her way to help us every time she saw us. We had a great stay and would recommend the hotel highly.
title: Wish all hotels were like this

review: One night business stop over. Handy for diagonal and Camp Nou. Good breakfast and clean quiet room. Coffee from a machine was actually very good and staff easy going with good English. Not a lot in the immediate vicinity, but as usual in Bcn you can find fruiters and bakeries close by.
title: Good breakfast. Value hotel

review: This hotel is well situated in the centre of Barcelona. It is about a five minute walk from Los Ramblos tourist centre but not so easy for those wanting the busy beach. Whilst we were able to walk there those less able would need transport. The hotel was comfortable but apart from breakfast we needed to eat out. The breakfast was on a self service basis with minimum staff but was adequate. The reception staff were very helpful and knowledgeable.
title: Holiday start

review: Just returned from a fabulous 3 days in sunny Barcelona, however our hotel was a disappointment. How it got its 4 star rating I'll never know? We found the staff very off hand and not overly helpful. The air con didn't work, and you were supplied with 2 t.bags and 2 sugars, no coffee, and had to go and get the milk yourself from downstairs! Staying in a 4 star,one would assume that about 5pm on a Saturday afternoon you would be able to purchase a glass of wine, or other alcoholic beverage? But no, apparently all was shut from 3pm!! Loved Barcelona,but will not be returning to this hotel.
title: Definitely not a 4 star

review: We booked a double standard room for our honeymoon and were obviously given a single room. Didn't look anything like the photos and we were given a single bed to share. It was horrible, uncomfortable and not enjoyable at all. We could have complained/enquired about the room size - but really who wants to do that on their honeymoon?!Take a dip in the upstairs jacuzzi if you dare! It's filled with cloudy, murky water...Be prepared to hear the train go past underneath the hotel and your neighbour go to the toilet - there's no sound proofing at all.Wouldn't stay here again.
title: The smallest room/bed I've ever stayed in!

review: i thought this hotel was a good location, walking distance to go sightseeing and restaurants and bars, easy access to taxi and metro good value for money, room is small and so is the bed size but nice central location for my vacation needs as i was solo, hotel had a small hot tub on the roof i didn't use it though
title: vacation

review: We've just left from a 5 night stay at the Garbi Millenne, we was a little worried about our stay before we arrived after reading some of the reviews, but we found our stay there to be very nice, the communal areas of the hotel are very well kept and clean, and the consierge at the front desk is always very happy and polite, the room we stayed in was a nice double, the air conditioning worked well and quiet enough for us not to notice while we slept, having a fridge in the room is great, with so many supermarkets on the door step it's easy to re stock with water and snacks daily. Take your own coffee if you like a coffee to start the day, although the cups provided with the kettle are very small.We skipped breakfast at the hotel and tried a somewhere new every day, the hotel is in a great location and all the tourist areas are easy to get to be foot.The only downside we had was that the bed was not very comfortable and to hard for us, but it's a hotel, and only a short stay so didn't let it bother us, over all we enjoyed our start I. Barcelona and would be happy to book the Garbi Millenni again
title: Week away

review: Had a great stay at the Sunday Aston Very centrally located very close to metro, bus routes and main train station Staff were very friendly and helpful could not fault them Room fairly basic but very clean and comfortable Rooms cleaned everyday with clean towels Would definitely recommend
title: Sun aston

review: My husband stayed here for a week whilst holidaying in Spain. We found the staff helpful and welcoming. The location was close to Las Ramblas and museums. It was afflicted with the local gym but we had to pay to use it. There was a Rooftop pool with great views but the area needed an update, as did the rooms which were devoid of character and space. The cleaners did a great job every day and made sure you were comfortable. It was overpriced and that did not even include breakfast. Do not get your laundry done there as it will cost you way too much we used the local laundry matt for a quarter of the price.
title: Needs an upgrade

review: I stayed here for 3 nights, and loved the location and the vibe of the hotel.The rooms were lovely and modern, with an amazing waterfall shower.The rooftop pool and terrace was an added bonus, as was the funky bar in the basement with live music.There's also a great bar next door too which had live flamenco one evening.Really loved my stay and the warm welcome from staff.
title: Lovely new hotel

review: Went on a four day city break with my partner to Barcelona , I booked Hotel Niu Barcelona last minute & I was dubious as what I would turn up to but when we arrived i was amazed as the hotel was absolutely spotless so modern , We arrived late at night so the next morning we woke up to find a lovely rooftop pool and loungers , A lovely bar in the reception and also a club downstairs with various artists on. We was literally a 5 minute walk from Las Rambles Which is the main part of Barcelona I would definitely recommend this hotel & look forward to returning for another city break.
title: City Break

review: Around a 5-7 minute walk from the Alfons X metro station so it is quite conveniently located. The actual area it is in isn't very 'happening' and make sure you convert currency before getting there as there is no currency exchange service nearby. The room was clean however there was an unpleasant odour lingering in the bathroom which was probably linked to the drainage system.
