Customer service/front desk was decent however ringing room service was a nightmare, didn't ever manage to get through/communicate what was needed. We had booked a triple room so expected 3 single beds (as advertised) but upon arrival there was a double bed and a sofa bed which we just made do with. Overall it was ok for the price but nothing special.
title: Average.

review: My partner and I stayed in the Niu Barcelona during a 4 night stay in the city in mid July.The hotel appears to be fairly new. I'm not sure of the exact opening date but it can't be more than a year or so old. As a result, everything is very clean and everything works as expected. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We arrived a few hours early on our first day, and were allowed to check in slightly earlier than the advertised time, which was much appreciated after a long journey.The room itself was clean, with comfortable beds, a flatscreen TV, a table and a nice bathroom with a large walk in shower.One of the best parts of the room was the air-conditioning system. Going back to my previous statement that everything is fairly new and works as it should, this air conditioning was a godsend, especially in the high 20-low 30 degree heat of Barcelona in the middle of July. After a day of exploring, it was great to be able to come back to a nice chilled room before heading out again at night. The location of the hotel is fantastic. You are within 10 minutes of La Rambla and the Gothic Quarter, but the area the hotel is in (El Raval) is great for bars and restaurants too. The doors of the hotel open out on to Rambla del Raval, which is home to many bars, shops and places to eat. A short stroll along Career de l'Hospital will take you right on to La Rambla, whereas heading north toward Carrer del Carme and beyond will take you up towards the University and more great places to eat and drink.The hotel has its own restaurant and bar, as well as a downstairs club. As we were only in Barcelona for 4 nights with a relatively full itinerary, we didn't have a chance to sample it ourselves, but the food looked very nice, and we were never disturbed at night by noise from the nightclub. Another feature that we did not get the chance to use was the rooftop pool. Maybe next time...If you are planning a trip to Barcelona soon, I would recommend the Niu Barcelona. Clean, comfortable, great location for tourist spots, and interesting immediate surroundings.
title: Great hotel in a great location

review: Pros- 10 min from La Sagrada Familia- 10 min from a lot of restaurants, Cafes and Metro station- Bus station V21 is just across street for going to city centre- Two playgrounds near by- Friendly staffCons- Rooms are not sound proof ( many times I thought somebody is opening room door)- There is no desk with chair inside the room !!
title: Nice hotel

review: Its a nice hotel, its a bit of a trip out of the busy parts of Barcelona but this isnt a problem for our young legs. Reception are helpful, rooms are clean and comfy. Didn't eat in the hotel but its looked nice.
title: Nice Hotel

review: I really loved this hotel. The rooms were small but really fresh and modern as were the bathrooms. Lovely big windows in the rooms. Overall quiet and charming. Service was great too. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
title: Charming hotel

review: Hotel - The hotel interior is very beautiful. The rooms were clean and spacious. We received fresh water and tea every morning. However on our 3rd night we saw ants in our room. We were directed to another room immediately no questions asked. Staff - We were looked after by many staff members who were very helpful and polite. Especially Sergio, he went above and beyond for us. Thank you so much Sergio, Adios.Breakfast - The breakfast I would rate 3.5 stars. There wasn't much variety however the staff were helpful and accommodating when asked to bring out more food.Overall; Ilunion Bel Art was a lovely hotel. Very close to the Alfons station and La Sagrada Familia.
title: Very accomodating

review: If you are looking for somewhere decently priced and to sleep, this is your place. If you are looking for something super fancy, keep looking. The rooms were smaller but nothing too bad. The bathroom had a smelly scent that seemed to be aiming from the pipelines but otherwise it was decent. Front desk staff wasn't very impressive or over-welcoming by any means. Good location though!
title: Not super impressed

review: This was a truly appalling experience. One night in this dump and I was bitten to distraction by bed bugs. (Check the photos). When I complained the next morning I was asked by the receptionist whether the bites were the result.of something I'd eaten. Yes Madam, I had a tasty tapa of bedbugs and then crapped them out in the night and they came back to bite me. An absolute disgrace of an hotel.
title: Bed bugs.

review: Unfortunately I didn't get one of the newly updated rooms but it was clean, just old and in need of a fresh (few) coats of paint and new wood work in the bathroom as the door frame was not really intact at the bottom where it had has year of getting wet, but I was here on business so it really was just a base at the end of a Long day. Make sure to take your own shampoo and conditioner as there is only shower gel, soap, moisturising cream, tooth brush, shaving kit and comb included in the bathroom. Luckily my college was staying in a different hotel so I borrowed some! The hotel staff are really friendly though and the breakfast room was clean and offered the standard continental breakfast. I had a room with a small balcony, but didn't dare to stand on it. I was also so tired that I did not hear any of the traffic outside, the airconnin the room seemed to be louder (but not abnormal as A/C goes)
title: Cheap and cheerful

review: We have just returned from three nights at the BCN Gran Ducat. Before arrival i requested an early check in as the only flight edin to barca was at 6.30am. We were told no and our luggage could be left with hotel. Not knowing to us that this would be a locker with a €2 charge.... disappointing as we could not help our flight time. Mid day (around 1pm) our room still wasnt ready and we needed in our suitcase, yes another €2 to lock it away again. Not a great start. Rooms are small and basic however there is a lovely balcony you can stand on and watch the city of Barcelona. Rooms seemed clean however on the Sunday the cleaner didnt get to our room until 6pm - not ideal as we were getting changed and freshened up for dinner! If you are looking for location then this is the place for you, only a minute walk from the main plaza in Barcelona. An absolute perfect location near two metro stations and a taxi rank. If you are looking for sleep... not so much. The metro runs under the hotel so every 10 minutes you will shake in your bed. The hotel walls are also paper thin and you could pretty much hear the neighbours conversations never mind the constant banging of doors at 7am. Staff were pleasant but not entirely enthusiastic or chatty, if you wish to use an iron you must collect it from reception and hand it back. The same iron gets passed around all the rooms. Overall it was a bed to sleep in, not a luxurious romantic getaway we were hoping for especially since it wasnt the cheapest either. The price point is for location and not for accommodation.
title: Great location but not 3 stars

review: The biggest advantage of the hotel is its location. It’s in 2 minutes on foot from Plaza Catalunya, metro station which is also Barcelona Rodalies station.As for the rest, hotel is quite dated and I wouldn’t recommend it, to be frank.Rooms are of medium size and quite clean. There are air condition, TV and tea kettle in the room. Everything looks like it has been in use for many many years - there are some spots on the chairs and pillows, scratches on the walls, etc. To use safe box (the one with key, not electronic) you need to leave 20 euro deposit that will be returned to you when you give the key back. Wi-fi is free and fast.Bathroom is quite small and not very convenient in use. Bathroom facilities function with some difficulties. The shelf in the bathroom was broken (nobody repaired it, of cause).Be aware, we saw cockroaches in the bathroom twice !!!!!!!! There were small flies aw well...Soundproofing is horrible. If someone use shower on the lower or upper floor, you hear it like it’s near your as well as everything that happens in neighboring rooms. Breakfast costs 9,90 per person and it’s really good for that money. There are hot eggs and sausages, choice of ham and cheese, some vegetables, fruits, cereals, bakery. There are coffee machine but coffee is so-so.Stuff is friendly and helpful. The price is too high for so poor conditions. For the same price it’s surely possible to find better hotel in Barcelona
title: Great location but dated hotel with insects...

review: We stayed in a superior double, which was very comfortable and clean. Very good beds and nice bathroom with all equipment you need. Quiet and a view over the small garden and pool. Very helpful staff. Nice location with a lot of restaurants and shops around the corner.
title: Great small hotel with a very nice location

review: Very nice hotel with excellent location. Walking distance to shopping and lots of restaurants in the areaWe stayed in an apartment, supermarkets and breakfast cafes very close by if you don't want to use the hotel restaurant Nice pool area for relaxing or cooling down after a hot day in the city
title: Great place !

review: Hotel Exe Laitetana Palace, was absolutely amazing!! the room were nice and spacious, the view we had was of the cathedral behind the hotel. the staff were very friendly and helpful throughout the stay. the breakfast could have catered abit more for vegetarian and fish lovers ( salmon bagels etc) but it was good.  the room was clean aswell, with AC and open door windows aswell. Room Service is from a separate food company - but the food was amazing and they arrived within the time advised.location is great!! 15/20 minutes walk to the beach, from Las Ramblas, from sights like Arc De trimof, parc de Cuitadella etc. easily accessible aswell, get taxi from airport for like 30 euros. would definitely recommend!
title: great place to stay in the city!

review: Good location but that's about it. We enjoyed walking around the El Born neighborhood and Barri Gothic. Word of advise- Bring earplugs! The walls were so thin we could hear everything happening on the street below - it's a pretty busy street to begin with, plus ongoing nearby construction made it even worse. No one likes to wake up to the sound of a hammer drill on vacation! To make things worse we could hear all the commotion in the room next door to us. Also, Terribly designed bathroom - there's nowhere to put anything and the toilet is so close to the sink you have to do an awkward shuffle to sit and stand. Probably the most uncomfortable bed of our entire 3 week Spain trip. Do yourself a favor and stay in a quieter part of town.
title: Caution - bring earplugs!

review: We spent six nights here. The hotel rooms are simple but comfortable and clean. The service people at the front desk were great. The front desk personnel, particularly Dikra, helped us considerably in booking tours and answering questions. The hotel is very well located, within walking distance of many shopping areas, such as La Rambla, restaurants, and tourist sites, such as the Barcelona Cathedral and the Picasso Museum. Altogether, a very wonderful experience. Highly recommend the hotel.
title: Comfortable and well-located lodging

review: We stayed here for a week in July, we had a room on the 3rd floor over looking the roman city walls at the back of the hotel, which made it quiet during the night. Great location, in the gothic quarter, short walk from la Rambla, 5 minutes walk from the cathedral, 20 minutes to the beach. Room was small, but clean and well decorated and well furnished. air con was effective which made the room very comfortable. All in all a good stay.
title: Great location without the heavy price tag

review: Stayed here for a surprise Birthday weekend for my partner in early June. Booked the hotel through easy jet and had a great experience with it all. IGNORE THE STAR RATING THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC! This hotel is by no means 'medium', the rooms are spacious with lovely clean bathrooms. Polite and respectful staff, the lady at breakfast was ever so polite and attentive and ensured the buffet stayed topped up. Large selection of continental breakfast items on offer. Beautiful, modern decor. 30-40 minute walk to the city centre but only 5-8€ for a taxi depending on the time of day.
title: Fantastic weekend away

review: This is in the old section just a few minutes walk from Metro which made it very convenient . Narrow streets with shops and supermarkets close by. The hotel had a nice courtyard with rooms all around it. The service was friendly and the breakfast very good and plenty full .
title: Charming

review: This hotel is located about 5 minutes walk from Diagonal and is within 10 minutes of the nearest metro station. It is close to the tram line so travelling to and from the university area is easy. The lobby area is inviting and fittings are of reasonable quality. The staff were helpful and forgave my terrible Spanish.I didn't try the breakfast as it was 8 Euros and I felt I could get it cheaper in the city -- in hindsight this was a mistake. As the city is so expensive I couldn't get a decent breakfast cheaper anywhere so I would suggest taking the breakfast in the hotel.The room itself was on the 4th floor right by the stairwell. The room was pretty small although the bathroom was a decent size. I asked for a double room but was given a room with two twin beds pushed together. This is not the same as the sheets are only single sheets so you end up just sleeping on one of the beds. There was no key to the safe which was annoying. The shower was pretty weak and the shower screen did not have a proper seal on the bottom so water flooded the bathroom after every shower with no drain in the floor to allow it to leave. The floors of the room and the corridors are tile so noises like people talking or the shutting of doors were heavily amplified. This, combined with a small bed with a lumpy mattress meant that I slept badly every night I was there which was a real shame.On the plus side, the room was cleaned every day and the general standard of cleanliness was good. Internet was also reasonable and so working in the room was possible but not the most comfortable.Considering the price of hotels in Barcelona, I suppose this place was quite good value but I would still opt to pay a bit more to get a better place to sleep.
title: Disappointed and a poor night's sleep

review: Came here for a couple of days in June with some friends and family. I booked it because of its perfect location (5 minute walk from las ramblas and 15 minutes from placa catalunya) and its price, which, because it was so cheap had me worried. I didn't need to be though. On entering the hotel the people were so friendly and the courtyard beautiful. Yes, the rooms are very basic, but they're big enough, with lots of wardrobe space and enough room to move around. The air con also worked brilliantly and the shower had plenty of hot water. I also couldn't believe breakfast was included for the price, and included a wide selection of breads, cheeses, meats, spreads, juices and decent coffee. The only slight negative would be that there was a slight damp smell in the room and that using the shower did mean the bathroom got drenched every time, even if you were careful. Because of the price and location though, I couldn't give it any less than 5 stars and will definitely be recommending it to anyone who wants a bargain in Barcelona.
title: Perfect location and excellent value for money

review: The hotel is alright for what it is. It's close to the shopping center, but about 20-45 mins away from tourist attractions and the beach. The shower was a little impractical - it was nearly impossible to take one without soaking the whole floor. The Front Desk team and the rest of the staff is friendly and tries to be helpful when they can. However, the manager Anna was an incredibly frustrating person to deal with. On their check out card it states that check out time is 12 am. We were confused as standard check out time is noon. We asked the front desk staff to clarify if there was some sort of misunderstanding but he confirmed 12 am as in midnight. With no where else to go the night before our flight we had no choice but to book last minute accommodations at a hostel for the night.This trip was booked through our travel agent, and I reached out to her just in case she was unaware about this oddity. To my surprise, she emailed me back saying she had spoken to the front desk, and they confirmed checkout as noon! We spoke with the same front desk staff member from before, where he apologized for the mistake but offered nothing to help us other than a complimentary breakfast but only after we became insistent. We asked to speak to the manger who wasn't in to the next morning around 10 am.Speaking with the manger Anna had to be the most frustrating experience of my life. Though my ability to speak Spanish is limited, I understand it quite well. We explained the situation to her, but I could tell from her tone that she was going to be of little help. She refused to accept any responsibility and implied that it was our fault for not understanding 12 AM in Spain is different than 12 AM in Canada. Even the hostel confirmed that what they have printed on their check out card is incorrect! We received a temporary resolution provided by the hostel NOT the hotel. If they could sell the beds, they wouldn't charge us for the night. Anna told us she and the staff would continually check in with the hostel to see if it had been booked, but when we returned at 10 pm that day there was no update for us. The next morning, we had to check out. We asked the concierge if there was any new updates, but there was nothing. Only after we asked, did he call the hostel who confirmed that they would be charging us 64.00 EUR. We asked what is going to be done for us, and he offered nothing. We asked him to call Anna as she was not in, and she offered nothing. Arguments back and forth were clearly going no where. The poor staff member told us they would offer to pay for something else, I asked them to pay for the taxi to the airport as this would cost about 30 EUR, and instead they offered to pay for the train which cost 8.00 EUR. Pressed for time, we no choice but to call a taxi ourselves. We asked for the number of any supervisor we could speak to, but they refused to provide one for us.We were only in Barcelona for 3 days, but this definitely soured our experience and our mood, and because of that would not recommend this place or any of its chains to any friends/family in the future.
title: First Time Visiting, Bad Experience

review: The main advantage of this hotel is LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. it is one minute walk from the La Rambla and the metro station. The hotel resides in a 19th century building and belongs to a family. the architecture is nice with a very pleasant patio where you can sit and relax or have something to eat (if you buy outside). The hotel is very basic. The rooms are actually spartan. We had a room with only a bed and a closet. There is no TV or radio. The bathroom was renovated not long ago but it had a bad smell (mold?). Wifi is ok (but slow) in the public areas (patio, reception) but weak or no signal in the rooms.Breakfast was good and the stuff was usually nice and helpful.
title: Very basic at a great location

review: Very friendly staff. We had a room in the attic : clean and quiet.The room is very basic but all we need is a bed and a clean (own) bathroom. The breakfast was more than enough (especially considering the price).
title: Clean and basic hotel

review: This is one of the closest hotels to Sants railway station, great for an early morning train.The member of staff at reception when we arrived was a bit grumpy, but the room was good and we found a great place for dinner nearby, and another place for breakfast next morning. It was a breeze to wheel our luggage to the station and hop aboard the train
title: Good hotel close to Sants Railway station

review: Great hotel, easily access all tourist areas as it's well connected with public transport. Especially handy for Parc Guëll and Tipidabo which are within walking distance if you're keen. Nice staff too. Clean, comfy rooms and good to see another neighbourhood. By travelling 10mins on public transport you'll more than double your bang for hotel buck, it's €22 by cab from Placa Catalunya after midnight.
title: Oasis of Calm

review: We were marooned in Barcelona due to the British Airways computer meltdown in May. We were supposed to fly out immediately after disembarking a cruise. Instead, we ended up spending 13 hours in Barcelona airport. During the wait to rebook our flight, we realized that we needed to find a hotel room for the night and we didn't want to trust British Airways to help us. We had stayed in a hotel near Cristal Palace in our last (planned) stay in Barcelona. When it came up as having a room available, we jumped at it and were very happy that we did. The staff were very helpful, especially once we told them how we managed to end up staying there that night. The room we had was on third floor, there wasn't much of a view, but the it had a good bed with ample space. The bathroom was huge with good water pressure and temperature. The wifi was easy to access and was quick. The breakfast buffet the next morning was excellent, with ample choices and everything was fresh. Upon leaving, the young lady at the desk invited us to come back if we encountered more troubles at the airport. On our next trip to Barcelona, this will be the hotel we will try to book first.
title: Bright spot in a bad day

review: - I Stayed in a double room 4 nights from 1 July to 5 July 2017- Room is air-conditioned , Room is air conditioned and provided with: twin beds, closet with sliding doors and included as safe , wall hang TV, full length mirror, desk with a chair & mini bar- Bathroom is provided with bathtub, double sink , WC & bidet - My room was not provided with any view but yet comfortable one- Room was always clean , thanks to housekeeping staff- Hotel location is perfect I it is walking distance from passeig de gracia & la rambla,and also near bus station & Metro and also nearby many shops /stores/ restaurants , I always pass by the hotel to drop all of my shopping bags and go for dining - I used bus #24 from passeig de gracia to reach to Guell park and it was really easy to reach there and it is a really recommended destination , and I enjoyed walking in la rambla and reach to the sea - Hotel staff are friendly and helpful- Breakfast includes variety of food (several types of cheese, bakery, juice, fruits, cereal etc.) and I would like to thank restaurant staff for being friendly & helpful and smiling all the time- I enjoyed my staying so much and I will recommend your hotel to my friends and I hope I will be back soon
title: enjoyable/comfortable staying

review: I went to this hotel and asked for a room. The girl at reception, who was too busy flirting with a mexican old man, took a long time to even say hi. When she finally acknowledged my presence, she gave me a price for a room, which changed every day (what the f!) and which ended up being different in total when she finally gave me the room: higher than she initially said, as she kept adding things. She showed me one room that looked nice and big, before booking it, and then gave me a key card for a very small one with a very small bed. The hotel does not look good inside. Halls, elevator, etc. I was very upset so asked for a refund and left. I do not do con artists or liars. I recommend you stay away from hotels that abuse their customers. Go to hotels that respect you and have decent, honest prices that match what they offer.
title: Horrible experience

review: Very friendly staff and very good location. Nearby metro and taxi stands. I walked the length of Las ramblas to the beaches from here. No cooked eggs for Breakfast. Lots of places to eat nearby. The tour buses at the top of Las ramblas were close by.
title: Two night stay

review: This a modern hotel down a side street near parallel and near the port end of the city. The area is quiet and safe even late at night and only 10 minutes from Las Ramblas and 3 minutes to the Metro.The area has many decent little restaurants nearby, when I stayed there was a local festival and I saw the real essence of the area friendly passionate people, the local roads were closed and within 100 metres of the hotel a stage was set up given lively entertainment in to the early evening.The room was basic bed, wardrobe, television on the wall with 3 English channels, safe (cost 2euros a night), very good air conditioning and bathroom with shower, the floor had marble type tiles which made the room cool when the temperature outside was about 30 degrees centigrade.There was two problems with the room one was the view from the window looking on to a brick wall in a central courtyard and the shower did not drain very well.I tried the breakfast on the last day which was fine for 7 euros a basic continental breakfast in a small area by reception.The staff were absolutely fantastic spoke Basic English but were helpful and friendly.If you are looking for a no thrills hotel this is the one to go for.
title: Great Budget hotel,near Las Ramblas

review: Stayed here for 3 nights, very basic room but clean, comfortable and was reasonably priced. Staff were friendly and accommodating. It is in a good location for the 'hop on hop off ' bus route. Would stay here again and have no problem recomending this hotel if you are looking for a city break.
title: Nice hotel in a good location

review: Traveled with her teenage daughter. The hotel was chosen because of the locationThe hotel is clean. A spacious room. Unfortunately uncontrolled air conditioning. Good breakfast. Responsive staff. Very convenient location. City center.
title: Wonderful hotel

review: AMAZING cleaning service. The cleaning staff need to be honoured as we were overwhelmed by the spotless room we would return to (and we're not the cleanest bunch of 19 year olds). They would even fold up our clothes and pile them in the cupboards!..Great and welcoming hotel staff who all speak very good English!Love from England
title: Boys holiday

review: Have just returned from 4 nights in this lovely hotel and was really pleased with my stay. My room was perfect for one, clean and comfortable and had hairdryer too. This is an ideal base to explore Barcelona, it is not situated in the busy tourist area and so is a lovely retreat after a day exploring. It is right next to the Hospital Clinic Metro so ideal for travelling very easily to all the places. The buffet breakfast was brilliant with a varied selection. Coming back after being out all day to the rooftop pool and Jacuzzi was bliss and the views from the roof are beautiful. Free wifi which worked straight away and was reliable...The staff were all friendly and helpful and being a solo traveller I felt very comfortable there.. I will definitely recommend this hotel and return in the future..
title: Lovely hotel and excellent value for money!

review: The hotel is in the best part of the city, in the Eixample, but it’s a 10 minutes walk for the L5 underground. A hotel itself is really clean, the rooms also. There is cleaning service everyday. The rooms are amazing. For us the beds were really comfortable, the room itself wasn’t big, but it was enough for us. It’s IMPORTANT that there is NO FRIDGE in the rooms. The bathroom is also okay. The Wi-Fi is slow in the evenings.The recepcionist are really kind. They helped us to find any transportation, places to eat or with any other personal needs. As I mentioned, there was no fridge, but we had some leftovers so we asked them to store it and they helped immediatelly. Even at 2 a.m.It’s important to note that the hotel is built together with Hotel Aston. We have to go in that hotel if we want to have breakfast, over to use the pool. During breakfast you can use from various foods, I think it was a really good thing, but nothing was too tasty. The pool is really small, also as the jakuzzi, so these are not the advanteges of the hotel, but otherwise it was marvelous.
title: Good rooms, better location, best staff

review: The hotel was well located for transport links and also for shops, restaurants. The hotel was also close to the hospital, in case whilst staying anyone needed it. It was very clean throughout and staff were very helpful. There was a hairdryer in the room if you needed one and the rooms were cleaned every day and towels changed, as well as complimentary toiletries I traveled alone but I felt very safe there. Breakfast was very nice, buffet style. Pool and Jacuzzi was also very nice. The hotel Is not in the central tourist area, which was nice, but it was close enough to be able to get anywhere in the city.
title: Very clean and very helpful staff, excellent value for money

review: Minus: Cleaning lady was loud and woke us up every morning while cleaning neighbouring rooms. A/C doesnt work in the room and can be adjusted only by the receptionist for the whole flor.They turn it off/on every 2 hours, also at night. I dont like to sleep with the AC on, its not even healthy, but I had to do so for more than a week. For me, this is the biggest minus of this otherwise pleasant hotel.Plus: The staff was really kind, always helpfull and the room was small, but clean and equipped with fresh shampoo and towels every day. Metro station is near, also some shops.To Pg. De Gracia is a pleasant walk.
title: Good location, nice staff, terrible A/C

review: Great apartment, with a lovely terrace. From the terrace the holiday maker can enjoy views of the mystical Mt Tibidabo! The room and terrace can only be matched by the extremely knowledgable, helpful and friendly staff. When we return to Barcelona will definitely return to Bonanova Appartments!
title: Views of the foothills of Mt Tibidabo

review: Accidently booked this hotel by mistake, meant to stay at the Ramblas Boqueria which I have stayed at before and is excellent.Rialto was dingy and exceedingly small and did not have a nice feel about it. Needs updating badly . Staff did find us a better room but I would never stay again.
title: Terrible dingy hotel

review: This hotel is located right on La Rambla! It has great restaurants nearby and you can catch the Metro nearby too. The hotel offers a self-serve breakfast so you can eat until you are stuffed. With lots of choices to satisfy anyone's taste buds. It is a very clean hotel but make sure you don't get a back room as the apartment next door can be loud. The Market is just across the street and down a block where you will find the most wonderful experience in culinary delights. It is a must visit! If you are lucky enough to be there for Barcelona's biggest festival in September, you will have parades going by every few hours on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.
title: Great Location

review: My stay at Internacional Cool was one of the worst I have ever experienced. The room was €160 per night for 3 nights. My room was so small it barely fit a full sized very uncomfortable bed. The manager, who was cordial, said he could make no changes. The bed was so bad with thin old mattresses that I ended up with back and neck pains. The shower was so small one could barely turn around. It was a very high priced (for Barcelona) low quality hotel. Avoid at all costs. The only thing it had going for it was the location on the Ramblas.
title: Disappointed

review: The hotel has free WIFI and is located in one of Barcelonas most busy streets. A short walk gets you to great restaurants as stores. And that's about it... The room was really small. Having a suitcase got to be a problem. We had to place some of our luggage in the bathroom. The bathroom contained some hair from other guests and God knows what else... The elevator didn't work, the TV had three spanish channels and the breakfast cost extra. Perfect! Since the room didn't offer a simple "do not disturb" sign, it was easy for the housekeeper to wake you up at 8 o'clock to tidy your room. Next time - no thanks!Hotellet er plassert sentralt i Barcelonas mest travle gate. Gåavstand til butikker og gode restauranter. Gratis WIFI. Der stopper det positive...Kun spanske kanaler på TV'en, små rom uten plass til koffert eller sekk. Sekken måtte for øvrig plasseres på badet. Badet inkluderte hår fra tidligere gjester. Heisen var i ustand og alt dette til tross for en vanvittig høy pris for rommet. I tillegg manglet enkle ting som et "ikke forstyrr"-skilt til døra. Pga. dette, kunne man raskt bli vekket kl. 8 av.at noen skulle vaske rommet. Neste gang - nei takk!
title: Small room - not clean, Et lite rom - og skittent

review: The location is the ONLY good thing about that hotel. It's unclean and VERY noisy. The king size bed is very small and uncomfortable. I found a dead spider on my pillow and blood on the bedsheets!! When i complained they took it very lightly and said they will have it cleaned TOMORROW because the housekeepers left LOL! Its only when i yelled that they changed the pillow cases and bedsheets on the spot. The breakfast is also terrible. No way on earth that i book Rialto again. You will surely find WAY better alternatives in the same street.
title: Terrible stay!

review: I was sceptical about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews but decided to go for it for the location. Oh boy did I make the right decision! Not only was the location so perfect but the hotel itself was lovely also! The location is snack bang in the middle of the old town (the gothic quarter) with everything that you could possibly want right on your doorstep. The buildings in this area (including the hotel) are just stunning and exactly what I expected of Barcelona. There is a place called 'Plaça Reial' which is a square of gorgeous restaurants and bars which is a 5 minute walk from this hotel and this turned out to be one of our most favourite places in Barcelona. The hotel was a little outdated (which is the reason for giving it 4 stars rather than 5) but we had a gorgeous floor length window which was stunning when we opened it! The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful when we asked about which buses and metros to take. The L4 metro is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel also and this can take you 1 stop away from the beach (which is also a 30min walk if you would rather walk). Overall I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely return if I came back to Barcelona, I had a lovely time.
title: Perfect Location

review: We had booked the Hotel Rialto for our one week holiday in Barcelona. We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and then decided to book another hotel (even though we did nit get any refund for the missed nights) - and this sums up our stay in the hotel very well.We arrived late at night to room that smelled like mold. We were able to change our room after our first night. We had a room facing the street, but the street noises did not bother us at our 4.th floor room.The aircondition did not work properly, it was way too cold in the room during nights. Somebody came to our room without knocking. The rooms were dirty (don't look under the bed) and not dated. The bed was very uncomfortable, it was very hard. No proper blanket.The location was very good - that is a definite bonus!If you are thinking about booking a budget hotel, think twice before coming to Rialto. There are better options available in Barcelona for this price range!
title: Not recommended

review: Having been to Barcelona a few times and seen all the sights, my daughter and I chose this hotel because of its location in the Gothic area which we love.Mixed reviews of a Hotel are not enough to deter us and we have always been fortunate to experience a good stay wherever we have been.Of course, there are better Hotels in Barcelona, but for a short break in an area of authentic narrow strees, little shops and sunny squares where you can enjoy a glass of sangria and a few tapas, Hotel Rialto fits the bill.Our room on the 4th floor overlooked the street but with the window closed, there was no noise, and offered us an excellent view of a few paradesAir conditioning in the room was a blessing but it was a bit cold during the night and I had to use the blanket stored in the wardrobe. We found our beds to be comfortable.The hot buffet breakfast was not to our taste but there were the usual cereals, yoghurts, fruit, different types of rolls, toast, cold meats and cheese to satisfy anyone.If that is not enough, there is an abundance of snack bars, cafes and restaurants in the neighbourhood at competitive prices.
title: Good location

review: very nice and helpful staff. but tourism kills the city and the souls of their inhabitants.very clean. very nice to have a water kettle but we miss a fridge. and nice to get breakfast (not incl) in the café next door. so U can choose something else than sweets for breakfast :-)
title: Extremely centraly located

review: I recently stayed at Barcelonaa Fira Travelodge. I found the staff to be friendly, helpful, professional and caring. The hotel room was spotlessly clean, great showers and good location and value for money. In particular I would like thank Frank & Daniel for making my stay welcoming, pleasant and friendly. Highly recommended.
title: Friendly, comfortable stay in Barcelona

review: We are a family of 5 who stayed at Travelodge Fira to be convenient to airport. We found the staff to be very friendly and welcoming with plenty of information on travel, shopping etc. The rooms were lovely and cool in the hot summer and the beds were very comfortable. The reception booked us a taxi for an early flight but the metro is also very close. We would highly recommend this hotel
title: Great hotel to stay for shopping and airport

review: Booked a one bedroom apartment but was upgraded to a two-bedroom - very pleasant surprise. The apartment was HUGE and we couldn't believe we were in the middle of Barcelona. Central location. Very clean and I didn't think the furniture was old at all. The welcome wine/snacks were also a nice touch to help us feel welcomed. The kitchen was spacious and easy to use, and we cooked on a Sunday when a lot of restaurants were closed. Glad we had in-unit laundry as we got drenched one afternoon in a sudden down pour. We had breakfast one day at the Hotel part one morning and enjoyed that as well.
title: Great Stay

review: This location is perfect for anyone wanting a mix of culture, beach and dinner/drinks. We had a triple room, there was enough space. Storage was great, really modern. The balcony was a nice addition. Great staff. Air con ace. Shower very powerful. Breakfast was not great and let's this hotel down.
title: Excellent!!

review: We are a family of 5 and space is a welcome plus when travelling. We stayed at one of the apartments of the hotel which is located away from the main hotel building. Could not fault the location but the apartment is somewhat a little dated. Smell of sewage lurks a little in the lift and corridors of apartment. That said, it is comfortable and clean. Perfect for family.....it has a living room, kitchen and laundry, which are huge bonuses when travelling. The rooftop bar is a must especially in the night. Great view!
title: Not a 5-star hotel but comfortable

review: Worst experience ever! I donot recommend any of the tourists to visit, regardless of the good location, the room cleaning was awful,the covers were dirty whereby me and my wife got bitten by the "BED BUGS" and we're suffering now!
title: Bed Bugs !

review: Great position,many restaurants and attractions near bye. Rooms excellent for 3 star. Good beds and breakfast. Friendly service at reception. Close to waterfront as well. Only 30 mts from the amazing La Rambla Blv. Very happy
title: position

review: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Moderno, which is located perfectly at the intersection of La Rambla and Carrer de l'Hospital in central Barcelona. The welcome from staff was friendly, and I found the room clean and comfortable. The wifi signal was excellent. It could get a little noisy at night but that is only because you are metres away from one of Barcelona's main thoroughfares. The air con can take a while to cool the room on a hot day, but once it gets going it does the job. I didn't try the hotel breakfast.
title: Great modern hotel in the perfect location

review: No problems at all, very clean, very nice atmosphere (34 degrees hot outside, perfect quality air condition).People in reception really helpful and not at all in the fake smile way. Would stay again any time!
title: The description is accurate 100%

hotelLocation: Passeig de Sant Antoni 36-40, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: I was there for two nights, the hotel is modern but each room is pretty small and worst than that the hotel is really noisy.Imagine that I could hear people having showers and they limited television set volume up to a max level.
title: Noisy

hotelLocation: Passeig de Sant Antoni 36-40, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: I had to stay here when my easyJet flight was cancelled. I arrived very late and was sweaty and exhausted and annoyed but despite this reception were friendly and helpful. As easyJet's hotel of choice they are probably used to dealing with frustrated customers!Unfortunately when I was there all the electronic keys had stopped working so you had to be escorted to your rooms to have them unlocked. Am sure they'll have that fixed soon. The room was odd, seemed like a studio with the bathroom sink in the middle of it. They provide separate shampoo and conditioner, soap and body gel which was very useful given my unexpected visit. The bed was big and nice and clean, however pillows were the lumpiest I've seen and I almost couldn't sleep because of it. Another thing that stopped me sleeping peacefully was that walls are paper thin. I hear could anyone talking outside in the hallway and there were a few loud excited people who woke me up. The tv is enormous but has the volume fixed to quite a low level so you can't go above it ,this makes sense given the lack of sound proofing but was a little too quiet for me to hear. The breakfast was very nice, quite a small selection but really good quality. Nice Spanish tortilla and chorizos. Nespresso coffee. Overall it was fine but the noise factor would put me staying again, even though the transport links are very good. Right next to estacio sants and bus/tram/tube.
title: Business hotel in great location

hotelLocation: Passeig de Sant Antoni 36-40, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed at the AC hotels Sants For 6 days. The location was so perfect that the Sants station was just 5-8 mins walk. All the staff person at the reception are helpful and friendly specially Paula. Breakfast was great, and if you prefer to eat out specially at lunch ,there's a lot of restaurant just around the hotel. The hotel cleaning staff do good job cleaning and providing you with toiletries. I will surely recommend this hotel to all who will visit Barcelona. Lastly it is very easy commute to and from the airport
title: Perfect Hotel

hotelLocation: Passeig de Sant Antoni 36-40, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: I always like staying at Marriott Hotels, being a member of their loyalty club. I was somewhat disappointed with this hotel however. With a modern appearance and upmarket design, there was little provision for dinner on Saturday night, as a chef was not employed over the week-end. That said, there was some attempt to provide some basic room service dinner items. Room design was modern and a agreeably different from the norm. Shower and bathroom amenity and toiletries were well covered, and above the normal items provided. Breakfast was good but there was not a lot of cereals and 'mains' choices - all other offerings were fresh and in good supply. The hotel is well located for the railway traveller, being only a two minute walk from the main Station.
title: A Hotel Which Doesn't Live Up to it's Full Potential

review: Safe to say this is one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in. Simple OK lobby, but a rickety tiny elevator, dirty in nooks and crannies, tiny TV, noisy and creepy hallways. The worst part was a hole(!) in the roof of one room, looking directly up into some kind of dark and dusty storage area above. This creeped us out so the entire family decided to sleep in one room. Good location, though...
title: Creepy and dirty

review: Sparse room with a tidy and clean bathroom. Hotel just to sleep, with little amenities, but not much else is needed when you go to Barcelona. It is just enough to cross the front door to find yourself in the middle of the populous Plaça Reial with plenty of restaurants, and bars. Excellent value & location.
title: Small hotel in the old town of Barcelona

hotelLocation: Passeig de Sant Antoni 36-40, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel had a much better equipped gym (the treadmill actually worked!) than the other AC hotel Irla we also stayed in. However the gym was not air conditioned and got HOT. we only stayed one night on a Sunday while waiting to fly back to the USA. The bed was large and comfortable and the room was modern. The bathroom was very clean. We were upgraded to a superior room I think because we were only staying for one night ok a Sunday and because I'm an elite member. The one complaint I have about this hotel is the AC. The AC was difficult to figure out and the room was very warm at night. Also the breakfast was very expensive (17 euro) so we opted out of the breakfast and just waited to eat at the airport. Hotel was much better in terms of size and cleanliness than AC hotel Irla, but Irla was in a better location and had more reliable AC.
title: Good for a train stayover

review: As other reviewers have confirmed, the hotel is basic but makes up for this with the location which could not be better. Although the hotel is basic, it is clean and the staff are lovely. We arrived early but the staff happily locked our cases away for us. We will stay again
title: Basic but good

review: If you are looking for something special keep looking. The accommodation is very basic but the location is great. Our room had little to no natural light but it was clean and functional. Basic breakfast is provided but the location is fantastic so close to everything. This place is perfect if you have a couple of days in Barcelona and want to spend all your time sightseeing and shopping and to have somewhere to sleep and shower.
title: Basic but good location

review: It is in one of the most lively squares in Barcelona. In between Rambla and Gothic Center. But do not expect too much from the interior of the rooms. It was clean but I did not like the fact that there were very little plugs inside the room and in weird places not next to the bed for instance!
title: Very central but basic

review: Stayed here for three nights at the end of June. Room was very clean and well maintained, the view from the spacious balcony was beautiful. the breakfast was absolutely perfect, with an endless supply of a fine selection of ham. The ladies who provided breakfast were lovely and cheery, also very helpful. I sincerely hope we can return soon.
title: Faultless

review: If you need a good and relaxing place after a long trip, don't go to the Catalonia Park Putxet in Barcelona.It has NO access for people with disabilities! I supposed that was a must for hotels, but I guess I was wrong. It had a fake electric chair to get down the steps to go check in, but it was not working! It was there for show only hoping, I believe, nobody would need it.The staff was very rude, unaccommodating and in no uncertain terms told me to go somewhere else because they didn't need to accommodate me. Well, I did! After I demanded it, they sent me to another hotel for the same price and paid for my taxi.I had never seen or met anybody as rude in the hotel business (or anywhere else for that matter) anywhere in the world!
title: How bad can it get?

review: Located on a back street from a main road. Upon first impressions the hotel was gleaming clean and smelt delightful.The receptionist was very helpful and checked me in without issues.I had a double basic room on the 3rd floor. It was what I expected, vey clean .. good shower.. poor view (expected in the city). Room service every day, all very polite do a good job. There is no swimming pool just for anyone confused by certain photos on google images. The food is delicious,they have a large selection on display all fresh.The coffee machine gives a good coffee too.In regard to distance to main areas e.g. .. la ramble the beach etc it is a busy sweaty bus ride depending on traffic 30-1h . From the beach to the hotel it is one long hill.All good if your prepared to pay for a taxi, approximately €7.50 to the beach front. I would also say that the main area is around La Rambla e.g.. food,shopping,bars theatres so on .. Personally next time I will be booking a hotel closer but it was all part of the experience. All in all The hotel is lovely . There is nothing for children more for solo,couples.. business.
title: You get what you pay for

review: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nice, big and clean. The pool was way smaller than the pictures show which disappointed us a bit, but overall a good experience and we enjoyed our stay.
title: Good

review: We stayed here last week hotel in general was nice but the staff are by far the most unfriendly non welcoming people I've ever seen I work in the industry myself and couldn't imagine treating people the way these staff do.the breakfast is from 7:30 till 10:30 on week days it bein our holidays we didn't go to breakfast till about 10:10 any morning we went only to be hassled and rushed by the waiter it wasn't just us other tables got the same treatment and I heard them say that breakfast isn't over till 10:30 which it does state. The waiter then proceeded to argue with all the tables that they have to be gone by 10:30 but most tables ignored him.he then came to us and said u need to hurry up I have to clear up breakfast is finished at 10:30 I checked the time it was 10:17 all I had was toast and tea. I went in the second morning and he was doing the same thing to every table in there I didn't bother having anything just went out for breakfast after paying €140 just for breakfast and to get that treatment is crazy. We tried the bar food one of the nights crazily over priced our bar tender was rude and very unfriendly i ordered a ham and cheese pizza and I asked if I could get French fries with that and the waiter said we don't do French fries only with certain things on the menu and the tables across from us had exactly what I ordered with French fries food wasn't bad but way way over priced it was our dearest meal of our week in barcalona and we had some great dinners there for half the price these staff clearly hate there jobs I wouldn't go back again!!!!!!!!!
title: Terrible staff and way over priced!!!!!!!

review: The hotel is decent, but it definitely doesn't meet the 4* rating.The hotel is pretty close to the Lesseps metro station, but you need to be aware that you need to climb a pretty steep hill from the station to the hotel.The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean, although the furniture is quite old and used.I totally didn't like the fact that the hotel canceled my reservation with just 2 hours before I arrived, because they were unable to book the reservation payment from my credit card. They sent me a message while I was traveling (in the plane) but I only found out about it when I arrived at the hotel. I was lucky that nobody else booked the room before I arrived.
title: Decent but overpriced and overrated

review: A lovely modern hotel situated in a quiet area, surrounded by local shops and restaurants. Air conditioned rooms, and a great breakfast buffet. The staff are easy to talk to and helpful. Close enough to walk to Park Guel (approx. 40 mins) and even Las Rambla should you want to (1-1.5 hrs), with metro access nearby.One to think about if you're after a relaxed time with some sight seeing.
title: Relaxing esacpe

hotelLocation: Calle Ausias March 25, 1st Floor, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: We were really happy with this apartment and also the staff. We were arriving late, and were worried that this may have been an issue as they don't have a 24 hours manned reception, but there was a smiling young woman waiting for us outside the building. The apartment is one of quite a few which is managed by Mayerling, and ours was very modern with ply timber walls. Not a large apartment, but everything we needed, including an efficient AC and kitchenette. Staff were so helpful, we can't wait to go back!Also can't go wrong with a supermarket a few doors away.
title: Delightful apartment

review: This hotel is in a great location - a quiet, residential area but an easy walk to the metro that connects you to the entire city. The staff was friendly and very helpful, the room was exactly what we expected and the breakfast was great. On the day we left, our train did not leave till the evening. The hotel allowed us to check out, leave our bags and pick them up after one more day in Barcelona. We were very happy with our stay.
title: Great hotel in a quiet, residential area

review: We spent 5 nights at this place one block south of diagonal. The area is nice with bars and restaurants within walking distance. The metro station is a short walk away (max. 10 minutes) The rooms are big and the beds a very comfortable. Even the sounds of the street are limited to an absolute minimum on our 3rdfloor room.We especially would like to mention Me. josep from the reception who was very helpful und friendly. The only thing I would have expected wasThat the deposit box and coffee on the room with the coffeemaker would be included the prize for the nights. Nevertheless, this little extra fee does not lower our experience made. Would stay there again!
title: Great Location, comfortable beds

review: This was our first trip to Barcelona. Due to our flight cancellation to Lisbon we had no reservation in Barcelona until 4 days later! One word of caution always book your flight with one booking! This way airline who had the delay/cancellation will be responsible to take care of you.The tourism office office referred us to Guitart Grand Passage. We needed room for 4 people, 2 adults and 2 kids. Thankfully manager Jenny Misurelli at Guitart Hotels accommodated us on a Sunday night. The hotel is priced well and it is close to the Ramblas street. It is very clean and room service is efficient. Make sure you choose the breakfast option. The quality of breakfast is very good as well.The staff assisted me with just about everything such as getting direction and making reservation for la Sagrada Familia. Most important everyone is polite and speak different languages.I highly recommend Guitart Grand Passage. The address: Muntaner, 212 . 08036 Barcelona Espana. Tel.(34)932010306. Hotelguitartgrandpassage.com.
title: Mr

review: a three night stay at this Boutique Hotel. Excellent amenities and polite staff. A shame they don't have tea making facilities in the room but i loved the location. Will definitely want to stay there again
title: Very good stay- central location

review: We stayed 3 nights in Continental Palacete and we enjoyed every single minute. We booked a twin bed room but were given a small twin bed room different from what we saw online. Luckily due to the room's AC malfunction, we were moved almost immediately to the room with the seat out over looking beautiful restaurants and shops.The staff are outstanding and the 24 hours buffets provided needed repast after full days of sightseeing.We only found English speaking news channels on the tv, everything else is in Spanish or French (I think). Since we spent most of our days out of the hotel, it was no biggie for us.There is a taxi park right in front of the hotel and the train station isn't far. It's located right in the middle of the city centre, with shops and restaurants right next door.I definitely recommend the hotel, you get value for your money.
title: Exquisite

review: Luckily for us, we love it. But it's definitely quirky. We returned to the Palacete after staying here 3 years ago. It has not changed and is still as charming as it was then. The 24 hour complimentary snacks and drinks are a great bonus. Highly recommend the Versailles suites. This time we stayed in the suite on the left of the main lounge (unfortunately the name escapes me) which is much better in configuration to the suite on the right so try and request that one. The only downside is you can hear the conversations of guests in the lounge next door and vice versa (which for us with 3 children was problematic trying to get our kids to speak quietly so as not to disturb the other guests eating and drinking in the lounge)!The location is excellent. Super convenient to La Rambla and the Cathedral. An awesome bonus is the proximity to Ciudad Condal - recommended by Gemma at the hotel and an excellent tapas restaurant just minutes away in the next block. When not snacking at the hotel we had every meal here for the entire duration of our stay in Barcelona!If you like small, quirky hotels at a reasonable price you can't go wrong with this one. We will continue to return.
title: You'll either love it or hate it

review: We stayed here one night on our way to Ibiza from Dubai. The staff were warm and friendly.. We were kindly given an upgrade to a suite ,which was HUGE and appreciated. The breakfast was good too.. Would stay again when in the city
title: Great nights stay

review: the honest of the assistant service personal is questionable, i lost an important mount of money of my room and they didnt anything to find it, i make an pólice report in the pólice station and i waiting the results.
title: i lost money in my room

review: Overall its pleasant and comfortable stay and I would recommend my friends. Rooms are quite and clean.ertify that this review is my genuine opinion of this hotel, and that I have no personal or business affiliation with this establishment, and have not been offered any incentive or payment originating from the establishment to write this review.
title: Average

review: Quiet, clean, comfortable boutique hotel located in family-oriented neighborhood. Very friendly and helpful staff. Close to underground metro, lots of restaurants and coffee bars near by. Safe and walkable area of Barcelona. Good value for the money.
title: Great boutique hotel in Barcelona!

review: I have stayed at Carlit over the short business and leisure weekend in Barcelona. The hotel is very clean and the staff helpful. Best thing is the location - walking distance to a few metro stations and even to Sagrada Familia. Lots of possibilities to eat nearby. I would come back and stay again.
title: Very good hotel with excellent location

review: Thank you for a fantastic time. Thank you for your kindness at the desk and your help and good recommendations about places to visit and trips out of town and for a good chat after coming home in the evening. We had a great room, with a beautiful view and very good cleaning every day.Thank you to all of you:-)
title: Holiday in Barcelona

review: We booked this hotel (2 rooms) as our train from Paris stopped in Barcelona and we needed to be close to the train station for our final leg to Valencia.Hotel staff were friendly, despite us arriving very late due to delays with the train leaving Paris. Wonderful hotel, very friendly, professional staff. Rooms were very clean, air conditioned and comfortable. Hope to stay at this hotel again and for longer as it is great value for money.
title: Quick Stop Over Close to the Train Station

review: For the second time we stayed in Expo Hotel Barcelona.We still think is a great hotel for the value and its location is great.The common spaces are looking good but maybe the rooms need improvements. Some things in our room seemed old or somewhat damaged.A new decoration would be nice.The breakfast is great and perhaps better than the last time.The staff is very polite and friendly and always ready to help.Having our 11 months baby with us made us need some boiling water and hot soup and that was never a problem for the staff.
title: Still very good but need some improvements

review: We wanted a hotel with a pool and by the time we booked within about a month before we arrived there wasn't many, but we got a fairly cheap deal for such a nice hotel! It's very minimalistic and spacey as soon as you walk in. The room was so lovely and we had a cracking view from the Wee balcony. Iv seen reviews complain about the balcony size that You can't get a chair out but there is the rooftop bar so it's not even a problem. Bathroom is big and plenty room to unpack and put suitcases. The beds were changed everyday, extremely comfy! Great duvets and pillows! The rooftop views were amazing. The pool was small but fine enough to cool down in. The only thing I would say is more sun loungers! I don't know if it's a health and safety thing tho? The pool opens at 10 and if you want a spot all day on a Lounger, get there at 10! Folk were lying on the patios. The bar food is fine, not much choice. The underground and main rail station literally across the road a 2/3 minute walk! Would definitely stay here again if I came back to Barca!
title: Worth the Pennies!

hotelLocation: Passeig Mare de Deu del Coll 10, 08023 Barcelona, Spain
review: Not aceptable. Very dirty and a lot of dust. Very old and it smells smokey in each room. The breakfast was ok but it doesn't matter with such bad rooms. We cancelled and booked another hotel. This hotel doesn't have 3 stars in my eyes!
title: Not aceptable!

review: Just back from a weekend stay in the Expo. No1 great location, just outside of Sants railway station which provides both metro and train. Only a 10mins walk from Espanya.Hotel staff were great, on the desk on check-in very nice and great at providing information on the city. Our room was lovely, very big with a nice corner balcony, great views of city as on 8th floor. Room was very clean, comfortable bed and good bathroom. Good size TV and in good working order. Only 1 thing I would say about room is no plugs at the bedside for charging phones. Roof-top bar was very nice and reasonable price wise. Did not eat here. Overall a great hotel for the price. Would defo come back here if in Barca again.
title: Weekend Stay

hotelLocation: Passeig Mare de Deu del Coll 10, 08023 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel is not in the city center but metro station is very close so you can reach it in 15 minutes. The room is spacious,clean, the temperature in the room was great and staff was really helpful. The only minus is that the pool is a little bit too cold and that you have to walk up hill to reach the hotel.
title: Nice, clean hotel close to metro

hotelLocation: Passeig Mare de Deu del Coll 10, 08023 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days. The hotelrooms were very clean and tidy, bit small but we didn't spend time in the room that much because of the great weather. Also there was AC! Bathroom is also very clean with bath/shower and good lighting.We really liked the staff, they were very helpful and nice even though we didn't speak a word English.Restaurant food didn't really stand out, only are there once.The pool was a lot smaller than we expected, also 1 meter deep. So not really for big swims, We just used it to cool down and chil around it. The hotel was very close by the metro, supermarket and bakery.If you walk down the street to the roundabout, take a right over the bridge, with the metro on the left. If you cross the bridge and cross the street you and go to the right the supermarket and bakery will be there. Overall great experience!
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Passeig Mare de Deu del Coll 10, 08023 Barcelona, Spain
review: Very nice and clean hotel. Room size is big for Europe. Beautiful lobby and restaurant. Nice area in lobby for socialization including a bar for those who drink. Rooms were very clean. Nice large beds. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooftop pool is amazing with sitting area. You can see La Sagrada Familia and city views from the rooftop. At night it is breathtaking. The pool does close at 10 p.m. There is a fitness room and it opens at 7 a.m. not sure when it close. Had enough equipment and weights to get a good workout. During this vacation, I traveled to Greece and Italy and by far this is the best hotel I stayed at.
title: Loved this Hotel

review: We are heading out from a 4 night stay here at Margo House. We can't believe the attention to detail and the service provided. We are staying in room #2 and loved the modern sparse decor. There was ample space for my husband and me. The hotel staff has been exceptionally attentive. We can't recommend this place enough! Some hints - 1. breakfast is amazing - let yourself fill up on some amazing jambon, cheese, and pastries and then have a nice pastry mid-afternoon before you take a siesta. 2. use the 2 loaner bikes to tour around town - they are easy and enjoyable and Barcelona is set up for cyclists. 3. Take the route 24 bus (right out side our door) up to Parc Guell - $2.15 each and you get to see parts of the city you might not otherwise. The Parc Guell itself is stunning and home to the Gaudi parc. 4. Travel just a little north west of the hotel for some more local but still stylish food options - don't get stuck in the tourist trap restaurants.
title: Service, luxury, and beauty.

hotelLocation: Sant Gervasi de Cassoles 26, 08022 Barcelona, Spain
review: Good location, spacious rooms and very positive first impression when checking in but still need for attention to small details for customer satisfaction. I wish the staff cared first about the guest's health before rushing to ask for one euro for half melted bag of ice.
title: Nice welcoming

hotelLocation: Sant Gervasi de Cassoles 26, 08022 Barcelona, Spain
review: Good staff at the reception, but hotel a bit old furnished and unfortunately not very clean. My room had all over the floor fingernails and hair!!!!! Disgusting... It has a trip advisor reward of excellence for the year 2013, but now is not the hotel it was
title: Not really welcoming entrance (reception and breakfast room) Not clean

hotelLocation: Sant Gervasi de Cassoles 26, 08022 Barcelona, Spain
review: Barcelona was our first stop on our Euro trip and we couldn't have been more excited. The staff was really friendly and helpful. We loved how it was walking distance to many sites and the Metro. The neighborhood was quiet and quaint. We had the largest room we've stayed at in Europe (we also went to Paris and Rome). The only thing we would suggest is free continental breakfast, coffee, or snack. We would definitely stay here again!
title: We had a great time!

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 36, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Minutes to La Rambla, just across from the Gothic district with Barcelona Cathedral and a short walk to the Marina with good value restaurants. Very close to the tube station and bus stop with access everywhere! My teenage son loved the hotel, it was very modern and the lounge downstairs was comfy for him to chill out and download his videos on the free wifi!The supermarket along the road is great and has water bottles for 50 cents which we stocked up with everyday. Didn't hear any street noise from inside the hotel. We arrived very early at 10.30am and were found a room to check into immediately, we were then able to leave our bags on the day we left. Labels were attached to them and a corresponding one given to us, so we could enjoy a full day and left about 6.30pm. Very friendly reception staff every day. I would recommend this hotel.
title: Brilliant location!

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 36, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: I stayed here in 2012 and the hotel was a great find! Back then I felt it was in a good location and the hotel was clean and modern. However, during my recent stay it was dated, the bathrooms weren't the cleanest and the staff were not friendly. The place has gone downhill! There are also no safes provided in the rooms! In a city with pick pockets galore, you'd think this would be a standard amenity! In a nutshell, shame on you for claiming you are a 4 star hotel!
title: Shame on you!

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 36, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: My partner and I had a 2 night break here, we cannot fault it! The staff were friendly and helpful and the whole place is clean and modern. Our room was exceptionally comfortable and a lovely bathroom too! Good value and great location.
title: Fantastic!

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 36, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: We had a 3 day city break & chose the Onix Liceo Hotel, its position (just off The Ramblas) is perfect, The hotel itself is spotlessly clean & beautifully cool, (as in a/c cool)Breakfast is buffet & endless & well worth the €9 each.We stayed in room 501 which was exceptionally clean & well kept.The staff genuinely want to help you have an enjoyable stay,I would have no reservations in recommending this hotel & will without doubt use it again!
title: Flawless!

review: So on the positive side, the location is perfect for first time visitors, right on la ramblas which is filled with cafes, bars, restaurants and a very lively and safe area. However in terms of the hotel itself, not sure how it's classed as four stars, the bed sheets were literally torn and even after informing reception no one changed it the next day. We also found 3 tiny insects after which we requested new bed sheets.. In terms of the reception staff I have to stay the are very friendly and helpful.
title: Four star?

review: Will go back friendly kind reception start to finish, clean room, service was 100%, very quite & swimming pool was great, my friend learned how to swim there. His confident he can swim in the sea now.
title: Excellent

review: A great place to stay and enjoyed my time there. A great room which was well equiped and a comfortable bed. The ensuite was well appointed and lovely shower. The breakfast was great with a very well presented selection. A great start to the day.
title: Happy guest.

review: This is a tale of two visits... the girl on front desk on Sunday lovely and kind, free afternoon tea, nice quiet room. Nothing like the bad reviews I had seen. Then the Monday morning experience - my quick breakfast was interrupted no less than 5 times as the waiter wanted to make damn certain I had paid for it, which I explained I had... then at the end as I was leaving he was friendly! Then I went to check out and the guy on front desk asked for 23€ for my sushi. I explained I'd already paid directly to the delivery guy and instead of believing me like a normal human being he took the cash with a promise of reinstating it. I haven't mentioned the pre pay charge for a dog... if you travel with a dog they charge 200€ up front in case the dog damages the room. So €200 potentially for a dog, breakfast paid twice - which I just avoided- and sushi paid twice - it may look like a good price but an unaware tourist could be out of pocket for almost 250€! Nightmare - I'd go anywhere else with this guy in charge... he's only after your tourist money.
title: The main manager wants your money.....

hotelLocation: Gran via de las Cortes Catalanas 327, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: Hotel was nice and had nice sized rooms, we had a kitchen in as it was like an apartment, aircon worked well which I was concerned about as other reviews said they had issues, wifi was very poor in the room, Room was noise due to traffic. Overall , it was well priced and was clean and neat with good quality beds. Location is very good as close to the Red train line meaning you can use it to get anywhere in Barcelona
title: Well Priced and above average

hotelLocation: Gran via de las Cortes Catalanas 327, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: Had a wonderful time during our stay here last summer. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, especially the reception staff and the lady at breakfast, who on one of the days went out to buy croissants for us as they had run out before we came downstairs. Breakfast is plentiful and the hotel in general is very quaint and well decorated.Excellent location, 5 minutes from Monjuic Fountain and super easy access to tons of restaurants and cafes. 5 minutes walk from a huge mall too so you get the best of both worlds with the local places on the street right next door to the hotel and the fancier places inside the mall. The metro is also right near the mall so again, a 5 minute walk. Plenty of authenticity in this area too.The room was clean and very roomy, we booked a quadruple room and were not disappointed. The cleaners also found my watch which I had misplaced in the room and left it on the bed! Truly enjoyed our stay and when we come back to the beautiful city of Barcelona, will definitely be staying here again!
title: Wonderful experience!

review: It is a lovely hotel with a stunning elevator witch is my favorite company the service is so nice and my room was on the 21 floor the top floor my room number was 2105And the food on the 1 floor is niceThank you and this was my review
title: Hotel

review: I stayed here during a business trip. Not a bad hotel, it has a great roof terrace - small but modern and a great sun trap!The rooms are ok - basic and clean but there was a slightly off 'drain' smell lingering around. The weather was very hot so this may have something to do with it but after a couple of nights it was rather off-putting.Service at the reception was a little hit and miss. Sometimes it was spot on and very efficient and friendly but one morning asking someone to call for a taxi for me and give me a hand with directions the response was rather surly.I am not sure how far away it was from the very centre of the city as I did't travel there - I imagine this is a good value hotel for it's location but worth shopping around....Nice hotel, could do better.
title: Nice roof terrace, average rooms

review: We stayed for our first short break as a couple the room was clean and nice not one English channel on the TV to have on while in the room, the pool area was lovely, as for the hotel reception staff we found them rather rude as we booked our booking on booking. Com and booked it at £424 and had to pay £487 as they put on street tax wen we got there and we were not informed of this via email, there was also a taxi strike wen we were there and the hotel didn't inform any of the guests about the situation it wouldn't have hurt to put a notice up in the reception area, the hotel is miles away from any amenities, and Barcelona we found was very expensive as it was 10 euro in a taxi to most places,
title: Hotel

review: Very clean place, excellent food, nice personal, friendly an all question. very nice location close to every point to be transport . We very happy to stay in the hotel if we ever travel to Spain we will choice the hotel.
title: Excellent

review: Its a nice hotel with clean and modern rooms. We were on the first floor overlooking the street and it was still quite. It is close to the water front and in easy walking distance of a lot of the attractions. Parking is about 200 meters away. There are many nice restaurants and bars close by.
title: Nice Hotel and Great Location

review: The stars mean something different in the old world. Good location. No area to leave baggages ( middle of the street). Incredibly small rooms even for European city standards. The staff was nice but most are not in condition to help you with the usual tourist questions (they know nothing about restaurants, tours, etc). If you're a couple below 30 and no kids I guess it's ok. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it.
title: Unimpressed

review: 2 weeks ago we stayed there for a family vacation, This place offers a good location, but is not good for families with small children. Staff in front were nice, but were not locals (all were from other countries) and in times for help, well they did not knew the city very well or were able to recommended anything useful. Nevertheless, location is right there in the middle of Gothic Old town, which is great for local shops and restaurants. Again most things were walking distance, also the time we visit was really full of Tourists making our stay with a toddler a very difficult one there. Room was very small, but they did provided a crib. this place is better for Young couples without children or People /groups which did not care about space and can sacrifice other comforts to be right there at the city. So we understood out limitations as a family. In our care was booked with an agency we requested 4 stars hotel in Barcelona, but this place did not reflected 4 stars in any way. Breakfast was good thou.
title: good location, not so for families

review: Stayed here for 4 nights, great location right next to the metro. Staff were always friendly, air con was a little bit noisy but not too much of a problem. Misses bag got stolen on our first night and the staff were very helpful with getting hold of the police. Highly recommend.
title: Amazing bathroom

review: We checked into room 504, which would have to be the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. One side of the bed is flat against a wall therefore you can only access the bed on one side. The bathroom is unbelievably small, the basin is so tiny you can't even wash your face without water going all over the mirror, yourself and the floor. As you sit on the toilet you are squashed between the door and the shower. Positives of the hotel include, air conditioning, nice balcony however always too hot to use, staff where friendly, the location of the hotel is perfect and very central and good water pressure from shower. Negatives include, very small room(when asked to change and even pay extra we were told nothing was available), the smell of the hotel which is strongest in the room is horrible, it smells like some strong chemical, when we checked into the room the sheets where stained and we asked them to be changed (to which they where changed within the hour) and breakfast has a poor variety and is basic.We would not recommend for families or couples, probably best for one person who will spend minimal time in the hotel.
title: Extremely Small and unusual smell

review: A nice hotel with an experienced and friendly staff. Located close to Joan Miro's Library and Park, and walking distance of Plaza de España. Please visit the close-by shopping mall where the Plaza de Toros used to be and go to the restaurants on the top roof. The view is amazing.
title: Good and well located Hotel

review: The hotel is in an excellent location and is very well connected.
