The entrance to the metro is across the street and bus stops with buses to major attractions are a short 3-5 minute walk from the hotel. Las Ramblas is a 5 minute walk. There's lots of restaurants and cafes in the vicinity. We ate out mostly in L'Eixample district which was a 10-15 minute walk.The rooms are simple but clean, bright and modern. It looks like the rooms were recently refurbished. There was a flat screen tv, safe and air conditioning. There's no tea/ coffee making facilities or a fridge, which would have been useful. Bed's were very comfortable.There's a lovely decked garden and seating area. Breakfast is available but from memory it was quite expensive. We had coffee and pastries in the many cafes nearby instead. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again in the future.
title: Perfect location. Clean, modern rooms

review: It took me less than 30 mins to get to Hotel Marvi from Barcelona Airport Terminal 2 by Aerobus A2 (€10.20 return tickets, valid for 15 days). There's many restaurant and mini-mart nearby. We were greeted with the newly renovated hotel from the reception to our rooms. The staff are friendly and helpful in showing us around Barcelona on the free maps that the hotel provides. The triple and double room are spacious. The beds are comfortable with fluffy pillows. The toilet are equipped with decent shower facilities and hairdryer. There's also a nice terrace (refer to photo) at the reception level, pity that i didn't get a chance to chill there throughout my 4 days stay here. Pleasant experience with Hotel Marvi.
title: Newly renovated hotel & Fast Wifi

review: We're currently staying at this hotel. There's a sign on the door that says it's about to change names to "Chic&basic". Probably should've thought about that name a little. However, the rooms are spotless. Kudos to the cleaning staff. There hotel in general is very clean. There are no kettles in the room (which we already saw on Trip Advisor) before arriving. But there are tea and coffee making facilities by the reception/outside lounge area all free of charge! We didn't have the breakfast. It's 9 euros which is steep in my opinion. You can have an actual meal for 7euros at the places a few steps from the hotel.Staff friendly and helpful.Excellent location. A few minutes walk to Las Ramblas. We hired bikes from a shop nearby so used that to get around (not that we needed to). Great transport links Nd places arguably walkable depending on how far you like to walk! So pleased with this hotel.
title: Very clean & super location!

review: We stayed one night, arriving and departing by train. The hotel is very close (5 minutes) to Sants station.The surrounding area is quite pleasant; we enjoyed two good meals in nearby street cafes.The hotel itself looks rather grand (we were allocated a rather grand room on 7th floor, don't know why). But the restaurant was a bit too fancy for our needs; it lacks a simple cafe in the hotel, but there is plenty of choice nearby.
title: Almost excellent

review: We stayed 4 nights at Abba Sants Hotel. The hotel is about 15 mins away from the airport (about 25-30£) & very close (5 min walk) to Sants train station.The surrounding area is quite but we enjoyed two good meals nearby (Plaza Catalunya).The hotel itself looks rather grand but our room was far from that! It was just average & the bathroom door was once wet which prohibited from closing. The staff (especially Javier) was helpful & informative. They assisted us 2 nights with dinner recommendations & reservations.Depending on why & who I return to Barcelona will determine if I stay again. I prefer a much more lively atmosphere.
title: Ok Stay

review: Stayed 2 nights with our 3 year old and were very happy that they had put an extra bed into our room for her. The location is very close to the sants station but a bit far away from the city's attractions. The hotel breakfast was good lots of choices and the rooms were clean.
title: Great location for Sants station

hotelLocation: Passeig Joan de Borbo, 54, 08003 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed in this hotel last week and was so impressed. Fantastic, welcoming polite staff and the room was so clean. The best thing of all was the super comfy bed. It felt like home from home! Would highly recommend this hotel and intend to return one day...
title: Amazingly comfy beds!!!

review: The hotel is in an industrial/tech area of the city so seems a bit desolate if you are there at the weekend as everything is shut - not a wealth of bars or restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The positive of that was it was fairly quiet.We felt safe at all times walking around the area. The beach and marina are a 15 minute walk and easy to find. The metro station is 5 minutes away. Taxi rank directly outside the hotel.Our room was very clean and comfortable. Good aircon. All staff we encountered we friendly and helpful. Breakfast was 12 euros and was a really good standard - lots of choice. Free wifi was good all over the hotel. The spa looked lovely - didn't have time to use it.
title: Good Hotel. Good base for exploring. Helpful staff

review: We stayed here in July for 4 nights. The hotel is in a good location, rooms are clean and in good condition. For some reason all the 3 rooms we had smelt terribly of sewage. It seemed like there was some sort of leakage somewhere.The reception staff were helpful when needed, and spoke decent English. The taxi stand is right outside the hotel, and a few pubs and restaurants are there within the vicinity. It is walking distance to Razzmatazz nightclub, 5-7 minute taxi ride to Casino Barcelona, all the good clubs are around that area.Few minutes walk to the beach.
title: Would rate it between 3 and 3.5 stars

review: Hotel was pleasant enough and rooms were clean but slightly worn - had a mouldy patch on the ceiling in the bathroom that dripped water through out our stay. Pool area was very nice however with bar and breakfast buffet was very good and had a lot of different items to choose from. Bit disappointing you could not get any drinks after 12pm, not even to your room on room service. Also in a pretty far out area of town.
title: Nice hotel but nothing special

review: It was practical for the office I was visiting, but not the best view.However hotel room was lovely and clean and the service was great.Breakfast was really good and enjoyed mine outside near the pool.Would come back again.
title: Nice hotel in a strange location

review: We have visiting Barcelona with two small kids in August 2017 and stayed at Vila Olimpica. In the overall hotel is nice, spacious lobby, small but cosy pool area, modern and large rooms. Kitchen in the rooms comes with extra charge (12e/day) and you are not able to have it, if you stay under 7 days.The hotel is built in 2016, but it is already needs some small fixing. Very friendly and helpful stuff. As it is normal in Spain, prepare to wait a bit for everything. :)Not much variety in food at breakfast, not really worth the price. The restaurant is a bit overpriced for just an ordinary food. Location is not the best one, but ok. The best area around the hotel is not so nice. Metro station is close (10 trip ticket costs 9,90 €) and there is a long street with lots of restaurants and some shops just in 10 minutes walk. The beach is also in accessible distance by walking. Taxis are quite cheap, so if you are not able to walk, it is easy to get around by taxi (I.e. trip to Sagrada Familia 8 €, to Park Guell 11 €, to the airport 36 €). Spa was ok. For those, who is travelling with kids, be aware, that you are able to use spa only in the mornings.I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
title: Trip to Barcelona with small kids

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 570, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Very clean hotel, convenient location near La Rambla and other nice spots.Good and plentiful breakfast but it could be improved.The rooftop pool was very appreciated after a long hot day.Would go back!
title: Very good location and great small rooftop pool

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 570, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: ‪I am having to right this out of frustration & deep annoyance if the way my friends & I have been treated by Sunotel Central. We booked 6 rooms back in March around 11.30pm through a booking agency. We realised we had made a mistake within 10 hours of the booking so through the agency (who called the hotel direct at 9am) to try and cancel the rooms . They refused to do so stating they had a non cancellation policy . It was explained that as the holiday was not until September, surely they could take a small cancellation fee, but no they stuck to their policy rigidly . My friends & I worked something out so we could still use 4 out of 6 rooms . I called the hotel again requesting they cancel just 2 rooms . However again they refused to budge repeating like parrots their no cancellation policy . I think a bit of consideration & understanding would go along way . I only want to cancel 2 rooms which I'm sure they would be able to re sell before September!! Very unhappy customer who will not be recommending this hotel & the rest of it chain ! Ok thanks for letting me vent , unfortunately it doesn't get my money back ! ‬
title: Despicable behaviour by the hotel with a future booking

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 570, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: A good location with excellent staff.The room was small and had no view but was spotless clean and comfortable.The staff was excellent.I got the room for early checkin at 10:30 am on arrival, a very nice surprise.The room was always cleaned while I had breakfast.Pool area on the roof is not that big but had around 15 sunbeds, a small pool and a jacuzzi, very nice.The location of the hotel is really good. Just a short walk down to Las Ramblas and the area around the hotel is filled with local restaurants and two brewey pubs.
title: Review of Sunoitel Central

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 570, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: I would give this hotel 4.5/5 if possible but decided to swing to 5 to help boost overall figure. We booked a basic room just a few days before we stayed and found the price of £100 per night a good deal at such short notice. If you book a basic room and are surprised by the fact it is small and doesn't have a great view then you need to loosen the purse strings a bit! The basic room was cosy, very clean, had a fridge, big bathroom with rainforest shower, cleaning service every day if you want it and all the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. The rooftop pool was small but very clean and there were enough loungers it seemed to stem the flow of people coming up at various points during the day, the view was good, pool temperature perfect for summer weather and clean toilets up there, including a shower and hairdryer for people who check out early but hang about the pool until their flight.If you're flying into El Prat then the Aerobus stops at Universitat, which is 3 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is surrounded by well priced bars and restaurants and is 10 minutes walk to Ra Lambla - but Eixample itself is great for up and coming gastro places. Thank you Sunotel, we will stay here again when we return!
title: Great service and location...Better than reviews suggest!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 668, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: I will not add to the previous reviews mentioning the facilities and the beauty of the architecture, I would rather add to them the outstanding attitude of the staff there. From the front desk (Mariano) to customer service (Suzanne), the Operations manager (Jaume) and all the room service and concierge staff members. It makes you feel that you know all these people for so long even though on a short stay! We were upgraded to a suite on arrival and hence, got the full treat. It will become our next destination every time we visit the city.
title: Impressive, and not only the facilities, mostly the staff!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 668, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: We just came back from Barcelona where we stayed at El Palace Hotel . I just want to say that it was one of the best hotels I ever stayed. Everything was amazing. The hotel itself is gorgeous with a prime location. Our room was beautiful and always clean. The housekeeping was doing a great job every day. The stuff at the front desk and the guys at the door were just amazing. Always friendly and always helpful. The guy who spoke Russian was the one that we talked the most ( I regret so much that I forgot his name). He was always caring and attentive and always went beyond his way to help us.  I would like to point out a special lady by name Julie who made our stay unforgettable . My husband was in touch with her before our arrival. Since it was our 5 year anniversary we were given an upgrade to a better room and received a bottle of champaign with chocolates including a hand written note from her. She took time to meet us in person later during our stay and it was a real pleasure.  There is absolutely nothing negative I can say about El Palace . If I am back to Barcelona, I would only stay there.
title: Spectacular !!!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 668, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: I just returned from a stay at the El Palace Hotel. I was most impressed with the staff, who truly tried their best to make our stay enjoyable. My favorite was Amal from Guest Relations- who went out of her way, each and every day she worked during our stay, to ensure our stay was perfect and that all of our needs were met. She was so very welcoming and warm and helpful. Amal helped to make our trip extra special. I also so enjoyed Guiseppe (who works in the Winter Garden Restaurant)- he was so friendly and enjoyable and made our dining experience fun.
title: Nice location with friendly staff

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 668, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: What an amazing piece of art in the heart of Barcelona!Every detail is well thought of, from the decoration (impressive) , big size of the rooms the roof top terrace with a panoramic view of Barcelona (best view actually)to the extremely respectful staff , the professionalism of the concierge who were very helpful in giving the needed guidance... surely the palace hotel made our stay my husband and I memorable in Barcelona The location as well is perfect: 5mn walking distance to catalunya place or passeias de Garcia and yet very quiet environment.I highly recommend this hotel for couples/ families or any person looking to have a great stay in Barcelona because this hotel will make sure to fulfill all the needs of their customers .
title: Beautiful monument in the heart of Barcelona

review: We had a nice view of the Mediterranean from our smallish 5th floor room. We wound up in that room because the hotel could not get the internet to work in two different rooms on the second floor in the front of the building. Our bathroom sink backed up a few times, and I had to ask for a plunger to dredge up some amazingly diverse slime and restore the flow at one point. The breakfasts were mediocre although the fresh fruit and yogurt were OK.
title: Location, location, location and not much else

review: I had a very bad experience with this hotel staying 7 days. Most of the worst customer services you will ever get especially senior managers of the hotel are not helpful and rude. They look tired and they totally dont want to work, it looks like if they are making favours to the customers by replying. If you booked this hotel just cancel it as it will ruin your holidays which you have worked so hard for. They make your stay stressful and without any services at all. And its not that close to the centre - you still have to get a taxi to the centre - by walk it will take you at least 50 min. There is no such balcony as on the picture- all you get is one small window looking outside. So don't even rely on their pictures on the website. Basically you will flush your money for no service, not great room, not great view, breakfasts has no choice at all, very poor. Prices are too high for such place. Absolutely waste of money!
title: Absolutely terrible service-DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL

review: The Hotel looks very up-to-date and clean. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was not small (which is the case in many other hotels), also the shower was perfectly spacious!Hotel was right at the beach, and a hop-on hop-off bus stop was around the corner.
title: Comfortable stay

review: Not bad hotel for business travelers, small but clean rooms.Staff if friendly, however a bit slow ( but ir is summer time in Spain, so no surprise ;) )Breakfasts are rather narrow not proposing wide variety ...Price is higher than it should be for this type of hotels...
title: Clean, comfortable, a bit expensive

review: We stayed at the Eurostars Monumental Barcelona 25-30 June , the hotel is situated About a 10 minute walk from the Basilica Sagrada Família, , the hotel rating is 4**** , although it is clean and tidy, on entering the reception the area seems a little tired, bedrooms are spacious, clean, and fresh towels daily , breakfast there is a good selection of fruit , pastries etc, my husband tried the scrambled eggs but found them cold even though were in a container that should of kept them hot, plenty of different Nespresso coffee to choose from, we being english like a good cup of tea, we only found breakfast tea available on first day, we asked each day after to be told no only other fruit tea / herbal available, luckly we had some we brought just incase, On the whole i would recomend for convenience to sightseeing/ metro line
title: Mini break

review: I bought this trip through Travel Republic as a surprise for my husbands 50th birthday. I emailed ahead and asked for a nice room with a view as it was a surprise. I had booked transfers too.We arrived and there was no one waiting for us. We waited for half an hour but nothing. We walked 10 minutes through the terminals and we came across the transfer office. They did not apologise, just made a phone call and said 5 minutes. 15 minutes later still nothing. So I went back to the desk and they made another call and said 5 minutes. We were completely fed up by this time.We arrived at the hotel and the lady on reception told us to check in at 2 and took our bags and gave some information about catching buses etc. She was the only helpful person I came across. We collected our luggage and went to the room. Yes we had a sea view and the window opened wide which was nice ... and that is the only good thing I can say about this hotel. The room is in dire need of updating, walls are badly marked and when u pull back the curtain there was mould. The bed was hard and the only plug socket you could use was if you unplugged the lamp or fridge. Trying to get ready was a big issue as a woman. The hairdryer was in the bathroom but getting ready in there was impossible, no air con in bathroom, gets too hot to do makeup. So u have to pull the chair round to the long mirror, where there is nowhere to put makeup, I set myself up a table with my suitcase. Then had to unplug the fridge so I could use the socket for my own appliances.Housekeeping didn't clean our room any of the days of our stay until 430. Then all they did was make the bed and clean the shower. I went to have a shower on the second day and had no towels. I had told reception in the morning that my husband had broken a glass in the room which we had picked up the pieces and left on the tray. He told me not to worry as housekeeping would deal with it. They just left the glass on the tray, they didn't change our dirty coffee cups or replace any coffee or sugar etc. Very bad service and when I rang down reception just sent me 2 cups and a glass. I had to ask again for her to take the broken glass away. The breakfast was typical and nothing to really say about the quality. How this hotel makes any money is beyond me. My husband and I went to the bar at least 7 times during our stay looking for a drink and bite to eat. Only twice did we manage to get a drink as the bar was not staffed. We saw quite a few people walk away after being unable to get a drink. Absolute rubbish.The hotel was near the beach, which was nice. Just be warned the beach bars have very high prices. I was charged 9 euros for a pinacolada, picture was in a large glass, they brought it to the table in a plastic cup that was only half full, and when you cannot get a drink in your hotel you get forced elsewhere. Just take lots of euros with you. Would I go back ? Not a chance!!
title: So disappointed

review: Eurostars Monumental is a great choice for a stay in Barcelona! Just a minutes walk from the Monumental metro station and a 10 minute walk from the Sagrada Familia. There is a supermarket next door and many places to eat and drink are also a relatively short walk away.Our room was very spacious and comfortable, beds were very comfy, bathroom was a good size and shower was great! Breakfast is a buffet service, which had plenty choice of both hot and cold food as well as drinks. My only negative around this is the the breakfast room is very small and fills up quick so I can imagine this can be a problem at busy times!
title: Excellent hotel!

review: Stayed here for 4 nights last week and was disappointed. The good point is the location lots of restaurants within walking distance of all types/budgets , Metro station virtually outside the hotel but even as a base this hotel falls short of 4*.Small reception , tiny bar in corner of reception never saw it being used this is a shame because after a days sightseeing its nice to have somewhere to sit and relax , there was no atmosphere as its in the reception theres a small amount of chairs that need replacing as stained/tears etc . Most reception staff helpful , the younger girl on in an evening doesnt speak English or French so there was no way of communicating our problem to her so we gave up , a 24 hour reception needs staff fluent in more than one language. Everytime we passed reception she was on her mobile. Rooms were small with inefficient air conditioning , all buttons had been removed on the control panel to prevent people turning it up as the room was small it was very stuffy , there was no option of opening the windows as the traffic noise. The room needs updating , the beds were very hard and cheap quality and we were woken numerous times by doors banging loud noise inside the hotel and drilling on one occasion.I would expect tea/coffee making facilities in a 4*.Breakfast was a disgrace didnt even bother going on the last day. It is in the basement in a small stuffy airless room with no windows there are only 8 tables and no atmosphere. Were out of stock on breakfast tea for the whole 5 days no apologies (doesnt take much to pop to the supermarket 2 doors away ) Coffe machin useless everyone was complaining about it so slow there were large queues for drinks. Fruit selection ok but cereal selection poor , hot items terrible congealed egg and greasy bacon with cauliflower and beans in inefficient warming trays worst breakfast i have experienced in a European hotel.Hallways need carpet replacing , overall a 2* star business hotel , no frills and no atmosphere would not revisit
title: Not a 4* Hotel

review: We booked this as a "Top Secret Hotel" on Lastmnitue.com. It was supposed to be a 4* Hotel. We thought we pay a bit extra to treat ourselves and were really looking forward to our holiday in Barcelona. The Hotel Staff was quite friendly however the room was a tiny dingy cupboard. There was no ceiling lighting in the room. As there was only one free power point we'd had to unplug one of the bedside lamps if we needed to charge more than one thing, which plunged the room into near darkness. The wardrobe was also so small that only one of us could unpack the luggage for our week long trip. When we arrived the safe wasn't working because the batteries were run down, we asked to have them replaced but they used such cheap batteries that it continued with low battery warning. Very Very disappointed . This is definitely NOT a 4* Hotel!
title: This is not a 4* Hotel

review: been there for 4 nights on Dec. 2016 . very nice hotel . nice room. very clean . very nice neighborhood with restaurants and coffee shops. all the Receptionists were very nice and try to help with every Q.good value for money.
title: Great hotel !

review: Hotel Glories is clean with large rooms and the staff are lovely.We had a very enjoyable stay in our air conditioned room located close to the Strada which was the main reason for our visit (Perfect)!
title: Great Location

review: We stayed for 7 night here in july and it was great. The staff were super friendly and nice. All of the staff spoke english. It has air conditioning and a pool on the rooftop. If you want to stay in central Barcelona i recommend it.
title: Super Hotel in central Barcelona

hotelLocation: Placa duc de Medinaceli 8, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel is in a great location for exploring being a short walk from Las Ramblas and The Marina with other attractions within easy access. Be warned that there are no tea and coffee facilities in the room and no kettle and not made available on request. There is a small fridge and that was useful. No bar in this hotel either but a great little bar almost next door and no clubs so no late night rowdyness. Breakfast was alright but a good selection.
title: Good location

review: Air conditioning broke and after 3 time of being told someone would fix it, they never came. No refund or compensation. 30 degrees in the room (7th floor, heat rises!!) unbearable. Terribly reception staff too.
title: Awful. Please avoid!!

review: The hotel is quite central to the center but I do have to say it is not a 4 star and definitely not worth the price we paid. The hotel is looking tired and dated in certain areas and the breakfast is very expensive at €15 each for a continental buffet. The hotel lacked atmosphere and although it had a pool it was impossible to get any loungers. I think I would save my money and go for somewhere cheaper next time
title: Not a 4 Star!

hotelLocation: Placa duc de Medinaceli 8, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Just for a two days business trip. The location of the hotel is good. just a 10 minutes food walk to the beautiful beach.Rooms where clean. Be Aware about the inside rooms without a windows. Will work for two days and if you drink something :-)Rest of the Hotel is good and clean. Nice Service.
title: Nice and clean Hotel

hotelLocation: Placa duc de Medinaceli 8, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The location of the hotel is perfect. Las Ramblas is about 2 minutes away, Gothic Quarter is about 5 minutes away. There are markets and restaurants right around the corner. The staff is very friendly, when we arrived they were outside waiting for us and helped us with our luggage. Check in was smooth and the front desk receptionist even came up with us to show us the room and how to work the AC. The room is kind of small but good enough to satisfy our needs. Our room view is great, we're facing one of the side streets. Our room has a mini fridge but it does not have a microwave or a coffee maker. There is a safe, but it's old school and it does not come with a key, the front desk said they would hold our stuff if need be. The room does not come with an iron, but if you ask for one at the front desk, they will provide you with one. There is no ironing board. I guess my only complaint is that the hotel is missing some of the amenities most 4 star hotels include. This hotel is nice, but it should be advertised as a 3 star hotel rather than a 4 star.
title: Great location, friendly staff!

hotelLocation: Placa duc de Medinaceli 8, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Lovely location, easy to reach the attraction points, unfortunately the room was not the best, had broken bits in the walls, broken bed( one leg), the bed was moving all the time... I informed the receptionist, but no change... Lovely large bathroom and shower cabin, but flooded sink, as previously, I informed the receptionist , but no change... Breakfast... Poor. The receptionist was lovely, giving information about the town and tickets, which you can buy them from there. Overall, good... Could be betterThese are pictures from the balcony
title: Spain

hotelLocation: Rambla de Sant Josep 91 - 93, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: I stayed in this hotel last week for several nights and it was great! The hotel is located on the La-Rambla street right next to the La Boqueria market. The ladies at reception were so nice, welcoming and willing to help - they were the greatest! Breakfast is not that good - didn't have much options to choose from but had fresh orange juice and great coffee each morning. Rooms is good size including 2 balconies right to the La-Rambla - fabulous!!I would defiantly recommend the hotel
title: Nice and Pleasant Place Where Everything is Happening

hotelLocation: Rambla de Sant Josep 91 - 93, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: We decided to stay here because it was in the heart of La Ramblas and close to the Boqueria. We loved it here, close to the metro, buses, restaurants, beach etc. We had a room in the front overlooking the La Ramblas and it was in June. We had the airconditioning on at all times so we had no need to open the doors. yes, opening the doors = noise but keep the airconditioning on and we slept all night with zero issues. The breakfast was average, I wouldn't buy it especially being next door to the boqueria. You can eat there everyday. It was clean, convenient and close to it all. I would go there again.
title: Great Location

review: Lets begin where our journey started, we looked up the prices through booking.com and a dutch travel agent called Tui. The travelagent offered a superior twin room which was also a roomtype on the website, it was combined with a flight. The price was about the same, so we booked trough tui. When we arrived at the hotel it was very clear that the room that was booked for us was not a superior room but a standard room. We tried to change this because we booked a superior room, but according to the manager he offered this room as a superior instead of the real roomtype because of the company were we have booked the room. This was unbelievable for us he just laughed at us and did nothing to help us with this problem he did not listen to our story but was only looking at the line with people who wanted to check out behind us. Because everything was full we had no other option to stay in the closet.The room is interior in a building, it looks like a closet and does not have enough space for two persons who stay 6 nights. There is a semi double bed, but this wasnt even close to the worst things. Every night we heard noises from the room next to us. There are a lot of young people in the hotel that like to go out every night. That's fine and fun but when they came home at 2:30, they kept talking loud and played music. If it wasnt for the room next to us we heared other noises like people leaving the pool area shouting and laughing hard, so hard it appeares that they were standing in our room. One night a fire alarm went off, we went to the reception and asked what was going on, he did not know. This was in the middle of the night. When we got back to sleep there was a constant noise like an alarm clock at 5:30 AM. I walked into the hallway and discoverd that the alarm went of because the room lock. When I went down to reception I again received the answer that they dit not know how to fix it. This morning I heard somebody snoring really loud, and no it wasnt my roommate.My other complaints are: The sheets of the bed were not replaced for six daysThe staff is nice except for the time when there are problems or complaints, they cannot handle or reslove them, the only answer is no or i cant do anything about it.The fire alarm went of in the middle of the night, there was no follow up on this, no excuse nothing.The only positive about this hotel is the nice location and great staff at the bar.
title: If you dont need any sleep stay here!

review: Beautiful and comfortable Hotel, 5 min from the beach and 5 min to the main street "la Rambla".The Hotel is very clean and the rooms have air condition. On the 2° floor there is a beautiful terrace with a well furished bar and a little pool.The price is well balanced with the quality they offer
title: Nice stay near the center and the beach

review: Booking.com has this a 2 star hotel but it isn't clear why. The rooms are quite basic but comfortable and the staff were very helpful. There is a buffet breakfast with a decent range of food and a terrace and pool for guest use (we didn't have swimsuits so didn't try it out). The aircon did struggle a little in the Barcelona heat but I still had a comfortable night. It is close to the Barceloneta port and the Gothic Quarter.
title: Good location; better hotel than expected

hotelLocation: Placa duc de Medinaceli 8, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: My first booking at this hotell. Great location by the end of La Ramblas and the Gothic quarter. Swift check-in even though I arraived very early in the morning. Got a good clean room with a good bed.
title: Barcelona recommendation.

review: What a great hotel. Only two stars but we went off the reviews on booking.com and here and gotta say it's great. Staff very friendly and helpful, the roof terrace has a small pool and a bar that does cold food to a high standard and whichever cocktail you ask them to make. Really good sun trap and everything done to a high standard. The rooms are small but well presented and very clean. No fridge but much better than most 3/4 star hotels I've stayed in before but the the location is amazing. In the gothic quarter it is a short walk from port Olimpic, short walk from the main square in the town centre and short walk to tourist hot spots. The tour bus route goes right past the hotel too. Highly recommend. Best value for money hotel I've ever been in and I tracked maybe five times a year.
title: Value and Location

review: Located at start of residential Eixample district. Good value, clean , nice sized rooms and bath. good AC. Close to public transport and lots of bars, restaurants nearby. Try Ugot for breakfast or lunch just across street. Some rates include free parking.
title: Quiet Location

review: We stayed here for 2 days in July. Staff was friendly. Room was clean. This hotel is near to city attraction. This is easily accessible from metro as well as Airport (Aero) Bus. We really enjoyed our stay.
title: Pleasant stay with nice staff

review: This is a nice hotel close to the main city centre attractions (easy enough walk/very close to a number of underground stations). Staff were friendly - my boyfriend and I would like to mention member of staff Miriam in particular; she was incredibly helpful with check in/us having to change to a quieter room/transport information. Nothing was too much trouble - please send her our regards and best wishes. Rooms are a good size with a decent bathroom - could perhaps do with some slight updating, but it's totally adequate for a city centre base! Did not have breakfast with the hotel as there are affordable alternatives nearby. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family.
title: Nice hotel in good location

review: Nice clean hotel, located near the middle of everything to see in BarcelonaFront Desk staff need some training in customer service, as keeping a group waiting until after 5PM to get their rooms is inexcusable.As for giving room keys for occupied rooms to complete strangers, who are joining the group, is a major security issue.In the 3 days I was there, multiple people tripped on the uneven entrance to the property, with 2 people actually taking a tumble - this should be resolved immediately before someone gets seriously injured.
title: Centrally Located, Clean & Tidy

review: ***DO NOT STAY AT HOTEL OASIS*** We paid €1005 for 7 nights at Hotel Oasis, believing their promises of an ‘inner city oasis’. What a mistake we made. My partner and I are not picky, nor do we have unrealistic expectations for hotels - all we wanted was a clean, comfortable room. But, from the moment we opened the (broken) door to our ‘superior’ room, we were extremely disappointed…the balcony doors were also broken (so anyone from outside could get in)…the towels were dirty and the air-con was broken. Initially, we decided to put up with these issues, but the constant disruption from builders next door tipped us over the edge. From early in the morning to late afternoon, there were builders renovating the room directly next to us - we'd wake up to the sound of industrial drills and hammers, and the smell of dust and cigarettes. Obviously we were really disappointed, and requested to be moved. The manager laughed in our faces and dismissed our complaints, but promised to move us to a ‘better’ room. Later that day, we were directed to our new room - and I have never been more appalled. The smell of cigarette smoke was so pungent that my partner and I began to cough and react. Additionally the basic (ugly) wall fittings were falling apart, and there were stains all over the walls and lampshades. The lights didn’t work either. Sitting in a pitch-black room, knowing that the manager of Hotel Oasis was probably taking great pleasure in our misery, we asked to be moved again. This time, we were sent to an extremely basic (or ‘standard’) room that was just horrible, and definitely not what we paid for. So, we asked to be moved again. Finally, we were sent to a dingy, dark room with no exterior window. Throughout the moving process, we were constantly lied to about the availability of rooms. We were also told that our original room was now booked up - another lie! After admitting that our original room was actually still available, we moved back. Note: we moved back to a room NEXT TO a building site because every other room was WORSE. Throughout all of this, the manager never apologised or offered any kind of compensation, nor were the room/balcony doors fixed. The last straw came when a builder actually walked into our room one morning whilst we were sleeping - completely unacceptable! We mentioned this total disruption of privacy to the manager, who again laughed in our faces and tried to move us to another room. All we wanted was an apology, but no, we were belittled and ignored. This hotel is 2-stars for a reason, having a small rooftop terrace full of dirty outdoor furniture and overpriced drinks doesn’t make up for nasty rooms, broken facilities or disgraceful management. We heard several other guests complain about their rooms too, and they were told the same lies as us e.g. “there are no more rooms available”. Despite having a good location (even though the road noise is deafening on floor 1) and one nice receptionist, I would ward away all friends and family from Hotel Oasis. There are so many nicer hotels in the same neighbourhood, for the same price, where the manager won’t treat you like a piece of dirt. I have never been so appalled by a manager in my life - he alone ruined our experience. The building work may be completed by the time you’re looking at this hotel, but the sub-standard rooms and lying manager will remain. Do not stay at Hotel Oasis.
title: Building Site - See Photos

review: This hotel is a treasure! Excellent rooms, great-value breakfast, very welcoming and helpful staff. The hotel is just 50m from a metro station and 100m from a small supermarket. Perfect hotel for a city break.
title: Great hotel run by really nice people

review: Just returned from a three night stay. Hotel is situated in a residential/business area, which makes it quite nice as it's out of the busy tourist area. Still offers a lot around, with great restaurants, supermarkets and a market within 5 min walk. The metro (L6) in 2 min walk and only 4 stops from the main station. The hotel itself is small, but adequate. Staff are a real asset to the business. On check-in I discovered that my safe was not working, and the receptionist on duty tried to fix it. Was unable to, so called out the maintenance man who arrived an hour later to resolve the issue. Daily housekeeping was good, cleaned the room thoroughly. Room had an air con, which was definitely needed. Only let down was breakfast. Service was great and breakfast was neatly presented, however the quality of ingredients was not that great which is a shame. Maybe we were spoiled by eating at one of the nearby bakeries two of the days, but I think that this is one area that can be improved upon. I would rather pay more (charged at EUR9 pp), and have freshly squeezed juice, better quality yoghurt, etc. Having said all this, it would not stop me staying again. Overall, a great little hotel in a great area.
title: Enjoyable stay

review: Not too bad a hotel. Has most things you need. We came with our 2 year old son and they provided a cot for free. There is also a safe in the room which is free if you ask for a key from reception.You get free tv and air conditioning thankfully as if you come in summer, you're pretty much guaranteed you'll need a mid afternoon break from the heat if you have a young family and they'll appreciate it too. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the rambla which is one of the main shopping streets that leads to the harbour.Some advice... take water with you or shop on the side streets for it as in the centre you'll pay 1.50 euro a litre and on the other streets off it you'll pay maybe 35 to 50 cents for the same. The same goes for other stuff too.Fortunately there was a really cheap mini supermarket on the same block so it pays to look around. Turn left on the main street to the rambla and turn right and walk for 10 minutes to the fountains. They do a dancing fountains show at 930 Wednesday to Sunday but get there an hour early for a good view.Tip.. it pays to work 1 or 2 streets off the main road for shops and quirky little bars and places to eat.... there is so much to see. Also the mini bar (fridge) does great for little things like milk or butter or a bottle of water too.The hotel provides everything you need and the staff are great. It has its own restaurant but we didn't use it and chose to eat out. There is also a kiddies play area on the same block which is indoor ballpark type at 5 euro an hour. They sometimes need a break from the heat You're also just 45 minutes walk from the beach and the lovely MediterraneanI could go on but try exploring, it pays off. Enjoy your trip
title: Ola ola Barcelona

review: All good! Just a short walk to the Harley Dealership!! :) Overall not a bad location! Little challenging to drive to, but doable after a couple of lapes!! LOL This was our last day in Spain. Parking is nearby and this is a plus!!
title: Vacation

review: Hotel is located near metro and it is in a quiet part of the city. The hotel is very clean and employes are very nice and helpful.I can't give a review on food because i didn't eat it but i am sure it's delicious.The hotel is not that close to Plaça Catalunya but it's worth going on foot.
title: Public transport is near

review: Stayed long weekend wit my wife. Nice tidy clean Hotel, reception staff very helpful and pleasant. Situated just out the way so nice and quiet but within easy reach of everything. Used taxis as opposed to public transport very cheap. There is a bar/café opposite the Hotel which is great value and the staff are brilliant. Very Spanish full of locals. Try it. Only complaint we had a ground floor room which was quite claustrophobic and dark, no view other than a brick wall from the window! Otherwise the room was fine, but if I was there any longer I would have asked to move. All in all well worth the money and I would stay there again.
title: Nice location

review: Just back from 3 nights at your hotel we had a fantastic time seeing the sights of Barcelona. Nou Camp which is a 5 minute walk from the Hotel. We found the room to be comfortable and the bathroom was a good size and both very clean and was kept that way during our stay. Breakfast was fantastic such a variety of foods on offer. Staff where very helpful and friendly during our stay and were happy to answer our questions particularly would like to say a 'Thank you' to Goretti who works in the bar so pleasant and friendly always so helpful to us during our stay, she is a credit to your hotel. We look forward to coming back soon and also in trying one of your sister hotels. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
title: Can't wait to return

review: Stayed here for 4 nights with my mum for my 21st birthday. Honestly this place has hardly any faults. We were greeted by a friendly security guard by the doors and a helpful, polite, multi language speaking lady who checked us in with a smile.The whole hotel smells lovely probably as a result of the spa in the basement.Our room had a 40 inch tv in it, although we only had 1 English speaking channel, room service was excellent and our room was tidied up every day. Electric beds and air con with black out curtains.. honestly me and mum felt like we weren't posh enough to be there!The rooftop pool and decking made us feel relaxed and secluded. Towards the end of the holiday it did become noisy and rife with what seemed like a school trip but can't fault the hotel on that. Did notice no life guard or staff on the roof though which may have been helpful.The spa is mainly a water experience with all kinds of different pools. This was peaceful and free for guests in the mornings which was a great way for us both to start each day. The buffet restaurant always seemed to be closed however we may have just missed opening hours as we were exploring the city every day.Only major fault is location. Me and mum love a good time and it was a while away from most lovely bars! Very close to the football stadium though.Would definitely visit again.Bravo to all staff who were extremely helpful. Especially our friendly security guard!
title: Amazing!

review: The room was clean and spacious although a little tired. We did not get the tea and coffee in the room at all despite asking reception.Reception gave excellent advice for places to eat and travel. Booked through booking.com and the price was more than quoted as we had to pay the hotel direct and didn't include breakfast as was quoted. Also unexpectedly had to pay local tax once there.The breakfast is expensive at €14 but is excellent. So much choice and the freshly made onlettes are superb.The pool is considerably smaller than it looks in the picture but is clean and well kept. The hotel bar has a great barman and he makes fab cocktails. Barcelona is a brilliant city and we had a great time.
title: Great break

review: Located next to the famous Nou Camp ( 5mins ), metro nearby, many (food) shops around, they are open until 9pm about...easy to a catch a taxi, but we used public transport, Barcelona center is really nice, a must at night time! Not to mention other stuff...I mean lot to see in Barcelona...Anyway...hotel was nice and would stay here again!!
title: Very good, would/will stay here again!

review: The hotel itself was very clean. However, you have to pay extra to use the spa. The pool is on the roof. Very small. Only 20 people allowed in at once. But, it's Barcelona !! That city is amazing. And it's a ten minute walk to camp nou.
title: The spa hotel

review: Been there for 3 nights with my wife. We also stayed at the Petit Palace in Malaga and Madrid. The one in Barcelona is by far the WORST in terms of facilities (quite dirty) and personnel.The hotel is currently under renovation and there is dust around the reception area and other communal parts. The path to the lift is poorly lit also. Reception: the personnel is quite unfriendly, albeit polite. They distil relevant information slowly, including on how to access the hotel with your hotel card. Compared to the other two Petit Palace, they have a long way to go.Internet connection: simply embarrassing. Slow, choppy and unreliable. Breakfast: very expensive. Turn right and walk down one block. Then cross the street and keep walking down - On your left you will find "El Fornet" - High quality breakfast for a very reasonable price.We were also unlucky as the other guests were quite noisy and impolite. Our sleep was interrupted by abrupt noise in the middle of the night.Unless obliged, please stay away. Cost/benefit analysis very poor -
title: Quite disappointing

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 455, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: I was somewhat surprised by the ample high rated reviews for this hotel. We were not overly impressed and given the plethora of hotels in Barcelona we will probably stay elsewhere next time. We arrived about an hour prior to the official 2pm check-in. The person at the front desk sternly reminded us that we arrived prior to the check in time so we stored luggage and walked around. When we returned to check in the person at the front desk told us he could only give us one key due to "system technical difficulties" but that they will try to give us another key the following day. Given we were two people sharing a room with opposite schedules this didn't work for us and by evening time we got that second room key. The hotel is relatively modern. The rooms are spacious. The bathroom amenities are cheap and basic (more typical of a 2.5 star hotel in the US). The rain shower head didn't work so well so we used the shower hose which was a bit tricky to balance. Water also flowed all over the floor. Not a big deal just not overly convenient and comfortable. The wifi is slow and not overly reliable. There is a rooftop "pool". I would consider it more of an oversize bathtub. A few lounging chairs crammed together so overall not a very inviting area to enjoy the sun and bath. We didn't take advantage of any of the other facilities which weren't many aside from breakfast since the hotel doesn't have a gym. The hotel is located on Gran Via and next to a Metro station (the L1 line) which can get you to any part of Barcelona quickly. As mentioned above, most likely will not choose to return to this hotel. It is fine but there are plenty of other/better options in town.
title: Mediocre at best

review: The walls are very thin and the staff is very loud. The rooms are very minimal. The water was off the first day we got here and the electrician didn't let us get much sleep into the next day. There is no guide to calling the front desk in the rooms and when one person smokes in their "balcony" every room smells it. Keep looking. There are so many better options in this city. This just seems like a careless establishment. There are better prices for better locations.
title: There are so many better options

review: I stayed at the Petit Palace Barcelona for 5 nights, with 8 people, 3 rooms, and it was utter disappointment. To start off, you walk into the lobby and everything is very dark. The furniture, the walls, and a lot of the decorations were either black or very dark which is not appealing for a hotel. It gave a sort of muggy look and scary really. The hotel rooms had a lot of issues such as doors not locking securely, tvs not working, and leaking from vents. The maid service was also unacceptable. After being out all day, we stopped by our hotel room around 5pm and the room was still not done. After calling the front desk they mentioned the maids were gone for the day and the best thing they could do was give us fresh towels. Just towels? I thought that was unacceptable. Overall although the Petit Palace Barcelona has a good location it does not compensate for the lack of service given to its guests.Only Pros: About a 10min walk to las Ramblas and main shopping/dining area. About a 20min walk to the Sagrada Familia. 5min walk to two different train stations.
title: Good location, not so great hotel

review: Having booked this hotel following flattering reviews on TripAdvisor six months before we found to our surprise that the hotel was being refurbished when we booked in. We had to change rooms three times during our stay because there were certain aspects of the accommodation that were unsatisfactory. However the Manager, Alex Taranilla and his team dealt with all aspects our complaints in a truly professional manner bearing in mind that this place is being refurbishedThis place has a lot of good things going for it. It is located near all the famous sights within 15 to 20 minutes of walking distance. The Breakfast served by the hotel is truly remarkable in that it caters for all different types of dietary requirements. One can also hire bikes for free to tour the cityOne thing that is truly remarkable is the management and his team who are kind and considerate and very accommodating to our needs.My heartfelt thanks to Alex and his teamI will certainly stay at this hotel againKind regardsTushar Trivedi
title: 6 nights

review: My stay at Petit Palace Barcelona was quite unique, it started with a very nice room that unfortunately looked like the housekeeper didn't finish the job in the bathroom; the faucet was still running and there was some dirt in the tub. Otherwise the room was very clean. I do think it was a genuine oversight.The night manager, Andy handled the situation very professionally. He immediately gave me keys for another room of the same type. Unfortunately, the shape was very awkward and smaller than the other room - I wouldn't have been able to use the desk for work and it did not have a patio like my earlier room. He was very apologetic and provided me with a suite to use for the night. My stay would have been unenjoyable without Andy's help.The next morning, I spoke with the GM and she was also very apologetic and allowed me to stay in the master suite and sent a bottle of wine. The hospitality was great, the staff were very friendly. The hotel has bicycles to use in the city. Definitely try to book the suite with the balcony!
title: Rough start turned fantastic stay

review: The hotel it's located a little far from the city center or plaza Cataluña, but it's really close to the green line of the metro station and about 8 stops to Las Ramblas. There is a very complete supermarket just around the corner. The room are renovated and very spacious with mini fridge and cable tv. AC works just fine. The housekeeper removed the card from the controller and when we arrived at night looking forward for a cool room was hotter than outside!!! Breakfast it's average. Very friendly and helpful personal. internet is free of charge.
title: Nice Hotel very close to Metro station

review: The room was ok. Service was ok. Not many places to eat in the area. Metro stop it's close. But, the closest hotel to U of Barcelona for a meeting I had. Next time, might try some place closer to the center.
title: Decent and far from all the action

review: We stayed at the hotel in April. The room was spacious and the kids had a bunk bed in an ante room type space. They had a small, but well kept green space which was perfect for some running around for the kids and drinks for the adults.It is conveniently located when it comes to metro access. Not many eateries around though. There is a big supermarket in a block close by. They do have order in facility in conjunction with a local pizzeria/pasta place and must say their pastas and pizzas were good.
title: Clean, close & convenient - 3Cs.

review: I stayed in there with my mom in May for almost one week. We did not spent much time in the hotel, it´s a bit old, but clean, so can not complain. The hotel is just next to the underground station with good access to city centre and all sigts, it takes about 20 minutes to La Rambla. There is not much to see around, but we found great grocery store just next to the hotel with plenty of choices - great place to buy some breakfast or wine.
title: Family trip

review: We stayed here for 4 nights and were satisfied with the place. Good staff, helpful and friendly. The hotel is situated about a 15 minute journey from the centre of Barcelona. We made the mistake of using the 'Telepizza' service through the hotel which was so bad - pizzas were terrible! The hotel is quiet and just what we needed for our stay here. The AirCon could be cooler with the rooms being a bit warm at night. Would come back! Thanks.
title: Good Hotel.

review: The hotel's place is a good point and you can go to anywere by bus or metro. You can walk in about one hour to reach gothic area of the city or beach. But our rooms wasn't good enogh and the service was below average. Our room was in first floor with a small window. If you opened it you could just see emergency exit with ugly view. There wasn't any blanket in the room and when we asked for that we recieved a dirty one without cover. We had some problem with the safe box too and waited two days until someone came up and fixed it. If you want a cheep hotel near bus or metro its a good choice. But next time I choose a different hotel for sure.
title: It's not the only choice!

review: We stayed for 6 days in May/June. We were on the 5th floor with a corner room. Although the room was on the small side it was very clean and functional. The shower was very good with toiletries and a hairdryer provided. Tea and coffee with an electric kettle is supplied but it is paper cups and no milk provided, but that is no problem as there is a fridge and several supermarkets close by. The wifi in the room was good and a small furnished balcony overlooking the junction. The breakfast was very good with a variety of fresh fruit, yogurt, rolls, cake, ham, cheese etc. every day. The coffee was unusually good to say it was from a machine.The reception staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and there is a computor on the first floor that has a printer which anyone can use free of charge. On the 6th floor there is a solarium with sunbeds and table and chairs, but the lift only goes to the 5th floor, so the stairs then have to be used.The hotel is a wedge shape on a corner of a fairly busy junction, but we did not find it a problem. Transport is very close by, either bus or metro to take you anywhere. You can walk to Sagrada Familia and also to the San Pau hospital which is a beautiful building, now a museum. Many good bars and restaurants all close by without having to go too far.Taxi from the airport is the quickest and most direct way to get to the hotel but it does cost about 35 euro.
title: A small hotel with a big heart

review: Hotel is just 5-10 minutes walking distance from Sagrada Familia. Well connected by buses just around the corner and metro Sant Pau nearby. Easy transport access to every major tourist attraction! Welcoming and helpful staff, can book visits to top attractions on offer and skip queuing in line. Would keep in mind to visit again in the future. :-)
title: Great location, quality and service in one!

review: The best thing about this hotel was the location, just a few blocks from La Sagrada Familia and one block from Saint Pau hospital. A lot of cafes, bakeries, restaurants and mini markets around. The hotel itself is just ok but not very comfortable and extremely noisy (possible to hear people talking, flushing toilets and having a shower in the other rooms at all hours). Beds and pillows could be better too. No places to put the suitcases at all. Lights are really weak in the room. Shower has good pressure but it's not well built, the bathroom completely floods after a shower, as there's no door. Also the bathroom ceiling was moldy and the exhaust fan had a lot of lint and dust which flew around while it was on. The staff at the reception was polite (not very friendly) but one of the ladies was very helpful.
title: Only the location is good....

review: This Hotel is located in a very good position for Las Ramblas and all central areas. Excellent service. Staff were very helpful, check in very swift and efficient. Hotel clean with modern facilities. The breakfast was very good catering for all needs. Fantastic room on high floor at front of Hotel. Wi-Fi good and free to use. Would recommend to all visiting Barcelona.
title: Good Location

review: This was our final stop on a bike trip from the UK. Parking for the 2 motorbikes was clean and secure and a good price as was the hotel room cost.Staff were friendly, rooms were clean and breakfast was a decent variety of foods to suit all - sweet and savoury!Location was fab. A short stroll from a lot of tourist sites.
title: Great location at affordable pricing!

review: Location is perfect next to metro and the all the other attractions are nearby as well. First day experience which was not great let the hotel down for me, went with the Mrs and we booked double standard room instead we a got a twin room, went to the reception for change of room, and was told that their are no room available until next day. So had to sleep in a room with twin bed no working AC.. so basically lack of sleep!! When we finally got a better room it was with a balcony on the 6th floor was good but not a great start hence 3 stars.
title: Location is perfect..

review: One of the best hotels I ever stay!Exellent location! Just 10 to 15 minutes walk to any key point!Super friendly stuff! Spacious, modern, well decorated and very clean room with fast Wi-Fi.On site parking lot for very attractive price.Hotel gives me experience that I wasn't expecting from overbooked summer Barcelona.For sure will come back.Amazing break!Administration MUST place additional information regarding location of parking lot on hotels web site - its really difficult to find it!
title: It cannot be better!

review: Good hotel in a great location in the city, people in the reception where very welcoming and helpful. We also ate breakfast in the hotel which was very good. Lot of places to eat and shops around the hotel.
title: Fine Hotel, great location

review: This hotel is in a really good location . Ten minutes from placa catalunya, and two minutes from casa balto. It has very friendly staff. We also had a very nice room with a good city view and a balcony with a table and chairs. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also clean and had a shower/bath, toilet and large mirror and sink. It was a good hotel for a good price and it's easy to get everywhere. There's a 24 hour supermarket round the corner if you need anything and nice cafes around the area. It would be a five if it had had tea and coffee facilities in the room.
title: Clean, and in good location

review: La entrada muy limpio y el personal muy amables todo estaba bien, asta que entre a la habitación, cuarto limpio pero el baño estaba horrible la regadera estaba sucia con moho podrían usar un poco de cepillado para sacarlo. El aire acondicionado no enfriaba parecía una sauna estaba muy caliente. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly, everything was fine from there. The room was clean but the downside of it all was the bathroom. The bathtub was dirty with mold, you could see that it needed a bit of scrubbing. The air conditioning was terrible, room felt like I was in a sauna. It was very hot. Wi-Fi was fast.
title: Disappointed !! No me gusto!!

review: Absolutely perfect! Ideal location, short walk to lots of major attractions and beautiful beaches! Rooms are immaculate, staff couldn't be any more helpful, friendly and welcoming and breakfast was delicious with a vast array of sweet and savoury food on offer! Rooms were as I mentioned, beautiful and clean as well as very secure and noise proof. Would definitely stay again and recommend! Can't quite remember the names of the men at the desk, but a massive thank you to you both for making the experience in your hotel amazing!
title: Perfect!

review: Hotel is very well located, right next to the Ramblas.Please avoid the single room, it is extremely small for even just one person. The Double room is good.Breakfast is very complete.Overall a good budget hotel.
title: Hcc Taber

review: Overall the hotel is nice even though quite old. Location is really good but isolation within rooms and the aisle is bad and you can not rest peacefully. Personnel it's nice but furniture inside is very old and basic.
title: Noisy and pverpriced

review: Whilst rooms were O.K. & breakfast excellent, our holiday was ruined because on 3 out of 7 nights our sleep was constantly disturbed by revelers on our floor. Doors banging, people running in the corridor and loud shouting. When reception was approached both during the night & first thing in the morning they showed little concern and even appeared to be amused. No apology was given. Ironically a card is left in each room with a quote from the Dalai Lama "sleep is the best meditation" - what a joke !!
title: Dissatisfied travellers

review: The hotel is set in a quiet neighborhood in Barcelona. It is well communicated with metro. The room was cozy, with comfortable bed and a nice terrace. The best was the service. The breakfast was also worth. Thanks! We will come back!
title: Great!

review: Clean rooms, good location and money value. Staff not frendly, except one young receptionist that just started working there (very good english, very friendly and helpful). Supermarket is just across the street, and bakery around the corner.
title: Good location

review: I have nothing to compare with in Spain however if I judge this hotel in comparison to 3 star hotels in USA than it is very good hotel. Ladies at the reception desk were friendly to me and kindly provided any help I needed (printing tickets that I've ordered online or even helping order the tickets or some other stuff ). The rooms are clean and have most of the thing one need they supply toothbrush & toothpaste, shampoo, bathgel, soap, disposable razor blades & shaving cream , comb shower cap and more. The breakfast is quite reach the hotel have restaurant inside with bar however I've never seen someone using it. The parking place at the hotel is very small (about 7 parking places only ! ). The parking is very narrow(quite hard to park), it cost extra and you need to specify that you will need it . However since the hotel located in the center there is a big parking place(and more expensive) available nearby, a lot of restaurants close to the place, supermarkets across the street , inside a room small frig available. So after I told you about my personal experience it is up to you to decide.
title: Good hotel

review: The hotel is typical 3 stars, with a minibar and safe box. It is clean and the towels, cosmetics etc. changed daily. The hotel situated at the intersection of the streets: carrer de Viladomat, carrer de Valencia and carrer d’Arago – in a calm middle-class area. The noise from the construction work across the hotel front was felt just one morning for 6 days, spent at the hotel. The closest metro is at 350 m, called Roca fort, exit Cambria (the station has 2 exits). On one hand, the hotel is not far away from the downtown, boutiques and department stores, and tourist attractions. On the other hand, 1.5-2 km in the humid and hot Barcelona… Nevertheless, such a position beyond the tourist area has an advantage. You may eat better and cheaper.The very good seafood restaurant, called the Crown Marine, is located at the intersection of carrer d’Arago and carrer Rocafort (Esquina Carrer d'Arangó, Carrer de Rocafort, 130, 08015 Barcelona). Normally it is not cheap. But, the menu served from 1.30 pm to 4 pm is only euro 12. The dishes of the menu are changed every day, and they are all delicious. Because of the local clients, it is almost impossible to find a table up to 3 pm. Later it is quite possible. The trip from the airport to the hotel is possible by taxi, subway (metro) or express bus. The bus stop is 15 m off the exit from the main terminal of the airport (baggage claim of arrival area), on your right. The bus is called AEROBUS. The cost is euro 5.90. This express bus makes just 3 stops (placa Espanya, carrer del Comte d’Urguell, and placa de Catalunya). It takes 20 minutes from the airport to the city center. Our stop is Urguell (pronounced “urhel”). The Barcelona’s central bus station (if you wanna go, for example, to Tarragona or Valencia) can be reached by the direct subway line from your ‘hotel metro station’.Our room 603 was quite good, a corner one with views on Viladomat and Arago/Valencia streets.The grocery stores are El Corte Ingles, CONSUM, Mercadona, and DIA. All are close, not more than 500 m off. El Corte Ingles is little more expensive, but the best.There is no fan (exhauster) in the bathroom, the mirrors become misty over. However, that is a case in all Spanish hotels wherever we stayed.
title: Good Base to Explore Barcelona

review: Stayed here for a long weekend, hotel itself was clean and staff were very friendly, even had security 24/7.Just a short walk from the beach, 5-10 minutes! Lots of lovely shops and cafes on the way to the beach however!Central to the bars, restaurants, beaches and taxi/hop on buses. Absolutely no concerns and would return to this hotel!
title: Excellent!

review: The apartment was delightful. We had room 106 and that had a terrace which got the sun around lunch time to around 4 ish. If you wanted sun from the start of the day, the sun terrace and plunge pool on the roof was a lovely place to read a book and get relief from the heat in the pool. It was not at all busy when we were there in the first week of July. The kitchen had all the pots, pans, cutlery and crockery you needed to make snacks and light meals with the two ring electric hob, microwave and fridge with icebox for ice, a tray of which was ready for us when we got there. The layout of the apartment was good and it was spotlessly clean with cleaners visiting daily. We could get to the local train station Av. Tipidabo in a 5 minute walk and it took 10 minutes to get to the Place Catalunya. It was so easy travelling around on the Metro system with a 5 day travel card. The 24 hour reception staff were friendly and efficient and very patient and good humoured while I practiced my "Beginner's Spanish".We tend to go to Barcelona once a year and we would gladly go back to this establishment which suits us down to the ground.
title: All the freedom of an apartment with all the services of a hotel.

review: i think that this place offered good value, nice location close to beach and restaurants and bars. also close to metro station. i would stay here again. thanks to the staff at the hotel. enjoyed my stay here.
title: clean, comfortable, good location

review: Their staff was friendly ans helpful. We were 11 people and booked 4 apartments. Stay was great, with walking distance to eating restaurants and train station. There is a grocery store just below the apartment and daily needs/ Wine can be purchased easily.
title: Best peaceful location, Great Service by Aparthotel Bertran

review: Very clean, very good and helpfull staff, good location, best hotel Manager Mr. Jose who makes sure that the hotel guests are happy and comfortable by asking them daily about there satisfaction and their comments if any. Simply the best hotel Manager I ever met.
title: Excellent

review: We spent 7 nights in this hotel, the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was quite small however comfortable. We enjoyed the location of the hotel, it is near the La Rambla de Poblenou, the street where many shops and restaurants are located. Plus it is near the metro station.
title: Pleasant stay

review: Service and facilities were excellent. The staff made us feel at home. The front desk staff who checked us in (didn't get his name, unfortunately), saw that my sister and I were so tired from our travels and did his best to get us a room asap. Beds were comfy, hot and cold shower available, basic amenities were provided. Excellent location as well, just a few minutes from restaurants, bars and cafe's and the beach! There is a bus stop right outside, and the metro station is just a few minutes walk away. We loved our stay here!
title: Home in Barcelona

review: Hotel Catalunya is easy to get to from the Barcelona airport - take the bus to the Plaza Catalunya (city center) and it is a few blocks away. It is just off La Rambla. Easy walk to the Picasso Museum, La Sagrada Familia, the Basilica of Santa Maria Del Mar. the public market, beach, etc ...the list goes on and on.The hotel accommodations are simple and clean. My room overlooked a side street and building, so it was quiet. A breakfast buffet is across the street in another hotel for a fee, or, there are shops open early right next door for coffee, pastries, sandwiches, etc. The grocery store is a few blocks away for any other needs. Lots of wonderful restaurants and shops are close by. As noted in other reviews, the location is perfect.
title: Easy, clean, and great location

review: The best thing about this Hotel is the location ! we did not use a taxi besides when we arrived from the airport and left to go back to the airport. We walked everywhere, we shopped alot too, considering being in the heart of the city. The hotel was perfect for our needs ! Clean , nice , not too small, we found it quiet at night unlike the reviews I had read before booking this hotel. I suppose we were on the side of the building and not the front which mean't no balcony but we truly did not need it. The air-con was perfect and the wifi is very speedy ! No complaints here ! We will be back if we are ever in Barcelona again :)
title: Location was everything !!

review: Great staff, great location, great breakfast. I'd come back in a heartbeat! Easily accessible to public transportation and near everything! La Rambla just minutes away. Lots of shopping, restaurants, everything you need for a great trip.
title: Fabulous stay!

review: Excellent Location.Family Room.Stayed with family (3 Children). This hotel is so central and was excellent value for money. It was approx 1 minute walk from Las Ramblas and 3 minutes from Plaza Catalunya. Catalunya metro station is only around the corner. The Room had 4 single beds and they said that 2 of my children will have to share a bed. This was perfect. We pushed 3 singles together and 4 of us slept there and 1 on the other single bed. There was no issue with noise outside at night. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone. There was no issue with the Air - Con. Cant comment on the breakfast as we didnt eat here. Staff were very helpful and friendly
title: Excellent Location - Great stay with Family

review: The hotel if located in Gothic quarter, just off la Rambla street, a quite busy street with tourists and party goers..The staff was quite welcoming at our arrival and helped explain everything in detail. The hotel has 24 hours reception desk. They also provided sleeping cot for infant.Breakfast was quite simple, no eggs or meat. There were some corners in the bathroom that were a bit rusted so a bit eyesore but everything was working fine. Just a refurbishment is due.
title: Great location, cheerful welcoming staff!!

review: The hotel is situated in a Great location, just off the Ramblas. The staff are very friendly, very welcoming and went through everything we needed to know on check in. The rooms are small and basic but are kept very clean and tidy, what more do you need when you are in Barcelona, we certainly didn't spend much time in our room! I would definitely stay here again, it is a fab base for getting out and about and seeing everything that this beautiful city has to offer!
title: Lovely hotel

review: I am currently staying here and this place has been nothing but a disappointment.It was very expensive for a four star yet...-the shower gel is just a basic pump style thing that you'd get at a budget ibis-you get a measly five bits of tissue paper-no conditioner given-no coffee, was told what is with the kettle is what you get and nothing else (only tea)-rude receptionist-awful shower-very uncomfortable bed-very poor breakfast - can't believe I paid extra for thisOnly positives are that the room was always left clean and the inside of the hotel is quite modern and nice.Extremely disappointed and there's no chance I'd ever recommend this place to anyone.
title: My first ever one star review

review: The only pleasant part of our stay at Hotel Adagio was the location. The room temperature, controlled by the front desk for each floor, was inconsistent and set in either extreme. The wifi was spotty and never reliable, which caused an inconvenience for travelers relying on that for access to maps, etc. The lobby and 'restaurant' part of the hotel always had a very unpleasant odor, and because of this, we never cashed in on our complimentary tapas, as to avoid sitting down there for a long period of time. To top it all off, we got home from vacation and realized we have beg bug bites all over. Again, the location was great, but I would recommend looking into other choices close by.
title: Disappointed

review: Hotel situated in Eixample. Little on the edge of most of the tourist attractions but easy to get to them. Close to a metro stop . Rooms are a little compact but clean and comfortable. Could do with extra pillows in the room. Bathroom well proportioned. Good breakfast also, served til quite late which was helpful. A nice little find
title: Long weekend in Barcelona

review: We booked hotel just for sleeping and for that reason this hotel was ok. Otherwise it's not really good, rooms were a bit dirty and because of thin walls you can hear noises from other room and hallway. Location is really good, it's middle of everything. Adagio is good choice if you want just to place to spend nights.
title: Great location

review: It is an average hotel, with no elevator and more focus in the restaurant than the hotel.I stayed in a central room with no window to outside but I believe that the rooms closed to the stairs or the ones with windows to the restaurant downstairs must be noisy.It is good located depending where is your point of interests.
title: A restaurant with a hotel upstairs

review: Across from the famous Ciudadela park this is a delightful place to dine. Very good food, attentive staff. Well worht a stop if you're wandering the park or Arc de Triunfo area. I am reviewing the food not the hotel.
title: Ate in Restaurant - Excellent Meal

review: Great hotel with great location. close to everything and the Ramblas is just 5 minutes walk. Close to the sea and port and the mall. The room is a little bit small then other hotels i have been but it was very beautiful and had everything we needed. The staff was very polite and answered every question we had
title: Great hotel

review: This hotel was located in a perfect place on the main street of Laietana near the waterfront. One block and you are in the heart of the Gothic District and across the street is the area for best restaurants where local dine. The front desk staff were particularly helpful for a first time visitor to Barcelona. The room was quiet with comfortable beds.
title: Awesome location!

review: This hotel would be a 3 star in Australia but even then, you would get some complimentary coffee or water in the room. Safe broken. No mini bar. No room service (they have vending machines).
