Hotel Bar never open. 1 receptionist & 1 bell boy managing entire hotel (to their credit). Room was nice, bathroom amenities are basic sachets of soap and shampoo. No toothbrush, body lotion etc. Was expecting so much more for the price.Plus was its great location and housekeeping service.
title: Spanish Hotel classification system is different.

review: This is a centrally located hotel in Barcelona, right on the square at the Barcelona cathedral. Very convenient to Picasso museum, shopping and restaurants. Buffet style breakfast is good but over priced-- stop in at a nearby cafe instead!. Great beds and shower.
title: Barcelona hotel

review: Perfect hotel. Close to Sagrada Familia, plenty of restaurants and bars around for various dietary needs. 5 minutes to El Clot metro station giving you access to the city. Clean, tidy and well presented. The rooms were a good size and comfortable. Would definitely return and would recommend.
title: Birthday

review: I have to say the location is excellent. Close to Las Ramblas, seafront and old town. Apart from this, it is not worth the money. It is a four stars hotel, quite expensive and you pay for the location. We booked for just one night, so we weren't going to stay much in the hotel anyway, but we arrived at 2.30pm and the rooms were not ready yet. They told us to wait for about one hour. (I asked what was the allowed check in time and they said 2pm). We wanted to have lunch as we hadn't eaten yet and I even asked to have two rooms who weren't next to each other, that we didn't mind, but they said it was not possible as they would be different price rooms etc. So we left and came back about two hours later. For the bathroom, they only give you three little sachets of shower gel/shampoo per person, not conditioner, body lotion or any other thing you can think of. Not enough for four stars, in my opinion. Horrible window view to interior patio. There was a safe but instead of a code there was a key lock, but no key. The next day we went for breakfast, and the lady asked us to go back to the room to get the room number paper and honestly, it could not be worse. Chistorra and sausages were cold (we came down at 7.30am as we had to catch a train) and bad. Albondigas looked like they were done last week (and probably cold, but didn't dare to try). Spanish omelette was not good (I am Spanish and I know what I am talking about). Pastries were hard (we tried two different ones). Orange juice and coffee are from a machine. Orange juice not fresh and disgusting, honestly. The lady watches everyone but does not do anything else. Not good.
title: Not worth the money

review: All excellent, good location, good air con, cleaness, staff, facilities. Just didn't have time to enjoy the swimming pool. My sister tried but it was full, she went back to the room. Lovely balcony, very comfortable bed
title: Hotel

review: We booked this hotel for a short break to celebrate Silver Wedding Anniversary. Staff were very attentive and polite giving us a free upgrade to newly renovated Junior Suite on arrival along with complimentary drinks. The room was nicely decorated, immaculate with a super King bed, seating area, X2 satalite tv. Bathroom was spacious,with separate wc and separate walk in shower. Unfortunately we did not eat at the hotel as we wanted to see as much of Barcelona as we could in the 3 day visit. Hotel was situated in the residential area which suited us as the city centre was very busy and noisy. Close to Clot metro station approx 5 min walk and 15 minute walk to Sangradia Familial Basilica which is a must see. Lovely street of cafe bars near the basilica. Used the tour bus for 1 day which made it easier to see the city, only wished we had booked a 2 day pass as there was so much to see. Would definitely recommend this hotel and hopefully will return soon to complete the tour of this lovely but very busy city. The reception staff were outstanding and helpful and always asking us by name how we were and is there anything they could help with.
title: Short break

review: If you are courageous enough to use the metro, then this is a good location as it is only a 5 minute walk from the nearest station. The breakfast is quite good, depending on who the grill chef is that day. One guy is very friendly and very competent, while the woman seems grouchy, and is not quite as good. Kamil is a friendly server that always smiled while she worked, and always made me feel welcome. The rooms are good, with a small balcony. I didn't use the balcony except at night when the air was cooler. The only challenge is that if you want to try a nice restaurant with some atmosphere, you may need to jump on the metro and hit the city center back alley ways or the Ramblier Drive. There is not a lot of great options near the hotel, although the food at the hotel is quite tasty.
title: Good Value

review: A very comfortable stay for family of 5 very close to more expensive hotels but for considerable lower cost. Excellent wifi, shower, air conditioning. Helpful and available front desk. Some street noise and neighbors can be loud in stairwell, but no complaints otherwise. Small set of stairs to elevator. Very happy with the accommodations.
title: Great for the family

review: My family and I stayed at the Splendom Suites for almost a week in June. The location is outstanding, situated near the center of the city in the beautiful Eixample neighborhood. Basically everything we wanted to do was a short (and inexpensive) cab ride or short to moderate walk away. The staff of the Splendom Suites were very friendly, from the check-in desk to the cleaning service to the nightly bed turn-down. We stayed in a two-bedroom suite, which easily housed four people. The room was very well equipped, including a washing machine, kitchen appliances and wares, and a private rear balcony. The room also featured a second outer set of windows/shutters on the front to help block-out noise from the streets, which made it much easier to sleep. I not only would gladly stay at the Splendom Suites again, I would also look there first for available reservations if I were to return to Barcelona.
title: Fantastic for families; exceptional room!

review: Shame they did not warn these young people in a graduation trip.They came at 3 to l'épave and they charge thème an additional night !Absolutely unfaithfull way to make money on the back or young and unexperienced people!Don't send your kids!
title: Bad behaviour with checking Out Time , no flow of water , no view ,an another room 2 meters in front !

review: This is a very trendy hotel that offers WiFi, daily breakfast and a friendly staff who speaks English. It's steps away from the metro train, restaurants, shops and the supermarket. Also, it's minutes away from high end department stores which is why it's located in one of the nicer part of Barcelona.
title: Absolutely Awesome

review: Great location in the centre but close enough to the beach. Exceptional staff that is willing to go the extra mile. They were friendly, Professional and helpful. The breakfast was ok but the chef made up for the limited choices by being helpful and efficient. The eating area was clean and looked out onto the Golf range.
title: Weekend Away

review: As quaint and charming as the city itself. Small like most of the hotels in the city, it is well appointed with cafe tables in front, a nice breakfast room and a roof top pool. Easy walk to many city attractions.
title: Great Barcelona Hotel

review: A second recent stop over at the Catalonia Barcelona Golf, this time with our son in a triple occupancy. Just what we needed for a couple of nights. Clean comfortable room, friendly and helpful reception staff. Very convenient for the Gracia part of Barcelona. Didn't eat in at all - there are many nice local bakeries as alternatives.
title: Another pleasant stay

review: Excellent facilities and friendly helpful staff. In a fantastic location within walking distance to main tourist areas. The hotel did everything they could for us when we needed an extra room at short notice. Nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely recommend.
title: Excellent location!

review: Great hotel, great location, very helpful staff that helped me with my train tickets when I had difficulty.Very friendly and fluent in English and Spanish. Breakfast was great. I would certainly stay here again. Taxi stand right outside. Beautiful rooftop patio
title: Great Centrally located Hotel

review: We were at the america hotel for 4 daysThe hotel is perfect!We traveled 2 adult and 2 children we have got 2 rooms with conecting door, it was great!Very clean, comfortable bedsThe roof is very nice!The best thing was the service!Very kind and helpfull!We will come back!!
title: Excellent hotel excellent service

review: I stayed here for 2 nights with my boyfriend from the 28th July to the 30th July. We had stayed here previously a few years ago back in 2012 and were fortunate enough to be offered an upgrade on arrival.The room: -Nice view from room 401-Shower spacious and powerful -Bed was very comfortable -Compact and cosy roomThe rooftop bar/pool:-The rooftop bar is a wonderful gem to unwind with a cocktail or beer after a day of sightseeing. Cocktails were nice, service efficient and the atmosphere was always friendly both during the day and the night. Didn't have time to try the pool out but it looked extremely inviting and ideal for a few hours sunshine. It was popular with guests but not overcrowded. I will definitely utilise this on our next stay.Staff:- I found all staff to be professional, friendly and hard working and always happy to help out. We were made to feel welcome at all times. I couldn't fault any of the staff.Local area:- Some nice bars, tapas places, brunch spots and shops in the local area within a short walk. A wonderful area to explore.Overall, another fantastic Barcelona trip and a lovely stay in Hotel America. I will definitely return again soon!
title: Lovely visit/friendly hotel

review: Excellent apartments modern , spacious and clean only a 10 minute walk to the nearest tube and close by to the fountains we found clubs and bars close by but only a taxi drive from main area on evenings . Bargain prices would stay here again !
title: Great hotel

review: I spent 4 nights with my family at this hotel. It's fantastic and I never thought this was what I would get. Kids love the swimming pool and there is free parking. Value for money and will always recommend it to people visiting Barcelona. The hotel is working distance to the national museum and plaza espanol. Quiet and lovely atmosphere. 15 minutes drive to camp nou, 10 to la rambla and 15 to the beaches. I rented a car but there are metro and buses to everywh
title: Best place to stay in Barcelona

review: We booked this hotel based on the location. Near to Urgell metro station and Universtat station for Aerobus. Rooms were spacious and neat. We went in early April so it was little hot and we had difficulty in sleeping in the night. The AC can only be switched on or off and no way to reduce the room temperature. Breakfast was good. Lots of restaurants and super market near by so no worry about food. The hotel may be good in winter but not recommended for summer time.
title: Good location, Clean rooms with poor view and worst air conditioning

review: We arrived very early. After 24 hours in the hands of Singapore Airlines.The charming receptionist was wonderful and stored our luggage and hurried up room preparation. He's a gem.Room unfortunately had been used by a convention of smokers. Disgusting smell. Bathroom excellent. Bed comfortable. Breakfast is varied, fresh and delicious.
title: Excellent location

review: While visited it was under renovation, a smell of paint was spread all over. Rooms are slightly small but extremely clean.Location is good for those who like to walk they can reach plaza espanya, Las Ramblas and many other attractions on feet.Staff are very helpful and in the lobby you can get discounts cards.Breakfast is good.
title: Good overall

review: Friendly staff and great location. Rooms size was good but could hearing people talking and snoring in adjoining rooms. Breakfast had good variety. Other than being very noisy could not fault this hotel. If you have trouble sleeping I would not choose this hotel.
title: Great Location

review: het hotel needs a renovation. My room was dark, noisy (woke up several times a night) and old. People at the front desk were very unfriendly. The breakfast is very expensive and in an unpleasant basement. Only the location and the pool are excellent.Not worth its money.
title: Only location and pool are ok.

review: We loved this hotel. Air conditioning worked well, with a nice and clean bathroom.The continental breakfast offered a very large variety of food, local and international.The staff were very accommodating, knowledgeable, and helpful.This hotel is two minutes walk from La Ramblas. Well located and nice and quiet. The only drawback was the lack of a view.
title: Delightful hotel well located

review: This hotel has a four star rating but does not offer anything close to European four stars standards! Our room on the first floor was really dark and we had a view on the hotel AC system... We asked if we could have another room but were told they had no other room available when they had rooms available to book online. The staff is not particularly friendly either. The pool area looks nothing like the pictures! I would definitely not recommend this hotel as I have stayed in Barcelona several times before and you can get a lot better for value for your money!
title: Definitely not worth your money!

review: For a city hotel you can't fault this location. The tiny roof top pool is small and really welcome with a bar, snacks and loungers. No umbrellas (maybe a hazard if it's windy) but ample shade. Good car parking underground- but very expensive at €29 per day. The reception area and staff are very welcoming. Breakfast good and they even had gluten free bread! NegativesWe were in room 218. Very noisy. From 8am you could hear running children and even the lifts opening and closing. We would return here when improvements are finished as sleeping areas need modernising.
title: Great location, pool and staff

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 574, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Very conveniently located. Bars and cafes around. Easy walk to Plaza Catalunya where the hop on hop off bus is. Airport bus shuttles are also within walking distance. Rooms are clean though old design. Hotel staff are friendly. Would recommend. Superb value for money.
title: Great location, rooms are clean

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 574, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: same high standards, lovely rooms, great staff, great location, spotless, nothing too much trouble, only down side was the poor lady looking after us at breakfast, she was amazing but needed a helping hand.
title: second visit 8 years apart

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 574, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Spend a lovely few days at this hotel. Room was very spacious & also came with a large balcony (which we didn't request but were delighted with!!) Good coffee at breakfast.Beware of pickpockets in this area. Very close to Metro, short walk to La Rambla also.
title: Great!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 574, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel is just off placa universidad and is a few mins walk from where the Aerobus, to and from the airport drops you off and collects, which is really helpful. There is also a metro close by, which I recommend using during your stay. Not a good connection to the airport though. Maybe an easy 15 min walk to La Ramblas.The room was clean and quiet. The air con was actually really good. Comfortable bed. The mini bar was pretty good value, especially compared to any of the shops. Only Spanish TV channels and no tea/coffee facilities though.Breakfast selection was small but everything that was there was fresh and nice.They also have a 24hr front desk and a really good luggage drop off option. I would recommend this hotel as a practical and reliable place to stay with friendly staff. No luxury but perfectly comfortable.
title: Well situated hotel. Clean rooms. Helpful and friendly staff.

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 574, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Came here for business trip and was happy with stay. Place is easy to find and although on the Main Street not to noisy. Checkin is easy and efficient. Breakfast is great value and good quality. Had a room with big balcony on top floor which was nice had it not been too warm to use. The air conditioning in the to floor room is not sufficient to get room to a nice sleeping temperature which is a thing to watch.
title: Good place to stay!

review: This was the third time we have stayed at the Regente. This time we stayed for 10 days in June and July. We booked in September last year in order to secure superior room 703 which has a large terrace and lots of room. The staff were as always superb and could not do enough for guests. A special thanks to Sandra the Reception Manager. All in all this was, as expected, another excellent stay at a well run hotel in the city centre. An extra special thank you to Silvia the Hotel Manager for, again, making our stay so enjoyable.
title: Yet another fabulous stay at the Regente

review: Am writing my review from the hotel right now , the hotel is beautiful a bit older but nothing major , the staff here do their best to help you in anyway, the breakfast buffet also good hot bacon, scrabble eggs and fresh juice. The only fault I found with this hotel there are tiny ants everywhere in the bathroom and in the beds , before I leave am definitely shaking out my suitcase, also if your looking to sleep in it's impossible due to the morning rush in the hallway yelling or talking . The location of the hotel is spectacular!!! Everything is right around the corner from high end shopping down to Mac Donald ... lots of tapas to try also if you like u can buy your own wine or beer at the local supermarket with is a 2 min walking distance . I forgot to mention if your looking for a night cap check out the roof top patio for your complementary drinks and the sunset absolutely beautiful.
title: Beautiful Hotel....

review: This is a beautiful Hotel, Close to la rambla and also placa Catalonia. Super Outstanding service from all of the staff. Including Paulina who was very helpful, focus and good service at the beautiful hcc terrace with a wonderful views. Value for money was ok and the breakfast presentation and quality just outstanding. Stayed July 2017, travelled with group.
title: Excellent hotel hcc

review: HCC Regente is in a great location, within walking distance of many sights and a metro station. There are also many restaurants, cafes and bars close by. Staff at the hotel are very friendly. Rooms are nice, without being exceptional, and the buffet breakfast is excellent. The rooftop bar is small but nice and the (small) pool is a great way to cool off after a day of sight-seeing.
title: Agreat place to stay in Barcelona

review: We upgraded the the room and got room at the top floor with balcony and street view. But the room is very small. The brekfast is good. The hotel is 10 minutes walking to catalunia square. But the hotel located in center so you have many options around.
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: 10 Th, Riera Blanca Street, 08903 Barcelona, Spain
review: Great hotel with a great location. Stayed here for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. The rooms are nice and cosy. They have everything that you need. Staff is very helpful and friendly. They will tell you what all to visit and how to get there. Breakfast is OK. Nothing out of the world but just basic food. It has a McDonald's right outside and handful of restaurants around. The main airport line metro is just steps. Thanks for the awesome service.
title: Brilliant

hotelLocation: 10 Th, Riera Blanca Street, 08903 Barcelona, Spain
review: Just next to metro station Collblanc line 5 and 9. Most attractions and sights can be reached by public transport within 30 to 60 minutes. Cleaning is adequate. Breakfast buffet is not impressive. The waiting staff at breakfast could use some training in customer service, whereas the reception staff are very helpful and professional. Air condition in room is very hard to control. Will shut down when you leave the room, so you will return to a blazing hot room in the evening. Also sometimes randomly shuts off during night, so you'll wake up early in the morning due to heat. Some noise from the street, but not bad. WiFi is completely useless. No fridge or boiler in the room. Reception and breakfast around the block.
title: Decent for the price

hotelLocation: 10 Th, Riera Blanca Street, 08903 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed for 6 days at Madanis hotel recently. We were given the 'executive floor' room which was always tidy provided with a brilliant housekeeping service. As we were very active in Barcelona trying to see as many things as possible, we did not spend much time in the hotel, however there are many touches that made our stay a pleasurable experience. First of all the staff: they were all really nice and helpful, constantly smiling, especially the lady at reception when we checked in. She gave us a map of Barcelona and immediately circled around all the most important and interesting sites to visit which was very nice of her. Staff were all really responsive and first class - spot on. I also work in a 4* hotel in England and I must say that the details in Madanis are most certainly worthy of the 4* it has.
title: Lovely stay

hotelLocation: 10 Th, Riera Blanca Street, 08903 Barcelona, Spain
review: We had 2 rooms on the 4th floor, 5 of us travelling rooms are very small for 3 people in one room no tea or coffee making facilities one night we had no hot water and the following morning had no electricity, it's a basic b&b type of hotel similar to a holiday inn travel lodge type in the uk, staff are very friendly but the rooms are not to a 4* standard, it's far from the city too it does have a metro few minutes walk from the hotel but your not central, we hardly spent any time in the hotel as it felt claustrophobic
title: Doesn't live up the the standards

hotelLocation: 10 Th, Riera Blanca Street, 08903 Barcelona, Spain
review: Daughter paid for this trip for 2016 Xmas present. Lovely clean hotel perfectly positioned for camp nou and close to metro to get into the city, ate here one night and couldn't fault the food or the lovely waiter, would definitely recommend.
title: Lovely

review: We stayed at this hotel in second half of July 17. The location is simply unbeatable. It is right on the main ramblas street, next to placa de Catalunya , metro station, bus stops, hop on hop off stops and dozens if not more places to eat and drink nearby. However the room and bathroom were a bit small, we expected bigger based on the photos on booking.com. Room was basic with a tv and wifi. No mini bar and no kettle/ coffee service. The room was clean and the balcony facing the ramblas street was good to watch all the activity.
title: Small room but tremendous location

review: Stayed for 3 nights. Excellent central location on main street for access to metro, hop on hop off tours, airport bus. That came with downside of noise at night which did affect my sleep. Room was clean, bathroom was very tight on space and I could see difficulties emerging for customers who may be obese as hard to close the door, pass by the toilet to get into the shower. Breakfast room was clean also. Fresh fruit of bananas, apples and oranges. Fruit juice, water, coffee..selection of cereals, croissants and bread for toasting were available for guests. Never met staff members in breakfast room but staff on front desk were friendly and helpful.I have no hesitation recommending this hotel for a city break just try and reserve a quieter room
title: Great location, adequate breakfast

review: This hotel is a little gem right in the heart of the city, great location and friendly staff, the rooms are nice, clean and more than adequate. You can fall out your bed and straight onto Las Ramblas, it is also very handy for the aerobus bus stop
title: Great wee find

review: This hotel is amazing location. In centre barelona. Room is comfortable and reliable. Price is not bad. Friendly staff. It's on the la rambla. Everything is easy to reach. The environment is a bit noisy but a place where barselona is a place to live.
title: Good.

review: Excellent location. Rooms are luxurious and clean. Perfect quiet airco and very good breakfast. Diner possible with nice price (menu of the day for 20€ wine included). Metro and bus stops within 200m and close to Casa Batlo.
title: Splendid hotel

review: It's a nice centeral hotel easy to walk every direction, close to atractions. Hotel staff is helpfull, we came face to face with heavy rain (eventhough we are in the middle of summer) they gave us their umbrella and really friendly people.
title: Nice hotel

review: Stayed here for 4 nights.First impression was that it looks like a grand hotel. The rooms didn't match up as they are pretty basic. I'm not sure how Spain classifies 4 Star but certainly not in my opinion 4 Star compared to many UK and other international hotels we have stayed at.Very basic free bathroom amenities so you have to buy your own and the bedding was stated as being changed every 2 days - expect daily in a 4 Star hotel.No tea or coffee making facilities which all international hotels we have stayed at always have.The cleanliness was ok but nothing more.The bathroom was very small. The room was dark with dark furniture and fittings. The headboards were wooden which made it virtually impossible to sit up and relax in bed. Only 3 plug sockets with none next to the beds.Good wifi connection and ok location.Not good value for money.
title: Average at best

review: The location of this hotel is enough to make it a perfect stay, it's in the heart of Barcelona and real close to everything. The rooms are rather big and clean. The breakfast is great for Europe. Wifi is free and it works.All the negative reviews here ignore the fact that it's a 2 star hotel. The only drawback I can think of are the pillows being too hard, but maybe it's a local thing)
title: Wonderful location

review: A very good hotel in an excellent location just off La Rambla & less than 5 minutes from Plaça de Catalunya where the airport shuttle bus runs from. The room we had was a reasonable size & clean. Breakfast was a typical continental buffet - with cold meats, cheese, bread, cereal & yoghurts & excellent coffee - a great way to start the day. English language TV limited was limited to BBC World News - but at least we got weather forecasts.Many attractions, including the beach, zoo, la Pedrera, Barcelona & Gaudi's La Sagrada Familia cathedrals are within reasonable walking distance (if you enjoy walking) - Park Güell is a short bus journey from Plaça de Catalunya.
title: Good hotel in excellent location

review: I booked this due to it's location and I'm really happy with my choice. My room was on the second floor with the window looking out on to the street.Santa Anna is a nice little street.The hotel is very clean. I think it's been redecorated recently? The walls, curtains and bathroom look pretty fresh. The beds are comfortable! As are the pillows. This is really important. The shower has great pressure and is easy to adjust the temperature. The staff are friendly and helpful. The only thing I didn't like was breakfast. I wouldn't bother unless you're happy with toast or a croissant.I had a spoonful of yoghurt which tasted artificial and it had beef gelatin in it... that's a bit odd.I also had a bite of an apple. It wasn't a nice apple. So I ended up buying my breakfast from the local market.Personally I think, if you can't provide a nice breakfast then don't bother providing breakfast because half of it will be thrown in the bin anyway. Other than that, everything was fine. I would stay here again.
title: Great hotel. Amazing location!

review: This is a really nice hotel located in a perfect location just off La Rambla. The staff were all lovely with really lots of useful information available. My room was small but well furnished with some nice touches including a welcome basket. The only thing lacking was the absence of electrical power sockets. My travelling companion and I both like to charge our devices and this was not easy. The rooms were very clean and well maintained with good wifi and hot water. Breakfast was also good for the money and the barista making fresh coffee was really nice. Some more high fibre cereal would have been good but the yoghurts and croissants were really nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value, centrally located hotel for a reasonable price.
title: Lovely hotel with great location

review: This hotel is situated in a lane that leads to La Ramlas. Our second floor room was spacious and accommodates 3. It had a bar fridge and a lovely snack basket (chips, juice). The bathroom was clean and spacious. Toiletries were provided. The breakfast was excellent. At the end of the lane, you have access to taxis, buses and the metro. About 2 minutes away is the "hop-on hop-off tour buses. (It is cheaper to book for 2 days). We booked for 3 days as there was so much to see and we still have not seen it all. Across the park was the airport shuttle bus-stop. The pedestrian walkway was always busy with tourists as there are many top brand and local shopshere. Also lots of restaurants - we were spoilt for choice. Shops and restaurants are open till late. Many theatres in the area - Spanish dancing. At the other end of La Ramblas is the sea. We would love to return and stay in the same area.
title: CENTRAL LOCATION

review: It was a sisters trip with our sons. The location ok but quite far from tbe beach. Neat and clean but kitchen very less equipped. It does not have hand blender mixture or toaster. Secondly only 1 bathroom a d that also old fashioned amongst 2 bedrooms. Also no iron and ironing board. T v alao very small.
title: Good but missibg on many amenities

review: Aparthotel Is in great location, close to Sagrada Família, close to old city center but that's probably all good what I can say about it. AC Is very noisy, water leaking in the toilet and make nois too. You can here almost everything what Is going on in the apartment next to you and on the floors. Kitchen poorly equiped.
title: Ok

review: Great location, new and clean rooms, great hospitality, lovely and caring employees... just a little bit small rooms but it didn't bother us. Very good restaurants around, you could walk lots of places
title: Location, location, location

review: Me and my 2 friends stayed here for 2 nights and we left booking to the last minute so when we came into Barcelona we had absolutely nothing booked. Lucky we quickly found this hotel through booking.com and for us it was a little expensive (compared to staying in hostels) but it was such a nice hotel! The staff were so lovely, helpful and it was very clean and quant. The beds were so comfy and the bathrooms were really nice, they had a huge wardrobe as well with mirrors. I think it was central to most things although we struggled in Barcelona because it's all so busy and it's hard to find your way around. I would definitely stay here again, we didn't get to try the breaky but then again we didn't want to pay for it either. Also the laundry prices are way too expensive. But all in all, we had a great experience at this hotel ! Thank you to all the lovely staff
title: Europe trip

review: Our family of four adults stayed in Barcelona from 7/18-7/23 and were pleasantly surprised with the hotel accommodations. We found the hotel staff very helpful with answering all of our questions about getting around, where to exchange money, where to find a lavanderia (laundromat), etc. The hotel has good security since the front desk staff will let you in and out. If they need to step away, they will return quickly. We had a family room with four single beds. The room had TV with a few American channels, the bathroom was very large and the air conditioning fantastic. We could not have been more pleased with the location and the fact the street was quiet (at least for us since we had an interior room). My thanks again to the hotel staff for their help, especially upon arrival after an all night flight. They offered to store the luggage, though we opted to use their lockers and pay 2 euro per locker for the day. We will stay there again if we return.
title: Great location and service!

review: This hotel is located on the extension of La Rambla so is very close to the main tourist location but far enough away to be safe and quiet. There are dozens of Tapas bars and restaurants along the street and lots of goods shopping very close. We were able to walk to both cathedrals and the water front from the hotel.
title: Location, location, location

review: The Ónix hotel has a very good location, you are in the center at walking distance to a lot of points of interest, but the hotel needs a facelift. The beds are not comfortable, the pillows are hard. The Ac makes a very loud noise. The closet smelled bad... could be amazing but they need to do a little work.
title: Great location old hotel

review: One of these hotels that I have nothing to say about. It was OK. Bathroom - OK, unless it was quite old and shower worked from time to time, bedroom - OK but they didn't change the sheets. Street outside is pretty busy so take my advice - book rooms with windows directed to the inner yard. It's OK if you stay for one night but I wouldn't recommend stay here for long periods of time.
title: Mediocre

review: Nice friendly hotel, clean and comfortable.Great location for getting around Barcelona.Walking distance from the Segrada Familia.(5mins) local supermarkets, and bars and restaurants, and Metro witch is great for getting around.Breakfast is continental, and the same every morning.Most rooms have no balcony, this is an extra, and I wish I had payed for it, as the hotel has no pool, only a small sun terrace on the roof.The check in staff spoke English, and were helpful in helping us plan out trips.In Barcelona, not many people speak English.Would got back to this hotel for a weekend break.Good 3*
title: Great location for attractions

review: The staff was excellent and welcoming the breakfast prices and food were very reasonable. But the hotel room it's self was less to be desired. The bed was uneven there was a slant on the right side so I kept having to push my self up to the middle of the bed. The room was pretty small, the walls were paper thin. We could hear the elevator going up and down every time some on entered. We had to kill several silver fishes, the bathtub/shower was not clean. The first night we spent there our house keeper never entered or cleaned the room and our neighbors where rude going in and out of their rooms slamming doors. We didn't get a good nights sleep to say the least. I know guest/neighbors is not really in the control of the hotel but I feel as if the hotel walls were thicker then maybe it wouldn't of kept us up at night . Needless to say we were disappointed sadly . Maybe there are better rooms else where in the facility but the room we got was horrible.
title: Great location but that's about it

review: Worth a visit get a guide it's worth the extra we all thoroughly enjoyed our visit inside and out our guide from trivago was extremely knowledgable and answered many questions he seemed to know everything :)
title: Interesting and stunning architecture

review: Very comfortable hotel with all amenities. Food in restaurant and breakfasts excellent. Reception staff polite and knowledgeable particularly about local transport. Pool very clean and quiet. 2 stops on metro into Barcelona or a bus stops outside hotel. Big enough to accommodate groups without affecting couples and families.
title: Great hotel

review: They don't understand the difference of freezer and refregerater. When I was check in at midnight. I asked the staff to freezed the icepack that I brout form my home, because to make it cool to carry my sons eye medicine. But after four days when I checked out and asked them to bring it back. They give me a unfrozened icepack. When I complained they just said sorry. But now I'm really worry about the medicine. If you are travelling with a child who need special care, this hotel is not the right place. The staff of this hotel are lack of professionalism.
title: Never go again

review: The hotel is close to the beach, there is an area full of restaurants. It's also quite close to the Zoo (a bit further than the nearest Metro station). There is a bus line in the front street, that can take you directly to the Aquarium. Nice breakfast choices (ice cava was a novelty). Large room. For the rest of town, we had to use the Metro, which means 2 x ~1Km to walk. The line close by is not really well connected, which means you always had to switch somewhere. The view...well, if you see the sea it's ok, the sunrise was quite orange. Some of the buldings nearby look however depressing.
title: Depends on what you want from Barcelona

review: The staff are Friendly and couldn't help us enough but the breakfast menu was a bit overpriced apart from that it was a lovely hotel it was close to the beach and shops... I had a decent night sleep and really enjoyed my stay.
title: Lovely hotel

review: Stayed with husband and son for a long weekend. Location is fab. Very close to beach and fab restaurants, cafes and bars a stones throw from the hotel. Due to recent surgery I have mobility issues so this was just perfect. We walked to beach and picked up tour bus which allowed us to see Barcelona without much walking. Pool is small but sufficient for our needs. No pool bar but plenty of supermarkets round about to buy your own drinks etc that you can have at pool. No towels either so most people used towels from their room. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel as plenty of places round about to try. Rooms are a good size and very clean. Air conditioning very effective. Perfect location for us and we will definitely return.
title: Great Location

review: Almost everything was good , the desk and the room service was excellent, I think the breakfast was over priced unless you wanted to gorge yourself. we had breakfast at a little bar, Mar i Costa.in the cetre ville plaza, ham omelette, toast, coffee,jam. 7.25 euro each. salads were great, deserts not so good. tirimisu, nothing like, came out of freezer still frozen in middle.can not comment on the pool or fitness centre as we travelled from Canada and we do not want to lounge next to a pool when the beach is 5 mins away
title: Brians review

review: We enjoyed our 2 days stay at Ilunion Barcelona in the heart of Poblenou. The streets around the hotel have a quiet provincial atmosphere as the whole area. Its location is very convenient. A 10 minutes walk took us to the popular Playa del Bogatell on one side and to the lively Rambla del Poblenou on the other. And it's only 3 blocks to Llacuna metro station where we could easily reach the city centre. We also found a taxi stand just opposite of the hotel to go to the airport.Ilunion is modern clean relatively recent with a design decor. Lobby is spacious and stylish. Amenities and services were suitable, staff was efficient. We used the business center but neither the gym nor the pool. We ran away from the breakfast hall looking like a shopping mall cafeteria. Our room was large bright functional silent with comfy beds including the extra cot.How much it costs has varied from day to day, one night was quite expensive.
title: Convenient and comfortable hotel

review: We stayed there 10 nights 11 days A 10 mint walk from the beach there a ling street right on the corner 2 mint walk filled with bars and resturants (even halal food is available) there are also small spas (nail and facial) a couple of supermarkets .Excellent location i cant say 10 mint walk from metro station everything you need is there also you're serrounded by bike shops .We used the taxi to city center because my grandma couldn't walk you oau around 8€ one way. 15 mints away by taxi.Bed are not comfy and if you book a triplet room they give you a( roll on / extra bed)They dont have rooms with 3 main beds and yes the rollon beds are even worse than thier main beds , if you have a back problem or care much about your sleep i dont recommend it , but there are many positives that makes me overlook the bed problem.Their cleaning staff arent very dedicated, tou have to tell them specifically to clean around the sink and to change tour bed covers. Even i saw the cleaning lady taking the bed civer from the room facing our and putting in our room instead of getting a new one.They have little staff if you want something you need to go down get it youself most of the time , even the bags we mived them by ourselves. They do keep your bags after checkout for free.Very friendly staff I must say always smiling . They don't have a tourists office but they try to help as much as possible.They offered us a wheelchair free of charge for my grandma and when we thanked them by a small present they have us free cake and sweets I Wwould thank (Mrs.Nuira) most helpfull of all for her kindness . She has definitely a good impact on your hotel and she gives the guests with a positive impression.They offer breakfast but its not a continental one I think 15€ is too expensive for a cold breakfast , you have many bakeries 2 mint walk away so no need. They have a gym A pool on the roof but i didn't use it since the beach is nearby.
title: Very good

review: The room is relatively small. The hotel is not centrally located, but it's very close to a subway stop. The breakfast is good and the staff is friendly. The wi-fi works terribly unless you are in the common areas.
title: Good stay in Barcelona

review: Nice hotel with spacious rooms, much larger than usually found in Barcelona. Location is great to go to the beach while still quiet because it is not too close to the hectic city center. We checked in late and Ariel was great - in fact all Front Desk staff was super friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the morning and the rooftop pool (which is a bit small but so cool). Definitely recommend!
title: Friendly Front Desk staff and spacious room

review: Great location in a nice quiet area. Close to Metro, and other transportation. 15 minutes walk to big shopping centre/ mall. Very friendly staff and always helpfull. Brekfasthall kind of small and very little space.
title: Barcelona

review: Was very impressed with the room size and what it had to offer including mini bar and a balcony. The service the staff provided was spot on and could not fault anything they did. I would definitely come back
title: Value for money

review: I stayed here in may 2016, only remembered now to do the review as I was looking up other places in Barcelona as I am going again next week.. Stayed here with a friend and as soon as we got out of the taxi when we arrived at the hotel there was an over powering smell of sewage..not the hotels fault but just pointing it out.. Nice, clean hotel and good breakfast options.Beds were so hard.One of the days in the late afternoon I had a bad migraine I tried having a nap before dinner and the room next door to us had music on full blast with their doors open! Couldn't sleep or even hear myself think, I phoned down to reception to ask if they could ask the guest to turn the music down a little, which they didn't, as we were leaving the hotel to go to dinner I complained again about the music at reception where the receptionist just laughed at me and said they could play music if they wanted! As a paying guest like everyone else our comfort and every other guest should be a priority. Also the cleaner took our spare room key from our room while we were at the pool and when I confronted her she reluctantly gave it back to me, it made me a little uneasy as to why she would take our room key?! Security at this hotel isn't the best.The hotel is a short enough distance to the beach, and there is a lovely little bar/restaurant around the corner called 'Fabrik'.I've been to Barcelona a few times but I wouldn't stay here again only on the basis of the staff make you feel like you are not wanted.
title: Not the beat

review: I liked this hotel.it is near the city center and the subway station.the room was very clean and nice.the bathroom was clean and modern.the breaksfast was very good(international buffet).i stayed 3 nights
title: Very good

review: This is a good budget hotel. The room was clean and functional, the bed was comfortable and the staff were pleasant and kindly looked after our bags for several hours after checkout. It is also well located, fairly close to two metro stations. We decided the breakfast was too expensive to justify. The one thing to be aware of is the traffic noise in street facing rooms as the hotel is on a very busy street. Barcelona has more than its fair share of crazy drivers and they thrash around at ridiculous speed, including on ear piercing mopeds. This starts as early as 7am; I know that as I was woken by them at around that time in our third floor room. If you are anything other than a very solid sleeper and are in an aforementioned street facing room, please remember your earplugs!
title: A good hotel...but be aware of the traffic noise.

review: Very clean, nice and safe area, many cafes, shops around, not too close to the center but transport makes it easy. Helpful staff, nice sleep, quiet at night. We got the information we needed for nightlife, called a cab for us when we asked. Separate room to guard our luggage before the flight.
title: Pleasant stay in July 2017

review: We stayed here at very short notice and we were made very welcome by the excellent reception staff. The room was of a high quality, perfectly clean and the bed very comfortable. It is a good place to stay should you be in this area of the city, an dis a short walk from good bars and restaurants.
title: Comfortable, pleasant hotel

review: We booked a family room and instead got a very tight room with no space for the 4 of us. We had paid for the extra spacious room but it turned out they had none.The room is stuffy as there is no circulation of air.The bathroom is small and floods with water after use.The reception has a strong smell that I can't quite place. It's like a damp room.The staff are fairly friendly The location was the only excellent thing as you could walk or commute with ease.I wouldn't stay there again though, at least not for the price they charge.
title: Excellent location but nothing else to write about

review: The hotel located with many cafes, shops and metro nearby... however, the room doesn't match with the photos shown online. The room is old and small, a bit expensive for this size of room. I stayed 2 nights; the hair dyer is attached on the wall. And broken on the first night, the staff came up and tried to fix. But not success and do not have a spare one to borrow. I told them that I will go out early in the morning and hope it will be fix, or switch room or they need to buy a few hair dyer that is not attached to the wall.As expected, they cannot fulfil any of my suggestions.The check-out time is 12pm noon. The cleaner started knocking hard on my door at 10am and 11am; and woke me up twice. And they can't speak English, I have no idea what they want. It was scary! When I check-out, I complained to the front office, and suggest them to make some "do not disturb" sign and avoid this happen to any of the tourists. They mentioned the sign is on the desk, but not hanging on the door. And it was not in my room.
title: Disappointed with the hotel service

review: This was a short break for myself and daughter booked through secret escapes. The hotel was very central, just a five minute walk from last rambla. The receptionist was very friendly and informative. Our room was small but clean. We followed instructions for the safety deposit box but couldn't get it to work. We see told it would be done the next day. Not ideal to carry your valuables around the city. Complimentary wine and glasses after use were left in the room for our entire stay, despite housekeeping every day. The lights in the bedroom stopped working after the first day. We were advised to play around with them until they worked! -They didn't. Then the bathroom ceiling leaked water from the upstairs room. Breakfast was varied and acceptable, but food remnants remained under the tables after tables were wiped. On our checkout, surprisingly, we weren't asked if we enjoyed our stay!!!!!
title: Lights out before bed

review: Two very tired teachers stayed here recently (23rd-27th July 2017) as a quick break away to start of the Summer holidays! The hotel could not have been better. Fab location (5-10 min walk to the main square) with help from the very friendly hotel staff who were on hand everyday (sorry!) to tell us the best places to visits and what to do in Barcelona. Our room was cleaned everyday and was very modern and ideal for us. We never wanted to leave! Thank you to all the staff for your help and guidance, we had the best holiday! Love Katie and Priya x
title: Outstanding hotel!

review: Wow a great hotel! If you are looking for somewhere smart but not in an ostentatious way then this is the hotel for you. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle but not too far to walk, in what we would describe as a trendy up and coming area. Modern, quirky and a great place to stay. We loved the feel of the hotel right from stepping of the pavement. Friendly, accommodating staff who spoke good English (sorry our Spanish was so bad!) Just the type of place you would want to be seen in. A lovely room with an amazing shower that I need in my life for 365 days of the year not the 4 we stayed. A hand written note welcoming us on arrival. The latest edition of a glossy fashion magazine to read on the desk. Bluetooth speakers, comfortable beds, controllable air conditioning, great lighting, a good choice of products for all those things you forgot to pack, good quality towels and linen. Lots of considered touches that we enjoyed. We would definitely stay again and recommend to friends. We are now looking to stay at another hotel in the chain for our next break. Good value for money too. We had a great stay thank you!
title: A wonderful short break

review: This hotel was outstanding. They gave us an early check-in. Hector at the front desk was very helpful. Anytime we wanted to get a restaurant recommendation, they knew exactly where to send us. Comfy and amazing. Breakfast yummy. Loved our experience!!!
title: Pre cruise. Perfect location!

review: My partner booked this hotel for a short break. I had no idea of what had been arranged and where we were staying. When we arrived there was building work on both sides of the hotel and the road in front had been dug up as well. We could hear drilling and hammering during most of the normal working day. The hotel itself is painted dark grey and black throughout. Exposed concrete walls and dark furnishings throughout, It is tastefully done however it is not to my liking. The bathroom however was well equipped with good facilities and plenty of shelf space. The bedroom was small and lacking a dressing table so very little room for personal belongings. There is no restaurant and alas no bar either which ruled out the odd G&T before dinner at the end of a hard day's sightseeing. The breakfast room in the basement was pleasant enough and the spread was satisfactory. There is a marked lack of staff in this hotel, there is no one to show you up to your room or anywhere else for that matter, it is a case of finding things out. There is a plunge pool on the roof terrace with a few sunbeds but no other facilities that we could see apart from a few tables and chairs, sadly there are no views of the city. What this hotel does is good however it is more like an upmarket B&B so not sure if hotel is the correct description, having said that, it is the best B&B we have ever stayed at! So long as you are clear about what you are not getting it is convenient for getting around the Barcelona sights.
title: Modern hotel/B&B in a convenient location

hotelLocation: Calle Beltran i Rozpide, 7-9, 08034 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed one night and had two rooms for 6 people. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Did not eat at the restaurant because the breakfast price was outrageous. Within a 3 minute walk to one of the hop on hop off bus tour stops which was convenient for us. Don't even think about getting laundry done - price is per item - $4.50 for a pair of underwear to be laundered! Hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood!
title: Large comfortable rooms!

hotelLocation: 173 Sant Antoni Maria Claret, 08041 Barcelona, Spain
review: Had to stay a week for business at the UNI which is next door.Check in/out perfect. Perfect staff too.Hotel is clean and well-kept despite the few unavoidable traces of wear here and there.I had a one person room and as a result there was not much space. One person bed, no double bed. Great location with cafés up the street, and metro stations nearby.10 minute walk from la Sagrada.Now, your experience will greatly depend on where your room is. The first days I was in 416, right in the middle of the corridor and with the bed next to the door, the light sleeper would have trouble finding sleep. When I came back for one night, I had 304 and it was much quieter being at the very end of the corridor. But the same could be said about any hotel.Breakfast was good too even if I could do without the soft drinks they had for juice.So yeah, no problem whatsoever, recommended for sure!
title: Typical 2 star Hotel

hotelLocation: 173 Sant Antoni Maria Claret, 08041 Barcelona, Spain
review: This was my 5th trip to Barcelona and this is my personal experience. I have been in hospitality management for over 33 years. I am ALWAYS willing to bend and/or break the "policy" when it comes to legitimate human life issues of my guests/clients. I prefer to cultivate a relationship based on trust and RETURN business with my clients. On July 9th we had a family emergency but even after explaining the situation were denied a refund for the nights' stay on the 10th that we could not use as we had to fly back home to SF.Based on this personal experience when I return to Barcelona in 2018 I will book elsewhere.
title: Even with a Family Emergency - No Refund.

review: Perfect location. Easy walking to port and ramblas. Some nice bars in the area for cocktails. Room was clean and large. Staff friendly. Bathroom was clean. Beds comfortable. TV in the room.Short walk to hop on and hop off bus stop.
title: Great location

review: Pretty ordinary but we had a clean room and nice bathroom with plenty of hot water. Our room had a balcony which was a plus. Unfortunately the aircon didn't work & the room was stifling so we left the doors onto the balcony open. Consequently we were bitten excessively by mosquitos which I accept was not directly the managements fault but it was the result of the faulty aircon being a lack of maintenance. My granddaughter arrived 2 days later which we had booked the same time only to be told that there wasn't an available room. However, this was dealt with professionally and she was accommodated at a nearby hotel, much, much nicer & the breakfast was thrown in. Makes one wonder how their booking system works?
title: Good Location

review: Not a bad hotel. But when your flight gets cancelled and you let the hotel know that you will be joining them the following evening and you arrive to be told that they have given your room to someone else and the only room available is a double ( and 3 of you are travelling) so my partner had to sleep on the floor the first night of our stay. So not a great start. Rooms were clean and tidy, food was good to plenty of choice even for gluten intolerant people.
title: No bed to sleep on.

review: I've visited this hotel before, since rooms are functional and location near Les Corts metro station & El Cortes Ingles -store convenient. And personnel is brilliant. However this time I was disappointed: I stayed for 5 nights. I woke up (!) 4 times in the middle of the night for heavy smell of smoking. That is nasty smell if you're non-smoker. At reception they had no solution: people are allowed to smoke in their rooms and there's no way to block the smell. (There is no night club or bar nearby). For me this was surprise since this had not happened at previous visits. In the future I'll choose non-smoking hotel. But I do hope they would change this otherwise nice hotel entirely non-smoking.
title: 3 star hotel, 5 star staff

review: After a rough wait for check-in, everything else went smoothly. The room was nice and Wi-Fi worked fine. It is in a good location, easy to walk to La Rambla and a metro station. The room was clean and inviting. The breakfast is a bit expensive but wonderful.
title: Nice Hotel, good location

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The location is the ideal for watching the dynamic Barcelona and the activities that go on by walking only a short distance. As you enter, the hotel has a notice in front "you are only 24 steps away from the lobby/reception" which is a fact. The shower in the room is the smallest space ever I have seen for a shower in my life. One can hardly move inside or get in & get out. I found it so difficult to apply soap with such a limited space.
title: Excellent no-frills hotel

review: Our first trip to Barcelona and this hotel is perfectly placed to Catalunya and Las Ramblas.....The room was lovely and the hotel itself is beautiful, breakfast and it's setting is very relaxing. Staff are very attentive and polite. We would very much stay here again. Thankyou for making our first visit very comfortable.
title: Absolutely Perfect!

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: With my son and a friend we were in Barcelona to attend a football match at Camp Nou. We spent one night at El Jardi. This little hotel is ideally located in Barri Gotic area. Its charming facade is overlooking typical Plaça Sant Josep Oriol.After a drink at the tiny Bar del Pi we came into the historic building. We were kindly welcomed and proposed a cozy functional simple bedroom. View from the balcony on the famous Catalan gothic church Santa Maria del Pi was really stunning.After a short but quiet night we came down to eat something and have coffee. As the breakfast room was a bit gloomy we went outside and took our café and buñuelos at a nearby terrace. Looking at the city coming to life around the pine planted in the middle of Plaça del Pi All in all we had a pleasant stay at El Jardi.
title: In the heart of Barri Gotic

review: We enjoyed our stay very much at this hotel.The hotel itself was ideally placed, it was very clean and well presented with some lovely period features and the dining area was very nice. Our room was clean but only thing we didn't like was it was an internal room with no window except to a service shaft which was very noisy. The staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful and I would recommend this hotel.
title: Short break

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This is a nice hotel, in a historic part of the city. Dating from 1860, it's was apparently only the third hotel in Barcelona, although I don't know if the other two are still there! I didn't initially realise it was that old though, as it feels like a modern hotel, other than a slightly quirky layout. The staff are pleasant and lots of letters of thanks are on show in the reception area. Our room had 2 balconies overlooking the square below, which was a pleasant feature. The accommodation was functional and comfortable. We got the impression the walls of our room were a bit on the thin side when we were awoken by a couple loudly showering and leaving at approx 5am! We got a discount of 10% for paying cash, which was a nice bonus. For good value, basic accommodation, we would stay there again and recommend to others.
title: Nice place, recommended.

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: This hotel is good for price and near all kinds of shopping and stores and a big mall. Loved the staff and they were so helpfull and friendly. Not the closst to city center but buses and metros are easy to catch.thank you
title: Best staff I've ever met

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay. Our room was quiet enough (interior room). Remember that Spain builds and decorates with stone, tile, and wood. Hard surfaces...sound carries easily in these situations. Our room was clean and comfortable to move around it. The beds were a little firm but good for me and my daughter. You can't beat the location. It's in the middle of everything. It's so easy to just wander and get lost in the history and ambiance of the area. Lots of little restaurants around to eat or drink. Parking in this area is not easy. We had to park in the underground lot by the Cathedral of Barcelona. It's pricey by the day, but you can purchase multiple days in the garage and it gets more reasonable...€80 for 4 days. Once we parked, we left the car there even though you get a pass that allows you to come and go. Traffic getting to the Barri Gothic is heavy. I would definitely stay at this place again!
title: Great hostel buried in the middle of Barri Gothic

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: We crossed path with Emirates crew members at the AC Marriott Forum Barcelona. We asked them how their stay was. They said that their stay was good worth. We assume that our stay was good worth as long as they stay with us at same hotel. Emirates has good taste and right choice where crew members can enjoy and get good value. We loved swimming pool and quiet bar on the rooftop of the hotel. The hotel is located next to Marbella beach and Forum shopping mall including grocery store. Of course, the hotel is ideal for families. Big minus is not reliable computer center where business center is located on ground floor at AC Marriott Forum Barcelona. There is forever problem with computers and internet. However...Our stay was good worth anyway!
title: It is good worth stay at the hotel as long as Emirates crew members stay

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The first thing to get out of the way here is location. Its on a square that also includes the Basilica Santa Maria Del Mar. If you are the sort of person who prefers to have a hotel close to all the action, this is a great choice, less than a minute from La Rambla. The lanes adjoining the hotel in the Gothic quarter are fascinating and even after a week in the hotel, we left feeling we'd not done all of them justice. It's very close to several metro lines: I was attending the Barcelona Rock Festival at Can Zam, the other end of town, and it took me about 40 minutes to get there and back, even past midnight, thanks in no small part to how well connected this area is. I won't waste time talking about the numerous food options which have more than adequately been covered, but this is also five minutes away from some of the best music stores in the city -- from big box retailer FNAC (practically extinct in India and Singapore, a city I live in and one that I've visited of late) to Revolver Records (who have two stores one of which specialises in progressive and mainstream rock and the other which is more skewed towards indie and alternative) and heavy metal specialty store Pentagram. The staff at the hotel were pleasant, unobtrusive and very helpful whenever we went to them with a specific query. The breakfast quite adequate and the WiFi fast and generally extremely reliable. Can't think of anything to be improved or changed and so, a well deserved 5.
title: Incredible little hotel at the heart of the city

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: A nice Hotel to stay in when on business trip, amazing location, close to Diagonal Mare mall,Rooms are clean,comfortable bed, u might hear a bit on street noise if you are at lower levels.Staff are very friendly and helpful.Haven't had the chance to dine at the hotel as i was enjoyed food outdoor in such beautiful city at the best weather
title: Nice and convenient

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: Stayed with family for a recent conference. Hotel is perfect for a business traveler to Barcelona. With a family, it's OK. If this were our first visit to Barcelona, we would be disappointed with the location as it is far outside the center, however the links to public transport are excellent. Staff was very good.
title: Business, mostly.

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: As a very seasoned global traveler, I would highly recommend the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum (Marriott) Hotel because of the excellent service, attentive staff, perfect location and comfortable rooms.We traveled to Barcelona for business and found an absolute jewel in the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum. - The location was exceptionally convenient. We had a professional conference at the convention center which is next to the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum- Easy walking distance to the metro. The Metro (underground subway) is very easy to navigate, very clean, air conditioned and staff are available to assist if you need help. Passengers are also a great source for help - the people of Barcelona are so helpful. Buy a multiday pass at the Barcelona airport or at the metro station.- Rooms are clean, clean, clean. The hotel staff are friendly and incredibly efficient. We appreciate the staff for their pride in keeping the rooms cleaned.- At the end of a long or hot day, take a quick dip in the pool. There are poolside loungers, tables and more tables inside the restaurant. The hotel can provide pool towels and the staff are very attentive. Enjoy a drink poolside - the view is absolutely beautiful!!- Across the street is the Diagonal Mall - lots of shopping, food choices and good restaurants (asian, italian, spanish...). We enjoyed an evening of tapas and paella which were very tasty and reasonably priced. A grocery story is located inside the Diagonal Mall - get some bread, wine, cheese, a bit of prosciutto and fruit for your hotel room! The selection at the grocery store is amazing and you won't be disappointed.- The hotel has a very good breakfast area with a wide selection of food. The service was incredible and the staff worked very hard to keep the food fresh and the tables clean. - The hotel room was very clean and kept clean every day. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning functioned perfectly and the rooms had darkening shades. For an international traveler, these provided the right environment for a great night of sleep. - Beyond the obvious sights of Barcelona that are listed in Tripadvisor, don't miss the many unlisted churches (the architecture and relics are historical gems that cannot be found elsewhere, one church had a special staircase that led us to the most amazing rooftop views of Barcelona), a simple scoop of gelato by the waterfront, and the wonderful food/wines from the local restaurants.- From the hotel, it is a relaxing 10-15 minute walk to the beach. There were a lot of families, surfers, people playing sports, open showers and a few nude bathers. The beach area was well maintained and busy on a hot day.- Taxis can be found in front of the hotel. Very convenient. - And, most importantly, I have to mention the high level of service provided by the hotel staff at the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum. Near the end of our trip, the glass vanity in our bathroom became cracked. We informed the front desk staff immediately and returned from our city visit in the afternoon to find that the entire glass vanity in the bathroom was replaced (wow!). Front desk, housecleaning, restaurant, poolside - we received the best service from this team and truly appreciate how comfortable our stay was because of their efforts.Barcelona and its culture are worth exploring. We enjoyed the people, the food, the cultural sights and this was especially worthwhile because of the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum. Sharing our experience with others is important because traveling is expensive and helping others to know what to expect is important. Please do let me know if this review was helpful so that I am motivated to continue sharing my experience with others. We made a great choice with the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum (Marriott) and hope you enjoy Barcelona!
title: Loco for the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum - Perfect for Business Travelers!

review: I had a great time here. The hotel is very nice, super clean, good service and it's in the PERFECT location. The area is great, with tasty bakeries, nice bars and restaurants and a metro station right across the street from the hotel
title: Great hotel in PERFECT location

review: The hotel is located in a very good situation near the metro station. It has a small lobby the rooms are neat and clean but they are small . It has a very very small pool .The breakfast is very good and delicious. The hotel is about 10 to 15 minutes to la rambla street and sea. You can find lots of shop and food and cafe nearby.
title: Small and lovely

review: Good centrally located hotel. Room with a lot of space; the airco did not work optimally. The breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly. While the period that we stayed was very hot, it was a welcome to go to the open swimming pool.
title: Good hotel for citytrip

review: The Silken Concordia Hotel, is centrally located in Barcelona, easy walking distance to buses, Metro etc. The staff at the front desk are very professional, speak English and are just willing to help you. The rooms are well maintained and spacious , breakfast well presented and caters for various tastes.
title: Good location

review: Stayed here for 4 nights before heading off elsewhere and it was a nice stay. Great location in terms of being close enough but far enough away. First 2 days we walked miles then on the third day stayed local and visited the Picasso Museum which was only 10 mins away. Lovely pastry bakery just down the road and the underground metro is only 50m away. Rooms are not sound proof as they advertise, but wasn't a huge issue. Small pool, busy, not many sun loungers available, but good of you find one! Ideal for a short Barcelona break, as great location and clean. Would recommend
title: Nice place

review: Cannot rate this hotel highly enough!We arrived earlier than expected and was greeted with such warmth and professionalism, and unexpectedly they checked us in early and with efficiency.Our room far exceeded our expectation for comfort and space considering it's a 3 star hotel, boasting large beds, excellent bathroom facilities, storage and dressing table. We had views spanning from the sea, gothic quarter, placa de catalunya to montjïc!The pool terrace was in the sun all day and the bar has the best sangria we had in Barcelona.As our visit called us to Barcelona on my business, the location of the hotel, and the pool facilities enabled me my wife and I to both enjoy some time together. So nice to be able to use the pool and sunbathe on a business/city break!Location wise it could not get any better as it is central to shops, cultural attractions, our favourite restaurants and bars, and just one minute from the metro station whose line services all of the beach stations! We will certainly stay at the hotel again, if I had been checked into a room that was noisy, as other reviews suggest, I would have asked to move as our room was very quiet.No coffee/tea facilities in room but the hotel is flanked by 2 excellent coffee shops, which we frequented for breakfast.
title: Perfect mix for Business and pleasure

review: This is a pleasant, clean hotel with a great location. We always choose our hotels for location and this delivered 100%. Although just a 3 star hotel we could not have asked for a better location, it was perfect, clean, had a swimming pool and served a reasonable breakfast included in our rate. All staff were friendly and extremely helpful (we emailed ahead with some requests/questions and they came back immediately helping in every way possible). Our room was great, we had the top floor with a large balcony comprising sun loungers, tables and chairs all with a roof top view, could not have asked for more. The room and bathroom was modern with a huge bed and exceptionally clean. We would advise anyone to read the blurb on the hotel as tea and coffe was not supplied in the room, however, this was not a problem for my coffee addict husband, we took a travel kettle with us. Water was not supplied in the room, however, a supermarket close by sold bottles reasonably priced. There is no concierge, however, the reception staff are on hand to answer any questions about this city. We purchased the open top bus tour through the hotel saving us a couple of euros. There is no entertainment here just a bar with little atmosphere, buy hey, you are in the heart of Barcelona, go out into this beautiful city and embrace it, it's right on your door step! We enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to return.
title: Perfect location

review: This hotel was a very good choice for our stay in Barcelona. It's centrally located, the subway station is right in front of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very well kept. We couldn't enjoy the pool, so no review about it.
title: Very good location

review: Granted, this place is clean and in a good location. However this is where the positives end.The walls are paper thin so we can at this moment hear the couple on one side of us having a conversation and the cleaner vigorously cleaning the room (and possibly rearranging the furniture??) on the other. Every time our neighbours take a morning shower (at 6am, or this morning at 4.30am) it sounds like a waterfall is running down the wall beside our bed! We can hear lights being switched on, plugs being put in and out, conversations, TVs, hangers being battered in the cupboards, and people walking on the laminated flooring. The hotel has a pool which attracted us in the first place, but don't let that entice you, since it only gets sun in the morning and the loungers and swiftly taken by people who don't leave them all day so no chance of using it until the sun goes down! Avoid at all costs if you want a good nights sleep in preparation for your busy trek around the city.
title: Avoid!!!!

review: Stayed here two days before and after our cruise. It's centrally located in the city so it's easy to get around. The front reception staff are helpful. The amenities are ok but don't expect much. Rooms are clean but on the smaller side. Free breakfast room which had a good selection of food and plenty of seating. Pool was very small and limited lounge chairs but served it's purpose. No exercise room. For a 3 star Hotel I recommend it.
title: Nice location

review: Spent a week in this hotel whilst attending a nearby conference. It is a bit out from the main buzz of Las Ramblas but easily accessible by tram that stops outside the hotel/ 10 euros by taxi..The hotel is outstanding. Rooms airy and very clean with good air conditioning , the staff were all really friendly and helpful and the breakfast was outstanding. The beach is 5 minutes walk away, the rooftop pool ideal after a hard day and there were several good eating places a few minutes walk away.. Would definitely stay again
title: Excellent hotel

review: We paid for the upgrade to include the Executive Lounge which was "not very Executive" at all, in fact pretty shocking throughout and very poorly managed. It was clear there was no management oversight from an operations perspective and the hotel have clearly cut back on the staffing of this area. At one point in the day there were no glasses to pour any drinks into, no ice, fridges were poorly stocked up and nothing was faced up or presented well and many of the plates were dirty. The toilet door lock was broken, the place was filthy inside and out with used glasses and food debris everywhere and children were just helping themselves with no supervision which surprised me as technically these children had unsupervised access to alcohol, I thought this level was over 18s !!  There was little or no food available at the key walk in times like 7pm, this was repeated in the afternoon. This is the 7th year staying at this hotel and the executive lounge facility was the reason I booked the hotel, but over the last couple of years it seems to have gone downhill and has got progressively worse. I thought last year's poor service was a one off but it was poor for the two days I stayed there this year.  It is the last time I would consider upgrading for the executive lounge in future and may actually not book there at all next year. I did complain to reception but there was no attempt whatsoever to recover the service or offer any form of compensation which I thought was a missed opportunity and has cost them a couple of customers as a result.
title: Disappointing!

review: We had been looking forward to a short stay in Barcelona and picked this hotel due to the modernist architecture, which did not disappoint - however it was missing the touches you would expect in a good three star hotel and decent four star. Service was slow from waiting to be seated at breakfast, to replacing faulty swipe cards and failure to replace pool towels for afternoon arrivals. The worst evidence of the complete lack of focus on the customer was that despite reporting a faulty lock which allowed us to have interconnecting rooms with our children this was not fixed and we spent an uncomfortable night listening out to ensure they were ok. This could be a great hotel but sadly just scrapes into the mediocre category. We've stayed in far better Barcelona hotels....give it a miss and spend your euros elsewhere.
title: Visually impressive hotel without the service to match

review: I stayed with my parents for 5 nights in July 2017. From the outside the hotel is attached to another unfinished building and it looks like construction has been abandoned... it's not a great look especially with all the tagging on the building. Having said that the inside of the functioning part is well kept and around 4 star level. There's not a whole lot going on in the area, it's about 30 mins by underground from the centre of Barcelona, but you are 10 mins walk to the beach in that area. Also the poble nou area is quite close (catch the tram outside the hotel doors) and is good for meals. We hired bikes and found it the best way to get into town. It's an area for music festivals in the forum area and conferences so may be higher prices at certain times.
