However it's much calmer and quieter than staying near la rambla or catalunya especially at peak times.There's a large mall across the road and some of the restaurants are quite good, we had great pinxtos at Sagardi. But had most meals in the town centre. There's a gigantic supermarket in the mall with all you need including a large alcohol selection.The staff were very helpful but it did take quite a long time to check in. The pool is upstairs on the roof and is quite small area so often no stretchers available but nice to cool off in pool after walking in sun all day. Also gets a bit windy. There's a pool bar but I never saw anyone serving there.The room was clean and nice with good pillows. It was smaller than expected especially for three adult people. There were a million light switches, some labelled, some not, so we had a fun game trying to turn them all off at night!The bathroom has a see through blind which means people in the bedroom can see you getting undressed, good for honeymooners but not so much when staying with friends or parents!! We booked one room for three but it appeared they just put campbed in the room. No extra towel, mug, wine glass etc so obviously they assumed a small child. There was a kettle and tea/coffee which was great and unusual in Barcelona. Also it appeared on the website the extra bed would be in a separate area but not so. Breakfast was 16 Euro but was high quality and plentiful with mumms champagne, a range of good quality meats and cheeses, hot food etc. The museum of natural history across the road is worth the visit although almost completely empty as most visitors to Barcelona come for the beach!
title: Nice hotel away from hustle and bustle of city

review: Affordable accomodation. Small room but very clean and modern with small balcony. Directly across from a subway station as well as in perfect location. Not too busy but in walking distance to la rambla. Friendly and helpful staff.
title: Good location

review: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in June. We requested a room overlooking The square which the staff accomadated for us. Many reviews say the hotel is noisy, with the doors closed we didnt hear much noise at all.The hotel was clean, modern and comfortable. The room had a safe which cost 2 euros per day. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and will be re booking for next year!
title: 30th Birthday trip

review: ...in a Hotel. Waited two hours for my booked room, got him and he was DIRTY. Not enough: The reading lamp was destroyed and i feared an electric shock. Next thing: I booked a comfort room and the porter said, comfort is the same as standard. Lost money, I think. At least - remember 2 Hours - every porter want a copy of my credit card - whats going on? --- well I think therme is more to come.
title: Worst Check In. Worst 3 Hours...

review: Only negative review I have is the lift wasn't working so the dear receptionist had to lug everything up the stairs. Also during our week stay our towels weren't collected, so imagine 20+ wet and sandy towels strayed around the room. Otherwise the hotel is quite good for the price. Right next to the metro, very close to the beach and walking distance from the other attractions. If you close the balcony door you won't be able to hear the busy road ahead of you. However, as its so hot you may wish to keep it open and suffer from the noise. We had two rooms, beds were good sized. Rooms very modern. Another issue is breakfast is served in the sister hotel across the road. Don't forget to pick up a pass on your way out. I wouldn't vouch for their breakfast, not the best. Opt for room only if you can. There's a lovely bakery right downstairs and they serve literally everything a European bakery should. Rooms overlooking the side street (right of main photo) are much quieter and great for people watching. Staff are friendly. Overall, I would happily stay here again.
title: Girls trip - Great Central Location

review: Hotel Suizo was a lovely little hotel. We stayed in a double room which was lovely and clean as was the bathroom too. The space is fairly small as expected in a city hotel but the design and layout of the rooms does the best with the space. We even had a balcony facing out onto one of the side streets which was lovely to watch the hustle and bustle below. Also, the lovely smells that floated up from the patisserie and restaurants below was also very pleasant! We didn't opt for breakfast with the room as we were wanted to try local places for breakfast. The patisserie on the corner to the left as you exit the main entrance of the hotel is lovely for a quick coffee and croissant - the croissant con crema is lovely - but they are big and very filling! The Bathroom is small but the design and use of the space is again good. The shower has two heads and is powerful. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Also, the Metro is located just outside so you can jump on the underground with ease. You're right in the heart of the Gothic quarter too, the cathedral is just up one of the side streets! There are loads of restaurants nearby too. We didn't find the hotel to be noisy considering it's location. It's a perfect *** hotel for people who are going to be out the majority of the time exploring but want somewhere comfortable and clean to rest. I'd stay here again.
title: 30th birthday trip

review: Located close to metro station, Acacia Suites serves as a decent stopover hotel for a short stay. Our room for 3 was comfortable, clean and functional. There was no tea coffee maker in the room but they provided a hot water kettle and the top up shop is just next door. Some of the front desk employees were polite and helpful, others not so. The hotel locks the door from inside in the late hours which is very good in that neighbourhood. But the absence of anyone at the front desk to open it can be irritating. A great local restaurant is close by - to the left of the hotel as you come out nearing the curb. Be careful when you are smoking in the evening outside the hotel. We were approached by a seemingly friendly Person for a light who clearly had other intentions as plan clothes policemen surrounded us in minutes. All in all uneventful comfortable stay.
title: Comfortable stay

review: My sister and I spent 7 nights in this perfect hotel in Barcelona. We had room 002 on the ground floor just off the foyer. As it was alongside a park with windows on two walls we thought we would never be able to open the curtains and would have noise problems. NO! This area has the best soundproofing and privacy we could ever want. No one could see in (we tested it) and we couldn't hear anything from outside. The room was spacious and beds extremely comfortable. Bathroom and shower were brilliant.We had the breakfast included and found that we made this our main meal of the day. So much variety and you could also have eggs cooked to your liking. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.The hotel reception was also amazing, asking if you needed a taxi - 'how was your day' etc.Just near the reception is a wonderful bar/snack bar which serves delicious 'light' meals at a very reasonable cost. All in all I feel it is the best hotel I have ever stayed in!
title: The BEST

review: I stayed with my kid and wife. We came to meet our son and i must say the place is right place for those who wants to cook their own food. We are vegeterians and place is idle in terms of travel and availability of grocery etc. Every thing including laundry is with in 5 min walking distance. Hop on hop off is quite near stop 17.. Bust stand metro is a stone thriw away diatance.I like the friendly ness of staff and eagerness to help customers is worth noticing and appreciating.I would strongly recommend family vegeterian or vegan and would live to live peacefully a d near by every means of transport. This place is the place for you.
title: Warm welcome

review: Fab hotel. As you walk into reception you are struck by the cool air con (a relief from the heat) and a spa style aroma. Reception staff are friendly and professional. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms spacious and the beds very comfortable. We didn't book breakfast initially but were offered it for €10 at checkin. A saving of €4 - and the breakfasts were well worth it. Huge buffet style of hot and cold fruit, cereal, veg, meats, cheese, eggs, breads etc. Catering for special diets also. The rooftop pool is small but big enough to cool off in and offers amazing 360 degree views of the city. The spa contains a pool with jacuzzi and a steam room. There is also a small gym. Spa treatments are available if you want a little pampering - a little expensive but what the hell! It's only money!A great nearby restaurant for dinner is El Clot.
title: Superb

review: I was going to miss my breakfast as I had to check out early by 6am. However, the kitchen and reception guys made a picnic basket which we had it at the airport. Very satisfying experience. We will opt to return soon.
title: Picnic basket

review: Got a great deal for four nights at this hotel. It is a little out of the way but the subway is just over the road and the main attractions really don't take long to get to. The rooms were spacious with amazing air con. We used the gym a few times and it was great. Didn't eat at the hotel but the menu looked delicious. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful too. I asked about the best way to get to the airport early and they booked a taxi for me. Would definitely stay here again
title: Couldn't fault it

review: We stayed in this hotel only 2 nights. If you want to have rest you should not stay in this hotel . 2 nights 2 marriage parties too loud music until very late. Also u can here everything of next rooms. No insulation.. ıt is pity , bec it is avnice hotel nice deco nice location ...
title: Too noisy

review: Nice, clean hotel in walking distance to Sagrada Familia and shopping area. Room was nice, comfortable, and spacious for a European hotel. Staff was very nice and had great recommendations for dining. Our room faced the street and although there was some noise overnight, it didn't bother me at all. The breakfast was really good. It was the best breakfast compared to other hotels I've been to in Europe. Overall great experience.
title: Decent Hotel Near Sagrada Familia

review: Good location, about 15-20 minute walk to the main area. Lots of good bars and places to eat around here, also peaceful. The hotel staff were all friendly, the room was kept spotless the whole time we were there (1 week), the breakfast was good and lots of it, also served to 10.30 which was great after a late night but as a few people have said some days its was stone cold, unfortunately our last morning was one of them. The minibar wasnt replenished every day but just spoke with reception and they had water sent up within 5 minutes. The noise from other rooms was a bit of an issue though, constantly heard people walking above us, maybe giving out soft slippers and requesting guests not to wear shoes until going out door would be a good idea? Big bonus though was that the air con and safe were free! All in all though a good clean hotel with a fantastic roof terrace to laze out on after loads of walking around a amazing city.
title: Nice hotel

review: Located in the old town and within easy walking distance to the Sagrada Familia, Casa Battlo, and La Pedrera. A little farther away is Park Guell and LA Rambla, but still within reasonable walking distance. The hotel was clean and the bed comfortable, staff was friendly. I thought the cost was high, but then this is the high season. Overall a good place to stay.
title: Three star hotel in a good location

review: We ended our two-week trip here to relax before a long international flight & couldn't have chosen a more perfect place. The hotel is clean & modern with an attentive staff. We had a first-floor room with a view of the ocean, pool, & beautiful grounds. We had snacks in a pool cabana, swam in the lovely pool, & relaxed in the hammocks. Perfect beach walk to end the day!
title: Beautiful grounds & right on the neach

review: Very good location at an area with a long beach strip of approx.. 8 km. The beach is a wide sandy type and close to the hotel there are plenty of restaurants. The rooms are clean with modern equipment, wooden floor and a good bed. The airco is a little noisy and the TV doesn’t have any English news channels on. My room was overlooking the garden/pool and behind that the beach. Other than that the room was pleasant. They have a huge garden with a reasonable pool and area to relax and get drinks. You can go to the beach by exiting the garden. The breakfast is of a good level, mostly self service. Beware of the wooden structure above part of the buffet, I am tall and banged my head on it. The service in the afternoon was rather slow, there isn’t a lot of staff and they weren’t very alert, it took me half an hour to get a beer.
title: Nicely located hotel with good facilities

review: We stayed only one night, for the reasons described in the title of the review. The beach is literally outside of the gates, and it is not busy. There is also a pool , but it gets very busy and noisy. So we skipped the pool. The checkin was ok, though the hotel has an odd parking policy. Unless you get out of a car and register they will not open the parking gate. But where to park if the street is permanently occupied by cars. And we could not park in the hotel yard as it is too small for two cars. So i gad to park illegally about 50 meters on the yellow line and was only lucky the car was not towed or penalized. Very inconvenient, why not allow cars in the parking before checkin, as all other hotels do? Other than that, the short stay was ok. There is nothing outside of the hotel in terms of convenience stores or smth. So stock up . The airport is about 15 minutes drive via the highway.
title: Best feature is proximity to the beach and the airport

review: This hotel was beautiful and most staff were kind and helpful. Breakfast was good, setup at pool conducive to many relaxing areas, and hammocks behind were a good napping spot. We were on first floor so had a view of pool, but kind of wish the beautiful sea was in sight as well. Maybe on other floors. Also wish coffee was available in room. Staff spoke at least some English. Relaxation was key here
title: Beach and pool relaxation

review: the room is small and basic, old fashion. breakfast is only bread and cheese... very poor. if you are looking for a place to sleep with a good location and nothing more, this is the place.... for any other wishes look for another hotel.
title: good loction very basic hotel

review: The Hotel is very well placed in Barcelona. Its quite close to some of the attractions such as Magic Fountains as well as Metro. Would have preferred if the Spanish architecture is represented more in its interiors. Recommend.
title: Recently refurbished Hotel in close proximity to the city

review: Great location to see Barcelona, great access to nightlife and restaurants. The location gives you access to La Rambla, subway and a short walk to central plaza with all the bus tours. It is only a 10min walk to the beaches as well.Breakfast was decent, but the rooms were small.
title: Good location

review: Located a 5 min walk from the main train station. Easy enough to find as we took the train from the airport to the hotel. Nice, small hotel. Not necessarily within walking distance to places but the train station is near enough.I'm a tea junkie! They didn't have any tea making facilities, so took a travel kettle, mugs and tea bags so we could have a cuppa! They also didn't have an iron!! They say it's because an iron almost caught fire previously, so we would have to use our straighteners to iron the clothes. They offered an ironing service which wasn't cheap. Found a cockroach which we thought was dead, but when we returned to our room it had disappeared. The room was a reasonable size, could've been a little bigger. Staff were friendly enough. Nice enough but not one i would rush back to. The last time I was in Barcelona we stayed at the hotel Espana just off Las Ramblas. I would highly recommend that if you can find a good deal for it.
title: 3.5 I would say!

review: The hotel is in a great location, right next to the metro and a mainline station which is great for a tourist, the breakfasts were pretty good however their juices are a little on the cheap side (made with cordial). The rooms were clean but one thing that was ridiculous is that you had to pay or put a 20 Euro deposit down for a safe key which is the first time I've experienced such a thing, the shampoo and body wash were really cheap and not exactly the same. One day we wanted to have lunch in the hotel but we were told that it was closed for a private function which struck me as very odd and unprofessional as there was space on the terrace away from the party where we could have sat. The WiFi is the poorest I've ever experienced in a 1st world country apparently 4 star hotel, when we asked about the wifi the manager simply said that because there was a lot of people staying at that time, the service wouldn't be as good and suggested we come down to the lobby with our devices for better speeds....this suffice to say, did not work.I'd expect more from a 4 star establishment and although it seemed like good value on booking.com, it actually wasn't.
title: Great location, a bit rough round the edges

review: Very friendly staff and service. Room was very clean and comfortable. Excellent buffet style breakfast and a wide choice of dishes. Rooftop pool was smaller than it looks in the pictures and the Bar snacks a little pricey although the view from the roof was fantastic.
title: Barcelona city break

review: Comfortable room free wi-fi but limited and very convenient hotel to the metro system and airport rail. Could do with a coffee/tea maker in the room but otherwise great place to stay. Breakfast is adequate and plenty of restaurants and convenience stores close by.
title: Great Tourist Hotel a few steaps from Barcelona Sants Metro

review: Really nice hotel with friendly and helpful reception staff. Great location - further west of the main city centre but we enjoyed being away from the main bustle. Still walking distance to metro and connecting bus routes. As per previous reviews we've seen there were no tea-making facilities in the room (which is always nice to have). We didn't have an iron either but used the iron room (downstairs in the hotel) on the first evening to iron all our clothes which was fine. Also, the wifi inside the hotel worked ok for us - useful to be able to message home. We visited during 30C heat and the air conditioning in the room was excellent and really cooled us down.Main negative was the very thin walls. Our room had a connecting door to the room adjacent to us and on the first evening we overheard a long intimate exchange, which made us feel quite uncomfortable! Would be happy to return for future visits to Barca.
title: Good location, walls a bit thin

review: Fantastic friendly/helpful staff and clean comfortable rooms. Location is great as well if you want to shop (there is a mall across the street) and/or see the city (the best way to get around the is city is by bus and there is a bus stop across the street in front of the hotel).
title: First time in Barcelona

review: Hotel itself is very neat and clean, with friendly staff. Just steps to the Glories metro stop, we never worried about transportation to all the things we wanted to do while in town. The roof top offers great views of all the major landmarks of Barcelona (including the tower directly next door) and overall our stay was perfect. I would stay here again if I returned to Barcelona just because I know what I'm getting at a reasonable price.Words to the wise: do NOT eat any of the food at the rooftop bar. We would go to the local grocery store and pick up cheap wine to drink on the roof each night just to soak up the evening, but the one time we got food it was disgusting. Let me also point out that I'm easy to please, but I thought I'd vomit after eating about half of the roast beef sandwich I bought.
title: Roof-top views are thing of beauty!

review: Very excellent. We enjoyed and all was good We were happy to be upgraded to suite instead of guest room. I will recommend this hotel to all the people that I know. The staff were nice and helpful. The hotel is located at good area easy for shopping and transportation.
title: Very nice

review: Wonderful welcoming hotel in a beautiful and vibrant city. The hotel staff was amazing. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. The neighborhood was fairly quiet at night (which we love) and everything in the city was easy to walk to and if we couldn't walk the metro and taxis were a half block to get anywhere in the city.
title: Gates diagonal of Barcelona

review: This was my 2nd time to Barcelona & the first time staying in Barcelona itself. Went for gf's birthday & the location of the hotel was good as it wasn't in the heart of the city. On our arrival, we had an opportunity to upgrade rooms which we did for 20 euros extra a night. The room was good, clean and of good standard. The staff were always friendly & polite. They told us about the festival of saint joan & told us of the fireworks going off all night and the beach parties nearby. The atmosphere was excellent for the festival. The hotel staff told us of the best places to eat and their own breakfast was of good standard also. Would go back to this hotel. Love Barcelona.
title: Long weekend in Barcelona

review: We have just returned from a whirlwind stay in Barcelona & thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We stayed for 3 nights and though we didn't spend much time in the hotel, we were more than satisfied. The hotel is modern with a small but pleasant reception area. The young man who booked us in was very cheerful & helpful. Our room was modern & relatively spacious with a walk in shower in the bathroom & open double wardrobe in the main bedroom area. The hotel is about 15 mins walk from Laccuna metro station & about a 10 min walk to the beach. If you turn right out of the hotel and walk for 5-10 mins until you get to a cross roads there is a tree lined avenue full of bars, cafes & restaurants with lots of people milling around - lovely to see & lots of choice. If you want to stay near the beach but still within easy striking distance of the centre than Hotel 4 is a good shout.
title: Short but sweet stay

review: It was a decent hotel. Breakfast was okay. Found hairs in the bathroom upon arrival. Bed was comfy. The location is good if you want to be near the beach. Outside the hotel smelt like rotten egg. It's a good hotel if you plan on spending most of the day out.
title: You get what you pay for

review: The location of the hotel is quite nice, near to the beach and only 5 minutes walk to the metro station.The room we stayed in was not clean, the bathroom was dirty, and we got the idea that it was not cleaned properly, also all the shelves were full of dust and we had to clean it on our own so that our clothes don't get dirty. A good thing is that we got clean towels everyday. The breakfast was boring and poor in comparison to other 4 star hotels we stayed in. It is not a 4 star hotel, maybe a 3 star and we have to emphasize that we are not very demandable guests.The older lady at the reception was quite rude when we were leaving and the day before that. She didn't even bother to say bye on the check out and she was talking on the phone and couldn't care less about us. We left the hotel with many question marks because that's not the way to treat guests after we spent 7 nights there. Maybe she should reconsider a career change. We have to say that the other 2 young man at the reception were very nice and helpful.We would not stay in this hotel again.
title: Hotel 4 Barcelona - review

review: I came here with my husband and had a great time. As it was our anniversary I requested a room on the top floor with sea view, our requested was granted and our room had a lovely view of the sea plus we could see the cemetery (did not bother us). Breakfast was good and the location was great. We walked to the beach which was only 10 minutes walk away. We also took the metro which was also, only 10 minutes walk away. We brought a 2 day visitors bus ticket (from reception) which was slightly cheaper. All in all we had a great holiday, the only reason we did not give 5 stars was because outside the hotel there was an unpleasant smell. You could not smell it in the hotel but outside it was quite strong. All the staff were very helpful and friendly.
title: LOVELY SHORT STAY

review: My friend an i stayed here at the beginning of July or 3 nights.i believe our room was 304 or 305.Firstly the hairdryer is good, i have long thick hair.They offer amenities in the room but they also have things such a sewing kits and razors if you call reception.There is a safe and fridge in the room.The room was clean, good size, view was off the hotel and hotel pool across the road, we weren't planning on being in the room much.I didnt find it that noisy but i wasn't back in the room till 2am or later each night.The hallway did smell a bit of sick but i wasn't too fussed as it was a 12 second walk in and out.Good location, sometimes could be hard to find taxis and there will be a small queue of people waiting for the hotel to flag one down, however do not wait, just walk to one of the main roads and flag one down yourself.Closest metro station is 5 minute walk away, old-town i would say is more of a 20 minute walk.Only gripe i have is that if you checkout they only have a toilet area to change etc. At all hotels I have been to in the UK and abroad have always had a shower area for your to get ready for your flight once you have checked out.For what we paid it was a great hotel/location.
title: Clean,good location great room.

review: i used smokers room and I am happy with this. Restoran food was excellent. Elevators moved slowly.Wifi was bit slow. Nice coffee machine in hotel room and good wine also. 200 characters is too much for me.
title: Happy customer

review: I have little to remark concerning the hotel, and the main reason I opted for an overall rating of 3 and not 4 is because of the location. The hotel itself is neat and clean, with adequate rooms and everything you might expect of a 3-star hotel. But the neighbourhood is less than attractive: it looks like no one lives there, with some partly torn down buildings and shabbily maintained commercial premises. There are very few shops or restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, plus which the location is not exactly convenient for the major sights of the city -- even the nearest metro station is a 10-minute walk away.
title: The hotel is good, the location not so much

review: We stayed here for 4 nights Monday - Friday. I have been 2 Barcelona 2 times before and stayed near by, so i roughly knew where we were going.The area itself looks run down as there is a lot of building work going on, but a 5 minute walk away looks much more bright and new. We didn't ever feel unsafe walking at night, but if you'd never been to Barcelona you may be thinking to yourself "Where have I ended up!"The hotel is a few minutes walk from Bogatell Metro station which is a 5-10 minute ride from Gothic Quarter, Las Ramblas... everywhere you'd want to be. It's also only a 10-15 minute walk from the beach (The reason I have stayed in the neighbourhood before!)We got to the hotel and the staff were very lovely and helpful - even helped us find somewhere that would be serving food as we arrived around 10pm!We were offered a non-smoking room, but it was on the smoking floor. The hallways had an unpleasant musky smell from this, but we didn't notice it in the room thankfully. The room was lovely and clean (although the floors could have done with another sweep, but that's me being picky). There was plenty of room for us to put our belongings and a safe that was easy to use.The bathroom was clean and bright, but if a powerful shower is the be-all and end-all of your holiday, don't stay here as it wasn't fantastic,I'd say this hotel is suitable for couples and perhaps business. I wouldn't stay here with a family (unless they offer family rooms? I'm unsure). Overall a very pleasant experience and would consider staying here again.
title: Very good - if you know the area

review: Enjoyed our stay at Barcelona. The Plaza Catalunya location cannot be beat. There is a Metro stop right across the street, and the airport bus comes to the square, too. We only used the Metro once, as there is so much to see in walking distance. I was a little worried that it might be loud, but it was not. Breakfast was not supposed to be included, but they gave it to us free two of our three nights anyway. They also did our laundry for a low cost. Staff spoke English and was very pleasant, especially Alfred.
title: Clean and friendly, with character; perfect location between Las Ramblas and Exemplar.

hotelLocation: Ctra Vallvidrera al Tibidabo 83-89, 08035 Barcelona, Spain
review: I made a quick stop in the grand Hotel La Florida. I enjoyed the quiet atmosphere on the beautiful terrace, with an mazing view on Barcelona. The staff was very helpful. Perfect to relax during the week-end.
title: Amazing view and excellent service

review: We hadn't realised till we arrived just how central this hotel was in Barcelona. It's on the upper floors of a building right in the corner of the busy Plaza de Catalunya. At street level it's like entering a private apartment building - feels exclusive!! Our triple room was fairly spacious and overlooked the busy square. This was not a problem as the double glazed soundproofing was excellent and we were not at all bothered by street noise. The room had a good air con unit which was also fairly quiet when the fan was turned down for the night. The reception staff were charming and always helpful when we needed advice and the housekeeping staff were stealthy and efficient. We thought the breakfast was not good value for us so we ate at a nearby cafe instead. A great base for our week in the city.
title: Excellent very central small hotel

review: I've waited a week to write this review to make sure that I was fair . One month prior to my arrival I confirmed that they had received my payment but the credit card i used had to cancel due to some fraudulent charges. I confirmed with Hector that I would be bringing a different credit card but I would have my passport and that we would be arriving at midnight and I did not want to have any sort of hassle. He assured me it would be fine after checking with management. Once we tried to check in I went through a huge hassle all regarding this same issue. Finally that was resolved and the person took us to our rooms and the first door he opened there was a couple in bed prepared to make love. How horrifying! He then check us into our other two rooms and showed us how the air conditioning work. Lo and behold the next day we are trying to take a nap and my son came in and said his room was so hot. I couldn't get it to work and so I went to management, he came down and showed us that the air conditioning that we had been shown for this room wasn't operative and that there was a remote control for another one. I felt horrible that my son and friend sweltered through the night and the day. He did comp us some Waters. The locations lovely but the rooms are small. One other thing is that they only have European Outlets. Unfortunately I did not see the little folded card that said that adapters are available for $7 and I had waited a day and went to the local mall to buy two adapters for $22. I think the customer service aspect and training needs to be re-evaluated. Management did tell me that they had three new employees. One other thing is that we couldn't get our safes to work. These are very important to us as we wanted to store our passports. My husband went down the first morning and asked the attendant about the safes and she said none of them were operational in the entire Hotel . When the manager came to resolve the air conditioning issue I mentioned to him about the safes and he said they did work and showed us how they worked. I explained that my husband had asked and he said that there were new employees. Again they need to re-evaluate their training.
title: Rough check in

hotelLocation: Ctra Vallvidrera al Tibidabo 83-89, 08035 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is very nice. You definitely need a car if you want to see Barcelona. Getting taxis is difficult and the city bus can take a long time, too. The rooms are spacious and in good condition with very nice furnishings and decor. The food is just ok - better to have a breakfast in the city for less than half the price. And there's nothing to walk to, so pick up whatever snacks and small items you need before you get there. We had a mountain view and overlooked a large fountain at the hotel, which made it sound like it was lightly raining all night - a nice feature.
title: Lovely rooms and view, out of the way

hotelLocation: Ctra Vallvidrera al Tibidabo 83-89, 08035 Barcelona, Spain
review: This was our 3rd visit to this hotel and again the quality of service was second to none .You can not fault this hotel , the staff are so amazing and committed to the guests .Camille and Daniela our waitresses were excellent and so professional .Javier , Julia , Alejandro , Roger and Gisèle were so helpful , full of knowledge and extremely friendly .You can ask anything to the staff , they will assist you anyway they can .Thank you again , we will be back .David Beaufils and family
title: The best hotel in Barcelona

hotelLocation: Ctra Vallvidrera al Tibidabo 83-89, 08035 Barcelona, Spain
review: My wife is a heat seeking missile for the truly special things in life. You know, those things that sit at the intersection of "great price" and "fantastic quality". It's no mean feat then, that Gran Hotel La Florida sits among her list of "favorite places" to stay. From check-in to check-out, expect a sterling quality of service from everyone. The whole staff radiates a sense of pride at their jobs, and for the place that they work in. They expect to serve you well, and they expect that they will be good at it.I don't always like dining in the hotel, but you should for this hotel. The views of Barcelona make up for the lack of proximity to most of the Barcelona attractions. That's because the hotel is nestled atop Mt Tibidabo. It overlooks Barcelona. That means you trade easy access to Barcelona hot spots for the view and some privacy.We particularly enjoyed the view over breakfast - an opulent affair spanning all the spreads: from cuts of artisanal sausage to custom made omelettes to racks of sweet buns and breakfast meats galore. I particularly enjoyed having a drink and looking at La Sagrada Familia - still imposing from a distance.The rooms themselves are very large and very comfortable. I've stayed in Parisian hotel rooms as large as the bathroom in our room in Gran Hotel La Florida. The turndown service even sets the system to play classical tunes as one gets ready for bed. Our room featured a balcony from which I could check out Sagrat Cor (itself worth a short walk).There are so many wonderful places in the world to see. So we it is rare for us to be tempted to return just because of a hotel. But Gran Hotel La Florida did just that for us.Hint: parking is valet only (our fee included it), but they are ridiculously quick.
title: Set A Really High Standard

review: Nice clean hotel in a great location, staffs were very friendly and accommodating. Hotel was walking distance to a lot of major spots of your travel in Barcelona. Bus stop and metro was just a few minutes walk away, a lot of nice restaurants and cafes close by. Would highly recommend.
title: Nice hotel in great location

hotelLocation: Ctra Vallvidrera al Tibidabo 83-89, 08035 Barcelona, Spain
review: I cannot recommend Gran Hotel La Florida enough, it is beautifully styled and the staff are fantastic. They provided us with a very professional yet personalised service that could not be faulted and truly added to making our stay all the more wonderful. With regard to the room it was finished to an very high standard, we stayed in room 118 which had beautiful sea views and a balcony. The hotel itself is something to behold each room is tastefully decorated and it has an exceptionally relaxing atmosphere. The hotel is outside of the city which is exactly what we wanted, peace, quiet and tranquility with the option to hop on the bus and go into the city when need be. The bus is located right beside the hotel and was only €3pp taking you directly into the city centre. The T2B bus runs every 20minutes and most attractions are within walking distance from the centre. I cannot recommend this fabulous hotel enough, we had a fantastic time and will be back.
title: Wonderful stay at a beautiful hotel.

review: not in bussy downtown but an upscale area with good options to dine out. metro station is a few hundred meters away. the rooms are typical nh style (dark wood) and the breakfast truly great (as in all nh hotels I stayed in this year 7+). the service was very attentive also recognizing your status right from the beginning.
title: great location

review: Overall, this is a correct place to stay! The location is perfect - at about 15 minutes walk to the Rambla - and the surronding is nice! The night live is plaisant with many small palces to stop, sit and enjoy a refresment. Peoples living there are nice to speak with and happy to help when required! As I stated in my comments about the Hotel, rooms are small, clean and the personel is excellent!
title: 2 days staying at this ressort

review: I stayed here for 6 nights while visiting Barcelona.If getting the metro from the airport to the city, take the L9 Sud to Treessa (I may be misspelling this) and transfer to the L1 until Urgell. The hotel is just a short walk from the Urgell stop. I would recommend getting the BCN card for 2 days for €14.50 at the airport. This will cover all of your transport on metro train etc around Barcelona, as well as the trip to the airport. Our flight was delayed and I emailed the hotel and they kindly reassured me not to worry, they have a 24 hr reception.At check in the hotel staff kindly informed us of the onsite gym, the restaurant and also the snacks and drinks available for purchase in the reception/ lobby area.The hotel also has parking.We got a twin room which had a mini bar and the usual requirements. The house keeping is very good and the room was always cleaned with plenty of clean towels. It is a nice and modern hotel.We had a difficulty with the safe in our room due to our own error and the lady on the front desk helped immediately to resolve this.We were also stopped the night before we checked out by staff who kindly told us that there would be a taxi strike the following day in case we were getting a taxi to the airport. This was first class service, as we had not seen any news or notifications regarding the taxi strike. It was real personal service and we really appreciated it.Overall it is a great hotel with superb staff and I would have no hesitation recommending the hotel.Have a great trip to Barcelona if you go!
title: A really great stay

review: Clean and spacious rooms. Friendly staff, they put attention to little details and make you feel comfortable on your stay. We even had questions regarding our flight tickets and "Irene" assisted us and took time to made online research to help us. And if you do not mind to walk a few minutes you can find main streets near to the hotel.
title: Excellent customer service and great room

review: The hotel is in the heart of La Rambla. It is very convenient from the Metro stop Liceu. Getting from the airport and to the metro took about 30 minutes. The rooms are very nice and spacious. We had a great time here and would come back to this hotel again.
title: Convenient Hotel

review: Tiny room, comfortable bed, helpful staff. We had a problem with our reservation (somehow there were 2 rooms booked for us when we only needed one) and the staff were as helpful as they could be about figuring out what happened - problem with booking company - and a path to resolution. Great location, near lots of beautiful places to visit and nice to walk in the area behind the hotel (Barcelona Cathedral, lots of restaurants and shops, etc). Although the area is very active and noisy, the room was well insulated for noise and it was quiet for sleeping. Loved the balcony overlooking the street.
title: Nice hotel, great location

review: We have been to Barcelona numerous times, and this might be the best place we have stayed. Literally right on Las Ramblas, and only a few steps from the Mercado de San José de la Boquería. Plus, it's right across the street from the Metropolitana. As if that were not enough, it's about 3 blocks from the Aerobus stop at Placa de Catalunya. The hotel staff was terrific (in both Spanish & English). The room was very comfortable. The price was right. What more can you ask for?
title: The Place to Stay In Barcelona!

review: The Flor Parks Hotel is right in the middle of Las Ramblas, my wife and I took the Sageles transfer bus from Girona Airport to Estacion Nord in Barcelona then around 9 euro cab ride to the front of the hotel. The hotel is clean and inviting, the cool interior was very welcoming. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, the young lady who checked us in gave us lots of information about places to see and visit and even arranged our entry into Segrada Familia enabling us to visit there on my birthday. Our room was a standard double which again was spotlessly clean, with all amenities, bathroom was spacious and had a wonderful double size monsoon shower. On the day we were leaving we even enjoyed an hour or so on the lovely little Solarium on the roof. Would not hesitate to recommend the Flor Parks Hotel and will be staying there again. Thank you for a fabulous Birthday experience.
title: A brilliant 3 night 'Birthday Stay' in Hotel Flor Parks

review: Efficient experience from hotel staff and conveniently located with supermarkets and everyday article shops located nearby.Nice 20 minute walk down to the expo center to see the musical fountains and then Les Ramblas another ten minutes away.Good breakfast layout made the start of the day more pleasurable.Only problem was that the street did not have facility for parking of large buses and as we were a group of 23, the getting on/off the bus was a rushed event.Would recommend to friends and co-travellers
title: Comfortable and good value for money

review: Has great character, clean, comfortable, and great locationIn barri gothic but not too loud.Elevator is great feature for upper levelsBreakfast wad greatI highly recommend this hotelWould be amazing if it had a bar
title: great hotel

review: This was everything you'd expect being in the middle of Barcelona. It was close to all the action of La Ramblas' restaurants and street vendors. The hotel itself was comfortable and of the old style, tall ceilings, tiled floors, but modern bathroom. The staff bent over backwards to help you out, ie: storing luggage, since we were very early for our reservation, offering suggestions on dining and providing info on area attractions. I would definitely consider staying here again if I returned. We attempted to speak in Spanish, but they returned in english, very helpful.
title: Heart of Old Town Barcelona

review: My wife and I found the staff to be pleasant, friendly, and helpful -- but perhaps that's because she's Spanish and I'm fluent, so we could chat and joke and we developed rapport. The elevator was small and slow, but hey, we're on vacation! One really nice side of our stay was sitting on our very nice 4th floor balcony listening to the church bells, watching the clouds drift overhead, watching the neighbors on their balconies, and enjoying the evening breezes as dusk turned to night. The beds were comfy and when our TV went out, the staff had someone up to fix it (batteries in the remote apparently). Nice bathroom. Small rooms but (since we're used to Japanese hotels) no big deal. Best of all, of course -- as others have noted -- the location is fantastic! The staff told us where they eat, and every suggestion was a home run. Most were within a couple of blocks. Despite the location, our rooms were very quiet.
title: A great choice

review: We were very happy with our experience. The arrangements were easy to make on-line, the location was excellent, the rooms were very comfortable and the staff was friendly and very helpful. I would also recommend the free walking tours of the Gothic Quarter as suggested by the hotel staff.
title: Excellent Hotel value in Barcelona

hotelLocation: Mare de Deu de Bellvitge, 3, 08907 Barcelona, Spain
review: Exceeded our expectation by a lot. Food close by, easy access to metro, highway, and amazing customer service. Suite was sweet! Plenty of room and super clean. Hector went above and beyond to help us get around the city. This place is a Must stay.
title: Fantastic!

review: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Nouvel. The central location, a block off Las Ramblas, was excellent and the hotel itself was fine, if a little tired. Our room was clean and quiet, but small. The staff left us underwhelmed however. They seemed more interested in surfing the Internet in the back room and acted bothered if you had a question. When we arrived, they also required a printed copy of my reservation. I had made my reservations through Trip Advisor which had linked me to a site called HotelQuickly. I had even contacted the hotel directly prior to arriving to confirm my reservation- but despite all of this, they demanded that I print out my confirmation for them. I have made many on line hotel reservations, and this is the only time I have ever been required to print out my confirmation! I’m pretty certain that I had reserved and paid for breakfast, but they said I hadn’t and I chose not to argue it. This happened on a couple other reservations in Spain- so in the future I think I would just make room reservations, and then decide on breakfast when I arrived at the location. The breakfast at Novel appeared to be quite overpriced and we found many cafes nearby that were open in the morning- including El Mos across the street that had the best café con leche we found in all of Spain!
title: Centrally Located Historic Hotel, So, So Customer Service

hotelLocation: Mare de Deu de Bellvitge, 3, 08907 Barcelona, Spain
review: I have mixed feelings about the experience of the Aparthotel. The staff are very helpful polite and it is a good choice for access to the airport if all goes well in choosing an apartment. Some people will have a satisfactory outcome. I didn't. I hoped to drop my bag once I checked in at 1pm, and be able to meet my sister to do sightseeing in central Barcelona. Because of the technical problems I needed to stay around for 3 hours until I received a replacement key for a new room.The air conditioning was so feeble that although it was set at 19 the temperature climbed from 25 to 27 C within 2 hours of getting my room.No technician appeared when I asked for help, so I packed up and went to reception.A member of staff was really kind and brought me to a better apartment on the cool side of the hotel. The AC still didn't work but at 22c it was bearable. This is not a renovated room so furniture and sofa were not to the same standard as 302 my first room.I took a taxi from town to the hotel as I didn't want to negotiate an unlit underpass from the Hospital car park, where you find the metro access. The bus stop for night bus N16 is on a level with Galp petrol station, and there are well lit walkways to get there.The bus to the airport arrived on schedule and took 10 minutes to get to T2B at 3.33am.Such a brief stay but I may use again providing I can get a room on the shaded side.
title: Both good and awkward aspects to the apartment

hotelLocation: Mare de Deu de Bellvitge, 3, 08907 Barcelona, Spain
review: Good choice for a city trip in Barcelona. The rooms are small studios, with small kitchen in the living room, bedroom and bathroom. The reception is in the nearby Hesperia Tower, where we also had the chance to enjoy a small breakfast the day of the departure (we did not have the breakfast included). It is a great value for money, not being so expensive to be a 5 stars hotel.The downsides are the distance from the city centre (around 25 minutes to be in Plaça Catalunya with the red line) and the fact that many services are not included (there is the coffee machine but the coffee tabs have to be paid apart, swimming pool and other amenities to be paid in addition). On the other side, it is close to the airport that is perfect when the flight is in the early morning.All in all, it was a good choice with a good service.
title: Great value for money, far from city centre

hotelLocation: Mare de Deu de Bellvitge, 3, 08907 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel is absolutely beautiful, the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Its located more with the locals near the airport, rather than the hustle and bustle of the main city. Sits by a metro station which takes less than 15 mins to La Ramblas. They also have a free shuttle bus you can use. I would certainly book again!
title: Absolutely Stunning

review: Loved the hotel.. Very clean.. Ultra modern with the bidets in the bathrooms.. Nice touch.. The continental breakfast in the morning was well worth the cost.. Enjoyed every moment of my stay.. Would recommend to my friends
title: Great Hotel.. Perfect Location

hotelLocation: Mare de Deu de Bellvitge, 3, 08907 Barcelona, Spain
review: I booked this Hotel based on the relative closeness to airport and that they advertised that they offered airport shuttles. (Be careful; these are limited as I found out)Positive notes: Lovely girl on reception very friendly but she was a trainee and had to keep going off and asking questions; this meant a less than speedie check-in. I had already been up travelling for several hours and just wanted to get into my room, it was now late afternoon. The apartment block was in a separate building across the street; Very very spacious apartment, 2 bedroom even though I'd only booked a 1 bed. Very different in terms of a lot of black so it seemed quite dark the bathroom was all black tiling and very poor lighting. Excellent shower but it did leak all over the floor! The kitchen was weird in that even though it had a microwave etc there was no cutlery or plates so even if I had managed to find somewhere to buy food, I had nothing to eat it on/with?The internet was very poor and couldn't get a connection at all; phoned reception for assistance they said they'd send someone..... 2 calls later and 30mins plus (now getting very frustrated) A lovely guy finely came, got me connected using an 'internal staff' access!! He escorted me back down to the main reception/foyer bar area where I got a couple of glass's of wine and re-connected me again via a staff internet access....No restaurants close by and as a single female traveling I wasn't keen and he recommended that i don't go out walking around to find food although public transport was close by...The next morning was a nice surprise as I waited for the airport shuttle, (earliest was 7am which was touch and go timing for my flight check in). But free coffee and small selection of pastries was available for self serve in the foyer bar area. So touching back on the airport shuttle; they only provide this service several times a day it is not a continuous running service all day/night. So when my flight arrived at just prior to 5pm, after much confusion found out that the next shuttle was 7pm. So I ended up getting a bus, this was ok and cheap but the driver was a little confused in terms of where I need to get off. Had to cross a freeway/main road and then walk through a park area to get the Hotel. You can also not pre-book this service it is a first in best dressed.Note for Management: please offer guest a map on there check in as these are not available in the rooms
title: Very large apartment; airport transferred are limited

review: Stayed for 2 nights in a family room (1 dbl 2 singles)Room was small and no views etc but we were there for sightseeing, very clean - beds not overly comfy.Location wise - perfect and surprisingly was not noisyReception staff were very friendly and helpfulBreakfast was very good - variety of continental and hot foodNo bar area but vending machine with drinks etcWould recommend if on a budget and here on a touristy visit
title: Barcelona budget - worth it

review: The hotel is very clean and the rooms are quiet without sound from other rooms. The reception staff members are friendly and professional with excellent English. The other staff are also pleasant and helpful.The breakfast has a good variety of food and hot and cold drinks. The hotel is in a central secure location. The lockers for luggage storage are very useful.
title: Value for money in a top location

review: Nice and clean hotel and great staff. Fantastic location for La Ramblers just a minute walk away which was ideal for us. Didn't make breakfast the two days we were there but it did look very good. Rooms were ok but a little small but very clean and tidy with beds made every morning and room cleaned. Will definitely go back again when next in Barcelona
title: Good Location

review: The hotel is located steps away from la rambla and nearby restaurants, friendly staff and good breakfast provided! Overall a good stay for me and perfect if you wanna be near the Barcelona buzz at night.
title: Centrally located Hotel

review: Nice clean room, a bit small but has almost everything you needExcellent location, 3 minutes walk to placa catalunya, and has carrefour right in front.Breakfast is good, and good AC in the roomGood bathroom with nice walk in shower, and good daily room cleaning.only negative issues are the lack of a mini bar as well as a adequate space for clothe and luggage.
title: very good place to stay in Barcelona

review: Great location accessible to major hubs: buses, metros as well walking distance to the heart of Barcelona city centre. Hotel room was nice, spacious and quiet. Front desk staffs were really cheerful, knowledgeable and helpful. On-premise restaurant menus (i.e. Breakfasts) were adequately convenient. An upgrade to coffee maker is recommended as our coffees (cappuccino, expresso etc..) tasted rather horrid. We recommend four-star overall.
title: Great Location & Wonderful Concierge

review: Stayed at the Rocafort in January 2017. This hotel is in a quiet reidential street, in a central part ofthe city, ideally placed for all the atractions that Barcelona has to offer.The rooms are stylish, well equipped and very comfortable. Breakfast buffet is more than adecuate and the hotel has a lovely outdoor terrace area just off the dining room. A little oasisin the city centre.Polite and helpful staff in all areas. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a quiet and comfortable base in Barcelona from which to explore this wonderful city.
title: Hotel céntrico, cómodo, y tranquilo.

review: The hotel location is great. 5 min walk from placa espanya which is the point for tourist hop of hop off buses, aerobus , metro etc. The hotel also has 3 to 4 supermarkets in a 2 min walking range so very easy to get water and any other supplies. There is a coffee shop across the road if you want to grab a coffee and breakfast or a snack anytime and the jotel itself also has a bar and coffee shop which very convenient. They provide 4 small bottles of water, free, which was very welcome Now the rooms. Well for Spain it was great the A.C. and wi fi were working great in the room which was not my experience in many other hotels I stayed across Spain The room is small for sure but not uncomfortable. What I did not like is if you mean and sit up on the bed against the wall ..the whole bed slides ..very annoying specifically because there is just 1 chair on the room and the bed is where you would sit even if u wanted to for a few min. The bathroom was clean. Toiletries provided. My room passage started dripping water from the ceiling and I complained and they were very efficient in fixing it. Also the staff is really helpful and very well spoken in English. Even though the check in time is 3 pm you can leave your bags in storage if you arrive early and they keep it for you. I think overall it was a nice choice of hotel.
title: Great location, great staff.

review: I won't advice you to live there in July, I wasn't able to find air condition. It's ok for one night but its a shame for it's location. Work on service is much needed. The room was ok, make sure to print your confirmation, going the extra for the customer was not their thing. I was asked "what do you expect from 2stars hotel"? My reply everything on the web but then again it's a 2star and for me a 1 star should nev3r ask customers such a crazy question. Barcelona is a city with endless of hotels and hostels make sure to have a look around, so book one night and find that which suits you. You might even like the place.
title: Not satisfied

review: Very happy with this hotel. Decent size, friendly reception who greeted us kindly , informed us about the area, called a taxi for us etc. Great location as well only about 5-10 minutes walk to la rambla and gothic quarter etc. Clean and affordable. Deserves much more then 2 stars!
title: Great value, great location

review: The hotel is in a very central location and staff was very friendly and helpful.Other than that, I would not stay again. It had a strange smell in corridors and in the bedroom. Our bedroom had a small window facing the wall, so it was very dark. Bed was extremely uncomfortable; breakfast was of a low quality, lacking any fresh produce. Barcelona has got fantastic restaurants and cafes so don't waste your breakfast here.
title: Location

review: This was a very nice hotel for our group of 12 people. Our check-in process was efficient and friendly. The room and bed were both comfortable. The room provides a counter with television and desk area and a small closet. There was a refrigerator with four bottles of water (no charge). The bathroom has a basin on a small counter with a variety of provided amenities (toothbrush, comb, etc.). The tub/shower has a glass door that covers only half of the opening, so it was hard to keep water from running onto the floor during a shower. The shower drained very slowly, but the water pressure was strong and the temperature stayed consistent. The free WiFi service in the room and the lobby was strong and reliable. We found only one electrical outlet in the room and one in the bathroom for charging electronics, but we carry our own plug strip so it was no problem. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would be glad to return in the future.
title: Convenient location and friendly staff

review: The Hotel itself is in a great location, near shops, public transport and restuarants. The reception and restuarant were all very nice and friendly. However, I had major issues as first I had to change rooms due to lack of space, then the sink in the bathroom was getting blocked everyday and the fridge didnt work despite reporting this. And to my disappointment, a pair of my nice earrings I had left on the table went missing one day when I returned in the evening. I spoke to the Hotel manager about this as I wasnt happy and she did very little if nothing to help me. The staff didnt get spoken to and she told me different things everyday. First she promised me the Hotel would give me a voucher to buy new ones, then she took that back and denied she had said that. There was no safe in the room so as a guest I would like to be able tyo trust the staff that nothing gets taken. This has never happened to me and I travel a lot. I was very upset and I had to keep chasing the Hotel Manager for answers. She basically said its not their problem in the end. She didnt even give me a discount on the room and I paid almost €1000 for my stay! How very poor.
title: Great location but poor customer service

review: Ideally located hotel in central Barcelona, it is in walking distance to many sights and close to a couple of metro stations. The hotel is basic but suits the needs of a weekend stay. Staff were very friendly and welcoming.
title: Good value hotel

review: Comfortable boutique hotel. We'll positioned for metro and bus just 5 min away. Plenty of places to eat within 5 to 10 mins walk. Magic fountain just 5 min walk. Hotel staff couldn't have been more kind and helpful. Bed was comfortable, room clean. Only thing missing was maybe some drawers to let us unpack from our cases.
title: Good position

review: Lovely clean rooms with excellent and very quiet air conditioning unit - greatly appreciated as temp this July was around 30 degrees hot. The staff are friendly and helpful with good humour. Breakfast gave good choices of both continental meats, cheese and pastries along with some cooked items too. We are three women '50ish' and although the hotel is not ultra modern it is characterful with a lovely ambience - we very much enjoyed our stay in this hotel located in the heart of La Rambla! One slight possible negative as across from the hotel is a nightclub that kicks out at 4am - if you're a night bird this wouldn't be an issue.
title: 5night city break

review: This is a top location hotel with very nice stuff. However, the building is old and not well maintained. Beds are very uncomfortable. What is worse is the noise from other rooms. The walls are very thin you can hear every word your neighbor is saying. We were not able to sleep at all. There is also the noise from the underground metro which is every 10 minutes. It stops after 1am-2 am though. We were on the 3rd floor, the water pressure was very bad as well. It is a challenge to even brush your teeth. A fairly good breakfast buffet was included. However, outside the rooms and the reception area, the hotel is not air-conditioned. It is too expensive for what the hotel offers overall.
title: Very noisy - very diffucult to sleep

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for 5 nights at end of July and were extremely happy with this hotel. On arrival the receptionist was extremely friendly and gave us a map which she then proceeded to draw the bus stops, best places to visit etc so that we knew where we were going. The hotel rooms are basic but very nice! The bathrooms are split with a curtain from the main bedroom but the toilet is separated by a proper door for privacy. The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms do have air con. The roof bar is lovely and has space for sunbathing as well as €6 drinks deals every evening - bartender Sofia was fantastic! Close to Las Ramblas and Metro stations. Definitely visit again!
title: Amazing hotel, great location!

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Very clean, fab food,.helpful staff.Loved the roof top bar.The only bad thing I can say is that it is situated up a dark street and wouldn't recommend walking alone to it .Also the air con was noisy.Saying that i would go back .
title: Lovely stay

review: A great little hotel in an excellent location. It ha no trimmings but for the price in the area it is, you can't expect any. The staff are amazing and so helpful with anything you need to know. There are literally dozens of restaurants at your doorstep as well as shopping and supermarkets. Sangria is literally a step out the door. Breakfast is plentiful and the staff, are again, wonderful. Comfortable rooms, although we would have liked a small fridge. Would definitely stay here again if in Barcelona.
title: Pleasant hotel with very friendly staff

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is a 5 minute walk to las ramblas and a 5 minute walk from the metro station, easy to get to using public transport. Room was a basic double but the bed was a king size, nice and comfortable for me and my husband. Room was small but adequate, you could draw the curtain across from the bathroom and the toilet was Ina seperate little room. Very light and airy. Only wish you could leave air con on whilst out as it was so hot in August! Staff were very friendly and helpful and would give you tips of what metro station to use or which line. All staff greeted you as you came and went. Rooftop bar and lounge area on 6th floor was really nice to relax in! Overall a lovely stay!
title: Quirky hotel with lovely staff!

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: I stayed here in may for 3 nights with a friend. The hotel was very clean and the staff were extremely helpful! Our room was small with the shower and sink in the same room as our bed with a curtain to separate, and a separate toilet cubicle. This took a bit of getting used to but it wasn't an issue. Although small, the room had everything we needed and was ideal for us as we were out exploring each day and didn't need to use it a lot. There was a hairdryer, a tv, a safe, towels, shampoo and soap. Rooms cleaned and towels changed daily. The only downside to our room was that there was a huge crack in the mirror, though this didn't cause any issues. The hotel has a unique theme to it though don't let this put you off as it's really interesting. There is a rooftop terrace with a bar and sun loungers. We ate breakfast at the hotel which was lovely. It was a buffet style set up with plenty of continental and hot food to chose from. Full selection of teas, coffee and juices. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from La Rambla and 5 minutes to the metro station. There is a mini market opposite the hotel. The hotel has facilities to leave your luggage in a safe locker space which we found useful on our last day as our flight home wasn't till late. All in all I have no complaints about the hotel as it was the perfect stay for a busy city break. If you plan on spending more time in the room then maybe you might find it a little cramped. Must say again how lovely and helpful the staff were!
title: Charming hotel close to La Rambla

hotelLocation: Nou de Sant Francesc 40, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel is located in a road parallel and just beside the Ramblas, at the port end.It is quite basic but has all of the basics.It is clean and comfortable and serves a reasonable breakfast.The reception is 24 hours.There was a bit of noise from the street.It is great value.
title: Great location, great value

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is ideally located near the 'Gothic' quarters of the City, making it a perfectly central location to most key tourist locations (5 min walk from the metro. 10 min walk to la Rambla and 10 min bus ride to the beach). Myself and 3 friends arrived for our first girls holiday to Barcelona and were welcomed with a friendly reception as we entered the quirky hotel. With little idea of how far we were from the tourist attractions we'd planned to visit, the receptionist whipped out a map and gave a swift and detailed summary of our closest metro stations, most accessible bus services and even the advised us on pre-booking some of the attractions we'd planned to visit. The rooms we'd booked (two doubles) were clean, spacious and extremely comfortable. We'd seen on the website that only a mesh curtain separated the bathroom from the bedroom, and as we were sharing between friends, we figured this would have been a bit intimate... however there was also a white curtain which could be drawn for privacy. (The loo had its own private room as well, thankfully). I have to say the beds were absolutely incredible. So comfortable, which was a dream to come back to after our long days/nights out. We spend a few afternoons and evenings on the spacious and modern rooftop area, enjoying the fantastic cocktails and soaking up the sunshine when we were a bit too tired to head down to the beach. Overall, I'd highly recommmend the hotel. We received a fantastic service from all the friendly, welcoming and helpful staff, with special thanks to Sophia for making the tastiest Mojito (or 4) in town
title: Wonderful week at Acta Mimic Hotel

hotelLocation: Nou de Sant Francesc 40, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for three nights whilst exploring Barcelona. Great location near the metro stop drassanes. Which is at the bottom of la ramblas. We were able to check in a few hours sooner than the time specified which was great. They stored our luggage on our last day too. Room was nice. Fridge was good to have. Air con wasn't the easiest to work. Breakfast is awful, we tried it one day. Don't bother. Would have been nice to have kettle with tea and coffee options in room
title: Great, can't complain

review: My boyfriend and I chose this hotel, didn't know what to expect but it was honestly such a great find. Our room was modern, it wasn't the biggest but we had a comfy bed and had everything that we needed such as a good shower, toilet, AC, tv etc. It was simple and met our every needs. The hotel is in a great location, literally only a 5 min walk to Las Ramblas. I would definitely book this place again.
title: Really great hotel

hotelLocation: Nou de Sant Francesc 40, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed in a bijou room for 3 people. V little space in the room with 3 people and suitcases but it was fine for our needs (somewhere to change and sleep). Shower powerful and hot, complementary water in room, air-con, TV. Little wrought iron balcony overlooking the street was an added bonus. No amenities at the hotel but not needed as spent all day sight seeing.
title: Little no frills hotel in excellent position for port and La Rambla

review: Just came back from a 7 days stay at this Hotel with my husband and 16 year old . It was everything we were looking for and more.The subway was less then 10 min walk, la Rambla also, rooms were clean and the daily service was excellent. Everyone at the front desk, especially Marc, were not only very nice but very helpful with any questions we had. Only thing missing was a mini fridge but beside that we would definitely go back again.
title: Barcelona in July

hotelLocation: Nou de Sant Francesc 40, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: For some reason this hotel was cheaper than any Airbnb in Barcelona, so we booked it solely based on it's great location. Having no expectations at all, I was pleasantly surprised to discover that it was a great budget hotel, close to the metro, many attractions and bars.Our room was very clean, quite, had great air conditioning, hot water and excellent Wi-Fi reception. Breakfast for 5€ was a great deal, since bakeries in Barcelona are on the expensive side.I really don't have anything negative to say and would totally recommend it to anyone.
title: Very good hotel in the heart of the city.

review: Our stay at Barcelona Center Hotel started awfully as we were placed in a smoking room even with a confirmed non-smoking reservation. The front desk agent informed us that all their rooms were non-smoking but this room clearly was not. The room wreaked of smoke and there was an ashtray on the bedside table. They were sold out that night so we had to endure staying there that evening (I get headaches from cigarette smoke). After we were moved to a different room the next day, the rest of our stay went okay. The hotel amenities were slightly below expectations (no conditioner at a 4-star hotel?), and everything else was fine. Mediocre hotel but the location was convenient.
title: It was okay

review: The hotel was a little far from city centre but not that far. 10 to 15 min walk. A few good restaurants not too far away and relatively quiet area. Staff were quiet pleasant and helpful. We stayed in a double room which was ok. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was big.
title: Hotel Barcelona Center

review: Firstly, the location of this hotel is excellent. We purchased a 'Barcelona card' which allowed us use of the cities excellent public transport system, all of which is readily accessible from this central hotel.We requested a double bed in advance through the booking.com app, received a room with 2 singles, frustrating but not the end of the world. The room itself was an ok size for 2 people but felt very small due to the window not allowing much light in. After exploring Barcelona all day, my wife and I decided to spend a little time on the rooftop soaking up the sun in the jacuzzis before our concert that evening. We were disappointed to read upon arrival that the jacuzzis were in fact hydrotherapy pools (unheated), again frustrating but it's summertime so not the end of the world.We had bought a couple of beers and took them up to the roof and hadn't sat down for more than 30 seconds before being set upon by a very rude member of staff who asked us to leave immediately as we were not aloud to bring our own drinks to the rooftop. I attempted to reason with her, explaining that it was one bottle of beer, we were unaware of this rule as there are no signs or notices anywhere we had seen forbidding bringing your own drinks, plus it was our first visit to the hotel and city - all to no avail. We offered to pour out the drinks and buy some from the bar, no. Out. I could continue in a similar vein, every interaction with staff was contemptuous, even the manager when I called to complain about the way we had been spoken to. Loved the city, already planning a return but it won't be to this hotel.
title: The only negative from a fantastic visit

review: First of all, I would like to say that the lobby of this hotel is very nice-looking. Also, the location of the hotel is in a quieter part of town so at least you don't have to put up with noise all night.We entered our room. It looked okay. Then we went to open the cupboard door so we could check the mini fridge. The door was literally hanging off it's hinges. Every time we closed the cupboard after using the fridge, we had to pop the door back in place.Additionally, the washroom (the bathtub especially) had mold/mildew in the corners. The cleaning lady only changed the towels; she didn't even try to clean the mold.And the WiFi. From our room on the third floor, the wifi was incredibly slow. From time to time it would disconnect for no apparent reason. This was really annoying when we were trying to check our emails, read the news etc.Lastly, the Jacuzzis on the roof were lame. The jets didn't even work, even when we pressed the designated button over and over. They were also very small.Overall, I think that the room and hotel was satisfactory for our 4 night stay in Barcelona, but I don't believe (based on our experience) that the hotel is worth its 4 star rating.
title: Satisfactory

review: the hotel is quite good, spacious and clean rooms.a little bit far from the city center but has two shopping center right next to it and lots of restaurants.you get a good value for the price you pay!
title: what you expect for the price

review: Not sure if it has a pool but I stayed here for two nights with a group. Room was clean, had AC that actually worked, window view was beautiful and breakfast was good!Not too far from metro station and close to market and mall.
title: Great hotel!

review: I don't think the difference of price between ibis and ibis budget is justified. We've booked Ibis this time because all the ibis-budget were already sold out. But i didn't like it very much. The bathroom was bigger and put altogether, okay, but the commodities were very similar. It was very different to season the water - either too warm or too cold. We were put in a smokers' room even though we're non-smokers, and even though the room was clean, of course, there is always that smell in the air that never goes away. They should, definitely, offer breakfast... it is not a "budget choice", it's already a three star hotel. But I must say, the staff were amazing, and that's really what saved the day for me.
title: Visiting Barcelona for a couple of days

review: Unfortunately, we didn't have a great experience at the hotel - beginning from the moment we arrived in our room. Despite booking a double room, when we entered into our room following check in it was apparent that we had been given a twin room. Nothing was said to us about this at check in, so we had to head back down to the reception desk to ask to be moved to a double room as per our booking. The receptionist was very rude, didn't apologise, said that there was nothing he could do about it (he couldn't move us, he couldn't arrange for the the bed to be made into a double bed ) and smugly stated that the hotel being able to unilaterally change the type of room a guest had booked was (apparently) "within the terms and conditions". We asked if there was anything else he could do - for example, give us a complimentary breakfast the next day - but we were firmly told that he couldn't do a single thing (including, as it became only too apparent, apologise). We asked to speak to the manager, but the manager wasn't at the hotel until the next day (which is worrying in and of itself - surely a duty manager should be at the hotel at all times?!). We asked for the manager to contact us the next morning - but we heard nothing. On check out, I asked for a feedback form and described our issue so as to give the hotel a chance to apologise and make amends (I always like to give service providers a chance to correct issues before taking to Tripadvisor to write a scathing review) - but still nothing. I'm sorry, therefore, to post this review - but it's only fair that other travellers are aware of our experience. If you book a specific room here, beware - you may get any old room depending on how the hotel feels on the day! Otherwise, our room was OK and it was clean - but generally the hotel is pretty mediocre and tired. And the service is utterly horrendous.
title: Tired hotel, awful service - but good location

review: Let me begin by saying the drive from Valencia to Madrid along parts of toll route AP-7 produced some views, including of the Mediterranean, that were spectacular. My only wish was that there were viewing points along the roadway so that you could take photos. The total tolls I paid were €29.10 (€3.70 + €3.70 + €21.70). Finding IBIS Barcelona Meridiana was not entirely difficult, even with my bicycle oriented GPS map of Spain. Although the hotel is located outside the center of Barcelona, I found the location to be ideal, especially with the amount of visitors/vacationers that I encountered in the city. It is located specifically in Heron City and part of/connected to a mall, that includes a supermarket, and next to a Cortés Inglés (is a 'national' department store). The mall includes a few decent places to eat (and has a McDonalds, if you are so inclined). There is also a nice park directly across the street that contains a large public swimming pool.
