And, of course, there is also an adjacent residential area to explore, listen to the linguistic cadence of the people and find typical tapas bars.Although, IBIS Barcelona Meridiana is located outside of the center, the metro station 'Favra i Puig' on Line 1 is located a 15 minute leisurely walk from the hotel (out the front door, to the right, through the park). The cost of a one-way 'simple ticket' or 'billete sencillez' is €2.15. I would recommend taking Line 1 from Favra i Puig to the Catalunya stop -- a 15 minute ride. This will put you in the center of much of the "action" and a good point to access much of the city center. This is where I took the 'Hop On Hop Off' sight-seeing tour bus, which I highly recommend. I initially thought the €29 price was expensive. However, it turned out to be more than fair, as Barcelona is a grand city. There are two routes to the tour: one on the 'blue line' and one on the 'red line' -- each taking approximately 2 hours to complete without getting off. This is a very good way to see Barcelona. But, if you really want to EXPERIENCE Barcelona, you need to consider staying several days.(A couple of other comments about the city of Barcelona. There are 1.1M inhabitants in the city of Barcelona. But, if you include the outer areas of the city, Barcelona has 3M inhabitants. Also, Barcelona is very bike and moto friendly. Alongside most of the city roadways, there are separated and separate routes/lanes for both bikes and motos. The suggestion is there are over 100 km or 65.5 miles of these lanes!)In between the two tour lines, I actually had lunch in the cafeteria on the 9th floor of Cortés Inglés. There are window tables that line the entire length of the 9th floor. Shall, I say the view of the city is SPECTACULAR! If you can grab a window seat. If you can't but can sit even somewhat close, you will be very pleased nonetheless. Even though the dining location is listed as a 'cafeteria', all the food looks gourmet. And, I can testify that it is. I had the seafood paella (there were 3 types of paella, including a vegetarian option), which was incredible!... The portion was significant and I only paid €9.95. I would have paid €19.95!I know this review is supposed to be about IBIS Barcelona Meridiana. But, it is really about the entire experience. The hotel is a typical IBIS (the 3rd I have stayed in on my vacation and the best next to IBIS Málaga Centro) -- the main space and bathrooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff were very nice, engaging and attentive -- much more so than in the other IBIS locations I have been in. Perhaps, this is because Barcelona has greater competition for hotel rooms and the staff are "more on their game". There is parking under the Heron City Mall, which is a nice option. But, I think the cost, which is €12.80, is a little high, especially since I am currently paying €8.00 at IBIS Madrid Meridiana. At minimum, where IBIS does charge for parking, perhaps they should be consistent at €8.00. All other IBIS accommodations are fairly constant, why not the price of parking where they charge for it?Still, and all-in-all, I would highly recommend planning your stay at IBIS Barcelona Meridiana.
title: IBIS Barcelona Meridiana--More Than Worth The Visit

review: At the check-in we were given less change, so be attentive. Then it appeared they don't take 500€ notes. But it was ok to take it before.... The breakfast was ok, nothing special. The hotel is far from city centre.
title: Be attentive

review: very nice hotel in the center, not too big; although it is close to Rambla, it is in a quiet street; easy access to the important places in Barcelona; very friendly staff, good breakfest, clean rooms;
title: Nice town hotel

review: Our 3rd visit to this hotel / such a good location and very comfortable hotel, friendly staff and good breakfast catering for our vegan diet as well! Would visit again if we return to BCN! Keep it going.
title: Excellent hotel Barcelona

review: There was an extreme noise from the other guests during the late hours of the night. People were coming and going and the doors make a lot of noise when they open and close. I think they should ask the guests to be considerate of others and do something with the doors.
title: Hard to sleep at night

review: the extra touches like the cookies and wine were enjoyed by all. early check in was much appreciated after an overnight flight from Canada. Location was superb and the ability to have 4 in a room was great. Would recommend your hotel and would stay there again if we are in Barcelona.
title: stayed july 21-23

review: Located at Plaza Catalunya (top of Las Ramblas), which is the more affluent section of Barcelona with tons of shopping and fashion forward retailers. Walking distance to Gaudi's Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. Nice hotel and great service, with spacious rooms. Perfect for families traveling with kids.
title: Perfect Location on Las Ramblas

hotelLocation: C/ Consell de Cent 51-53, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel was so much better than we expected. We left booking our hotel for Barcelona quite late so everything was quite pricey. We booked this hotel due to the location and price and were pleasantly surpised when we arrived.We could not fault the cleanliness, everything was tidy, clean and we did not notice any issues during our 3 night stay.The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Espana underground station, which links directly to the city centre, 4 stops away from Placa Catalunya. This was perfect for us and Barcelona pubic transport is so cheap. Buy a T10 ticket for under 10 EURO which has 10 trips that can be used by multiple people.The only downfall of this hotel is there is not many nice restaurants around the area, but this didn't affect us too much as it is so close to the city centre.The staff were friendly, but could have been more welcoming on check in.Overall we were very happy with our stay, the room was clean and very large, and it was the perfect location for us.Would definitely recommend and stay again!
title: Just what we wanted

hotelLocation: C/ Consell de Cent 51-53, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: Hi Friends... I stayed at the Pestana Arena Barcelona it was a nice hotel with a nice lobby to relax and have a delicious cup of coffee or cappuccino... Our room was spacious and clean with a large glass window that opened (no screens) The bathrooms were very nice modern and clean as well... Breakfast was a Buffet it had a lot of things Eggs, bacon cereals, cheeses, ham, pastries etc. and delicious hot chocolate it was like you were drinking melted chocolate... Yummy :-) it was close to the bus stop, train, restaurants and had shops near by... I hope you have a great stay :-)
title: "Nice Quiet and clean"

hotelLocation: C/ Consell de Cent 51-53, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: I was looking for a hotel close to the Plaza Espanya, and Pestana did not dissapoint. We were a group of 8 and our rooms were very clean, modern, with minibar, safe deposit box, comfy beds and pillows. The front desk attendants were very nice and professional, with suggestions and tips. The breakfast buffet is very good and complete with juices, fruits, cheeses, cold cuts, breads, eggs etc., plus we had dinner one night at the restaurant and it was very good too. The location is 2 blocks to Plaza Espanya, Arenas shopping center, metro and train station. We liked the hotel so much, that I'll be looking to book Pestana in our next trip to Barcelona o any other city they have a hotel.
title: Modern Hotel in a good location

hotelLocation: C/ Consell de Cent 51-53, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: I liked my stay there , from 11 to 16 July, excellent hotel, proffesional staff , rooms are wonderful and clean , i spent 5 nights there in junior sweet, reception staff were excellent , breakfast and food were good, excellent location in the city, near subway, approach to any place was easy, i suggest this hotel for anyone will visit barcelona, i will stay again in it during my next vacation
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: C/ Consell de Cent 51-53, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: Pestana Arena Barcelona is in walking distance from the Sans train station. The staff is multilingual and very helpful. The rooms are large and very well appointed. The bathrooms are gorgeous. I only spent one night here before a cruise but thoroughly enjoyed my stay.
title: beautiful hotel near the train station

hotelLocation: Gran Via Corts Catalanes 647, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed two nights. Not my favorite location in Barcelona, but it's not bad. The good: quick check-in and super quick check-out. The bad: corridor near my room had a terrible smell, but I didn't see anyone trying to do anything about it, not that day or the next day. I didn't complain, but there is no way housekeeping didn't notice the smell. Rooftop bar was very nice.
title: Location is not bad, but corridor near my room had terrible smell...

hotelLocation: Gran Via Corts Catalanes 647, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Very nice stay would return again. The service was wonderful we lost our drink tickets somewhere on way to Sagrada Familia and they replaced them for us no problem. The bed was comfy and bathroom was awesome with a bidet. Even enjoyed roomservice and it was very affordable.
title: Free Drinks on the rooftop terrace,

hotelLocation: Gran Via Corts Catalanes 647, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: This place was wonderful! It was clean and comfortable. The location was very close to everything and the cab stop was right outside the door. The front desk helped plan activities and ordered tours !
title: Beautiful interior and roof top bar

hotelLocation: Gran Via Corts Catalanes 647, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is in the centre of the city however very quiet and is in a very prestigious place. The sky bar is great with the pool overlooking the Sagrada familia. Staff were great - rooms are very clean and comfortable.
title: Outstanding accommodation in the heart of Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via Corts Catalanes 647, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: I have been in quite a lot of hotels, but this one is certainly above average. The rooms are clean, and spacious enough with very high ceilings. The rooftop bar and pool are really nice after a day of traveling or walking in the city and the personnel are very kind and helpful. Last but not least: the breakfast is great!
title: Great hotel with a very nice rooftop terrace and super friendly personnel.

review: Visited for my birthday, requested early check-in & had to wait 3hours, kids running about & jumping in the pool, charged me room tax twice, staff are useless, breakfast is awful, went back to room 1 day & there was a man in our room & most of the gym equipment didn't work
title: Not the best hotel

review: I was positively surprised with this hotel. It's not near the touristic attractions, but there's a subway station, two blocks away. It's an efficient mean of transportation, except for the stairs inside the stations. A big advantage is the existence of a mall with stores like FNAC, Carrefour, H&M etc. The room had adequate space for a couple with a child. Wifi was good too. There were not many options of TV channels. A nice restaurant with activities for the children at diinner. The terrace had a pool and fitness center. During several evenings there were a musical programming for the guests.
title: Very nice stay

review: a few minutes walk to glories station. Here are some directions:1. From the Airport - take the metro (Zona University line) to Torrassa (L1) Station, then take the train to Glories Station2. to Picasso Museum - take metro Llacuna to Jaume. Walk about 9 minutes.3. to Park Guell - From Glories (L1) take to Catalunya. then take L3 (green) to Vallcarca
title: friendly helpful staff, good location, within walking distance to metro/Tram

review: Room rather small with 2 kids, but ok. Room was clean.Most annoying: very bad smell in the bathroom. Complained and they send housekeeping but problem could not be solved. I suppose other rooms had the same problem, because we smelled it also in the street where the hotel is located. Hence maybe the hotel couldn't help this and did the best they can, but for me this is the reason why I will never book this hotel again. For a few days we could manage, but if we had stayed here for e.g. a week this would not have been feasable.The hotel staff could easily smell this themselves and should immediately have offered another room (if the problem was room-located).Breakfast: ok, enough choice. Some places however should get a better lightning (rather dark).Rooftop terrace: went there for a drink in the evening. Rather strange choice of placing high seats on stones: not stable, not comfortable. Staff was friendly, but the cocktails we ordered (Margarita & Cosmopolitan) were what I would call "undrinkable". If you don't manage the job to make cocktails please don't offer it on the card.Location: a bit outside the center, but that's not a problem. Everything within walking distance or via the metro or busstops nearby.Yoga: very much liked the offered yoga-session in the morning!So mixed feelings about this hotel: doubted between poor and average.To make a comparison: I stayed at the Novotel in Luxemburg a few times (also 4*) and compared to this one in Barcelona I would rather gives the Luxemburg hotel a 5* and the Barcelona hotel a 3*.
title: No 4*

review: We stayed 5nights very clean rooms wth staff very friendly Breakfast is very very good with a wide verity The hotel restaurant food is very poor quality for the price an we waited 25mins for a cocktail we ordered an the place was empty with two members of staff doing nothin that was a major let down to a lovely quiet hotel in a nice location
title: Nice hotel. Near the beach

review: Front desk staff very helpful and friendly. I encountered many problems during my stay that should never happen at a hotel with this rating and price.First, the air conditioning. One has no ability to adjust the temperature, only the fans. I found this quite shocking again for the rating and price. Regardless, even with the fan turned at maximum and the temperature at minimum, the room temperature was still way too warm, On maximum the fan was too weak to adequately cool the room. In addition (again, quite surprising) is that when you remove the room key that powers the lights, the air conditioning shuts off as well. At the end of the summer day, when you come in all hot and sweaty from touring around, the room temperature was unbearable and took hours to "cool".Housekeeping staff was not quite competent. Three times during 7 day stay I had to call the front desk because either the soap was not replaced, the shampoo or conditioner was not replaced, my bathrobe was not replaced etc. Again, this should NOT happen at a hotel that supposedly is rated this highly.For the final straw, my room safe was broken. This was verified by the maintenance person. The next day someone came to fix it. I still could not get it to work. Turns out, the instruction card on how to use the safe was completely incorrect. When I showed it to the hotel worker, he tore it up and threw it out.
title: Not living up to the rating or price

review: Better breakfast please, not very tasty, cheaper to go to the nearby shopping. Otherwise good hotel with a nice garden to relax in. Parking cellar can be a little tricky, but it's safe to park in and access directly to Hotel
title: Good Hotel, close to Metro and the Diagonal

review: I choose this hotel due to close access to train station, but was pleasantly surprised to find it was close to all city transportation. Close to supermarket, pharmacy , restaurants and shopping center. Great area for working and eating outdoors.
title: Amazing Stay

review: The junior suite comfortably accommodated all three of us. a king sized bed and a separate area, with 2 single beds. The king sized bed was so comfortable with really soft sheets. I slept so well on those 2 nights that we were there. It had a big bathroom as well. The hotel is about 5 mins away from a big mall (Diagonal del Mar) and very near a number of bus stops. The area is quiet and less crowded because it is quite far (about 25 mins by bus or metro), from the city center and all the touristy places.The breakfast spread was delicious and ample, and I have to highlight the service that the staff delivered. They were very accommodating and quick to deliver whatever it is you needed. The food was immediately replenished.
title: Nice hotel near the beach

review: The Positives:The location of this venue is absolutely perfect. 5 minute walk to the Diagonal Mar Shopping Centre and 10 minute walk to the beach. Banks/ATM's/Supermarkets 2 minutes' walk away.The Front Desk Staff were awesome and always ready/available to assist. Checking in and out was a breeze and absolutely no problem/hassle at all.The Staff in the Restaurant in the Evening were very kind/helpful/attentive and the food quality was very good.Breakfast Buffet was fine, good choice of coffees/beverages and the options for which type of breakfast were wide.The Junior Suite has a large bathroom and the bed was comfortable.The Negatives:Sadly, there are a couple of things that really let the hotel down and would in our opinion, be pretty easy to solve.The Junior Suites are on all floors, the first Suite and not ideally placed next to the Housekeeping Room - so there is a lot of noise from the Housekeeping door being opened/closed and the Room Attendants and their associated noise/chatter.Our Room attendants failed badly on the second/third night (First night we opted just for change of towels). But nights 2 & 3 the room was not cleaned properly, mini-bar not replaced, toiletries not replaced, all round a shoddy/rushed job (not once but twice). After we complained to Front Desk things were fine - but the staff on Housekeeping those two days badly let the hotel down - just simple laziness.The second problem is that Wi-Fi, whilst free throughout, is not stable at all and not only keeps dropping, but can remain down for long periods of time. If you do find that you are the type of person that needs to work whilst travelling, this can be a major interruption.But solve the 2 problems above and you have a very good, pleasant experience and even without a Gym or Pool, you would have a good stay if only those 2 issues could be resolved.
title: Great Location and Great Front Desk Staff

review: Dont stay in this hotel if you need an extra bed in your room, my son could not sleep in his and we had to stay 2 nights.He tried 1 night but got sore back after having the metal springs in the matress hurt his spine. And do not expect to get any help to get better bed either, you will only hear lots of excuses.. Even i booked the extra bed 1 week upfront they prefered to give the good extrabed to someone arriving same day, who had not booked this in advance..? Desk manager told me they were a big group arriving bit earlier than me.. Really dissapointing!
title: Mr. Tol

review: WOW!! What a great location..if you're going to Barcelona and would like to stay at, what I would call, centrally located hotel, pick this Hilton. The staff was welcoming and helpful without coming across as being less than genuine. Special kudos to the server in the restaurant, wish I could recall her name, she was terrific!! She was the only dark hair female host/server so she will be easy to spot..great service!!Check in/out staff also very good and helpful.The host working the lounge also went out of her way to greet and make the HHDiamond members staying on the fourth floor feel taken care off. The only minor problem occurred at the lounge when I tried to get a glass of cold water and all the cold drink holders were locked. The lounge attendant called for the keys and a grumpy older gentleman came to unlock the fridges but not before complaining about how those fridges were locked at a certain time and then open much later. He was quite loud about that to the point that the lounge hostess had to apologize for this persons lack of tack.Most Hiltons that I have stayed before usually have the fridges open for guests to get cold bottles of water or juice, don't see why this Hilton locks the fridges.My room was clean, comfortable and the a/c worked very well. Bottom line: great place to stay!!!
title: Love it..except for one thing!!

review: I stayed here for business and came back two years later with family because of the great beach/city location, friendly and helpful staff, and overall nice experience. I was not disappointed and loved my second stay.
title: Great location, helpful staff

review: Very comfortable hotel and location, nice and tiny swimming pool area, the only inconvenient is if you want a sunbed you have to pay an extra otherwise you can comfortably accomodate on a sofa chair. I have experienced a very good service, the hotel is next to the seaside and only five minutes walking from the beach, whatever you want you just ask and you will have it. If you want to surprise your partner with a present to be found directly in the room you have many choices proposed by the hotel, management is attentive and accurate. Good vibes.
title: Just ask

review: We did not get the room we pay for it was clean but very small, that is about all bad we have to say, nice staf, little pool and not enaugh space to go into pool. since we close to beach it was no problem with that so we go there instead.Close to bus and metro, but dont eat at the restaurant they need to improve a lot, go to restaurant close to hotel instead many many to chose from. 3 at the beach and like 10 around there with tapas and other, no 5 stars but ok if you want to fill your little belly ;)Any way i would go there again the weather is fantastic and walk at the beach nighttime 25 warm is worth the trip and place itself
title: Nice hotel

review: This hotel was in the middle of town, walking distance or a quick train ride to most of the attractions. Our room was exactly what you'd expect from a Hilton property - knowledgeable and friendly staff,clean and comfortable rooms. The restaurant however is a hard pass for dinner. Breakfast was the usual mediocre but dinner was over priced and disappointing. There is a tapas place right next door.
title: Gorgeous Hotel

review: Currently in the occidental atenea hotel in Barcelona writing this reviewAfter 10 hours travelling, we had a late check in and greeted by Melissa. It was 3am but she was inviting and politeWe were given a room with two great beds and an extra thing in the cornerThe pictures do show a bed that is smaller. The image is identical to real life The third bed is not for sleeping, it is not a bed, nor a sofa. It is flat, the springs stick out and when laying down you will sink to the edges of the thingAbsolutely abysmal. Three adults, paid £1500 on a last minute bookingThe extra 'bed' is not a bed and is not something to sleep on- certainly not for 6 daysMelissa at reception has provided a temporary solution however we unfortunately will waste the first day of our holiday discussing the issue with hotel manager Miguel .... extremely disappointed so far.If your booking for three people in one room, please read my
title: 3 Adults, one room= 2 comfy beds and 1 'extra bed/sofa bed'

review: We walked in here and left happy the service and the food in the restaurant was excellent and a change from all the other local Restaurants offering tapas . Good choice off menu and wine selection and there is no dress code you just walk in as you are .
title: Evening meal

review: I seldom write hotel review, but Occidental Atenea Mar Hotel made me spend my precious time writing about how awful we felt when we stayed there. We were planning to have lunch at the pool and did a bit of sunbathing. We collected the towels from the lady at the pool counter, and we sat down at two empty sunbeds, spent a few minutes to undress and settle down our things there. Then the lady came to us and said "Sorry, if you would like to stay on these sunbeds, you would have to pay." She showed us a menu as follow:€20 for using one sunbed€30 for using one sunbed + one drink€40 for using one sunbed + one drink + one burger"... or if you prefer not to pay, you can move to the beanbags area on the floor, and that is free." She said. Oh well... We certainly were "cheapskates" and we decided to roll over to the floor without spending a cent. We didn't even want to buy our lunch as planned. We discussed, and decided that we would never spend a further cent at this hotel, and would never come back again. I have been travelling around the world and this was the first time I felt shocked and humiliated at a hotel pool. As a beachside resort hotel, Occidental Atenea Mar Hotel failed to provide the most basic facility – sunbeds!!! How about the couches in the lobby? Shall they impose some charges as well? I didn't dare to sit there if it costed €20... There were plenty of space at the pool area. They could simply put more sunbeds there instead of having so much empty space on floor. If this is not a strategy to rip off clients, I don't see any justification for this tier of charges otherwise. Even if this is the hotel's deliberate business decision to impose such a ridiculous tier of charges for basic facilities, there could be a more civilised and human way of managing client's expectation. For example, the pool lady could have explained the tier of charges when we picked up the towel, and she could have put some warning signs on the two empty sunbeds. But she didn't!!! No sign, no explanation. She gave us the towels without a word, and waited for a few minutes for us to settle down, and then she came! If this is not designed to be a duo-way trap for ripping off clients or humiliation, then it must be a duo-way mess of brainless hotel management and reckless staff implementation.我一直在世界各地旅行，這是我第一次在酒店游泳池感到震驚和羞辱。作為一家海濱度假酒店，Occidental Atenea Mar Hotel酒店未能提供最基本的設施 - 日光浴床！大堂的沙發怎麼樣？他們也要強加一些費用嗎？我會真誠地建議任何值得基本的尊重的旅客，以避免這家酒店，無論你有20歐元浪費在日光浴床上。
title: What a humiliating experience!

review: Hotel Banys Orientals is an amazing boutique hotel in Barcelona's old town - we have stayed here before and were very happy to come back. The rooms are comfortable, the staff are friendly and very helpful - always willing to help with directions, suggestions and tips.The hotel's strong point is its location - in the middle of the old town, within walking distance of La Rambla and the sea, as well as being in the middle of bustling shopping streets, art galleries and local restaurants and bars serving delicious food.The breakfast is full of local delicacies and there are fridges full of free bottled water on each floor which are very welcome after a long day trekking around Barcelona.Finally, on a side note, the amazing staff at the hotel saved our holiday for us when I dropped my phone (with our pictures, videos etc.) in the taxi on the way to the airport - a quick call (from my partner's phone) to the hotel, they were able to find the taxi and get them to bring the phone back to us - a big big big thank you to the hotel for this!!!
title: Gem of a hotel in Barcelona's Old City

review: Very nice hotel with a good location and a very polite and friendly staff. On the hallways there was free cold still water on bottles, which was very good. Breakfast; the bread was very dry, and there was no scrambled egg and bacon, which we missed. There was no juice, only oranges which you had to press by yourself. Very inconvenient.But overall a very nice hotel.
title: Nice location.

review: Hotel Banys Oriental is located in lively medieval Carrer Argenteria, a small pedestrian street full of tapas bars, trendy spots and old shops. In the heart of typical El Born, one of the most attractive area in Barcelona. Between haussmannian Via Laietana and spectacular Basilica Santa Maria Del Mar. We were warmly welcomed by friendly and efficient staff at the front desk in the stylish lobby. This hotel de charme set in a nice building has an outstanding contemporary decor with elegant bright colors walls, design furniture, black and white photos, ebony-colored floor in the hallways and stairs. Our room was small but cozy and nicely furnished. We specially enjoyed the comfy canopy bed. All this creating a subtle unique mix between modernity and tradition.
title: The discreet charm of the hostelry

review: I was with family but it's perfect for couples and business.Pros:- Safe area.- Free (and fast) wifi.- Perfect location.- Great atmosphere. - Extremely helpful staff- Good buffet breakfast (for extra charge)Cons:- No ventilation in the bathroom.- The rooms was very dark. Lighting would solve it.- Almost zero noise insulation between rooms. Seems like part of the room wall is made of a very thin material. - A bit noisy during the night.
title: Small charming hotel. Perfect location.

review: Stayed at this hotel/suite for 5 nights in July, I would highly recommend this hotel. Check in - Opened 24hrs, staff were friendly (spoke fluent English) check in was very quick and easy. I don't recommend asking some staff for directions.....on two occasions we were sent the wrong way :) They do have maps though so I would read from the map. Great security in the hotel, cant use the lifts without your room card. Room - We had 1 room for 4 of us, its perfect and 10/10 for the cleanliness! Could not fault the room, small kitchenette if you need it, two tvs in the room, the sofa converted into a double bed (wasn't the most comfortable) but the main bed is. I would ask for more pillows though! The pillows are thin! Room cleaning was done daily, and done really well! No complaints from me! Lovely big bath and shower. Pool area - The pool is small yes, (you can see that from the photos) I can see that in winter it would be FREEZING as in summer it was still cold but it was hot so it was refreshing, I think a few more sun loungers would be beneficial and the towels restocking would be ideal. My children loved the pool. Location - Good location, close to shops, Metro (buy a t10 pass, which allows 10 rides) *The café across the road -BEAM is great for breakfast, pancakes are amazing as is the musli and yoghurt!
title: Good choice in Barcelona!

review: Bang next to the Ramblas,the hotel looks nondescript from outside with virtually no lobby to speak about!.However once you get in, the rooms more than compensate. Very good beds, excellent air conditioning(which is a must in summer) and sound proof rooms with a safe.Decent breakfast spread.Minus points for customer service, none of them looked interested in helping or serving anyone! Staff at check in was rude and looked absolutely disinterested in being there.If you don't mind the impersonal attitude then this place is pretty worth it for the value.
title: Superb location.

review: We stayed at the Condado for 4 nights. Overall the we stayed in was spacious and clean with plenty of wardrobe space.Our room was back of the hotel, which meant it was nice and quiet. However the windows looked out into an external shaft so had no view and little sunlight.The lighting in the room itself was a little dim but I guess it could be classed as subdued, and there is no fridge, iron or kettle in the rooms. There is a safe, hair dryer and tv and good wifi. On each floor there is a small fridge with small bottles of water and in the lobby there are 2 computers with a printer to be able print out tickets etc..Breakfast at the hotel is continental style with sausages,bacon and scrambled egg, costs 12 Euro (there are lots of coffee shops and cafes less than 5 min walk from the hotel).The area is about a 15min walk to the Diagonale or Gracia metro stations. However this is a much more relaxed part of Barcelona. Nice bars and restaurants only a short walk. The Meatpacking Bistro around the corner is really nice. Over the road there is a big food supermarket.Taxi from the airport was around 35 Euro.I would definitely recommend the hotel if you don't want to be in the very hustle and bustle part of Barcelona and don't mind a 15min amble to the nearest metro stop or hop-on-hop-off bus stop. (Of which we tried the Bus Turistic and had very few problems ).Also as was replied to a previous review... do ask for a light key for your room
title: Decent hotel, quiet location

review: After looking dir a Good central hotel we found this hotel .We nice help staff , they even allow us stay longer until 19:00 for extra 40€.Room for 3 people was big .comfortable. Breakfast was nice .Location is perfect .
title: Good Surprise

review: About two blocks from the Ramblas and a metro station. Staff not that friendly, but usually responsive. Great breakfast provided. Rooms are small w/no view except of the open courtyard "shaft" in middle.
title: Great location, excellent breakfast, no view

review: Positive experience. A little pricy. Recommend a rental car, taxi or bicycle to get around. (A really, really long walk to the beach for wimps). We eventually moved to a less expensive hotel closer to the water and rented bikes near the water. Everywhere the food was great. Bring water (wine, cheese & baguette) in your small backpack. Lots of people...watch your wallet and valuables. Really nice hotel...pay for a great breakfast$.
title: Barcelona

review: The Condado is a three star hotel but in my experience it should be four star. There is nothing to complain about, staff were courteous and helpful even to us non Spanish speakers. Rooms were clean and bigger than I thought I was going to get. Breakfast was good as well, everything you need for continental and cooked. Breakfast was updated by staff all the time and I have to compliment the gent who looked after the breakfast as he never stopped cleaning tables and keeping the food at the breakfast table up to date. Also the reception was very clean and had fresh iced water for anyone to use. The bonus for us was the unlimited supply of bottled water in fridges on all floors. All I can say is thank you for a good stay, and thank you to the staff member who found my money belt.
title: Great Value Hotel

review: We arrived early but there is a room where you can store your luggage while you start to see the sites of the city ,The room great and and with being close to the Square you can walk down to the square (where you catch the hop on and hop off buses also other coach tours )the hotel is situated so it is a nice stroll to a lot of eating places etc.
title: Very handy to the "square"and close to plenty of eating places.

review: Room was clean and location was good. The front desk staff need to more customer service skills as everyone I ran in to came off as very standoffish and aloof. I was afraid to approach them to ask any questions because they seemed so involved with themselves. The one time I did ask for some direction, I was given a very curt reply. Overall, I would look for another hotel if you are going.
title: Clean room but very aloof front desk staff

review: The hotel is near in Plaza Catalunya, Las Ramblas, and the shopping areas. There's a metro station near the hotel Universitat station, which makes it easier to take the public transport. Basically, the hotel is not that big, but we've got junior suite room which is for me pretty big for 2 persons. The hotel is clean and their breakfast has variety of food you can choose from. The dining area is a little bit small especially when the area is full of guests. But all in all I will say that this is the place to stay if you want to be in the center of Barcelona.
title: Perfect hotel in the center of Barcelona

review: My young adult daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights to explore Barcelona before a great bike trip with Creative Catalonia.We then returned for one more night 10 days later and it was like coming home to family!!!The rooms are quiet with great double paned windows. We were on the 6th floor facing the street and I am a very poor sleeper.With ear plugs in, the street noise was barely audible until 7 am when the mopeds were operating- time to get up and explore this wonderful city by then anyways.The staff are very professional, helpful and go out of their way with their clients. Treat them with respect and a smile and the staff will reciprocate. Their manners are much more formal than in North America, but please don't misunderstand this as being "cold"- that is not the case.I like hot herbal tea before bed, so although there is not those facilities in the room( very common in Europe), I went to the front desk staff each night with my tea bag and travel cup, and they were more than happy to prepare this for me in their breakfast room.We always felt safe in the neighbourhood, and the staff are quick to observe the comings and goings at the front door as far as clients that are entering.The water bottles on each floor were a godsend as it was 35C for several of those days.
title: Wonderful hotel, just far enough away from the maddening crowds

review: My husband, Daughter, Son in law 2 year old grandson and myself stayed for 3 nights in March. The hotel was a short walk from the Central metro stop which was very convenient as we were using the Metro to get around the city. The rooms were not huge but big enough and they gave us rooms with an adjoining door so our grandson could wander in and out as he pleased which was great. The staff were very helpful. There was a buffet breakfast available but we chose not to have that. I would happily go back there as it was comfortable , clean , welcoming , well situated for getting out and about and ideal for a short stay.
title: Lovely hotel

review: Due to mistakes made with an original booking at a different hotel in Barcelona we found ourselves desperately searching for a place to stay. I'm so glad we found Akos Suite Hotel. We booked online at 10am, turned up at 11am and the staff went out of their way to get a family room available for us as quickly as possible. The rooms are big, beds are really comfortable, theirs a little cooker and fridge. We couldn't hear any of the rooms next door or above. Our twins preferred the little swimming pool on the 7th floor to swimming in the Mediterranean! I absolutely recommend this hotel.
title: Fantastic hotel. Very helpful and friendly staff.

review: We booked directly from their website, and with cheaper price than edreams/trivago et similar, we got also breakfast included. Hotel is very clean, positioned between Monumental and Sagrada Familia, well served by respective metro stations. Also buses connect it with center or Barceloneta. Breakfast was fine and relatively vary, and personnel was always kind and professional. Definetely to recommend!
title: Perfect and well positioned

review: It was very good. Every thing was ok for me.I got all information I needed. The team was professionnal.Thank you .Special congratulation for Pablo for his professional and helpful attitude. Coffee was free. I will come to Barcelona and to this hotel a second time thanks to you .Good luck and good continuation
title: Très bien

review: Stayed here for two nights after a cruise from Athens with Princess Cruises on Royal Princess.We took a taxi from the cruise port to the hotel which took about 20 minutes.Check in was quick and easy by a very welcoming receptionist.Our room was on the first floor, room was a good size with plenty of storage space very good shower.The air conditioning in the room was very good.Bed was very comfortable.We had breakfast on one morning which was good for 9€ each.Hotel is very near two metro stations.Our only issue was on departure when the lift was out of order, we were glad we were only on the first floor with two cases to carry down the stairs.We would stay here again if visiting Barcelona.
title: Post cruise stay

review: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Sant Antoni while visiting Barcelona. The room was comfortable and accommodated the three of us nicely. We very much enjoyed their breakfast each morning and the staff was friendly and helpful.
title: Excellent Barcelona Stay

review: The hotel is in a very convenient location, close to Rocafort metro station which provides great connections to the city and is directly next to a large and good-value supermarket, however make sure you check the opening times as we were surprised by what we considered quite an early close. Reception is open 24 hours per day, as the hotel does seem to be aimed more at business customers.We had one of the most basic rooms available and whilst it was comfortable, the kitchenette was so small as to be impractical for cooking anything more than an omelette. The room itself lacked natural light with only two small windows, and there weren't enough hangers in the wardrobes to be realistically useful. The bathroom was stylish with a surprisingly large shower. Everything was very clean, and the room was well-equipped with a TV and a Nespresso machine.
title: Great location, but upgrade your room if you can

review: The beds were decent. The bathroom was worn with rust and discolored tile grout. But it was all functional and very important for us...well working AC. The wifi however was painfully slow. A limit of only 3 devices was certainly an issue for us. As we had to take turns getting on it.
title: For one night, not bad. wifi slow but AC excellent

review: This is a modern well run hotel. The room was modern, air conditioned and clean with a comfortable bed. The Wifi wrks well and the hotel is only a short walk from the harbour and Las Rambla. The only downside is that it does not have a bar but I would certainly stay again
title: Overnight in Barcelona

review: The location of the hotel is excellent, it's nearby the port and the ramblas.we have an easier access to the metro and bus station, and also for a taxi.But we were disappointed about the cleanliness of the room: the stuff didn't do properly their job and our neighbors were so loud specially between 1 and 4am.
title: my experience

review: This is an okay hotel. Don't expect luxury but everything is clean and neatBe careful with the elevator, only 3 person can ride the elevator due to weight restrictions.Enjoy Friday & Saturdays the tapas bar in the lobby. It usually has music and it is very nice
title: Chich & Basic Barcelona Ramblas

review: This hotel was terrible. I requested a quiet room but I was given a room opposite where a music concert was playing until about 3am so I got no sleep on my first night. The windows are useless so you can hear everything outside. I moved to another room (after a lot of discussion) for my second night. In this room the aircon didn't work as the window was broken. I had to push a chair up against the window to keep it closed so the aircon would work. In this room you could hear chairs dragging across the floor in other rooms. One of the worst hotel experiences I've had.
title: Very noisy and not worth the cost

review: Great hotel. We felt very safe. Great location - especially if you're getting off or going on a cruise in Barcelona. Close to las ramblas and the ports. Close to other sites and good restaurants. 20 min taxi to sagrada.
title: Great / Safe hotel

review: Good location, quiet and clean room and friendly staff. You need to be let in to the hotel via an electronic lock which makes it feel safe. We were able to leave our luggage on arrival and departure. Easy walking distance to restaurants and metro
title: Good location

review: Had been here in June 2017 and the place was a nice cosy place in the heart of barcelona near La Ramblas Street. The place has an interesting decor and looks really good. The rooms are a little small but are quiet cosy. Only con is that they dont allow you to take the keys but there is someone at the reception 24*7. Had a great time there
title: A chic hotel

review: The pros: The lobby was cute and the location was fine. The hotel staff was very nice. The air conditioning in the room was good. The cons: I was on the 6th floor and the wifi was slow and weak. The water temperature in the shower wasn't consistent. All of a sudden it would get scalding hot or ice cold. There was a funny smell in the room.
title: Average

review: Although a bit tricky to find initially, it's location is great, just around the corner from a metro station, a short walk to La Ramblas , very clean, room was lovely, included a small kitchen area including a fridge, also a free safe, staff very helpful, you are able to leave your cases if you arrive early, or fly later than your checkout time, would definitely stay there again.
title: Perfect for our short break.

review: Chic and basic is exactly that- basic yet extremely chic and cheap! Perfect for a short stay at rooms are clean, comfy beds and well decorated. Lovely breakfast and outside area to have drinks- would definitely stay again
title: Does exactly as I says on the tin!

hotelLocation: C/ Cristobal de Moura 138, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
review: This felt more like a business hotel but was perfect for my two nights, three days of sightseeing. The area is unusual in that it's essentially residential, and not that close to transport links. There is a lot of graffiti around the area but it's more street art than tagging and some was quite good! My experience at reception was great, the lady was very helpful and took the time to explain the best things to do in Barcelona, which I found very useful. I upgraded to a junior suite at reception as it only an extra €30 a night. I didn't regret it as the room was large with 4 separate sections, a big spa style bath, two TVs, king size bed and most importantly a nespresso machine. The only thing missing was a balcony. Being on the ninth floor it was very handy to the 10th floor pool. The view from the pool is stunning and goes right around so you can see sagrada familia in the distance. I enjoyed sunbathing and reading my book there, the pool was quite small however. I got the breakfast which was €10 if you book in advance but not great, the meats were not high quality and scrambled eggs mushy. Although the parties were very fresh and there was a good selection of fruit. For €10 it's ok. The room was spacious and very clean, plus you can turn the air con up and down.Overall a great stay and I'd recommend upgrading to the junior suite.
title: Nice hotel for solo trip

hotelLocation: C/ Cristobal de Moura 138, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is located only a few blocks walking distance from Barcelona´s beaches. Although in a rather industrial aera no problem to walk. The staff of the hotel was exceptionel. Very customer oriented and friendly. This is true for the reception teams as well as the people servicing.
title: Great staff. Very friendly, quick and competent.

hotelLocation: C/ Cristobal de Moura 138, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
review: The location is the only thing lacking at this hotel. The building, rooms, food, pool, and roof are all very nice. You can take a long-ish walk to the beach and there is quite a bit of interesting street art nearby, but all the tourist spots require a walk to the metro and longer metro ride.
title: Beautiful property, not a tourist spot.

hotelLocation: C/ Cristobal de Moura 138, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
review: Arrived this evening and check-in was speedy. Room service order and wait is 1hr. We are unable to go on planned fancy night out because outfits are creased (suitcase). Such a shame hotel has no iron to offer. We will now on his birthday have no choice but to opt for a causal bar :(.
title: No iron

review: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Continental Barcelona! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The 24 hour breakfast/snacks and drinks were a plus! The rooms were a little outdated and could use some upgrades. The beds were very comfortable. We had two rooms with balcony overlooking all of the activity of Las Ramblas, but we were not bothered by any noise. Great location Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend!
title: Great Hotel on Las Ramblas!

review: Loved this quaint hotel at the very top of La Rambla. Only two minutes from playa Catalunya so getting Aetobus to there from the airport was so handy. Hotel is in an older type building, but that doesn't deter from its warmth, charm and friendliness. Staff always kind and helpful, theyd left us a bottle of cava in room on arrival and given us a decent room overlooking the patio at the back as they had promised in emails. . Our room 258 was a good size, had a lovely bathroom, a free safe and air con, plus s little fridge and micro were an added bonus. Free buffet was a lovely touch. Wine, beer, sift drinks tea and coffee, breads, yoghurt, fruit and a small selection of hot foods at all times was very enjoyable. Good breakfast for a city hotel too. Would definitely go back, great little hotel, lovely staff in excellent location.
title: Lovely hotel, great staff and amazing location.

review: Stayed hear for 3 nights my wife and I and the lad and his girlfriend. The hotel isn't the cheapest but worth the extra due to location which was 2nd to none! Rooms a little dated but nice. The 24 hour free snacks was a nice touch even though it was the same every night, microwave in your room with fridge. But the main thing which I've never experienced was the free BEER & WINE!!! fantastic! Overall loved our stay will be back next year for sure.
title: Great place to stay and the best location

hotelLocation: C/ Cristobal de Moura 138, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
review: Been to Barcelona before & we stayed at a hotel nearby so we already knew what to expect with the location. The area may not be the 'prettiest' however we preferred to be in the residential part instead of next to bland buildings - lots of street art & mismatched houses, love it! If that is not your thing, then use Google Maps/Street View prior to booking & stop complaining about location! We had our baby with us & felt safe in the area when we walked about.Only a few minutes walk to Metro / Shopping Centre / Waterfront - such a handy location! You're away from the bustle of city centre so it's quieter (but easy enough to get to).All the staff were really friendly & helpful, we honestly would have left them all a tip if we had any money left!! :( Hotel room was fab, very clean & spacious, even with our baby crib in it! Only issue we had was the people next to us were noisy for a couple of nights so it must be thin walls. Of course I cannot fault the hotel regarding how our 'neighbours' behave, but I suggest maybe allocating families together if possible?The swimming pool is quite small but did the job for us. Plus the views from the terrace/top of the building are amazing - 360 degree view of Barcelona and you can see the La Sagrada Família (& hear it ringing in the distance), fabulous! We felt very welcomed & was sad to leave! :)
title: Lovely hotel

review: You can hear noise from next room. Walls are not sound proof. Location wasn't the greatest to down town. The rooms are not clean all the time. Very dusty. The hotel breakfast was not good, no variety.
title: First time to Spain

review: Nothing to tell.Hotel is good central,lot of eat possibilities in the near area.Breakfast topStaff are very well,speaks a lot of languages,help in every situation.I can recommended espescially Karina.Thank you one more by this way
title: all was ok

review: After 4 days of being covered in sand on a beach I came into central Barcelona for one night for a friend's wedding which went on until 3:45 am so I wasn't in the room that much (but Gracias for the late check out!). I had to be near the Placa Catalunya for the wedding shuttle bus and this hotel is 1min walk away. It was also 5min walk to the cheap and efficient and frequent (every 5min!) airport bus. The staff were polite and helpful. The modern room and bathroom (facing onto a quiet lightwell rather than the busy Rambla de Canalettes) was spotless. The aircon and ceiling fan and safe were all in perfect working order. Upon returning to the hotel at 4am I admit to having more than a "snack" at their generous 24hr "snack bar" which is more like a full buffet. I slept through the official breakfast, but indulged in the snack bar again mid-day while sitting on their secluded courtyard terrace. For me this hotel was great value for money. The only thing I didn't like was eating off of paper plates with plastic cutlery, but I am NOT going to let that put me off of booking this place again for a city centre visit. Oh, security is really good too. Book this hotel...
title: Great value, great room, great location, great 24hr "Snack bar"

review: We stayed in Hotel Teatre Auditori for a week from July 16th 2017. We had a lovely experience during our stay. The Hotel was clean and rooms nicely made every day.The location is in a safe neighborhood, very convenient to several prominent attractions and walking distance from Sagrada Familia and downtown attractions, and to Metro as well. Also closer to the newer part of the town.The staff were very friendly. Karina and Anna were wonderful and Karina in particular was awesome. Karina was extremely knowledgeable, very pleasant, explained about several attractions, gave useful tips and was never rushed and always had a smile. She helped with booking several attractions and activities.The Air conditioner could be more powerful. We did not have breakfast there as there are many options close by. Overall, wonderful stay. Thanks for making our stay so comfortable.Mukta and Murali
title: Great place to stay in Barcelona

review: Great hotel, rooms are tight but very nice and classic place, friendly and very helpful staff, free buffet 24/7, including free beer etc!Very good location! Been there before and will go again!Thank you
title: Very friemdly

review: My partner and I had 3 wonderful nights here (room 602) The service from the get go was outstanding, could not fault it at all. The room was spacious and clean, and very generous with bathroom amenities. The room we were in had a small balcony which was lovely. The hotel has a gorgeous rooftop bar, with stunning views over Barcelona, and lovely cocktails (mojito) We also indulged in room service one night which again was delicious and couldn't fault. Breakfast also had a wide selection, and goes til 11. I can't fault the hotel or the staff. It was a wonderful spot, and very close to a few scenic spots. Highly recommend staying here.
title: A wonderful hotel

review: Not too central but only a 40 minute walk to Las Ramblas.Next to L'auditori and the national theatre. Room small as I expected, air con OK, internet good. Fridge good, bathroom excellent.Breakfast was basic but as expected.
title: Very good hotel - ideal for where it is

review: Renaissance is a 5-star Marriott hotel located in the center of Barcelona 10-15 minute walk to main streets and 15 minutes of jogging to the beach. Clean and tidy room with comfortable bed, fridge, pot and ironing board. Typical urban surrounding. Easy accessible WiFi. Quite confusing e-key causing a bit of problems in a lift and while opening room.Nice open restaurant at the top of hotel with panoramic views and nice snacks and bar offer. Tasteless breakfasts.Good wait staff, generally bad and chaotic front desk staff (late credit card charge after check out with no following information to the customer to be just as an example) with exception of Polish girl.Several small meeting rooms available in the basement. Several problems (i.e. faulty projectors) did not leave good impression.
title: Basic stay, couple of probelms ncountered

review: We have just come back from our vacation and we already miss Barcelona. We spent 10 nights in the city at the Theater Auditori Hotel at the recommendation of a friend. The staff was welcoming and friendly. The hotel is positioned relatively close to Torre Glories and Sagrada Familia. From Torre Glories you can easily reach anywhere in Barcelona with various means of transport, buses, trams and metro.From the hotel reception you can buy tickets for different tourist attractions.Karina Rut have been very attentive and friendly with good recommendations on tourist routes. Bedding changed daily and breakfast ok.The beach is about 25 minutes' walk away.We hope to return to the city in the future.
title: A nice holiday in Barcelona

review: I am a Premier Platinum rewards member and the service was awful. Our hotel room was over 75 degrees despite having them fix it once and requesting a switch to another room. After paying 165 K points and $200 in cash for 3 nights ! The breakfast was good but after multiple attempts I gave up on getting a cool room. I spoke with the director of engineering and he said it was fixed - not ! I received no Platinum welcome gift and the front desk staff seemed almost bothered at each encounter for change, information, etc. Overall I would probably not go back.
title: Great Location, poor hotel and service !

review: My recent stay was a mixed experience....very long wait to checkin/out..with the number of tourists checking in,usually in groups, 3 stations(one for elite members),the process is painful.Then u get an email days before arrival asking u to check in early...well ,when u show up at the tine,rooms are not ready until later in the day! Why do they bother to do this is beyond me,since they are not asking guests to checkout before noon.They do not have a restaurant.The bar serves some food,which is very good and the breakfast buffet is excellent. Service personnel were helpful.The rooms are very damp and there is little air circulation ...the windows do open partially. The location is excellent. They do have a roof terrace bar which I did not use but I believe the view would have been good.
title: Not up to standards

review: This hotel is very central in Barcelona in the old town near Las Ramblas, it has comfortable air conditioned rooms, a roof top pool and a good selection of buffet breakfast options.A ggod palce for a weekend in barcelona
title: Comfortable Hotel with roof top pool

review: The hotel is not on the Ramblas as the title implies . It's about 10 minutes walk off the Ramblas we where very impressed with the hotel the room we had was very clean and a decent size . The staff at the reception where very very helpful with assistance and information. Thank you for your advice and help
title: Nice hotel

review: ...then this is the place for you! Get ready to wait in the lobby, sitting on your luggage while rude, condescending staff lie to you about how long it will take for your room to be ready and you waste your day in Barcelona! Enjoy watching other frustrated tourists be offered no water or refreshments while the lobby plants get watered, and you wait for 3+ hours with misinformation and are held hostage because you must wait with your luggage and no porter is offered so you can enjoy the city. I've been treated with more grace and respect trying to get my friend out of jail. There are at least 5 other guests in the same situation in the lobby so thought I'd give everyone the heads-up that this hotel is managed with less courtesy and honesty than I have ever experienced as a guest. Stay away not matter how good the points deal is...save yourselves, dear reader!
title: Want to feel like you're at the airport at your hotel?!

review: We booked this hotel last minute at a very reasonable price and were pleased with the location. It is very close (less than 2 minutes walk) to the food market, where we walked for breakfast each day. It is also less than 2 minutes from Las Rambla and a short walk from the waterfront. The nearest metro station is also very close and allowed us to get to Park Guell very quickly with no train changes and also to several other main sites. Everything else was walkable. The rooms were clean, a decent size and had excellent air conditioning facilities. The pool on the roof is small but is just what is needed if you fancy a lazy afternoon on a sun lounger. Staff dealt with a leak in our room (which was the fault of those staying about us) calmly and quickly so that it didn't impact on our stay at all. Would definitely stay here again if I return to Barcelona.
title: Perfect location

review: Hi,We just checked in at Leonardo and the hotel location is so good. The lobby and personal is great. Our Room is big and well designed with comfortable beds. The thing that we do not like is dust in the corners.. Do not feel good at all
title: Good but not clean rooms

review: We really enjoyed our stay here, staff were very friendly our room was clean and tidy, loved the little terrace pool and bar Marco was excellent really made us feel welcome and made a great sangria, I work for the holiday Inn in Southampton and have been in the leisure industry for many years, thanks to all the staff,, expecly marcos,,
title: Great little hotel

review: We stayed at Hotel Curious for 5 nights. The staff were welcoming and friendly , and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was very small but your in Barcelona so we were hardly in it. It was furnished well and clean. The breakfast had enough choice for us and we even had the choice of an early breakfast on the day of our departure.The hotel is in a great location being just off Les Rambles . I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again when we return to Barcelona .
title: Great stay

review: Hotel Curious is located just west of La Rambla (lots of people walking), the main north to south touristy thoroughfare in Barcelona. The hotel offers a great breakfast with lots of juices and coffee options. The balcony we had overlooked the street the hotel sits on and noise was not a problem at night - the balcony doors were nice and kept the sound on the outside. The room was nice and modern. My only complaint is that we could feel the springs in the bed. Despite this, we had a surprisingly good night's sleep each night. I especially liked the light switches by each side of the bed that could turn on/off the whole room's lighting and also would control a table side lamp - very nice and thoughtful. The staff was helpful and friendly.
title: Convenient, Friendly and Great Value

review: As mentioned this hotel has a great location. Next to the market, gothic quarter, la rambla st, great dining options and snack bars. Bus stop was 5/10 min tops walk to and from airport. Price is fair and hotel is clean but it didn't wow me. We didnt spend much time in the room so we didnt care about the wow factor. Staff was friendly but the breakfast was just okay. Nothing exciting.
title: Good location Fair price

review: We stayed here for one night before joining our cruise and it suited our needs perfectly. The location is fabulous, right off Las Ramblas and close enough for us to be able to walk to everything we wanted to see. The street it's down caused us no problems noise wise. The rooms themselves are small, but we we weren't looking to spend a lot of time there, so that caused no problems at all. Beds were comfortable, and the hotel was spotlessly clean. What really made the hotel was the kindness of the staff. We were recommended an excellent restaurant by the man at reception, he booked us a taxi to take us to the port, and was always a friendly face. Even in just one day we got a real feel for the attentiveness of the staff at Hotel Curious. We wouldn't hesitate to return to the hotel if we ever return to Barcelona.
title: Excellent little hotel

hotelName: Alexandra Barcelona A DoubleTree By Hilton
review: Stay of 3 nights there. As HHonors Diamond you should be treated fairly. Unfortunately not at all. No welcome ! For breakfast the hotel do a segregation of HHonors member on the underground with a limited food and untasteful. Moreover the staff is far to be professional and spend more time to chat and joke than take care of customer. This hotel is not at all as Hilton level and should be removed from Hilton Group.
title: Very far from Hilton standard. A nightmare

hotelName: Alexandra Barcelona A DoubleTree By Hilton
review: We stayed from the 23-28 July at the Alexandra it was a good week, we love the hotel and it's location just off passeig de Gracia, just over €1000 for the stay, not bad value. The staff are very helpful, friendly and we got nice fresh warm cookies on arrival in the hotel. The bar downstairs is a great spot for chilling, relaxing and having a quite drink with some local food. We had a nice view over the swimming pool, it does get kind of busy but we managed to get sun loungers no problem. Only down side the cleaning ladies start early and they can be quite noisy and they feel like they are practically in the room with you.
title: Week away in Barcelona

hotelName: Alexandra Barcelona A DoubleTree By Hilton
review: Ideally located in the Paseo de Gracia in the Examplair district, this property was within walking distance to La Sagrada Famiglia , casa Battlo and the Liceu Theater as well as la Pedrera. it was a short taxi ride from Park Guel. Shops and restaurants all around. Staff was attentive especially Elena on the concierge level. During our trip to Barcelona, she became our concierge and suggested places to go and visit. In addition she was very attentive to our need during breakfast. Only complains would be that the in-room mini fridge was not very cold and that the parking was extremely tight. Sergio, the doorman/bellhop was helpful as well and directed my husband in and out of the tight parking lot. Overall a nice stay in a basic but well appointed hotel. Will definitly recommend it.
title: Great location in the Examplair /Paseo de Gracia

hotelName: Alexandra Barcelona A DoubleTree By Hilton
review: Perfectly located just outside the Old City section and just down the street from Sagrada Familia. Boutique hotel with friendly service where they answered all my questions and helped me get around Barcelona. The rooms were a combination classic and ultra modern.
title: Great location, with exceptional service

review: This hotel is in a great location, less than a block from the Metro and close to hundreds of shops and restaurants. The breakfast was very inexpensive and had many great options. The room was quite large with a balcony. There was a minifridge perfect for storing cheese and jamon purchased at the market. The room and hotel itself were very clean and quiet. The WIFI was very reliable.
title: Very nice hotel in excellent location

review: The Hotel Actual is unusual for this fashionable area for being a reasonably priced 3-star establishment. As such it is a perfectly satisfactory place to stay if you do not mind eschewing extravagant luxury.Bedrooms and bathrooms are fine as is the WiFi.The hotel has no garage but there are many car parks nearby - just be wary of the prices.Also bars in the area often close quite early during the week at 1:30 a.m. If you want a drink later catch a taxi to the Passeig del Born. Otherwise the location is excellent.
title: A Cost-Effective Hotel in a Smart Part of Town

review: Standard 3 stars hotel with very good location in the city center. Parking place a little bit far from the hotel. Slow internet connection.The restaurant is closed during the day and night, only breakfast is available. But no problem as there is a plenty of good restaurants and cafeteries in surroundings. The room was clean, a little bit noisy but in general confortable.
title: Good location close to one of the most chic avenues in Barcelona

review: The two of us plus our alarmingly tall 13 year old checked into Hotel Actual last week and shared a room during our 2 night stay in Barcelona. It's kinda dinky and the welcome at reception is pretty cool but the beds were comfortable, the room was clean and everything worked. We're not undecided about the modern trend to zip single beds into a double. Somehow we're always on the seam which feels a bit precarious but as somewhere to sleep in between touristing, it works.
title: Small but it worked for us

review: Stayed 3 nights for the last weekend of June as a couple. The hotel is modern with a coral and the sea theme running throughout in furnishings etc. The style is attractive and quirky. Upon entering, reception is also in the communal area which is where breakfast is also served. I found reception to be friendly and very accommodating. We arrived very late and were assigned a ground floor room which I was told could not be changed that night. Unfortunately we slept very badly due to pavement noise and dustbin lorries etc. Asked at reception early the next morning and were given a 3rd floor room facing away from roads etc. RoomsThe room was comfortable with a large bed complete with a very thick mattress topper so sleep was excellent. The room was fairly basic but modern with all that you need, good power shower, air con. etc. BreakfastBreakfast was very busy but we chose to sit in the outside courtyard with sofas tables and was cool and quiet. Food was fairly standard with a nod to Spain with tasty Spanish tortilla and also tomato pulp to spread on your toast. Bikes We hired two bikes at a cost of €15 per bike per day and a €50 refundable deposit from the hotel. It was a great way to pedal the cycle lanes along the coast and through the quieter parts of the city. Area The area is away from the city but fairly near (10 mins) walk to the hive of activity which is the beach. Great for cycling and walking for many miles before breakfast. The city is also easily reached by foot through the Parc de citadella to the Gothic quarter and beyond. Would we stay here again? Yes in the summer because of its position to the sea. But would stay more city central in the winter to be in the hub of shops culture etc.
title: Modern and quirky

review: Very nice hotel, with a great rooftop pool. Unfortunately they for some strange reason have chosen only to put 4 sun beds there! And then tons of sun chairs which are impossible to lay in. A shame for an otherwise nice pool area. And it open at 10 first! So forget all about a morning swim. The pool get very packed doing high season so move fast if you want a spot by the pool. Rooms are nice and metro close by.
title: No sun beds - an no morning swim

review: Very welcoming and helpful staff , lovely indoor and outdoor spaces to relax in, small but well appointed rooms, great breakfasts and good coffee at the bar if you need one to keep you going.Being away from the main tourist area was a bonus for me as was close enough to walk to most areas or catch transport and was not crowded. Having the beach so close was great too to go for a walk or swim and the big local park was lovely to wander around in. The area felt fairly safe even later in the evening and would stay there again if came back to Barcelona.
title: Great place to stay

review: Very Modern hotel at an extremely fair price. the location is defiantly in a much more local then touristy area though which can make you trip a lot more fun depending on what you are looking for. The beach is a quick jog away and fantastic cafes are on almost every corner. For your more laid back travelers this is a perfect stay.
title: Great Stay, Great Value

review: The hotel was very nice. I liked the location because it was close to downtown but you couldn't hear the noise. The restaurant was good it had a nice breakfast buffet. I would totally recommend this hotel to people visiting Barcelona.
title: Good hotel nice service, and a nice location.

review: We stayed 4 nights and loved the location. Great restaurants nearby and just a short taxi ride away from the Gothic Quarters and La Rambla. The hotel offers breakfast at a cost. Loved the quiet outdoor patio!
title: Great Hotel

review: Location, location, location!!! Large, clean, updated rooms with excellent amenities. Very friendly and helpful staff. Small gym has limited exercise equipment but serves the purpose fine for vacationers. Excellent new spa and sauna facilities.
title: Nice stay at Catalonia Ramblas

review: Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff. The room was luxurious and the afternoon chocolate was a lovely treat. Pool and roof terrace were hidden treasures that we thoroughly enjoyed. Would highly recommend this hotel and will be returning on my next visit to Barcelona.
title: Lovely stay with friends

review: The stay was okay. It wasn't particularly great nor bad. Our bags weren't held when we checked in despite this being promised when we arrived an hour early and the check-out was a little sluggish, but our bags were held there so that we could go into the city a bit before we had to go to the airport. Would not strongly recommend or disrecommend visiting. Location is great.
title: Okay

review: Thought quite expensive as didn't include breakfast! View of a wall from our window, room 10. Bit disappointing but we were not in room that much! Good location. Air conditioning good. Very clean and good amenities. Taxi rank just up from hotel, so handy for airport (15 mins away, 30 euros for four of us. Would recommend Restaurant Ca L'Estevet, which we found through trip and it was only 5 mins walk. Wonderful Catalan food. We also had the best ever burger at another restaurant 5 mins walk in other direction called Bacoa. There is a little takeaway breakfast place over the road (4 euros for a croissant each and a bottle of water!), but there are loads of cafes to eat a substantial continental breakfast in, in every direction you turn. We paid about 35 euros for coffee, juice and croissants for the four of us in a cafe, whereas it would have cost 70 euros at the hotel. Drinks by the pool were reasonable. The hotel is very big, that's why I felt it impersonal. Would recommend though.
title: Great position, lovely hotel, but a bit impersonal!

review: We really enjoyed our stay here. Only regret was we didn't spend enough time relaxing by the pool as we were so busy exploring Barcelona. The room was very clean and comfortable (great bed) and it had a good size bathroom with excellent shower. We caught the Aerobus T2 from the airport to the Place de Catalonia and then took a five minute walk across the square to the hotel. The hotel is situated slightly away from the square so when you enter you escape the hustle and bustle of Barcelona into a little oasis! Even the pool area feels quieter and calmer even when it's busy. Personally I would have liked a bigger pool but it was fine for a gentle relaxing swim. We had breakfast across the road at a great Spanish cafe as we only wanted coffee and croissants so we didn't eat in the hotel. Overall a very enjoyable stay.
title: Lovely hotel, excellent location.

review: No late check out even for an extra half an hour. Zero value for money. Bad location. Inefficient staff which was not helpful. Very poor overall. I would definitely not visit the hotel or its chains in the future.
title: Scam

review: Last week we stayed for a couple of days for holidays and we could relax after a non-stop visits to Barcelona museums and places. This hotel is perfect if you want to make a break at your staying in this city. We could enjoy its swimming pool which was perfect after a tired day! Staff was not only very helpful but also gave us advice where to go or what to visit. Room big and very comfortable specially its bed. Everything was clean and breakfast was very tasty. We recommend it!
title: A relaxing place in the middle of a great city

review: The room was very clean. Great breakfast. Perfect location, quiet, close to the stores, restaurants and the metro. Friendly staffs, specially Veronica, always willing to help you! They scheduled all our tours, it made it easy to just enjoyed our time in Barcelona.
title: 30th Anniversary

review: Something went wrong with our booking through airtours but the staff at Belmoral let us sleep over one night and have breakfast buffet before finding our booking the next morning. Strongly recommend the hotel! Really nice room and breakfast buffet on top of that.
title: Exceptional staff!

review: It's a very good hotel staff are very accommodating Veronica is very helpful. The place is near the centre just 20 min walked, metro is also accessible, as well as the bus, the hotel is clean and the breakfast is very good . I will stay here again when we go back to Barcelona
title: Nice Hotel on a very nice location

review: Very good location, near to the diagonal avenue and near the best stores of Barcelona. Rooms are very confortables and the attention was very good. Maybe the breakfast need more options. Very clean and all the people working in the hotel are very kindle.
title: Family trip

review: We had a great experience at Hotel Balmoral. Lovely spacious, modern clean rooms. No issues with anything. Great location in the city for us, close to Diagonal metro station. Hardly heard anything from other guests. Perhaps the roof terrace could benefit from allowing food & drinks out there but honestly in a city with as much to do as Barcelona it was no hardship. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Fantastic Hotel!

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: Our family enjoyed a wonderful 5 days in Barcelona, and we loved our stay at the Sheraton Four Points. The hotel was wonderfully situated and provided easy access to all the tourist sites, while giving you a "Local" experience in their emerging neighbourhood. The surrounding restaurants were excellent, and within a few minutes walk from your room. While the rooms are modestly appointed, they were clean and perfect for resting at night, and parking suitcases during the day while you explore the city. Lastly, the staff was excellent! Front desk, waiters etc... were all interested in making our experience positive. I was very happy about our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend time touring while visiting Barcelona.
title: Great Value in Barcelona

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: Can't say enough about the great team at this hotel. They offer helpful advice and impeccable service. As always, the room was spotless and comfortable. Great value for Starpoints, too. The location is outside of the main attractions, but is an easy walk or taxi.
title: Fantastic stay and staff!

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: The shore is only a few minutes away. There is a great deal of food options down the road. The staff was really great. We really liked the bar, the bartender was very nice. I will stay here the next time I am in town.
title: Great Location

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: The front desk staff is so very accommodating and went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful experience! They were lovely, spoke English and helped with tours and information. The hotel is a 15 min walk to the beach, close to great restaurants and public transportation.The rooms were comfortable and very clean. I would definitely stay here and recommend this hotel to others.
title: Superb Staff, Great Location

review: I think this hotel "made" our stay in Bacelona. This was a splurge for us, but might be pretty basic for others. The staff was always outgoing and helpful. The location was perfect. I am of limited mobility and can't walk long distances. This was our first trip abroad since I became thus, so planning was a bit stressful. I communicated via email with the staff in my also limited Spanish several times before the trip. They were very patient. My English interpretation of their Spanish-language emails seemed to tell me that they were reserving TWO rooms for us.
