Check in staff when we arrived was very friendly and helpful. We had a courtyard room, not that we really used it as we were out and about a lot. Large room, very comfortable beds. Breakfast excellent. Restaurants across the road on the top floor of the Arena for tapas or absolutely delicious tapas restaurant called Bodega Monumental a 5 - 10 min walk away. Would stay here again because it was a little out of the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas in a quiet street. The pool, although small, is a bonus.
title: Recommend

review: Centrally located! Close to every sightseeing spot (Sagarada, parc guell, las ramblas,....). Very clean, staff very friendly & available! Highly recommende for either families or couples and even a group of friends!
title: Perfect location and great service

review: WiFi doesn't work! But cleanest and personal pretty cool! And at all, my staying be like good, but for a business trip i can't recommend your hotel, because internet it's very important part of service!
title: WIFI

review: The Ofelias hotel is great for a quick trip to Barcelona. It is in a lovely area, and it's about a 30 minute walk to the gothic quarter. There is a lovely roof top pool with really comfortable sunbeds. But you need to get there early because space is limited. The reason I didn't give it an excellent was because we paid to have the breakfast 1 day, thank goodness we didn't pay upfront for the whole week. It was Disgusting! The coffee is from a machine and they have cold eggs on a plate with a bit of cheese and some salami. There is also no bar here, which was fine as there are so many to choose from in the area. The beds are uncomfortable and gave me a bad back because they were so hard, but we managed a good night's sleep. We would definitely stay here again, without the breakfast, it's a very stylish boutique hotel.
title: Lovely hotel

review: This hotel is stunning and I loved the location. It's situated very close to the metro and many tourist attractions are a short walk from the hotel. The rooms were clean and the customer service was a 10/10. All the employees were very helpful.
title: Beautiful hotel, nice location

review: Great hotel within walking distance of the centre of Barcleona and really close to metro station. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was lovely and clean with good size rooms and free wifi would def recommend
title: Fab hotel

review: Stayed here for a long weekend break. Breakfast and restaurant staff are the only saving grace of the hotel. Inexperienced and poorly trained staff. No concierge service, no maintenance staff over the weekend and we were told no senior staff over the weekend if something was to go wrong, like it did in our case. I am not sure how they assessed this hotel to be 4 star! There are better places to stay in Barcelona for the price we paid. I would not recommend this hotel.
title: Travel lodge pretending to be 4 star!

review: When we first arrived we were offered a dark room on the first floor with only one window facing the lobby. Fortunately we were able to switch to a much better room on the 5th floor. The room was very fresh and clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The only thing missing was a wardrobe to put cloths in. Nice roof top terrace, although the pool is tiny. We never tried the breakfast. Instead instead we chose to eat at some cafes just around the corner. Great location in the old gothic quarters and very friendly staff.
title: Nice hotel in great location

review: I would recommend this hotel. The rooms are clean, dark at night, and comfortable beds. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The only negative is that the rooftop pool is very small and cold. But I would stay here again.
title: Excellent Choice of Hotel

review: Nice hotel right in the heart of the gothic quarter. Comfortable rooms with decent sized bathroom. Staff are excellent and always willing to help. Convenient cafe in the foyer with very reasonable prices. Would stay here again if I visit Barcelona.
title: Gothic quarter

review: We arrived at the hotel this afternoon a little frustrated with things (not related to hotel) after having a few issues with the airline, missing bags, delayed flights etc. Xavi (hope that's the spelling) turned the mood of our trip around by being super pro-active on getting my partners bags back from the airport and arranging delivery and finding several awesome little ways to make our trip more enjoyable and the experience exceptional. Very impressive customer service and the room is really nice (opted for upgraded room for 20 euro, well worth it), loving it and looking forward to a couple of nights exploring Barce!
title: Wonderful customer service - Xavi

review: Stayed at this property for a business meeting. Good comfortable rooms and a good location. Great views of the city including Sagrada Famillia and Casa Mila. The restauant staff was very helpful in customizing the food menu. Pleasant stay.
title: Stay at Condes De Barcelona

review: I went for a drink in the middle of the afternoon on the weekend. Excellent service, great space in the top of the hotel and a really original menu in that white box. The prices a bit expensive, however the view is great and really nice if you have a good weather. I'll go back!
title: Roof top

review: We stay here 4 nights and I must the location is great, the rooftop pool and bar great, the pool is small but cosy with great views.Our rooms while they were big they were very tired in need of an update. We had and executive room and yes it was big but with atrocious views to the back of buildings and construction works, mixmatch furniture one small round table with one very dirty chair and one wall desk with a small desk chair all this in a big room, the bathroom was big and practical.I guess we were unlucky with our selection so choose carefully and inspect the room before check in.The lobby is great skip the downstairs restaurant go out for eating and drinking as u a r surrounded by great restaurants and tapas bar.Recommended with caution.
title: Great location

review: Having looked at this hotel as a potential wedding venue some 7 years back it was a nice surprise to see it pop up when searching for a hotel for our trip this year, albeit now with two kids in tow. The location is fantastic and the buzz of Paseig de Gracia and neighbouring streets made it an easy selection for us.Due to a last minute flight change we added an additional night at the start of the booking for which we had to book a suite. This was located on the 7th floor underneath the restaurant. The room i have to say was dated, no bigger than a normal room in most cities and aside from the terrace area was just average.Based on the fact that the next 4 nights would be in a standard room i was worried what we would find. In fact the standard room had been renovated and was more comfortable, clean and welcoming than the suite. It did have a smaller bathroom and obviously no terrace, but the room itself was far more to our liking than the suite. Our only moan about the room was that the fridge is actually a vending machine with a touch screen, meaning a our young daughter kept ordering items that on check out, they didn't refund, even though they were still in the fridge and more importantly we were not able to store any milk, fruits etc in the fridge for the kids, not at all practical for anyone let alone families. That said the baby cot was waiting for us in both rooms which is always a nice relief!Another reason for choosing the hotel was the pool, although small it offered a nice opportunity for the kids to cool down mid afternoon, unfortunately it was so cold that even our superhero obsessed son was only brave enough to last 5 mins and our daughter and I didn't even brave it at all. Its such a small pool it can't be difficult to maintain temperature control.We didn't dine or drink in the hotel and as mentioned there are some great outlets close by including a little mini mart and a Costa for the coffee junkies.I would stay here again but for the cost it certainly wouldn't be our first choice.
title: Overall good but left just a little underwhelmed

review: Hotel is ok kind of, location is not bad but not a walking distance from attractions. Rooms are quite small and breakfast is very basic. I would explore another hotel if I go again to Barcelona. It has 2 elevators, one was down during my entire 3 days stay. Staff are quite helpful with good English communication
title: Feedback

review: All we can say is : very good service. Very good location , excellent service from the staff. We will come back again sometime. But the bar closes way to early. (22.00) that is the only negative thing i have to say
title: Very good hotell

review: We were recommended this hotel by a local friend. Reviews on Trip Advisor were very good. 1. It was easy to get from the airport by the R2 train and cheap £102. Reception Staff were helpful and welcoming.3. Room clean, roomy and airy. Basic furniture. It would have been nice to have a comfortable chair to sit on. Room reminded me of an upmarket Travelodge.4. Good selection of food at breakfast but staff not really focused on customer service e.g. to help, explain the routine etc5. Wifi in bedroom was very poor. Three times we contacted reception and despite saying it will be sorted it still was not working. Very frustrating!6. The fridge in the room was locked. 7. No complimentary drinking water in room.8. No complementary biscuits.9. Lifts were slow and the one by front desk a bit temperamental.10. Great location with Metro and Train nearby, also just for walking.We paid £202 a night for a basic room and breakfast. I feel the 4* +extra rating is overstated. This is a basic 4*. a bit overpriced and disappointing overall.
title: Great Location but little niggles!

review: We spent a week here and had a lovely time. The staff were all so kind and helpful and the breakfast buffet really great. The swimming pool is small but still very pleasant in a quiet courtyard. The hotel is ideally located for local attractions and near the metro. Really good value for money and a lovely place to stay.
title: Lovely hotel and wonderful staff

review: Excellent location, walking distance to many attractions, shopping, restaurants, transportation in a very safe neighborhood. Friendly staff always willing to help. Beautiful rooms with luxurious bedding and toiletries. Attention to details and decor.
title: Very nice hotel

review: I've stayed from 28th July till 2nd August. The reception staff and all of them there at Hotel Balmes are really very friendly and professional. Big thumbs up to everyone. I love the chocolates that you leave in my room everyday after you cleaned. The hotel is actually 3 min. walk to the metro station Provenca which serves 3 lines. If you love walking this hotel is walking distance to most of the landmarks, you can actually google them :).My only complain is you can literally hear everything in the hallway and the rooms next to your room. Also if you are booking a single room be ready that it's really small but bathroom is amazingly big though.I loved my stay! Hope to stay here again next time I visit Barcelona..
title: Very friendly staff and hotel is centrally located.

review: Location, location, location! And the best mojito in town..... close to the best Barcelona has to offer.....mwah. Next door to El Born. Recommend hiring a e-bike as the cycle tracks are awesome and the quickest way to get around town, though the clime to park Guell is a bit steep.
title: Close to must see's

review: The hotel is in a great location just a short walk away from a metro stop and surrounded by bars and restaurants. The rooms were quirky and clean. Loved the lights everywhere are the stairs felt very grand. The biscuits and coffee were an excellent addition and overall the hotel is excellent value for money! Would really recommend staying here!
title: Very Interesting Hotel!

review: We have just returned from a great weekend in Barcelona to celebrate our 45th wedding anniversary. The Hotel is in a great position on La Rambla. We got a free upgrade on arrival and our room was specially decorated with balloons and heart shapes on the bed. A very nice touch. The room was good. On the third floor with a small balcony looking out on to the main strip. The staff at the hotel were excellent. Extremely helpful and very friendly. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Barcelona and would book again on a return visit.
title: Great Hotel

review: An amazing hotel; there was nothing basic about it! Chic and Basic have absolutely nailed it.The location is brilliant - and I loved just sitting on the balcony watching Barcelona. The tapas bar below was very good and the hotel is exactly where you need to be.The decor and style are breathtaking and the touches like free water, coffee and open areas are very generous and welcome.The building itself was very special. In the room, the furniture, bed, shower and all the things in the room made for an excellent stay - ut was almost a shame to leave the hotel to venture to Barcelona. Although we loved Barcelona (3rd visit) we looked forward to going back to this hotel.We stayed in the bar late onto the evening, where the staff were very friendly, helpful and really professional.I would not even consider anywhere else in Barcelona - straight back here and I do hope I can go again.
title: Everything! Location, staff, facilities, even the ethos of Chic & Basic!

review: Arrived at the hotel only to find out i had lost my passport on the way! The receptionist was very good to me and gave me directions to the local police station to get a statement so that i would be able to fly back home at the end of my stay! The room was lovely and clean and the bathroom was amazingly big (room 414) On my last day i arrived at the airport and they would not accept the police report so missed my flight! Was very distressed and decided to go back to the hotel! They were very kind to me and managed to book me in to another room! Gave me the address for the British Consulate and was very helpful! I would like to say thank you to all the staff and i'm hoping to come back in September but will hold on tight to my passport next time!!!!!!
title: LOVED THIS HOTEL!

review: super hotel, everything on your doorstep, its ideal for a weekend city break, spotlessly clean, efficient friendly staff, and very relaxed! staff are wonderful at giving directions and advice, highly recommend.
title: great weekend break

review: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and the staff at arc la rambla made it an incredible experience. They upgraded us to a suite as soon as we checked in. They truly made it an unforgettable experience. Any time we had a question or needed advice on site seeing tour or even as simple as restaurant recommendation, they were so friendly and always happy to help. We would definitely stay there again when we return to Barcelona!
title: Amazing experience

review: Perfect location for accessing the harbour, beach. metro and the many places to visit. Staff were very helpful and friendly. We arrived at 11.45am and thought we would have to wait until 2.00pm but they gave us our room straight away. The room was comfortable, clean and exactly as expected. We really enjoyed our stay.
title: Good location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes 322 - 324, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: An absolute pleasure to stay at. Spacious luxurious and very comfortable. Could not fault this hotel. Professional and friendly staff and exceptionally helpful. Clean and tidy. Very modern with large bathroom
title: Above and beyond

review: Very good hotel in great location. Reception quick and effective. Room clean and spacious, big bed and well layed out. 10 minute walk to La Ramblas and Gothic quarter. Roof top bar spectacular 360 views. Breakfast was adequate, had better, had worse. Would stay again. A pleasant experience.
title: 2 night stay in City

hotelLocation: Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes 322 - 324, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Daniel and Joesp were helpful whenever we had a question or needed service and always pointed us in the right direction when we needed to know something. They always showed an interest in our needs. They made traveling so much easier which is a big bonus when traveling in a country where you may have a language barrier. The staff at the Ayre Hotel Gran Via is the best I have dealt with in a long time and I have gone every other year since 1995 to Europe. The hotel also has a great locaction for airport transportation on the Aero bus.
title: Best hotel staff of any hotel of the we visited on our trip.

hotelLocation: Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes 322 - 324, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: The best hotel in this way...near the underground great position for everything! Near there are the arena with inside a lot of attraction and restaurant also the magic fountain! The stuff really kind , available for everything ..every time! Also the breakfast so generous and there are a lot of type and differently food!! The room really comfortable, biggest and really clean every mornings the stuff getting the room so cleaner! I'm very pleased to this experience in this hotel! I will come back in the next time...sure!
title: GREATFULLY HOTEL!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes 322 - 324, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Traveling with family (including kids) we reserved a Junior Suite in the Ayre Gran Via. The room was great, lots of space and clean. Breakfast was quite good and totally worth it. We will definitely try to book this hotel for the next time!
title: Junior Suite

review: Great stay at a cool hotel. Good location close to Las Ramblas and 20 minutes from Port Vell. Clean hotel with friendly staff. Comfortable room made into a triple. The lighting could be improved in the bedroom area. Superb 360 view from level 11.
title: Barcelona Raval

review: Hotel less than 10 mins from Ramblas not really a swimming pool more like a paddling pool taxi rank outside so easy to get to beach helpful staff except at Buffett breakfast would definitely class hotel as 4 star
title: Three day break

review: Hotel situated 10 mins walk from La Rambla and metro. Room clean & comfortable although lacking drawer space. Need anti-slip mat for shower. Roof terrace has spectacular view but plunge pool and sundeck area nowhere near adequate for number of guests. More info needed in room on how to operate equipment eg lights.
title: Gaudi Experience

review: The rooms in this hotel are very luxurious and the staff are really friendly and helpful. The roof terrace bar is a great place to sit and have a cocktail and gives great views over the city. The location is great for the town centre and Las Ramblas. You can also walk to the beach in half an hour, which is fantastic. and has plenty of places to eat and drink.
title: Lovely hotel

review: Stayed 4 nights with my daughter. The hotel is impeccably clean, modern with all the amenities we needed. The staff were always helpful and spoke fluently in English. The location is just perfect for exploring the Gothic Quarter, and the beach and local metro (underground) stops were within a short walk of the hotel. Locally there are some great places to eat, I would recommend Momo just round the corner from the hotel and Benedict to the rear of the hotel does an awesome brunch! As with any hotel in a major city there was some street noise but just people not traffic. There is graffiti all over Barcelona and this includes the streets near the hotel, but at no point did myself or my daughter feel unsafe, even returning to the hotel at night. I fully intend to return to this hotel, it is an absolute gem!
title: Perfect!

review: Booking: hotel websiteTravel Type: family travel with teenagersLocation: Gothic quarterRoom Type: triple, double, and single roomStaff: very friendlyBreakfast: it's cheaper to get a breakfast from bakeries that are very close to the hotel Accommodations: free wifiConclusion: will stay again
title: a nice small hotel in Gothic quarter

hotelLocation: Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes 322 - 324, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Very convenient for transport to & from the airport (100m from bus stop). Nice modern clean hotel. Very quiet considering it is just off a main road. City bus tour pick up point only 100m & some attractions on the tour within walking distance of the hotel. Staff were very friendly & helpful. Good breakfast buffet & lite bite cafe. Although it is 2.5km from the centre we walked in each night (taxi back approx 10 euro). Room was spacious with excellent bathroom facilities (walk-in shower, no bath) & good wardrobe space.No tea / coffee facilities in room
title: Weekend Break

review: This is a very comfortable boutique hotel in the Gothic Quarter. A seven minute walk to the metro in either direction. Lots of good restaurants steps from the hotel. Great for exploring the Gothic Quarter on foot. Comfortable beds (but only twins). Professionally run. The buffet breakfast is pricey, but you won't be disappointed by it. If you prefer something less elaborate, there are bakeries within a few steps of the hotel. I read the reviews that complained of a sewer smell on the first floor. There is a slight smell. I only noticed in passing through the lobby and sometimes in the elevator. It didn't really bother me. Excellent AC. Balconies. The street below can be noisy at night, because the street is lively and the block is narrow. The hotel is owned by the NH chain, but the name on the front of the hotel is Hesperia (so you don't confuse the cab driver).
title: Great stay

review: Location is perfect, in the heart of Barri Gotic. Rooms are super clean, we stayed there for five nights towels were changed every day and they even changed the sheets. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Would recommend and definitely come back.
title: Hidden gem

review: I called in the evening (before 10pm) to ask for more pillow as they are really uncomfortable. The staff Suhil blamed me for not calling earlier and told me she cannot give me pillows because she is the only staff in the hotel. I was upset by being blamed by such unfriendly hotel staff and asked if I could self-serve and she couldn't understand English at all and started yelling on the phone. How much worse can hotel service be?
title: Ruined my stay in Barcelona

hotelLocation: Pl Paisos Catalans, Estacion Barcelona Sants, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed in July at this hotel. This is a modern hotel that is centrally located in Barcelona with quick and cheap access to all important places. The neighborhood is great bustling with activity all the time. The views from the hotel were great (Montjuic). With a friendly staff and a great ambience (Star Wars theme), this is a place I highly recommend.
title: Centrally located great hotel

hotelLocation: Pl Paisos Catalans, Estacion Barcelona Sants, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: The room was small, and corridors were not air conditioned.The hotel entrance is beside the train station station and the hotel is just above the station.Bathroom was really small. Beware, they charge kids above 2 years as adults, and it was not mentioned their policy on website. Book through barcelo.com to get 5% voucher to spend during your stay.
title: Average

hotelLocation: Pl Paisos Catalans, Estacion Barcelona Sants, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: We arrived by train from Granada so the hotel was basically in the station precinct. We used the Metro to go into the city of Barcelona you just walk next door. The room was large, bed comfortable. Breakfast is included in the booking. The dining room is large and food excellent.
title: Barcelona

hotelLocation: Pl Paisos Catalans, Estacion Barcelona Sants, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: Accommodation was great bed very comfortable . The room itself was clean. We have had a good start to our holiday. It was right next to the station which was invaluable to us. Especially as we were taking the first train out of Barcelona.
title: Hotel

review: Stayed at Smart rooms for a long weekend to see the city. Very happy with the service, rooms and location.Very friendly reception giving advice.Rooms were basic but clean and beds were comfortable.Lockable cupboards (free) for suitcases.Location was in a residential place with a Metro station at top of the road (8 mins walk). Felt secure at hotel area after hearing all bad thing about crime in the City.If I went back a I would stay again, no problem.Tip.... If you go to top of road, turn Right, walk 25 mins down hill you will come to old bull ring which has been turned into shopping center, a fantastic palace of the arts building and the old Olympic stadium.
title: Smartrooms lodgings

hotelLocation: Pl Paisos Catalans, Estacion Barcelona Sants, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
review: If you need to catch a train or need access to the airport you can't beat this location. It also has metro access to visit anywhere else in the city. It has a space travel theme that is kind of fun and the rooms are modern and appointed very well with clever space saving concepts in mind. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the hotel bar service was great with the bartender going over and above to look up a special drink my husband ordered. The one and only downside was the noise between rooms..the floors are wood which make them clean and look nice but it sounded like the people upstairs were moving furniture round all night and we could hear every door opening from the hallway outside as well.
title: Great hotel above the station

review: When you are in Barcelona for 5 or more days and you need a decent place which doesn't break the bank.... Smart Barcelona is your MUST choice! Staff is super friendly, beds are very clean and comfortable, everything is new and tidy! Breakfast is a must, really all you can ask for a 7 eu bfast. Really great place, glad we found it!
title: A gem of a place for every tourist

review: Stayed at Smartroom last night.Good location especially for an overnight before traveling from Barcelona Sant early departure.Clean and neat as a pin no doubt.BUT- Paper thin walls so you hear every movement from rooms either side and above. Light sleepers beware. Also if you are larger than a thin short model - you will battle to fit in the shower cubicle let alone wash yourself. The smallest shower I have ever had the misfortune of using.Something needs to be done urgently to address these two issues or there will be no returning guests.The staff are great and very helpful
title: Very Modern and Reasonable - but....

review: I am baffled at the 5 star reviews of this hotel. I only stayed here one night because my Airbnb place was not ready until the next day. I was shocked when I opened the door and saw a room that only fitted the bed, I felt like I was in a cage, window opened to the wall on the other side, there was nothing in the room, they take minimalistic to a whole other level. I was thrilled to leave the next morning, I think I would cry if I had to spend my whole Barcelona stay in that cage of a room.
title: very small utilitarian room

review: You get what you pay for here, although money doesn’t go very far in central Barcelona as a rule! The family room (and hotel in general) appears recently refurbished, and is clean, comfortable and modern, if dormitory-like and functional rather than inspirational. The Hotel location is reasonable; it’s a 5 minute walk to the local Metro station, which is a relatively short ride to the more trendy and touristy parts of town, and is very well located close to Barcelo-Sants overground train Station. It’s also a 25min walk to the Camp Nou Stadium for the football-obsessed. Breakfast is not included (an extra 7€ per person). I wouldn’t return here for the “experience” but this is about as pleasant as cheap (sort-of) and cheerful gets. 4/5
title: Delivers what it promises.

hotelLocation: Placa de la Rosa dels Vents, 1, 08039 Barcelona, Spain
review: Having been to the W Hotel on a number of occasions in London I was expecting a lot.Reading about this fantastic rooftop bar and pool area, things where looking good!How wrong I could be! As you walk into the hotel it looks fantastic although a little busy with 15-20 year olds running about taking photos, but that was as good as it got.Lighting - Cheap Blue Lighting making the place look more like a grotto than a up market bar Floor - Worn out grey concrete Bar - Relatively little atmosphere, with large areas roped off with nobody in the bar????Music - Dull and when you don't have a full bar I would probably go for something a little more up beatDownstairs there was a massive party at the pool which looked great and I can imagine it to be an ace day out around the pool! Perhaps a bad evening for them, but just not what was expected
title: W for wishful thinking

hotelLocation: Placa de la Rosa dels Vents, 1, 08039 Barcelona, Spain
review: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights after 1 week at a hotel in central Barcelona. It was like a second vacation. The views from the rooms are amazing. the rooms are very fresh and spacious. I had 2 rooms, Wonderful and Fabulous rooms. They were exactly the same expect one (Fabulous) had a view of the beaches (north) and the other (Wonderful) had a view of the harbour. The breakfast is average and I expected more of live cooking.There was many children under 10yrs that filled the pool. It was funny to see the pools as deep as 1.16m for an adult targeted hotel. Pool service is very good. The food is good and there is a good selection of restaurants below the pool terrace. You will have short access to the sea and the towels will be handed to you.Good choices of dining and night life. Eclipse is the place to meet others and drink.
title: A hotel with amazing views

hotelLocation: Placa de la Rosa dels Vents, 1, 08039 Barcelona, Spain
review: This place just has it all - great rooms, super friendly staff, awesome breakfast, amazing pools, best spa in the area, right at the beach ... it is really one of my favorite w hotels ever. They also really know how to pamper an SPG platinum member. And all very reasonably priced compared to other luxury hotels in the area. Just book!
title: My favorite hotel in Barcelona

hotelLocation: Placa de la Rosa dels Vents, 1, 08039 Barcelona, Spain
review: I've had a great pleasure to visit my favourite European city during NYE celebrations, more so by staying one of the nights at wonderful W Barcelona. This is undoubtedly a landmark of the city, a place to be. Note, that W is a bit "different" 5*, and it doesn't have to fit everyone's needs and desires. As long as you know what to expect from this quirky brand, you'll enjoy every single second at W Barcelona. Everything was a highlight for me, thus I'm not going to describe all the stunning services but I'd like to mention two of the best moments during our stay: Waking up in the bed while watching the open sea and sunrise; Views, service & quality of the food and beverages at the rooftop bar Eclipse.It's a bit of a (pleasant) walk from the closest metro station or Las Ramblas, but taxis are also a great option - very reasonably priced in comparison with other European cities. If you are more of an explorer, check the schedule of the public bus which stops nearby.Can't wait to savour W Barcelona and its services again during the summer season which is definitely the best time to enjoy everything what this stunning hotel has to offer.
title: It can't get any better...

review: I enjoy it the staying in this hotel was very good, front desk are very helpful and very friendly.. there always there to help you any thing..I highly recommend it to any body who is not looking for fancy hotel but some clean hotel in Barcelona
title: Front desk very friendly

review: I've visited during the MWC confrence but even taking that into account, chatging the price the hotel charged was shameful.Other than the nice location near the segrada familia and the truly pleasent staff, the hotel is not a reccomended experience.Rooms are tiny, built in a way that makes them extra uncomfortable, lacking in some basic elements you'd expact, not even a kettle.It looks, feels and is old, as if time froze in the early 80s, and breakfast tastes as if it was made then.Too bad - nice team and in hotel that leaves much to br desired.Eoukd only reccomend if the price was VERY low, and in MWC it was not.
title: Basic got a new meaning

review: We enjoyed it to the fullest. Breakfast was delicious with many options and Cava; rooms tidy; terrace excellent with great views of Sagrada Familia. The hotel is few steps from the subway. We recommend it wholeheartedly!
title: Great location, wonderful terrace, nice room

review: Loved this hotel. Room was clean and functional with a nice bathroom. Our room was on the front, second floor, but was very quiet, and had good air conditioning, much appreciated during the hot weather. Very walkable area, about 15 minutes to Placa Catalunya, and 5 minutes to Sagrada Familia.
title: Clean, friendly, budget hotel close to bus station and Familia Sagrada.

review: Loved my stay here, the beds were super comfy and the breakfast was devine. Loved the espresso machine in the morning! Rooftop bar with a fabulous view of Sagrada and the staff were excellent. Recommend if you want somewhere centrally based and well air conditioned!
title: Quiet, clean, central hotel!

review: Awesome location, comfortable king size bed, amazing selection for breakfast. Very good service from staff. Highly recommend. Reasonable rates. Second visit to Barcelona with family. No tea coffee facilities. Free WiFi. No swimming pool but could use the gym pool next door.
title: Clean, friendly with location

review: Great food, beer, and friendly service staff. Wonderful location and always comfortable sleep every night!! Truly wonderful hotel. Several restaurants are nearby as well as great views of Sagrada Familia!!
title: Cool stay in steamy Barcelona!!

review: Good hotel, would recommend this to anyone as has got good links via metro into main centre of city but is much quieter. We got free upgrade to a room with view of sagrada famillia by lovely receptionist for our honeymoon, great views.
title: Great stay July 2017

hotelLocation: C/ Lope de Vega, 141-147, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
hotelName: The Level at Melia Barcelona Sky
review: Absolutely loved every minute we spent at this resort. The location is perfect. Close to the beach and also to the city. The hotel is separated into two sections. They have the Melia which is downstairs lounge and the lower levels. The Level is the 5 stars hotel with an amazing 25th floor view and a fine dining restaurant!Do not miss the breakfast! I wish I could have that breakfast forever. The breathtaking taking view, the personal chef, and the huge selection of drinks/foods are amazing.They also have a swimming pool located on the rooftop. It is not heated. They also have a really modern gym and spa. If you book this hotel, you will never want to leave !!
title: Touch of luxury-with high standard breakfast!

hotelLocation: C/ Lope de Vega, 141-147, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
hotelName: The Level at Melia Barcelona Sky
review: Cannot fault this hotel in anyway, my wife is very particular and she loves this hotel she wont hear of going to any other and we have been to a few, but this one stands out I must say I was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience from check in to check out. The customer service and the staff the facilities the room, breakfast the Merkado the views from the level overlooking the city and sea were all well worth it. Definetly looking forward to our next visit. Keep up the good work !!
title: wonderful experience !!

hotelLocation: C/ Lope de Vega, 141-147, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
hotelName: The Level at Melia Barcelona Sky
review: I travel for a living and I promise you a great time too. hotel is not in the middle of the city but close by metro service and staff awesome, Cristina is the best (by far) she goes above and beyond to help you with everything. Many thanks Cristina.
title: What a great time

review: The H10 is great location in the gothic quarter Hotel is clean and comfortable, breakfasts fine and friendly staff. Many tapas bars can be found within a few minutes walk. La Rambla is about 5 mins walk. Ocean is an easy walk through the Gothic quarter streets
title: great location

hotelLocation: C/ Lope de Vega, 141-147, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
hotelName: The Level at Melia Barcelona Sky
review: Perfect 4 night weekend in Barcelona. Stayed at The Level 26th Floor with a city view which was absolutely stunning. It overlooked most of Barcelona, and you could see Montjuic castle, which lit up at night, as well as a beautiful sunset every day. Amazing service from the moment we arrived, from all the hotel staff as well as The Level staff. A special shoutout to Paramjot from The Level for his outstanding and efficient service, a very warm, friendly and helpful person. If you are stuck on where to go for the day or night, he has excellent recommendations and advice. The hotel is in a perfect location if you are pro-active and want to make the most of your time in Barcelona. Closest metro station is Poblenou which is a 5/10 minute walk away, and tram line is right outside, which takes you straight to cuitadella park behind the main beach area. The metro station takes you straight into the main areas of Barcelona too, very easy to navigate, similar to TfL. Lots of small bars and good tapas restaurants around the hotel, a short 15 minute walk to one of Barcelonas nicer beaches, gives you a chance to look at local shops on the way, less touristy. The hotel facilities are high standard, spa is quiet and peaceful, perfect after a long day of exploring. Pool is a beautiful, relaxing area, always plenty of loungers and helpful staff around, and good back ground music. The Level has free snacks and drinks (alcohol/non alcohol) throughout the day until 10pm, which was a nice touch. Breakfast was fabulous, lots of choice and stunning sea views with the sun rise. Overall, excellent hotel, I would not stay anywhere else if I was to visit Barcelona again.Many thanks to all the staff.
title: Long weekend girls trip

review: My wife and I had planned a four day visit to Barcelona and chose the H10 Raco Del Pi on the basis of its central location. We were a little wary of being able to sleep at night knowing the Spanish (and Catalan) love of late nights and being in the city centre. However the hotel turned out to be a real gem. Clean and comfortable, with modern decor, our room was very quiet and we had no disturbance at all despite being only a few minutes walk from The Cathedral, La Rambla and myriad bars and restaurants. Being able to walk to many sights was a great advantage and when we traveled further afield (the Sagrada Familia and the FC Barcelona Camp Nou Experience) the metro ride was only 20 minutes. The only downside is that being in a pedestrian zone taxi access can be difficult .... our taxi driver dropped us off at the nearest main road and we had a five minute walk with our bags to the hotel. The staff were attentive and friendly and check in and check out was no hassle. The welcome glass of Prosecco was a nice touch. We have stayed in many hotels around the world and whilst this was certainly not the most luxurious, it rates as one of the best value for money options we have found. On our next visit to Barcelona, we will definitely be staying here again.
title: Barcelona's best kept secret ?

hotelLocation: C/ Lope de Vega, 141-147, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
hotelName: The Level at Melia Barcelona Sky
review: A last minute three-night booking and a flight delay saw us arrive at stylish and contemporary 'The Level Melia Sky' at about 1.30am on a Wednesday morning, so unfortunately missed the opportunity of checking in at the bespoke 'The Level' reception desk, albeit the standard Melia Sky reception on the ground floor was perfectly agreeable and the reception team wide-awake!We were allocated a sea-view room on the lowest of 'The Level' floors (20th) with a bed comfortable enough to accommodate a great night's sleep. Beyond the black-out curtains was a lovely morning view with a distant sea outlook and an urban landscape below. The room was of average floor space with a rarely used bed-end sofa and occasional table taking up useful space but looking good on the room spec'. Room cleanliness was good, but on two of the three full days housekeeping omitted to clear used coffee cups, milk cartons and all-importantly to me replenish the Nespresso coffee capsules which was disappointing. Calling to ask for some in my boxers wasn't on the agenda. The location of the Melia Sky was debatable having previously stayed in the heart of Les Ramblas (Hotel Bagues), it is in a far more remote residential location meaning if you're looking for sightseeing this isn't a good bet, but for a great selection of local bars and restaurants and a non-tourist adventure it fits the bill nicely. A taxi rank is outside the door and 12Euros gets you to Les Ramblas in 20 minutes, a taxi from the airport at 1am to Melia Sky - 46Euros and a midday return to the airport 29Euros, with the journey taking around 30-40 minutes.Albeit a lovely hotel with great staff the location would mean a return visit to a more centrally located hotel would be preferable.
title: Lots of positives, but a few negatives...

hotelName: Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
review: the hotel is just a short walk from the Sagrada Familia, there is a metro station very near to the hotel which make it easy to reach the city center and old town. The rooms was comfortable and reasonable for a three star hotel. the staff was very friendly and breakfast was tasty.
title: business

hotelLocation: Placa de la Rosa dels Vents, 1, 08039 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed for 8 nights in July 2017. Big mistake. Really underwhelming and full of teenagers and early 20's trust fund kids.Genuinely, the entire hotel works around the teenagers and their party schedules. It is literally just like a big glass youth club disco. If you are a grown up, and get up before midday, and expect any staff to be doing anything, you will be seriously disappointed. During the morning the staff relax and have a break, because the trust fund kids are still in bed. We went to the pool at 8am on the first morning (the advertised pool opening time) and found clubbers sitting there, surrounded by empty champagne bottles, smoking cigarettes. There were cigarette ends in the pool. we decided to go to the beach.The decor is cheap and nasty, and the rooms are tacky. I hope you dont mind going to the toilet in full sight and sound of your husband/wife/etc...we had a 'cool corner suite' (tacky name for a tacky room - and at €1000 per night, faced a dirty old shipyard) and the toilet was just a glass box, about 3 metres from the bed. My wife was horrified.Several incidents occured during our stay which made us really question the running of the place. The Manager (you will see his very defensive replies on Trip Advisor - in fact he is known locally around Barca as 'Defensive Conor') is never to be seen. He is probably in his office writing defensive Trip Advisor replies.Awful place. Unless you are here to spend the trust fund on very expensive champagne, I would stay well clear of it.
title: If you are over 22, you will hate this place

review: Another very nice experience at the H10 Raco Del Pi hotel. We arrived several hours before check in and we had a short wait before our room was ready. The room and bathroom were very clean and a good size. The front desk and the ladies in the breakfast room were very friendly and always accommodating. The buffet was more than sufficient to get the day started. I can't wait to return to Barcelona and the Raco del Pi!!
title: Second time and still a charm

hotelName: Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
review: Cons: Old and smelly towelsA bit expensive for what it offers but that was still the cheapest I could find matching my budget and criteria.No minibar/fridge in the room.Smell of cigarette smoke from the adjacent room in our bathroomThere were sometimes cut offs in the Wifi connectionPros: Clean, quiet near the public transportation (Metro Clot)Helpful staff. The receptionist provided us with new, clean towels because the towels in our room were old and a bit smelly.The room has got coffee and tea facilities. There was a large glass bottle of mineral water in the room for free.
title: A good 3-star hotel!

hotelName: Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
review: Stayed 4 nights 2 rooms, positively surprised even after reading positive reviews on TA. Rooms were extremely clean, bathroom was great, service was good. Comfort rooms are smallish but okay, the Deluxe room (with Nespresso machine!) is great though and doesn't cost much more. Location is nice and cozy, and 2 minutes away is the Clot metro, at 1 EUR per ride anywhere in the city I would much rather stay in a quiet and affordable location. Sagrada Familia and the Glories Mall are easy walking distance, and there's also a bus we took to Parc Guell and the science museum. To the budget-conscious, you can get from the airport to El Clot Arrago railway station for 1 Euro using the R2 train and walk to the hotel, which we did on arrival and return. Wi-fi was super fast. The breakfast was okay when we tried it but most days we got some croissants and pastries from the several bakeries up Mallorca st.Had a couple of good dinners at the strangely-named "Glow Bar" a few steps from the hotel entrance.Would certainly stay here again on a next visit to lovely Barcelona.
title: Excellent hotel, metro easily solves location issue

review: This H10 is well located, but otherwise a very modest hotel. The staff were very nice and helpful. The location was great! The a/c inthe room was barely noticeable and the lighting in hallways and the room was extremely dim.
title: Solid Chice while in the Gothic Quarter

hotelName: Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
review: Excellent hotel, very good attention, rooms, centrally located, with possibilities to use the metro and bus, I recommend the hotel for its services, location, comfort, attention The metro that can be used is the red line and the bus 62 also take you to plaza catalunya
title: Family visit

hotelName: Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
review: Good hotel for a short stay in Barce. We had an issue checking in, we paid upfront for the room when we booked so the room was already paid for. When we checked in the 2 slightly rude girls on the desk said we needed the card we used to pay for security reasons to prove who we were despite having other cards in the same name & our passports this wasn't good enough for them. They said we couldn't check in without it so we had to leave our bags with them while we went into the city & waited for a relative back home to take a photo of the card and send it to us. This meant we couldn't use our room to freshen up after a long day of traveling. This was sorted later that day but some basic common sense from the hotel staff would have fixed this. Very stupid.Location is a little way outside of the city but good public transport links solve this problem. We got the train from the airport to Clot main-line station which is only a 5 min walk away. Also Clot has a metro stop with an entrance just meters from the hotel.The rooms are basic but nice for what you pay. Shops in the area for food and drink if you need any in your room. Bed was comfy & the was pretty quiet at night, our room faced the main street.
title: Good mid-range hotel

review: Very nice hotel breakfast was great sparkling wine with you breakfast more of a buisness hotel than couples but we had a great time as a couple It's In a great area near football stadium and near to tube station and nice bars near only a few stops from the strip It's worth a try
title: Sofia Barcelona

review: Hotel is nicely located in the middle of La Ramblas. You're within walking distance (less than 20 mins) from all the touristic sites. For those wanting to take a taxi, access to and from the hotel is very convenient. You have everything you can think of within walking distance from the hotel including a supermarket, 24-hour pharmacy, coffee shops, gift stores, etc. Hotel staff were super nice. Concierge desk was great in getting tickets for the different activities.
title: Great hotel right in the middle of La Ramblas

review: As almost all of the reviews have said, this hotel is in a great location. We had a problem though that negatively impacted on our stay. We had no hot water in our room for long periods (many hours) during two of the four days we were there. Sometimes we would let the water run and run, and it it would never get hot. At other times, no water whatsoever would come out of the hot water side of the faucet or shower. We reported this to the front desk staff several times each day and were always told the same thing: "maintenance is working on it." When I asked when it would be fixed, they said they didn't know. This made planning our days very difficult since we never knew when we were going to be able to shave, shower, etc. I understand that things break down, and that often it cannot be avoided. But the real problem was there was absolutely no sense of urgency. The front desk staff seemed like they were tired of people asking about it. And no one ever took the initiative to update us on the status of the problem, or when it would be fixed. The unfortunate way this was handled would cause us not to return to this hotel.
title: Great location - but had some issues

review: Barcelona was the last stop on our family summer vacation from Paris to Spain. We only had 2 nights in Barcelona unfortunately, but chose Le Meridian as it seemed like a good location.It is centrally located, but it's a bit too close to the La Rambla area. There were massive crowds 1/2 a block away and the area was loud throughout the night. It felt a bit like Times Square in NY. We did like La Rambla for shopping and to get a feel for the culture, but would have preferred to stay in a hotel a bit further away from the heart of the action.As far as the hotel, it was what you would expect in a traditional European hotel. Relatively nice, very small rooms, historic. It served our purpose as a central spot from which to explore, but I would not stay there again.
title: Last stop on a family trip from France to Spain

review: Nice clean hotel and centrally located to wide range of activities. The Concierge are very helpful and they can book you to any attractions you may want to visit. It is an expensive hotel to stay in with minimum facilities. Food is not great and I advise to have breakfast in any of the many of the cafe's nearby. I had a very bad experience with respect to my booked rooms. Triple room joining a double room at the end of the Hallway at the 3rd floor. Too much noise apparently was coming from the supermarket next door. There is a common wall between my room and the supermarket. I had five days of noise (rolling noise) starting at 3am. The hotel staff did nothing until I lost my patience on my last night when I heard the chiselling and hammering noises from next door. When I asked for the hotel manager he was very apologetic and offered me 2000 Starpoints (wow). It made me more angry.
title: Centrally Located to Shopping area and transport to most attractions

review: We spent 4 nights here and it was one of the best hotels I've been too! Fresh bedding and towels everyday, rooftop pool with bar, spa and gym. 5 min walk from the metro, 4 min walk to the bus stop. 5 min walk to the shopping centre and 10 min walk to the beach (all straightforward to get too!!) I'd 100% recommend this hotel to anyone who fancied exploring the city but also relaxing by the beach. I can't wait to come back here!!
title: Perfect location

review: Wonderful hotel. Perfectly situated in the heart of the action. Walking distance to all that is great. Clean and light rooms. Delightful and attentive service. Particular kudos to Monica who was of great assistance to us. Can't recommend this hotel enough.
title: Fantastic in every respect

review: Le Meridien is right along La Rambla, the popular shopping/restaurant strip in Barcelona. It's practically beside La Boqueria, a market with delicious eaterie and cheese and jamon shops. It's also right beside a supermarket (Carrefour). It's walking distance to Plaza Cataluna and Passeig de Gracia, where major shops are located. You can also walk around Barrio Gotica where you have small alleys with endless shops and restaurants. Despite being right smack in one of Barcelona's busiest sections, the noise didn't reach our room even if we were only on the 2nd floor. My only complaint was, we got a triple room and it was a bit too small. A king sized bed and a pull out bed. We hardly had space to open our luggages. When we checked in (check in time was supposedly at 3pm but the room was ready at 4pm), the third bed was not made yet and concierge told us it would be ready by 6pm. When we got back at 10pm, the bed was not yet made and I had to call reception again. It took housekeeping 30 mins to sort this out. Sadly, the pull out bed had only a thin mattress and was not comfortable at all. For the price, we expected proper beds.Aside from this, service at Le Meridien is excellent! Check in and check out were seamless and the staff is always at your service. Even the porters made sure your bags were attended to and kept safe, during check in and check out.Breakfast was delicious and had decent selections. They also have a section where you can specify how you want your eggs done.I would definitely stay here again. Best location when in Barcelona
title: Perfect location!

review: Our family enjoyed a relaxing time at this very clean hotel. The roof top splash pool and bar were a lovely touch. Good points: very helpful/smiling staff happy to talk in English, 5 min walk to metro, 10 min walk to sandy beach, safe and mini bar in room very useful, towels for plunge pool nice touch. Liked the toiletries. Mainly residential area so more relaxed than centre of Barcelona which suited us as a family. Easy to walk to Diagonal Mar which is a large shopping mall where there are lots of options to eat/drink/shop. We will be back.
title: Vincci Bit hit the spot for location, options of relaxing at plunge pool or nearby beach, metro, and shopping

review: Located by Diagonal Mar, Barcelona. Location-10 mins walk from the beach, close to Diagonal Mar shopping centre (5 mins walk). 10 mins walk to metro station where you can get a metro into Barcelona central. Plenty of restaurants located at Diagonal Mar.Hotel-Retro art deco throughout, staff helpful (reception & cleaning), rooms modern and clean, large shower cubicle. roof terrace with Bar and Pool, didn't use this but looked very good. Free safe, Wi-Fi, mini bar/fridge. TV (limited on English speaking channels). No problems, highly recommended.
title: Great location for weekend break.

review: Location is good, about 10 minutes walk to the beach and close to metro. Taxi cost us between 11 - 16 Euros into the city center depending on time of day/evening. Also the hop on hop off tour bus stops 5 minutes down the road which is great to get for sightseeing and costs 29 Euros for 1 day tour. First impressions of the hotel were good, the reception area is large and brightly decorated and very modern. Reception staff were always very happy and helpful, very informative about the local area and transport links. We stayed in room 322, no faults really. Comfy beds, air con worked without a hitch, plenty of towels available, room cleaned every day. The only thing I would add would be for more lighting in the room as there is only a few spotlights which wasn't ideal when we were getting ready but we managed okay. Breakfast was really good, so much variety for continental, English breakfast choices was average but I was happy to eat croissants and fruit. The best thing about this hotel is the decoration make sure you visit every floor to have a look at the different artists it really is fabulous. The roof top bar is great too, nice food and cocktails with a friendly service. The pool is small but okay for a quick dip and plenty of beds to relax and sunbathe on. We went Thursday - Sunday and managed to get a bed every day. I really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely be returning if I visit again.
title: Better than I was expecting

review: Stayed there from Thursday to Sunday, very good service , close to beach and all facilities of port olimpic. Good price for quality, better than the W and much cheaper.Avoid if you want to go city center regurlarly.Always go here when I am in Barcelona.
title: Best for week end

review: We arrtived around (12am )night (3 adults) my mom , my grandma (senior) and me .We had booked through booking.com after confirming that we could add an extra bed in the room ( as we booked it last minute) and we had to pick this area because it was near the medical conference. Anyways..., we were surprised that they had no available extra beds or any triplet rooms. We called booking and they said we had to deal with them they refused to help in the beginning...but after 3 hours of begging them because it was already night and my grandma had a broken leg they agreed of letting us sleep and a double room.The hotel is clean , big rooms the 3 of us slepf comfortably on the double bed (very comfy beds ) . near the beach. But i have to say its not recommend for families or elderly. They dont have lost of staff but they are very quick and responsive. Didnt try their breakfast . Near transportation. Also there a park and a mall near by.Quite area .
title: Not very helpful

review: I have had the most excelllent customer service experience and from a trainee too (Mario Guijarro). He was extremely polite and helpful when something got messed up with my reservation and got back to me very shortly while exchanging emails. I am very satisfied whit him and how he represented the company.
title: Excellent customer service

review: Our experience staying here from start to finish was really good. The check in process was pretty seamless and staff were friendly, helpful and professional. The room were stayed in was well presented. Overall we enjoyed our time staying here. Thanks
title: Wonderful Place to Stay

review: I have stayed here a few times with work but first time for pleasure. After a poor experience with another hotel in Rome the week before this hotel delivered the complete opposite with excellence all round. From the warm welcome on reception, to the attentive bar and restaurant staff, the hotel could not do enough for us. We had a lovely room with view of the sea and high quality bathroom. We enjoyed the city but also quiet time by the pool - shame it rained one day but we enjoyed ping pong instead outside getting a bit wet but it was fun. Food is great, lots of choice at breakfast and eggs cooked to order when requested. Love the food at lunch and dinner, always an option to choose from. Everyone always has a smile and is helpful, not one member of staff disappointed. Cannot wait for an excuse to come back. A really great hotel.
title: Wonderful repeat visit with continued high servicw

review: My husband and I went to Barcelona for the weekend. Arrived at our hotel at approx 2330.Check in smooth, drinks in bar, close to promenade and beach.Breakfast very well organised, plenty of choice and service great.Rooftop pool area, clean and plenty of space. Pool a little cool even when it was 34 degrees! Fine temperature after a swim.Choice of pillows on a pillow menu.Rainforest shower and separate bath, double sink.Close to bus stops to get you to centre. Take V21 for Sagrada Familia. Easy to walk around Barcelona.Very helpful reception staff, nothing was too much trouble. Late check out arranged, coutesy room available for freshening up. Booked at time to suit us. Reception staff and porter staff stowed and recollected our luggage. Could not fault this hotel except for miserable chamber maids not saying hello.
title: From start to finish we were looked after

review: Hotel is clean, beautiful and in good area near city center and shopping areas. Breakfast was quite large and good. Airconditioning kept rooms nice and cool. Safety was available in our room. However some problems appeared. There was just one towel in two persons room. Is it supposed that couple uses one same towel? And one day toilet paper was totally missing and we need to ask to get it. Nice hotel, but custom service needs improvement.
title: Allmost great hotel, but with some problems

review: Stayed at the Hotel Espana for 4 nights last week. Lovely hotel, road just off La Ramblas. We had a deluxe room with street view balcony which was very spacious. Can be a bit noisy if you like to go to bed early but wasn't a problem for us personally. Modern decor. Absolutely loved the rooftop bar, chilled but good vibe. Bar staff up there very friendly and great service. Didn't have breakfast or eat in the restaurant there so can't comment. Rooms were lightly cleaned daily. My only moan is the reception staff weren't very welcoming when we arrived, didn't seem friendly at all and always seemed to rush you when you went to reception.Overall great stay at hotel espana.
title: Great Hotel Stay

review: We booked this hotel and what a great choice. We had a nice room with a balcony out onto the street. It was a very quiet room. Despite opening the doors and being a minute from la rambles. Friendly helpful staff Lovely rooftop bar. Comfy bed.
title: Great hotel. Great location

review: The hotel is very nice. The onsite tapas place on the 5th floor terrace was excellent. The staff at front desk were very helpful.Location-wise, it is a short walk to La Rambla and La Boqueria. It felt safe for my family of 3 with a young child.
title: Great location

hotelLocation: Av Marques de L'Argentera 11, 08003 Barcelona, Spain
review: This is a sweet small unpretentious hotel in a great location. It's a short stroll to Barceloneta Beach and the historic neighborhoods. Great restaurants and bars nearby. Room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Bed was extremely comfortable. WiFi worked well.. Staff was helpful and friendly. We could not have asked for more.
title: Great Location Sweet Hotel

review: We booked the hotel for 5 nights as a treat for our first anniversary. We loved the location of the hotel. Just off a side street on la rambla. The architecture inside and outside the hotel was modern yet had a feel of age aswell. An interesting mix. Most of the reception staff were helpful. The pool bar staff not so friendly. The pool itself was very small and roof space was also minimal. Only room for 6 sun beds. The pool bar area was nice to sit and relax in the evening. A bit pricey for food and drinks on the roof terrace. The ground floor hotel bar never seemed to be open. We had a look at the menu for dinner but didn't like what was being advertised and so never ate there. Our room rate which wasn't cheap did not include breakfast either, we ended up having breakfast locally for very little. The hotel is in a central location for the busy la rambla, harbour area and for bus or boat tours also for local markets. plenty good bars and restaurants nearby. Cleanliness was a bit of an issue. The floor never seemed to have been swept all the time we were there although our towels were changed when needed. The room had a safe and hotel wifi was free. A bit awkward getting transport right to the front door for arrivals/departures as street has rising bollards.
title: First visit to barcaelona

hotelLocation: Av Marques de L'Argentera 11, 08003 Barcelona, Spain
review: Hotel easy to find, good for transport and walking round city.lots of restaurants and supermarkets nearby.room was quiet and comfortable, if a bit small. Pool on a the roof!food choice for vegans or vegetarians
title: Well positioned and friendly

hotelLocation: Av Marques de L'Argentera 11, 08003 Barcelona, Spain
review: Myself and six friends stayed at this hotel for 10 nights (10th-20th July). The hotel is in a perfect location to explore the beautiful city of Barcelona,within 10-15mins walk from the beach & las rambles. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The rooms were cleaned daily and the beds were very comfortable. Had no issues what so ever,will be returning next year.
title: Geat location,friendly staff very clean & comfortable

hotelLocation: Av Marques de L'Argentera 11, 08003 Barcelona, Spain
review: On our 12th trip to BCN we had a fantastic experience here. Interesting how a hotel can have such wide ratings. We never had a negative experience once there. The location is fantastic. Steps away from what I believe are many of BCNs best restaurants. Our room was modern, sparkling clean and had a monster bathroom which is rare in Europe. The staff were helpful so many times and we stayed 1.5 weeks with other friends who fully enjoyed it. The restaurant was exceptional in the evening, thou it's hard to eat there more than once when there are so many options within 3 min walk. The breakfast was extensive. The pool is small but has a great view of the city. The pool area was always crowded so seats were had to get. Start with a G+T in their tiny street patio before heading out each evening.
title: Perfect in so many ways

review: After being in Majorca without air con this was a very welcome place! The relief of a very clean & cool apartment was great! We had a one bed apartment. Lovely decorated and clean, cool & spacious. Kids slept on the sofa bed & Hubby & I had the king size bed in the bedroom. Huge shower in the big bathroom. Kitchen with micro, sink, fridge with very small freezer, enough for bag of ice! Cleaned and made up every day. Very quiet. Definitely recommend. Close to metro & supermarket
title: Brilliant room!

review: We stayed here for a 4 night break with our grandchildren. Rooms are very very comfortable , clean and Tidy with loads of space, beds were also very comfortable so we slept well. We all had breakfasts for 3 mornings during our stay, a very wide selection of food on offer.All the staff were very polite and helpful . Only downside is no late check out on rooms, so no where to shower if you have a late departure/pick up
title: FANTASTIC HOTEL/APPARTMENTS

review: We booked the hotel as we were taking my 12 year old daughter and we needed a separate room for her but didn't want to put her in her own hotel room. The apartment has the kitchen / table / sofa bed in one room and the bedroom with an on suite (the only bathroom). When we arrived, we were given our room keys and went up to the room. On the room door there was a 'do not disturb' sign. We knocked on the door, no reply. I opened the door to be faced by a man asleep in the sofa bed in the middle of the room. The staff at the front desk had given us the keys to an already occupied room!!!! I quickly apologized and shut the door, going down to the reception to get another key. I don't know if this kind of thing happens a lot, but it has never happened to me before and I was really shocked about it (the joke for the rest of the week was whether the staff had given our door keys to anyone when we were out!). The rooms are nice and we were very appreciative of the air conditioning. In terms of the kitchen, it's not very well equipped (there's no cleaning equipment, there's no large spoons or anything to stir food in the pans (we had to use a fork!) we had to go downstairs to get a corkscrew, tea and coffee wasn't replenished until the end of the four night stay (when they thought we'd left, cancelled our cards and locked us out of the room!) The overall impression we got was that you weren't really meant to use the kitchen. In terms of staff, the woman running the bar / restaurant deserves a pay rise, as she was lovely and the food at the hotel was reasonable. The solarium on level 6 has views over to Torre Glories, which lights up from about 9:30 at night. Location wise, the hotel is in a good location close to the metro (Marina) and the Tram and is in a quiet neighborhood. It's just a couple of stops into the centre of Barcelona. Overall, it was ok. We won't be rushing to book again anytime soon. They seemed very disorganized to say the least (giving us keys to an occupied room and canceling our keys before we'd left!).
title: Not the best of starts...

review: Rooms were huge, lovely soft bed with big pillows, soft sheets. Bathroom also more than big enough for two, with nice amenities, soft big towels. The area around was maybe not the prettiest, but a 15 min walk from the beach. Close to Marina metro and tram.Food from roomservice was good. Will try Capri by Fraser again if they have it at my next destination.
title: Modern, clean, spacious!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 559, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: We're staying here on in our Anniversary. Great, modern and good facilities. The staff are very attentive and polite. Good location for site seeing. Had a few drinks at the pool and the bar maid was really friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel for all visitors. The pool is very shallow, perfect for little ones however then you'd worry about them on the high terrace. Breakfast was good also has English breakfast items.
title: Lovely Hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 559, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed here recently pre-cruise for 5 nights and booked the suite. We were delighted with the size it was huge, we are members of H10 and were spoiled by the staff that were constantly bringing us gifts.....robes,slippers,chocolates, mints,bottled water, plus a cocktail for each adult, not to mention the nice glass of Cava as we checked in. The suite was spotless and the bathroom/changing room was superb with a huge walk in shower with rainfall shower head and additional shower head. Coffee/tea making facilities were in the room, a television in each room.After a busy day sight seeing the plunge pool and bar was a welcome sight. All the staff are helpful and friendly and Mrs Torres was lovely working hard behind the bar.Location was spot on because i think if we picked one of the other H10 hotels they were either a bit far out or right in the middle of main busy streets. Well done H10 Casanova and it's staff hope to see you in the future.
title: Great Hotel and Location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 559, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: The H10 Casanova lies within walking distance of most major Barca's places to be.If not, underground is 100 meters away (L1/L2/L4)Rooms are neat, well furnished. Ask for twin beds=>the room is a little larger, you'll lookat the inside patio ,offering silence at night.Bathrooms are spacious and clean.Breackfast is huge. Choice of large fresh juices, vegan, veggie, glutenfree range or whole US breackfast.Reception staff is really helpfull.The rooftop plunge pool terrace is small but refreshing.Great venue, stadting point to enjoyyour Barcelona stay.H10 prooven quality
title: Located really good/friendly stuff/ quality breackfast

review: Trendy modern yet cozy and clean hotel which is relatively central located. nice and helpful staff i asked for a room with a balcony and got a really nice room with cozy little balcony. Had two great nights of sleep at this hotel !
title: Cozy hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 559, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: We had a booking mixup, but they still found us a room, while chasing our booking agent in New Zealand to resolve the problem. The gave daily updates and solved the problem.I was that impressed I have joined their loyalty programme for my next trip to Spain.
title: These people go the extra mile.

review: We stayed 3 nights in this comfortable and clean hotel. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast....although the scrambled egg looked a little passed it's best, as it is kept heated under lamps. Sausage, bacon and beans. Cheese, meats and salad. Fresh fruit, croissants, pastries and muffins. There was lovely fresh orange, water, pineapple juice, tea and coffee. Cereals, milk and soya milk. There is also facility to print boarding passes or tour tickets. Also liked the convenience for transport.
title: 40th Wedding Anniversary

review: I stayed 4 nights in the hotel with my sister, everything was clean and we were sent to the room right away without waiting. the hotel staff was very nice and very helpful all the time. the noise can travel through walls so if you have noisy neighbors it will be a slight inconvenience. the location of the hotel was not ideal, a little too far from anything to walk, the closest metro station was a 20 min walk and if you take the bus from the station right in front of the hotel you will have to change the bus line at a few stops before getting to any major destination.other than that the hotel was fine.
title: Good hotel, unideal location

review: Accessibility was foremost for me choosing this hotel it was my second time visiting Barcelona and I would stay here again. Was quite happy that I did, and was in no way disappointed everything that was shown and mentioned on the site was delivered and up to par. Exceptional front desk and dining room staff. Overall my expectations were met and Petit Palace Museum will be hotel of choice. Keep up the good work hopefully in the near future I will be back.
title: Great Location

review: Stayed as a family of three for 4 nights. A lovely area, very safe, easy walk to the main sights such as la pedrera, casa batllo and further into la rambla and to the port/beach. The first impression was good, a nice welcome and a classy interior. Our room was large enough for us and seemed perfect for our needs. Bar and mini bar prices very reasonable. However, the beds were incredibly hard, to the point of all having a very uncomfortable and broken sleep. This, coupled with being in the room next to the lift meant we were also bothered by shouty residents coming back after a night out. The cleaning staff should knock before entering a room, this can be a little disconcerting when chilling after a shower! There was an almighty storm our last night so we decided to have room service which the information told us started at 7pm. Called down to order to be told they don't do it on Sundays!! Could have given that info!! It was a great area to stay and the hotel could have been wonderful but would look for alternatives for my next visit.
title: Nice hotel needs a few tweaks

review: We stayed for 4 nights in late July and I was very happy with our choice. Rooms are a decent size for what you pay, and our bathroom was big by European standards. Very clean, and the location of the hotel is in a great area, a little bit away from the dense tourist spots (though not too far away). Tons of great restaurants on adjacent streets as well. Also there's a very small terrace on the roof that we didn't discover until the last night, which was my fault because it was mentioned in the hotel welcome book in our room. I'd recommend this hotel to family and friends.
title: Clean hotel, great location

review: Me and my family were not expecing that the hotell was so nice. For a day trip in Barcelona the hotell felt very nice. The people behind the desk was friendly and helpfull. The room se had was larger than expected from the pictures. And the view for me was gorgeous Would go the when I take a trip back.
title: Suprisingly good

review: Great location just 10 min walk from Placa Catalunya, great spot to arrive on aerobus. Lovely staff, basic room was clean well lit and absolutely perfect as we really only slept there ( comfy bed) . Didn't try breakfast at the hotel, lots of local cafes .Would stay here again no worries.
title: Clean, comfy bed, great shower!

review: I found the hotel to be beautiful and pretty and in a great location. It was very clean and the room was quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful . I would definitely stay at the hotel again and highly recommend it!
title: Lovely hotel and friendly staff

review: We stayed one night in this conveniently located hotel. Although very quiet surroundings and plenty of nice shops, restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood. The hotel's staff was very friendly, the rooms clean and comfortable. A large choice in the morning for breakfast - nicely prepared and well organized.
title: Great location, nice staff and good choice breakfast

review: Possibly one of my favourite hotels to date... I could compare this to a boutique hotel... only for size.. the staff and knowledge of the concierge are second to none... breakfast although for some was inadequate , was for us perfect... not over facing..I love the al a carte aspect of this... and could not fault.. yes it's expensive.. but what you get for your money is justified In The area!!... if you are willing to pay for a 5 star hotel then expect nothing less than the service and facilities you receive... for relatively new hotel the experience is seamless and well worth its 5 star rating.. the rooms are beautiful,the linen immaculate and cleanliness superb...if you like the finer things in life please stay here, location is fantastic and staff are helpful to say the least!...
title: Fantastic

review: The location was fantastic, with cute little cafes nearby and shopping right at your door step. The rooms were very well appointed and it was easily recognisable that there was a high level of sophistication and attention to detail. I absolutely loved the gold/brassy decor and velvet that flooded the hotel! It was amazing how the windows in your room opened up, like a balcony. The bed was super large and comfy. The bathroom was all dark and glitzy, with an excellent rainfall shower.The staff were incredible also. I will definitely be returning! xx
title: Beautiful property, amazing staff with incredible attention to detail

review: We spent three amazing nights at The One Barcelona. From the check-in that was absolutely flawless to the food and the rooftop pool and bar, we could not have asked for more! The bellmen are absolutely great, with a genuine hospitality oriented attitude and extraordinary professionalism. The room was comfortable and classy beyond words. The bathroom is gigantic with great amenities. The bed is incredibly comfortable and they add a special touch by bringing you the number of bottles of water that you need, which is always appreciated with a 30+ degree temperature. The spa and the pool are great, while the gym, albeit small, is well equipped. The only minor dislike I had was with the pool/rooftop restaurant staff as I felt they were not at par with the rest of the hotel. The hotel is walking distance to La Pedrera and Casa Batlò. My friend and I like to walk and we had no problem walking from the hotel to the port or La Sagrada Familia. There are plenty of restaurants around and it's a very safe neighborhood. I would highly recommend to stay at this magnificent property, you will not regret it as it is worth every penny!
title: Outstanding Hotel & Amazing Service
