review: Excellent hotel, beautiful rooms and great service from all staff. They even had little touches that made it extra special! The location was fantastic and views on the rooftop were breathtaking! Free relaxing spa was another plus too!
title: Excellent service and hotel - it's the little things that count!

review: We stayed in The Mirror Barcelona from 7th till 8th of July. We were 8 people in total. We were returning customers from a stay in February.The check-in took 45 minutes, and all informations were given upfront through a booking form.The room service closed during check-in, so we weren´t able to order food. When we asked the personnel at the reception about take-away in Barcelona, the answer was no. I still do not believe in that.The rooms were nice. In the morning, we had a visit from a big cucaracha in the room. At the check-out the clerk at the reception asked us how the stay was. I said we were hungry on arrival, and the check-in took too long. We were not happy about the cleaning, as there was a big cucaracha in the room. A few days later we called in to ask for a leftover gadget. However, as it was charging in the bathroom, easy visible, it was not found by the cleaning crew.The normal compensation for a stay in a hip hotel like The Mirror would be to offer a week-end stay for free, however it seems like this hotel has some management problem.
title: Bad experience

review: The Mirror hotel is very different it is not called the Mirror for any other reason you are literally walking into mirrors from floor to ceiling it is quite amazing.The bed was to die for one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in in a hotel.The staff are very unique they are all dressed in black and white trousers waistcoat and hat very stunning.Good buffet breakfast with an egg man.
title: Amazing hotel

review: This is a very nice hotel, close to the metro. The design is special, the rooms are elegant and very clean. The restaurant offers you many choices, I was here twice and I will come back every time because I loved it.
title: Great hotel

review: This hotel is a wonderful, luxury hotel set in a great location. It is quiet enough for you to feel distanced from the hustle of the city life yet close enough for you to get a great breakfast and even walk to the city. We had a lovely stay here; our room was perfect! I have no complaints. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Amazing!

review: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mirror Hotel. The location is great....just five minutes to the next metro station and the neighbourhood Eixample is also very lovely! The room was good..very clean but not really comfortable, because everything in the room is white.... The stuff was really friendly and helpful. The best thing in the hotel is definitely the pool! You have a great view to the skyline of Barcelona.
title: Fantastic pool with great view!!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 629, Eixample, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: My husband and I have just returned from a week here; the hotel is in a great location for shopping and walking to all attractions. Unfortunately we didn't get the best experience as my husband was poorly and spent 3 days in hospital. However, we could not fault Hotel Indigo - spotlessly clean, lovely terrace, lush GandTs and fantastic staff - especially Isabella! Lovely place!
title: A lovely hotel, so clean, great staff

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 629, Eixample, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Indigo, it was a last minute choice to switch hotel because of advised from our friends to check other locations.Hotel Indigo is right at the center of the City, a few minutes walk to great shopping at Passeig de Gracia and all the major shops, a few minutes walk to La Rambla, and if you are up to walking, Sagrada Familia is walking distance, maybe 30 minutes walk, all the must see location are walking distance from the Hotel, There is a metro station nearby. Major upscale hotels but the area is less crowded.Service was excellent, as platinum members we had water and juices complimentary provided everyday, we got upgraded to a ground floor room with a terrace and big sofa area, perfect to relax, lie down and drink the morning coffee. The front desk was awesome, patient and always ready to help. We requested for a connecting room but after seeing the ground floor room we did not mind and it did not make a difference since they gave us adjoining rooms.
title: A Gem in the heart of Barcelona, perfect location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 629, Eixample, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: First off, I love this hotel. The staff is amazing and very helpful all around. The common areas and the rooms are spacious, clean, bright, and welcoming. The bar and restaurant are great, too.. I would stay here again in the future. There are a couple things that I think the hotel could change to make it a much more, a 5 star visit: Clean the pool area. We wanted to use the pool but not. Two occasions there was either a large party hoarding the pool OR the area surrounding it was dirty (full of dishes and generally a mess) from other guests, which detracted from the experience and caused us to go elsewhere. The AC in our room was ok.. it was hot while we were in Barcelona.. so AC was key in picking a hotel. The system in my room (119) was lacking and could not keep up.. even on high output. Also, the strange setup of the room where you enter the room to two other doors (one to the bathroom and one to the sleeping area) while nice because of privacy... was strange because the AC could not flow to the bathroom making it incredibly hot all the time. Other than those two things, which can be corrected, the hotel is great and I would recommend.
title: Great staff, great hotel, awesome location.. but...

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 629, Eixample, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Went to Spain on a family vacation, overall had a fantastic time and a wonderful experience in the country. Everything was great except for this hotel it was the only negative experience of my entire trip. Were we not so exhausted from our international flight upon arrival we would've certainly gone elsewhere. We paid extra to have a triple room, and there was nothing triple about it. With the extra bed put in the room it was nearly impossible to open the closet door, which was by the way the only place to put our clothes which was ridiculously insufficient. The air-conditioner barely functioned, blowing out almost no cold air. When we complained about this they tried to convince us that it worked perfectly which was a terrible way to handle the situation and a total shame. Located a few feet from our room was a cart of cleaning supplies. This made the entire hallway smell terrible, which was disgusting for any hotel let alone one of this supposed caliber. And for the icing on the cake, our room was filled with construction noise from some construction project which they supposedly did not know the origin of. Nobody got a good nights sleep while we were there. We wrote an email to management with no reply, clearly they do not care. There are plenty of other hotels in Barcelona. All of our friends who went to Barcelona stayed at other hotels that were at the same price point and had completely, much better experiences. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!!!
title: Avoid at all cost

review: Very helpful staff (before and during visit), knowledgeable concierge; Everyone understood our English. Comfortable room, good food, close to sites. The minibar was large enough to store our leftovers. The bus line and also the metro were close by.
title: An American and her daughter in Barcelona

review: 2 nights in this beautiful hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly. Spotless clean and very comfy. Parking on site and good breafast. 2 blocks from metro short walk to segrada familia. Would stay again !
title: Great stay! Central location

review: This Hotel is very central and we love the area, the staff are all very professional and helpful.We have been visiting Barcelona for the past 7 years and are happy to say that Hotel Dante has become like a welcome home family from all the staff and management who always go out of their way to make our stay comfortable.The breakfast buffet is outstanding serving a wide and delicious choice to suit all tastes. We would highly recommend this Hotel for a stay in Barcelona.
title: Home From Home

review: The hotel itself is ok. However for 150€, the room needs to be rennovated: old fashion wood. And no breakfast included for this price. Most important not helpful staff at all even if I am gold member of Best Western. In conclusion I dont recommend this place. You have another hotel in Front of Dante, 10 time better than that...please note the incompetent staff is the most important thing
title: Expensive and not helpful staff at all

review: pros: located just outside train/metro station, so easy transportation, clean, friendly staff, dining room on top floor with GREAT views (we only had wine and dessert--nice) friendly staff, allowed early check in, comfortable bedcons: room a bit noisy facing train station ( but we were happy to be able to check in early), hard to find concierge --couldnt figure out the hours or location
title: Good location, clean, nice hitel

review: Great hotel, central location, nice staff, cool rooftop terrace.... highly recommend it! And very comfortable rooms. We had a balcony which looked out to the square which was very nice :) Rumbla is just a walk away which is also good.
title: Stay at Pullizter

review: Very good hotel in a fantastic location, I liked the fact that we were given a few little extra's as we had booked using the hotel website. Superior room was excellent if a little compact but was very clean and comfortable with everything required. Roof terrace was also excellent with a good vibe, but very disappointing that on our second night it had been closed due to a private function, as this was one of the reasons to book the hotel, I did not give 5 star because of this. Front of house staff very good and friendly.
title: Great Location

review: I was expecting more for what we paid. Very cheap soap, shampoo ... Wasn't able to sleep from the horrible pillows. Too noisy. Can hear the people chatting on the room next to us. You can always hear The sound of the water coming through the water pipes in the toilet throughout the day and nught. Worst experience ever
title: Worst hotel ever

review: Great location - rooms at back perfect-exceptionally clean - cleaning staff seemed to take a genuine pride , perhaps motivated by wall mural of cleaning staff. Air conditioning worked well . Shower was excellent. Breakfast was really good. Layout was great and variety of foods available. Serving staff were great - attentive when needed but not in your face.
title: Ideal

review: An overworked and understaffed check in area manned by cheery staff. Bare minimum facilities. Noisy floorboards, no team making, no tissues, primitive vanity, just one blanket and dodgy power points. Even on the fourth floor the street noise from Ramblas is untenable all night long and despite double glazing. Good breakfasts in an pleasant dining room manned by efficient and good natured staff. Expensive for what it is
title: Disappointing - and noisy

review: Casa Camper Barcelona really is the perfect place to stay when visiting Barcelona. Not only is it in a great location, but the staff is friendly, efficient and knowledgeable; the rooms are modern, comfortable, spacious and clean; the breakfast is plentiful and delicious; snacks and drinks are available all day and the price is reasonable. There is also a roof deck, a gym, your own personal "lounge" including a hammock, free reliable wifi and an outdoor wall garden. If we make it back to Barcelona, this is where we will stay and I would recommend this property to anyone that will be traveling there.
title: Perfect place to stay in Barcelona!

hotelLocation: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 174, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: While arriving at the AIr BNB I was staying at, this location was down the road and was reviewed positively for the Brunch. We arrived and the place was busy yet they were able to seat the table of 2. The prices were reasonable and the bottle price for Cava was great.
title: Sunday Brunch

review: The hotel is in a very good location for walking or metro. The staff is friendly and there English is very good. The hotel is very clean as is the room and the bath. The cost of the stay is a great value for the money. I give this hotel an EXCELLENT RATING.
title: Excellent hotel

hotelLocation: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 174, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: We can´t no why this lovely hotel only have 3 stars, we want to put at least 4 stars to it!!!Good location 15 minutes walk from Rambla and Pl CataloniaVery good food in the restaurant, we eat the duck!!!Good breakfast in the morning untill 11:00We had a penthouse with a wonderful terrace.We will book here next time in Barca!!!
title: Very good in Barca!!!

hotelLocation: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 174, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Loved this place. Great breakfast. Great room. Great location too! Great staff! Pool was nice too ! They provided us with lots of great tips for visiting and dining in Barcelona! Don’t miss tapas restaurant nearby Platilleria
title: Wow!

hotelLocation: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 174, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Not cheap, at nearly €200 for the night I stayed, but I loved the hotel. It could be hard to find, the sign discreetly hidden behind some trees - but the staff are terrific (and have perfect English), the decor is imaginative, the aircon was a blessing, and there were ingenious touches - like having the aircon in the bathroom set to a higher temperature, and having a little motion-sensitive light by the toilet, so you don't have to turn on the light if you have a call of nature in the middle of the night. It had the most comfortable mattress I've ever slept on! It was so handy, too, to have the vending machine right outside my door. I liked my private balcony, and that the hotel had a pool.Cons: the price for the room, the price for breakfast (€15?!), and the fact that the crisps in the vending machine aren't heavy enough to activate the release mechanism of the machine, so you have to get someone from reception to rescue them! Oh, and the free WiFi was so weak that I turned it off, and used my own data.
title: Beautifully designed!

review: Stayed here for one night (pity) before going back home. The most expensive one I paid for accommodation in my whole trip but really worth every cent. Spacious room, proper bath room and quiet terrace. The hotel was just steps to metro and very close to main tourist attractions. It also only takes 5-6 minutes walk to Placa Catalunya for aerobus. If I would come to Barcelona again, I will certainly stay with Vincci Gala.
title: A perfect ending of my trip

review: comport rooms, welcoming hospitality, great breakfast.everything was at place. the hotel is really to a metro station, plaza Catalonia and the Rambla. there is a 24/7 marketplace across the street. most of the guests are 40+, so don't expect lobby talk.there's a hotel tax that is not part of the booking price. it's a small price anyways.
title: Great hotel & loction

review: Stayed here for 3 nights, once we walked into reception we had a great feeling about this hotel. We were too early to check in so on a recommendation of staff we went around the corner for lunch which was amazing!The room was large with high ceilings, MASSIVE bed and couldn't be faulted!I would definitely stay here again and will be recommending it to anyone that is thinking of staying in the area.Great location too!
title: Great hotel and staff!!

review: Me and my husband stayed here 21-24 July and we booked after reading others reviews. Hotel is great. Exactly as per the pictures on the website. Good location. Very closr to the metro which will take you to la ramblas in 15 mins. And you can walk to some other attractions within 20-30 Minutes. Theres a few supermarkets nearby and restaurants to choose from. Staff were very helpful at the hotel. Especially paula.
title: Nice,clean, safe, welcoming stay

review: We felt at home the minute we arrived :) we have never been treated so well in any hotel ! The staff are fabulous (Paula and Cesar were great), the rooms all have a personal theme that is fantastic and the breakfast was tasty ;) Can't recommend this hotel highly enough.
title: We felt at home :)

review: The Vincci Gala Hotel is perfect in many ways. Firstly the location in near Urquinaona is between the Old City with the restaurants, monuments, plazzas and shops, and the new city with the beautiful buildings in Paseig de Gracia, Casa Battlo' and Sagrada Familia. You will find yourself in walking distance to the Barcelona Catedral, Casa Battlo' and Casa Mila'.The service is very good with very professional people. A special thanks to Cristina, the Day Manager, that helped us solve a problem with our reservation.The rooms are very nice, clean and tidy. It really feels like home, to open the room door and smell the fresh air with no dust. Beds are well made and the mattresses are hard, but comfortable.There is a restaurant with a good offer in and I recommend the Jamon Iberico with Tomato Bread.All in all a great place to spend days in Barcelona.Recommended!
title: Perfect in Any Way

review: Well located, clean, very helpful and friendly staff. Only negative remark is related with window insulation to outside/ street noise during the night. Nice touch the free water/coffee/ tea in the lobby area.
title: Good stay

review: In general the hotel is OK. The people at reception are not very helpful, I called twice in advance to check on storing our baggage and parking and both answers were not very helpful (if you don't offer the service at least give another option. WIth the exception of Paula who went above and beyond to find transportation to the airport (taxi strike in Bcn) and Xavi who also was collaborative when they couldn't find our reservation and created a new one (I had an email with the number) the personal was not that helpful. We arrived driving from France with a 5 year old and many bags and they didn't even stand up to help, so we had to carry all our bags into the lobby and our room. They kept looking at their computers (with no other passengers to attend), while we did this. I think the hotel still needs some adjustments (leaking ceiling at lobby, key cards deactivated daily, etc.). We don't think we will return, but we recommend it if you are in your 20's or traveling alone.
title: Just OK

review: We had the misfortune in encountering a taxi strike the day we left Barcelona and would probably have missed our flights had Paula not alerted us to the problem and arranged a solution. This hotel is close to the Gracia neighbourhood which is a great place to eat and explore and is only 100m away from the Metro which takes you to Place Catalunya which is central. Stayed at this hotel for a week and was totally rested,
title: Great Desk Service. Comfortable Modern Room

review: The hotel was simply beautiful! From the building to the interior design. Our room was simply gorgeous with a wonderful small balcony observing the street. Free coffee and croissants every morning are a great way to start your day.Only wish the bed was of a better quality... wasn't the most comfortable but simply ok.
title: Beautiful hotel at a great location

hotelLocation: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 174, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: It is a beautiful and cozy place in the central area. Everything is so thought of, all the small and big details are so pleasant. At some point we felt like staying in our room instead of sightseeing (yes, it's THAT good!).The staff are very friendly and helpful, were nice to inform us about the taxi strike in advance.The kitchen is amazing. But if you are up for a dinner - better reserve a table in advance.And don't expect it to be a quiet place on a Friday night!☺️
title: The best hotel we have been to so far!!!

review: Stayed in this hotel for the first time. Chose this hotel for it's history and character and that's what I got. Friendly personel and lovely terrace where you can bring your own food and drinks. The only one minus is the wifi. Even thou you get a transportable wifi device it is still weak and bad. Want to come back to this hotel when this would change!
title: Authentic hotel in the center of Barcelona

review: 位置一流，环境一流，房间很大，床很舒服。没想到这个酒店是在西班牙最舒服的一家 good location and services. Love it so much! The bed is comfortable, and the coffee is free every day. There is a small garden you can have a rest with coffee and bread in the morning. Near from the Mila, Batllo and metro station.
title: Excellent

review: We had a great time in Barcelona recently staying at Pratik Rambla. Pros:- Very nice and helpful staff. - Great terrace area to enjoy. - Location is incredible and perfect for exploring Barcelona.- Free croissants in the morning are actually excellent, but make sure to get in by 0900 or they'll be gone. Cons:- Small rooms, very little space for luggage. - The washing subcontractor lost serveral items of my clothing - still waiting to hear from hotel if they turned up. Overall decent for price. Fantastic tapas place across the road which is great for breakfast.
title: Amazing location

review: This hotel is in a brilliany location for accessing bars/restaurants and the main shopping square, where you can easily pick up the tour bus and you be at the main sights in about 10 mins. The architecture of the hotel is beautiful and has a very gothic vibe, but with a comfy modern bedroom!! The shower was heavenly and the little garden patio is incredibly peaceful and quaint. I stayed for 2 days and the staff were very friendly and efficient. They organised my taxi to the airport which was about €30. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, just so convienient to everywhere but with a traditional Barcelona vibe.
title: Lovely hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 656, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed for a long weekend break, our room was on the rooftop, which was lovely - bar the unclean jacuzzi which we couldn't really use. Our main issue was that someone had been in our room, on more than one occasion. We had been out during the day, our room had been cleaned with fresh bedding and toiletries (lovely!), we then came back after being out for our tea and someone had been in our room and looked through our suitcases and bags!! This made us feel very unsafe and paranoid. The second to last day when we came home after a day out touring the city, the 'cleaner' had taken one of our keys which we kept in the electricity port to keep the room cool with the air con. Our bags had been moved again. When I asked reception why the key had gone she replied 'oh it happens sometimes' I'm sure this should not happen at all! I've never been in a hotel where the cleaner or anyone else takes the key and you've had your bags rummaged through. We didn't eat in the hotel or use the bar, the room was alright but we probably wouldn't stay again.
title: Wouldn't stay again

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 656, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: It is the 2nd time we stayed at the Acta Atrium Palace. We enjoyed the very central location (close to shopping and many restaurants). Staff at the front desk as well as the housekeeping staff was always nice and helpful.Quality of the beds and matrasses are a dream - we slept like in heaven :-)
title: 2nd time we stayed ....

review: Excellent location and easy access for transport, shopping and sightseeing. Very comfortable rooms and excellent friendly staff. I have stayed here 3 times due to the location. You are close to plaza Catalunya where you can get the bus tour, aerobús for airport transfer and the subway.
title: Rambla stay in Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 656, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Was looking forward to finally visiting Barcelona. I expected it to be hot in August, and it is, but I never expected the air condition in the hotel to not work. Literally sitting in the room sweating while the air conditioner blows warm air. Went downstairs to reception to enquire and was told it would not be fixed until Monday. No concessions offered just I'm sorry. Making for a miserable first trip to Barcelona. Don't think I'll stay here again. As a matter of fact, I'm going to try and change hotels and request a refund. Not worth the money.
title: Air condition not working

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 656, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Certainly the hotel is right in the heart of things, opening onto la Ramblas about half way down. Easy to reach near a metro station. After that, things go down hill a bit.Checking in took for ever as the previous couple were having problems. But then we were dealt with promptly and the receptionist recommended we avoided the restaurants outside on la Ramblas. So helpful too.The room was very plain with only the bed and a single desk chair to sit on. Not very comfortable, but clean and with everything we needed. It looked straight out onto la Ramblas, so wasn't quiet, but the double glazing helped. There was a great view from the little balcony.We'd opted for breakfast, possibly a mistake. It seemed pretty institutionalised with coffee out of machines and a buffet of not particularly exciting food. They tried to vary it each day, but seemed to only have two variations, so after a few days it was repetitive.If I were going back, I don't think I'd stay here again - better to find somewhere with more character in the old town.
title: Right on la Ramlas

review: Royal Ramblas is located at the end of Las Ramblas, near Plaça de Catalunya. It is basically the Times Square (NYC) of Barcelona. The staff was amazing! Extremely helpful and friendly. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, we were able to check in. They provided us with a map of Barcelona in addition to popular sightseeing tours we can purchase. As soon as you leave the hotel, there are so many things to do -- shopping, sightseeing, eat! There were many small cafes and restaurants nearby including La Boqueria Market so we did not have breakfast at the hotel. We stayed in two connected rooms (family of 4). The decor is modern and the windows are soundproof. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. I do wish the shower had a door instead of a curtain but that's just me being picky. The bathrooms can use an upgrade. We were located on the 5th floor so we had no complaints in terms of noise from the busy streets. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! Highly recommended.
title: Great location, lovely hotel and staff

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 656, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: We booked the hotel at the last moment after having an issue with our flight from Barcelona. We chose it for it's location predominantly, but also needed Wi-Fi and an in-room safe. When we tried to enter a code for the safe, it did not work. We called reception and someone immediately came to the room. He checked the safe and said it needed a new battery which they could not change that day. We explained our need for a safe and asked for another room but were told they could not change the room. I called reception again and they offered us another room. After changing rooms, that safe's readout again stated "batt" (the same as the first room that we had). I went down to reception again and was told by a person there (a blond female reception staffer) who informed me that the safe was not working because our computer was too large. I told her that the safe easily accommodated the computer at which time she repetitively insisted that I was wrong. Another reception person came to the room and he confirmed that there was no issue with the computer size. He was able to get the safe to lock. The attitude of the blonde woman was certainly not what I would expect from any customer service person, especially at a 4 Star hotel.The hotel generally felt worn with scratches on the walls and doors in the hallways. The room was small and dark (but had good closet space). The bed also was very small compared to any other double bed we have experienced on our stays at literally 30 + hotels in Europe, ranging from 3-5 Stars. The bathroom amenities were also minimal with a generic shampoo/body wash and no conditioner. The room was quiet facing the rear of the hotel but soundproofing was poor. We were woken several times by other guests in the hallway going to their rooms and by shouting children in a room across the hallway.We have stayed in 7 hotels so far on our current trip to Spain and Croatia. I have not yet had the chance to review the other hotels which were all great but wanted to post this review so that other TripAdvisor readers are aware of our experience at this so-called 4 Star hotel
title: 4 Stars??? Definitely not. Our stay was barely a 2 Star experience!

review: We stayed at Royal Ramblas for three nights/four days in July and were more than happy with our experience here. First, the location is excellent. Right at the center with walking distance to Gothic, eixample, beach and placa da catalunya. Very happening place. We got around 11am and our room was ready. We got a suite on the 2nd floor (room 11). There were three of us. The extra bed was already made up. Room was very specious with two sinks and a specious bathroom as well. The staff was very friendly and cooperative. We did not have a view of the Rambla but rooms were very quiet considering the hustle & bustle on the Ramblas. We also had breakfast in the hotel and it was great to have coffee in the morning watching the action on Ramblas. We will definitely be staying here again.
title: Fantastic location, excellent service

review: Wonderful stay. Very experienced staff and it showed. Got there early after cruise and had to wait for room. Clerk was very sympathetic and even upgraded us due to the long wait. It's nice to have such experienced/competent staff.
title: bcowantx

review: The hotel it self was not a new and modern one but it worth coz of the location and facilities nearby Hotel room was clean but staf was not so skillfull esp. in house keeping part The most positive point for the hitel was the restaurant just beside the entrance door wich was open till 12 midnigth and good prices and good foods for time u missed other restaurants
title: Not so special but good enough

review: superb place to visit, amazingly clean, everything in place, location is perfect, customer service made me welcome, price is affordable, highly recommended for couples or families , would consider going again
title: perfect location and service

review: We stayed for 3 nights it was a great location. The staff were great. Room big enough for two people. Breakfast was good and convenient in the morning. Good that there was a laundry service to wash our clothes.
title: Comfortable

review: Our room was clean and appealing. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom roomy for getting ready, It was inconvenient to have to use your key in the elevator with all your bags and luggage but I guess that adds to the security of the hotel. The location is close to the bus pick up point, metro and on one of the most famous busy streets of Barcelona, We really didn't have any issues other than it would have been nice to have clean towels after a long day of exploring the city. You could get them but you needed to trade your old ones in at the front desk on a daily basis.
title: Convenient location.

review: This was a very large room in an amazing location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. It was very clean and front desk was great! I was here for 3 days and they were extremely accommodating and nice.
title: Great Hotel

review: Stayed at Citadines Ramblas for 3 nights with another couple. It is a great location right in the middle of La Ramblas. The rooms are good size and very clean. The hotel also has a roof deck in the 9th floor overlooking the city, complete with lounge chairs. It was great to take up some pre dinner drinks and nibblies after being out all day and just relax. The hotel also has car parking at €25 a day. The staff on reception were very helpful. The brekky is basic but we went to a cafe just a few doors down the road each morning. We would definitely come back and stay again. Great value!
title: Great Hotel in the Ramblas

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: the best location you ever dream everything is near by the hotel its make the vacation easier.at the evening its must to get to the pool that in the roof of the hotel , there is a bar and with a cold beer with the view you can enjoy from a quality time .
title: the best hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: The room was terrible. It was so small with no sunlight and ages old carpet. The pictures on trip advisor and other 3rd party sites are deceptive. There might be some rooms which are better but the room that was offered to me was not at all I would have booked if I had seen earlier. Me and my friend arrived here at around midnight and as soon as we saw the room we decided to leave. The receptionist gave us another room to check out but it was no different so we asked him to cancel the reservation and give us our money back which was around €600. He said due to their 24 hours cancellation policy he couldn't do the money back. With all these back and forth by this time it was 1:30am and since we paid so much already we stayed in the night. We stayed in with a suffocating feeling the whole night and the old building/carpet smell, on top of this there was only a thin sheet to cover, no comforter or anything and the bed was like a box spring. So disappointed, not how I wanted my vacation to start. I would not recommend this hotel.
title: Not worth your money!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Wonderful hotel! Perfect location with access to great dining options and sights. Hotel was extremely clean. The gentleman at the front desk was extremely friendly and approachable. He made us feel welcomed from the moment we stepped into the hotel. Great value option!
title: El Avenida Palace

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel was quite lovely inside, beautifully decorated and lots of history. The staff was quite friendly and helpful and the rooftop bar was scenic. Our only complaint was the room we had. The smell of mildew was quite overpowering inside which could not be reduced even with opening the door to the beautiful terrace we had outside. We had a different room the first night due to the hotel being overbooked when we checked in, which did not have that issue, but we were asked to move to a different room for the remainder of our stay.
title: Beautiful but musty

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: If I am back to barcelona, I will visit this hotel again. Definitely. I recommend this hotel if you are planning to visit Barcelona. But the noise of subway train was little bit annoying when I tried to sleep. Because I can feel and hear when the subway train comes near
title: Perfect.

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: You're paying for the location here, if you want five star luxury, go somewhere else however, if you're looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff in the heart of the city at a very good price, look no further! The hotel is just off the Ramblas right opposite the Guell palace, you can't get nearer to the beating heart of the city. Breakfast was indifferent but with good service. The rooms are basic but very comfortable and despite us overlooking the main street, surprisingly quiet. This is a great hotel for exploring the finest that Barcelona has to offer.
title: Location, Location Location

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for 5 nights on first visit to Barcelona. Situated just off the famous La Ramblas promenade and close to subway. Not exactly inexpensive but rooms were excellent and hotel service good. Staff very friendly and helpful. Only downside was the breakfast which at €25 is overpriced for what you get but that seems to be to trend in Barcelona hotels. Rather don't take the breakfast and instead go to a taverna or the great food market down the road.
title: Great hotel in the heart of the Barcelona tourist district

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: The air conditioning was not working very well. It is hot in Barcelona in July!Someone had been smoking in the room and the air unit was just circulating the smoke. We both woke up feeling ill. The sheets had holes in them and we were sleeping on box springs not a mattress. We were each allowed one towel.We were very disappointed and tried to book another hotel but there was noneAvailability. The hotel was clean and the sangria was very good but notgood enough for us to be able to sleep through the night. We were exhausted.
title: Hot in Barcelona!

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is 3 star and therefore relatively basic, but there was nothing to complain about and the location is excellent. Our family room was very sizeable; it was at the back of the hotel, so the view was not great at all, but it had the advantage of being amazingly quiet, considering the proximity to the (heaving) busy La Rambla.The roof top terrace bar, with glass fronted foot pool was a real treat. There are views all around Barcelona city and down to the port, with the Palau Guell (Gaudi designed) rooftop directly opposite. Personally, I would have thought that this premier location could be turned into a much more expensive cocktail bar, but it was certainly a very pleasant addition as it was.We did not eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on that, but would definitely stay here again, if visiting Barcelona.
title: Excellent location, decent hotel

review: Great facilities, love the roof terrace, very accommodating, breakfast was amazing, so much choice and try everything!! Cocktails outstanding. Would recommend to anyone that wants a relaxing break and has cash to burn!!
title: First class

review: This is a basic, no frills hotel at a good location. The metro station is just 5 minutes away. Also, there is a elevator right across the road that takes you to the subway. The rooms were compact but clean and housekeeping was done daily. The staff was helpful. the AC and wifi worked fine. Its not really value for money for the tariff they have, but then Barcelona is expensive when it comes to accommodation. Decent average stay!
title: Basic, No Frills Hotel

review: I had booked a room at a hostel but that hostel was so loud and low quality that I immediately looked for a proper hotel to transfer to after quite some sleepless nights. I found Hotel Via Augusta and spent my last night there. I found out it is a 2* hotel but I'd give it one more star. It felt like heaven after that horrbible hostel experience. The room was very clean and mostly quiet and I slept wonderfully. The location was fine as it is close to the Fontana subway. Maybe the view was not the best as my room was an internal one but all I was looking for was some peace and I definitely slept like a baby.I might come back here.
title: I would give it one more star

review: We really enjoyed the Mercer, the rooms are beautiful- but the staff is what makes this hotel unique and superb. The breakfast was delicious and quite beautifully prepared each morning. We had a couple of hick-ups with the broken A/C, but overall a great location to wander around the Gothic Quarter from.
title: Superb service

review: We stayed at this hotel for four nights as a family of four. We stayed in a suite and had 2 roll away beds added to the room and still had plenty of room. The service was impeccable, the linens were beautiful, and the artwork in each room and in the corridors were inspiring. Most of all, we loved how the hotel treated us and took care of our every need. A few things to consider before staying there - the rooms are a little dark with several spot lights that are well appointed in the room so please note this if you are a big reader. The pool on the roof is very small, so the photo is a bit misleading. Having said this, our two boys went up there each day to take dip while we ordered glasses of wine and looked out over the city. In addition, it is much quieter to stay in the Gothic quarter than in a hotel that faces a bustling street, but this means that a taxi can barely squeeze through. Finally, there is the price tag - it is definitely luxury pricing, but you are getting what you are paying for.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of the Gothic district

review: Hotel Villa Emilia made our Barcelona visit unforgettable. We arrived to the hotel before check-in time. Monica at the front desk was very accommodating and she arranged a room for us within minutes. Room was spacious, clear and had a beautiful view of the neighborhood. Wifi was fast and signal was present in all areas of the building. Breakfast buffet offered a lot of variety and it was available until 11:30AM. Hotel offers complementary coffee, tea, and pastry on the rooftop between 5-7PM. Throughout our entire stay, everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and accommodating. Pere Fabregas himself, who is the director of the hotel, gave us useful sightseeing tips and helped us book our tickets to Park Guell. In addition to great service, Hotel Villa Emilia is centrally located within 10-15 min walking distance to most attractions that Barcelona has to offer. Subway station is also available one block away. This boutique hotel was a gem. We will definitely be back.
title: Excellent Stay

review: 3 days stay in Barcelona is so short. I would love to stay a little longer. Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona is a wonderful place. The hotel design is beautiful and very refreshing to the eyes. Our room was big and clean. Love the complimentary food and drinks that they offer. We’ll go back in this hotel for sure. Very awesome stay!
title: Awesome hotel in Barcelona

review: stylish hotel that always smells good. Friendly helpful staff, very good breakfast with excellent ingredients (yet a bit limited). You feel that every detail in this hotel has been thought of. I would surely go there again
title: Excellent relaxing stay

review: Clean and friendly hotel, the view from our room was terrible as we were overlooked from every angle and received no natural daylight due to the closeness and height of the buildings.On the plus side we did have a small balcony which meant that I didn't have to stand in the street to smoke.No tea/ coffee making facility in the room.Don't think I would stay there again
title: Birthday jaunt

review: Have just returned from a 2 night stay Friday to Sunday. Doing my research before choosing this hotel really paid off. What an absolute gem of a place! Fabulous location, not a touristy area but so near to centre. Little delay on checking in but then given a great room on the 8th floor. A very spacious twin bedded room with black-out curtains, air con, safe in wardrobe, plenty of storage, flat screen tv with many channels in different languages, full length mirror and very comfy beds. Big bonus were the doors opening onto a sweet little balcony with table and chairs and views down the main road. The room was very quiet at night. Slept really well. Free wifi worked fine. Good lift to all floors. Bathroom was also spacious with bath and shower. Good water temp and pressure. Windows opened which is always good when it's hot. Nice toiletries supplied.Breakfast served till 10.30. What a spread. Selection of hot foods, cold meats and cheeses, fresh fruit, cereals, yogurts, cakes and pastries, rolls and toast, huge selection of hot drinks and very nice fresh juices. All fresh and replenished right up until 10.30. All staff so friendly and helpful. Happy to advise on buses and metros. Fontana Metro station 4 mins walk - handy supermarket and ice cream parlour on the way (this line L3 took us to nearly all the places we wanted to visit - got to know it really well!) 2 stops to centre of city. Had ordered BCN Hola 3 day card before leaving so just had to collect cards from machine at metro at airport. Really easy to get from/to airport this way. Used our cards many times on buses and metro so certainly good value for the cost (38 Euros for 2 people). I don't understand why this hotel only has 2 stars - I've stayed in 3 and 4 star hotels that were not as good. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and I can't wait to return to Barcelona (what an amazing laid back, friendly city) and will definitely stay here again. To finish I would just like to say thank you to the lovely staff, especially on reception, for helping us have a truly memorable stay. See you next time!
title: Fantastic hotel in great location should be more than 2 stars!!!

review: The hotel is very nice. It's not near the tourist spots but there is a Metro station 100m away. The room was good; slightly on the small side but fine. There is a top floor terrace which we enjoyed sitting out on after a tiring day walking round the sights of Barcelona. What we found lacking was the helpfulness and response from staff, particularly one girl.
title: Service could be better

review: We booked 4 rooms for 4 nights for various family members. The hotel was everything we could've wanted. All of the staff were friendly and professional. The breakfast was excellent, plenty of choice. The rooms were large and clean with plenty of facilities. The hotel was in a quieter, less touristy area of the city but the metro was at the end of the street and close links to all of the major attractions. Best bit was the rooftop bar which was a great place to have a late night drink.
title: Great hotel

review: 49yo traveling with 18yo- this hotel has plenty of common space! Rooftop lounge and mezzanine biz center makes for comfortable travel with menopausal crazy people. EXCELLENT BREAKFAST, solid dinners. Get the chicken.
title: Tidy

review: Hotel is beautiful. Location is perfect. Rooftop bar/pool was great and relaxing.We changed rooms as initial room was tiny. #262. We changed to #263 and was just enough bigger to make the difference. No one would be happy in #262. Breakfast buffet was amazing. Staff great.
title: beautiful Hotel

review: This hotel is amazing! The staff are friendly, the rooms are beautiful, and the breakfast is delicious!!! It was our favorite part of the time we spent in Barcelona. Highly recommend for anyone wanting a luxury hotel in the city.
title: Best part of our trip to Barcelona

review: Had a fabulous 3 night break. The hotel was spotless. Staff were very helpful. Really enjoyed the pool. Can't wait to come back. Very comfortable beds. The shops and restaurants are on your doorstep. Lovely little caffe next to the hotel.
title: Great hotel, location, pool, rooms!

review: Great hotel. Its located in the middle of the high end shopping distriict - which is not my thing, however, there are some advantages. You away from the hustle and bustle of things, but yet a short walk from some Gaudi building and nightlife. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly, and the hotel is well built. Highlight is rooftop bar/pool, which can get crowded quickly due to small size, as well as an off the chain breakfast buffet. would highly recommend.
title: Treat Yourself

review: Was very impressed from the moment we pulled up in the shuttle. They had someone that greeted us at the curb took our bags in and they checked us into a concierge type of check in ( room around the way) from the main area. From there a person explained our room and every detail and Susanna made sure that everything worked out for us. She made sure that our stay was special. I was very impressed with the rooftop deck and the pool area and it was very busy at midnight and just wonderful. I was able to book this on Expedia with my flight and so I believe I got a very good rate . I've been to a lot of hotels and traveled often and I would say this is been one of the best hotels I've been to and it's walking distance to everywhere and I especially love the marble bathroom with the deep tub. If there was just one tiny thing that I would have preferred it might have been an expresso machine in the room that made -- real dark strong coffee -- instead of the automatic one that they have in there but that seems to be a typical thing everywhere. I would surely stay there again and it made Barcelona even nicer. Oh there was a man at the Rooftop area that allowed people in and out and very tall and slender... he was quite arrogant and unfriendly. Yet, Marissa was a hostess up there on the rooftop... and she was very nice. And David which was a bag man , was very nice too.
title: Susanna made sure that everything worked out for us.

review: We spent 5 night at the Majestic in June, and booked one of the Majestic Residences (directly across Passieg de Gracia from the hotel). Two bedrooms, two full baths, a ktichen, dining/living room, balconies, laundry - we had it all. It would be hard to find better service or amenities than this. The hotel is centrally located, and we walked to many attractions & restaurants (including La Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera and Las Ramblas). The hotel has a very nice spa, and a rooftop lounge with a great view. The full breakfast at the hotel is delicious and has choices for everyone, but it is on the expensive side (we did not include this in our visit, but chose to eat there once for the experience). We would surely stay here again on a future trip to Barcelona!
title: Great Service & Central Location

review: Excellent hotel very clean and modern and great location around the corner from the Catedral. Although the staff were very helpful on the front desk and breakfast staff attentive and quick the bar was slow with the waiter servicing the pool on the 5th floor , room service and the bar . After waiting 30 minutes for a drink I gave up . There is a need for dedicated bar staff and other services not just the one guy .
title: Barcelona 2017

review: Amazing breakfast - I am gluten intolerant, and the hotel had special bread for me, which just made my vacation much easier. The location of the hotel was right in the middle of the city, which means everything was close to the hotel - Shopping centre was only a 10-minute walk away, and the Rambla was almost beside the hotel. I would definetly recomend this hotel to everyone!
title: Wonderful location!

review: Great location, right in the heart of the city. Zoo is a 10 min walk, so is the Picasso museum. The room was modern, the air-con was good, free wifi, room service. They have a rooftop pool area, although it could be better as it would be great to have a bar up there.The gym is a bit of a let down, one treadmill and one bike, small room, no water as it was always empty and the bike didn't operate smoothly.One nice touch is they do free cheese and wine at 5pm every day for guests. However you get a very small glass of wine, and no seconds, and they don't put out a huge amount of cheese which means by 5.15pm all the other guests have had it and they dont refill the plates and as i got abruptly told "when its finished its finished"..hey-ho...Overall a great little hotel, right in the heart of the city. Would definitely stay again
title: Great all round

review: Lovely modern and clean hotel. The location is spot on and you can access everything you need. It is a five minute walk from the Place Catalyuna where the airport bus drops off. The hotel pool is fab, very relaxing and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was small but it was lovely. I would absolutely stay here again.
title: Perfect hotel!

review: This was an small hotel in Colon ave in front of the bay i just sleep and enjoy the terraza bar the hotel personnel was very professional i would go back again free wifi If someone ask me for a fine hotel this would be one
title: May 2017

review: Where do I even begin? We LOVED our stay, the hotel and the staff. We thought the hotel was beautiful. The room where breakfast is served is really nice. The rooms were large and the bathrooms are AMAZING!! The rooftop terrace views are RIDICULOUS!! It's the view of the Ports and it's gorgeous!! Yes, the pool is small but we weren't there for that - the beach is across the street. There are plenty of tables if you'd like to sit but only about 6 lounge chairs. We would go up for a cocktail everyday - otherwise we were running around the city. If we had more time we may have lounged near the pool - it didn't bother us really. The location is EVERYTHING!! You are close to the Port, Barceloneta, Las Ramblas, and in the Gothic Quarter. The only reason why it would be bad is because it's hard to pull yourself out of the area to visit outlying neighborhoods!! Really, we were able to walk everywhere. This was our favorite area of Barcelona.Breakfast was incredible! The spread was perfect and food fresh. You are also able to pick how you'd like your eggs made. That right there was a home run for my husband and I. I wish I remembered the woman's name that handled the breakfast - but either way, she was great! Very friendly and very efficient and she maintained the breakfast area wonderfully. The bellboy - was super friendly as well (I think his name was Ruben). He was always smiling and interactive and always tried to help us if we needed anything at all. We really appreciated him.I will be honest, some of the front desk people are friendlier than others. Some were really amazing and some were ok. None were terrible or anything - but when you have people that are amazing the others stand out. LOL - BUT - all are helpful if you need anything. LONG STORY SHORT - we LOVED Barcelona. It was our first time and certainly not our last. We were there in July and are already booked to go back in September. Before we left - we booked our next stay here. We will make this our home whenever we come to Barcelona. Next time we will have a Port View Room, which we are happy about. Our room had no view and nor did I expect one - so big deal. I explained that we'll be coming back and already booked. They offered us a 10% discount for being a returning customer.OH - the WiFi worked great as well. I figured I'd point this out because that was not the case in other area's of Spain or other hotels.
title: Future Home Every Time We Visit Barcelona - Excellent Stay

review: Arrived 2 hours early for check in to be told no worries your rooms will be ready in 1/2 hour. Cava for you and your husband. Water for your children. You are more than welcome to go to the rooftop terrace and wait. Fantastic. The rooftop terrace is amazing. Fabulous view over the marina. Small pool. Great seating, good food served, speak to the Jamon man, he's wonderful. Room was spacious. 1 enormous king+ size bed and 2 singles. Lots of space. Air conditioning silent,sound proofing excellent. Children slept in until 10am!!!! Staff fantastic, very forgiving of terrible Spanish. Close to Las Ramblas and the port. Parking 200m. €30per day. Loved it. Back in October.
title: What can I say!!!

review: The location of this hotel is perfect - directly across from the port and right on the front step of the Gothic Quarter. In addition to this though, the hotel is beautifully presented and elegant. We had a small room, but it had lovely decor, comfortable beds and a very spacious bathroom with bath and shower. The hotel has an excellent rooftop bar and plunge pool to enjoy views of the port and Barcelona waterfront. We were also very impressed with the service, particularly the friendly and professional staff, and the complimentary bottle of cava that we received upon arrival. It was a perfect stay in Barcelona and we'd definitely return to Duquesa again.
title: Perfect in every way

review: Spent 3 nights in this lovely boutique hotel. The room had a much needed King Size bed, night tables with close by plugs for all your electronics. Bathrooms were large and modern with everything you could possibly need, slippers, bathrobes,etc. Staff was amazing, location can't be beat! Did not indulge in the breakfast but went to the bakery around the corner for chocolate croissants. Would definitely return!!
title: Wonderful Experience

review: This hotel is just a couple of minutes away from Casa Mila and Casa Battlo which is terrific. The staff is very friendly. The price however is higher than we have paid in other neighborhoods so I doubt we would stay here again if we were just visiting to start a cruise. The breakfast buffet is very nice.
title: Excellent hotel if you are seeing Casa Mila and Casa Battlo

review: This hotel is a real gem in an amazing location. It's a few minute walk away from the nearest metro stop, a twenty minute walk to Sagrada Familia. Upon arrival, as my boyfriend had written that it was a surprise trip for my birthday, we got told we got the best room in the hotel, room 602 on the top floor. They really weren't lying! Amazing terrace with a table and sunbeds, a HUGE bed and bathroom with a big bath. Was wonderful. A day into our trip we also came home to a cold bottle of cava sat on the side with their good wishes. We also went to Hotel Majestic, the sister hotel which is a five minute walk away. Being able to use the top floor to sunbathe, enjoy the views and swim in the pool was great. If not the drinks were a little pricey (just beware!!) The staff at the hotel were very accommodating, booking us a taxi back to the airport, keeping our bags so we didn't have to lug them around the city. Nothing seemed too much. Thank you for making a trip to Barcelona a great one. Will definitely be returning.
title: An amazing stay in a beautiful hotel, made better with a few little touches

review: We spent two nights at this property and its location is great. It is close to La Pedrera and Casa Batlò as well as countless restaurants. The atmosphere around it is great and relaxed. This hotel was recommended and although the room was acceptable, I felt like it fell short somehow. Nothing is particular amazing. I felt like I was disturbing the staff with my questions, there is no gym on the premises and the overall experience was somehow flat. It's very dark when you walk in, which is in contrast of the bustling of the streets just outside.It just didn't do it for me.
title: Good Location

review: Our daughter stayed here earlier in the month and recommended we book.I would happily go back and would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Great location for the sights. Handy for the metro.
title: Lovely !!!

review: Thank you for such a nice vacation. The hotel is amazing, the food is tasty. I would love to come back. The staff is very polite and helpful. The hotel is clean and our room was very comfortable. Love it. Definitely will come back.
title: Perfect stay

review: Nice Hotel Good location. The staff were outgoing, the family suite was convenient.The breakfast isnt worth the price. You can do much better elsewhere.The bar on the rooftop is fun, but beware of its prices.
title: Nice Hotel Good location

review: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel in June for 4 nights and we are so glad that we chose this hotel.The hotel is in a perfect location - it is within a 10 minute walk of 3 different metro stations, (Urquinaona, Passeig de Garcia and Catalunya) meaning that it is easy to get to from the airport or train stations, and that it is a short walk or metro ride to anywhere in the city. It is also only a 5-10 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya, and the top of La Rambla, and a short walk from the Barri Gotic and El Born areas. Being located a short walk from all these areas also means that it is in a quieter area than some hotels in Barcelona, and we found it very peaceful each night and easy to get a good nights sleep.The room itself was spacious enough for 2 people, and had a comfortable bed, a nice bathroom with a very large shower, shower gel and shampoo and a hairdryer, a safe, and a lovely little balcony/terrace area, which had a couple of seats and was a lovely place to sit and have a snack, and overlooked a quiet courtyard type area. The room also had a minibar, which was just a small fridge which we used to put our own drinks/snacks in and was incredibly useful. The air conditioning in the room worked perfectly, making the room a lovely cool temperature to retreat in to when it was nearly 40 degrees outside!The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, and were quick to respond to emails that I had sent them before booking the hotel.There is a restaurant next door if you would like to buy breakfast or dinner. We didn't visit the restaurant though so can't say if the food was good. The hotel has a rooftop bar, which we visited on one evening and wish we had managed to visit more often. The man serving was very friendly and had a bit of a joke with us, the drinks were good and a reasonable price and the atmosphere was great. It wasn't a huge area but it was nicely done and we would recommend having at least one drink up there.As said in the title, the hotel definitely deserves more than 2 stars and we would 100% stay here again, as we could not find another hotel with a private balcony, rooftop bar, private bathrooms and minibar for the same price. It is a lovely hotel in a great location and fully recommended by us!
title: Don't let the 2 stars put you off, definitely deserves more!

review: We booked this hotel for 4 nights in June as part of our month travelling round Spain. We chose this because of the good reviews and we were not disappointed. This definitely feels more than a 2 star! Check in was good with the receptionist spending a lot of time pointing out things on the map for us and answering our questions. Room was one of the best we stayed in with small balcony overlooking the front of the hotel. The location was in a quiet area just off plaza de Catalunya but within walking distance of La Ramblas and shopping area. We were 10 minutes from El Born a lovely area with good restaurants and bars. We used the metro which was a handy way to see the city and very good value if you bought the 10 ticket deal. Nearest met was Urquinaona. They have a roof top bar here which was lovely but underused which is a shame but on the plus side we always found a table.
title: Fantastic hotel in great location

review: We stayed in a tasteful, clean, functional room (B40) overlooking the harbor in a port view room. (FYI...You can usually only get this type of room when you order online directly through the hotel's website). For our family visit of 3 people, it was a very functional set-up. We had a king size bed for the 2 of us and a single bed for our teenage daughter. There was another single daybed that we used to put our luggage. The bathroom set-up worked well for us. We had a single stand-alone shower in one area. Then, there was a second shower/tub/toilet. Having 2 separate shower areas was great for getting ready more quickly. In between both showering areas, there was a fairly large area with a sink, big mirror, magnifying mirror, and all of the various toiletry items as well as a blow dryer. We had wonderful robes and thick towels. They had champagne and chocolates waiting for us in the room. They had many different pillow sizes and a card that allowed you could choose the fragrance of you room. The room was quiet and the A/C worked great. We had troubles with the safe and had to call them 3 separate times to get it resolved which they finally did by changing it out for a new one. The room had a table, desk, coffee maker, and mini refrigerator which was stocked with drinks and food though we did not buy any of their products. Instead, we walked to a grocery store that was only a short 5 minute walk away behind the hotel. The view was wonderful for water lovers like us, though know that the balcony is just big enough to stand on to gaze over the harbor. There is no room for chairs out there. We were on the 4th floor and we could see over the trees... any lower floor and I'm not sure you would be able to see much except the trees. There are about 6 lanes of fairly busy traffic in front of the hotel but it is quite easy to cross and once you do, you can walk for miles on the waterfront boardwalk area. Plus, the land developers have dotted the area with palm trees to make it more visually appealing. You can get an idea if you use the satellite view on Google Maps. We were within 5-10 minutes walking distance to a tourist information booth at the end of Las Ramblas near the Christopher Columbus statue. In the same area are also several boat rides that you can sign up for rides/tours. We chose the large catamaran "chill-out" boat tour (live sax music) and it was one of our best memories from our trip as we took a cooler with cheese and crackers and ordered sangria while lounging on the giant boat talking to other people from around the world. The boat departed from that same area and was just a fantastic, relaxing experience. Through the tourist information booth, we also signed up for a tapas tour in the Gothic Quarter and a flamenco show in the El Born district. We also meandered to Las Ramblas to walk down the famous street. All of these activities were only about 10 minutes away from the hotel so super convenient and walkable. We took a taxi for La Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell as they are located much farther away. We also took a taxi up to the beaches near Port Olympic. It was walkable in about 25-30 minutes but we were carrying a bunch of beach stuff so it was easier to just get a ride. Note that it is best to catch the taxi on the opposite side of the street of the hotel if you are heading north to the beach since the roads are one way! We paid extra to head south, turn around at the Las Ramblas roundabout and head north again passing our hotel along the way. Not a huge price difference but learned quickly to cross the street to save time and a bit of money! :) There are tons of food places nearby. There are upscale seafood places and cute little beach bars known as chiringuitos right on the water. In the historic area right behind the hotel there are tons of little cafes and shops. However, our first night we sat at the rooftop bar eating tapas and drinking sangria. Service was crazy slow as expected based on prior reviews, but we were not in a hurry and we thoroughly enjoyed relaxing on the rooftop watching the sunset and seeing the Barcelona skyline go from day to night. There is a small plunge pool up there but don’t expect to be able to actually swim in it. The pool is more for just getting wet to cool off before going back to the lounge chairs to bask in the sunshine or read a book in the shaded area. On our final morning, I saw other guests bring their free champagne up to the rooftop and they enjoyed it overlooking the city. We did not do this but in hindsight seemed like a pretty good idea! After our sunset, rooftop dinner, we headed out to walk the area nearby. We went further and further mesmerized by all the activity and the great people watching. We went so far that my feet began to hurt and I did not want to walk back! We took a rickshaw ride back to the hotel! Great way to cover a lot more area quickly and easily and way more ambiance than a taxi ride! Each morning we went to the breakfast room which used to be the palace stables. It was a beautiful room and a wonderful buffet full of interesting goodies. The menu offered various hot eggs. We tried something different each day…veggie omelets, ham and cheese omelets, scrambled eggs with chorizo, fried eggs. All were good and beautifully presented. There were also cereals, fresh fruit, hams, cheeses, yogurts, cereals, fresh squeezed juice, pastries, green beans with ham, baked tomatoes, Spanish potato/egg tortillas, spinach tortillas, and so much more. The breakfast workers did a great job of keep everything full but you may have to flag them down to order your eggs as they get sometimes get very busy and are unable to take your order. As for the other workers, the front desk workers were professional. We had especially attentive service from Alex the concierge and I enjoyed talking to Marc who was friendly and eager to assist which I always appreciate when traveling to new areas. Overall, it was a lovely hotel in a very good, central location for most that we wanted to do. The wifi worked well and was included in the bill I thought the overall hotel was a bit pricey but I am a water person and love a good rooftop view so for me it was worth it. The fact that it took 3 visits by staff and 2 days to get a working safe did cause me to knock it down a star. Other than that issue, I would recommend this hotel and this area to stay in!!
title: Port views, rooftop bar, wonderful breakfast, 2 showers, super functional!

review: We spend three nights in early July. The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean; it has a nice balcony with comfortable chairs to enjoy the view.Perfect location, walking distance to public transport amenities like La Rambla, Plaza Cataluñaand more. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. Nice area for shopping and eating out.
title: Nice hotel in a great location!

review: Very nice hotel w friendly front desk staff. Hip and modern although the hallways may be a bit morbid (dark and grey). Nice location although some of the surrounding streets were not exactly posh. Rooms were bright. Elevator kinda slow.
title: Hip and modern

review: Stayed for 6 nights. Very clean and simply furnished hotel. Good location and excellent staff. Good breakfast. Excellent location and convenient for the ramblas, metro felt very safe. Good tapas bar just up the street.
title: Great hotel

review: Excellent - great location and amenities. Rooftop pool is a huge bonus, especially for the area. Would not hesitate to recommend and will return in the future. Service was better than other locations. Price was extremely competitive.
title: Excellent stay!

review: The room itself was nice and the front desk staff were good but the hotel lets itself down in a few areas. First off, have free water for people in the lobby instead of just ice. Fridges in the room would be nice. Also rooms on the first floor get a lot of noise from the electric doors downstairs. Gym was a bit of a joke, not much happening there. Upstairs area view is beautiful but very small. Parents let their kids loose and the pool is off limits because they've invaded the small pool. So overall an ok hotel but just lacks a lot of niceties that most other hotels have.
title: Ok place

review: Hotel is beautiful and in great location. Staff was amazing. We were robbed at airport while leaving Barcelona and they worked with me to get room since I had no ID (but had police report). Even called to check on us.
title: Great hotel. Even greater staff!

review: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and the best thing about this hotel is it's central location which is close enough to walk to most of the main attractions.The rooms are clean and whilst I understand it is an eco hotel, a fridge or tea/coffee facilities in the rooms would really enhance the overall experience of staying at the hotel. The breakfasts were great with an extensive for a 3 star hotel which really set us up for the day. There is a Carrefour across the street with several shops, cafes and eateries and souvenir shops all within a few mins walk. La Rambla is a 5/6 min walk, Montjuic is 10 min and the beach took us about 20 mins. The metro is at the end of the street and v easy to use. You can buy the T10 metro card for 10€ from Reception.Highly recommended
title: Excellent location

review: Booked the hotel initially for being close to the train station as we were heading to Madrid. We directly got the feeling that we should have stayed more there as the room was so spacious and the staff very friendly. Breakfast was great with wide variety and a great view of this part of the city.
title: Great location, welcoming staff

review: Stayed here for 5 nights on the 15th floor. Our room was large and very spacious with the added bonus of corner windows which provided great views. Great toiletries were supplied and our room was cleaned each day. Our bathroom was enormous with a wet room and bath provided. There was also plenty of wardrobe and drawer space too.I had booked a taxi to collect us from the airport to the Gran Hotel, but unfortunately, the day we landed the whole of the Barcelona taxi fleet were on a 1 day strike. We had to take the train, how fortunate it was that the hotel was just across from the train station, it made a big difference to us.Breakfast on the 23rd floor was fantastic and spacious with the added bonus of panoramic views of Barcelona, it was lovely. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfasts here, the food was tasty and the friendly staff provided a first class service. Other good points are the amount of lifts available, if I recall there are 6, which were quick and fast. Reception staff were also friendly, polite and very helpful. The reason I only gave 4 stars was because of the noise of the air conditioning unit. I am a very light sleeper and found it difficult to drop off with the noise, but I have that same problem with any hotel.Would I stay here again? definitely, the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya provided everything and is in a great location.
title: Great convenient hotel which provided an excellent service

review: The location of this hotel is fantastic -- we walked most places, but the metro was within a couple of blocks, and when we did ride, we could get everywhere we wanted to go easily. The train station is right behind the hotel, so trips outside of the city are convenient as well. There is a bar onsite just for hotel guests, and we had a lovely couple of hours there one night relaxing and drinking wonderful mojitos. The room was maybe the largest hotel room I've ever been in. The shower could have fit four or five people, and there was a separate tub as well. The views were spectacular both during the day and at night.
title: OUr corner room was huge, with floor to ceiling windows. We felt like we were camping in the clouds!

review: We visited the terrace bar of the hotel for a drink and for a hotel this nice we were surprised at the $5.50 Aperol spritz specials. Although you can't see the sunset directly or the Plaza Cataluña, the place is rusticly decorated with wood beams and lots of plants. It provided for a nice. There's not much of a party scene although there is some music in the background (at low volume). It makes for a nice place to hang out with friends and chit chat over inexpensive drinks.
title: Nice terrace scene at sunset

review: The Hotel creates a fantastic atmosphere right after the entrance. Very good and attentive staff. We enjoyed our stay immensely. The room had everything needed and the bathroom was modern. Good and quiet AC. The only disadvantage is that the room was not so quite (street noise).
title: Fantastic

review: The location is great if you're visiting for business, but it's a little ways out of the city center for restaurants, bars, etc. We walked to the main shopping street, which took about 20 minutes, and another 15 minutes from there to the La Rambla area.The room was huge, so was the bathroom. Air conditioning was nice, they also had lemon water and snacks in the lobby, which was nice because it was insanely hot and humid outside (July). The staff were very friendly and helpful, and you get access to the rooftop pool at the adjacent hotel, which was a really relaxing way to start your day each day.
title: Big rooms, rooftop pool

review: A nice hotel, perfectly located to visit Barcelona and enjoy restaurants and shopping. Friendly staff. Absolutely need to check out the rooftop it is extremely nice and we had a great time every evening up there, as it was never too busy.
title: Perfect location, and great rooftop

review: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was amazing, the staff are so lovely and nothing is too much for them. They are so helpful letting us know all the good places to visit and where to eat. The hotel is beautiful very clean and modern. Breakfast was nice too.
title: Lovely hotel and perfect location

review: I would like to comment on this 20 plus room hotel in Orense,is nice and clean change the linen daily bathroom is well stock with toiletries like shampoo,shower gel. Tooth brush and paste, They also have a cafeteria and restaurant where you can eat very good food at economic price staff are great, happy and very helpful.Being here 10 days and very happy.
title: Hotel Puente Romano, Orense

review: Check in was easy and the room was one of the larger triples I've stayed in while in Europe. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, and perfectly located. The beds, however, were hard and difficult to sleep on. The walls were PAPER THIN and you could listen in on the conversation of those in the room next door and write it down word for word. I have never had worse sleep in any hotel in my life. Two nights in a row I was woken up at 5 AM because the guests next door were speaking loudly. Normally guests speaking at 5 am wouldn't be an issue, but here it was because of how thin the walls were. Avoid staying in 435 in you want quality sleep... there is NO sleep to be had in this room.(And it was not even a front facing room). I even complained a few times but nothing changed. Other than the sleep quality, the hotel is in the best place it can possibly be!!
title: Mixed feelings

review: We stayed for four nights. Great breakfast and nice rooms, some noice from the Rambla, and also from adjacent rooms. Price to match the location, but after all price was acceptable.100 meters to Liceau metro station and also bus 59 to the beach :-)
title: Great location and nice breakfast

review: Basic hotel that needs a bit of an update, Staff were friendly enough, the hotel was claen and tidy. Perfect location to sample the city day and night life. bedrooms were a little small and under equiped, only one double plug socket for the whole room.
title: Weekend city break
