review: Good little boutique hotel set away from hustle of main streets. Very clean rooms and lovely bathrooms . Nice touch with free coffee on first floor . Would definitely stay again and recommend to family and friends
title: Excellent choice

review: We spend 4 great nights in June. On arrival we were upgraded from Junior Suite Room to Suit Monument (Thank You!).Rooms are not big but that's expected in city center location. Hotel center location is one of its biggest advantages. You can get by foot or by taxi to everywhere in about 10 minutes for just 10 EUR. Sometimes it takes longer to go to nearby metro station than to get to destination by taxi. Hotel staff is very helpful with catching taxi. I've tried to do this myself 3 times, but never succeeded. They did it very efficient.Rooms are stylish, very clean. Only very minor issue was leaking water from shower flor to bathroom and even room flor.We spend 4 days for sightseeing and sunbathing. Hotel on our request provided us with beach towels.Breakfast are served a'la carte, i prefer buffet way, but they are tasty. Restaurant staff also accommodated our special needs due to multiple food allergies. They had everything prepared in advance.I highly recommend this hotel, we will be back there if we visit Barcelona again.
title: Great weekend

review: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The room was not ready when we arrived but they held our luggage & directed us to a cafe up the street. When we returned the room was ready. We had a room that faced the street of the front of the hotel. The room was clean & the beds were comfortable. The room was small but we were only in there to sleep so it wasn't a major issue. I loved the location of the hotel. It was accessible to 3 major metro stations, restaurants & shopping. We took a bus from BCN airport to the hotel & that was only 5.90 euros per person. The hotel is within 5 minutes walking from the bus stop.The hotel staff spoke very good English & worked with us when we tried to speak Spanish with them. They were all friendly & helped us with the map & routes to our many excursions. Overall it was an enjoyable stay & a solid choice for our needs while in beautiful Barcelona.
title: Good Stay

review: Great location, a few mins away from the major trains and metro station. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean and modern. Facing the main road but quiet. We will definitely stay this hotel again.
title: Very nice hotel.

review: Located near to the main Saints Train Station easy five minutes walking distance. Train journey to and from Airport easy at a cost of just over 4 Euros, tickets available on the day from the machines. Metro line in the station was L3 that brings you near to all central meeting points in the centre of Barcelona. Bought a ten journey ticket that worked brilliantly. Very helpful reception staff always spot on with answers. Clean comfortable room rather small cramped bathroom but adequate. Great plunge pool just right after a full day sight seeing towels provided. Excellent Sangria from the bar and only a few Euros more than elsewhere. Food menu could be a bit more exciting ok for a snack but main courses not brilliant. Went in search of staff on a couple of occasions service can be slow on the terrace. The kiddies park at the rear does go quiet after 9pm. Can't be heard inside the hotel. Would recommend this Hotel as a clean quiet place in a very very busy city.
title: Easy Access Hotel

review: Hotel situated only a few minutes from Sants Estacio, with great transport links and very easy to find. Arrived at the hotel and was offered a welcome drink of fresh fruit juices or cava which was a lovely surprise. We were also upgraded to a deluxe twin room which was excellent; very spacious and the bathroom was clean. Both the room and the decor in the hotel were very modern too. Although the pool area is rather small in terms of number of beds, we never found it a problem to get a bed - no queuing at 7am and the pool in general was quiet (and we went mid July). The breakfast every morning was great, with selection of cereals, cooked breakfast and pastries (to name but a few). The hotel itself was excellent but the staff make it what it is, very friendly, always smiling and nothing is ever too much trouble. Would definitely return to this hotel in the future.
title: Excellent hotel

review: When arriving to the hotel we were greeted with a free glass of champagne. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. At night we never seen the restaurant open but outside there is plenty of room to eat which most people did and ordered food at the bar. Hotel was close to the Nou Camp and the magic fountains but was a walk to the beach and other site seeing areas but Barcelona is a huge city so this didn't bother us as we got taxis which were reasonably cheap but being not so close to the beach at night it was quite so you could get a decent sleep. Rooms very clean and had a fridge which next door is a supermarket which is so cheap! So we stocked up. I would really recommend this hotel again and I will be staying in more of the h10 hotels.
title: Beautiful holiday!

review: The hotel is located in the area of Montjuic, just some 15 minutes walking from the city center. The views from the restaurant and the terrace are amazing!The rooms are nice and well distributed, they have a nice bathtub, big king size beds and also have a lovely balcony to let the nice summer breeze in. The service is fantastic! The front desk staff is always on point and are willing to go above and beyond to solve any issue that you might have. It was always a pleasure to be greeted by them and to see their smiling faces day to day. Overall a fantastic property! Top choice, I could not recommend this hotel enough. Until next time!
title: Classy and Modern

hotelLocation: Av. Diagonal de Barcelona, Barcelona, Spain
review: Great hotel. Very comfortable, clean, friendly staff. Good location. Walked up to 30-40 mins to various attractions, et. Room was modern, well-equipped. TV tad small for size of room and remote did not work great, but OK. The channel guide was not working and there was limited channel selection, especially for the English-speaking tourist.
title: Very Nice Hotel

hotelLocation: Av. Diagonal de Barcelona, Barcelona, Spain
review: Booked through Qantas hotels and not dissapointed. Very good position for this hotel, great and helpful staff at the reception. Clean, nice big bathroom, all amenities as you expect. .Clean and cosy Very close to everything interesting. We even walked from Plaza Espana after a nice evening watching the Magic fountain there. Walking distance to the best shopping in Barcelona, lots of restaurants and also your Hop on Hop off Tour bus. Across the hotel is El Corte Ingles - big shopping centre for your everyday needs if neccessary. Public transport as well.We enjoyed breakfast, but could have more options. Located on top floor with nice views, and small pool when hot and nothing better to do. Great for evening drinks to relax after long day. Room has flat screen TV, but no english speaking channels. Coffee and tea making facilities, water included. Overall - good choice for holiday as well business trip.
title: Little gem within the Vincci chain

review: A short break of two nights was all we had time for, but in this short stay the staff, hotel amenities and services were at it's best. The jr suite is perfect for a family of four. Breakfast is great and location is perfect with the metro 5 min away. I highly recommend this hotel.
title: Great family hotel

review: Great place to stay, room was always clean, staff were helpful and friendly, hotel location seemed to be classy and few meters from bus and tram stations, around 400 meters from subway station, all day long there were taxis in front of the hotel, on the other side of the street there's a nice mall, bed was nice, bathroom also nice specially shower room, I asked for iron and they provided me at onceLobby's odor was always pleasantIn general I loved my stay in this hotelThanks Novotel management team
title: Great hotel and friendly staff

review: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of days at the start of a holiday in Spain. Our flight arrival time meant that we had to check in very late at about midnight and the reception staff were curt and very slow. We had booked a family room, but when we got to it, it was not prepared for a family just double occupancy.The hotel is not located in the main tourists part of the town, although it is fairly close to a metro station.On the whole I would regard it as just an average hotel charging 5 star prices. I'm sure there is far better for the money available in Barcelona.
title: Expensive average hotel

review: Only good things to say about our stay here. Good location with fabulous view of sagrada familia. Less than five minutes walk to metro and tram stations. Room was big by city standards, food was good and lively bar on top floor. The gym was well equipped with stunning views. Will definitely be back.
title: Great hotel

review: Visited for my birthday, requested early check-in & had to wait 3hours, kids running about & jumping in the pool, charged me room tax twice, staff are useless, breakfast is awful, went back to room 1 day & there was a man in our room & most of the gym equipment didn't work
title: Not the best hotel

review: We are a couple with two boys and stayed at the Novotel Barcelona City for 6 nights in July 2017Location :Very good. Not in the "heart" of Barcelona but on a nice and quiet ( and less touristy area ) which was nice. Many buses and metro around the hotel ( 3-5 minutes walk ) . We had a shopping mall across the street and 3 blocks form the hotel there is a street called Rambla de Plobenou with lots of restaurants . A taxi or a cabify to Ls Ramblas was around 8 eurosRoom :Good size ( for European standards ) , the kids slept on a sofa bed that was comfortable . The rooms and bathrooms are very modern. They all have a safe and enough closet for you to organize your stuffBreakfastVery good, we are glad we got the package that had breakfast included . It goes until 11 AMRooftop:Off of the main reasons why we stayed here, we thought it was a great idea to have a place to hang and also a good pool for the kids to chill out after a busy summer day . We loved it and went there almost every day. They also had music 3 or 4 nights and kids entertainment . A bar with refreshments and appetizers was also availableService :Very good, staff was friendly and we didn't have any troubles Others:Restaurant at the main level ( we didn't go but it was always busy at night ) , we went to a place across the street and had a great "menu del dia" for $6/personThere are a couple of rental car places closed by Cabify ride from airport = $26 euros ( No uber here, only Cabify )Laundry : there's a coin operated laundry 3 blocks from the hotel
title: Family of 4 - 6 days at the Novotel Barcelona City

review: I was positively surprised with this hotel. It's not near the touristic attractions, but there's a subway station, two blocks away. It's an efficient mean of transportation, except for the stairs inside the stations. A big advantage is the existence of a mall with stores like FNAC, Carrefour, H&M etc. The room had adequate space for a couple with a child. Wifi was good too. There were not many options of TV channels. A nice restaurant with activities for the children at diinner. The terrace had a pool and fitness center. During several evenings there were a musical programming for the guests.
title: Very nice stay

review: a few minutes walk to glories station. Here are some directions:1. From the Airport - take the metro (Zona University line) to Torrassa (L1) Station, then take the train to Glories Station2. to Picasso Museum - take metro Llacuna to Jaume. Walk about 9 minutes.3. to Park Guell - From Glories (L1) take to Catalunya. then take L3 (green) to Vallcarca
title: friendly helpful staff, good location, within walking distance to metro/Tram

review: Don't waste your money coming here. I'm not a complainer at all but I wouldn't come back or recommend this hotel. Breakfast is rubbish, poor selection of non-fresh food. reception Staff cant be bothered helping you.Been out site seeing all day and just wanted a cup of tea when we landed back but they don't serve drinks on the ground floor in summer so you have to go upto the 19th floor if you want a drink.Nightmare if you don't like lifts!!!Rooms are basic and nothing special - Right next door to the hotel is some kind of outdoor disco which goes on all day till about 11pm - really loud and does your head in!!!Location not that great with a lack of decent restaurants close by.Would defo not NOT come back.
title: Avoid this Hotel

review: The Novotel Barcelona City was surprisingly easy to get to by car. It has a very good underground car park with large parking spaces, this costs €18 but is worth it I think for 24 hours.We arrived in the city by mid-morning so parked up and explored until the evening when we checked in. The room was a good size and had a big walk in shower in the bathroom rather than a bath. Breakfast was a let down. It felt like eating in a conference room. The choice of food wasn’t great, so we didn’t get great value for the money.The only other comment was that the lift to the underground car park and the car park itself smelt of bad drains and was quite unpleasant.
title: Novotel Barcelona - very convenient for one day trip

review: Room rather small with 2 kids, but ok. Room was clean.Most annoying: very bad smell in the bathroom. Complained and they send housekeeping but problem could not be solved. I suppose other rooms had the same problem, because we smelled it also in the street where the hotel is located. Hence maybe the hotel couldn't help this and did the best they can, but for me this is the reason why I will never book this hotel again. For a few days we could manage, but if we had stayed here for e.g. a week this would not have been feasable.The hotel staff could easily smell this themselves and should immediately have offered another room (if the problem was room-located).Breakfast: ok, enough choice. Some places however should get a better lightning (rather dark).Rooftop terrace: went there for a drink in the evening. Rather strange choice of placing high seats on stones: not stable, not comfortable. Staff was friendly, but the cocktails we ordered (Margarita & Cosmopolitan) were what I would call "undrinkable". If you don't manage the job to make cocktails please don't offer it on the card.Location: a bit outside the center, but that's not a problem. Everything within walking distance or via the metro or busstops nearby.Yoga: very much liked the offered yoga-session in the morning!So mixed feelings about this hotel: doubted between poor and average.To make a comparison: I stayed at the Novotel in Luxemburg a few times (also 4*) and compared to this one in Barcelona I would rather gives the Luxemburg hotel a 5* and the Barcelona hotel a 3*.
title: No 4*

review: A lovely modern hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Room was a standard double with sofa bed for two teen boys. Clean, enough room for 4 nights . Breakfast great, lots of choice. Pool terrace on roof great for afternoon cool offs. Liked Glories as an area as close to metro, teams and taxi tank outside hotel. Best thing was the shopping mall which was under construction across road. Huge Carrefour supermarket to get drinks and food for the day. Selection of restaurants for at night with a lot of variety if you didn't want to go too far. The only downside was check in which was a bit of a lengthy process.
title: Great base

review: Chose this as an Accor member and based on location and reviews. Just wonderful experience. We had a free upgrade, some gifts for my toddler, discounted breakfast buffet and wonderful staff. Room (modern, comfy) was upgraded for free, with a magnificent view of downtown Barcelona, Sagrada, etc. Breakfast was outstanding.
title: Top-notch Barcelona Hotel

review: As I often say in my reviews, I am an Accors Hotel member and particularly like the Novotel. My experience around the world has been extremely reliable and Barcelona was no different. The way their rooms are designed is especially a favourite for me - very practical, well thought out and stylish. Best of all they are well sound-proofed, from the outside as well as the foyers and we were near the lifts, it was whisper quiet.The facilities comparative to the size of the hotel was the biggest con for me. The pool/rooftop bar combined is spectacular on first glimpse. The gym is right next to this on the same floor. But it was completely overrun by children (not complaining, I had a 5 year old) but there were too many people all of the time and not enough division between each area i.e. gym vs bar to get a noticeable reprieve. There were never enough seats, locations to set your things down and we were over it pretty quick.  The gym is also overrun by children who want to 'check' out the equipment - not sure where parents were and surprised children were allowed into this area.The location was a 20 min walk to Segrada Familia but we had an 83 yo and 5 yo in our party so was perhaps a bit out of the way. The local underground we struggled to find until the last day, yet it is very close (stupid on our part perhaps) and the tram line is a nice trip into the port.There are also only 3 lifts which are tiny and there was high frustration by many coming and going, especially flight crew who stay here and were trying to catch transfers. I heard several people complain. I did think the staff did a good job of trying to accommodate our requests, they were attentive and friendly. My ongoing frustration with Accor Hotels is that while it is lovely to have a special check-in desk for Accor members - it is (a) never manned and (b) your loyalty is never acknowledged when you step up to be checked in. Shame, this would be the icing on the cake.
title: Reliably Novotel

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Hotel Gaudi was perfect for our first visit to Barcelona! It's literally located steps from Las Ramblas, a main street in the center of the city with lots of shops and restaurants. The hotel staff was very accommodating for my brother's food allergies, which we greatly appreciated. They were always available to answer questions and show us places to go on a map. The rooms were clean and nice. The best part was the rooftop terrace/bar. It has comfortable couches, a small pool, and great views of one of Gaudi's works and the rest of the city skyline. It's a great place to watch the sunset and enjoy a glass of sangria!
title: Great location and service

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for 5 nights on first visit to Barcelona. Situated just off the famous La Ramblas promenade and close to subway. Not exactly inexpensive but rooms were excellent and hotel service good. Staff very friendly and helpful. Only downside was the breakfast which at €25 is overpriced for what you get but that seems to be to trend in Barcelona hotels. Rather don't take the breakfast and instead go to a taverna or the great food market down the road.
title: Great hotel in the heart of the Barcelona tourist district

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed here a few days after our cruise and thought the location could not have been better. Our room was spacious and had great views of Barcelona. We were in the center of everything. We were right on the Ramblas and loved the night life there. Lots of places to eat outside and people watch. We were close to the hop on hop off bus which is a wonderful way to see Barcelona. You could also see a lot of things on foot. We also did a lot of shopping. We loved Barcelona the architecture is so different.
title: Great Location and good value

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: You're paying for the location here, if you want five star luxury, go somewhere else however, if you're looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff in the heart of the city at a very good price, look no further! The hotel is just off the Ramblas right opposite the Guell palace, you can't get nearer to the beating heart of the city. Breakfast was indifferent but with good service. The rooms are basic but very comfortable and despite us overlooking the main street, surprisingly quiet. This is a great hotel for exploring the finest that Barcelona has to offer.
title: Location, Location Location

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: The air conditioning was not working very well. It is hot in Barcelona in July!Someone had been smoking in the room and the air unit was just circulating the smoke. We both woke up feeling ill. The sheets had holes in them and we were sleeping on box springs not a mattress. We were each allowed one towel.We were very disappointed and tried to book another hotel but there was noneAvailability. The hotel was clean and the sangria was very good but notgood enough for us to be able to sleep through the night. We were exhausted.
title: Hot in Barcelona!

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is 3 star and therefore relatively basic, but there was nothing to complain about and the location is excellent. Our family room was very sizeable; it was at the back of the hotel, so the view was not great at all, but it had the advantage of being amazingly quiet, considering the proximity to the (heaving) busy La Rambla.The roof top terrace bar, with glass fronted foot pool was a real treat. There are views all around Barcelona city and down to the port, with the Palau Guell (Gaudi designed) rooftop directly opposite. Personally, I would have thought that this premier location could be turned into a much more expensive cocktail bar, but it was certainly a very pleasant addition as it was.We did not eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on that, but would definitely stay here again, if visiting Barcelona.
title: Excellent location, decent hotel

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed at the Gaudi hotel for two nights , the location was fantastic just a few minutes from Las Ramblas.The rooms are spacious and comfortable except there are no tea and coffee facilities in the rooms. Also the room does not have a fridge which I found very difficult as I had no where to store my insulin.I asked for a fridge and was advised to bring my insulin down to reception and they would refidgerate it and give it when needed, I take 4 injections a day so this was impossible.The service was incredibly bad except for One receptionist named Laura who was fantastic.Also there was no key for the safe.Also the room was not cleaned until after 3 pm.
title: Great Location

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Visited over the weekend, 2 night stay with friends. We all had a double room for single occupancy, 3 rooms overall. It was a great location, rooms were clean and did what we needed. Our rooms were very small with little natural light, inward rooms that faced a wall. Overall this is okay as to be honest all we needed was a room to sleep & Shower, however for the price we paid we felt it didn't represent value for money. We've stayed in better hotels (rooms, view, size, location) for less in Barcelona. We did see the balcony rooms and they were amazing!The terrace bar was lovely, the staff welcoming and friendly with aircon and free wifi. Overall a good hotel, a great hotel if you get a room with a balcony!
title: 3.5 out of 5!

hotelLocation: Nou de la Rambla 12, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Hotel staff was amazingly welcoming and helpful. The rooms arnt overly big however in such a beautiful city you don't want to spend much time inside. The breakfast is reasonably priced and has a great selection. Room service is also fast and attentive. We were lucky enough to have a massive balcony with city views. Rooms were clean and tidy and staff were very professional when cleaning our rooms. Location if perfect, I suggest going to Güell Tapas on the same street as the hotel. Amazing food and beautiful staff. The combination made our time in Barcelona so memorable.
title: Perfect for traveling as a couple

review: Lovely hotel although it's little bit further away from the main scene (i.e the marina, and the Rambles). The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There were a few restaurants close by and a shopping centre not too far either and it was also a stones throw away from the beach. I would definitely stay here again, can't fault it in anyway.
title: Would recommend

review: The overall experience I had at the hotel was generally average. I found that the room was quite average when compared to others I have stayed at. The breakfast buffet could be improved by increasing the quality of the omelette that is made.
title: July

review: I recently stayed here for a couple of nights on a business trip. I enjoyed the quietness and the view from the room. It was a relaxing stay with a well presented breakfast selection. The staff were very helpful and friendly and most spoke enough English for me to get by. The hotel had free WiFi but I was unable to get this to work but as I was only there for a short while it wasn't a problem for me.
title: Friendly and welcoming

review: Good hotel with roof pool and bar. Great breakfast. Location by the beach an easy 10 min walk to Port Olimpic restaurants and bars. Right next to green route tour bus stop that can be used as a hop on hop off taxi service. Good clean rooms.
title: Great Hotel right on tour bus route

review: Hotel location is good, close to the beach.Front desk experience was the biggest downside of our stay.Rooms were nice depending on room type. Comfortable beds.A la carte restaurant menu needs more selection.
title: Good enough

review: Very nice hotel in outstanding location with great staff. The breakfast was exceptional and the pool area that overlooks the ocean was breathtaking. The rooms are nice especially those overlooking the ocean. The hotel is a little far from city center.
title: Excellent Stay with Small Group

review: It is close to the see and offices in that area, however far from city center. I could not set properly the room air condition, it was too coold or warm. I didn ot find description about room thermostat settings. The area is quiet, but I do not recommend to get room on the street side on 1st to 6th floors - too much traffic noise.
title: Good option for business travellers

review: Out of the heat and hubbub of the city center, the accommodations, friendliness of staff and access to the beach provided a very relaxing venue to a business conference with an easy ten minute walk to the convention center. The food at the cafe was very good. I highly recommend the artichoke salad with romescu sauce
title: Convention traveler

review: Had a most enjoyable weekend here.Rooms clean and tidy. All staff were very helpful and friendly.The hotel is well situated with good access to both tube stations and bus routes with a good selection of bars and restraunts in the local area.The downside of us re-visiting this hotel was the sewage smell outside the hotel, the poor quality of the cooked breakfast and the extortionate cost of the 4 poster sun lounger(€100 - €170) per day or a basic sun lounger €20 per day.
title: Weekend break

review: I am staying in this hotel with my wife for our honeymoon, the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with great hospitality and the very nice and helpful staff.the nice ladies at the reception upgraded us to a deluxe room with a partial sea view the moment they knew we were on our honey moon.also the tourist help guide is a fantastically helpful person who highlighted the sights, the transportation and everything.and the moment we entered the room we were greeted by complimentary desserts.the hotel is a bit far from the city center but we prefer this to the crowded areas as the rooms are very calm although facing a main street and the beach.excellent room, excellent service, very highly recommended. the staff really make this place more special!Thank you guys for making our honeymoon a better experience.
title: one of the nicest hotels ever!

review: I stayed here for business and came back two years later with family because of the great beach/city location, friendly and helpful staff, and overall nice experience. I was not disappointed and loved my second stay.
title: Great location, helpful staff

review: Excellent service, food, pool facilities, and location for the beach. Wifi, Air conditioning worked perfectly from anywhere in the hotel and very helpful and welcoming staff. This hotel exceeded our expectations.
title: Highly recommended! Great stay in Barcelona

review: The hotel is very close to the beach and on the hop on/off bus route with taxis available less than a minute away. Reception staff are hit and miss, some ok others not very helpful or friendly, cafe staff are all miserable. Breakfast is a joke, 17€ each and served on saucers, you can eat as much as u like but it wasn't very nice, pasties were ok though but not worth the money! Pool area looks nice but 20€ for a sunbed and 100€ for the larger beds is ridiculous, beanbags are available and are comfy for about 2 mins, not good if you want to sunbathe, bar staff by the pool are rude. There was a taxi strike on the day we left, hotel did not inform us before, we had to read it on an A4 poster by the lift, we usually took the stairs so lucky to see it. Had to drag all of our cases to the metro, this made us miss our flight, if hotel had bothered to inform people checking out that day it would of helped us plan our trip home, a note under the door maybe!! Overall we would not stay at this hotel and do not recommend, sorry occidental!!
title: Average stay

review: Very comfortable hotel and location, nice and tiny swimming pool area, the only inconvenient is if you want a sunbed you have to pay an extra otherwise you can comfortably accomodate on a sofa chair. I have experienced a very good service, the hotel is next to the seaside and only five minutes walking from the beach, whatever you want you just ask and you will have it. If you want to surprise your partner with a present to be found directly in the room you have many choices proposed by the hotel, management is attentive and accurate. Good vibes.
title: Just ask

review: We did not get the room we pay for it was clean but very small, that is about all bad we have to say, nice staf, little pool and not enaugh space to go into pool. since we close to beach it was no problem with that so we go there instead.Close to bus and metro, but dont eat at the restaurant they need to improve a lot, go to restaurant close to hotel instead many many to chose from. 3 at the beach and like 10 around there with tapas and other, no 5 stars but ok if you want to fill your little belly ;)Any way i would go there again the weather is fantastic and walk at the beach nighttime 25 warm is worth the trip and place itself
title: Nice hotel

review: Had been here in June 2017 and the place was a nice cosy place in the heart of barcelona near La Ramblas Street. The place has an interesting decor and looks really good. The rooms are a little small but are quiet cosy. Only con is that they dont allow you to take the keys but there is someone at the reception 24*7. Had a great time there
title: A chic hotel

review: Good Hotel very central location. Barcelona is dirty – very dirty. The smell of sewerage hangs in the air constantly. Beggars and people defecating in the streets are fairly common. Hotel Leonardo was a good heaven to return to after walking the streets of the City. The standard rooms are very small – concider an upgrade if you are staying longer than a day or 2. Room has aircon – bit noisy but it works. Coffee/Tea making facility in room. Bathroom very good. Breakfast excellent and worth booking when you make your reservation (unless you want to eat in the stinky streets).Restaurants worth visiting: El Callejo. Excellent service and very good food. Pintor extremely good food. Little more pricey, but worth it.
title: Haven in a smelly City

review: The location of this hotel is fantastic. Great restaurants, shopping and walking distance to public transportation. The roof top pool is small but nice. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Check in was very slow, but the stay there was worth it. I would join their rewards club as the benefits are worth it. All of the sites of Barcelona are accessible from this hotel via taxi or public transportation. If you like good food and shopping would suggest staying in this part of town and the Leonardo is a great option.
title: Great Location and Good Accommodations

review: We booked this hotel last minute at a very reasonable price and were pleased with the location. It is very close (less than 2 minutes walk) to the food market, where we walked for breakfast each day. It is also less than 2 minutes from Las Rambla and a short walk from the waterfront. The nearest metro station is also very close and allowed us to get to Park Guell very quickly with no train changes and also to several other main sites. Everything else was walkable. The rooms were clean, a decent size and had excellent air conditioning facilities. The pool on the roof is small but is just what is needed if you fancy a lazy afternoon on a sun lounger. Staff dealt with a leak in our room (which was the fault of those staying about us) calmly and quickly so that it didn't impact on our stay at all. Would definitely stay here again if I return to Barcelona.
title: Perfect location

review: This hotel is very central in Barcelona in the old town near Las Ramblas, it has comfortable air conditioned rooms, a roof top pool and a good selection of buffet breakfast options.A ggod palce for a weekend in barcelona
title: Comfortable Hotel with roof top pool

review: The hotel is not on the Ramblas as the title implies . It's about 10 minutes walk off the Ramblas we where very impressed with the hotel the room we had was very clean and a decent size . The staff at the reception where very very helpful with assistance and information. Thank you for your advice and help
title: Nice hotel

review: Me and my 2 friends visited Barcelona in June 11 - 14, 2017. We booked a room for 3 persons. The check in was quick and fast. The receptionist is very accommodating. Our room was not yet ready when we checked in, it was yet early, before 12 noon. We kept our luggage in the locker just beside the reception. We used euro coin to lock the locker and then we went sight seeing. We came back to the hotel at night, quiet exhausted after a long day sight seeing in the city. We got our room keys and got in the room in the 4th floor. We discovered that the bed was prepared only for two persons, there were no extra pillow and bed sheet for the 3rd guest and the extra bed are not fixed. Me and my friend went down ( although we were so exhausted ) to the reception to complain. The receptionist ( male ) just gave us extra pillow, bed sheet and extra towel and told us to fix the bed ourselves. Ive stayed in different hotels in many different countries already but this experience is new to me. Usually someone from the hotel will fix the bed for the guest. The following day, our towels were replaced but stil we got towels for two instead for three guests. We went again in the reception to ask for another 1.But anyway, our room is big. There were 2 airconditions in our room but unluckily only one is functioning, but ok. The breakfast is good, they tried to make variations. Good selection og juice and warm drinks. Very comfy breakfast chairs and tables. The swimming pool in the rooftop is not really as big as we can see in their website. The elevator is somewhat slow but ok.The location is perfect. Easy to find and accessible to public transport. Near restaurants and shopping. Wifi is good
title: 3 day Trip with friends

review: We recently stayed 4 nights in this hotel prior to a cruise, followed by a further night post cruise. We had booked a deluxe room for the 4 night stay which we found to be very spacious and furnished to a high standard - very pleasant on the eye. Very comfortable bed and TV's both in the sitting area and bed area. The bathroom was also spacious and nicely finished. Also, pleasantly surprised to find complimentary wine, water and snacks in the deluxe room on arrival. The breakfast buffet was also excellent. Nice food and more than enough choice. Small pool and terrace on the roof. Bars in both the ground floor and rooftop at the pool but generally only 1 bar open - depending on the weather - which is fine! No restaurant facilities other than breakfast. Hotel is not in the most attractive street in Barcelona but only 2 streets off La Rambla so overall a great location and good value for money. 5 min walk from Metro station and many bars and restaurants. Approx 34 Euros by taxi to the airport and <20 Euros to the cruise port. Staff are very friendly especially Ali on the front desk at night - full of helpful advice! I see from other reviews that some rooms are less spacious but we really could not fault the deluxe room. We would definitely look to use this hotel if we visit Barcelona again.
title: Excellent small hotel close to La Rambla

review: Great location , near Las Ramblas. The street it was on was scruffy but don't let this put you off. Room was an adequate size for 2people . With air conditioning, to etc Clean, well decorated. Roof top pool area a bonus for relaxing after a busy sightseeing day. ( pool is small but what do you expect) . I would've scored it 5 stars if breakfast was included. I would recommend this hotel to friends
title: Short break to Barcelona

review: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. The hotel is just a few minutes walks from Las Ramblas. The hotel room was quite small but clean and had a large bathroom. The view from the window was another buildings wall, but that didn't bother much as we didn't spend much time in the hotel room. The rooftop was great with a small pool to dip into. The sangria at the bar was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.
title: Children friendly hotel in great location

review: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the start of our Europe holiday- 2 adults and 2 teenage children in a deluxe family room (June 20th 2017). It was fantastic. Reception staff cant be more helpful and friendly. Our room was a good size for Europe hotels- it had 3 single beds and a double futon sort of bed- enough space for 3 large bags. Not large enough to comfortably spend the day in the room but we never planned on doing that. Large bathroom. Hotel is located 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas- you couldn't find a better location. 5 minute walk to a train station and buses. The breakfast was good- wasnt fantastic but good enough to start your day well- scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, yoghurt, dry meats, plenty of options for toast, croissants, Mediterranean options. Clean dining room with plenty of space. We used the pool daily. It is quite small but my kids found it better than nothing after a long day of touring. It isnt deep- about hip height but enough to refresh and cool down on a hot day. They provide towels for a small deposit which you get back when you return the towels. There is also a bar service by the pool which is nice at the end of the day. Wifi worked well for 4 people on 4 devices whilst in the room all the time. No noise at night.I will definitely be recommending this hotel to friends and family.
title: Great hotel close to Las Ramblas

review: We have just come back from our vacation and we already miss Barcelona. We spent 10 nights in the city at the Theater Auditori Hotel at the recommendation of a friend. The staff was welcoming and friendly. The hotel is positioned relatively close to Torre Glories and Sagrada Familia. From Torre Glories you can easily reach anywhere in Barcelona with various means of transport, buses, trams and metro.From the hotel reception you can buy tickets for different tourist attractions.Karina Rut have been very attentive and friendly with good recommendations on tourist routes. Bedding changed daily and breakfast ok.The beach is about 25 minutes' walk away.We hope to return to the city in the future.
title: A nice holiday in Barcelona

review: Nothing to tell.Hotel is good central,lot of eat possibilities in the near area.Breakfast topStaff are very well,speaks a lot of languages,help in every situation.I can recommended espescially Karina.Thank you one more by this way
title: all was ok

review: Good clean and friendly hotel conveniently located to the World Trade Center in Barcelona. Friendly staff and good breakfast. Simple but clean rooms. 24 hour security at the door. reception very helpful.
title: Business Stay

review: This is a modern well run hotel. The room was modern, air conditioned and clean with a comfortable bed. The Wifi wrks well and the hotel is only a short walk from the harbour and Las Rambla. The only downside is that it does not have a bar but I would certainly stay again
title: Overnight in Barcelona

review: we stayed here 2 nights before a cruise. 7th floor room, very nice. very friendly, helpful staff; gave directions, maps, ideas for eats, transportation, arranged tours(Trevor, Jordi, young woman(sorry cant remember name)).very good water pressure in showers(careful with spray to not flood bathroom). bed very comfy. daily service good. did not eat there. ate nearby for bfast.very helpful exchange of emails before we arrived helped figure out ideas.near metro. short walk to blain st eats. short taxi ride to port. good stay...
title: great location, very helpful staff

review: The location of the hotel is excellent, it's nearby the port and the ramblas.we have an easier access to the metro and bus station, and also for a taxi.But we were disappointed about the cleanliness of the room: the stuff didn't do properly their job and our neighbors were so loud specially between 1 and 4am.
title: my experience

review: This hotel was terrible. I requested a quiet room but I was given a room opposite where a music concert was playing until about 3am so I got no sleep on my first night. The windows are useless so you can hear everything outside. I moved to another room (after a lot of discussion) for my second night. In this room the aircon didn't work as the window was broken. I had to push a chair up against the window to keep it closed so the aircon would work. In this room you could hear chairs dragging across the floor in other rooms. One of the worst hotel experiences I've had.
title: Very noisy and not worth the cost

review: Rhe front desk service was exelent. Room was great. Breakfast had everything. I recomend this hotel anyday small but really nice. Located very close to the City center. Only a few minutes walk to the beach.
title: Elegant with exelent service 😍

hotelLocation: Carrer de Lope de Vega, 4, 08005 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here with a group of friends for an end of school holiday.Had 3 rooms for 7 of us all, rooms were clean and fine. Bathroom was ok. Breakfast was good, but I've had a lot better.Hotel reception and lobby is very nice and modern. Location is perfect, able to walk everywhere in the city, right next to the beach, McDonalds nearby was a lifesaver, lots of near by restaurants with good value and choice.Would stay again, but only because of how cheap we managed to stay here for.
title: Good enough

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: We had a one night stay here before our cruise out of the Barcelona port, and we were so VERY pleased with our stay. We booked a Club level room, and were more than satisfied with how large our room was and how quiet it was, even though we were close to the elevators. We really enjoyed the extra amenities that came with the club level room, and would recommend the upgrade to anyone who stays here! We stayed at a different hotel on our return from our cruise, but were much more satisfied with the VALUE of the Crowne Plaza hotel and will return to this hotel next year when we come back. Thank you for the best hotel experience of our trip Crowne Plaza Barcelona!!!
title: Highlight of our trip!

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: We added a day to our Celebrity Equinox cruise and spent the night at this wonderful hotel in Barcelona. This was the first time we stayed at a Crowne Plaza property and were amazed at the size of the room and the extensive (included) breakfast buffet. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona. The location is outside the city center, but a reasonable taxi ride.
title: Luxury describes this hotel

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed in a suite and paid extra for the Club Room. It was worth the extra expense because we had a full breakfast buffet in the morning, free drinks for most of the day, and snacks in the evening. The club room also had a concierge who was very knowledgable and helpful. The fitness room was great for a hotel. This was the perfect hotel for the three of us.
title: WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Would 100% recommend. Not too far from nearest metro, our room came with a beautiful view which could also be found on their gorgeous rooftop bar. Breakfast was lovely and staff were very helpful. The complementary hat and fan was a great touch! All around brilliant base for your Barcelona trip!
title: Could not fault this hotel!

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed for 5 nights in the club level. As you walk into the holel, there is a nice airy, spacious lobby with a bar and restaurant. Large comfortable rooms have a decor was that was soothing and neutral. . Room air conditioning was great with your own thermostat which kept the room cool day and night. The room was serviced regularly.. Staff were very pleasant and helpful The club room served tasty food and wine. The kind and patient concercierge staff were knowledgeable. There were always taxis outside. The location is in a quiet section, near the museum of art and magic fountain. We were very pleased with our stay there.
title: Perfect hotel for a pre cruise stay

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: From start to finish it was brilliant. A good location close to the metro and a reasonable walk to the main areas. The car park is great as well. The staff took care of our case as we arrived early and set off for our exploration of the city. We came back later to check in and were taken to the club lounge as we had booked club rooms. The staff were fantastic and we enjoyed a drink there with our children and checked in, our case was taken to our room while we were there. Breakfast was great, exactly what we needed and was also served in the club lounge. There is a new roof top pool which is small but enjoyable with a great view the bar is also nice with a good selection of food. We had a late check out so returned here after a trip to Camp Nou for a drink and some nibbles. I would not hesitate to stay here again, brilliant !!!
title: The best Crowne Plaza I've stayed in

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: The rooms were very clean and the decor was modern. The staff was quick to accommodate our last minute needs and allowed early check-in. The hotel is near the magic Fountain, Art Museum and Arenas which is an old bull fighting ring turned into a shopping mall which are all in walking distance.
title: Modern and clean

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: I had a great stay at this recently rennovated Hotel next to the exhibition center.Very friendly stuff, great restaurant. Outstanding rooftop poolbar which is a highlight here.Rooms are spacious and I even had Nespresso coffee maker in my room (guess it was a club room or so)Plaza de Espana Metro station is 500m away. Aerobus from the airport is €5,90 going all 5 minutes as well good for return. Taxi is about €29,- Ramblas are 4km away. €8 by taxi.Overall: great experience and I would choose this again but I guess a busy place if there is a exhibition.
title: Great location - just renovated!

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: We booked this at the last minute but our normal preferred location is near the Barcelonetta beach / Ramblas. This hotel is out of the way of those but only about a 10 mins taxi ride away. It is near The Magic Fountain (on the same road, a 5 min walk away) which was lovely as we enjoyed the fountain show. A shopping mall is nearby too - again walking distance.The lobby is large, clean and very relaxing with plenty of seating. The rooms are designed really well and are well maintained. The air con is effective, the bathroom is very contemporary and overall the rooms are really comfortable. The beds and the recliner chair are all comfortable for their purpose. Loved the USB charging points by the desk and the bed for phone / iPad charging - every hotel needs those!! Free fast wifi too was great!The breakfast was tasty and plentiful. Loved the omelette station - very tasty fresh omelettes!The only criticism is the spa. The treatments are overpriced for what they are. The therapists need more training to give more effective massage treatments and really disappointed that you had to pay 15 euros to use the spa pool and gym having spent so much on the hotel rooms! This needs to change! No wonder it was empty...total rip off.The walls of the rooms were thin and you could hear everything next door. The windows are pretty thin too and we were kept awake at night by an alarm from a nearby building / car outside. IHG needs to build thicker / better sound proofed rooms.
title: Good clean hotel - near The Magic Fountain

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here two separate times. Both rooms were very clean and updated. We had lunch and breakfast at restaurants. One out of two breakfasts, scrambled eggs were scary, soupy. Lunch... we ordered pizza and a burger. Pizza crust was stale (beyond expiration) and medium well burger I ordered was raw and lost appetite. Even fries tasted out of date. Looking for a nice clean place to stay, this is nice. Food wise? Get a taxi to go else where!
title: Rooms clean and nice. Looking for food or view very poor.

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Top notch hotel with very good service, rooms, business centre and breakfast A little out of town but no issue if your not afraid of walking or taking tubeDecent gym and spaLarge selection of continental food at breakfast including Chinese breakfast options
title: Fantastic for business

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed at hotel recently in July (high season) in a Club Level room with King Sized Bed. Hotel located in safe area with great access to public transportation and many of the local tourist attractions for a reasonable cost. The room was large and comfortable with good AC. The bed was very comfortable and the best sleep we had while in Greece, Montenegro, Italy and Spain. Bathroom was good sized also with separate shower/tub and toilet, both of us were easily able to get ready without bumping into each other. Room had a safe that fit a 17" laptop along with all our other valuables. Desk was spacious (although chair not super comfy) and a large flat screen TV. The Club had nice sitting area w/ snacks, drinks etc during the day. They also had a good breakfast included each day with our room. Staying at the club level provided private check in/out and concierge service in the club. DangXia was VERY helpful and provided a wealth of info that made our time in Barcelona the best possible. Have already recommended the hotel to a couple of colleagues who are traveling in Oct and Nov.
title: July 2017 Stay

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed one night here and it is in a good location, very quiet just next to the old Fira congress center. The rooms are good, nothing special but the beds are nice, the aircon works and the bathroom is really nice. The breakfast is very good, with excellent orange juice, pastries, eggs cooked for you and a Nespresso machine definitely worth having. A good hotel but for what we paid would not stay again for that price.
title: Does what it is promised to do

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for 1 night with friends. Ideal location for airport and also centre of town. Very clean, excellent rooms (just done up I think). A short stay but couldn't fault it and will definitely use again if visiting Barcelona.
title: Excellent stay

hotelLocation: Avenida de Rius I Taulet, 1-3, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
review: Returned to Barcelona for 5 days to catch up with family who were visiting here as well, excellent hotel, breakfast amazing best omelettes ever! The hotel is busy but you would never known that it's so quite, Clean and friendly staff . Can't think of anything that wasn't right about it.
title: Return to Barcelona

review: Just spent 2 nights with my extended family at The Gallery Hotel.The location is fantastic (perfect for walking everywhere), the staff could not have been more helpful (from our arrival, to chasing down a stray taxi on departure!), the breakfasts were outstanding, and the rooms/decor were well designed and comfortable. Infact, the beds are probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in!Would thoroughly recommend..
title: Well located gem in the heart of Barcelona

review: We really enjoyed our stay in Gallery hotel. It is a clean and comfortable hotel in a convinient location. Staff is helpful and our room was very nice and clean. The rooftop terrace was good to relax before or after sightseeing.
title: Recommended for a relaxed stay in Barcelona

review: Classical and stylish hotel with very good facilities (including kettle in the room!!) and attentive service. Very nice bar with a garden and a good restaurant (both open to non-residents). Close to Passeig de Gracia for both sightseeing and convenient transportation links. Busy area for shopping and nightlife.
title: Classic central hotel

review: Just returned from a weekend break at Gallery Hotel and well what a find. Having not been to Barcelona before I had no idea where anything was and this Hotel was exactly as described, 15 minutes stroll to La Ramblas. This hotel is located in a great area, a little bit away from hustle and bustle and so nice to return to after a day sightseeing.We had room 103 which was a lovely size, well equipped with toiletries, tea n coffee and minibar. Hairdryer, dressing gowns and slippers to. The bed was very comfortable and although at the front no noise from the road below.The pool at the top is small but enough to just cool off and chill in at the end of the day. The lady in the bar up here was great and never seemed to stop, her cocktails were to die for.The Gallery cafe to side of hotel was a bit hit and miss, I dont think they had the attention to detail as the rest of the staff. We had an evening meal with the music night and the food and service was good. We had pre and after dinner drinks most night from the bar sitting outside which was delightful. Matias, Mustafa served us very wel over the course of our stay but Bashir stood out from the crowd. He was always so welcoming, remembered our drinks, made pleasant conversation and made us all laugh, he really was first class and genuinely seemed pleased to greet us.Breakfast was lacking a bit in organisation, it all seemed a bit chaotic when sometimes coffee and juices were outside but then not the next day, had to go search for jams/salt n pepper that sort of thing, but the food on offer was again very nice and plentiful.Olga checked us in and a nice touch is the way she gave us a guided tour of the hotel and a few tips to get the best out of our trip. Javi on reception was also very helpful whenever we needed anything/questions.On a very big plus, wifi was available free of charge and was very reliableI would definetly recommend this stay for the comfort, location and staff
title: Weekend Break

review: Our friends in Barcelona told us that Gallery Hotel was the best place for us to stay on this, our first visit to Barcelona. The desk staff was always ready with big smiles and lots of suggestions of what to see and do.
title: A wonderful hotel in Barcelona.

review: Great location, well appointed and quiet room with the most comfortable bed. Friendly and attentive Reception staff who gave us a personal tour of the hotel facilities and our room. The only not so good point here was our evening meal in the hotel restaurant was terrible.
title: The best bed in Spain

review: Nice option for central Barcelona, with an easy location to reach shops, touristic spots and public transportation. Breakfast is varied and complete. Personnel is friendly. Swimming pool is very small though. I found a little bit expensive at the end, but considering other prices around for high season, it's finally worth.
title: Central location, good breakfast

review: Comfortable stay with all nearby walking distance. On request the check out time was extended. You will receive and free welcome drink during your stay. The family rooms are very spacious and the sofa bed is perfect for 02 kids
title: Stay in Gallery Hotel Barcelona

review: We stayed 4 nights at Gallery Hotel spending vacation. The hotel is located one block from Passeig the Gracia, which is the main avenue of BCN (all the stores and 2 of main Gaudí museums are). If you have good mobility you can explore everything walking. We could get to La Sagrada Família, Casa Battló, Parque Güell (this is kinda far), and Casa Milá. Great restaurants and stores are just by as well. A place to stay in BCN.
title: The right choice in BCN

review: Stayed at the Gallery for two nights end of July. Reception staff Aaron and Ricardo were welcoming and attentive on our arrival and throughout our stay. Always happy to help and advise us on directions to places and transport around the city etc.Our room was quiet, modern and clean, everything was supplied, from toiletries, (even a toothbrush) to slippers, a fluffy dressing gown and a powerful, effective hairdryer. The bed was SSSOOOO comfortable. Breakfast was buffet style, lots of choice and food was replenished frequently. We sat out in the courtyard each morning which was delightful. There are lots of local places to eat around the hotel. If you walk out the back of the hotel, through the park and turn left, they are in abundance.The roof top bar is a very pleasant, relaxing space, especially at the end of a long, hot day sight seeing. However, we did feel the prices of the cocktails / drinks were a little on the expensive side.I would absolutely recommend this hotel as a fab place to stay. If I find myself back in Barcelona I would definitely book the Gallery.
title: Great hotel in the heart of the city

review: Spent one night here pre-cruise. The staff were all very friendly and helpful...they happily accommodated a late checkout. The room was very nice, clean, beds comfortable. Good breakfast and coffee - indoor and outdoor seating. Only positive things to say.
title: Lovely hotel in great location

review: We stayed at the Gallery Hotel for our first few nights in Spain this July. Traveling with my son, daughter in law and three teenaged grandsons. The location gave us easy access to the spots we wanted to visit. For those places that were not walkable for me, taxis were available and reasonable. My room was small, but cozy. There was no view, but the bedding was lovely and there was literally no noise. The breakfast was fine and we loved the oppportunity to sit outside. The staff was friendly and attentive.
title: Perfect landing while in Barcelona

review: Lovely hotel, great location slightly away from the main tourist parts but easy to get everywhere. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Great breakfast selection and we had a wonderful evening meal as well. Barcelona is a fantastic city and I would definitely recommend the Gallery Hotel.
title: Fantastic hotel in an exciting city

review: Excellent service, location, staff and room. Would recommend staying here when visiting Barcelona. All staff were courteous and helpful at all times, we were upgraded and given a portable wifi to take around the city with us. Perfect location for shopping, dining and sightseeing! Axel was 10/10! Always paying attention and provided exceptional service beyond expectations.
title: Highly recommend

review: Very good value stay in a lovely part of Barcelona. The recent addition of the rooftop bar and pool made our stay all the more enjoyable. We stayed with family and friends and had a very enjoyable time. Service is good and reception staff very friendly and helpful.
title: Good value and great location

review: Gallery Hotel was conveniently located right by Diagonal station and a few minutes walk from the Casa Mila. There are a lot of restaurants, cafes, and supermarkets close by. The staff are very welcoming and I especially loved the bed they have at the hotel. Very soft and comfortable; by far the best bed I was on during my one month in Europe. Rooms are not enormous but the bathroom was very spacious. The pool I must say was even smaller than the photo looks, definitely more for soaking than swimming. There are no pool chairs either and just normal seating for the bar/restaurant which makes it hard for guests to lounge/relax for a long period of time. Breakfast was 19 euros so I just opted for the nearby cafes.
title: Best bed!

review: I spent one day/night at the Gallery Hotel before getting on a cruise. I found the hotel to be quite comfortable and staff to be friendly and helpful. (When I went down to late in the day to catch the cruise line rep to ask about the next day's transfer, the guy at the desk had all the answers I needed.)Room 411, economy roomThings I loved:* comfy bed* free Internet* breakfast included* great toiletry kit, though I would have loved the addition of a mouthwash* lots of outlet space* decently priced room service menu* free slippers * free welcome bottle of water* mini-fridge for putting your own drinksWhat could have been better:* a box of tissues was not in the room* the room I was in had no hotel info, so I didn't know what was available to me (ie restaurants, spa services, etc)* the location is ok, not the best but not bad either, main tourist sites are not as close as the brochure says though you can still walk to more than a few, including Sagrada Familia* no view at all, at least not for my room, in fact when I looked out my window i could see directly into other people's rooms, which of course means they could see into mine
title: Pre-cruise stay

review: My wife and I stayed at the Gallery Hotel in Barcelona and were blown away by the accommodation and the friendliest of the staff. The bed in our room was SO comfortable. The service ( especially by Falcon and Juanna) was excellent - the staff could not do enough to make our stay a highlight of our holiday in Barcelona. The location was central to the metro and all the major designer shops. It is located just off Passeig de Garcia and nearby to Gadi's la Pedrera which is a 3 minute walk. This place is the best and we will be back. Bob and Jan from Australia.
title: Holiday

review: Went there on my way home from my cruise of Mediterranean. The staff were very pleasant the location is fabulous. The breakfast the next day was amazing. Lots of variety. The room was great with lots do little extras included like toothbrushes. Very friendly staff that spoke English that made it a lot easier, they recommended some nice restaurants. Sorry I didn't have longer and only had one night here.
title: Nice hotel!

review: Very conveniently located close to all cool restaurants, subway and cool landmarks.. hotel staff is simply the best.. the cool part of the hotel is there is actual key not a key card.. the rooms are very upscale and modern.. breakfast is always the best.. I am not able to think of anything negative about this hotel.. highly recommend this place for traveler on business or pleasure..
title: Awesome Hotel in the Heart of Barcelona

review: Excellent staff. Beautiful rooms. Great location. Close to Hop On bus stops. Buy your ticket at the hotel at a better rate. We ate dinner one evening in the restaurant. Hermes our waiter was the best. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Great Hotel

review: When we first checked into the Gallery Hotel I was skeptical of its location because of the route we took to get there. I could not have been more wrong. One of the BEST THINGS about this hotel is the location. One block to the left is Passeig de Garcia where one of the famed Goude houses is located. It is also a major shopping avenue. To the right one block is another great shopping street. There are also many restaurants and cafes nearby. The location is definitely GREAT for walking. If you want to take a tour, the stops for both Hop on- Hop off tours is also about a block away as well.The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby and dining areas are comfortable and accommodating. The dining room offers a morning “ European” breakfast. There is also a rooftop pool and bar. It is a great place to relax after a day of shopping. The pool is not very big, and isn’t really for kids, but for adults to take a quick dip, it would be fine.The room I stayed in was of ample size with a queen bed, and 2 nightstands, a desk and lounging chair. The bathroom was very nice and again a very good size. The staff was also very lovely. Sara at the front desk and Axel the bellman were especially helpful.I would recommend this hotel if you are going to Barcelona. It is more American than European but if you don’t mind that… you are good.
title: Nice hotel, nice staff, nice location

review: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Gallery Hotel twice before my current stay, and the quality of service is always the best. The staff at reception, the porters and the housekeeping staff are friendly and very efficient. In the restaurant/bar, the service is welcoming and excellent, thanks to Nuria, Andres and their compañeros. I hope I will return soon!
title: Wonderful, attentive service

review: I went to Barcelona in a business trip and stayed at the hotel due to the great location. I was very pleased with the room and friendliness of the personnel. In particular I have to mention Javier and Ricardo at the reception for their help and suggestions and Bianca at the swimming pool... she is a treasure. I managed to get a full operating office under the sun overlooking the city from the pool at the top of the hotel- what a treat!!! After that I reserved the same table every afternoon until my departure... I got my ideal office there!
title: The best office EVER!

review: We stayed at this hotel as part of a group trip that was arranged through my place of work. The hotel has a very nice exclusive feel to it, owing to the lower number of rooms that you find in more tourist centric hotels. This works out great, as the hotel never felt crowded while we were there, save for one night where the rooftop bar was packed owing to an event (timing on our part, in no way the fault of the hotel). Hotel breakfast was very good, though they would run out of bacon before I got my shot at it, again this was probably more due to bad timing on my part (more than a couple of late nights beforehand). The only minor gripe I would have is the duration of the pool hours, just felt that 8 PM was a bit early to close the pool off especially given the summer heat in Barcelona. That said, a minor issue, and in no way did it affect the experience for the rest of the stay.Staff were great, and our concierge Eri went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. Special thanks to him! Hotel's location makes it very well placed for shopping, eating, drinking, or just simply exploring the beautiful city that is Barcelona. Highly recommended to anyone considering visiting Barcelona, and especially anyone looking for somewhere that won't always be swarmed by tourists.
title: Great hotel! But wish the pool was open later!

review: Stayed here with a friend and we had a superior room which was nice because we each had a single bed. The room was well stocked and included an Nespresso machine which was great in the morning. There was a lovely rooftop pool and bar, as well as a gym. Staff was super helpful with any question we had. Location is also close to the Diagonal Metro station which connects to L3 and L5 lines - easy to get anywhere in the city. There was also a Gallery market next door to the hotel on weekends.
title: Great location, lovely staff, comfortable beds

review: The staff at this hotel are so kind and helpful. The rooms are clean and amazing. The rooftop terrace is a wonderful spot to relax in the evening and the bartenders are just amazing with great entertainment. The location in Barcelona is perfect for shopping just down the block. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Barcelona.
title: amazing hotel and a perfect location

review: It caters well for all needs. The reception team were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms have all the you need and everywhere is clean. Great to have breakfast in the the courtyard. Would stay here again.
title: Business or pleasure

review: Great location and price for our trip. Close to restaurants, shops, and tour stops. Rooms were clean and well stocked. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nice and modern but still felt cozy. Would recommend highly.
title: Nice

review: Great Hotel all round! Very ideal location, around a 35 minute walk to the harbour but with very easy access to the local metro stop within a minutes walking distance.Very attentive and friendly staff who went out of their way to help. The room was excellent, decent size with smart furnishing but topped off with a great bathroom and an unbelievably comfortable bed! The breakfast comes at an extra cost but is worth it to avoid any hassle trying to find other food locally. The rooftop pool and bar is an added bonus which makes a great change from other city centre hotels I've stayed in before. Its a great place to spend an hour or so in late afternoon to relax after a day of wandering around the city. Great choice of cocktails, but underwhelmed by the overpriced "grill menu" of small bar snacks. Overall though a great hotel to stay, would thoroughly recommend for whatever the occasion as ideally located for a comfortable stay in a great city!
title: Fantastic Hotel

review: Around a 5-7 minute walk from the Alfons X metro station so it is quite conveniently located. The actual area it is in isn't very 'happening' and make sure you convert currency before getting there as there is no currency exchange service nearby. The room was clean however there was an unpleasant odour lingering in the bathroom which was probably linked to the drainage system. Customer service/front desk was decent however ringing room service was a nightmare, didn't ever manage to get through/communicate what was needed. We had booked a triple room so expected 3 single beds (as advertised) but upon arrival there was a double bed and a sofa bed which we just made do with. Overall it was ok for the price but nothing special.
title: Average.

review: Pros- 10 min from La Sagrada Familia- 10 min from a lot of restaurants, Cafes and Metro station- Bus station V21 is just across street for going to city centre- Two playgrounds near by- Friendly staffCons- Rooms are not sound proof ( many times I thought somebody is opening room door)- There is no desk with chair inside the room !!
title: Nice hotel

review: Location is perfect just 10 minutes by bus or 2 stops by metro. Room was nice with balcony. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Really recommended for everyone. The Barcelona beach was near only 20 minutes by bus.
title: It was great location and wonderful hotel

review: This Hotel is located in a very good position for Las Ramblas and all central areas. Excellent service. Staff were very helpful, check in very swift and efficient. Hotel clean with modern facilities. The breakfast was very good catering for all needs. Fantastic room on high floor at front of Hotel. Wi-Fi good and free to use. Would recommend to all visiting Barcelona.
title: Good Location

review: Location is perfect next to metro and the all the other attractions are nearby as well. First day experience which was not great let the hotel down for me, went with the Mrs and we booked double standard room instead we a got a twin room, went to the reception for change of room, and was told that their are no room available until next day. So had to sleep in a room with twin bed no working AC.. so basically lack of sleep!! When we finally got a better room it was with a balcony on the 6th floor was good but not a great start hence 3 stars.
title: Location is perfect..

review: Holiday inn express are almost as basic as it gets, however you know that when booking. Check in was relatively simple with good English spoken. Payment is up front with the detailed invoice being given to you upon departure. The rooms are pretty basic but clean with a good powered shower in the bathroom. The evacuation came as ambit of a surprise at 02.20 this morning, but everyone left in an orderly fashion. It turned out to be caused by someone smoking in their bedroom. I was surprised that as the smoke alarm had been activated that the fire service did not appear to have been called to ensure the building was safe ( particularly after the recent dreadful fire in London)Breakfast was ok
title: Value for money

review: The 3 different people at the reception were cut and dry. Did not like to give information. Not pleasant at all, almost rude. We arrived at 11:30 pm extremely tired and were not welcomed by the person. The hotel is old, neglected walls and a horrible bathroom with a dirty white curtain in the shower. Breakfast with no bacon! The safe did not work. The pillows are hard, I felt really bad there. The only good thing was the location!
title: The worst hotel I have ever been

review: We liked this hotel in Barcelona as it was very central and the breakfast was good. We got a room facing the square with a balcony which we loved and surprisingly it was very quiet. Good for families. The checkin process was super quick. It is a block from the ramba and mercardo.
title: Great location, quiet room, value for money

review: I had sat down on the plane to Barcelona when i received an Email saying my 5 night stay had been cancelled. I was about to board the flight so was unable to call the hotel. As soon as i arrived at Barcelona i called the hotel who said because i had not prepaid my booking had been cancelled with out any warning and the staff were very rude towards me. They had not tried to contact me and ask for payment! They then said they had given my room away this left me in sheer panic as i had no where to stay for the trip. I also had arranged an airport transfer to take us to the property.
title: Cancellation as i was about to aboard the flight to Barcelona

review: The hotel is centrally located and our room was clean and newly renovated. We had read the reviews before our stay so we expected some of the issues that had already been highlighted such as the gathering of homeless people around the hotel and a basic breakfast. The reception staff were ok and would help with basic information if asked but they did print out tickets that we had bought online which was nice. I wouldn't stay here again as we were all female travellers and it felt a little unsafe in the surrounding area.
title: Okay

review: Room - 2.5/5Location - 4/5Cleanliness- 3/5Staff - (-2/5).... rspecially the receptionist...he was rude and arrogant..,not at all friendly ... just for him I would not recommend this place to anyone....
title: Unfriendly receptionist

review: Great hotel with fantastic staff. Recently refurbished. Cab rank on the corner (not central). Air con not great, so ask for additional card to leave the a/c running whilst you're out. Very comfortable; and inexpensive bar prices
title: Solid 4* hotel no more than €10 cabs away

review: Visited Barcelona and was looking for a hotel which looked nice as well as not being too expensive. When we arrived was pleasantly surprised by the decor as well as the friendliness of the staff. When we got into our room we were scared to touch anything in case we were charged but enjoyed every night that we were there. We also received 1 hour in the spa which as a group we all enjoyed apart from having to purchase a swimming cap at €3. There were many different facilities making it both friendly for adults and children. The breakfast every morning was amazing with a variety of different foods to satisfy every need with many going back for more food. The only disappointing factor was the location as it didn't smell the nicest as well as being 30 minutes from the beach and very far from the city centre but close to the metro meaning it made it easier to get around.
title: Amazing hotel with amazing breakfast

review: If you request a Standard deluxe room ( newly updated) you will love the balcony feature.Salles Hotel Pere IV has no bellman to assist with luggage and taxi. It is very hard catching a taxi at this location, especially with no staff assistance. Yes of Course FREE WIFI but the CONNECTION is Extremely slow.The Front desk staff is nice BUT! they are not trained correctly especially planning reservations for BRUNCH, Dinner, etc. With the wifi hardly working the front desk staff wifi works just as slow.... BEWARE
title: Great place to stay IF YOU DO NOT NEED WIFI!!!!!

review: I had a very bad experience with this hotel staying 7 days. Most of the worst customer services you will ever get especially senior managers of the hotel are not helpful and rude. They look tired and they totally dont want to work, it looks like if they are making favours to the customers by replying. If you booked this hotel just cancel it as it will ruin your holidays which you have worked so hard for. They make your stay stressful and without any services at all. And its not that close to the centre - you still have to get a taxi to the centre - by walk it will take you at least 50 min. There is no such balcony as on the picture- all you get is one small window looking outside. So don't even rely on their pictures on the website. Basically you will flush your money for no service, not great room, not great view, breakfasts has no choice at all, very poor. Prices are too high for such place. Absolutely waste of money!
title: Absolutely terrible service-DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL
