review: I stayed with a group of teenagers with a travel company, and I was surprised how calm the atmosphere was in the hotel. The reception wanted us to fill out paperwork to figure out the tourist tax when we were trying to get our group settled and organized in their rooms, but they let us come back later and figure out the bill. The rooms were always cleaned well and the reception put in a wake-up call for me and called a taxi for me when I needed to go to the airport.I thought that there would be more craziness since it's close to La Rambla, but it was quite the opposite. I can't say that I felt unsafe at any point, but there were some weird people outside. I feel like that is almost everywhere near the city center, but I think it's important to note if you stay there. I never felt unsafe, but the people were strange. Also, please note that the download and upload speeds are very slow. If you need to upload, download or transfer files on business, then you might want to consider another hotel. I had to try uploading pictures through dropbox and it would take an hour instead of 10-15, which is the typical time for the amount of files I was working with at the time.
title: Good restaurants nearby. Weird people outside.

review: Hotel was perfectly situated and staff helpful and friendly. Rooms are just dated and don't match condition of lobby. Pool is the perfect roof top terrace with a full service bar for the most part. Pool and area are nice and clean.
title: Great location

review: We stayed for 4 days at the Silken Ramblas, from Monday the 3rd to Friday the 7th, staying in room 406, can only say what a delightful stay we had....The whole staff, without exception were, brilliant, plus the hotel was spotless, breakfasts were really good, plenty of everything with a great selection, and all areas spotlessly clean, and the staff were excellent, in particularly the 2 waitresses who did breakfast and the hotfooted up to do the pool bar etc., they were both, kind and very thoughtful.The Ramblas area was also very good, seemingly in the heart of everything worth seeing, shopping....restaurants of which there were many and very varied.....anyone going to Barcelona be advised and see the Flamenco with dinner, and also go to Luki's, a brilliant eatery bit out of the Tourist area but a visit is a must....Would love to go back to Barcelona, and would definitely return to the Hotel Silken Ramblas and thoroughly recommend it.
title: The hotel silken Ramblas

review: The location of this hotel is great and I couldn't fault the staff. They were very friendly and helpful. The main issue was that the room themselves are very tired and extremely noisy. Whilst we stayed we didn't manage to sleep the good due to being kept awake or woken up by people walking or talking in any room adjoining or even above us due to the laminate flooring and thin walls. This was extremely disappointing considering it is meant to be a 4* hotel.
title: Great location, tired and noisy rooms - terrible nights sleep

review: My girlfriend and I stayed at Silken Ramblas Barcelona for three nights, from 3rd-6th July. The hotel was a short taxi journey (approx 25 euros) from the airport and when we arrived we were amazed at how well the hotel is located. There is a metro station (Catalunya) less than a 5 minute walk away and it is a very short tube ride from the main tourist attractions of the city. The hotel is right outside La Rambla street which is full of high quality restaurants, markets and high street shops. It is also a short walk from the Gothic Quarter. The hotel itself was very smart and clean, with very friendly staff who were happy to answer questions. The bedrooms were well designed although we were given two adjacent single beds, which seemed very light and moved when sat on. The bathroom was very smart although of all things we found it strange that there was no soap holder for the bar they provided! The rooftop bar & decking area was nice to relax by although it did get very busy, the photos online being deceiving as the pool was very small! All in all, a fair 4/5 stars - the best factor being the location!
title: Great staff & amazing location

review: The hotel was located near great/affordable restaurants and close to the metro. Rooms were comfortable and clean, and the staff were all accommodating and so nice. I would stay here again and recommend to friends.
title: Great hotel! Great price!

review: We enjoyed our stay here, was good location and very clean. Located 5 min walk from Sagrada Church ehich is awesime church site. Breakfast was great too. The staff was helpful and pleasant. Would not hesitate to recommend to others.
title: Great Hotel!

review: Perfect hotel. Close to Sagrada Familia, plenty of restaurants and bars around for various dietary needs. 5 minutes to El Clot metro station giving you access to the city. Clean, tidy and well presented. The rooms were a good size and comfortable. Would definitely return and would recommend.
title: Birthday

review: All excellent, good location, good air con, cleaness, staff, facilities. Just didn't have time to enjoy the swimming pool. My sister tried but it was full, she went back to the room. Lovely balcony, very comfortable bed
title: Hotel

review: This hotel was in a great location right on La Ramblas and within short walking distance to the metro station and airport bus stop. We were located on the second floor and faced the side street which was fine however the noise that emanated from below meant that I had to sleep with earplugs the whole time I stayed there. The reception staff were friendly and the room although dated was adequately appointed.
title: Great Location but Very Noisy

review: Great hotel for the price right in the middle of las ramblas gentleman at reception really friendly made us feel really welcome we booked a twin room and there was a mistake so they upgraded us to a one bed appartment at no extra cost. Spotlessly clean would definitely recommend thank you for a lovely stay.
title: Great location

review: The hotel was in a prime spot and was close to everything and faced La Ramblas. Room was small but expected for Europe. Staff was very nice. Other restaurants are close by. Would stay again. Hope to visit again!
title: Great Location!

review: this hotel was funky and modern room was nice big and clean. the public areas were nice and the staff were really nice. the rooftop pool was nice and funky. the location is great right beside the design museum 15 min walk to the beach and a nice little shopping centre across the road. Stations were handy too.
title: lovely hotel

review: I found the Gates Hotel very nice and fancy but it lacks all the important details for a hotel to become confortable. I arrived at 2PM in hotel and actually had to wait 1 hour for room cleaning. Acceptable but not good after a couple of hours travelling. As soon as i entered the room, i found a chewing gum in the window shades! That is really disgusting and disappointing! Almost 200€ a night just to find an old chewing gum in the room! I couldn't look at it anymore... i could not believe that room service did not noticed it. I have also noticed that the room lacks soom privacy... it tall buildings next to it, it is easy to see through the big windows unless you put the blackout all the way down... The bathroom was good but a bit warm because of the window and lack of air conditioning there. I have also found a roll of duct tape under the bed. Really? This hotel has all it takes to be an amazing hotel but it fails in the smallest details.
title: Disgusting

review: Room was amazing electric blinds, aircon very good space and the bathroom was grate I went with friends stayed in the room with my boyfriend it's deffenitly a place to remember! Loved it room cleaners super Aswell everything was spotless!
title: Perfect stay room was gorgeous!

review: Parking problems, couldnt get in After it was blocked by a transporter car. He said we had to wait 1 hour. Ridiculous! Cleaning People got in to the room but we put the red Card outside. No good service. When we came back hé threw away the shampooing, we wanted to get a shower. When we told it at the réception he just said 'oh' and didnt even excuse for them or help us.
title: Personal unfriendly

review: Very excellent. We enjoyed and all was good We were happy to be upgraded to suite instead of guest room. I will recommend this hotel to all the people that I know. The staff were nice and helpful. The hotel is located at good area easy for shopping and transportation.
title: Very nice

review: Hotel itself is very neat and clean, with friendly staff. Just steps to the Glories metro stop, we never worried about transportation to all the things we wanted to do while in town. The roof top offers great views of all the major landmarks of Barcelona (including the tower directly next door) and overall our stay was perfect. I would stay here again if I returned to Barcelona just because I know what I'm getting at a reasonable price.Words to the wise: do NOT eat any of the food at the rooftop bar. We would go to the local grocery store and pick up cheap wine to drink on the roof each night just to soak up the evening, but the one time we got food it was disgusting. Let me also point out that I'm easy to please, but I thought I'd vomit after eating about half of the roast beef sandwich I bought.
title: Roof-top views are thing of beauty!

review: Very good. I did not know what to expect from the hotel but overall it was a pleasant experience for a first timer. I recommend it to anyone who would like to be close to all sightseeing places and more...
title: Barcelona first visit

review: Modern hotel in an excellent location. Friendly staff and wonderful roof top terrace! We used the metro, although it was only 6 euros from las Rambla! Amazing experience-would definitely stop again!! Mr & Mrs Young
title: Wedding Anniversary two night stay

review: Extremely dirty bathrooms. Terrible staff that do not care for the customer. They seemed annoyed when asked for questions. When they made a mistake the just said "oh well, too bad." And we were stuck with the wrong parking bill. They know people come to visit Batcelona once in their lifetimes therefore they do not care of a returning customer.
title: Terrible stay

review: Ok hotel. Bit out of town. Beware of 'private' parties that stop you using the rooftop poor and terrace. No access for a whole day when we wanted to sunbathe and relax by the pool. Infuriating. Also, noise from corridors and from the music on the rooftop can be annoying if your on one of the top floors - and it goes on 'til late. Staff can be great to rude. Some training perhaps needed?
title: OK stay which could have been great.

review: Nice location, adjacent to supermarket and some restaurants. Friendly staff. Nice rooftop, doesn't get too crowded. Hotel could do with some basic improvements in the rooms. Overall it was good and comfortable.
title: Good stay

review: Myself and my boyfirend stayed here for my 21st birthday, the transfer was great as we got to see the surrounding city before arriving at the hotel. We arrived before check in but we were able to leave our luggage in a locked room and were able to explore the area and then check in was easy and quickly.The rooftop pool and bar area is nice and has some really amazing views of the city, there are a few sun loungers which means it doesnt get too busy. However the pool is freezing and i could only manage a few minutes.The room was amazing, the bed was nice and big so theres plenty of room if you struggle with heat on holiday (but we had the aircon on), I loved the bathroom with the glass window - the blinds are also an added bonus as you can block out the light. The only downside was our view of a construction site and another hotel.The room service wasn't the best but was very prompt. If you have booked without breakfast and need something quick and convenient I would avoid the breakfast buffet at the hotel as it was so expensive for what it was! However, there are two little cafes right next door which are breat have and some good food!
title: Lovely stay for a 21st Birthday present

review: Room not ready on arrival, staff rude, charged twice for the room!!!When I told them, they said, of course, we preauthorized the card and refunded it. They sent me a ticket that is not even mine! So I finaly paid 300€ for a room like this!!!! Ridiculous!
title: Staff Not friendly

review: The overall hotel was really good very friendly staff an courteous, everything went well an would recommend this hotel to anyone location for transport is very good an was easily accessible with a short walk
title: Good stay

review: This hotel is a modern styled multistory property located conveniently close to the local shopping centre and just a short tram trip to the beach (or 15min walk).The rooms are clean and well equipped with essential air conditioning. The bathroom is modern and features bath, 2 x shower heads, basin, wc, and a bidet. A sliding screen seperates the bedroom from the bathroom for thoses who prefer to retain a bit of modesty (see images).Breakfast is important, and this hotel offers a fully cooked quality breakfast along side the usual continental selection. The breakfast area is large and at no time was there any need to queue up.Reception staff are very friendly and accommodating and very knowledgable with the local area. They have plenty of time for you and can offer maps showing you the local attractions.Getting to the hotel from the airport will cost around €35 by taxi or just over €4 by train. The train can be embarked on at the airport and will take you to within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. You may want to remember this in case the taxis are on strike, as they were when I visited!Any negatives? Well no, not really. Around midnight it can get a little noisy in the corridors due to guests returning to their rooms, but there again this is Barcelona so this will surely be the case in all hotels!As commented by others, the rooftop is a really pleasant area to relax and wind down. A pint of Pisners will cost you €7, but for the scenery and luxury afforded this is good value. I did not sample the food so I cannot comment on this.I have no immediate plans to re-visit Barcelona, but if I did then The Gates Diagonal Hotel would certainly be at the top of the list for my accommodation.
title: Clean tidy and convenient

review: This hotel it's very recommended who want to have nice hotel in Barcelona , the location of this hotel it's very great u can go to the beach only by walking and what I like from this hotel because the staff are friendy
title: Clean room and friendly staff

review: Beautiful hotel, lovely location. Nice breakfast, great buffet. The hotel was not clean.The cleaning service in the room is not ok. We had 3 days no shower gel, the other day we had no towels for two,... You can walk in and out, nobody was talking...
title: Pascale

review: Fantastic friendly/helpful staff and clean comfortable rooms. Location is great as well if you want to shop (there is a mall across the street) and/or see the city (the best way to get around the is city is by bus and there is a bus stop across the street in front of the hotel).
title: First time in Barcelona

review: The hotel is ideal for using the metro we found it very easy to get around. One complaint was a stain on the carpet which was a little off putting but I am very fussy and the rest of the hotel was immaculate. The staff are so friendly. We arrived at the hotel over 4 hours before check in, but they allowed us into our room early which literally made my day. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.
title: Lovely friendly staff, great stay!

review: This is a nice hotel. The staff is friendly. They offer free wi-fi, that works quite well. The rooms are spacious, however sometimes it can be noisy. The breakfast is very good and the breakfast staff are very friendly. However, I think it is a little bit to expensive (18 euros). The rooftop swimming pool is minuscule. It's more like a oversized jacuzzi. The location is excellent. It is possible to walk to the Sagrada Familia Cathedral. The tram and the subway station are just 1 minute away.
title: Good Hotel

review: Great location in the city center, with a lovely view on Sagrada Familia and a big shopping center nearby. Very friendly staff. Clean room and the breakfast was also very nice. Defenitely worth the money.
title: Nice hotel

review: Very friendly staff and service. Room was very clean and comfortable. Excellent buffet style breakfast and a wide choice of dishes. Rooftop pool was smaller than it looks in the pictures and the Bar snacks a little pricey although the view from the roof was fantastic.
title: Barcelona city break

review: Good hotel with large breakfast buffet. Furniture, carpet somewhat outdated. Well located to Metro and Tram in between downtown and congress center. Overall good experience for business and excursions.
title: Good location

review: Good hotel, great location with good tram links to the beach and marina, cracking rooftop views from the roof terrace/pool area, comfortable room, friendly and knowlegeable staff. The only real downsides were an event on the roof terrace on the Sunday that restricted our access to this part of the hotel on our last day, and a sticky toilet (sliding) door that didn't close properly.
title: Stay at the Gates Diagonal, Barcelona

review: Train station only 5 minutes away.Shopping centre directly over road with plenty of food choices.Hotel staff friendly and helpful.Pool was lovely on roof.Room clean and spacious.Bathroom was clean.Overall great experience and would recommend to anyone looking to stay in Barcelona.
title: Nice hotel, great location.

review: Great family trip away rooms with view of torres. Loved rooftop bar and pool great lunches. Only issue is beds have sharp corners that stick out and on day 1 this caused an injury to my mum - bed frsmes not suitable for anyone with fesility or mobility issues. Saying that would love to come again as location great and next to metro
title: Chic hotel in good location

review: The Hotel Gas a small but nice Pool. Good for 2 or 3 Nights. Close to an Metro Station with a small way to the Centre of Barcelona. The Air condition was unfortunatly very cold an directly above the bed.
title: Nixe hotel directly to Metro station

review: Good staff for my arrival.Nice room but not very clean in the shower and toilets.The rooftop is beautiful but the dinner don't have the level. Don't expect used the swimming pool the size is ridiculous but the night with lights is not badGood localisation for visited Barcelone. A metro station is next to this hotel.
title: Nice for one weekend

review: IT was not a good look..too expensive and the pool is top small..not room for All the people..the view from the suite were to a construction site.. they were so kind to check us out before that was positive thing and the man in the reception were kind..
title: Too expensive

review: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights over the weekend, for a 4 star in Barcelona this was great value for money, a lot of the other ones were coming up a lot more! I have stayed in numerous hotels in Barcelona and this was one of the nicest, on site parking which was great as Barcelona can be a nightmare to find parking! Pool on roof was one of the smallest I have ever seen, resembled a bath! the Pool bar was also very over priced, £12 for a vodka! crazy! room was nice, couldn't really fault that except wires to the open and shut blinds hanging around! I hear a lot of people moaning about the location but Barcelona is so huge to do the sights your not going to be near some and closer to others, the tubes are the easiest to use in the world, so easy to read and just pop on and off in minutes! tube station is next door to hotel!
title: Great value

review: Great rooftop parties especially if you love House music, apparently? Because hotel guests are not allowed in.....Poor service in the rooftop bar too, if you can get in there of course. Such a shame as great location and smart looking hotel
title: Gutted with my stay here

review: We stayed there for 4 Nights while exploring Barcelona the first time. We especially loved the roof terrace near the Torre agbar. This was a perfect location for our Trip: we walked a lot or used the hotel bikes for sight seeing. Can't say anything about the breakfast.
title: Great Hotel with a fantastic view

review: Wonderful welcoming hotel in a beautiful and vibrant city. The hotel staff was amazing. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. The neighborhood was fairly quiet at night (which we love) and everything in the city was easy to walk to and if we couldn't walk the metro and taxis were a half block to get anywhere in the city.
title: Gates diagonal of Barcelona

review: The entrance is very nice but the rooms are so dirty@! I even took some pictures I was shocked. There was hair all over the bath, and the curtain in the bedroom was ripped and disgusting. It's a shame because the hotel looks nice and the bed was comfortable but I was uneasy about sleeping in such dirty conditions. I won't be staying here again or recommend it. I come to Barcelona often and I'm disappointed by my experience.
title: Nice entrance dirty rooms

review: night stay 2 separate days before and at end of cruise included guided tour of Barcelona. Bathroom faucet for second visit had a broken faucet handle which was not repaired as required requested. Shower configuration allowed water to spill out on to the floor with no way to prevent this. Valet staff were very good
title: DeSimone June 2017

review: Noisy. Bad bed and cover. Ridiculous bathroom and smelled of sewage. Not accessible. Cleaning staff and left garbage on the floor. Bed linen ripped and torn - no bed sheets. Overall a bad experience. Not to repeat
title: Never again

review: I expected much more from this hotel having seen the photos and in light of the price I paid. The room is ok size, but beds very uncomfortable. The hotel seem to have no proper walls between the rooms and awful sound insulation, you can hear the person next door sneezing. The blinds made such noise, that each evening and morning it was disturbing as guests would put them up or down. The roof terrace is nice, but the pool is tiny-don't expect to have a proper swim, although it does serve the purpose to cool down in a hot weather. All in all disappointing experience! Having said this, the staff is really nice, welcoming and friendly...
title: Cardboard walls, uncomfortable beds...

review: I've just returned from a lovely stay of five nights in Barcelona and all in all I'm very happy with my decision to stay at The Gates Diagonal Hotel. The design of the hotel is modern and minimalistic, which is very appealing to me, and even though there are signs of wear and tear in the rooms the overall cleanliness and state of the hotel is perfectly adequate. My room was clean and very bright with floor-to-ceiling windows offering magificent views of Torre Glóries (Agbar). The air conditioning worked perfectly and a window could be opened for fresh air - a most welcome but everso uncommon feature in hotels nowadays. The design is very contemporary and attractive but certain details, ie the shower, are designed poorly without taking function into account; it was impossible to use the shower without soaking the entire bathroom. The hotel has a nice roof terrace with magnificent views of the surrounding area and also a small pool and restaurant/bar. I did not have any drinks and/or food at the hotel. Checking in and out was quick, efficient and friendly and all in all the stay was very hassle-free. The lifts, however, were somewhat dirty and extremely slow so I preferred using the stairs during my stay. The location is, in my opinion, excellent. Glóries metrostation is just down the street which means that all parts of Barcelona are easily accessed. The area itself is somewhat lacking in character and charm but is safe and clean with good transportation options and a major shopping complex just across the street. The nearest part of the beach is easily reached by a leisurely walk for roughly 20-25 minutes. As a whole, I'm very happy with my stay at Tha Gates Diagonal and I would gladly return to this hotel for my future travels to the lovely city of Barcelona!
title: The Gates Diagonal

review: Excellent facilities and friendly helpful staff. In a fantastic location within walking distance to main tourist areas. The hotel did everything they could for us when we needed an extra room at short notice. Nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely recommend.
title: Excellent location!

review: Great hotel, great location, very helpful staff that helped me with my train tickets when I had difficulty.Very friendly and fluent in English and Spanish. Breakfast was great. I would certainly stay here again. Taxi stand right outside. Beautiful rooftop patio
title: Great Centrally located Hotel

review: We were at the america hotel for 4 daysThe hotel is perfect!We traveled 2 adult and 2 children we have got 2 rooms with conecting door, it was great!Very clean, comfortable bedsThe roof is very nice!The best thing was the service!Very kind and helpfull!We will come back!!
title: Excellent hotel excellent service

review: Almost everything was good , the desk and the room service was excellent, I think the breakfast was over priced unless you wanted to gorge yourself. we had breakfast at a little bar, Mar i Costa.in the cetre ville plaza, ham omelette, toast, coffee,jam. 7.25 euro each. salads were great, deserts not so good. tirimisu, nothing like, came out of freezer still frozen in middle.can not comment on the pool or fitness centre as we travelled from Canada and we do not want to lounge next to a pool when the beach is 5 mins away
title: Brians review

review: Definitly not value for money !!!Staff very cordial but everything else quite disapointing. The room was TOO expensive and definitly needed a refresh. Floor, bathroom and furniture really in bad shape. Room noisy because you can hear all around what is happening in the vicinity....
title: Very Disappointed

review: Hotel in need of renovation. Strange "moldy" smell inside, in the main hall and the corridors... don't really now if it was from the old carpet.Breakfast was good, but nothing spectacular.Car park and car park acess to hotel and quite ugly. Was really dark. As usual in Spain, small parking spaces.
title: 4 stars in need of some care

review: They don't understand the difference of freezer and refregerater. When I was check in at midnight. I asked the staff to freezed the icepack that I brout form my home, because to make it cool to carry my sons eye medicine. But after four days when I checked out and asked them to bring it back. They give me a unfrozened icepack. When I complained they just said sorry. But now I'm really worry about the medicine. If you are travelling with a child who need special care, this hotel is not the right place. The staff of this hotel are lack of professionalism.
title: Never go again

review: The hotel is close to the beach, there is an area full of restaurants. It's also quite close to the Zoo (a bit further than the nearest Metro station). There is a bus line in the front street, that can take you directly to the Aquarium. Nice breakfast choices (ice cava was a novelty). Large room. For the rest of town, we had to use the Metro, which means 2 x ~1Km to walk. The line close by is not really well connected, which means you always had to switch somewhere. The view...well, if you see the sea it's ok, the sunrise was quite orange. Some of the buldings nearby look however depressing.
title: Depends on what you want from Barcelona

review: Very comfortable hotel with all amenities. Food in restaurant and breakfasts excellent. Reception staff polite and knowledgeable particularly about local transport. Pool very clean and quiet. 2 stops on metro into Barcelona or a bus stops outside hotel. Big enough to accommodate groups without affecting couples and families.
title: Great hotel

review: We were staing in the hotel 23/06-2/07. We like hitel very much, good location, near the beach. We like the waiter Marycarmen from the restaurant, she gave us good service and she is very policeThank you very much!Sergey
title: We like everything!

review: Very nice hotel with a full breakfast. The location is within walking distance form the Gothic District, Del Born, Marina. Plenty of great restaurants close by. Our room was very quiet on the courtyard side. Our daughters were on the street side which was a little loud.
title: Perfect location!

review: We stayed here for four nights in July. Location was excellent - close to the beach and neighbourhoods in the older part of the city. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful when we needed information on the metro. The room was quiet as it didn't face the busy street. We gave this hotel an average rating because the breakfast was not great and there was a sewer smell coming from the bathroom vent. It was so bad on the second night we closed the bathroom door and left the window open at night. Not sure we would stay here again.
title: Excellent location, average room

review: Super expensive hotel and inflexibleNon smoking room smelling smokeHalf a soap in the roomParking too far awayNo breakfast before 7 am without breakfast basketI Don't recommend this hotel It is abusing of its location
title: Expensive and inflexible

review: Pricey by US standards but I loved the location of this hotel. My room was typical but clean. There was free WiFi and the breakfast was included. We had dinner on the plaza (diagonally from the hotel entrance) and the food was very good. It had the added ambiance of a street performer singing opera nearby.One note: the taxis were on strike the day we arrived. Apparently they do this once a month as a protest against Uber. We had arranged for a transfer from the airport to our hotel in advance but our friends (that we were meeting) had not. They spent hours dealing with this and the hotel was not equipped to offer any assistance.
title: Nice Location

review: Great hotel with great location. close to everything and the Ramblas is just 5 minutes walk. Close to the sea and port and the mall. The room is a little bit small then other hotels i have been but it was very beautiful and had everything we needed. The staff was very polite and answered every question we had
title: Great hotel

review: This hotel was located in a perfect place on the main street of Laietana near the waterfront. One block and you are in the heart of the Gothic District and across the street is the area for best restaurants where local dine. The front desk staff were particularly helpful for a first time visitor to Barcelona. The room was quiet with comfortable beds.
title: Awesome location!

review: We arrived at Hotel Colonial Barcelona after traveling for over 24 hours and experiencing a several unexpected events on our flight. The person on duty, at the time of our arrival, was most understanding and helpful. We arrived too early to check-in, but he worked hard to get us one of our two rooms ready as early as he could. For that, we are so grateful. As you can see from the lobby, a remodel should be considered in the near future. We were thoroughly pleased that there wasn't carpet on the floors. We had a little balcony where you could stand and look out on the main street. The balcony wasn't large enough for a chair so sitting wasn't an option. Our room was located in a section of the hotel where we could hear the subway running at all hours of the night into the early morning. If you you are a light sleeper or have children, this might be something you consider when selecting your room. In the United States, we are used to having washcloths, but apparently washcloths are a United States thing because we did not have any in our room. If you really need a washcloth, you may want to consider bringing your own. Speaking of the bathroom, the shower definitely needs some attention. There was a musty odor upon opening the shower door. There was mold on the walls of the shower, which may be the cause of the musty odor. Although we had paid for our hotel charges in advance, we owed a 5 euro local tax upon arrival that wasn't covered in the booking charges. If you plan to utilize the safe, you will need to access the key at the front desk. When you return the key, there is a charge of 2 euro per day. The best part of the hotel was the friendly staff.
title: A Bit of a Disappointment

review: Cannot fault this hotel. Clean, great location and staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small as in all European cities but the location made up for this. Would definitely recommend for short city break
title: Fab location

review: Stayed for 3 nights. Excellent central location on main street for access to metro, hop on hop off tours, airport bus. That came with downside of noise at night which did affect my sleep. Room was clean, bathroom was very tight on space and I could see difficulties emerging for customers who may be obese as hard to close the door, pass by the toilet to get into the shower. Breakfast room was clean also. Fresh fruit of bananas, apples and oranges. Fruit juice, water, coffee..selection of cereals, croissants and bread for toasting were available for guests. Never met staff members in breakfast room but staff on front desk were friendly and helpful.I have no hesitation recommending this hotel for a city break just try and reserve a quieter room
title: Great location, adequate breakfast

review: I visited this hotel right now. I was searching for a modern hotel, close to the beach and not so far from the city in a quiet district, not so noise than in downtown of Barcelona, which also has a roof top swimming pool itself. It is a really reasonable hotel with good service. The only issue is the swimming pool! It is much smaller that I expected! The breakfast was excellent and to walk to the sandy beach took about 10 minutes. To go the the city by taxi costs about 8-10 EUR only!
title: City bisit

review: We enjoyed our 2 days stay at Ilunion Barcelona in the heart of Poblenou. The streets around the hotel have a quiet provincial atmosphere as the whole area. Its location is very convenient. A 10 minutes walk took us to the popular Playa del Bogatell on one side and to the lively Rambla del Poblenou on the other. And it's only 3 blocks to Llacuna metro station where we could easily reach the city centre. We also found a taxi stand just opposite of the hotel to go to the airport.Ilunion is modern clean relatively recent with a design decor. Lobby is spacious and stylish. Amenities and services were suitable, staff was efficient. We used the business center but neither the gym nor the pool. We ran away from the breakfast hall looking like a shopping mall cafeteria. Our room was large bright functional silent with comfy beds including the extra cot.How much it costs has varied from day to day, one night was quite expensive.
title: Convenient and comfortable hotel

review: Stayed with husband and son for a long weekend. Location is fab. Very close to beach and fab restaurants, cafes and bars a stones throw from the hotel. Due to recent surgery I have mobility issues so this was just perfect. We walked to beach and picked up tour bus which allowed us to see Barcelona without much walking. Pool is small but sufficient for our needs. No pool bar but plenty of supermarkets round about to buy your own drinks etc that you can have at pool. No towels either so most people used towels from their room. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel as plenty of places round about to try. Rooms are a good size and very clean. Air conditioning very effective. Perfect location for us and we will definitely return.
title: Great Location

review: We stayed there 10 nights 11 days A 10 mint walk from the beach there a ling street right on the corner 2 mint walk filled with bars and resturants (even halal food is available) there are also small spas (nail and facial) a couple of supermarkets .Excellent location i cant say 10 mint walk from metro station everything you need is there also you're serrounded by bike shops .We used the taxi to city center because my grandma couldn't walk you oau around 8€ one way. 15 mints away by taxi.Bed are not comfy and if you book a triplet room they give you a( roll on / extra bed)They dont have rooms with 3 main beds and yes the rollon beds are even worse than thier main beds , if you have a back problem or care much about your sleep i dont recommend it , but there are many positives that makes me overlook the bed problem.Their cleaning staff arent very dedicated, tou have to tell them specifically to clean around the sink and to change tour bed covers. Even i saw the cleaning lady taking the bed civer from the room facing our and putting in our room instead of getting a new one.They have little staff if you want something you need to go down get it youself most of the time , even the bags we mived them by ourselves. They do keep your bags after checkout for free.Very friendly staff I must say always smiling . They don't have a tourists office but they try to help as much as possible.They offered us a wheelchair free of charge for my grandma and when we thanked them by a small present they have us free cake and sweets I Wwould thank (Mrs.Nuira) most helpfull of all for her kindness . She has definitely a good impact on your hotel and she gives the guests with a positive impression.They offer breakfast but its not a continental one I think 15€ is too expensive for a cold breakfast , you have many bakeries 2 mint walk away so no need. They have a gym A pool on the roof but i didn't use it since the beach is nearby.
title: Very good

review: Nice hotel with spacious rooms, much larger than usually found in Barcelona. Location is great to go to the beach while still quiet because it is not too close to the hectic city center. We checked in late and Ariel was great - in fact all Front Desk staff was super friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the morning and the rooftop pool (which is a bit small but so cool). Definitely recommend!
title: Friendly Front Desk staff and spacious room

review: Great stay with hotel Ilunion in Barcelona! If you like swimming you can use the pool or you can go to nice beach only 100meters from hotel. You can also visit a well equiped gym for free and there is a possibillity to borrow a bike for 15eur/night or have a breakfast for 14 eur I think. Unfortunately we did not used this service but I can reccommend you the room- clean, modern, with a/c, wifi, free water and nice view! Hotel staff is always ready to help you! The distance from the city centre is not small, but you can always take a bus which goes every 5 minutes.
title: Beach behind the hotel and rooftop pool

review: The hotel is top nodge , big rooms , excellent location near the beach . Their computers run slow though , I made a reservation online and it took mode than 15-20 minutes for my order to be processed. Stuff is nice , you can keep your luggage for free if you want to go places before your plane flies u back . As a downside , it would be the view from some rooms (you see some unused , ruined , old constructions) , but who has time to look over the window when in Barcelona ? Also , the room has one of the nicest bathrooms from any hotel that I visited.
title: Fair

review: Hotel was dated, staff were lovely and don't order room service! Varied from day to day what you got and how much it cost!! Close to shops and restaurants though but wouldn't stay here again. Close to beach
title: Dated could do with a revamp

review: Great hotel, good location, lovely friendly staff and fab buffet breakfast. Thank you for making it a pleasant and happy experience. The pool was a little small but the cleanliness and maintenance was excellent. The room service was excellent with daily cleaning and towels changed
title: excellent overall hotel

review: very good, all staff were most approachable and friendly at all times the property was always clean and tidy. In a prime position to get any were either in taxi or bus or private transportation. All of our party of 3 couples enjoyed every thing about our stay at Catalonia La Pedrera and all the iland had to offer.theuin dhdue dhtie dhfbneolm, cjsuioner jstekri fgey tur totmno fhdb tdhid fbdfhdi fkfkf dkthw jdndg jfheo uehbw 5749 ehed vndkgp dkewys fndo shwo fdg dyddwuo eu iuef
title: very good

review: Everything was lovely. Really nice room overlooking the street. Reception staff were excellent in their knowledge.Fantastic tapas bar across the road. Transport system excellent and only 10 euros for a 10 trip card!!!we were there to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday and had trips arranged to go to new camp and an exhibition in a museum. The staff were excellent at guiding us to the right transport system.
title: lovely hotel in really nice area

review: nice hotel friendly staff i would come back to stay here. the pool and the views where very good the location also was perfect. the hotel bar was very expensive and even with a taxi rank it was hard to get a taxi at times.
title: review

review: Central to everywhere. Easy to catch Taxis which is our preferred choice to get from A to B . But also close to the Underground Metro and buses. Lots of cafes around and close to good restaurants. Walking down la Rambla is a block or so away , excellent shopping as well as wonderful architecture everywhere to see and enjoy. CAsa Battlo a few streets away , the sightseeing bus a good way to orient yourself with the city . My tip visiting barcelona is to book all the sightseeing places in advance as they can get booked up e.g. Sigrid Familia, the Picasso Museum and also the Park Guell.
title: Percect location for exploring Barcelona

review: The location was perfect for me as it was a 2.5km walk to barceloneta beach, the room was clean, staff were nice and efficient and the room was spacious enough. The gym and pool was also a bonus. I would stay in this hotel again.
title: Great Stay!

review: the hotel was absolutely fantastic, the hotel was very clean although slightly dark. I really enjoyed my stay and it was perfect throughout. the hotel pool area was also lovely and more than expected.
title: Revuew

review: Great location and very near to all prime attractions. Within minutes of walking. Facilities very good and rooms are really nicely decorated.A smell of drainage in our room for the duration of our stay tarnished our enjoyment.
title: Excellent location and facilities

review: The room was quite small and bathroom even smaller. The was traffic noise, but it's to be expected in the middle of a busy city. The hotel is modern and very clean. This is a about 10 to 15 minute walk to the centre, but a nice stroll and it is safe, there are bars and cafe's near by. The roof top pool is lovely too. Most hotels have roof top pools in Barcelona.
title: A lovely hotel

review: Could not find a fault with this hotel, the rooms were comfortable and clean. The breakfasts were very good with a wide selection of both continental and cooked. The restaurant in the evening was excellent although it appeared under used by the majority of the guests.
title: Lovely Hotel

review: The hotel location was very convenient for us as we had a meeting on our return with our car to Barcelona and the car parking was a big plus. Easy to access car space for €20 a day in central Barcelona seemed reasonable. The hotel twin room was very comfortable with good beds and linen, and so was the bathroom too. A relief as we're paying over €200 for the room and parking and no breakfast. There are plenty of very good cafes and bakeries nearby so no problem especially as the check out time is 12 o'clock. There is a roof top pool which seemed to be very popular judging by the number of people in swimsuits going up to the roof. Probably a real bonus on a hot summers day in Barcelona. All the reception staff are very helpful and made for a pleasant one day/night stay.
title: Mid summer so prices high

review: Yes the location is quite good, walking distance to nice restaurants, a nice shopping area and even the metro is close by. The rooms are decently sized and clean and the morning breakfast was good. The only reason the review gets two stars and not one is because the first couple of nights my stay was actually pleasant but from the third it all went downhill extremely fast.So from the third day (I stayed 5 nights) I had a group of boys staying on the same floor as me. Their rooms were spaced out on the floor, one or two at the side of me and another down the hall. They used to get ready to head out (I'm guessing to party) around 11 in the night. So for a good 2 hours I could just hear them walking in and out of each others rooms, doors slamming, loud talking in the corridor (the sound proofing is appalling), they even used to open the back windows and talk and move stuff around in the room. This used to go on till about 1am and restart when they got back in around 6am - 7am.I called the reception the first night this happened, the person at the desk (Visily) said he would look into it and the noise did get toned down but the group also did head out for the night so I manged to get some sleep.The second night, the same issue continued and this time it was louder, so I went down to the reception, the person on duty (Visily again) denied there was a group staying on my floor when clearly there was, he said he had told them to keep it down and also surprisingly asked if I wanted to speak to them. Why should I as a guest in the hotel tell others guest to keep the noise levels down? Isn't it the duty of the hotel to make sure there is a proper sleeping environment for all guests? He did not look interested in helping so I just gave up and suffered through the third night as well.It is safe to say that I will never stay in this hotel again and if this is the type of service to be expected, i will definitely not consider any other hotels in this chain as well.
title: Terrible experience

review: I stayed here on my own and was made to feel very welcome and looked after. The staff helped me with maps and the best things to see, and were generally very polite and helpful. The hotel and rooms are modern and very clean and the rooftop terrace is lovely.
title: A very friendly, clean and welcoming hotel

review: We had a room with terrace and it was awesome! The terrace was huge with table, chairs and even with two sun bathing chairs. Room was nicely equiped and minibar and complimentary coffee products were refilled daily. Only negative was the aircon that blowed directly to other side of the bed. Even the restaurant was good (only tried for dinner) . Pool was as small as expected. The location is just perfect close to everything and the area is full of lovely restaurants and coffee shops.
title: Nice hotel with perfect location

review: Hotel is right there in the busy part of town, everything you need is in walking distance, transportation, food, etc..the heart of sol is just a few blocks away...enough things to see and do to keep you busy..
title: Hanging at the Catalonia Eixample

review: Stayed here for me son's 21st birthday. We asked for rooms close to each other prior to our visit and the hotel were true to their word and gave us rooms opposite each other. The rooms were big enough and very comfortable. We had a street facing room and heard no noise at at night due to the double doors over the window.The roof area is great with a small pool and bar. Very comfortable for a relaxing afternoon.Breakfast great with plenty choice.Would recommend the Nespresso bar at front of hotel. Snack food was great and good value for money.A walk into the town centre is about 20 mins and the harbour a little further. We walked in and got the metro back which we found very safe even late at night.A very enjoyable stay and would recommend hotel without hesitation.
title: Well worth a look.

review: Convenient location, friendly staff, adequate sleeping rooms, good food - what more can anyone ask for? This hotel is located within easy walking distance of practically anything a tourist would want to do and see, and is convenient to reach other major destinations around the city by bus or taxi. The hotel staff is very helpful as well as knowledgeable, and their cheerful attitude makes a hotel stay comfortable and pleasant.
title: Great hotel, perfect location

review: Stayed in this hotel at the end of July for 4 nights. The hotel was clean, bed was extremely comfortable and staff were very accommodating. Everything we asked the staff for we got. Breakfast was included in our stay and was very tasty and suited all dietary needs.
title: Would stay again!

review: Just home from a weeks stay at this hotel. It was my wife and I first trip to Barcelona and the hotel was perfect. Clean, tidy and in a great location. We were a 10 minute walk from the Placa de Catalunya. From here you can walk onto the tourists buses, the Rambla, Gothic Quarter as well as stroll around all the shops along the Passeig de Gracia.The hotel has a small gym but perfect for a brief session to keep on top of the Tapas diet we adopted for the week. However the best asset the hotel has is the rooftop terrace with loungers, dip pool and bar that serves snacks and drinks.Overall a great stay! Highly recommend.
title: Great Stay in Great Location

review: Positively impressed by this hotel, even if the CATALONIA are always good. Two-windows room, absolutely central and quite at only 10 minutes walking from Placa Catalunya, pool and bar on the roof could give you relaxing moment before dinner! I paid 140€ in july, nothing for Barca!
title: Comfort in Eixample at low price

review: Staff was friendly fasting check-in and check out specially the accommodation they did for us as my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary, Hotel was clean and location was near attractions and transportation. the only bad thing that the room service is not 24 hours.
title: very good experience

review: Just got back stayed from 28/7-1/8 travelled with 3 other girls for a girly weekend away. Could not fault the hotel, clean and tidy and very comfy beds! Ideal hotel for the city sights, takes about 20 mins to walk from the hotel to the bottom of La Rambla, and 40 mins to the beach at port olympic, if you don't fancy the walk its less than 10 euro in a taxi. There were a couple of stags doo's but they were fine just lads having a laugh. The roof top bar and pool was a very big plus especially as it was reaching 31 degrees! We loved our time and didn't want to come home wish we'd booked for a few days longer!
title: Really Enjoyed

review: My partner and I stayed 3 nights in July. Both in our twenties. From the exterior the hotel is great, but disappoints slightly once inside (see pictures). We arrived in our room to find a used condom on the bathroom floor. The women on reception (morning shift) was insincere and simply told me that the cleaner would move it, no genuine apology. We didn't make a fuss, complain or ask to speak to management. Out all the things you don't want to find on your bathroom floor, a used condom would be up there. If we were an elderly couple or made more of a fuss I think we would have been taken more seriously, rather than brushed aside. The hotel pool area is lovely, however the pool itself looks very unclean. The hotel seems to be a popular place for large stag groups. If a group is in the pool you have not got a chance of relaxing in it. They can also be quite intimidating, a couple of times I witnessed two groups of females leaving the pool area after being pestered by groups of drunk men. The room is lined with wooden panels, all of which are chipped and worn. The shower curtain is inadequate, water leaks all over the floor and wooden door frame making it rot. The air-con temp is good / cold and we understand that aircon units are loud, but this one was the loudest we have ever experienced (and rattles). The two main roads at the side of the hotel make it impossible to sleep with the doors open. Overall, decent hotel for large stag groups; not the best for couples or families looking to relax - better alternatives withing then same budget out there.
title: OK. Not clean. Full of stag groups.

review: I use this Hotel for more than 10 years and it was always a pleasure to stay there. Excellent location in the Center of Barcelona, Close to two Metro stations, nice and clean rooms, good Service, excellent breakfast
title: Catalonia Eixample 1864

review: The hotel is in a great location close to lots of amenities restaurants, bars and plenty if shops. The staff were always friendly and very helpful.The room was really nice. I would stay here again and definatly recommend it.
title: Excellent hotel

review: Excellent location. Clean room. Good air-conditioning. Service was excellent and friendly. Would definitely recommend. Close to market and many sights. I'm from US and found this hotel one of our best on our vacation overseas.
title: Perfect

review: We booked our stay with booking.com And somewhere the information got lost. We booked standard room with breakfast, I need my coffee in the morning but the lady in the reception was telling us NO. She looked down at us. The breakfast is + €16 keep that in mind. Even if you book it may not register and off course that's not her fault but there is no need to make costumers feel ridiculous, really what is €16 when you pay €155 a night? So it's not about the price but the way they carrying themself. The room is clean but definitely not 4stars. The room was well made and good condition but if the staff cannot understand basic communication with customers then you are in great loss.
title: Not what I expected

review: Really great hotel.There is a big market just across the street.Room is big and very clean.Location is perfect, 2 minutes walking from Placa Catalunya and from La Buqariya market.Staff are very nice
title: Great hotel

review: I really expected much more; but in total the hotel was much of a good one.I start with negative points:The door wouldn't be locked properly; the staff knew little English; they asked for a 100 Eur deposit; the public bathroom in the restaurant area had technical problem and was locked. The kitchen staff were very friendly but the ones in reception desk or other areas were like programmed robots. In the last day of our stay, the reservation settings were not registered properly in the PC of the restaurant. They gave us one of the dullest rooms with no street view, the window would open to a noisy patio and the window wouldn't get opened or locked sometimes.The positive points: great location, pleasant view in restaurant, variety of food, clean rooms with proper facilities.
title: Great location, average service

review: Rooms are tiny !! - no privacy glass doors on en suite - rooms very noisy can hear everything from room next door - waited 10 mins to be served at bar gave up & went down the street to a supermarket & bought our own drinks - great restaurant next to hotel
title: Holiday

review: The cost of the room was too much for the accommodations we received. I wish the hotel was more updated in order to give a higher grade. The front desk people were friendly and helpful. I appreciated that. The hotel is centrally located and easy walking distance to other districts.
title: High cost for average hotel

review: If you are looking for somewhere clean, modern and in the center of all the action this is the place to go. It is a very nice walk to a lot of restaurants and a lot of the nightlife in Barcelona, as well as there are a few subway stations very close. The rooms are very clean, a decent size, we had a beautiful view of the courtyard. Employees are very nice and want to help you with anything.
title: Great Location

review: Location was the best thing about the hotel. The rooms could and should have been cleaner. I personally told them multiple times that there was a bad smell in the room which they totally ignored. The hotel Manager was extremely corteous though, not the rest of the staff
title: Not Satisfied

review: Overall, this is a correct place to stay! The location is perfect - at about 15 minutes walk to the Rambla - and the surronding is nice! The night live is plaisant with many small palces to stop, sit and enjoy a refresment. Peoples living there are nice to speak with and happy to help when required! As I stated in my comments about the Hotel, rooms are small, clean and the personel is excellent!
title: 2 days staying at this ressort

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: El Jardi is located in the quaint area of Barri Gotic, on a square. It is not far from a lot of areas that are within walking distance, especially our favorite, El Born. A few years back we had stayed at Jardi and it was fine for us, but this time we have outgrown it. Our room, with a balcony overlooking the plaza and Church was delightful, yet a bit too small for us. The bathroom was tiny, with a shower that proved to be challenging for my husband. Apart from that, the a/c worked well, the bed was comfortable- would have been nice to have a small mini-fridge to keep water/drinks cool. The staff was very nice and accomodating when it came to questions.As far as breakfast, it was not consistent. The first day they had a basic buffet breakfast which consisted of croissants, baguette-like bread, yogurt, jam, butter, fruit, oatmeal, and drinks which included tea, coffee, milk, and chocolate mix. The next day we came down and there was nothing- just baguette-like bread and coffee. After a while we inquired and a couple of croissants were brought out... As I mentioned, we had been to Jardi a few years back, and it was what we expected. This time, the lack of space in the room and bathroom and the sparce breakfast was a bit uncomfortable. Yet, the location is fantastic, especially to be able to walk to so many areas and have access to public tranportation so easily. Barri Gotic is full of great tapas places and walking distance to other areas- we even made it to the beach, which was fun! When you venture to El Born, make sure to pay a visit to Sagardi Euskal Taberna for some great pintxos/tapas and fun!
title: Great location, but a bit small.

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: With my son and a friend we were in Barcelona to attend a football match at Camp Nou. We spent one night at El Jardi. This little hotel is ideally located in Barri Gotic area. Its charming facade is overlooking typical Plaça Sant Josep Oriol.After a drink at the tiny Bar del Pi we came into the historic building. We were kindly welcomed and proposed a cozy functional simple bedroom. View from the balcony on the famous Catalan gothic church Santa Maria del Pi was really stunning.After a short but quiet night we came down to eat something and have coffee. As the breakfast room was a bit gloomy we went outside and took our café and buñuelos at a nearby terrace. Looking at the city coming to life around the pine planted in the middle of Plaça del Pi All in all we had a pleasant stay at El Jardi.
title: In the heart of Barri Gotic

hotelLocation: Placa Sant Josep Oriol 1, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The location is the ideal for watching the dynamic Barcelona and the activities that go on by walking only a short distance. As you enter, the hotel has a notice in front "you are only 24 steps away from the lobby/reception" which is a fact. The shower in the room is the smallest space ever I have seen for a shower in my life. One can hardly move inside or get in & get out. I found it so difficult to apply soap with such a limited space.
title: Excellent no-frills hotel

review: It was a decent hotel. Breakfast was okay. Found hairs in the bathroom upon arrival. Bed was comfy. The location is good if you want to be near the beach. Outside the hotel smelt like rotten egg. It's a good hotel if you plan on spending most of the day out.
title: You get what you pay for

review: The location of the hotel is quite nice, near to the beach and only 5 minutes walk to the metro station.The room we stayed in was not clean, the bathroom was dirty, and we got the idea that it was not cleaned properly, also all the shelves were full of dust and we had to clean it on our own so that our clothes don't get dirty. A good thing is that we got clean towels everyday. The breakfast was boring and poor in comparison to other 4 star hotels we stayed in. It is not a 4 star hotel, maybe a 3 star and we have to emphasize that we are not very demandable guests.The older lady at the reception was quite rude when we were leaving and the day before that. She didn't even bother to say bye on the check out and she was talking on the phone and couldn't care less about us. We left the hotel with many question marks because that's not the way to treat guests after we spent 7 nights there. Maybe she should reconsider a career change. We have to say that the other 2 young man at the reception were very nice and helpful.We would not stay in this hotel again.
title: Hotel 4 Barcelona - review

review: We have just returned from a whirlwind stay in Barcelona & thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We stayed for 3 nights and though we didn't spend much time in the hotel, we were more than satisfied. The hotel is modern with a small but pleasant reception area. The young man who booked us in was very cheerful & helpful. Our room was modern & relatively spacious with a walk in shower in the bathroom & open double wardrobe in the main bedroom area. The hotel is about 15 mins walk from Laccuna metro station & about a 10 min walk to the beach. If you turn right out of the hotel and walk for 5-10 mins until you get to a cross roads there is a tree lined avenue full of bars, cafes & restaurants with lots of people milling around - lovely to see & lots of choice. If you want to stay near the beach but still within easy striking distance of the centre than Hotel 4 is a good shout.
title: Short but sweet stay

review: Great hotel, great room, it's clean and roomy, in a great location where you can connect easily to all parts of the city. Service is friendly and lots of things to do nearby. Recommended for a tourist stay in Barcelona.
title: Great Hotel!

review: I had a great time here. The hotel is very nice, super clean, good service and it's in the PERFECT location. The area is great, with tasty bakeries, nice bars and restaurants and a metro station right across the street from the hotel
title: Great hotel in PERFECT location

review: Stayed here for 4 nights before heading off elsewhere and it was a nice stay. Great location in terms of being close enough but far enough away. First 2 days we walked miles then on the third day stayed local and visited the Picasso Museum which was only 10 mins away. Lovely pastry bakery just down the road and the underground metro is only 50m away. Rooms are not sound proof as they advertise, but wasn't a huge issue. Small pool, busy, not many sun loungers available, but good of you find one! Ideal for a short Barcelona break, as great location and clean. Would recommend
title: Nice place

review: We booked this hotel through NCL hotel pre-cruise package. The hotel was clean and the room average. We did not expect much so there is no disappointment on what we found. We requested a room from the 6th floor upwards after reading a review on Tripadvisor. Our room overlooked the pool area and was fine except for one night when there was a group playing in the pool around 10:15pm. We called the desk and eventually they went and took care of the issue. The offered breakfast was not much for a buffet style offering. We decided to not take the shuttle but took a cab to the ship since we wanted to board early and enjoy the ship. The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing in the Gothic area and we enjoyed many of the restaurants and sights.
title: A Central Area Hotel For Pre-Cruise

review: This is a pleasant, clean hotel with a great location. We always choose our hotels for location and this delivered 100%. Although just a 3 star hotel we could not have asked for a better location, it was perfect, clean, had a swimming pool and served a reasonable breakfast included in our rate. All staff were friendly and extremely helpful (we emailed ahead with some requests/questions and they came back immediately helping in every way possible). Our room was great, we had the top floor with a large balcony comprising sun loungers, tables and chairs all with a roof top view, could not have asked for more. The room and bathroom was modern with a huge bed and exceptionally clean. We would advise anyone to read the blurb on the hotel as tea and coffe was not supplied in the room, however, this was not a problem for my coffee addict husband, we took a travel kettle with us. Water was not supplied in the room, however, a supermarket close by sold bottles reasonably priced. There is no concierge, however, the reception staff are on hand to answer any questions about this city. We purchased the open top bus tour through the hotel saving us a couple of euros. There is no entertainment here just a bar with little atmosphere, buy hey, you are in the heart of Barcelona, go out into this beautiful city and embrace it, it's right on your door step! We enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to return.
title: Perfect location

review: Granted, this place is clean and in a good location. However this is where the positives end.The walls are paper thin so we can at this moment hear the couple on one side of us having a conversation and the cleaner vigorously cleaning the room (and possibly rearranging the furniture??) on the other. Every time our neighbours take a morning shower (at 6am, or this morning at 4.30am) it sounds like a waterfall is running down the wall beside our bed! We can hear lights being switched on, plugs being put in and out, conversations, TVs, hangers being battered in the cupboards, and people walking on the laminated flooring. The hotel has a pool which attracted us in the first place, but don't let that entice you, since it only gets sun in the morning and the loungers and swiftly taken by people who don't leave them all day so no chance of using it until the sun goes down! Avoid at all costs if you want a good nights sleep in preparation for your busy trek around the city.
title: Avoid!!!!

review: Cannot rate this hotel highly enough!We arrived earlier than expected and was greeted with such warmth and professionalism, and unexpectedly they checked us in early and with efficiency.Our room far exceeded our expectation for comfort and space considering it's a 3 star hotel, boasting large beds, excellent bathroom facilities, storage and dressing table. We had views spanning from the sea, gothic quarter, placa de catalunya to montjïc!The pool terrace was in the sun all day and the bar has the best sangria we had in Barcelona.As our visit called us to Barcelona on my business, the location of the hotel, and the pool facilities enabled me my wife and I to both enjoy some time together. So nice to be able to use the pool and sunbathe on a business/city break!Location wise it could not get any better as it is central to shops, cultural attractions, our favourite restaurants and bars, and just one minute from the metro station whose line services all of the beach stations! We will certainly stay at the hotel again, if I had been checked into a room that was noisy, as other reviews suggest, I would have asked to move as our room was very quiet.No coffee/tea facilities in room but the hotel is flanked by 2 excellent coffee shops, which we frequented for breakfast.
title: Perfect mix for Business and pleasure

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: Not valuable. Complimentary water is free only first day of stay despite you stay here for 6 night.Housekeeper take you key card from your room despite you not allow. They don't clean your bed and change bed cover only pretend to do it. Terrible Marriot experience here!!!
title: Terrible

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: We stayed here 6 nights in an ocean side room on the 22nd floor. Of those 6 nights, two were disturbed by an extremely loud concert nearby, which made it impossible to sleep. The first went on until 5 am. (The second is still going on, but it is 1 am as I write this and the music is still playing, whee!). If you value your rest, this is not the hotel for you.
title: Beware of Noise

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: I stayed this past week at the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum while in Barcelona on Business. This is a great hotel, the room was spacious and very clean with a great ocean view. The outdoor pool and bar were great, and the service was unbelievably great. Clio Rousomoustakaki and her colleagues in Guest Services were incredible. Clio arranged 2 great tours, found tickets to visit Segrada Familia when there were none to be found and made several dinner reservations at the most fantastic restaurants. Five stars and 2 thumbs up for this Hotel. I will definitely stay here again while visiting Barcelona.
title: Outstanding Experience

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: Stayed there twice for 2 nights on our European vacation. Found it very comfortable and the staff were helpful and pleasant. I would really have liked to have tea and coffee facilities in the room. Swimming pool was lovely but was difficult to get a chair.
title: Happy traveller

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: My Wife and i arrived here around 10pm on a Friday night.Check in was very smooth.We got up to our room and was really impressed with what we saw.We had a Standard Room.It was very clean.Lovely Bath and The Best Power shower.We had a City view which was Beautiful at night and the hills in the background.We could see Segrada Familia from our window too.There was a Lovely Perfume Fragrance in the Reception area.The Bar was good with Stunning views over both the city and the Beach.The area was good.Opposite Diagonal Mar shopping centre.There were local small Bar/Restaurants about 1 min walk away.The Metro station was reached with in a fdw minutes.A nice touch was the Carafe of Fruit and Water Drink and Marshmellows which refreshed us on our return from being out and about.We will most Definitely stay here again.Slso the beach was about 7min walk away.
title: Beautiful Hotel

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: We crossed path with Emirates crew members at the AC Marriott Forum Barcelona. We asked them how their stay was. They said that their stay was good worth. We assume that our stay was good worth as long as they stay with us at same hotel. Emirates has good taste and right choice where crew members can enjoy and get good value. We loved swimming pool and quiet bar on the rooftop of the hotel. The hotel is located next to Marbella beach and Forum shopping mall including grocery store. Of course, the hotel is ideal for families. Big minus is not reliable computer center where business center is located on ground floor at AC Marriott Forum Barcelona. There is forever problem with computers and internet. However...Our stay was good worth anyway!
title: It is good worth stay at the hotel as long as Emirates crew members stay

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: Stayed with family for a recent conference. Hotel is perfect for a business traveler to Barcelona. With a family, it's OK. If this were our first visit to Barcelona, we would be disappointed with the location as it is far outside the center, however the links to public transport are excellent. Staff was very good.
title: Business, mostly.

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: This hotel is good for price and near all kinds of shopping and stores and a big mall. Loved the staff and they were so helpfull and friendly. Not the closst to city center but buses and metros are easy to catch.thank you
title: Best staff I've ever met

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: We arrived on a Sunday to a very busy lobby, but Irene and Silvia at the Front Desk never lost their smile. They helped us throughout our whole stay and were knowledgeable,friendly and efficient. They truly made our stay that much more memorable! Thank you :)The hotel is clean and modern, with fast elevators, comfy beds and a great pool (a bit small, but really cool). The only negative is that the location is a bit far from the rest of the city, but at least you are across the street from a mall and the tram. Also not far from the beach.
title: Comfortable rooms and friendly staff

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: As a very seasoned global traveler, I would highly recommend the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum (Marriott) Hotel because of the excellent service, attentive staff, perfect location and comfortable rooms.We traveled to Barcelona for business and found an absolute jewel in the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum. - The location was exceptionally convenient. We had a professional conference at the convention center which is next to the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum- Easy walking distance to the metro. The Metro (underground subway) is very easy to navigate, very clean, air conditioned and staff are available to assist if you need help. Passengers are also a great source for help - the people of Barcelona are so helpful. Buy a multiday pass at the Barcelona airport or at the metro station.- Rooms are clean, clean, clean. The hotel staff are friendly and incredibly efficient. We appreciate the staff for their pride in keeping the rooms cleaned.- At the end of a long or hot day, take a quick dip in the pool. There are poolside loungers, tables and more tables inside the restaurant. The hotel can provide pool towels and the staff are very attentive. Enjoy a drink poolside - the view is absolutely beautiful!!- Across the street is the Diagonal Mall - lots of shopping, food choices and good restaurants (asian, italian, spanish...). We enjoyed an evening of tapas and paella which were very tasty and reasonably priced. A grocery story is located inside the Diagonal Mall - get some bread, wine, cheese, a bit of prosciutto and fruit for your hotel room! The selection at the grocery store is amazing and you won't be disappointed.- The hotel has a very good breakfast area with a wide selection of food. The service was incredible and the staff worked very hard to keep the food fresh and the tables clean. - The hotel room was very clean and kept clean every day. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning functioned perfectly and the rooms had darkening shades. For an international traveler, these provided the right environment for a great night of sleep. - Beyond the obvious sights of Barcelona that are listed in Tripadvisor, don't miss the many unlisted churches (the architecture and relics are historical gems that cannot be found elsewhere, one church had a special staircase that led us to the most amazing rooftop views of Barcelona), a simple scoop of gelato by the waterfront, and the wonderful food/wines from the local restaurants.- From the hotel, it is a relaxing 10-15 minute walk to the beach. There were a lot of families, surfers, people playing sports, open showers and a few nude bathers. The beach area was well maintained and busy on a hot day.- Taxis can be found in front of the hotel. Very convenient. - And, most importantly, I have to mention the high level of service provided by the hotel staff at the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum. Near the end of our trip, the glass vanity in our bathroom became cracked. We informed the front desk staff immediately and returned from our city visit in the afternoon to find that the entire glass vanity in the bathroom was replaced (wow!). Front desk, housecleaning, restaurant, poolside - we received the best service from this team and truly appreciate how comfortable our stay was because of their efforts.Barcelona and its culture are worth exploring. We enjoyed the people, the food, the cultural sights and this was especially worthwhile because of the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum. Sharing our experience with others is important because traveling is expensive and helping others to know what to expect is important. Please do let me know if this review was helpful so that I am motivated to continue sharing my experience with others. We made a great choice with the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum (Marriott) and hope you enjoy Barcelona!
title: Loco for the AC Hotel Barcelona Forum - Perfect for Business Travelers!

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: We were in Barcelona the first time for a family vacation, and stayed the first part of our trip in a very nice AirB&B in the city, and had always planned to stay in a hotel for a couple of days. We also had planned to use our Marriott Reward points. By the time we got around to booking at the last minute, the available Marriotts in the area we limited, and the points required for the AC Forum seem reasonable. I called them directly and the staff was very friendly and accommodating in the phone, and we book two references for rooms. The booked them both on the seaside and because I'm a Marriott Gold Rewards member I got upgraded to a Junior Executive Suite. Both rooms were outstanding. The view is spectacular right on the Mediterranean. The staff could not have been more helpful. We spent time at a beach nearby, and a subway stop is nearby so we were easily able to get to the center city and attractions. We enjoyed it so much we stayed several days longer with a deal of paying half and redeeming half the points that would be required for a full point redemption stay. I'm sure there are more highly appointed Or centrally located Marriott's in Barcelona, but staying right on the beach / coast, with access to nice restaurants and close by train / subway transport, the spacious rooms and the helpful staff, we will stay there if we ever are lucky enough to get back to Barcelona.
title: Very Nice Experience

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: Stayed here 2 night with mixed results. We occupied a junior suite which was really quite nice with a view of the beach. The room was clean, large and had a great oversized bathroom. However this very good room had some problems which lead to the mixed result experience with our stay. The beach view was nice if there is not a music event on the beach until 2am which kept us up. It was some kind DJ music event down the beach and it could be heard in the room. The other problem was the bed was not up to the Marriott standards which I'm use to, very uncomfortable. The breakfast was very mediocre much less than what I would have expected from a first class hotel. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel near the pool and had a very good dinner. So you can see why we had mixed results for our stay.
title: Just an okay hotel experience

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: Hotel did not advise guests of local issues affecting hotel (had a 2 night huge open air concert next door). Hotel staff did accommodate a room change that was appreciated.
