Irene was fabulous and did what she could to assist. All other "services" were a hit and miss. No concierge - offered pamphlets and left to our own devices. Stamp sales were ridiculous - only accepts cash at desk. Quoted me $2 euro per card and later found out it as $1.50 euro. Sink and shower drains were extremely slow - leaving a pool of water to look at and stand in. Was told "this is not a full service property". Check prior to arriving on the noise issues.......
title: Disappointed in a Marriot Property

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: A nice Hotel to stay in when on business trip, amazing location, close to Diagonal Mare mall,Rooms are clean,comfortable bed, u might hear a bit on street noise if you are at lower levels.Staff are very friendly and helpful.Haven't had the chance to dine at the hotel as i was enjoyed food outdoor in such beautiful city at the best weather
title: Nice and convenient

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: Nice hotel near the beach, which is not a good location if you are interested in sightseeing. The room was in good size and very clean. you can also have sea view if you ask for it. The free WiFi was very slow.
title: Good hotel, Bad location

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: This hotel is highly recommended by me! We stayed for two nights and it was a perfect location for us. We wanted to be close to the beach and we certainly were. A short walk to the beach front with beach bars and restaurants. When we wanted to explore more of the city we were spoilt for choice with transport. Trams, metros and taxis all close by. However, we chose to use the Barcelona City Tour Bus where a stop was just outside the hotel. The rooms were clean and modern and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Thank you for a fantastic short trip AC Hotel Barcelona!
title: Beautiful hotel - amazing customer service.

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: We stayed at this hotel back in April for 3 nights. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Our room had a sea view. The room was reasonably sized and spotless. The staff were welcoming, attentive and helpful. The restaurant was ideal to grab a bite to eat or even just to enjoy a drink with quite a good view of the city. The pool and terrace area were absolutely stunning - a really peaceful place to unwind and relax. My only quibble about this hotel would be that it's a little way from the centre. However, the metro stop is only a five minute walk away and the route stops at key places in the city (including Barceloneta and Passeig de Garcia). All in all, we really enjoyed our stay here!
title: Relaxing break

hotelName: AC Hotel Barcelona Forum by Marriott
review: We went to this hotel to spend my nieces 40th birthday, which was on the 4th August, the receptionist was very friendly and nice, also very helpful.The rooms were very nice, very comfortable with 2 large single beds, a well stocked mini bar, bathroom had hair dryer, very powerful shower, and complimentary, comb, tissues and shoe shine. Clean towels every day, also beds mad every day, and rooms cleaned. It had a large screen Tv, unfortunately there were no English speaking channels at all, ( not that I stayed in purposely to watch Tv).Pool area on the Thirteenth floor was lovely, very clean, the bar closed at 01.30am every night, drinks at the hotel are expensive tho.Just a word of warning to everyone, and I cannot stress enough, that this has in no way shape or form got anything to do with the hotel, please please be aware of pick pockets, on the first night there, my 2 nieces and there friend just went outside of the hotel to have a cigarette, and some low life, actually grabbed my nieces watch from off her wrist, So please all be very very careful in what jewellery you are wearing and please bags and wallets keep a very tight hold of them.The hotel security was very good, he was so very angry with what had happened.All in all an excellent stay at this hotel, plus you know it's a good hotel when 2 to 3 coach loads of airline cabin crew, and the pilots stay at this hotel.
title: Very comfortable

review: It is a little way out of the city centre, but about 50m from a metro station. The same station serves the train to the airport, so there is no problem with communications. It is on a busy road, which adds little to the charm, but I was pleased to note that the soundproofing on the windows is good. The hotel is formulaic, but clean, and everything works including the air con, and 100 euro a night is not bad in this city. The rooftop pool was small and cold, but the spa was worth 10 euro for a 2 hour wallow.
title: Good value place to stay

review: Excellent Hotel, good facilities rooftop pool brilliant. All staff polite and friendly, no complaints. Only downside is hotel a little out of the city centre but metro stop across the road which we used constantly. I would indicate location average which the markers below wont let me do.
title: Brilliant Hotel

review: The location is very good. Close to the subway Clot. Always a taxi ariuns if you want to move around quicky. Good restaurants in the neighbourhood. For breakfast you can go to Glow Bar. Small but delicious breakfast.
title: Great stay!!

review: Stayed here for 2 nights ( 14 July) . Upon arrival check in was busy and slight trouble finding our booking think this was due to a name change. We wasn't given any information about the area or a map. After checking into our room which was very nice. We went out. After asking at reception for a map they still failed to give any information or mark on the map where the hotel was which would have been very helpful. We found the bus stop right outside and found that the bus number 62 takes you to the shopping area and to the las Ramblas. ( last bus stop to get off at and it costs €2.15 each. ) it's also easy to get a taxi and the metro stop is across the road from the hotel. Upon returning to the hotel in the evening we enjoyed a drink in the nice bar area. Then went to our room. The guests staying opposite to our room were unfortunately very noisey slamming doors and screaming. Other guests were coming out to them and the hotel staff did tell them. But this did continue for some time. No consideration for the other guests staying in the hotel totally unacceptable behaviour. The beds were comfortable. The rooms were comfortable and clean. There is free WIFI. Housekeeping provided a good service. The buffet breakfast provided a good choice. On our last day we didn't have time to go out so we used the rooftop pool on the 11 th floor. There was a nice terrace area and solarium. And panoramic views. All very nice. And a very pleasant way to spend our last half a day in Barcelona.,The hotel has a spa and fitness area which we didn't have time to use. Very nice stay. The location was a little far out for us So. next visit I would prefer to stay more central based. But this is personal choice and I would recommend this hotel as it was a very enjoyable stay. Certain areas could have improvements made more information from the staff about the area. And inconsiderate guests , which the hotel has no control over. Overall a very pleasant stay and lovely break.
title: Pleasantbstay

review: Stayed for two nights at the hotel. It is close to all public transport which means you are only minutes from all tourist attractions and city centre. Hotel was very clean in all areas and had everything you need.
title: Barcelona Stay

review: I was going to miss my breakfast as I had to check out early by 6am. However, the kitchen and reception guys made a picnic basket which we had it at the airport. Very satisfying experience. We will opt to return soon.
title: Picnic basket

review: Got a great deal for four nights at this hotel. It is a little out of the way but the subway is just over the road and the main attractions really don't take long to get to. The rooms were spacious with amazing air con. We used the gym a few times and it was great. Didn't eat at the hotel but the menu looked delicious. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful too. I asked about the best way to get to the airport early and they booked a taxi for me. Would definitely stay here again
title: Couldn't fault it

review: Fab hotel. As you walk into reception you are struck by the cool air con (a relief from the heat) and a spa style aroma. Reception staff are friendly and professional. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms spacious and the beds very comfortable. We didn't book breakfast initially but were offered it for €10 at checkin. A saving of €4 - and the breakfasts were well worth it. Huge buffet style of hot and cold fruit, cereal, veg, meats, cheese, eggs, breads etc. Catering for special diets also. The rooftop pool is small but big enough to cool off in and offers amazing 360 degree views of the city. The spa contains a pool with jacuzzi and a steam room. There is also a small gym. Spa treatments are available if you want a little pampering - a little expensive but what the hell! It's only money!A great nearby restaurant for dinner is El Clot.
title: Superb

review: Stayed here in July 2017 on a city break to Barcelona. Hotel is in a good location with train station from airport just opposite and metro also there for travelling around the City. Pleasant and helpful staff. Would highly recommend.
title: Well located for visit to Barcelona

review: We stayed for few days before our cruise to the Mediterranean and the hotel was good the rooms was cozy, bathrooms was great and the service but the only thing I wasn't impressed were the beds they were hard and the pillow flat and the AC could of being better. We had breakfast at the hotel one day and the food was great but again the AC wasn't working. Also we asked at the front desk to see if we could get extra pillows to sleep better but the lady said she was gonna try to see if they have more but we never got any extra pillow. Location was perfect many restaurants and bars around. Local stores, Pharmacy anything you need is a walking distance
title: Family Vacation

review: An overworked and understaffed check in area manned by cheery staff. Bare minimum facilities. Noisy floorboards, no team making, no tissues, primitive vanity, just one blanket and dodgy power points. Even on the fourth floor the street noise from Ramblas is untenable all night long and despite double glazing. Good breakfasts in an pleasant dining room manned by efficient and good natured staff. Expensive for what it is
title: Disappointing - and noisy

review: First, it's challenging to find a room for a family of 4. This hotel provided a large size room with a large bathroom. Hotel was clean and, for a bit more, provided a really nice breakfast. A/C is provided and the location is wonderful. It was a 35 euro taxi ride from the airport and 15 euros to the cruise port. From this hotel, you might think you can walk to your ship, but trust me- you can't. Restaurants, shops and a large open air market were within easy walking distance, as was the Flamenco Cordobes. In addition, we were able to walk to our meeting spots for our tours. Some say it is noisy. We had a room facing Las Ramblas. I opened the windows, stepped on the balcony and soaked in the exciting atmosphere. Staff let us store our luggage until our 2p check-in and even offered a shower/bathroom if needed before check-in. There is a small elevator and helpful front desk staff. I would definitely stay there again with my family.
title: Good Family Hotel and Great Location

review: This hotel has just about everything from a medium priced hotel.+ Faultless location right on Ramblas+Bars and restaurants everywhere you look and turn.+ Great buffet breakfast+Rooms were relatively basic but very clean and adequate.(what more do you want when visiting Barcelona as there is so much to see rather than sitting in your hotel room)+ Wifi was not very good and did not connect for us at all during our 3 nights (hey...so what!)+ We had a Ramblas Room with balcony (very small)which opened directly onto the Ramblas. However, rooms were quiet and after long days walking and a few drinks any low level noise did not keep us awake!+Air conditioning worked well in 85 deg temperatures outside+Efficient and friendly staff.+Liceu Metro station just a 1 minute walk awayBarcelona is such a wonderful place to visit (our 2nd time) and this hotel could not be faulted at all and would stay here should we visit again.PS We got the best deal by booking directly with the hotel.
title: Suited us perfectly

review: We were very satisfied with our stay and would recommend this to anyone looking to stay right on la ramblas. Staff was polite and professional and the room was good. We paid for the breakfast and it was an excellent value with good service and good food.We booked a small interior room and got a small interior room. The bathroom was relatively modern, the furniture was in good shape. The only minor complaints I have were, There were too few electrical outlets available in the room, one in the sleeping area and one in the bathroom. The AC was... a little weak, but did function and cooled the room when given a long time. I went out and bought a fan though.
title: Reasonable hotel close to Metro, great breakfast

review: Check in was easy and the room was one of the larger triples I've stayed in while in Europe. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, and perfectly located. The beds, however, were hard and difficult to sleep on. The walls were PAPER THIN and you could listen in on the conversation of those in the room next door and write it down word for word. I have never had worse sleep in any hotel in my life. Two nights in a row I was woken up at 5 AM because the guests next door were speaking loudly. Normally guests speaking at 5 am wouldn't be an issue, but here it was because of how thin the walls were. Avoid staying in 435 in you want quality sleep... there is NO sleep to be had in this room.(And it was not even a front facing room). I even complained a few times but nothing changed. Other than the sleep quality, the hotel is in the best place it can possibly be!!
title: Mixed feelings

review: After looking for a month for a nice hotel in Barcelona I made a mistake of choosing this hotel , that doesn't care about anything besides taking your money , let's start with the -check in :unprofessional speaking loudly about pricing and rolling eyes about other guests . - the room : small with no design or amenities, ugly bathroom with no bidé or light dimmers , no hair conditioner , very small tv and poor air conditioning but the worse is the costumer service , I ask for places for dinner or drinks and they didn't know anything, I ask how to get the hotel 1898 roof top that has one the more famous bars in Barcelona and the look at me like I was asking for the moon , ask front desk for a toothbrush and they send to a Chinese store to buy it , Unacceptable when paying 200 dollars a night , the front desk is very casual and untrained calling me compañero few times. I'm not your friend, I'm a paying Guest !! To end this review: the minute that you walk out of the hotel you will find : prostitutes , people screaming, going to the bathroom in the street, selling drugs and counterfeit and trying to rip you off, literally a Zoo .Do no stay Here and if you do . Well you're going to regret it.
title: Horrible

review: Great location - rooms at back perfect-exceptionally clean - cleaning staff seemed to take a genuine pride , perhaps motivated by wall mural of cleaning staff. Air conditioning worked well . Shower was excellent. Breakfast was really good. Layout was great and variety of foods available. Serving staff were great - attentive when needed but not in your face.
title: Ideal

review: This hotel was a great choice. Apparently, taxi drivers frequently strike there so having a central location where I could walk everywhere was a life saver. The view from my room of Las Ramblas was great, if a bit noisy. Breakfast was terrific. It's a bit dated but overall a great hotel.
title: Great Location

review: Nice people, friendly staff, breakfast very poor. rooms good, need better hairdryer not strong enough. shower head in bathroom not stable. restaurant staff very friendly and accommodating. coffee terrible
title: Breakfast needs to be better

review: ...in a Hotel. Waited two hours for my booked room, got him and he was DIRTY. Not enough: The reading lamp was destroyed and i feared an electric shock. Next thing: I booked a comfort room and the porter said, comfort is the same as standard. Lost money, I think. At least - remember 2 Hours - every porter want a copy of my credit card - whats going on? --- well I think therme is more to come.
title: Worst Check In. Worst 3 Hours...

review: Spent a week in this hotel whilst attending a nearby conference. It is a bit out from the main buzz of Las Ramblas but easily accessible by tram that stops outside the hotel/ 10 euros by taxi..The hotel is outstanding. Rooms airy and very clean with good air conditioning , the staff were all really friendly and helpful and the breakfast was outstanding. The beach is 5 minutes walk away, the rooftop pool ideal after a hard day and there were several good eating places a few minutes walk away.. Would definitely stay again
title: Excellent hotel

review: Stayed here to be close enough but not right in the City center, As it was my GF's bday they upgraded us to an Exec room and suite access (get this if you can free bar and food in there with private lounge and outside area )which was a great start to the trip. Sea view room was nice and comfortable all in all pretty comfortable and as we were out and about so much was perfect for what we needed. Pool area is a little bit small but only here for 3 days so we weren't there for long enough to be an issue. Also want to say thanks for the bottle of champagne that was delivered with a Birthday card a real nice touch from the hotel! would recommend and I am back in Nov for business so will be trying to get booked in here again.
title: Great Stay, Comfortable and the Extras were a great touch. Defiantly worth another stay.

review: We had been looking forward to a short stay in Barcelona and picked this hotel due to the modernist architecture, which did not disappoint - however it was missing the touches you would expect in a good three star hotel and decent four star. Service was slow from waiting to be seated at breakfast, to replacing faulty swipe cards and failure to replace pool towels for afternoon arrivals. The worst evidence of the complete lack of focus on the customer was that despite reporting a faulty lock which allowed us to have interconnecting rooms with our children this was not fixed and we spent an uncomfortable night listening out to ensure they were ok. This could be a great hotel but sadly just scrapes into the mediocre category. We've stayed in far better Barcelona hotels....give it a miss and spend your euros elsewhere.
title: Visually impressive hotel without the service to match

review: This hotel is not at the centre of Barcelona but if you are confident on the metro the stop is just across the road and is good value and easy to use.There is the beach a short stroll away beautiful beach cafes with delicious food. Cocktails go down a treat.We were upgraded to use the 15th floor which was very nice, snacks and a drink late afternoon before heading out laterfor the evening looking out to sea was very nice.We didn't have the hotel buffet breakfast at €16 we chose instead to use the small cafe just across the road. Great staff good food.Most of the staff at the hotel were exceptional the man who took our luggage to the cupboard until needed was so helpful as were the reception staff.Only disappointment was the bar we decided to have an evening testing it out,a great shame poor staff several disgruntled guests. We waited so long for our drinks we got our money back and moved on.But this would not deter me from returning to this hotel the room was excellent we had a superb break.
title: Quiet location

review: I stayed with my parents for 5 nights in July 2017. From the outside the hotel is attached to another unfinished building and it looks like construction has been abandoned... it's not a great look especially with all the tagging on the building. Having said that the inside of the functioning part is well kept and around 4 star level. There's not a whole lot going on in the area, it's about 30 mins by underground from the centre of Barcelona, but you are 10 mins walk to the beach in that area. Also the poble nou area is quite close (catch the tram outside the hotel doors) and is good for meals. We hired bikes and found it the best way to get into town. It's an area for music festivals in the forum area and conferences so may be higher prices at certain times. However it's much calmer and quieter than staying near la rambla or catalunya especially at peak times.There's a large mall across the road and some of the restaurants are quite good, we had great pinxtos at Sagardi. But had most meals in the town centre. There's a gigantic supermarket in the mall with all you need including a large alcohol selection.The staff were very helpful but it did take quite a long time to check in. The pool is upstairs on the roof and is quite small area so often no stretchers available but nice to cool off in pool after walking in sun all day. Also gets a bit windy. There's a pool bar but I never saw anyone serving there.The room was clean and nice with good pillows. It was smaller than expected especially for three adult people. There were a million light switches, some labelled, some not, so we had a fun game trying to turn them all off at night!The bathroom has a see through blind which means people in the bedroom can see you getting undressed, good for honeymooners but not so much when staying with friends or parents!! We booked one room for three but it appeared they just put campbed in the room. No extra towel, mug, wine glass etc so obviously they assumed a small child. There was a kettle and tea/coffee which was great and unusual in Barcelona. Also it appeared on the website the extra bed would be in a separate area but not so. Breakfast was 16 Euro but was high quality and plentiful with mumms champagne, a range of good quality meats and cheeses, hot food etc. The museum of natural history across the road is worth the visit although almost completely empty as most visitors to Barcelona come for the beach!
title: Nice hotel away from hustle and bustle of city

review: This hotel is a family oriented hotel. close to public transportation and places to eat, however it is not a five minute walking to the beach like they advertise. The breakfast was ok. The pool was beautiful, but the water was beyond cold. It felt like you were in a freezer.
title: Nice Hotel, close to public transportation

review: The hotel is situated very close to the beach and was ideally situated for the Primavera festival. Checking in was problematic because they initially couldn't find our reservation - we had to provide printed proof (luckily we had the forethought for this). Our room also wasn't ready at the stipulated time and we ended up being reallocated a room. The rooms are decently sized and kept well. There isn't much of a view from most rooms. The rooftop pool and bar were a plus, it boasted a better view but nothing I'd take a picture of.I think the breakfast is overly priced for what is offered, based on what we experienced at other hotels. Given this we chose not to have breakfast at the hotel. A lot of public transport options are in close proximity which makes commuting to and from the hotel relatively easy.There's a large mall a stones throw away and a lot of little cafes and restaurants. All in all the experience was enjoyable and relatively affordable.
title: Very pleasant stay

review: 4 night stay. Although not the closest to the city the metro L4 line literally 1 mins walk away meant getting around was easy as it was a great line to be on. Add to that you are so close to the beach, a great shopping center and convenient for driving north if you have a car missing the city traffic. Check in was delayed by 1 hour and because of that they gave us access to exec lounge and spa for entire stay which made up for it. Pool is great a little cold but refreshing. Rooms are large and very dark so easy to sleep bed is comfortable. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever had for quality and choice. It costs 18 euro each so if you can get it cheaper by including it in package when you book I would recommend. There aren't too many other breakfast options around the area. Staff very helpful.
title: Great option

review: I passed 5 nights in this hotel. Closed to the city centre and to the beaches, this hotel is nice and well equipped. The breakfast is continental and respond to my needs. Only remarks for the rooftop which could be privatised for a day and not accessible to the people.I recommend.
title: Nice place

review: I had a 5 night stay for a conference in the nearby conference center, where it is located very conviently. Besides that it is a very boring part of Barcelona. If you want to enjoy the city, you should choose a hotel closer to the city center. The hotel is OK, but nothing special. If you want to work on your computer while you are there, expect a slow ann instable wireless network. The breakfast is very nice by Spanish standards, but nothing special from international standards. Conclusion, average taken the price in to consideration
title: Standard hotel. Strange mix between a business hotel and vacation hotel

review: We paid for the upgrade to include the Executive Lounge which was "not very Executive" at all, in fact pretty shocking throughout and very poorly managed. It was clear there was no management oversight from an operations perspective and the hotel have clearly cut back on the staffing of this area. At one point in the day there were no glasses to pour any drinks into, no ice, fridges were poorly stocked up and nothing was faced up or presented well and many of the plates were dirty. The toilet door lock was broken, the place was filthy inside and out with used glasses and food debris everywhere and children were just helping themselves with no supervision which surprised me as technically these children had unsupervised access to alcohol, I thought this level was over 18s !!  There was little or no food available at the key walk in times like 7pm, this was repeated in the afternoon. This is the 7th year staying at this hotel and the executive lounge facility was the reason I booked the hotel, but over the last couple of years it seems to have gone downhill and has got progressively worse. I thought last year's poor service was a one off but it was poor for the two days I stayed there this year.  It is the last time I would consider upgrading for the executive lounge in future and may actually not book there at all next year. I did complain to reception but there was no attempt whatsoever to recover the service or offer any form of compensation which I thought was a missed opportunity and has cost them a couple of customers as a result.
title: Disappointing!

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Fantastic place, fantastic people, fantastic rooftop bartender!! All star place. The theme and the deco is really fantastic, live the room, the headshower. Really cool rooftop chill place with really fantastic bartender, doing super tasty food at great value just at the spot!! Keep on the good work!!
title: Csaladi utazas

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Very good location. Only 3mins walk from Ramblas but quiet. Reception staff always polite and helpful. Really enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back. Huge variety of cafes bars and restaurants within easy walking distance.
title: A2night stay

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for 5 nights at end of July and were extremely happy with this hotel. On arrival the receptionist was extremely friendly and gave us a map which she then proceeded to draw the bus stops, best places to visit etc so that we knew where we were going. The hotel rooms are basic but very nice! The bathrooms are split with a curtain from the main bedroom but the toilet is separated by a proper door for privacy. The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms do have air con. The roof bar is lovely and has space for sunbathing as well as €6 drinks deals every evening - bartender Sofia was fantastic! Close to Las Ramblas and Metro stations. Definitely visit again!
title: Amazing hotel, great location!

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: An old theatre converted for hotel accomodation in central Barcelona was a real find!On arrival we were offered an upgrade to one of their Musical Theatre themed roooms - Westside Story, Lion King, Les Miserable, Phantom of the Opera or Chicago.We selected Westside story.The room was decorated with unique theatrical wall paper, pictures, murals and decor that matched the musical film artifacts.It was GREAT fun.We enjoyed our stay, the rooftop bar and breakfast room, all of which were very good venues.A special call out to Mohammed who looked after us with evening drinks at the rooftop bar, excellent service.All the staff were very welcoming and attentive.The location of the hotel was excellent, close to Port Vell, restaurants, and La Rambla.
title: A wonderful quirky hotel

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is ideally located near the 'Gothic' quarters of the City, making it a perfectly central location to most key tourist locations (5 min walk from the metro. 10 min walk to la Rambla and 10 min bus ride to the beach). Myself and 3 friends arrived for our first girls holiday to Barcelona and were welcomed with a friendly reception as we entered the quirky hotel. With little idea of how far we were from the tourist attractions we'd planned to visit, the receptionist whipped out a map and gave a swift and detailed summary of our closest metro stations, most accessible bus services and even the advised us on pre-booking some of the attractions we'd planned to visit. The rooms we'd booked (two doubles) were clean, spacious and extremely comfortable. We'd seen on the website that only a mesh curtain separated the bathroom from the bedroom, and as we were sharing between friends, we figured this would have been a bit intimate... however there was also a white curtain which could be drawn for privacy. (The loo had its own private room as well, thankfully). I have to say the beds were absolutely incredible. So comfortable, which was a dream to come back to after our long days/nights out. We spend a few afternoons and evenings on the spacious and modern rooftop area, enjoying the fantastic cocktails and soaking up the sunshine when we were a bit too tired to head down to the beach. Overall, I'd highly recommmend the hotel. We received a fantastic service from all the friendly, welcoming and helpful staff, with special thanks to Sophia for making the tastiest Mojito (or 4) in town
title: Wonderful week at Acta Mimic Hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: A Really nice hotel in a great spot. The pool is the icing on the cake such a nice spot to relax with a beer. The rooms are really clean and modern. Staff are extremely helpful too and have great local knowledge.
title: Great place in brilliant location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: Can not put into words how fantastic the service was, the bar staff were so friendly and couldn't do enough for you. The reception staff are extremely helpful and informative. The hotel itself is amazing, lovely decor and spotlessly clean. The rooftop pool is the best way to spend the afternoon after seeing the tourist hotspots. This is truly one of the best hotels I have stayed in! Hopefully I will be returning next year.
title: One of the best hotels

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: As regular travelers to Barca we had the B Hotel on our radar for some time. The rooftop infinity pool and bar, the perfect location in Plaza Espana (great if you are making your own way from the airport) and the obvious funky vibe and great design. Well we weren't disappointed! We stayed for my birthday at the end of June and we had a fabulous time. The rooms are modern and cool with tea and coffee (and mini-bar). Nice modern bathrooms and great communal areas. But above all the staff make the place extra special. The reception staff are friendly and knowledgeable and the bar staff at the fantastic rooftop pool/bar are brilliant fun. I was very touched to find a lovely card and bottle of Cava waiting for me in the room on my birthday and the fun continued by the pool with family and friends later on.I can't recommend the B Hotel enough and my daughter has booked to go there later on in August. If you want a quality hotel, great terrace, pool, food and a bar look no further.
title: The warmest welcome in Barca

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: I am writing this review to thank the staff for their outstanding service - from the moment we arrived until we left the service was prompt, thorough and friendly.From the complimentary champagne to assisting in sorting out our trips around Barcelona to the arrangements for a quick exit and taxi on the morning of our departure. I would like to make special mention of Marianne who did a brilliant job for my wife and I during our stay. She AND B hotel get a B for BRILLIANT Thank you Dave and Manuela Dennis
title: Top service

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: You made me feel very welcome and surprised me for my birthday! The rooftop pool was amazing, even though it wasn't sunny all the time. Javier the bartender was very kind and made great cocktails! Hasta Luego B-Hotel, see you soon <3
title: Worth 5* and excellent service.

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: We really enjoyed our stay at the B-hotel. Staff is really friendly and gave us directions where to find everything. The room is modern, clean and spacious. Nothing can top the rooftop though, the infinity pool was bigger than expected. The only downsides to our room were the shower (which is nice but the bathroom is very open so it kind of flooded one time), the plug connection which is on the other side of the night table (small detail) and the hotel is located to a big busy street so it can be a little bit rumourous at night (but totally didn't disturb us!) Those are small details though, i would definitely stay here again as the room was clean every day and the staff was always in a good mood. It's also located well next to shopping centre Arenas and of course Plaza Espanya where you can take the metro to basically anywhere.
title: Our stay

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: Lovely hotel & staff!! The pool is perfect and the staff sent up a bottle of champs as it was my birthday during our stay, very thoughtful! Would defiantly stay at B-Hotel on our next visit! The location is perfect as in the middle of all the main attractions!
title: Feel of a beach break in the city!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: We had a very nice 3 night stay earlier this month and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The staff were helpful, the subway stop was 100 metres away, and there were restaurants nearby if you didn't feel like making a track to somewhere new. There was a minor error with the time that we wanted our room cleaned by, but they made it up to us with a very nice note and a bottle of champagne! Very attentive and very concerned about their image. Of course the hotel was clean, modern, and the pool area was a great place to go after a long hot day trekking around Barcelona. my only complaint is one that is common in European hotels. There just needs to be more places to plug equipment in. Today people travel with so many pieces of equipment that need to be recharged at the end of the day, and with only one or two available receptacles and given the inconvenient European electrical receptacle design, it's just hard to get everything recharged for the next day. For any traveler, I suggest that you take a three-way American plug to plug into your European receptacle converter. This is not really a criticism of the hotel, as this place was great.
title: Very nice, well located, helpful staff

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July. The location was great, right by the Plasa de Espania, close to Metro, buses, shopping, Barcelona city tour bus stops and many other attractions. The design of the hotel is very modern and I would say urban. Our room was very spacious, with multiple lighting options, the view from the window wasn't that great (it looked at the back buildings) but we didn't really care, since we would come back late at night and go to sleep, the bathroom was really stylish. The best part of the hotel was the roof top infinity pool though. The view is breathtaking, you can see Monjuic mountain and the whole Plasa de Espania. The staff were very helpful and they all spoke very good English.
title: Great hotel, location and staff!!!!!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: Fantastic view from the rooftop. Great cocktails we had. Prices vary for what cocktails you have. Floor 8 of B-hotel. Great view of pool and plenty of loungers and tables. Great to see sunset from, close to metro
title: Rooftop bar

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: The room and facilities at the B Hotel Barcelona were excellent, as were the staff, in particular the bar staff and front of house staff. All were friendly and helpful, especially Javier at the pool bar who always added a dash of fun to his cocktails!
title: Excellent accomadation and service from the B Hotel Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: We were recommended the hotel by an extremely fussy member of my family. She was right to persuade us to stay.The room we had 209, one of the upgraded rooms, was large, clean and comfortable. A bonus was being able to open the window/doors and slide the external shutters.All the staff from reception, breakfast waiter, bar staff and cleaners were all polite and cheerful.Breakfast was excellent. Not a wide range of cooked food but everything was extremely fresh. Loads of fruit, hams and cheeses as well as cakes and other items I'm more used to seeing on a dessert menu.As for the roof top bar/swimming pool - amazing!Well situated for buses and metro. Shopping centre with restaurants next to hotel. Make sure you walk up to the National museum of art and walk around the olympic park and gardens.Only criticism was the lighting system in the rooms which you almost need a degree to operate. Nothing wrong with a simple light switch especially in the bathroom.Fantastic place to stay. Great value.
title: Good value hotel in ideal location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: I stayed here for a week with my girlfriend. The pool bar is great and the pool, even though small is a nice touch on the rooftop. You'll not use it for swimming, but it's great to cool off in.The rooms are o.k, but nothing special. Not much choice on the TV if you're wanting English. Having said that, who wants to spend time in the room?Location is pretty good. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants close by. It's about a 30 min walk to the main area - but only a few minute walk to the Metro.There us parking underground - but be aware that any large / wide car may have difficultly parking.The staff are really friendly and helpful. I shall certainly be back next year when in Barcelona.
title: Great Place to relax - and meet new people

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 389-391, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
review: Great hotel, clean and modern rooms, excellent staff especially at the pool bar. Location is a little out of town, but with excellent transport links this isn't a problem and there is plenty of bars and restaurants on the doorstep.
title: Weekend away

review: Very pleased with our stay at the Catalonia Rigoletto hotel. The staff were very helpful and took care of us throughout our stay. The room was very nice and clean. The breakfast had a good variation and everything was fresh. Located in a very safe area with the Maria Cristina metro being only a few hundred metres away.Would surely recommend should you be visiting Barcelona.
title: A wonderful hotel

review: It was great stay and really nice service. The support at reception was great. The room was agreable and what a great sleep quality. it is great to be in this part of city and enjoy the entire Barcelona.
title: Nice !

review: It was a great experience. Service, People, Location everything was top-notch . My room was always clean, every thing was replenished every day . Whenever I needed something I just had to call the ServiceDesk . The room service was good too
title: Wonderful

review: It was an amazing experience.Excellent hotel, comfortable beds and silent room.The staff members were kind and helpful.I highly recommend this hotel. Even if it is not central ,it s closer to the underground.
title: Wonderful hotel

review: The hotel is in a good position, some minute walk from the underground (green line, L3: it reaches the main touristic area). The room is clean with a big bathroom (and a very big shower). Breakfast was very good.The staff is very nice.
title: Good service, good breakfast and nice staff

review: Gustavo at the reception gave me a very beautiful room with a nice view and he was so kind and helpful. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and will recommend it to my friends as well. This hotel is not located in the heart of the city but there are lots of public transportation systems near the property like metro and bus which you can use to reach every district you want.There were some problems with the cold water in the bathroom, but this issue didn't affect my good experience at this hotel.
title: A great hotel with great staff

review: The rooms were very nice, the staff were really kind and professional, good cleaningservice and nice pool area.The only improvement would be the gym, We would preferably some free weights there too.We will definately return!
title: Hotell

review: The value / price balance was so poor. Room was too small. The problem with cold water couldn't be solved in short notice. There was no sense of urgency for solving the problem. The location of the hotel was quite good.
title: Dissapointment

review: Stayed here with my Girlfriend for our Birthdays (4 days apart) - I had emailed the hotel a week before we arrived to ask to put some decorations up for her birthday the day we arrived. The hotel were more than happy to do this and they had arranged for balloons, chocolates and even some wine, it was a brilliant touch. The rooftop pool was a lovely area, nice and quiet for when you wanted to chill out.The staff were so friendly and they couldn't do enough for you, the rooms were spotless every day and the bed was the comfiest bed we've ever slept in, unbelievable. Very close to the nou camp, just a short walk through a lovely park and public transport is easily accessible, with a tram stop not far from the hotel and Taxi's parked right outside the hotel. When checking out, the staff at reception noticed it was my birthday, and offered us a free breakfast, unfortunately we had an early flight to catch but we appreciated the gesture.We will definitely be returning soon & this time we'll be visiting the Camp Nou for a game.
title: Birthday weekend away

review: We booked our stay well before there were any reviews or pictures from guests on Tripadvisor. And felt we went out on limb.In short: Our stay was fantastic!The room was cozy and equipped with anything one could hope for. The breakfast buffet was very high quality, and constantly kept fresh and full.Staff was friendly and attentive. A very special thanks to Hector, who upon our arrival took som extra time to mark locations of restaurants and landmarks on a map for us.Would gladly visit again some other time.
title: Highly recommended

review: The hotel is just ok. There is absolutely no bathroom privacy and it looks a bit worn even though it is brand new. Hated the annoying club music that was everywhere all the time. The hotel should post the playlist so you can hear if you will like it. Loved the small roof terrace and the fresh orange juice for breakfast. The breakfast in general was good. The roof terrace should have more sunbeds and stay open longer.
title: Ok hotel

review: Stayed 6 nights, enjoyed the quality facility. It's a limited service hotel, that's how they can get the rate lower with such a high quality facility. Just know that's what you a paying for and be prepared to fetch your own ice. No bar or restaurant . Staff was outstanding. Room was outstanding. Location is outstanding.
title: Nice Design, it's "limited service" Outstanding Location and Staff

review: Be aware. This hotel has two small rooms on each floor which do not have windows to the outside. They have small windows that look out into a very dark, small open central lobby. It is our first time staying in hotel with no windows to the outside. We were unlucky enough to get one of these rooms.They try to sell you on their buffet breakfast. $13 euros reduced to $11 euros if you book breakfast for the entire stay. Bear in mind that you can get a baguette sandwich plus a coffee for about $3 euros from any of the little pastry shops around the hotel. We didn't bother with their breakfast option and were glad we didn't.The front desk staff is stand-offish, especially this one lady who works nights. The only helpful person we found was Maria who was very gracious and helped us with check out.
title: Very odd place.

review: A new, modern hotel with an exquisite interior. Centrally located just a 10 minute 'slow' walk from the Plaça de Catalunya. The hotel is served by two Metro stations with lots of local pastry and convenience stores nearby. Reception staff where helpful and friendly, with check in very easy. The deluxe room was spacious and cozy, well equipped with a large TV and integrated bluetooth in the room and bathroom. Very clean and rooms serviced daily. The breakfast buffet was simple but flavoursome, with something for everyone. Best of all, its open from 0700 to 1200 midday. Overall - a lovely, modern hotel, centrally located and great value for money. It must be noted, if you book a specified room type 'twin or double' via an external website, contact the hotel direct to confirm your request to avoid disappointment.
title: Central Modern Hotel

review: Two very tired teachers stayed here recently (23rd-27th July 2017) as a quick break away to start of the Summer holidays! The hotel could not have been better. Fab location (5-10 min walk to the main square) with help from the very friendly hotel staff who were on hand everyday (sorry!) to tell us the best places to visits and what to do in Barcelona. Our room was cleaned everyday and was very modern and ideal for us. We never wanted to leave! Thank you to all the staff for your help and guidance, we had the best holiday! Love Katie and Priya x
title: Outstanding hotel!

review: Spent one night here before heading home. Friendly staff. Comfortable and spacious room. Great toiletries!!! Good shower. Gym could be better. Love the location! Close to Plaza de Cataluña, which means easy airport transport. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Great!

review: Small and well-designed boutique hotel. Urban chic design - mix of dark grey and exposed concrete walls, subtle lighting, modern furniture (complete with a life-like dummy of a tattooed woman in a yoga position in the reception to add to the boutique feel). Bedrooms are well equipped in the same dark wood, urban style. Bathrooms are spacious with a good range of upmarket toiletries. Big walk in shower. Small gym in basement and a small pool (not big enough for swimming) and a few loungers on the roof terrace - with bar facilities (not manned). Excellent buffet breakfast; good range and great quality. Highly recommended. Just a shame there are building works next door (sound of drilling work me up, though it was 9am!).
title: Great boutique hotel

review: Wow a great hotel! If you are looking for somewhere smart but not in an ostentatious way then this is the hotel for you. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle but not too far to walk, in what we would describe as a trendy up and coming area. Modern, quirky and a great place to stay. We loved the feel of the hotel right from stepping of the pavement. Friendly, accommodating staff who spoke good English (sorry our Spanish was so bad!) Just the type of place you would want to be seen in. A lovely room with an amazing shower that I need in my life for 365 days of the year not the 4 we stayed. A hand written note welcoming us on arrival. The latest edition of a glossy fashion magazine to read on the desk. Bluetooth speakers, comfortable beds, controllable air conditioning, great lighting, a good choice of products for all those things you forgot to pack, good quality towels and linen. Lots of considered touches that we enjoyed. We would definitely stay again and recommend to friends. We are now looking to stay at another hotel in the chain for our next break. Good value for money too. We had a great stay thank you!
title: A wonderful short break

review: My partner booked this hotel for a short break. I had no idea of what had been arranged and where we were staying. When we arrived there was building work on both sides of the hotel and the road in front had been dug up as well. We could hear drilling and hammering during most of the normal working day. The hotel itself is painted dark grey and black throughout. Exposed concrete walls and dark furnishings throughout, It is tastefully done however it is not to my liking. The bathroom however was well equipped with good facilities and plenty of shelf space. The bedroom was small and lacking a dressing table so very little room for personal belongings. There is no restaurant and alas no bar either which ruled out the odd G&T before dinner at the end of a hard day's sightseeing. The breakfast room in the basement was pleasant enough and the spread was satisfactory. There is a marked lack of staff in this hotel, there is no one to show you up to your room or anywhere else for that matter, it is a case of finding things out. There is a plunge pool on the roof terrace with a few sunbeds but no other facilities that we could see apart from a few tables and chairs, sadly there are no views of the city. What this hotel does is good however it is more like an upmarket B&B so not sure if hotel is the correct description, having said that, it is the best B&B we have ever stayed at! So long as you are clear about what you are not getting it is convenient for getting around the Barcelona sights.
title: Modern hotel/B&B in a convenient location

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Great hotel! Staff is very friendly and helpfull. Good breakfeast and beautiful rooms. Hotel is situated in Raval, away from the tourists and between the real people of Barcelona. Located 5 minutes from the Rambla, subway Paral-lel and Drassanes.
title: Nice rooms, very friendly and helpfull staff !

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: Lovely hotel in perfect location. It was perfect for me for the weekend away. The only thing was there was no bedside table which is nice to have but overall loved it. It was clean and big enough for 2 ppl.
title: Great hotel!

hotelLocation: C/ Arc del Teatre 58, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed at this hotel only 1 night before catching a cruise. We choose it because of its location near to the center (so we can go out for dinner and walk along the rambles without having to go to the hotel by taxi ou metro) anf the entrance to the cruise terminal (a few steps away, next to the statue of the Colombo). The hotel is very jovial and different but had everything we needed. Our room had no view, but we did not mind. The breakfast had the possibility of being taken in a pleasant open air area. Without a doubt if you need to stay in Barcelona for a short stay, I recomend to book this hotel.
title: Very central and jovial hotel

review: Although this hotel is in a very good location and is a beautiful old setting, it has failed to keep up with today's standards. With just a little bit of effort on the owner and staff's part it could be excellent. We were in a standard room ( wish we had known that an upgrade would have been much better) and it was very small and not very clean. It seemed like no one cared about keeping this potential "gem" up the way it should be. Maybe a warmer greeting at the front desk, removing the very old and dirty bedspreads would have made our experience much better. We did, however, have one of the best showers which certainly was a treat. Breakfast was just adequate and again with just a bit more effort could have been much better. The potential is there and the location can't be beat. Maybe they will address these issues and have a great hotel.
title: Great location but....

review: We always stay here when in Barcelona and love it. The beds are extremely comfortable and the room spotless. Our only problem was on Monday 10th July 17 when the breakfast service was not up to the usual excellent standard. We went down at 8:15 and already there was no bacon or sausages and hardly any cold milk. The waitress seemed more keen on rearranging the food already there and came into the dining room to make a hot drink for herself then walked out again. Another diner asked for the hot food to be refilled and when our son went for sausages they were ice cold as if straight from the fridge and had not been heated but were put into the warming tray which is a food safety issue.
title: A lovely hotel

review: I was here only one night but it was perfect. Right off La Rambla yet really quiet. The room was squeaky clean and the staff very helpful. The breakfast was definitely worth it--a large variety of pastries and hot food (bacon, eggs, etc.). I totally recommend it and will probably stay there again!
title: Atmosphere in a reasonably-priced hotel

review: What a great, old world style hotel! We booked a room with a balcony, and spent quite a bit of time watching the people pass below. But when you closed the windows, the sounds of the narrow street faded away. We enjoyed the location: easy walk to the beach, with all of barrio gotic to explore in between. The staff was perfectly helpful. Not necessary to get the included breakfast, because there are so many options nearby. We would love to return. I hope we can someday!
title: Weekend in Barcelona

review: Has great character, clean, comfortable, and great locationIn barri gothic but not too loud.Elevator is great feature for upper levelsBreakfast wad greatI highly recommend this hotelWould be amazing if it had a bar
title: great hotel

review: Only negative review I have is the lift wasn't working so the dear receptionist had to lug everything up the stairs. Also during our week stay our towels weren't collected, so imagine 20+ wet and sandy towels strayed around the room. Otherwise the hotel is quite good for the price. Right next to the metro, very close to the beach and walking distance from the other attractions. If you close the balcony door you won't be able to hear the busy road ahead of you. However, as its so hot you may wish to keep it open and suffer from the noise. We had two rooms, beds were good sized. Rooms very modern. Another issue is breakfast is served in the sister hotel across the road. Don't forget to pick up a pass on your way out. I wouldn't vouch for their breakfast, not the best. Opt for room only if you can. There's a lovely bakery right downstairs and they serve literally everything a European bakery should. Rooms overlooking the side street (right of main photo) are much quieter and great for people watching. Staff are friendly. Overall, I would happily stay here again.
title: Girls trip - Great Central Location

review: Any problem reported was resolved quickly and for that,special thanks to Cornelia, the romanian lady at the reception which has been very professional, smiling and kind. Great hotel, very clean, cool, situated next door to Shopping center,supermercato,restautants with good prices, 10 minutes walk away to metro and then you can go everywhere in Barcelona . Very nice welcoming ,fresh water in the lobby with mint and ice, note write by hand in the room: classy.
title: Great staff, especially Cornelia,the romanian lady.

review: Great location accessible to major hubs: buses, metros as well walking distance to the heart of Barcelona city centre. Hotel room was nice, spacious and quiet. Front desk staffs were really cheerful, knowledgeable and helpful. On-premise restaurant menus (i.e. Breakfasts) were adequately convenient. An upgrade to coffee maker is recommended as our coffees (cappuccino, expresso etc..) tasted rather horrid. We recommend four-star overall.
title: Great Location & Wonderful Concierge

review: The Hotel itself is in a great location, near shops, public transport and restuarants. The reception and restuarant were all very nice and friendly. However, I had major issues as first I had to change rooms due to lack of space, then the sink in the bathroom was getting blocked everyday and the fridge didnt work despite reporting this. And to my disappointment, a pair of my nice earrings I had left on the table went missing one day when I returned in the evening. I spoke to the Hotel manager about this as I wasnt happy and she did very little if nothing to help me. The staff didnt get spoken to and she told me different things everyday. First she promised me the Hotel would give me a voucher to buy new ones, then she took that back and denied she had said that. There was no safe in the room so as a guest I would like to be able tyo trust the staff that nothing gets taken. This has never happened to me and I travel a lot. I was very upset and I had to keep chasing the Hotel Manager for answers. She basically said its not their problem in the end. She didnt even give me a discount on the room and I paid almost €1000 for my stay! How very poor.
title: Great location but poor customer service

review: This was a very nice hotel for our group of 12 people. Our check-in process was efficient and friendly. The room and bed were both comfortable. The room provides a counter with television and desk area and a small closet. There was a refrigerator with four bottles of water (no charge). The bathroom has a basin on a small counter with a variety of provided amenities (toothbrush, comb, etc.). The tub/shower has a glass door that covers only half of the opening, so it was hard to keep water from running onto the floor during a shower. The shower drained very slowly, but the water pressure was strong and the temperature stayed consistent. The free WiFi service in the room and the lobby was strong and reliable. We found only one electrical outlet in the room and one in the bathroom for charging electronics, but we carry our own plug strip so it was no problem. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would be glad to return in the future.
title: Convenient location and friendly staff

review: The hotel location is great. 5 min walk from placa espanya which is the point for tourist hop of hop off buses, aerobus , metro etc. The hotel also has 3 to 4 supermarkets in a 2 min walking range so very easy to get water and any other supplies. There is a coffee shop across the road if you want to grab a coffee and breakfast or a snack anytime and the jotel itself also has a bar and coffee shop which very convenient. They provide 4 small bottles of water, free, which was very welcome Now the rooms. Well for Spain it was great the A.C. and wi fi were working great in the room which was not my experience in many other hotels I stayed across Spain The room is small for sure but not uncomfortable. What I did not like is if you mean and sit up on the bed against the wall ..the whole bed slides ..very annoying specifically because there is just 1 chair on the room and the bed is where you would sit even if u wanted to for a few min. The bathroom was clean. Toiletries provided. My room passage started dripping water from the ceiling and I complained and they were very efficient in fixing it. Also the staff is really helpful and very well spoken in English. Even though the check in time is 3 pm you can leave your bags in storage if you arrive early and they keep it for you. I think overall it was a nice choice of hotel.
title: Great location, great staff.

review: The overall stay was nice- a few things I would have expected from a 4 star hotel was not that case with Barcelona Princess.Our room didn't have a mirror only the bathroom did which made it difficult to get ready especially if one person was in the shower. The room did not have a kettle to make tea/ coffee which most hotels do. At reception we asked for an iron but the receptionist said that they do not provide irons, if we wished we could have our clothes pressed we could but for an additional fee, and finally our shower was an open shower with a thin seal at the bottom but water would leak out so we had to put a tower to stop this.On a positive note a good nights sleep especially with the black out curtains, good location in terms of being near a 24hr taxi stand, bus stop and a shopping mall 2 minutes away.
title: Decent stay but not as expected for a 4 star

review: Was ok rooms were not very private as open plan and didn't have a sea view...shops next door ok I guess ...was quite disappointed with Barcelona to be honest wouldn't go back ... everything was too far away needed transport ...weather wasn't great very windy so didn't go to pool area ....
title: Bit out of the way

review: We have just returned from our 5 day trip to Barcelona & hadn't stayed here. Score, however we will return! We have stayed in other parts of the city previously & found this place to feel safer & more friendly.The area is not really touristy yet & there is a beautiful beach (with nobody but us on it!) & marina nearby. The hotel is right next to the tourist bus stop , tram station & metro station. The rooms are lovely, clean & the bed is massive! The only thing is that when we checked out no one told us about the taxi strike that was happening that day ! Lovely place. Will definitely return to this hotel
title: Friendly staff

review: I stayed here for 2 nights. It's a really nice hotel just beside the diagonal mar shopping center and a walking distance to the beach. Many nice places to eat around. And the tourist bus stop is just in front of the hotel, the hotel also provides sales of the bus ticket. The bus tour is a must do in Barcelona. It makes going to places a lot easier. The hotel also has nice swimming pools. Although I didn't get to use it cause I had so a little time in Barcelona. I would definitely be back to this hotel.
title: Nice hotel

review: For any negative comment I could find about this hotel, there is a much bigger positive to overshadow it. I am in a unique position for this review as I stayed in the basic double room and the master suite.Standard room; spacious, clean and floods with natural sunlight. The blackout and privacy blinds are fantastic, allowing you at have a good sleep in a comfy bed. The free minibar is limited, but it is free after all. The shower is fantastic, great water pressure and has therapeutic jets for a refreshing feel. We did have a flooding issue, but within 45minutes of reporting it, it had been fixated, cleaned and they had brought us champagne and chocolates as an apology. Fantastic customer service.Master suite; we decided as we were having such a good stay (and it was our anniversary), we would upgrade to the master suite for one night. It was a bit odd that the first time I asked about this, I was told it would be €250+. When I went to book, it was actually €150. The suite is lovely, loads of space and a confy sofa to relax on. The views are phenomenal, both during the days and in the evening, you can see over the city.Again, the hotel showed their customer service by bringing us complementary champagne and strawberries for our anniversary. The hot tub is also a great addition to your private terrace and sun loungers. The only gripe is that whilst we were in the hot tub (approximately 9:30pm) two cleaners came into the room, it was a bit of a surprise to see people walking around your space as you're relaxing outside, not something I was happy with really.The pools; we never actually made it to the top pool, it's very small and only as about 6 sun lounges. The pool on the 3rd floor has more space but filled up quickly and doesn't get the sun for long (it's in shade at about 3pm). The food; the food, unfortunately, is below par. Very expensive for what it is, poor quality and didn't match the standard of the rest of the hotel in my opinion. The breakfast was average, nothing particularly wrong, but not to my taste, good variety through and the waffles are nice. Massages; he massage was very nice, they have 2 rooms so you and your partner can be massaged at the same time. The company the hotel uses is very good and I would reccomend getting one while you are there.Location; right next to metro links, bus tours, taxi ranks, retail shopping and restaurants, as well as walking distance to the beach and other attractions (if you like a stroll down the beach).Customer Service; Fantastic, every member of staff, every day, was polite, attentive and most of all reduced the language barrier to nearly nothing. Nothing to fault, and just little note, you can see the the staff, especially the receptionists, are genuinely friends. This creates a lovely warm atmosphere. Overall a fantastic stay and I would reccomend to others.
title: What a place!

review: Put simply, this is a great hotel. The rooms are very well decorated and clean and the bathroom etc is very well kitted out.Bed was the comfiest and biggest bed I've ever slept on and the free mini bar in the room is an added bonus. Would definitely stay there again if I ever visit Barcelona again, A+++++
title: Great Hotel!

review: Recently stayed at the hotel for 3 nights - could not fault the hotel great modern rooms, equipped, nice gift of toiletries, loads facilities, bars, limited menus but sufficient for snacks only downside for us was a music event on 2 nights at the forum behind the hotel!! this led to sleepless nights as could hear music from hotel - otherwise good stay, breakfast was great
title: Great hotel - just make sure no event at forum!!

review: Stayed here on a 3 day break for my 40th bday , lovely hotel clean and friendly staff . Stayed on 25th floor with stunning views over the city . Hotel surprised me with champagne and cake which was a nice treat . Hotel is a good distance from ramblas and will cost between €12-15 in a taxi which will get expensive if you use it a lot . Metro and public transport is right outside so good to get into places . Only downside was we had a leak from upstairs toilet blockage leaking through our ceiling which was dealt with asap by hotel staff . The lifts in hotel are painfully slow when its busy but apart from that it's a lovely place I would visit again . Ps € 40 from airport to hotel .
title: Lovely hotel but out the way

review: I really loved that hotel! The service was great in all parts of the hotel. Really friendly staff! The hotel itself is nice an modern. Rooms are spacious with sexy bathrooms. The blinds were great and made the room dark. Included mini bar was great as well. Location is great besides a mall and the beach. Easy to walk around and find great food as well! Great hotel!
title: Awesome hotel!

review: Stayed two nights on a work trip, great room and facilities but staying on the 22nd floor meant the lift down was a complete headache. Pretty much stopped on every other floor and waited around 10 mins for the lift to even arrive. Mostly full so would have wait again. There's a bar on the 23rd floor right above my room and I had to listen to the most horrendous "dance" music until 1am last night and was up at 6am to catch a flight. Rooms not very noise proof.
title: Nice but a headache

review: Excellent service, attentive and friendly staff, spacious modern rooms and delicious breakfast. We came as a surprise birthday trip for my boyfriend's 30th, I received an excellent assistance in preparation of the bday extras, we received a free upgrade to a room on a higher floor with a view over the whole city where everything was perfectly arranged upon our arrival.The hotel is located towards the northern end of the city, next to a big shopping centre and perfectly connected with the city centre, bus and metro stops are just around the corner. Taxi from El Prat airport was less than EUR 40 on a Saturday evening. Personally did not experience any noise and sleep disruption, on the contrary, but there were no events at Forum during our stay.The rooms are spacious, the beds gigantic and comfortable, there is a free mini bar refilled daily and bathrobes and slippers are provided.Breakfast buffet is rich and delicious.The lifts indeed take ages sometimes. If you are in a hurry on a business trip, it might be an issue, but for us spending a relaxed and fun weekend, it was not really cumbersome. With special thanks to Marina, we'll be back and will certainly recommend to others!
title: Loved it !!!

review: Yes, the hotel is a little outside central or gothic quarters, but all we use it for is sleep and security. It is also a cheap option to be close to the beach. About a 10 minute walk.There are limited food options around because they close the kitchens early it seemed.The minibar is included which was nice. However, if you book the hotel via Expedia or Orbitz be careful to see if breakfast is included. For us, it was not which was a little annoying.They also loan mifi's out for the day at 5 euros. Nice little extra if you are going to be out all day. The hop on hop off bus stops at the hotel and the metro is a block out. Very coinvenieant.
title: Nice hotel in more remote location

review: I stayed at Melia Sky for one night and it was completely worth it. The room was very spacious and comfortable with an amazing view over the city. The service was impeccable from the front desk to the restaurant. I am allergic to gluten and at the time that I wanted to eat, the full menu was not available. When the waiters learned about my allergy, they made an exception and I was available to enjoy my grilled vegetables, which were great!The Pool Club is great with many sun chairs and cabanas. It is the only place where the service was so-so however as the ladies seem to be completely lost. My only drawback - and it's quite a big one - is that the room door is not sound-proof and same goes with the walls, meaning that housekeeping woke me up in the morning, and above all, I was woken up by my neighbors during their midnight tryst! So not optimal...The hotel is located away from the city centre, close to the beach and close to public transport. It is a new building and public areas are great.Overall I would definitely come back, but would ask for a quiet room!
title: Amazing View & Comfortable Hotel

review: Personal tries its best to provide that bit extra that makes you feel welcome. They succeeded! Bed and breakfast is awesome. Bar and restaurant are modern and personal gives honest advise (when asked).Will go there again.
title: Great hotel, with a great view!

review: I was taken to Barcelona as a surprise for my birthday last year. The hotel was good, the bed was incredibly comfortable. We had the LEVEL experience which was OK, but I don't think worth the additional. The breakfast was not very exciting and we weren't informed of ordering additional dishes until our last day.Not very close to the main attractions but quiet location.
title: Treated!

review: Myself and my partner stayed for 5 nights for my birthday. On arrival the hotel looked amazing, and the staff at the check in were so helpful, showing us a map of the area and the best places to go. We even got a room upgrade with it being my birthday which was a nice bonus! The area is so beautiful and more authentic than the centre (i.e las ramblas). 10 min walk from the beach and about 15 min walk from the harbour where you have all the bars, clubs and restaurants. You also have a street full of restaurants 5 min walk from the hotel. Plenty of Tapas and Sangria.The pool area is clean and modern, when we were there they hosted a party around the pool with a resident DJ which was brilliant. We also used the spa facilities, which has a Jacuzzi, steam room, and Sauna. Overall, brilliant stay and would recommend!!
title: Barcelona Mini Break

review: Everything about this hotel is amazing. The staff are wonderful as are the rooms and pool facilities. It is in an excellent location within walking distance to the beach. We loved it here and would definitely return.
title: Amazing Easter break

review: Me and my family staying here for 2 night we wish we could stay longer but the hotel is fully occupied. We experienced very good service and at the same time very bad service. During check-in Joana was very helpful she showed us our options in room.During our first night we orders room service. We were very disappointed with our room service. Our club sandwich was missing tomatoes bacon and very little lettuce. It was basically only cheese and small meat in bread. Our pasta was missing Parmesan it our chicken sandwich was good. Fausto was very helpful during this issue and made us feel like proper guests.The next day we had called at 1pm (3 TIMES) to have our room serviced. Returning after the beach at 4pm to find our room still very dirty was the worst part of our vacation.even after we called again it still took 3 hours to have our room clean at that time is was already 8pm. Maria was very helpful with delivery our ice which we waited over 40 minutes for.The pool staff was always in the back room therefore it was hard for us and other guests to obtain towels and order food.Overall we enjoyed this hotel, we want to recommend this hotel. Although there are a lot of device to fix. It seems like the ma agents and higher staff hide in the back while getting the interns and other lower staff to complete missed jobs.
title: Family vacations pros and cons

review: Amazing poolparty with a dj that choose the perfekt music between relax and party. We was feeling like in heaven. The manager Bruno reads all ur wishes from your lips, such a nice person that really care about everythink and of course that you feel more then comfortable. A big plus to the manager we will come back soon.
title: poolparty cocktails fun

review: I've been in this hotel 4 nights with my mom, the hotel very beautiful and clean, the service there is very helpful and friendly with every question we had .It's not in the center of Barcelona but in very nice neighborhood with lots of nice restaurants, the stuff give as great recognitions about where to go and where to eat and even how to get there.
title: Great hotel

review: So I was here on a conference. The hotel was usefully placed, right on both the tram and underground metro lines and within walking distance of where I needed to be. Very comfortable, high tech rooms. Lots of glass, including see-through glass from the bedroom area to the bathroom area - fine for me on my own or couples, but this was a twin room, and if you don't have that sort of relationship with your roommate, it could be awkward!Breakfast was absolutely stunning - good enough that I really felt no need to go for the brit standard cooked breakfast - I was there for 5 days and wasn't able to try everything!Nice pool area, with the pool just about big enough to allow proper exercise. I was put off slightly by the "cool crowd" who were there being beautiful on Saturday afternoon alongside a DJ. Not my scene, and I felt quite uncomfortable, but at other times was really very pleasant. Expensive bar on the top floor - probably standard for hotel prices, though.I'd definitely stay there again - the rooms, breakfast and pool (outside peak times) make this well worth it, and being slightly outside the centre wasn't a problem with the transport links.
title: Lovely modern hotel

review: I visited Barcelona as a treat for my 18 year old daughter. Melia Sky was amazing. Arrived late at night and had minor leak in bathroom but were immediately moved and upgraded to the level which was amazing. Gorgeous views and pool area. Reception staff were really helpful. We chose it because it was a little out of centre but metro was great and lovely restaurants and shops close by. Would definitely go again
title: 18th birthday treat

review: Room was very nice - comfortable bed, nice amenities. Like most European hotels, the A/C and power are only on if your key card is in the "dock" - so the rooms would get extremely hot while out during the day on business, and took longer than my usual liking to get back to a comfortable level. (For practiced business travelers - no, the "put the business card in the dock" trick does not work.) Bar and bar staff were excellent, food was very good, including the breakfast buffet every morning. Hallways a bit dark, but otherwise very nice décor in the hotel. Beautiful views from the top floor restaurant.
title: Very nice hotel, excellent staff, some minor tweaks and it would be perfect

review: This hotel is just amazing you can't fault it. The pool area on a Saturday has a free pool party which is good busy but a good atmosphere. Even the standard room is lovely. They went out of their way for my boyfriends birthday. Food is so good and taxis from hotel are easy to come by as they have a rank outside the hotel. Checked in at 2am due to flight delays and even at that time staff are so helpful and friendly. No other option of hotel in Barcelona this wins hands down and will be back
title: Surprise for Boyfriends Birthday

hotelLocation: Moll de Barcelona s/n, 08039 Barcelona, Spain
review: Lovely hotel at the marina, which is an easy walk to Las Rambla. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with great views over Barcelona. The hotel was quiet and has a nice rooftop bar. There is also a rooftop pool however no shade/umbrellas so quite hot in the sun. The hotel did lose our reservation however they handled it well and have an upgrade. The only downside is there is sometimes a wait for a taxi. Great place to stay and would definitely return
