review: Nice room and good equipment, kindly personal and very good breakfast. Just a little far from the center but near the metro and the main bus lines for visiting. Go there and you should be happy. Recommended!
title: Excellent

review: I can t complaine about anything...the staff was always available and very nice, room was clean, bed comfortable and in the last floor there is a nice spa, unfortunately I didn t have time to try it! Position is good, next to diagonal and well connected, you can also go on foot to Plaza de Catalunya and las Ramblas..
title: everything perfect

review: We had a great experience at Hotel Balmoral. Lovely spacious, modern clean rooms. No issues with anything. Great location in the city for us, close to Diagonal metro station. Hardly heard anything from other guests. Perhaps the roof terrace could benefit from allowing food & drinks out there but honestly in a city with as much to do as Barcelona it was no hardship. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Fantastic Hotel!

review: Very good location, near to the diagonal avenue and near the best stores of Barcelona. Rooms are very confortables and the attention was very good. Maybe the breakfast need more options. Very clean and all the people working in the hotel are very kindle.
title: Family trip

review: Very good hotel it self with service and location.You don't need any transportation to see so many things.Also they were giving away some drinks daily was very good refreshing stuff in it.So I recommend this hotel to everyone.
title: EXCELLENT LOCATION

review: The hotel is nice and clean, rooms are a good size and the beds are more like the english equivalent to a king sized rather than a double as advertised. The location was brilliant, a 5-10 minute walk to Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. La Rambla is around a 30 minute walk.
title: Fantastic Hotel and location

review: Perfect place for exploring BCN, rooms are not huge but big enough for some days. But we booked a double bed of Queen size. They first gave us a room with a bed of 120 cm width. Ridiculous! Wide enough fit two little children. The receptionist offered us a wider bed for 10€more. Thus you make money.
title: Queen size bed?

review: Nice hotel with friendly staff and clean facilities. My only critisism would be that the buffet breakfast is spread out around the restaurant a little so you have to go hunting for things, which makes things interesting in the morning :) but the food was good.
title: Nice hotel with a good location

review: The room was very clean. Great breakfast. Perfect location, quiet, close to the stores, restaurants and the metro. Friendly staffs, specially Veronica, always willing to help you! They scheduled all our tours, it made it easy to just enjoyed our time in Barcelona.
title: 30th Anniversary

review: Really really expensive for the general quality of the hotel, poor breakfast, quite simple room, very poor bathroom, no service available in the bar, and the price really high !!! I would not recommend this hotel.
title: Very poor, not good balance quality-price

review: If you want something centrally located and away from the hustle and bustle of las ramblas, this is the place to be. Clean, spacious and just far enough away from big touristy crowds. Excellent location , especially if you would like to immerse yourself in one of the old villages and be a part of the plaza life! Gracia was an awesome suburb to eat in, and is close to metro. We took advantage of the nice rooftop patio in between touring around and meals-it was great! Staff at Hotel Balmoral were also extremely helpful and knowledgeable, muchos gracias!!
title: Excellent location!!

review: Something went wrong with our booking through airtours but the staff at Belmoral let us sleep over one night and have breakfast buffet before finding our booking the next morning. Strongly recommend the hotel! Really nice room and breakfast buffet on top of that.
title: Exceptional staff!

review: Our stay at the Hotel Balmoral was excellent from the start. We were greeted with a smile and much helpful information about where we were staying and how they could be of help to us during our stay (taxis, tickets, etc.). The breakfast was wonderful, serving both American and Barcelona foods. The location had easy access to the Metro and bus lines, along with easy walking routes. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much and would return.
title: 5 stars and more!

review: Hotel Balmoral (HB) is in a prime location for shopping, long walks, delicious paella, even more delicious sangria, and, of course, very close to La Pedrera (Casa Mila). Nearly every staff member I interacted with at HB was welcoming and accommodating our needs and requests. The cleaning services were impeccable! The cleaning staff was so generous and we never felt pressure to leave at a certain time or not return to our room at a certain time. These amazing people were like ninjas -- great work! I would highly recommend a stay at HB and be sure to include the hotel breakfast in your purchase! The food is delicious with a wonderful mix of Spanish cuisine (like Spanish omelette and--my favorite--pa amb tomaquet) and classic European favorites (like Nutella and croissants). Plus, this hotel has central air, which is quite a luxury in European hotel and particularly important for fussy Americans traveling during the summer months. What a bonus! Wonderful facility, location, staff, and experience.
title: Beautiful Stay

review: My husband, young adult daughter, and I stayed five nights at Hotel Balmoral and loved the comfort of the triple room, the delicious breakfast, and wonderful service by the front desk staff. The location was great as well.
title: Beautiful stay in Barcelona

review: Well appointed, friendly staff, great room with nice balcony and very comfortable bed. The staff was excellent and helpful and offered suggestions on restaurants, tourist spots etc. Great restaurant around the corner called Mossul. We found this hotel to be centrally located allowing us to get around with ease. I would stay here again!
title: Perfect!!

review: No king beds even though they confirmed king. Charge for ice. Desk service is not nice, air did not work. We told the front desk and they said it takes a while to kick in we only stayed 6 days but we haven't yet seen it kick in. Front desk just did not care. I bet you they even had Kings beds but they did not want to bother putting us in the room that we reserved.
title: Not good

review: Hotel very close to the action. 5-8 Euro ride to Las Ramblas. Great sites, shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Friendly staff and good, complimentary breakfast. Adequate sized rooms that are meticulously cleaned daily.
title: I LOVE Barca!!

review: Nice hotel with very helpful staff. The young lady on the desk gave us great information and recommended a very good tapas by the harbour. The room and bathroom was of a good standard and my only criticism was the air conditioning was finding it hard to cope.
title: Very good staff

review: I have been coming to this hotel since 2013 and it is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed in Barcelona. Great location (walking distance to metro and Plaza Cataluña). Staff is very professional. Clean and comfy. Highy recommended.
title: Great place! Great location!

review: Hotel Balmoral is located near a metro and bus station which makes your transportation easy. With big cozy and very clean rooms. Amazing breakfast with lot of local products. The staff very helpful and everyone was with a big smile all the time. It was an amazing stay and the hotel is highly recommended by all means.
title: Great stay

review: This was a 4 day trip with my husband and 12 year old son.Hotel was excellent and pool area was great to relax and our son had a great time meeting new friends.Rooms were spacious and quiet and beds really comfortable.Great location and staff were wonderful.Highly recommend this hotel.
title: Family trip

review: We really enjoyed our stay here. Only regret was we didn't spend enough time relaxing by the pool as we were so busy exploring Barcelona. The room was very clean and comfortable (great bed) and it had a good size bathroom with excellent shower. We caught the Aerobus T2 from the airport to the Place de Catalonia and then took a five minute walk across the square to the hotel. The hotel is situated slightly away from the square so when you enter you escape the hustle and bustle of Barcelona into a little oasis! Even the pool area feels quieter and calmer even when it's busy. Personally I would have liked a bigger pool but it was fine for a gentle relaxing swim. We had breakfast across the road at a great Spanish cafe as we only wanted coffee and croissants so we didn't eat in the hotel. Overall a very enjoyable stay.
title: Lovely hotel, excellent location.

review: We booked this while in the cab from the Barcelona airport. Read other reviews and it really was perfect location! Close to the main hub of Ramblas street, great shopping, restaurants, easy walk to the marina and beach and the Gothic District.Hotel was clean, the staff super friendly.City bus tours just a 10 minute walk away too.
title: Great hotel in a great location

review: Superb location with excellent food/drinks and cleanliness. highly recommendable for families, business partners or even to share with a friend. though pool is small, the area is nice in terms of sitting and having a cool drink on the terrace. the Lobby has excellent food too. the Wine was exquisite and overall an excellent experience
title: Excellent hotel

review: Third time here wouldn't stay anywhere else . Very professional Team at the Catalonia ramblas location was excellent . Will defiantly be back again . Breakfast was delicious . We loved the pool and having lunch on the terrace .
title: Az and Kaz Barcelona Trip

review: This hotel is close to everything . The staff are friendly. The standard rooms vary considerably from the advertised photo. Mine had a wall cutting the room to something much smaller. I had a look at other rooms some had no extra space other than to walk around the bed. One had no window at all just light from an internal space. This may disappoint you especially since it isn't a cheap hotel. The pool is lovely but it isn't as deep as it appears. The depth is about waist height . The gym consists of 3 machines ; a bike, treadmill and another. It's close to all the shops and gothic quarter. The location is great just be careful with the room.
title: Central location but rooms varied considerably

review: Excellent stay will definitely stay at Catalonia Ramblas again. Very well located to lots of attractions. Breakfast excellent with vast choice. Very clean rooms and very comfortable. Rest of hotel spotless love the occasional seating areas dotted around - my friends and I had a brilliant time
title: Barcelona with friends

review: Location, location, location!!! Large, clean, updated rooms with excellent amenities. Very friendly and helpful staff. Small gym has limited exercise equipment but serves the purpose fine for vacationers. Excellent new spa and sauna facilities.
title: Nice stay at Catalonia Ramblas

review: Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff. The room was luxurious and the afternoon chocolate was a lovely treat. Pool and roof terrace were hidden treasures that we thoroughly enjoyed. Would highly recommend this hotel and will be returning on my next visit to Barcelona.
title: Lovely stay with friends

review: The stay was okay. It wasn't particularly great nor bad. Our bags weren't held when we checked in despite this being promised when we arrived an hour early and the check-out was a little sluggish, but our bags were held there so that we could go into the city a bit before we had to go to the airport. Would not strongly recommend or disrecommend visiting. Location is great.
title: Okay

review: Best location next to Ramblas, Passeig de Gracias, and walking distance to the Market. Rooms were great and spacious. Washrooms were super nice. Not much for views but you don't really stay in your room while you're in Barcelona. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
title: Best location and great rooms

review: Great hotel, central location, very friendly helpful staff - thanks to Dafne on the reception. The rooms were spotless, beds were very comfortable. The pool area was lovely and very welcome in the heat, pool towels provided.Room safe is free. Wifi also freeWe did not try the hotel food, there are lots of cafes and restaurants around the hotel.One minutes walk to las ramblas, the airport bus and hop on tourist bus both stop in the square around the corner
title: Fabulous central hotel

review: Like a lot of the reviews, we appreciated the great location, really clean room and spacious bathroom area. Breakfast was also very good -lots of choice and food fresh and plentiful. However we found the service at the pool bar slow in the afternoon and virtually non existent in the evening. And our food -pizza and tapas -was lukewarm and disappointing. Daughter said it was one of the worst pizzas she tasted and at 15 euros was expensive . The staff didn't really seem to want to be there but maybe it was an off day. Good to come back to after a busy day in Barcelona but not sure I'd rebook.
title: Good with some buts

review: People working there were brilliant helpful, i would to name a few a like Silvia , Natali and so onBagugae handlers all good The only thing I was abit not happy the toilet, could be up grade it and so on
title: Very welcoming

review: I knew from the minute I walked through the doors of this hotel that there was an issue. You could sense the atmosphere amongst the staff. Now, I booked a two night stay for four people some time ago. They charged me €680 for the privilege. On 15th May I asked if there was any chance I could have a 12pm - 1pm check in instead of the normal 3pm. They duly came back and said it shouldn't be a problem but they would see how things were on the day. I arrived at 9am from a cruise and spent the next six hours waiting on my room. All with young children. They kept saying "come back in 20 minutes" every time we asked, which was after 1pm and got all stroppy every time we did. I accept that there is a 3pm check in. Just say that an early check in is not possible. Better still, and I said this to reception, why not ask housekeeping if they could make a family room a priority as there was a family with young children waiting. All the while, guests were arriving and getting their rooms early. Nobody told me that the bar was a building site, banging and crashing all day and dust everywhere. I wouldn't have booked if I had known. They also saw fit to remove my spare room key that I had the audacity to leave in the room to leave the air con on. Shame on me, so they just left me with one key. The final straw, so far anyway as I am still in my room as I write this. I asked if reception could book me a taxi to the airport, big enough for four people and luggage. They said they couldn't because there is a taxi rank outside! Why can't they? And very rude they were, as I say in the title. Contemptuous. Very poor value for money.On the plus side, when I checked out in the morning, the reception guy was very helpful without being asked. He even came outside and made sure I got the right size of taxi. That's more like what I expect for €350 per night without breakfast!
title: Contemptuous!

review: The whole experience was disappointing. We were made to wait for 45 minutes before our room was ready and this is after the check in time of 3pm!!! There was a line of people waiting and we had to queue three times before our room was finally ready. We entered a warm stuffy room where the air conditioning has not been switched on! It is definitely not what I had expected based on the booking.com review. I will definitely not be coming back. Be ready to be disappointed...
title: An awful experience- this is definitely not a 4* hote

review: Stayed here for 6 nights in July 2017. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good. They had a person to make omelettes. The rooms were generous size and modern. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing to stay downtown.
title: Nice hotel in central Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We had nine of us staying here for one night upon arriving in Barcelona en route to a cruise. Our travel agent made the recommendation based on the location in the middle of the city and the price point. Everything went fine. My family, not used to European-style hotels were a bit taken aback by the old style heavy keys that you have to leave with the front desk upon departing. It was a holiday in Barcelona that Saturday so all of the shops were closed in the neighborhood; therefore we really didn't get a great feel for the area.The rooftop pool was refreshing and the deck was nice; pool is very small and fills up quickly. They didn't have much in the way of service at the upstairs bar.The morning breakfast was typical European; not fantastic but suitable. Overall it was fine for a one nigh stay; the rooms are very austere and I don't think I would choose it for an extended stay in Barcelona.
title: One night stay...good for that

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We loved our trip to Barcelona and enjoyed our stay at this classic and beautiful Hotel. The views from the rooftop was amazing both at Day and night. The location was perfect. The rooms and staff great, highly recommend.
title: Classic Hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: If I were to stay in this hotel again it would most certainly be because of the location. Just about a block away from Placa de Catalunya, it was a great home base for getting around Barcelona. The bathroom in our hotel room was really outstanding in terms of the design and quality of the fixtures. The bedroom was just okay. It was clean, but a little drab in its decor. I felt as if the modern and updated bathroom was a mismatch for the classic but still comfortable room. Unfortunately we had no view, or sunlight which made the room seem even more dull. Luckily we spent most of our time enjoying the city, including views of the city from the rooftop bar and pool at Avenida Palace. Be sure to check it out. So all in all, I had a perfectly adequate 3-night stay in this hotel, however when I return to Barcelona I think I will be looking for a slightly more stylish and luxurious accommodations. Avenida Palace had the price tag and amenities of a 4-star hotel, but it did not quite deliver with bedrooms. Bedrooms need an update to match the 'party' that is going on in the modern bathrooms.
title: Location, Plus Great Bathroom

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is a family-run business and is centrally located to both the Barri Gotic area and to the Exiample section of town as well. A number of good shops and boutiques are nearby on Passeig de Gracia, and El Corte Ingles is on the nearby Placa de Catalunya. The hotel's public areas are beautifully decorated, staff is very friendly and helpful with suggestions on places to eat. Our room was very nicely furnished with decent lighting for reading and with double sinks in the bathroom. Even though we faced the street and were on the 4th floor, the room was quiet. That being said, a white noise app on your phone will solve any problems anyone else might have. The breakfast buffet offers a wide selection of items - fruit was fresh as were the breads.
title: Great Location for sightseeing

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Wonderful hotel! Perfect location with access to great dining options and sights. Hotel was extremely clean. The gentleman at the front desk was extremely friendly and approachable. He made us feel welcomed from the moment we stepped into the hotel. Great value option!
title: El Avenida Palace

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: If I am back to barcelona, I will visit this hotel again. Definitely. I recommend this hotel if you are planning to visit Barcelona. But the noise of subway train was little bit annoying when I tried to sleep. Because I can feel and hear when the subway train comes near
title: Perfect.

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel was quite lovely inside, beautifully decorated and lots of history. The staff was quite friendly and helpful and the rooftop bar was scenic. Our only complaint was the room we had. The smell of mildew was quite overpowering inside which could not be reduced even with opening the door to the beautiful terrace we had outside. We had a different room the first night due to the hotel being overbooked when we checked in, which did not have that issue, but we were asked to move to a different room for the remainder of our stay.
title: Beautiful but musty

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Absolutely loved this hotel!! Prefect location just opposite the passage de gracia metro however we found that most places could be walked to. Pool area is fab for relaxing and taking in views of the whole city. Book directly with the hotel and get the best offers. Half price breakfasts (which are incredible) and a free drink on arrival. The only thing we found was our room wasnt ready until 4pm which meant us havin to wander around lovely barcelona for a while as we wait but this was due to their late checkout. You dont have to checkout until 2pm! Which worked for us on our last day very well.its just something to keep in mind when i go back id maybe ring the hotel beforehand and try get an early room if you are arriving early.
title: Amazing hotel in a great location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Hotel is situated at the central part of Barcelona. You can go walking by Passeig de Garcia and reach Placa Catalunya (Catalunya square). Suitable for shopping. There are a lot of brand shops on this street. In a five minutes of walking you can reach the famous Balue home projected by Gaudy
title: Hotel at the heart of Barcelona.

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Lovely hotel with a dipping pool on the roof top where you have also a superb view. The hotel is very clean and everything was well organized. But the best is the location of the hotel. Super close to Plaza Catalunya and Pg. de Grazia with Metro Connection. 2 stations to the beach, a 8 minutes walk to La Rambla,... we would be def. come back to Avenida Palace.
title: Nice hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: the best location you ever dream everything is near by the hotel its make the vacation easier.at the evening its must to get to the pool that in the roof of the hotel , there is a bar and with a cold beer with the view you can enjoy from a quality time .
title: the best hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: The room was terrible. It was so small with no sunlight and ages old carpet. The pictures on trip advisor and other 3rd party sites are deceptive. There might be some rooms which are better but the room that was offered to me was not at all I would have booked if I had seen earlier. Me and my friend arrived here at around midnight and as soon as we saw the room we decided to leave. The receptionist gave us another room to check out but it was no different so we asked him to cancel the reservation and give us our money back which was around €600. He said due to their 24 hours cancellation policy he couldn't do the money back. With all these back and forth by this time it was 1:30am and since we paid so much already we stayed in the night. We stayed in with a suffocating feeling the whole night and the old building/carpet smell, on top of this there was only a thin sheet to cover, no comforter or anything and the bed was like a box spring. So disappointed, not how I wanted my vacation to start. I would not recommend this hotel.
title: Not worth your money!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Perfectly located to walk down LaRambla, shop in Exiample and walk to the beach. ORnate lobby, great views from the rooftop bar and pool, well refurbished rooms and quality products in the room. Had a lovely last minute stay via Hotel Tonight and enjoyed fabulous service! Highly recommended for an easy and comfortable stay.
title: Old school glamour in the heart of Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We booked to stay for 4 nights at this hotel. It is in a great location easy walking distance to many tourist attractions and the tour buses stop just round the corner. The hotel itself seems nice and the rooftop bar is lovely, we enjoyed sitting up there and seeing the views at night.However the rooms really do vary so be warned, we were given one of the central facing rooms which overlooks an internal courtyard area, i.e no view whatsoever. We asked to swap but were given short shrift from the unhelpful receptionist and told no other rooms were available that weekend. Our rooms was clean and the bathroom was modern with toiletries. However the lack of a view was disappointing and as we were on the first floor at the bottom of this central courtyard/lightwell there was no natural light in the room at all. Every morning felt like the middle of the night. I work in a prison and kid you not the room reminded me of a prison cell in terms of lack of light (although not lack of space). Please take this into account, we cut our trip short and stayed just 3 nights instead (although this was partly due to not enjoying Barcelona in general at this time of year) I certainly would not want to stay an extended period of time in this hotel.The only positive was our room was very quiet at night whereas I imagine rooms facing the street are noisier.We were still charged for 4 nights though and over the price quoted when booked. We just wanted to leave asap and couldn't face challenging the staff over this though. The one positive staff member was the porter who ordered us a taxi without being asked and helped with our luggage so it was nice to end on a positive.We had the continental breakfast one day, the food was good but not work the money they charge for it.Overall I could not say we 'enjoyed' our stay as such but this may be partly to not enjoying a very busy Barcelona (our fault for booking in July!) we have enjoyed it much more at different times of year. Also I would advise avoiding Las Ramblas completely at night we were approached by over 20 different men offering us drugs and witnessed many common scams and people's bags being slashed open by pickpockets on our first night. Go else where in the city to enjoy the nightlife.
title: Hotel ok but rooms a bit of a lucky dip!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: To start off with, this hotel is right in the middle of Barcelona and exactly where you want to be. The hotel was very beautiful and from the outside very well kept. We are a family of four so went with the family room which essentially is paying for two rooms. Our nightly fee was €660. For this price we had high expectations. Once in our room, we noticed a horrible smell coming from the vents that was definitely something deceased in the ceiling. We immediately alerted the front desk and nothing was done. Therefore, all four of us slept in one of the rooms as our kids didn't sleep in the other because of the smell. The next morning I went down to talk to the front desk; I was told there were no rooms available to move into. Therefore, I booked a room at the Fairmont for 1/3 the price of this hotel. Upon check out, they magically said let me talk to the manager. The manager was very kind and went and acknowledged the state and smell of the room. He did offer us an upgraded room but by that time it was too late as we had already booked a different room at the Fairmont; being told previously told there were no other rooms available. We were not offered any type of discount and paid full price for the night we stayed even though we only used one of the two rooms. We are currently now at the Fairmont and couldn't be happier, as the accommodations here are excellent. It is on the outside of the city and not as convenient as being in the center of things, but a cab ride is very little to pay for a good nights sleep in this exciting city. Despite the bad smell in the room, the beds are very uncomfortable in the family rooms and not a comparison to any of the major hotels in the US; such as the Westin, Fairmont, Marriott, Hilton, or even the holiday inn express. I don't write too many bad reviews but I just feel that I must share this one.
title: Trouble in the Middle!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We booked a family room with 2 rooms interconnected. It is a classic and charming hotel with swimming pool and bar on roof top (not busy) that gives you a great city view.Rooms are spacious and very clean, breakfast buffet has many fresh and good choices. Location is excellent, it's on busy commercial street (you don't hear any noise though from hotel rooms) with lots of shops, bars, restaurants. And walking distance to casa batllo and la pedrera. If you come with a car there are public parking garage (book online in advance to pay a lot less!) just 3 min walk.Tips: take a cab if you have little kids to avoid walk, they are cheap and air conditioned. So far all the cab drivers we met are all honest and did not over charge (look up google map suggested distance and price).Hope you all have a pleasant stay like we did. We will definitely come again for this beautiful, sunny and friendly city!
title: Excellent location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed at the EL Avenida Palace Hotel for 3 nights during out time in Barcelona. We had 2 suites as there was myself my husband and our teenage daughter and 12 year old son. Wonderful location, clean and large bathrooms and extremely comfortable beds to collapse into after a day on your feet exploring Barcelona. The hotel building is beautiful with lovely stairwells, but also a lift for convenience. Our son enjoyed the pool. Great breakfast selection. I would definately stay at this hotel if I ever went back to Barcelona.Kellie NZ
title: Excellent hotel and location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed at this hotel before our cruise, 9 guests with 4 rooms for two nights, a significant investment. We went hotel directly from our international flight. We knew check in wasn't til later afternoon but hoped for a place to freshen up a bit, it was like 3am for us. We returned to the hotel at 3 and for our family with 2 rooms, we only had 1 ready at 3:50pm. We were late for our 4 pm reservations to Sagrada Familia and no one seemed to care. Others were waiting for rooms also by sleeping in the lobby. I'm not sure how difficult it would be to have enough staff to get rooms turned around more quickly especially for that first night after international travel. The hotel is beautiful, loved it and the rooftop area. I wish I had felt more cared for in the check in process.
title: Rooms not ready on timely manner

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We booked our stay about 3 hours before our check in time. We booked it through the app "Hotel tonight" . We got a fantastic deal through this app. We paid 311 euro for our 3 night stay. We did look at another website/app for 3 nights the following week on the same days and it would have cost us 690 euro. So the deal we got was brilliant. The hotel was brilliant too, very friendly & helpful staff, lovey clean comfortable rooms and bathrooms, a nice rooftop bar/pool area (small but lovely), the location was brilliant. just a 5 minute walk from the main airport bus drop off in the square.I would highly recommend this hotel to others.
title: Last minute stay

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Old school glamour with a nicely renovated room. Friendly staff. Great location near plenty of transportation options. Lots to see and eat within easy walk. Pool was small but just fine for us. Would recommend.
title: We Had a Great Time

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Excellent value for money - we had two inter-connecting rooms for similar price to cramped single rooms to sleep four in Paris, London and San Francisco.Excellent location - right next to a metro station and easy walking distance to most key locations. Beautifully presented hotelGood breakfast in beautiful dining room.Excellent rooftop pool and bar
title: Excellent value for money and location. Beautifully presented hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Excellent location and 5 star service. Worth value for money. Recommend hotel for any one want to stay in center of Barcelona. Close to Place de Cataluyna and Metro station. Perfect location for shopping.
title: Excellent hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: stayed with family at the hotel avenida. Was very central, really close to the ramblas. hotel was clean, lovely rooms, comfortable beds. very new and modern bathrooms with shower and bath. generous with very nice bathroom amenities. good breakfast. swimming pool with a beautiful rooftop with amazing views. When we mentioned we were celebrating two birthdays they put champagne in the rooms which was appreciated. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.
title: lovely central hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Went there for a week vacation with my family. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful at all times. Cleanliness was good and rooftop bar and pool made the hotel experience awesome for the hole family.
title: Very nice experience

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: First sheets are dirty, second I found bugs on bed which made me stay up and not have a sleep.. Metro goes under the hotel so it's like the sound or the shake of it can easily be felt till late at night and early morning... I do not recommend this hotel, you can have better for the same price and same area....
title: Horrible experience

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Returned once again to this special Hotel - having so many fond memories - selfies taken in front of the impressive elegant central staircase. Personnel extremely welcoming even to the point that we arrived very early - was greeted with ice cold home made lemon drink - WOW - we certainly appreciated that gesture after such a long and hot journey. The location of Hotel El Avenida Palace - Barcelona is superb - within easy walking distance to Las Ramblas etc. The plus side for our visit this year was the new Roof Terrace with heated swimming pool - having a cocktail over looking Barcelona - the new Restaurant with its fine cuisine. Excellent breakfast with a choice of hot and cold dishes which certainly sets you up for the day ahead. Highly recommended. We cannot wait to return to our favourite Hotel.
title: Jewel in the Crown - Hotel El Avenida Palace - Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: Excellent family run hotel with exceptional service, attentive staff and perfect location for sightseeing! Very pleasantly surprised by this hotel--has an amazing roof top terrace as well. Turn right from hotel and first left--street leads straight to La Rambla. Turn left from hotel and first right leads to the cathedral and Gothic area. This is the major shopping street in Barcelona (Passieg de Gracia which becomes Portal l'Angel). Of course, turning left on Passieg de Gracia also leads to stores--both high end and regular (Mango). Great restaurants within 5-10 minutes. If you book Viator tours, they leave from "Explore Catalunya" office which is about a 10 min walk. Anonio Gaudi's Casa Battlo and La Pedrera are on Passieg de Gracia---only 5 min walk. Sagrada Familia is about 20 min walk. Book without hesitation--you will not regret it.
title: Absolutely superb hotel- fantastic location, service and staff!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We had a good stay here. Breakfast included is well worth it. Nice rooms, very nice bathroom. Awesome roof top bar and pool. Perfect location to explore the city, right beside shoppimg, eating and subway.
title: Good hotel, perfect location

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 605, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed in a family suite with our two teen daughters. Lovely room, great linens, large modern bathrooms. Staff is attentive and multi-lingual. Location is excellent, just a block from Plaza Cataluyna and the Rambla, a block from Passeig de Gracia, and close to the Gothic Quarter. Lots of taxis and public transport options.Restaurant options are plentiful in the area, but especially liked Ciudad Comtal in the corner, Nostrum for quick to go options and coffee, and Vinitus for tapas. All are easy walking distance.
title: Great stay with our family!

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: I choose this hotel because it was slightly removed from the bustle of downtown Barcelona. It was a great choice, offering access to surrounding neighbourhoods, an easy, pleasant 20 minute walk to the beach and convenient access to the Metro.It's a Four Points Sheraton that delivers exactly what you'd expect. I took 3 rooms for my family and was very pleased with the rooms and the cost.Exceptional though, was the service by everyone I met. In particular I'll mention Angelica of the front desk team, to whom I ended up turning for any assistance, including one persistently insoluble issue, which she solved. Such great service, (and the location) will see me select this property over more luxurious venues on a return visit.
title: Mid-Range Hotel With Great Staff

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: We stayed here because we were traveling with SPG members who chose the hotel. The location was fairly quiet, next to a tram track and close to small grocers, bakeries, restaurants and 20 minutes walk to the beach. Getting taxis was only difficult because we were a large group and we wanted to ride together. Usually we ended up taking two nearby taxis and paying twice the amount, unfortunately. We asked the front desk to secure larger taxis for us but there seemed to be a communication issue. Our room was a large room that included a bathtub, but the glass partition only protected about 1.5 feet, so it was difficult to keep the shower water inside the tub. Our travel partners' room had a shower, not a bathtub, so I'm not sure how all the rooms are fitted. Beds were comfortable. The guest rooms were air-conditioned but the hallways are not. The wood laminate floors in the rooms are clean but the carpeted hallways didn't seem to be as clean. We stayed two nights and housekeeping made up the rooms both days late in the afternoon. Our room had a refrigerator, but I'm not sure if all rooms do. The free internet worked well for our needs. Front desk was not particularly welcoming or friendly, but maybe that is a cultural thing.
title: Basic hotel for Barcelona

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: I loved that this property was not in a touristy neighborhood. Easy walk to the beach and the Metro. The breakfast buffet was good and there is smoking patio out the back of the dining room. We also had a refrigerator in the room.
title: Nice property in a nice part of town

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: Can't say enough about the great team at this hotel. They offer helpful advice and impeccable service. As always, the room was spotless and comfortable. Great value for Starpoints, too. The location is outside of the main attractions, but is an easy walk or taxi.
title: Fantastic stay and staff!

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: Our family enjoyed a wonderful 5 days in Barcelona, and we loved our stay at the Sheraton Four Points. The hotel was wonderfully situated and provided easy access to all the tourist sites, while giving you a "Local" experience in their emerging neighbourhood. The surrounding restaurants were excellent, and within a few minutes walk from your room. While the rooms are modestly appointed, they were clean and perfect for resting at night, and parking suitcases during the day while you explore the city. Lastly, the staff was excellent! Front desk, waiters etc... were all interested in making our experience positive. I was very happy about our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend time touring while visiting Barcelona.
title: Great Value in Barcelona

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: The hotel is located in the quiet residential part of Barcelona which is a huge positive and within walking distance to the beach.There are several markets near for your basic purchases of water and snacks. The room also has a mini fridge which worked out perfectly for us. It was a pleasant stay with clean rooms and excellent housekeeping but it is a budget hotel so if you are looking for luxury, this isn't the place for you.
title: Good Budget Stay

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: The shore is only a few minutes away. There is a great deal of food options down the road. The staff was really great. We really liked the bar, the bartender was very nice. I will stay here the next time I am in town.
title: Great Location

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: The front desk staff is so very accommodating and went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful experience! They were lovely, spoke English and helped with tours and information. The hotel is a 15 min walk to the beach, close to great restaurants and public transportation.The rooms were comfortable and very clean. I would definitely stay here and recommend this hotel to others.
title: Superb Staff, Great Location

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: Nice and confortable hotel on new area of Barcelona, good location close to Metro, tram, and Bus; easy also for the beach. Good also the selection of bar and restourants in area.Hotel is clean and with good service.
title: Good Location

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: The hotel is excellent! In downtown area but not in walking distance of many tour sites like Park Guell. They have taxis outside the hotel a lot of the time. They also have a bus stop but they don't run a lot so your better off with a taxi. There is no free breakfast. Free breakfast is only if you have a platinum member in your room.
title: Four Points

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: We stayed five nights at the Four Points. We were given room 906, but I wished for a better room (more floor space), given my hubby's Platinum status. In the end, the room was comfortable. The bed was great and the linens are nice quality.The bathroom was comfortable, well-appointed, although, the shower around the glass base could use a little scrubbing. The breakfast was nice, with good food choices. I really liked the grilled vegetables. The staff is what makes this hotel top notch. Truly lovely, and pleasant ladies and gentlemen. The hotel's location is good. The tram is walking distance, a shopping mall called Glories, and Plaça Catalunya is not far by tram.Ramblas Poblenou is right there with several restaurants. It's super safe. The beach is about 25 minutes on foot. We had room service the first night, and the food came super fast and was delicious. We appreciated the daily water bottles. We also rented a car through the hotel, and the process was very simple. Recommend this hotel.
title: Wonderful staff...

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: The hotel is located far away from the bustling touristy part of Barcelona, yet you have everything in the hotel and around for a nice relaxing stay. The area has lots of restaurants and a shopping mall. Bogatelli beach (very busy) is in about 20 minutes walk via a nice pedestrian route dotted with cafes and small shops. Taxis are not easy to catch on the street, though we saw a couple parked just outside of the hotel. As to our stay, we stayed for 2 nights and were pretty happy. Checkin and checkout were easy, the front office staff is very nice and helpful. The room's size was ok, for two adults. Breakfast was fresh and very good choice. The manager and waiting staff were welcoming and helpful. Parking is available around the corner , but over-weekend you could park on the street even on the bus/tax lane (this was what we did). All in all , a very good choice if you want to stay away from the noise and traffic of the central Barca.
title: Basic but convenient

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: We have chosen this hotel because of its location - in enough distance from city center to meet more Catalonians than tourists on the streets, and still close both to the beach (Marbella) and some tourist attractions (Torre Agbar). Unfortunately the hotel was accommodating a lot of Chinese groups, which were taking over the restaurant during breakfast (they were even using coffee machines to water their instant noodle soups (the smell was awfull)). The staff wasn't capable of turning the tables fast enough, and the restaurant was really crowded. Housekeeping was also not doing its job - just after check-in we have found empty bottles in the bathroom (shower gel etc.), the sheets were never changed, although we stayed for 8 days, and the floor - well, enough to say I had to clean it myself because noone else did.
title: Could be better

hotelName: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
review: We arrived in the evening and was tired from a long flight. Upon checking in, we had to bring our own luggages upstairs -- no bellhop service. And you have to squeeze yourself into these 2 tiny elevators that can barely fit 5 people. Me and my family had to take turns going up! Being a platinum SPG member, they upgraded us or so they say. But the upgrade is the same type of room and just 2 floors higher. I needed some ice at one point and called the front desk if there are any ice dispensers -- which is typical of four point hotels. But was told I need to go down to the bar/restaurant to get it myself or they will charge a service fee if I want it brought up to the room. The shower is so narrow that you need to be careful that you do not hit your elbows.There was a situation where the people handling the breakfast table in the morning was getting fed up with the tour group from China who could not speak or understand English - remarking that English is important. Wait a minute, their bellhop can barely speak English when I asked for a taxi. I understand that the hotel is a basic hotel but it should not be this bad.
title: Basic should not mean bad....

review: The location is ideal for a lot of attractions in Barcelona. Not only that but staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and modern and the rooftop pool and bar make for a good view and a nice resting point on a busy day. A great choice.
title: Well suited

review: Glad we picked this hotel. It's a little out of the way for those wanting to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle but it's a lovely walk to the beach and the city centre (about 20 mins). The room was spacious and clean and the front desk were happy to store our bags before check in and after check out. The rooftop bar is worth a visit. The barmaid remembered our drinks after our first visit. The breakfast was really good. Lots of choice and every member of staff we encountered was friendly and helpful.
title: Great Stay

review: I've traveled many destinations and would not recommend this hotel. The entry to the hotel is terrible. The front desk staff is untrained and isn't able to answer simple questions. If you want to sleep comfortably I would not recommend staying here. If you require a strong internet signal in your room I would not stay here. If you prefer a cool room I would not stay here. When heading up to the roof top bar I nearly fell into the elevator as a vacuum cleaner was left unattended in the elevator. The roof top bar had grown men playing football that made it impossible to go into the pool without getting hit in the head. The manager of the front desk argued with us regarding the city tax even though our book it receipt showed paid. He insisted it was our problem to resolve and that we should pay again. The beds are horrible st best. See below .
title: Very Disappointed.

review: This was a perfect choice for a quiet stay in Barcelona, away from the crowds. It was perfectly located near the beach (a 20 minute walk). The service at this hotel was excellent, the rooms were kept clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. The rooftop pool and bar were well-maintained and the view was breathtaking. The distance from the hotel to Las Ramblas was about 10 minutes by car. We would definitely go back!
title: Absolutely wonderful!

review: We greatly enjoyed the food at this restaurant and would recommend it to those who are seeking some quick bites. The view from the outdoor cafe was interesting as we overlooked the pool and a grand sculpture which I am still unsure of what it is called. The cold soups were served in test tube type dishes and they were really good. We had the beet and the cucumber soups. The dishes were on the smaller side but that was fine with us. I had the taco and loved it!
title: Excellent food

review: First, the good. The rooms on the 9th floor are big and have a roomy, nice looking marble bathrooms with a great jacuzzi tub. Also the room has nice amenities like coffee, tea and water. That said,a night on their mattresses is not much better than sleeping on the floor (and I like hard mattresses, but this is ridiculous). And, of course, the rooms are noisy - it has been a long time since I could hear the folks in the adjoining rooms. There is no service to speak of - no bellhop to take you bags into the hotel and up to your room (we arrived at 8 p.m. and the doorman leaves in the afternoon), two hours (literally, and only after two irritating calls) to get someone to bring you a remote which works and they can't call you a cab (and there is no doorman). I was told that in Spain they cannot call you a cab if there is a taxi stand close by (really, with 50% unemployment of young people???), even though there are no taxis at the taxi stand. And this neighborhood is a $14 cab ride (one way) to the main boulevard and not one you would want to walk in (graffiti covers everything and with unemployment the way it is, there are young men standing about everywhere). Lastly, the bartender's idea of a martini was to put some vodka in a glass over ice and, then, when I explained I wanted it "up" (and told him "no ice"), he put the warm vodka in a glass and handed it to me. I think this is a hotel where they drop everyone off by the bus load. I love luxurious hotels and this just isn't one of those.
title: This is not a luxury hotel by any means...

review: Please Please Please ignore the miserable reviews below me. I cant believe how some people can be so damn rude and lack so much common sense!This is a lovely hotel, yes its main purpose is being a business hotel but familys are still welcome. Ive stayed in a few business hotels now, and there is absolutely nothing wrong with them, just some peoples expectations are not realistic. We stayed here for a week while exploring & relaxing in barcelona and i wouldnt have picked anywhere else to stay. Stylish hotel throughout, friendly staff (regardless of previous comments) and lovely breakfast. We specifically didnt eat dinner here because of previous reviews and to be honest was glad as the downstairs restaurant is under renovation at the moment, so they obviously cannot offer the full service they would like too. Although i would like to point out that absolutely nothing could fault the breakfast service. Huge array of choice, cooked, cold, cereal, fruit, breads.. how anyone could nit pick and find fault with that i have no idea.We had the first flight out of heathrow @ 6.15am so arrived at the hotel around 10.30am, even though check in isnt supposed to open until 2, our room was already ready for us to get comfortable and un-pack. Yeah okay the beds arent the softest in the world, but if they were soft im pretty sure someone would complain that they werent hard. After a couple of nights sleep you get used to it like a human, plus actually exploring barcelona makes you too tired to even care!The hotel itself is in a great location, 1 block away from the metro (which we used alot!) and only about 10 minute walk from the beach & restaurants at the port olympic. Everything is easy to get too, and it is not a scary neighbourhood which people have tried to put it out to be. Its a residential area and you barely see another soul walking around after 10pm. Only small downfall i must say would be the rooftop pool. As much as we loved it once we had beds, it just wasnt big enough or had enough room for everyone. But then you have to remind yourself that it is after all a business hotel catering for families etc, so its not going to be like the resort you would find on the costa del sol. We got up @ 9am to get beds and stayed there till about 3 on only 1 day of our trip, this being a sunday was an extremely busy day. It is alot busier from friday - sunday due to weekend travellers but its no big problem at all. Overall i would recommend this hotel & the chain (as their other hotels elsewhere are incredible) to people who know what their expecting and are not miserable human beings. I loved exploring barcelona, thank you h10 for making it a lovely experience for us.
title: Lovely 'business' hotel

review: My husband & I began our 10 day trip to Spain in Barcelona. The H10 Marina location was quiet and convenient, close enough to walk to the beach or to Sagrada Familia. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet was amazing!
title: Wonderful start to our vacation in Spain

review: The hotel is close to two underground tube stations, Marina or Bogatel, which then get you into the centre of Barcelona quickly, although the underground is efficient it is very hot but cool on the trains. The hotel is about a fifteen minute walk to the beach, through the streets. The Marina is about ten minutes walk the same way, restaurants available for evening meal there and a Casino.Our room was clean and plain but comfortable, large TV, no english channels apart from the news. Toiletries provided. No breakfast unless you pay extra, there are small eating places close by to grab a croissant and coffee. Had dinner there one night when returned too late to go out again, very good food. There is a pool on the top floor but it is quite small, there is a fair few sun beds and chairs there but they get taken very quickly, and you are sitting on top of one another, but it is good for a couple of hours rest after a hard day exploring. The reception staff were really helpful, we needed directions to a few things we had booked and they made sure we knew what tubes to catch and the exact directions. The area surrounding the hotel is more local and residential but we felt really safe walking about late at night and stopping off at some of the more local bars where you are not ripped off for a drink or meal as you are in the more touristy areas in the central area of Barcelona, we went there in the day and returned in the evening for a less busy evening. All in all I would recommend this hotel if you want to be on the outskirts which we like as if we stay in the thick of it we wouldn't venture out and see other parts.
title: Lovely hotel to stay in which is quite close to the beach, about a 15 minute walk.

review: The problems started at check-in. We were a company of 6 and had 3 rooms. At check-in one of the rooms were "missing" and they tried to make us pay extra for one of the children even though the cost for her was clearly included in the price. They were also unable to fulfill our wish to have a doublebed in one of the rooms. We only had dinner at the hotel once. We were almost the only ones in the restaurant at that time but still they were unable to serve us within a resonable time. They served undercooked chicken and paela with burnt rice. They did for the record remove the cost from all the delayed and bad food from the bill but it still ruined our experience. On the plus side, the breakfast was really good. There was only a short walk down to the beach and the staff in general was very friendly.
title: Naah

review: - Staf at reception wants you to pay in advance. - They gave a familyroom with 3 beds while we paid for 4. After that we got a 4 bedroom with a broken or too week airconditioning. Terrible night.- Very young staf showed no sincere empathy.- Child unfriendly.- Kept us waiting in the evening for a room while we had a baby that had to go to bed.
title: Go somewhere else

review: Just got back from a four day stay at h10 Marina. I enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room was very clean but a little small no tea or coffee facilities were available in the room as advertised with jet2. The breakfast was amazing so much variety. The area is not very touristy more residential. I travelled with my ten year old son and felt very safe and the locals where friendly. Lots of cafes and bars close by. The roof top pool was very welcoming after a hot day sight seeing and the sky bar was lovely lit up of a niggtThe beach is a 15 minute walk but it's 30 Euro to hire a parasol and two loungers which is a rip off. Overall I would recommend this hotel it has a good vibe and was child friendly
title: Happy with hotel

review: We stayed here last week. It was amazing, a great location as was out of the hustle and bussing of the city but close enough to walk to places. Took us half hour to walk to la sagrada familia. Right near the harbour, lots of lovely bars and restaurants. Hotel was very clean, staff very attentive and safe in the room. If you happen to have your car, there is secure underground parking. Breakfast was amazing so much choice couldn't fault it. If you're looking for a place to stay I highly recommend H10, would stay here again.
title: Fab hotel and safe parking

review: Back yesterday from a 5 night stay at the H10 Marina. My teenage daughter and I had a basic twin room on the 2nd floor. I asked for a quiet room (i.e. away from the bar and rooftop pool) and away from the lift, which I was given. As in any city-based hotel, earplugs were useful. The cleaners arrived early and were noisy than the norm. The pool is on the 8th floor. It's superb! After sightseeing it was a quiet, sunny haven to get a cocktail and some chill. It got a little busy at times but there was always a seat available, even if there weren't any loungers left. My only criticism is that smoking is allowed which seems a bit dated in an area where there's drink/food/children. Perhaps smoking should just be around the bar and not the pool. The room/bathroom itself were a little weary but the shower was powerful; pillows comfy; bed was clean, so all good! The staff were all lovely and helpful, particularly the bar/waiting staff on the ground floor. It's a 10/12 min walk to the beaches, which again, were superb. La Rambla and Casa Bastilo would be a bit too much to walk (I think!) so we hopped in a taxi -there are taxis to the left of the hotel- and then walked back. €10 ish. Alternatively you could catch a rickshaw bike along the beach front, part of the way and then walk the rest to the bottom of La Rambla. La Sagrada Familia is walkable. About 30 mins up a straight road with the cathedral in sight.
title: 10 mins to the beach and away from crowds

review: Due to bad weather decided to have dinner in the hotel....what a bummer....extremely disappointing regarding service and portions: 15 euro's for small, tiny piece of salmon. Not recommended. Waiter may need to look for a new job....
title: Extremely small portions, lousy service

review: Overall a very good stay here. Comfortable room double comfortable bed and Delicious breakfast 15 minutes outside of Barcelona. Would definitely stay at another H10 hotel. Good helpful staff. A short stay to visit Family who live here and also to soak up some culture. I would highly recommend this Hotel.
title: H10 Marina

review: Really nice hotel! Great rooms, breakfast and pool area. You can skip the spa but make sure that you book with "privilege" - free mini bar and great service! You can easily take the metro, walk or the cab. Close to the beach!
title: One week in Barcelona!

review: I stayed here with my adult daughter and had a great time. The hotel is ideally located - we walked everywhere. It is close to the beach, but also close enough to walk into town. The staff are very polite and helpful. The room was clean and had everything except tea and coffee which I would have expected for 4 stars! The roof top bar was great and lovely to return back to after a day of exploring. My only real complaint is that the bar could open earlier so you could get beach towels and a drink - they're missing a trick here as lots of people had obviously gone to a near by cafe. Also people had saved beds which is incredibly selfish in a hotel this big with such a small pool. The hotel should be clear and strict about having a policy for this. Employ someone to keep an eye and remove towels when the person has not been there for half an hour. Some towels were there for well over an hour!
title: Good hotel

review: Lovely airy rooms and a lovely spa. Great roof top pool as well that you can get tapas from 11-18 and cocktails. Dinner in the main restaurant wasn't the best. The only thing I would change would be the location. Had to get two separate metros to la rambla or an €9 taxi each way. There is a metro stop roughly 5 minutes sea which is handy
title: Nice rooms and spa, not great dinner and quite far from the la rambla

review: Hotel from hell from the minute we checked in and had to wait five hours for a room to opening the elevator door and finding a vacuum cleaner in the middle of it to having the front desk hit us with additional charges that according to book it were paid . the manager in the evening when we address these issues said to me I like Americans in a rude way.The beds had big gaping indentations in them very uncomfortable . Also look like somebody threw something on the walls in our room they were sticky and dirty the showers were very unsafe ,the toilet and the shower falling apart.Stay away From this place it not even close to the Marina .
title: Hotel from hell

review: Whilst this was a perfectly nice hotel with great staff I did not like the area. Long walk to the beach so for the first time ever I used the metro. Once you get the hang of the ticket system it is no different to the London Underground. The staff were wonderful and after having been ripped off by the taxi driver they couldn't have been nicer. WARNING - if the fare seems to high tell the driver to wait and go inside the hotel. Pool area is tiny and fills up very quickly. Breakfast ok.
title: Nice Hotel

review: We have stayed in Barcelona many times (+25 times). This was the first time at this hotel. It was mainly chosen because we came by car from Southern France, so it was very easy acces from north and you did not have to drive in the city center, and there was a fair prized parking in the basement.We were pleasantly surprised by the very friendly staff and the hotel quality. The hotel was very fairly prized compared to more citycenter hotels, and were absolutely better quality. Breakfast was very nice indeed.We are used to stay closer to the center, so we thought it was a bit of a walk to the center. There were however metro stations close by.
title: Nice hotel, location good if you come by car from north

review: We stayed 5nights very clean rooms wth staff very friendly Breakfast is very very good with a wide verity The hotel restaurant food is very poor quality for the price an we waited 25mins for a cocktail we ordered an the place was empty with two members of staff doing nothin that was a major let down to a lovely quiet hotel in a nice location
title: Nice hotel. Near the beach

review: The Positives:The location of this venue is absolutely perfect. 5 minute walk to the Diagonal Mar Shopping Centre and 10 minute walk to the beach. Banks/ATM's/Supermarkets 2 minutes' walk away.The Front Desk Staff were awesome and always ready/available to assist. Checking in and out was a breeze and absolutely no problem/hassle at all.The Staff in the Restaurant in the Evening were very kind/helpful/attentive and the food quality was very good.Breakfast Buffet was fine, good choice of coffees/beverages and the options for which type of breakfast were wide.The Junior Suite has a large bathroom and the bed was comfortable.The Negatives:Sadly, there are a couple of things that really let the hotel down and would in our opinion, be pretty easy to solve.The Junior Suites are on all floors, the first Suite and not ideally placed next to the Housekeeping Room - so there is a lot of noise from the Housekeeping door being opened/closed and the Room Attendants and their associated noise/chatter.Our Room attendants failed badly on the second/third night (First night we opted just for change of towels). But nights 2 & 3 the room was not cleaned properly, mini-bar not replaced, toiletries not replaced, all round a shoddy/rushed job (not once but twice). After we complained to Front Desk things were fine - but the staff on Housekeeping those two days badly let the hotel down - just simple laziness.The second problem is that Wi-Fi, whilst free throughout, is not stable at all and not only keeps dropping, but can remain down for long periods of time. If you do find that you are the type of person that needs to work whilst travelling, this can be a major interruption.But solve the 2 problems above and you have a very good, pleasant experience and even without a Gym or Pool, you would have a good stay if only those 2 issues could be resolved.
title: Great Location and Great Front Desk Staff

review: Great hotel, rooms are tight but very nice and classic place, friendly and very helpful staff, free buffet 24/7, including free beer etc!Very good location! Been there before and will go again!Thank you
title: Very friemdly

review: Loved this quaint hotel at the very top of La Rambla. Only two minutes from playa Catalunya so getting Aetobus to there from the airport was so handy. Hotel is in an older type building, but that doesn't deter from its warmth, charm and friendliness. Staff always kind and helpful, theyd left us a bottle of cava in room on arrival and given us a decent room overlooking the patio at the back as they had promised in emails. . Our room 258 was a good size, had a lovely bathroom, a free safe and air con, plus s little fridge and micro were an added bonus. Free buffet was a lovely touch. Wine, beer, sift drinks tea and coffee, breads, yoghurt, fruit and a small selection of hot foods at all times was very enjoyable. Good breakfast for a city hotel too. Would definitely go back, great little hotel, lovely staff in excellent location.
title: Lovely hotel, great staff and amazing location.

review: Stayed hear for 3 nights my wife and I and the lad and his girlfriend. The hotel isn't the cheapest but worth the extra due to location which was 2nd to none! Rooms a little dated but nice. The 24 hour free snacks was a nice touch even though it was the same every night, microwave in your room with fridge. But the main thing which I've never experienced was the free BEER & WINE!!! fantastic! Overall loved our stay will be back next year for sure.
title: Great place to stay and the best location

review: I stayed at this hotel for the third time in the span of a few months. I was not disappointed as the overall experience was excellent once again. Great and trendy hotel, with lovely staff and services. Good for both business and leisure. While the hotel is not in central downtown, it is very close to the metro while tourist buses pass in front of the hotel every minutes.
title: Excellent choice in Barcelona

review: This was my first trip to Barcelona. The hotel is right about on Diagnol Ave so the location is phenomenal. It's within walking distance to a lot of restaurants, nightlife, near the train, rail, etc. the front desk staff were very helpful and found them to be more helpful than the concierge throughout my stay. The rooms are nice, clean, and modern (especially the bathroom) The only confusing part for me is that there are two Hiltons, the Hilton Barcelona and the Hilton Diagnol so if you don't Speak Spanish like me very well make sure you show your taxi driver the address of the hotel so they take you to the right one!
title: Great location in Barcelona

review: Nice area, near a mall and some places to eat, and a short walk to the metro train and 30 minutes to the airport, The metro goes to many tourist sites and taxi is easy to get and also buses to other parts of the city.
title: Very nice place and quiet area away from tourist

review: Great location. Close to public transportation. Metro L3 in 5 minutes. Gets you to city center in less than 30 minutes. Lot of good restuarants in and around. Room was pretty good sized. Well maintained. Did not try the breakfast in the hotel as there were several options around. Quick access to airport also. Will stay again during my next vidit!
title: Hilton Barcelona

review: This hotel was in the middle of town, walking distance or a quick train ride to most of the attractions. Our room was exactly what you'd expect from a Hilton property - knowledgeable and friendly staff,clean and comfortable rooms. The restaurant however is a hard pass for dinner. Breakfast was the usual mediocre but dinner was over priced and disappointing. There is a tapas place right next door.
title: Gorgeous Hotel

review: Good friendly staff at reception, and check-in was very smooth.We requested an additional roll-away bed for our son and it was promptly brought in and set for us.Breakfast is good but BBQ restaurant is even better.It was a pleasant experience to stay.
title: Good hotel for business trip

review: WOW!! What a great location..if you're going to Barcelona and would like to stay at, what I would call, centrally located hotel, pick this Hilton. The staff was welcoming and helpful without coming across as being less than genuine. Special kudos to the server in the restaurant, wish I could recall her name, she was terrific!! She was the only dark hair female host/server so she will be easy to spot..great service!!Check in/out staff also very good and helpful.The host working the lounge also went out of her way to greet and make the HHDiamond members staying on the fourth floor feel taken care off. The only minor problem occurred at the lounge when I tried to get a glass of cold water and all the cold drink holders were locked. The lounge attendant called for the keys and a grumpy older gentleman came to unlock the fridges but not before complaining about how those fridges were locked at a certain time and then open much later. He was quite loud about that to the point that the lounge hostess had to apologize for this persons lack of tack.Most Hiltons that I have stayed before usually have the fridges open for guests to get cold bottles of water or juice, don't see why this Hilton locks the fridges.My room was clean, comfortable and the a/c worked very well. Bottom line: great place to stay!!!
title: Love it..except for one thing!!

review: Dont stay in this hotel if you need an extra bed in your room, my son could not sleep in his and we had to stay 2 nights.He tried 1 night but got sore back after having the metal springs in the matress hurt his spine. And do not expect to get any help to get better bed either, you will only hear lots of excuses.. Even i booked the extra bed 1 week upfront they prefered to give the good extrabed to someone arriving same day, who had not booked this in advance..? Desk manager told me they were a big group arriving bit earlier than me.. Really dissapointing!
title: Mr. Tol

review: Great location near a subway station. The hotel lobby is nicely decorated, service staffs are very polite, helpful and attentive. The rooms are comfy although a little upgrade of the amenities could be considered
title: Short stay!

review: The location in the financial district was well situated for getting around Barcelona.The hotel was clean and in a safe neighborhood. The breakfasts were well prepared and had a good selection. The staff was friendly and helpful but a few things in the room did not work properly.They need to have their facility manager check out the rooms more frequently that everything is in good working condition I.e. Working Phones, wobbly faucets,sliding closet doors that keep sliding etc.But I would stay again if I first checked out the room
title: Not quite a Hilton

review: This hotel was very nice and we enjoyed our stay. We would stay there again. The staff was great and the location although kind of away from the old part of the city was in a great place. Very near the subway and taxis were everywhere.
title: barcelona hilton

review: We stayed for just one night before flying home to Canada. The staff (who were in training) who checked us in and out were friendly and helpful. We had a sky view room which had double aspect views. We could see the city and the sea and the hills. Unfortunately, it was not a quiet room. We could hear the people in the next room talking, the television and there was a lot of loud banging of doors. The room was a connected room (which we didn't request) and if we were staying more than one night we would have asked for a different room. We were in room 1131 - not recommended unless you want a connecting room.The bathroom was fine; clean, good towels and spacious enough. We had breakfast in the dining room, mainly for convenience as we were flying out. It was not great; less choice than at any other hotel we have stayed in throughout Europe. There wasn't anyone giving service or asking if you needed anything. I would have liked a pot of coffee at the table instead of having to get up and refill the tiny cups several times. The hot food did not look that appetizing. We definitely didn't get our moneys worth at 18 Euros each. There isn't even a good ambience to the dining room - very rushed and understaffed is my opinion.We chose this hotel as it was closer to the airport end of the city but still close enough to do a bit of sightseeing for the one day we were there. The metro was a short walk away and is easy to use. This hotel is close to a university, hospital and shopping centre. It was adequate for our needs. I wouldn't recommend it for people who are going to Barcelona for a longer stay to see the sights. There were a lot of families at breakfast so it may be better suited to that demographic.
title: Close to metro but only 25 Euro (including tip) to airport.

review: I choose this hotel due to close access to train station, but was pleasantly surprised to find it was close to all city transportation. Close to supermarket, pharmacy , restaurants and shopping center. Great area for working and eating outdoors.
title: Amazing Stay

review: We stayed two different times for a night each time. We stayed with Hilton points. Overall I liked the Hotel as the rooms were larger than normal for Europe and while not exactly close to the Gothic area or Exiample area, it is convenient to the train station, we used twice, and airport and very close to the green line subway that takes you to the Gothic Quarter. The building is a cool modern kind of European feel and our experiences with staff were good. Also the breakfast and breakfast area for Hilton Honors was good. My only real complaint was the shower that was not real clear how to work. We came back a second time and it was still tough. Other than that all good.
title: Great rooms good location

review: Really nice hotel with good facilities. The staff are however extremely slow particularly on reception. For some reason there can be a que of 30 guests and just two people on reception. There is also not a separate hhonurs reception for members which is very unusual.
title: Very slow service

review: I stayed 19 July to 23 July 2017 in this hotel with my wife. I have been a diamond member for the last 4 years and stayed at numerous hotel in Asia, Europe, USA, Africa. Here are my bad experiences with the service, amenities and ambiance of this hotel. When arrived no one assisted us with the luggage, wanted to check in at the Ex Lounge, told can't and should check in the arrival counter. The staff was rude, not polite and when requested for a upgrade to a suite was told non available, Lousy executive lounge (someone sleeping in the lounge like a homeless person during day time and the staff was totally unaware). The breakfast at the lobby was the worst that I ever experienced (ate only one day). I was promised to a Junior suite on the 2nd night but the staff was not aware fully what's going on. However I got the upgrade on the 3rd night but the quality of the suite was not worth mentioning. The room amenities were minimum (i set of toiletries for 2 guests, no mouth wash). Reluctant to provide extra drinking water. When I asked to show the written benefits that the hotel provides to diamond member, none was available. The duty manager said she will send one to the room but never done. When I changed rooms, no one assisted us to move, my wife got a trolley herself and we arranged moving rooms ourselves.The hotel ambiance is not suitable for a Hilton hotel and more like a 3 star hotel. I wanted to talk to GM but was told always busy to talk to a guest. I think the GM and his staff need to get their act together to provide better service and improve quality.I had excellent stays at Hilton Malta, Hilton Algarve (Portugal) during our holidays this time. I will never stay in this hotel again. But must say Barcelona is a wonderful place to visit and one of the best European cities for holidays (food, site and sound etc.)
title: Worst Hilton I have ever stayed
