review: We were first 'converted' to the Hilton brand in Kiev (still the best we've stayed in by far) and have since sampled 10 other Hilton Hotels across Europe. You'd imagine that there would be some similarity of approach, if not of design, age and decor, but service standards vary far too widely. In Barcelona, the following were good features: - newly refurbished, fresh, modern and clean;- Exec. Lounge seating area separated from its cafe;- easy to use bedroom lighting;- very helpful and conscientious food assistant on duty at breakfast in the Exec Lounge.The following were less good:- difficulty of identifying the hotel from street level as all signage relates to other names;- poorly briefed desk staff - [if you have no Concierge, you need people there able to answer the simplest of questions (and they couldn't) - e.g. how far is it to walk to Maria Cristina station?- very small, so-called Exec bedrooms (think Japan business hotels); nowhere to put suitcases; no mirror over the desk;- poor menu choice for non meat eaters in bar and restaurant;- room service incomplete (no replacement toilet roll) and not undertaken until after 3.00pm and three lots of chasing it up.Not only connected with this particular hotel but the online booking system makes you start again even if you only want to knock a night off the end of a booking. This means that you lose your original rate and any special requests go missing. Next time, we'll cancel a room on arrival.
title: A mixed experience

review: Good location within walking distance from restaurants, shops and public transportation but far from most touristic spots. Beautiful lobby and really great rooms with nice beds and tasteful decoration. Nice bathroom with rain shower. Complimentary wifi (very very slow). Good breakfast! To my shock the cost of the parking was 37€ per night!!! It's so ridiculously expensive that changed all my perspective of the experience. Having a car, won't go back.
title: 5⭐️ but ultra expensive car parking

review: its good located and nicely designed !very spacious and clean ! the only thing i did not like was the breakfast buffet which was not hilton standard in europe ! friendly staff even though the hotel was packed these days !
title: hilton standard (almost)

review: First, the highlights. Updated hotel, with comfortable rooms and a great breakfast, in a great neighborhood. Secondly, the disappointments. As a Gold Honors member and 2,000,000 mile flier I have stayed at a few international hotels. The staff never quite got all of the amenities in my room right each day, no new coffee most days, bathroom amenities missed most days. Daily water was hit or miss, on my last day of 6, I asked for water to be replaced and was told the hotel policy was water only on the first day of arrival. Really? This is the first major brand 4star international hotel where I found the complimentary water rationed to one day. I explained my concern to the staff and they had no answers, penny wise, pound foolish, I will not be back.
title: Bad customer service

review: Brief description: Sleek, clean, newly-remodeled, well-appointed compact hotel room. 10-minute walk to Hop-On Hop-Off Bus. Small gym, no pool. I would stay here again.Detailed description of room #901.Comfortable twin beds, robes, slippers, blackout curtains, great air-conditioning, fridge, electric kettle, ironing board, coffee-no tea, no USB ports, two waters per stay. Small, but mighty bathroom. One piece of molded glass for sink with counter space on both sides with space underneath to store personal items, PeterThomasRoth toiletries provided, large mirror above sink that doesn't fog while showering. Small lighted round mirror, perfect for night light, bidet, towel warmer, deep narrow bathtub with detachable showerhead. Curved shower rod with sheer shower curtain top. Abstract knobs in shower. Supervise children: water gets extremely hot. Hair dryer provided, outlet outside of bathroom.Tips: Get a business card with the hotel's address. There are two Hiltons in Barcelona, both on Diagonal Avenue. This Hilton is closer to the beach. Buy advanced tickets online before attempting to visit any tourist attraction to avoid a long queue and/or disappointment. Buy a one-day ticket for the Hop On Hop Off bus to get an overview of Barcelona. Do one route, take a siesta in the middle of the day, and then do a second route in the evening. Take taxis to attractions on subsequent days. Taxi fares usually €10 - €15 and accept credit cards Taking the Hop On Hop Off bus for transportation to see sights is extremely frustrating since busses only run in one direction and time is wasted waiting for the bus. Barcelona BusTurista busses seemed to run more frequently than Barcelona City Tour busses.
title: Located in City Center

review: OK, it's expensive but it's central, quiet, spotless, great food and drink, and staff very polite and well trained to look after visitors. Very close to good shopping and tapas bars. Would I visit and stay again? Without question!
title: Forget the others!

review: Well located hotel only 15 minutes from the center it is also near to two shopping centers. Calm hotel and luxury room with confortable beds. Very friendly and careful staff, they all speak fluently english and french and are very welcoming, especially Karim, the executive lounge manager, who is very funny, well organized and helpful since he even advised us and gave as clue for our trip. I strongly recommend Hilton Barcelona.
title: Attentive staff

review: This modern, stylist hotel is very close to shops & restaurants. Staff are polite & they even arranged for a breakfast box for our 3 am checkout. Comfortable king bed and roomy ensuite with very modern decor.
title: STYLIST

review: I stayed at the Hilton Barcelona for 4 nights last week and really enjoyed it. The service was great all around, from the front desk to the multiple restaurants. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. Very clean and bathrooms are quite large. Breakfast was perfect with a nice selection of items. Location is also good very close to a mall and multiple restaurants. Will be back!
title: Great hotel in a convenient location!

review: Stayed for a couple of nights. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a one-bedroom suite (also because the room i booked suddenly became unavailable). Carlos at reception was very helpful. Rocio at the the executive floor was equally great. She introduced us to the Busturistic hop on and off buses which turned out to be a great way to see Barcelona. There's a stop very close to the hotel. I would definitely consider staying here again. Thumbs up.
title: A great room to sleep in

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel was outstanding in many ways! Loved staying in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona with it's many maze-like tiny pedestrian only streets and great shopping just around the corner. Not only did our second floor room have a beautiful view of the cathedral just across the plaza but the rooftop views were outstanding! Rooftop has a small wading pool with at least 2 deck areas with high top tables to enjoy the views and take photos. Our room was gorgeous! Updated with a beautiful tufted headboard, lovely fabrics throughout on curtain panels, bedding, pillows and upholstery in different shades of blue and green. Very clean and nice large bathroom with 2 sinks. Nice water pressure in shower. Room also came with a great espresso machine and fridge too! Would highly recommend this hotel because if it's location, views and luxurious feel!
title: A Hotel With A View!

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We revisited this lovely, gracious hotel after six years and it is every bit as good now as then. You can't beat the location: across the square from the gothic cathedral and down from the gate leading into the bari gothic, or gothic quarter, which is the most interesting part of Barcelona. The hotel has a nice, elegant restaurant with great service and it's less expensive than many trendy spots which are half as good. This square is a far superior location to the huge Plaza Catalonia, which is noisy and surrounded by busy streets with honking traffic. You will not be disappointed in this hotel.
title: Beautiful, super location

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We had a room with a view of the cathedral square, wonderful! The hotel was very very clean, and in an incredible location. It was also super easy to find, just take the T1 aeropuerto bus to the last stop and follow the avenue, to the cathedral. The staff were also superb, competant and friendly.
title: Romantic and totally lovely!

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We spended 4 night at this wonderful place , we really enjoyed our time there , the hotel have a fantastic view of the hestorical Barcelona cathedral, have very nice pool.Room was very nice and clean, reception team was very helpful, I loved the walk in the city , Will go back again
title: Wonderful hotel , great location

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel is amazing - the staff couldn't possibly be more helpful. And the location is ideal - across the plaza from the Cathedral in the center of town. It is very easy to walk to the major attractions and cozy neighborhoods.
title: Phenomenal hotel in central Barcelona

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed in a reburbished room on the 2nd floor. Room was beautiful, only problem was our double bed was 2 beds put together but everything else was perfect. Very clean hotel and cleaning staff did an exceptional job with our room each day. Would highly recommend this hotel for quality and location especially for first trip to Barcelona. Views from the roof terrace are amazing. Buffet breakfast excellent. Would definately stay again.
title: "Quality with great views."

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We booked directly through the site as I have read then when you don't the hotel gives you the crappiest room. I asked for a high floor bot thinking we would get it, but we got 508 which is the last level before the most expensive room. Get the one facing the cathedral. EPIC! It was a great location and the jacuzzi pool was small but perfect for us. We had it all to ourselves, and it gives you the best view of the Cathedral. They can also bring you food and dribks to the other side of the spa. I was excited when I saw "salad roll". It is hard to get salad and veggies when you eat out in Barcelona. A lot of salads come with fish or something like that. Anyways we only stayed too days before heading to Rome and it was great! We heard a ton of free music from up on the roof including the kind they play when they so the Catalan circle dance, opera, and a bunch more! Great way to relax and watch life go by.
title: Great location,best view, SALAD

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: With a location just steps away from the Cathedral, Colon Hotel offers a very comfortable stay. The great location offers walking distance to nearby restaurants, stores and shops, the hop on/off bus, and markets. While the hotel lobby has a very traditional vibe, our room was very spacious, modern, and comfortable. The hotel's staff and housekeeping were very friendly and courteous. I would offer the hotel five stars except that our room's bathroom door wouldn't close. Otherwise, overall, Hotel Colon is Highly Recommended!
title: A Fantastic Stay!

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: 1. best location, magnificent cathedral as background while you swim/sauna/steam or just casual drinking on open rooftop. easy to locate, all taxi/driver is familiar with the place. easy to walk to shopping place or local market for dinner 2. classic design with advanced facilities. interior is maintain its heritage look but combine with new design and technology. wifi is always on and enough for daily use. rooms are clean, spacious and all stuffs you need is there.3. excellent service from staffs, helpful and care for visitors. breakfast is complete however the variation should be alternate daily.our family stay 4 rooms for 4 days (24-28 july 2017), best vacation ever, 5 star from us
title: exceed your payment

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We visited Barcelona and I was a bit sceptical that I had booked the right hotel. However, my fears were wasted. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was airy, clean and had great views. The hotel could not have done more to make our stay more enjoyable. A special mention to Raquel in guest relations who organised some beautiful flowers for our stay. Will visit again
title: Special Break

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel s located right on the Cathedral Plaza and the Plaza teems with activity 24/7 so if your room faces the plaza and you're a light sleeper you may want to consider earplugs, Seriously. but that's a minor annoyance and likely a non-issue for most people. The plaza'a liveliness and activity are fabulous. Besides the proximity to the Cathedral, you're within a short walk to Placa Catalunya, the Picasso Museum, La Rambla, Santa Catarina market, etc. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is very nice and helpful.Special thanks to David!It's a can't miss.
title: Fabulous Location! Great Staff!

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Came here for my Birthday surprise which my girlfriend had organised. after knowing that she paid almost £500 for a two night stay i expected a bit more then what we got.On arriving check in was good and friendly, we were given our room keys on the second floor, room was quit small with 2 beds stuck together, balcony was tiny and can barely fit one person and over looking nothing really. t.v tiny too, usual options in the mini bar. bathroom was good however to switch on the main shower you had to be in it and bear the cold water before it goes to the temp you would like it as the door for the shower only opens inwards!! They sent us a bottle of cava like 2 seconds after we walked in the room, nice gesture but give us some time. now to the crazy part! So after having a rushed glass of cava my girlfriend went to get changed in the bathroom and closed the door behind here.Then the door didn't open, i tried and tried and the handle was not working, tried looking for the number of reception to call someone but no luck, so i headed down stairs and told them, the looked very relaxed about it and told me to go back up and the maintenance guy will be there to help. So i did. and indeed the guy turned up. speaking to my girlfriend she was now feeling the heat in a closed space and very unconformable, the maintenance guy tried and tried to open the door but no luck, after bringing his tools he managed to take the whole lock out and finally after 30 mins he opened the door. We opted to leave the room while he went to find and new door handle to fix, The disappointing bit is that when we came down to reception they really didn't care what had just happened i mean imagine someone was on their own in there! Anyways we didn't take second chances of trying to close the bathroom door again! Sleeping at night again uncomfortable pillows and the air conditioning only send cold air straight to the bed so we couldn't keep it on at night. The spa area on the roof was nice, the location was nice to i guess that's what they want you to pay for rather then having and nice room to sleep in!! I love Barcelona but will not stay here again as we all know there are plenty of hotels here. Shame!
title: 3 stars for location and spa!

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We checked in on July 31 and checked out on August 4. This hotel was central to everything we planned and did and our view of the cathedral and the surrounding plaza - an upgrade - was breathtaking. The hotel is in an old building which is spectacularly maintained. The staff was very attentive and efficient. However, on close inspection upon check in, the bathroom was not cleaned to perfection as we found some unappetizing body hair on the floor and in the bathtub (which was gone the next day). Also the TV was on the fritz on our first day but the maintenance staff addressed this issue quickly after we reported it to the front desk. The breakfast- also an upgrade- was excellent and the wait staff was very attentive. I would stay here again, but hope the housekeeping staff will devote more attention to detail.
title: Very good hotel

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed 2 1/2 days prior to boarding our cruise. Loved the location, friendly staff who spoke English, concierge assisted us to choose great dinner location options. Luggage is stored safely with quick easy access if need be.
title: Pre- cruise visit

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Overall, very good experience. They keep the public areas spotless. However there are some things you need to know. The restaurant is quite expensive. I elected to not have any meals there at all. There are so many options close to the hotel. Another thing you need to know is that they block the elevator from going to where the spa/Jacuzzi is located, until 10AM. It is not a pool, but a large jacuzzi, that is kept very clean and it is refreshing, but it is shallow. In addition, there were several times that they had not opened it until i called them myself to remind them to unlock it for guests to use. Why is that? This was at 10:15AM. Plus, there is an additional code on a keypad you have to enter, which is fine, but they changed the code during my stay, and i was not aware of that, because they had not informed me and they said they would have the maintenance look at it. Well, the staff person didn't even know that the code had changed themselves. That wasted a day for me. Not fun. The wi-fi in my room was not good, either. Bummer. The A/C finally was fixed after 2 days of complaining about it. My key malfunctioned 3 times over 3 days and they finally issued me a new one, but not until i really pressed them. OK, so why would i return? Because of the staff, like "Victor" who was excellent, and "Raquel" who is concierge. She personally got out , into the city to help me find some special requests that needed a native speaker. I will forever appreciate her personal help. The turn-down service with 2 little chocolates is a classy touch. The in-room safe is quite nice. The espresso service in the room is excellent. The view from the roof is quite amazing. You should see it.
title: Very good, but...be aware...

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: I had one of the hotel's single rooms for five nights. It was on the small side, but not unreasonable for a single. The room was spotless. I was on the back side of the hotel so I didn't have a cathedral view but also had no noise. The front desk and bell staff were friendly and professional. The restaurant was beautiful and the service very good but, as others have mentioned, the food in my one meal there was only ok. Not awful, but there are so many great places to eat in Barcelona. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's across the plaza from the cathedral and walking distance to Gothic Quarter, Born, and La Rambla attractions. About a five minute walk to a Metro stop. Also an easy walk to the Aerobus to/from the airport. This is not among the most luxurious hotels in Barcelona but it holds its own in the classic old school style of a full service hotel. Coupled with attractive rates and the excellent location, it's really a good choice.
title: Great location; classic style

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The Hotel Colon, named in honor of Christopher Columbus, in an older hotel with beautiful architecture. It faces on a plaza directly facing the Barcelona Cathedral, which is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe, inside and outside The plaza on which the hotel is located is a gathering place for buskers, flower sellers, and mimes. The hotel is a shot walk from the Rambla, a colorful market for local souvenirs, flowers, and in particular, fresh and prepared foods, including many that are not eve known in the united States. The hotel itself has prompt and attentive service, well-decorated rooms of larger than usual size for an old property. The bar service is in a beautiful capacious setting with attentive service. Sitting outside on the plaza is a fine people-watching place, day and night, not only for the street performers but also for the locals who pass through on foot and on bicycles, day ad night. There are numerous cafes and restaurants around the plaza on which the hotel is located. For a genuine introduction to the culture and people of Barcelona and Catalonia, the Hotel Colon is an excellent choice.
title: Charming Old Hotel in a Superior Location

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: I was traveling by myself in Spain and while I know Barcelona pretty well, I wanted to stay some place safe and near the heart of the city. I happened upon this place and I could not have been happier. The room itself was small but perfect for one person, decent price as well. Could use a bit of updating but it was clean and the bathroom was large and very nice. However, I spent almost no time in the room because I couldn't pull myself away from the rooftop terrace and pool. INCREDIBLE view of the cathedral and surrounding Barcelona. I was sad that I had to leave but I will definitely be back soon.
title: Perfect for a few solo nights in Barcelona!

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Shared a twin room with my best friend on a 3 night break. Everything was top class. Loved the room, little balcony. Modern shower . Can't fault it. Very clean. We sat upstairs on the roof top one night, and tapas and drinks were brought up to us. They said 20 minutes it was only 10... What can I say. Reception staff were truly delightful, always helpful. We were on the 2nd floor, their are two lift. Wifi was good.
title: Fantastic location, fantastic staff

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stopped in for two nights recently - well located in the Gothic quarter between 2 metro stations (a short 5-10 min walk to both). Exceptionally lively area in easy walking distance.We were able to leave our bags until our room was ready - staff were friendly and spoke English well.We had a balcony room on the first floor so were slightly concerned about potential noise from the square but as they are refurbished rooms they'd installed the French doors very well which blocked out all noise.AC didn't seem to have as much power as it should have. Very pleasant bathroom - one large walk-in shower. Free wifi was reliable and in room amenities good.As another reviewer mentioned, the bed was two singles pushed together so not ideal for a couple but the only minor flaw in our whole stay.Would definitely stay here again when visiting Barcelona.
title: Excellent city center hotel for short stays.

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Plunge pool, cathedral view, fantastic wifi. Hotel Colon was exceptional! Extremely friendly staff willing to help out with anything. Great price and family friendly. This hotel made our stay much easier because of its great location. Will not think twice about returning to this hotel and I highly recommend it.
title: 4 great days at Hotel Colon!!!

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: On our second stay in Barcelona,we chose Hotel Colon again and it was no disappointment. A well run Hotel with courteous, professional staff, some of whom were particularly memorable. Antonio,concierge, arranged several trips for us and Gustavo,front desk, was also helpful.Thank you for another pleasant visit.
title: Our Favorite

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Great staff and safety was there preference, I strongly recommend it to everyone. Happy to answer any questions. Its is centrally located and shops of all kind around , room and service was perfect and so was the room and space
title: Loved it

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: the hotel is ok and the staff are lovely, however the rooms and other parts of the hotel are extremely old fashioned and definitely need a revamp for the prices charged. on a positive, the view from the rooftop bar was beautiful.
title: OK Stay

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: My daughter and I recently stayed at this fantastic hotel. We'd spent 2 weeks travelling around Spain and Barcelona was our last stop. We arrived a little early for check in but our room was ready for us. We'd chosen a Cathedral view room and I'd really recommend spending that little extra to do the same. Was a beautiful view to wake up to and listening to the bells was wonderful. The reception staff were all very helpful and so friendly and knowledgeable in all the places to visit. We had booked for breakfast and really enjoyed the selection of hot and cold food. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom was well stocked with all your needs. Would definitely book this hotel when I next visit Barcelona
title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Right in the centre for all tourist attractions and designer label shops. However a whilst a classic building a little faded in parts. Rooms clearly vary a lot and some are recently renovated others clearly not!
title: Great location.

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Perfect location. Small but pretty room with Juliette balcony and great air conditioning. Staff are attentive and helpful. Would stay again for certain. Always something going on and great family atmosphere. N
title: Perfect location

hotelLocation: Avenida de la Catedral 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Enjoyed our stay here. Great location. Had rooms on the 1st floor, view of cathedral not as good as the higher rooms, but the 1st and 2nd floors are newly remodeled and very nice. Top floor deck nice also for drinks. Would stay here again.
title: Great location

review: This hotel was perfectly located in the city centre, only a short and very direct bus ride from the airport. Within walking distance of many attractions, but they've also bus stops on the square outside meaning was very easy to get anywhere in the city. We were offered a glass of bubbly on arrival, and complimentary drinks were available from 12-4pm daily. Our room was lovely and the complimentary toiletries were of a very high standard. Service was excellent, the staff on reception were always very friendly and helpful. Great value for money. My only slightly negative comment is that it can get noisy throughout the night due to the rooms overlooking a central courtyard above reception, and any noise in the reception travels up to the rooms. This was easily resolved when a kind member of staff advised where I could buy some earplugs from! I can't believe this was a three star hotel, it felt far more like a four-star hotel. I would definitely recommend the hotel and plan to stay here again.
title: Great service, great location

review: Great location, spotlessly clean, comfortable bed.Quiet room which is dark at night. Very thoughtful design. Great amenities. Wonderful staff- gave great restaurant recommendations. Thoughtful touches.
title: Great location

review: Great boutique hotel right in the heart of Barcelona, by Las Ramblas. Very busy area outside, with loads of tourists, but H10 is a little oasis of calm inside. Nicely decorated rooms - a bit small - but typical size for a capital city - still very pleasant. We had one of the suites with the outside seating terrace which was great. Very cool air Conditioners in rooms, which allowed us to get a very nights good sleep when it was hot outside. Lovely for a romantic break. Close to the Gothic Quarter, our favourite area. Parking was not too bad using the underground SABAS underground car park just off Catalunya Plaza and only about 150m from hotel. Expensive to park though! Really liked the H10 chain of hotels!
title: What a little gem!

review: Went to Barcelona on July 6th, 2017, spent a week at the H10 Catalunya Plaza Boutique Hotel. Hotel has been restored, very pretty inside, very nice staff, especially Jordi at front desk. Great breakfast in morning, beer and cava are put out in afternoon. Clean rooms, but they are small. We requested to be moved from first room as it was so small. No washclothes. Great location as bus stop is across street and you are at the top of La Rambla(walking area with shops and restaurants). Lots of high end stores, like 5th Avenue in NY. Also, very busy this time of year and warm weather. NO public bathrooms, you either use a McDonalds or some restaurants require you to buy something to use the toilet. Eating outside was crowded,(and everyone smokes) but inside where they had air conditioning was less people. Make reservations before you go online if you want to see the major attractions. ( We took a 45 minute train ride to see the champagne caves and couldn't get a tour as they were all booked. )Train and bus service were easy to use. ITAPA next to hotel was not very good food. However, La Tagliatella was an excellent Italian restaurant, as was Bars & Bar. Everyone eats late, 9 to 10 at night, so if you go earlier, you can get right in. Mediterranean Sea was beautiful to swim in, beach nice, but crowded and there are restaurants you can eat at right on the beach.
title: City of Barcelona

review: The decor of this hotel is charming. We loved our room which was immaculate. The breakfast buffet was delicious. They gave us the option of ordering from a menu, which we did the first day. The next 2 days we just ate from the buffet which was very large, fresh, and delicious. This hotel is in the Plaza Catalunya, which is one block from Las Ramblas. We were able to walk to the Barri Gotic. The tour bus stop was on the square, right across the street/square from the hotel. The service at this hotel was great. Loved this place!
title: Charming

review: Nice Hotel, with very nice clean, and clear rooms. Small but very practical, which is not a problem.A little bit far from the gothic distric of the city (35-40min walk)!I would recommend this hotel.....with his great concept of the very good bakery at the ground floor.
title: Nice!

review: Comfy and clean hotel in a terrific location, 1 block from La Pedrera in the Eixample. Very nice and helpful staff. Rooms are pleasant - yes, they are small but to be expected in Europe, and who needs a big room when you should be exploring the wonderful city of Barcelona! The bakery is a great feature, we usually got breakfast there instead of the hotel buffet, more selection (almond and chocolate croissants, mmmm)
title: Terrific location and hotel, yummy bakery

review: great hotel. 5 star service. clean & good location.Breakfast was fine but worth considering to skip breakfast and take a coffee and pastry from the hotel bakery.A lovely team. This is a three star hotel but feals a lot more. I'll definitely come back again
title: Excellent

review: If you want to stay in the heart of Barcelona this is a perfect location - close to sightseeing points and the city centre. Highly recommended for a short stay, the bakery downstairs is busy but charming!
title: great location, helpful staff and cool atmosphere in the bakery

review: Stayed here with some friends last week. What a fun little hotel tucked away, yet close to everything. Rooms are small, boutique style but we'll equipped. The bakery first thing in the morning was absolutely fantastic. So fun to watch the bakers and pastry chef create as you enjoy eating their creations. Because of the small size of rooms, I can say 2-3 NIGHT stay here would be a great base while exploring Barcelona are area. Would love to come back, very soon.
title: Wonderful - top to bottom

review: This hotel was in a great location walking distance to all of the main tourist locations and 5 minutes away from the metro. The rooms were small, modern and clean but the beds were two twins pushed together which would separate and slide around, not the best for a couple. The shower was my favourite part of the room, absolutely massive. The air con was good. Shame that there was no complementary water/drinks in the room especially as you are not really meant to drink the tap water (especially when occasionally it looked brown) There is a supermarket across the road, but still not quite the same when you have travelled and need a drink. It was different staying in a bakery, everything looked amazing however we found that the bakery staff were very rude and unhelpful. It was hard to order especially as there were no signs as to what anything was. All other bakery's we went into had signs and menus on the wall. The staff put us off attempting to order there, the lady who served us rolled her eyes and scoffed at us which made me feel very uncomfortable on our first day!! Instead from then on we had breakfast in the hotel which was nice, everything was pastries, bread or cheese and ham etc. Bit basic I would say for 9 euro but did the job. The hotel reception staff were all lovely and very helpful. They all spoke very good English which made it alot easier for us. All in all I would say average hotel in a good location, if you can get a decent price it is worth staying.
title: Good location

review: Great location, clean minimalistic room which is pretty typical in Spain. Great shower!!!! Front desk staff very helpful with food recommendations and any questions we had. Bakery was awesome and smelled soooo good. Only complaint was very poor internet in our room....but, to be fair, we were on 6th floor. So we sat in the lobby and had a coffee or water when we needed online. Not a big deal :)
title: Great visit

review: Praktik Bakery is in a great location for both sightseeing and shopping. The rooms are very small but nicely decorated. Bathrooms are very small, hardly any closet space. It is nice that there is air conditioning. And the bakery downstairs is lovely.
title: Cute hotel

review: The hotel is beautiful. We had a two room connecting family suite and it was perfect for the four of us. The bakery is amazing and always so nice to walk into. Breakfast was included and it was wonderful! The location was perfect- away from the touristy areas, but easy to walk everywhere.
title: Beautiful hotel in a great location

review: I highly enjoyed and would recommend staying at Praktik Bakery. All 3 of the on duty receptionists during my stay were helpful and responsive even though they were busy. Late one night, when the couple next door was yelling loudly, the male receptionist came upstairs to personally knock on their door and let them know people are trying to sleep. I loved being welcomed by the bakery every morning. The breakfast buffet option was convenient and fresh. Hot fresh individual coffees (they have decaf.) Very helpful and clean and convenient to get to and from visiting the WHOLE city.
title: The best receptionist & maid

review: What a gem of a hotel this is!!!Visited in April with my wife and whilst it is a bit basic, it is absolutely stunning. Simplistic decor but very clean and attentive staff! The bakery is awesome and the goods on offer were soooo tasty. Breakfast is a must if you are staying. It is in a great location and close to the main shopping areas but far enough away from the super crowded streetsWe will be back
title: Just fantastic

review: Very gentle staff. The breakfast was adequate (it needs some improvement). The night auditor could be more friendly.Very well spoken english by the receptionists (although the girls at the bakery need to improve it)
title: A well located hotel

review: Enjoyed every minute spent at Hotel Praktik Bakery! We used the airport shuttle to and from the hotel and were treated to courteous service the entire time. The hotel is right next to Gaudi's La Pedrera, within walking or metro distance to other tourist attractions. As to the actual room, our twin beds were closer together than expected but this was no problem. The huge shower was divine! Finally, it was amazing to wake up to delicious bakery food for breakfast each morning. We will definitely stay here the next time we visit Barcelona!
title: Wonderful first time visit to Barcelona

review: We were very satisfied. And would recommend this hotel. Location and cleanliness couldn't be beat. Only wish it had a pool. Bakery was excellent start to the day and staff was always helpful and friendly even when it was was very busy. We would stay again.
title: Family stay in Barcelona

review: My husband and daughter and I loved our three nights here in July, when, importantly, the air conditioning functioned perfectly! Rooms are small but that is not important to us. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are QUIET and immaculate. Bakery is terrific, breakfast good, staff personable and efficient, and we loved the international atmosphere--several different languages spoken at breakfast and many young people with backpacks as well as older people like us. Great location, too, and be sure to pick up some turrón at the shop in the Casa Pedrera a couple of blocks away. The hotel will reserve a van to the airport for you if you like, but it would also be easy to hail a taxi on the Passeig de Gracia a couple of blocks away. On a more individual note, I must again express my appreciation for the hotel's kindness in allowing us a credit for the nonrefundable stay we had booked for March and were unable to use because of illness. We would stay again at the Hotel Praktik Bakery and would recommend it to anyone in a minute!
title: An absolutely wonderful small hotel

review: Super central and very modern. We enjoyed every minute in this hotel. the bakery is outstanding as well. we'll sure coming back on our next trip. the price is unbeatable and the workers are very kind.
title: Cozy, cheap and central

review: Great hotel with a very convenient location: far enough from the "Ramblas" crowds but walking distance to everything: attractions, Metro, Passeig Gracia, etc. Rooms are nice (Europe standard size, no drawers), clean, nice shower, quiet. Front desk very helpful with restaurants and directions, they also provide towels to take to the beach. The bakery located in the lobby is outstanding, best bread in Barcelona according to locals...Great for breakfast or light meals.
title: Perfect location, "to die for" bakery

review: Its a very nice hotel, the room was great, the personal was very very friendly, the lobby was perfect. We would recommened this hotel!We enjoyed our stay!Definetly will be back again in Barcelona and also back in Praktik Bakery!
title: Perfect Spot

review: We stayed 4 nights in Barça with our 3 boys. Had the family room and a double (actually had 3 separate rooms which were very nice). Staff super friendly.Amazing location close to everything, and the bakery is fantastic.Definitely would go back!
title: Awesome Location, Bakery...great place to stay

review: Good value for money, great location and clean rooms. Main recommendation would be some improved handling of customer service at reception. I requested a late checkout (1 hour late) but ended up waiting to check out/drop off luggage at an empty reception desk for over half an hour anyway. Staff that were around were dismissive and rude, not once acknowledging us or asking us if we needed anything. Although I don't object paying a late checkout fee, I would have thought some flexibility and consideration would equally be given to inconveniencing us as well. For a paltry Euro 11, is it really worth making a customer feel so unvalued?
title: Nice place but service could be better

review: A Nice hôtel to recommend the room Was a little bit small but very clean the breakfast not very diversified only slices of cheese butter and jam but in général good very delicious bread..... The staff at the reception really helpfullThe location of the hotel si excellent we will Come back in january ..
title: Nice trip un an original hotel

review: Overall hotel experience is very good. This was our 2nd stay here, the reason we keep coming back is the magnificent backery downstairs.And the great location.Lovely restaurants and bars just walking distance.
title: Barcelona

review: We have spent 5 nights here with my wife. It was one of the nicest hotels I have been for a long time. The room was adorable, clean, fresh, no street noise and with well working air conditioning. The staff was friendly, helpful and open to our requests. The location was perfect. The bakery downstairs has awesome food and staff is very welcome.
title: It is the place you want to be when you visit Barcelona !!!

review: Great Hotel, the Lobby a little bit messy and small but that's it. Rooms very clean, and comfortable If you are looking for a place near Gaudi's buildings and Plaza Catalunya this is the right place also the hotel smells like bread!
title: Nice Hotel

review: Clean and functional room,an excellent breakfast and helpful and smiling staff in a beautiful city..everything at the top and the location is the best of Barcelona..the metro station is so close at the hotel
title: A pleasure stay at bakery

review: Very hip hotel with the best bakery in town downstairs - it is buzzing all day. The rooms are very well styled. Would compare to the Ace Hotel as far a budget boutique with a vibe instead of being stale and bland like most cheaper hotels. Location is perfect too, walk everywhere.
title: Outstanding value for money

review: My girlfriend and I spent a week at this hotel and had a great time. The location was perfect, great breakfast and cozy rooms. For improvement purposes, I'd like to focus on some things that could have been better. Starting with the service and employees, they were friendly and helpful when we asked for help, also that it was staff there 24/7. We got the feeling that it was a lot of staff working there, but only one for the hotel part and the rest for the bakery. So it was not so much of personal contact, which often is appreciated. Just to have someone at the hotel help the tourists that's staying there with things that can improve the whole vacation to Barcelona by guiding to restaurants, public transportation, sightseeing and other things.For the beds, they had some extra madress, that was awful to sleep on, so during the last few days, I had to take that off the bed to get some sleep.The cleaners did a good job to make it tidy every day, though one simple thing to improve the stay would to have toilet brushes to stay in the bathroom, so we can keep the bathrooms clean ourselfs, which would have improved our stay.The bread that was served for breakfast was delicious, though it would be appreciated to have some more yoghurt, cerials etc. and more things to put on the bread and eat. Also the logistics for where the glasses, plates, bread, toaster, and drinks are placed is not optimal and would be better to be switched a bit. ex. not to have the glasses and juices on opposite sides of the breakfast table.Except for these small improvement possibilities, we had a good stay and would come back to this hotel if we're back in Barcelona.
title: Very cozy hotel

review: Good Hotel in top location. Good services, friendly personel, clean and a unique combination with the top active Barcelona bakery on the gound level and reception area. Unique experience. Really recommandable. Wiil book this hotel on my next trip to Barcelona.
title: Good Hotel in a top location

review: Location was perfect we could walk everywhere we wanted to go, and room was bigger than expected with huge comfy bed and very clean. Staff were excelled with great recommendations for local places to eat and drink (and a good sense of humour too - it never felt too formal). Thanks for a great trip!
title: Would recommend to anyone!

review: Easily accessible. Clean. Friendly staff. Fantastic food. Would stay there again. Watching the bakers at work at 2am after getting back from the Gothic Quarter was comforting.Personality I'd not spend €9 on the breakfast which is limited in choice - merely order your food directly from the bakery counter and give your change to the poor hungry guy sat on the pavement outside. Had a great time in Barca - largely due to this hotel!
title: Baked to perfection

review: We had a nice stay at Praktik Bakery. Everyone who worked there is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but cozy and clean. The location is perfect for visiting the main attractions of Barcelona. The only downfall was surprisingly the breakfast, which despite being in a bakery, has limited choices. Oh and the parking is very expensive, but this is the case for everywhere in Barcelona.
title: Very Practical for visiting Barcelona

review: A lively hotel with some character, fun to have the bakery downstairs. Basic rooms but clean. The staff are friendly but have terrible customer service skills - not the fault of the individual staff, they need to be properly briefed by management. Example - due to a problem on the street, there was no running water from 9am-3pm. We are pretty relaxed guests and would be able to work around this, however, the staff managed it very badly. We arrived at midnight the night before and were not told of this scheduled issue by the reception staff - hence woke up not being able wash, shave or use the bathroom. They should've offered us bottles of water and a gesture such as complimentary breakfast. It was v poorly managed.
title: Lovely hotel but poor customer service

review: Great location relatively central to everything with quick access to metro. Concierge staff incredibly friendly and more than happy to help with anything, would highly recommend just wish they had a pool!
title: Great location and super friendly staff

review: We arrived very late at night, the bakers were already making bread for next day, so it smelled like heaven! Friendly staff, amazing location, clean rooms, superb breakfast, even if you don't feel like the hotel breakfast you can just buy stuff from the bakery and eat downstairs or make it a breakfast at bed. Rooms are nice, a bit small.
title: Great location

review: Our stay at the Praktik Bakery could not have been better. The rooms are nicely appointed and while smaller, work perfectly for anyone who is out and about in a great city like Barcelona. Sitting on top of a bakery made it easy to have breakfast, snacks and quicker meals as we were trying to get out to see the city. The neighborhood has lots of local restaurants to get away from the packs of tourists.
title: Great choice in Barcelona

review: ... because everything is smooth and working well: nice room, rather calm, nice and welcoming staff, tasty breakfast... nothins to think about, so that you can save your energy for city discoveries and fun !
title: A place where you can forget material aspects of your trip...

review: When we come on your website we'll see "parking free", excuse me but I never hear that 88€ correspond to 0€ !!! the food is pretty good and healthy but the saler could be more happy to serve...the room is clean and nice.
title: The car park is too expensive !!!

review: Great breakfast, a nice vibe, really helpful staff. Room was a touch small, but really clean. Easy walk to some interesting areas, but we struggled to find restaurants that we really loved. But would stay there again.
title: Loved the bakery

review: A wonderful bakery downstairs at your fingertips everyday! Rooms are small, but clean and adequate! Service is outstanding! Loved watching the bakers in the back making these delicious breads and sweets! A truly unique place!
title: Charming....

review: Couldn't be more centrally located for all the stuff we wanted to do. (We could see La Sagrada Familia through our window.) When we arrived there was a line out the door of (mostly) locals just trying to buy the bread they bake in the lobby. It is unbelievably good. Clean, cute, and intensely affordable!
title: Most delicious hotel stay of my life

review: When we asked about recommending a restaurant that locals would go to they came through with a perfect recommendation. When we wanted to take a walk by the water they gave us the map, distances to 3 locations and a recommendation for lunch.
title: Concierge staff were extremely helpful

review: The location is perfect allowing quick access to explore Barcelona... located next to the beach, lots of terrific restaurants, shops, and night clubs. The GM, Raul, has created a superior team and over-the-top guest experience. Elena coordinated every detail of our travel arrangements and gave us lot of ideas before we even arrived to help us plan. They were wonderful and made this trip so perfect for us. We stayed at club level at the Hotel Arts (a Ritz hotel), and it was definitely worth the extra cost. For starters the Club Lounge offers panoramic view of the city and relaxing environment that lets you take in the city and beach while being catered to like royalty. It is open first thing in the morning until midnight and is staffed with concierge to help with reservations, answer questions about the city, make a cappuccino, keep the amazing endless buffet of food fresh and stocked... There is everything you could want to drink from sparkling water to juices to tea/coffee, champaign, wine, and mixed drinks. While out an about we would swing by the Club for a quick glass of wine or coffee and get some small plates. It made our trip more affordable and so easy. It was also nice to have a quieter place to get a way from the city for an afternoon break. Every morning I started my day running on the pedestrian path by the beach. You can easily get a good five mile run in along the beach. The bellman were so awesome to recognize me upon leaving and returning, greeting me by name, and quick to offer me a bottle of water upon my return. You can tell the staff there are happy, well-trained in all aspects of their jobs, and really enjoy working at the Hotel Arts. After my run we'd get breakfast at the Club, make reservations, and plan our day. The concierge staff working in the Club and in the main lobby are amazing. They managed to get us premium reservations in places booked out for well over a year (like the 4 star Michelin restaurant, Lasarte, which I'm reviewing next... an over-the-top amazing experience for foodies) and local spots that we'd never have found without their help.Barcelona itself is a dynamic, vibrant tourist destination. We heard rumors that in summer it is over-crowded to the point that you can't see the sand on the beach when looking down from the top floors of the hotel. We also heard that in the The Gothic Quarter (Barri Gòtic) that the night life can be rough with aggressive prostitutes and pick-pockets. We didn't experience that, but we went in March and our evenings were spent exploring the fine cuisine and gastronomy. When we did venture out to The Gothic Quarter we were extra vigilant and careful. We had no issues whatsoever. I'll be adding reviews of the wide variety of restaurants we dined at and some of our favorite sites to see (The Market, Gaudi sites, the Black Madonna). We spent ten days exploring Barcelona and still have more on our list of sites to see for future trips. We will definitely be back to Barcelona and will stay again at the Hotel Arts!
title: Incredible place to stay in Barcelona

review: The location is fantastic, with expansive views from every window. Rooms are very modern and comfortable, and there are lot's of outdoor places to lounge and relax. We stayed in a junior suite on the Club level. The lounge is fantastic, with great food and drinks all day long. But what really impressed us was the incredible service from the concierge's. Everyone was warm and helpful, especially Anna the Club level concierge, who went out of her way to prepare us an early morning departure treat as we were departing at 4:30 am - lovely hotel, lovely staff, we can't wait to come back!
title: The Best in Barcelona

review: We highly recommend hotel D'arts. Everyone was so nice and the concierge was particularly helpful with restaurant and activity recommendations. The rooms are beautiful - clean, wonderful views. We loved the pool and the beach! We enjoyed the amenities of the hotel
title: We loved this hotel!

review: Beautiful views of the city and ocean from the room. The Club Level was a great experience with excellent food and very attentive service. Would certainly choose this hotel again when traveling to Barcelona.
title: Wonderful Stay

review: The decor and rooms at this hotel are beautiful and the reception staff were very professional but we did have a few gripes. First of all, there was no corkscrew or bottle opener in our room so we had to ring and wait for one to be brought to us. Secondly, they have disposable 'take out' cups for the coffee in the room which might seem not much of a great deal, but I prefer to drink out of china cups/mugs. My biggest 'moan' however, would have to be about the breakfast which I thought was very average. Also, after ordering cooked to order eggs and bacon, our plates were left on the side waiting to be brought to us for at least five minutes and were uncovered with two waitresses talking to each other directly over them. I suppose I should have asked for them to be cooked again (as they were cold when they got to us) but, as were in a hurry, we didn't. Overall, a nice stay (one night before a cruise) but I wouldn't stay there again.
title: Great hotel but...........

review: Arts no longer wows like it did when it opened. It remains a very good hotel. You can see the Ritz Carlton management. Prompt response to requests, upgrades, amenities. Rooms are spacious and functional. Very nice views.
title: Modern hotel with classic management

review: A wonderful hotel in Barcelona located on the water. Being on the water, it's a 5-10 minute cab ride to the Ramblas, but I personally prefer being on the water then on the Ramblas. It's also next to night life. The hotel is beautiful, and service is excellent. The concierge is great, and will help with whatever you need. Rooms are "classy refined" with either city views, ocean views , or some corner rooms which have views of both. I must single out bellhop David Alster who was really great. Breakfast is excellent, with a great selection. Only disappointments were 1) pool (though nice) is small for a hotel of this size, 2) even though the hotel is on the beach it does not have its own private beach, and 3) (a personal pet peeve) was charged €20 for one serving of ice cream with three scoops. Though I expect high prices at a hotel, (and they did adjust it at check out), that was exorbitant. I definitely recommend this hotel for anybody going to Barcelona . One last thing, we checked out the W Hotel while there, as we were curious, as we debated staying there, and we definitely recommend Hotel Arts over the W Hotel. The W Hotel though nice, is more of a party hotel, and you can go there to party when you want, no need to stay there just for that. The Hotel Arts just deliveres on everything.
title: A True 5 Star Property

review: We stayed for 3 nights at Arts Hotel with my husband. The first room we were given was not nice at all, overlooking a crowded roundabout with a lot of traffic (and noise) and the corridors were kind of dirty. The front desk proposed a new room by the end of the afternoon and it was defining worth the wait! Nothing compared to the first one with a nice view over part of the beach and sea. Service was really good even though there are a lot of trainees who sometimes are clumsy with customers. The cons of the hotel: the location (around 1.5 km from anything), the swimming pool ridiculously small with LOTS of families and children (I do not understand parents going to these kinds of hotels with children who cannot clearly and fully have fun and enjoy as facilities are clearly not adapted to them), breakfast (you can order eggs, waffles or pancakes from the kitchen but nobody tells you that) which is not a 5* one (except for the price, of course). We tried the 'Do' last year and will stop at the 'W' or Mandarin next time so we have a clear picture of the luxury hotels in Barcelona.
title: Nice luxury hotel - very good service

review: This is not what you can expect from a 5 star hotel. Very poor in all ways. It need to be refurbihed, WiFi into the price (no Wifi, you have to [pay around 5 30,= a night), no hair dryer in our room, bbad shape with stings on the furniture, holes in the leather with the window, bath-tub damaged and no hotel guide about facilties. Difficult to find restaurant and no breakfast buffet. I could not find it and it was not available. High prices for dinner and breakfast. You have to pay for everything and I ordered for breakfast smoked salmond and received bacon (not for a lower price). They did not warn me there was no salmon availabe when I ordered it.
title: Bad experience with a 5 stra hotel in Barcelona

review: Excellent hotel with very friendly and careful stuff, perfect rooms, outstanding views and very good restaurants. We stayed in club room and had a few priorities as a club reception, free wi fi and special meal time 5 times a day. The only problem that spoiled our impression from hotel was problems with luggage, we waited for it 2 hours on check in and about 30 minutes on check out. And always check your bills, mistakes could happened.
title: Excellent hotel

review: This hotel is not pretty to look at from the outside but the inside is quite nice. We were fortunate enough to not stand in line at the level one reception as we booked the Club level and were able to have lovely personalized service for check in where they served drinks with or without alcohol. The public reception served champagne. The service everywhere is impeccable although it seemed like every employee I encountered had started work in the last 2 weeks to 3 months. Thus, there were many mistakes with their answers to my questions. Yes, even at the club level. I had little confidence in our club concierge who had begun work 2 weeks ago as she did not know about a couple attractions and gave us some incorrect information which frustrated us and cost us time. The club itself is lovely with a fabulous view and delicious food as well as drink. Our room on the 30th floor had a view of the sea and the city. We loved the size of the room as well; as the appointments. The rooms were large and the storage plentiful in European standards. The fitness facility is excellent and had much more equipment options than I imagined. This hotel is well situated on the coast, next to the casino (if that means anything to you....be sure to bring ID) and available to all areas via taxi or bus. The pool was crowded, but the area poolside was lovely. The bed, by the way was very soft.
title: Club level is the way to go

review: Is it the cloudy pool water or the tremendous lack of coordination by the pool staff that makes going to the pool at Hotel Arts such an aggravation and disappointment? Probably the latter. If you want a poolside chair, then hustle up early in the morning to claim your stake or get your name put on a waiting list for a chair. But wait, you can be on the waiting list (after you've been escorted to sit in the grass some 250 yards away and down a flight of steps) and still have someone show up after you only to demand seating and be immediately accommodated. The pool staff doesn't actually check with one another before offering a poolside chair so you have to speak with the right person or you sit in the grass with a view of the baby pool. Absolutely dreadful organization. This "waiting list" situation occurred not once, but 2 out of the 3 days we went to the pool. Consider the W Barcelona or the Mandarin Oriental if you want sophistication and relaxation.As for the cleaning of the rooms, do not anticipate that your room will be cleaned before 4:00 pm if the hotel is busy. After 4:00 you can expect several phone calls asking when it would be convenient for the room to be serviced. Since we were out of the room from 10:00 am to 4:30 pm, most days, it would have been convenient during that time. Unfortunately they got around to our room at 5:00 pm when we were freshening up from being out all day, then wanted to know when we'd be leaving... really???The saving grace of this hotel are the restaurants - which are absolutely excellent. The quality of the food, the service, the enthusiasm for the wines available are world class. Each venue is wonderful in its own way. The dining made up for a multitude of aggravations over the course of 5 days.Overall a great place for families, particularly with young children (read: not for couples / adults /romance). Also great for foodies and those who appreciate being in the company of Arabic counterparts as the hotel caters significantly to both. Avoid this hotel if you want sophistication, relaxation, have an expectation of consistency (whether pool availability or room cleaning), or if you don't enjoy the smell of stale cigarette smoke in your room/towels/sheets.
title: Horrible Pool - Stay elsewhere if you want relaxation

review: Very good hotel Big hotel, very nice The service is very nice The rooms are very goodThe price is expensive The Breakfast is very goodNice localization Need to have reservation, Good pool , in front of ocean
title: Good but need to improve

review: Hotel Arts is a beautiful hotel located on the beach in Barcelona. It's location is convenient to the Metro and of course the beautfiul beach. The staff were amazingly kind and considerate. Their customer service is the best of any hotel I have ever stayed in
title: Beautiful hotel

review: Top class hotel. Great facilities for events and meetings. Very central to all requirements. Fabulous breakfast for busy schedule. Excellent gym. Rooms are spacious with great beds and space to work or just relax a little. Bathrooms are equipped. The shower with ledge to sit is great ... otherwise soak it up in the bath. In summer this must be the place for couples with everything on the beach and shops/activities nearby. If you're a foodie, book in advance to Enoteca Paco Pérez (summer months) they do lunch and dinner and will accommodate kids, to an extent. Cooler months can be easier to get in. This is in the hotel, but leased out. Great wine list for the 'wine anorak' to the 'please help me' peeps. Tough decision not to stay in hotel again on my return a few months later, but needed easier access to another part of town. Bar hoppers best you head out, but it's ok for a night cap or '1 drink while you wait' meeting spot.
title: Corporate Conference

review: Stayed a few nights last week to kick off a 10-day jaunt through Spain / Portugal. We’re Ritz-Carlton Platinum and were upgraded to a higher floor (facing the city / beach), which was appreciated. Decided against the club level upgrade since we’d be touring most of the day.In general, the hotel is beautiful but falls a little bit short of U.S. Ritz-Carlton standards. The bathrooms were lovely, sitting / bed area plenty spacious, but somewhat sparsely decorated. Definitely appreciated the well-functioning black-out shades as we were a little jet-lagged. The hotel staff was wonderful and couldn’t have been more helpful. The folks at the check-in desk were great, the concierge was very helpful, and the complimentary champagne / cold water in the lobby is always appreciated! The main issue we had with the hotel is the location. It’s located on the beach, and is far from the old town / tourist attractions. Sure, you get access to the beach, but most ppl don’t come to Barcelona for beaches. And then there’s the issue of foot traffic from the cruise ships, which isn’t always the most pleasant. We found ourselves spending a significant amount of time in transit between the hotel and other parts of town, when it would have just been easier to stay elsewhere. Overall, a perfectly lovely hotel, but be aware of its locations with regards to what you want to do, and the extra time you may need to allot for transiting between the hotel and the main tourist attractions of the city.
title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff, alright location

review: It was for us a great experience, my kids was so glad to make their fist kids check-in. The pool is small, but there is not to much people. The localization is near the beach and the olympic port. I recommand this hotel.
title: Great hotel, great plesure

review: This property has it all . We were upgraded to a superb room on he 25th floor, and had a delicious dinner at the hotel. We loved the location and were not dismayed having to take taxis to the many sites of Barcelona. What makes this Ritz stand out is the staff who are the best trained of any Ritz (South Beach take a lesson please) and go out of their way to make the guests comfortable. We plan to return before years end. Thanks to Valentine, Mijan and Lorrenzo for their gracious service; you are the reason that Ritz Carlton continues the tradition of excellence
title: A perfect stay

review: Family with 2 kids, stayed 4 nights in an Executive corner suite. Second visit. Friendly check in process with drinks offered. Large suite with lounge area. 2 queen sized beds. Good-sized bathroom with bathtub, separate shower and toilet, Room was cleaned twice daily. This is a huge hotel with a lot of guests from all over the world so it tends to be a bit busy. Especially the pool area which might be a bit small compared to the size of the hotel. It can be difficult to get a sunbed by the pool.Large breakfast buffet with pancake-station and its also possible to order eggs any style etc from the attentive staff. Great lunch-restaurant by the pool and a nice cocktail bar close to the reception area. World class spa on the 43rd floor. Top notch concierge service and we got some great restaurant recommendations.Walking distance to the beach. A ton of restaurants nearby. The hotel is first class all the way and its easy to recommend. Definitely worth a try!A good tip is to use the express check out form so you do not have to wait in line when leaving.
title: Large 5-star Ritz-Carlton hotel, beautiful views, great service

review: Once inside it's more or less your typical RC but that falls apart at night. Not sure why but the acoustics of this building are terrible you can hear the people above you as if they were wood floors and the street noise is as if there were no windows! It literally sounds as if you left the widow open even though they don't open! That aside the rest of the stay was very nice. The concierge staff is awesome! They helped me out with a last minute business issue and I can't say enough good about them. The restaurants are good although I'd stay away from Enoteca (read my review).
title: Nice interior and property but...

review: The staff make this hotel - they are all just excellent.The Rooms (ours was floor 20) have great views - we were over the marina - stunning!!Food was great and service well timed.The downside - only one it was v expensive!!Oh and the pool and spa on the top floor is a must!
title: Outstanding !!

review: Stayed because I am a Marriott member. The hotel was excellent. Location fantastic, roooms excellent, staff phenominal. Only issue is prices in the restaurants/bars in hotel are astronomical. We ate out, but absolutely loved the hotel itself. Beautiful, clean, great location.
title: Stay at Marriott/Ritz in Barcelona

review: Very convenient location during our visit, outstanding hotel, spacious room, service and restaurants in the hotel. Staff is very attending and well trained to provide excellent service. We will definitely stay there during our next visit.
title: trip to Barcelona

review: Just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona staying in the Hotel Arts. Our party comprised three generations including a twelve year old and a sixteen year old. In every respect this is a superb hotel. Wonderful facilities, welcoming, helpful and friendly staff throughout the hotel. Having spent three days exploring this beautiful city, it was bliss to come back to the pool or simply relax in one of the quiet areas. I hope to return in the not too distant future.
title: A memorable stay.

review: I had never heard of this hotel, but it is a part of the Ritz Carlton brand which summarizes the service! Service:5+ stars. From check-in to check-out staff make every effort to provide high-quality service. Staff will greet you in halls etc. Location:5 stars. On the beach. Many restaurants near. Boat tours at the doorstep. The hip on hop off bus stops outside the hotel. Metro stop is a short walk through a park. Cabs easy to get. Casino and clubs walking distance Rooms:Clean, nice amenities, good bed Tip Opt for a club room. The club is wonderful. (5 meal servings. Wine and beer snacks. Nice view. Great staff. Made our trip a true vacation. Stay here again?? Would not stay anywhere else in Barcelona!!
title: Wonderful!!!

review: Second visit to the Arts in wonderful Barcelona. We were greeted in the Club Lounge and presented to a nice upgraded room along with the room for our children. Enjoyed very much these updated rooms in the upper floors, with beautiful views of the mediterranean and Barcelona. There are six restaurants and bars to choose from, serving everything from light, informal breakfasts and lunches to exceptional Catalan cuisine. We specially enjoyed the Cafe Veranda for breakfast, with so many delicious choices from local options, to Chinese fried rice to regular crepes & pancakes. It was a fun start everyday. Nearby there are many small restaurants, not very good, but there is also a the beach area to enjoy and drink a real Sangria while watching the sunset. Ramble area is a good 10 minute walk, but the hotel has always lots of taxis and private ones for transportation. The Club Lounge is worth it, they have 5 offerings a day and its nice to unwind late in the afternoon with a nice Cava and a few local appetisers while discussing dinner plans. The staff at the Lounge is well trained and help you with reservations and options for dining and exploring the town. Recommend the rooms with Lounge Access.
title: Consistant Service & Value in Barcelona

review: At Hotel Arts in Barcelona we had a great room with a wonderful view of both the harbor and the ocean. Very service minded staff. Especially at the pool area - even if it is rather small for the hotel size - they do their outmost to service the guests. Especially Lea. A very pleasant stay. Only thing - breakfast is pricy and so is lunch at the pool restaurant. But you have many options as the hotels is placed close to many restaurants
title: Great hotel - recommendable

review: I stayed for two nights with a group in the hotel in May. We were very well treated. Rooms are lovely - huge double bed and fab bathrooms with all the comforts of home. My view was not great but the swimming pool was very nearby. The hotel is well situated - just afew minutes walk to the beach and a nice stroll to the centre of activities. Food was lovely and they cater for all types of food requirements.
title: Top Class Hotel

review: I had a two-night stay here in July 2017 (room 2704). The room itself was very nice and had a lovely view over the beach. The bed was comfortable, and the shower was OK though it seemed to veer between "freezing" and "scalding" with no discernible state in between, whatever I did to the temperature dial. Breakfast was good, and the pool area is very pleasant, albeit crowded. There was a well equipped gym, the only quibble being that the TVs on the cross-trainers did not work, and were still not working on the day I left, despite my reporting the problem on the first day. The staff in the hotel were the biggest asset, as they seemed unusually capable and friendly. Bear in mind that the location of the hotel is just by the sea, so ideal if you want to use the public beach or look out over the sea, but most restaurants and sights will be a taxi ride away. Not a problem, but just to bear in mind depending on your preferences. There is a "club" area with food and drink, though if you want this then maybe best to book a room with it built in, as to purchase access is a hefty €200 a day, and there is even a waiting list for this. Wifi is chargeable unless you have a Marriot rewards number or similar.
title: Nice Staff

review: I appreciate the attention to detail and the welcoming feeling you receive when staying at the Barcelona Arts Hotel. When I left my passports in the safe and called from the airport to pick them up, the staff had them waiting at the valet station when I arrived to expedite my returning to the airport in a timely manner.
title: Friendly attentive staff

review: We stayed here for our final two nights in Barcelona. The hotel is great, the room was over the top awesome (see pix!), the staff was friendly and helpful, especially ORIOL FREIXAS, who treated us as though we were royalty. The bed was Ritz quality, and the bathroom products were ok (Molton). We stayed in Room #3109, which has a panoramic view of all of Barcelona, including the beaches. The only "complaint" that we had was that this hotel is not in the best part of town. We tried to go off premises to have dinner, but we quickly ran back to the hotel to eat there, as the neighborhood was a bit seedy. No question we would stay here again.
title: It's a Ritz Carlton!

review: Great hotel. Excellent Location. Staff is eager to please. Rooms are gorgeous and for 3-500 Euros a night, this is a good deal. We'll look to stay here again soon, as we had an overwhelmingly positive experience
title: Excellent Experience! Good Value

review: This is a Ritz-Carlton hotel so quality is assured. I love the location which is close to the beach and marina. Not inconvenient if you want to visit the tourist sites and the hop-on-hop-off bus stops nearby (greenline). One of my all time favourite hotels. Reserve the VIP pool loungers for a spacious day in the sun.
title: Beautiful hotel

review: This place is simply amazing!!!!!! The hotel is stunning, the service is A+, and the rooms are gorgeous. Did I mention how awesome the service is?! There is always someone around to help you out, answer your questions, or to simply wish you a "buenos dias". Oh and added bonus the entire staff speaks English.
title: Love Love Love

review: This was our second stay at the Hotel Arts and it was as Great as I remember. Fantastic service and the location is Awesome. The pool area is fantastic and the overall food choices at the property are top notch.
title: Great stay at Hotel Arts

review: We are world travelers , best hotel we have ever stayed at. The concierge staff was amazing thank you carlos , Juanra ,Carmen, Blanca and Fred . the house keeping manager Sara made us feel like family, very hard to find these days. we will be back Barcelona was a great city. The entire staff and the food was just amazing Thank you all the Seijo's
title: Best stay ever

review: Easy to resume, everything was just amazing! We travel the world but this place is just the best ever in all aspect. Chapeau! Service, cleanness of the room, the hotel in general. The valet service, the employees, the concierge, everything is just wow.
title: One word.... Wow!

review: My wife and I visited Barcelona for the first time this past week and it was absolutely amazing experience staying at the Hotel Arts Barcelona. We had stunning room on the 32 floor Club Level with panoramic views of the ocean and city. We highly recommend the Club Level experience which was out of this world. One floor above us was the Club room serving meals and drinks from 7 am to 10 pm. We stayed four nights and ate 95% of all our meals (seriously) in the Club room. The staff in the Club room was First Class in service and informing us about the hotel and the local activities. The next time we travel to Barcelona we will be staying at the Hotel Arts for sure.
title: BARCELONA FIRST CLASS EXPERIENCE

review: Teetering between three and four stars, but decided to go with three. While free nights were used to stay here I still believe this hotel should be held to Ritz Carlton standards. As for location, I would not stay again in this area - though if you enjoy crowded beaches and long treks, this is your spot! Personally Gracia seemed to have less tourists with far better cuisine and shopping. Also am not sure why this is called the hotel arts as it's not particularly aesthetic (Gehry aside) nor is there one piece of art on the wall in our room. We were given a "better" room because of gold status but cannot imagine how it was different than a regular room - upsides were early check in and a partial city/ocean view. Overall the accommodations were fine yet tired - comfortable bed, generous bathroom and good housekeeping service. The hotel itself is massive and the staff is more than friendly. Some of the facilities such as the pool just aren't able to handle as many guests. Poolside drinks are $30 for a pair and take as many minutes (an exception to the rest of the city). The free internet has been spotty at best.
title: just ok

review: We really enjoyed our stay we are a family of 5 and we were able to really relax here after traveling from the states. The staff was very accommodating and kind. The food was excellent as well. We highly recommend this hotel.
title: Barcelona

review: The Hotel Arts is not only charming but it has exceptional service, food & clientele. The Hotel Arts staff truly makes you feel like you have their undecided attention and they help you create a Barcelona experience you will never forget. I also highly suggest the club level as it make eating & snacking so convenient. Apart from breath taking views, the staff on the club level took care of our every whim and desire. All in all, it was the perfect hotel and I can't wait to stay there again.
title: One of the best hotels in the world

review: Aside from a beautiful hotel, they couldn't do enough for you. I've never actually experienced anything like that before. Someone grabbed me out of line at check in to bring me to their computer. They have someone at the elevator to press the button for you or answer a question. If you ask where something is they escort you. Most of the staff are adorable young students from all over the world, working at the hotel while studying in Barcelona. Talking to them all and finding out what country they were from made it very interesting. Breakfast Buffet was amazing. Location on the beach was good. Pool are was nice.
