Wish they had their own private area on the beach as being in a public area was annoying because it was non stop vendors walking around you chanting what they were selling as in water, beer etc..Room was very nice. View was amazing with a corner view. Beds were amazing.
title: best staff ever!

review: From the moment you arrive, get in the lift up to reception and receive a champagne reception you feel very special. We were allocated a superb room (24006) and thought it was fantastic. Could not be faulted in any way whatsoever. Only two "issues" The pool is massively oversubscribed and because it is relatively small you feel it is over run by children. Also, the restaurants/room service prices are astronomical. (€27 for a burger, really??) other than that this is a top class hotel. Go ADULTS ONLY guys, this establishment is made for it!
title: Fantastic Break

review: One of my top 5 hotels. The location is great, seconds from the beautiful beaches of the Mediterranean and a short walk into downtown Barcelona. The Hotel is fantastic. Rooms were in stellar shape, the pool was perfect. Really not a single complaint about our time. Their car service picked us up promptly from the airport, and we were allowed to check in early which was great having just landed on a red eye from the US. Recommended to anyone traveling to Barcelona who wants to enjoy the best of the old city and the beach.
title: Awesome

review: Stayed here in 2006, was very disappointed. This visit was much better. Breakfast buffet very European. Rooms were great. Responsive service. Best beach location, a cab needed to get to La Rambla and shops. Will stay here again.
title: Much Better Service

review: Stayed a week in this lovely, tidy with great facilities hotel. Walked to the beach and restaurants. Our room was overlooking Barceloneta - it was magnificent! Paradise in summer ... highly recommended.
title: gran lugar in Barcelona

review: Highly recommend staying at this property everything is first rate. The rooms, on premise dinning facilities and the staff are first class. The property is in an excellent location close to the beach and major attractions. Would stay here again on my next visit.
title: Best Resort ans Spa In Barcelona

review: I stayed earlier this year in January during Torres Winery's Global Conference. Awesome location and magnificent views both facing sea in the front and the city in the back. Superb breakfast and very dedicated service. I would definitely stay again.
title: Outstanding

review: This is an excellent hotel, but with some drawbacks: (1) it's not very close to anything, other than the beach, which is a little grimy (it's a City beach), so we found ourselves walking for 10-15 minutes before hitting anything very interesting; (2) the hotel facilities are lovely, but are not commensurate to the number of rooms -- for example, the pool is v small and often was overcrowded, the lobby was often a zoo, the restaurants were packed; (3) the staff are very friendly but needed multiple follow ups before any of our requests were handled.
title: Luxury hotel with some drawbacks

review: We stayed for 6 nights at the Arts Hotel Barcelona, for a family vacation. The hotel itself is big and busy. Initially at check in we were told that our room wasn't ready and they can't guarantee a time of check in. However another room was ready with partial sea view- this was at 3 pm. When asked again how long the wait would be for our requested room ( sea view) again we were told that we could not be given a specific time. Since we were tired and were traveling with our 9 year old daughter we took the room. It was a big spacious room with beautiful views of the sea. That made our visit much more pleasant. Housekeeping were very efficient, the pool area was very crowded and noisy. For a hotel that size, the pool is extremely small!!! However service is great and staff are all very helpful. The lobby was very busy and chaotic. Overall it is a luxurious hotel,staff are very kind and go out of their way to help. We did face some wrong charges upon check out almost 800 euros extra. However that problem was fixed. So I guess the hotel needs to work on the computer system that they currently use. Overall it's a nice hotel with helpful staff and a great location and for sure would stay there again.
title: Nice hotel....gets really busy

review: we booked this hotel because on web site clearly stated welcome pack for kids treasure hunt for kids and various games also it did not have a kids club as implied on web site after various complaints the treasure hunt and welcome pack was done The staff r lovely and the club lounge was excellent the offerings of food was amazing The swimming pool is far too small for the size of the hotel not enough chairs and a waiting list to sit round the pool also if u leave your chair for more than 15 mins your things r removed the pool is on the 2nd floor the club room is on the 33rd it's impossible the arts want u to spend money round the pool for lunch and not use the club lounge which we have already paid forThere r some great hotels in Barcelona the arts is not one of them The staff are all lovely
title: Needs improvements

review: I was taking my daughter and two granddaughters on their first trip to Europe. Cruise on Mediterranean to Italy, decided to spend 3 days in lovely Barcelona first, chose and reserved two rooms, 4 beds, 2 bathrooms and sea view a year in advance. All confirmed and then reconfirmed upon arrival. One room ready, exactly what I wanted. Adjoining room was then given away while we waited for luggage! Offered apologies and then a suite. Suite had no sea view, only 2 beds only 1 full bathroom. I was supposed to sleep on a sofa bed and rollaway! We let my granddaughters use the suite, I went back to original room. Offered free cocktails with dinner and that was it. By the way is near hospital so sirens all night. Service at meals was excellent but would never use hotel again!
title: Pre cruise trip to Barcelona

review: We had three rooms for a one week stay and each rooms occupants had a wonderful experience. Rooms were impeccably clean and spacious, room service and laundry were well done. Location is very close to the beach and night life.
title: Lovely luxurious stay

review: Stayed here in 2015 and staying here again. Will not return from management to Front Desk staff it's been a poor experience. It's not the same. They keep apologizing and sending "stuff" up to the room. I need more action less "gifts." Not letting my 73-year-old mother into her room after I specifically asked the front desk intern to add her name to the room at check-in was and is unacceptable especially on a hot summer day. Management or leads do not help the situations. I would list them by name BUT I will NOT. Several situations have occurred since check-in. I am not happy. Please also note most staff are interns but I honestly think it's management issue!!! Best to all of you who decide to stay. It's really unfortunate!
title: 😱NOT 5 stars! NOT Ritz standards🤢73-year-old mom

review: Hotel Arts is dated, expensive, chaotic, and has a transient lobby full of wealthy, overweight not chic guests. Better go to Soho House or Mandarin. We booked via Amex Plat and were told we had an upgraded room. After going to the room this was not the case and when I followed up with the staff she acknowledged this was not the case. Why did she lie? There was no turn down service in the room, carpet fraying, interior decorating style of 90s airport hotel, rationing of 2 Nespresso pods per day per room, a food and beverage credit that excluded alcoholic beverages--why bother!, broken AC in gym, no availability of lounge chairs by pool until we complained and begged--this is why we had booked hotel--incidentally pool was overrun with screaming children. The second day they upgraded our room which was better and had sea view. Checkout was chaotic, bill was incorrect. Generally over priced for luxury. Puts Ritz Carlton to shame.
title: Deeply disappointing

review: Loved our stay at the Arts. From the moment you walk in until departure, everything was excellent.The service and the view were excellent. Enoteca restaurant was fabulous. But the best was the Club. Its personnel went out of their way to make you feel special.
title: The Arts, a great hotel.

review: First I would like to say the staff at this hotel is superb. They upgraded us to a room because it was our honeymoon and let me tell you this room had the most beautiful views of Barcelona and the beach! Estelle went above and beyond to make our honeymoon special! Thank you so much
title: Outstanding views

review: Great place to be if you want to have fun, next to the beach, excellent water front walk, excellent for the athletes of all kind.Food in the area is just excellent, eat sea food, its the best.Night clubs are the greatest.the hotel provides excellent concierge service, we visited some great places thanks to your concierge service.Checking in and checking out was really smooth, I was informed of the Taxi strike and arranged for us to leave earlier.
title: Paradise

review: I always try and stay at Ritz Carlton hotels but partly due to the comments of the other reviewers I only stay in club rooms with access to the lounge. Previous reviews are totally correct. This hotel needs to invest some of its income on new carpets and a deep clean of the sofa's! The decor is fine actually, typically RC and there are some nice touches such as sweets for the children. The pool area is a joke and not in a good way. Far too small and unless you get up to save beds at 8am (which I was forced to do having had nowhere to sit on the first day) you can forget about finding anywhere to sit. It was only because the sea was too dirty to let the children swim and beaches no better that we put up with the hotel pool but it's such a shame the hotel doesn't spend some money on improving this situation. There is the space for a separate club level pool in the garden areas.Everything was very expensive but I don't mind this as it keeps certain clientele at bay... I have been to more 'affordable' Ritz Carlton hotels before and it totally ruins the experience. At least most fellow guests did have a bit of class and knew how to behave. The hotel overall (or rather the club lounge/floor) rescued our trip after the disappointment of the beach and we were very impressed at the consistency of staff. Whoever is responsible from the training of the staff is doing a super job overall (although it did take 45 minutes to get a drink by the pool one time). I have rarely come across such excellent customer service and consistency of approach. On the club floor nothing is too much trouble and anything is possible. It really is impressive. If in Barcelona again (which won't happen!) I would stay here but if you're looking for more genuine luxury stick to the club level and prepare to be a little disappointed by areas of shabbiness and of course the pool.
title: Rescued by the club floor

review: We had a glass at the bar at hotel art and it was an Amazing and breathtaking experience. Lovely and very service minded staff and overall a luxury and top experience. We will definitely stay here next time. Drinks are super.
title: Had a glass at the bar

review: The hotel itself is very nice. The staff, not so much. Did not properly address our repeated complaints. And when they finally did, it was in a rude and disrespectful manner. The staff appeared to be overwhelmed and unwilling to take the time to help.
title: Passive aggressive staff

review: We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary at Hotel Arts. The entire staff was absolutely amazing. They greeted us by name and made us feel extremely welcomed. Knowing it was our anniversary, they congratulated throughout our stay and really made it special. This was a first class hotel. I read a few negative reviews and am surprised. This hotel was perfect. I travel for business weekly throughout the States and have seen the best and the worst.... this is up there with the best! The amenities, the cleanliness, the beautiful cut flowers, dinner recommendations, the gym, pool were dynamite.  I do note that it was a short cab ride to almost everything as this hotel is on the beach. For us, it was perfect. We had all the modern amenities and it was less than 6-10 euro cab ride to everything. Simply perfect hotel and location. Thanks Barcelona Arts. We will be back with our children next time.
title: First time in Spain-- Awesome Hotel

review: I stayed here for a few days with some friends. The building is huge and in a great location. The staff are helpful, friendly and welcoming. All staff I met were so polite and kind and happy to stop what the were doing to talk with you. The service from the hard working staff really was 5 star. The public areas are well maintained and luxurious. The views from the hotel are incredible the view of Barcelona really is breathtaking to wake up to!I felt let down by a few things. The pool was far too small for a hotel of this size. It was also very shallow. I stayed here with the plan of spending a few hours each day by the pool but I only spent two days by the pool as it was not what I expected at all. I pre paid for the breakfast but I feel that the choice was very limited and sometimes the scrambled eggs were cold. There was a good choice of pastries and bread but limited on hot food and cereals. I did not feel like a 5 star breakfast and was not worth what I paid for.There was also a few issues with the room. Some of the sockets did not work and there was a smell from the A/C. They were minor issues but they weren't resolved and it wasn't what I expected from a 5 star hotel at this price. The room itself felt a little dated and in need of a refurb. The phone looked at least thirty years old!Overall they were many good points to the hotel worth noting the staff really do provide an incredible 5 star service but I just felt that it wasn't worth what we paid for taking into account other options available in Barcelona.
title: Amazing staff

review: One of the greatest hotel in Barcelona, Spain and Europe. I recommend it for your journey in Barcelona (leisure or business), as long as you can afford it. Good services, great people and great city. Don't miss the Arola restaurant. Ask anything at the front desk and they can almost provide anything requested. "Neque porro quisquam est qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit..."
title: Arts Barcelona

review: We stayed here on several occasions whilst visiting my favourite city in Spain. Amenities were perfect. Excellent service and friendly, polite and respectful staff everywhere we went from the gym, to the swimming pool, breakfast etc. Handy to the beach and niteclubs are within walking distance. Magnificent night vista over the city. Highly recommended! :)
title: Superb Hotel

review: The Hotel Arts was meant to be one of the best hotels in Barcelona - but it does not live up to this hype at all.For those reading this - you will probably see all the other '5 star' reviews and think - this guy is talking nonsense. But the truth is that this Hotel gives off the air of a business hotel and a conference centre, with no soul or atmosphere. If you are a family don't go here - stay at the W. There was a queue(!!) for the lifts, and the staff did not even use their own elevator but instead used the guest lift!! Not very useful when there is a queue and nobody can get a lift-the paying customers should get priority I think??The swimming pool was as small as a fish tank. The water was as cold as the atmosphere - for a hotel with 40 floors surely there should have been a greater amount of space dedicated to a leisure area?? Furthermore - there were no changing rooms on the pool level - disappointing for a five star hotel. On the contrary when we visited the W hotel - which was cheaper (!) -we saw it had multiple panoramic pools, large and spacious enough for a luxury hotel.The food was another problem. Our first meal at the pool bar cost us upwards of 150 euros for a family of 4! The pizza was ridiculously overpriced for an oily piece of bread that would have costed 3 euros at max to make - but was sold at over 20 euros!! Just because this is a 'luxury' hotel doesn't give you a licence to rip customers off. At the W where we ended up eating in nearly every night; there was a beautiful terrace with multiple restaurants by the beach serving tasty food which wasn't horrendously priced.Credit where credit is due, a positive for the hotel arts was that the breakfast was very tasty. Plenty of choice and great quality - the spread was very good and it exceeded my expectations.The rooms were a bit outdated but the rain shower was excellent and the views were nice. The service was fine - everyone was very pleasant but when coming to deal with certain pressing issues we had, the front desk failed to respond or get back to us on time. In conclusion, this was just underwhelming. If you want to come here as a family, you will be stuck with nothing to do inside! Although it is 'close' to the city centre, so are most of the other good hotels; and this hotel simply seemed like a business facility. It isn't a hotel that wowed me or blew me away at all.
title: NOT a family resort - more like a business hotel. Not impressive.

review: So good for a cheap place, I really liked how the set up was and how we were able to go from place to place and make sure that the locaiton was legit. all of that really helped and i hope to go again so i can help.
title: Great Room

review: Staff were excellent again, room very spacious and nice, food was excellent and the bar very trendy, stayed at ritz Carlton many times and will be back againAlways helpful and willing to help so thank you
title: Fantastic family vacation

review: The hotel is located near the sea front and is pretty handy for the beach, restaurants and on the bus city tour routes. We had 2 rooms with 2 double beds, with a great sea view on the 20th and 21st floors, we asked to have the rooms near each other but the hotel couldn't accommodate. The rooms were nicely decorated and very comfortable, were very clean, with free bottled water by the beds. The toiletries provided were nice. The rooms were clean and serviced regularly. The reception area on the first floor is attractive and the concierge was very helpful with dinner recommendations.We did not eat in the hotel but used the bar in the reception area a couple of times but it was completely without atmosphere and the service was dreadful.The pool area is too small for the hotel and the sun beds are packed in around it. We were told that if we left our spot for 30 minutes our beds would be given to someone else and our belongings removed so we couldn't even leave our beds to have lunch. The outdoor restaurant by the pool was nice but a little pretentious and not good value for money.We did not have breakfast at the hotel because it was not part of our booking and was ridiculously expensive so we ate in a cafe around the corner which was fine. We had a great week in Barcelona, and despite the comments I have made enjoyed staying at the hotel. It is a good base for a week of shopping and sightseeing but not a week of sunbathing!
title: Good location

review: We stayed here for three nights around Barcelona pride. The hotel and rooms are well-designed with a modern flair. Though some of the design choices in the rooms sacrifice function and practicality. The rooftop is small but nice, and we made new friends over a bottle or two of wine up there! The staff are friendly and try to be helpful, but they need to hire a management training consultant to come in and train the staff as service was sub-par. There were a few employees who were new (maybe temp staff to handle the busy pride period?). Overall, it was a decent stay and a nice gay option to have in Barcelona.
title: Good stay overall!

review: Judging by the five stars reviews I was excited about our first stay in this hotel. As I have sleeping problems I usually asked for quiet room (away from the lift) as part of my request.Upon check in I even repeated my request and was assured it be away from the lift. Not only my room was right opposite the lift, everyday there is construction work above my room from 8:30 to 18:00. It was rediculois and the hotel wouldn't admit it has anything to do with them, apart from every time I called, the work would stop for 20 minutes or so then resume.The hotel room used to have nice slippers (I visited one of my friends who stayed there last year) but now they only provided them upon request. Apart from that, the room is clean and the atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing. The pool bar was nice but I think is a bit over priced (€12 a glass). Will I give it another shot! I probably will but if I get another noisy experience it'll be the end.
title: Underwhelming

review: From the moment I first arrived at the hotel, I knew I would have a great stay. I was warmly welcomed, and the staff recognised my Expedia status - and were able to offer me an early checkin which was appreciated.The rooms are clean and was adequately sized for me. The rooftop pool area was always kept clean, with plenty of towels on offer. I read someone else complained about the drink prices at the rooftop bar - I thought they weren't too bad, especially given the costs of running it (i.e. staffing it).An amusing aspect was seeing and speaking to people who didn't realise it was a metro-friendly hotel when booking. They first appear a little nervous and apprehensive, but you soon notice them relax and enjoy themselves. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends, gay or straight.
title: Great stay in BCN

review: My fiancé and I stayed at TWO Hotel a few days ago and the room was comfortable and quiet. Great showers with comfortable bed. If you decide to watch television, and I would hope you didn't, the channel selection is pretty good. The rooftop area is quaint and relaxing with a good bar - we really enjoyed Andres. Everyone at the front desk was great and extremely friendly. The area is awesome with tons of restaurants and great shopping. I will certainly stay here again and would recommend it.
title: Great Hotel / Amazing Service

review: The hotel is really nice and quaint. The staff is friendly and helpful. They gave us tips on where to go, how to get there, and where to eat. Hotel has a cute rooftop bar, pool area, hot tub, gym, and sauna.
title: Nice Hotel

review: Sometimes when you get to a gay hotel or a restaurant/bar you expect that rude attitude towards people. Gay people tend to mix professionalism with drama and sometimes that mixture goes wrong. In the case of Two Barcelona, things kept professional with 2 points to improve: the breakfast is fine (the fruit selection is faulty) and the maid cleaned my room after 5pm, ... despite that everything went fine. Expect those clones of all age showing off their bodies and sometimes sad grindry hornety faces: that is gay life in the 21st century, where people act much and mean very little.
title: Nice and clean gay hotel

review: We were on holiday with my mom and we both really liked this hotel! The stuff was friendly, breakfast was really good and the atmosphere was really pleasant. The pool area was amazing! The room was nicely decorated, even though it was a bit surprising that the bathroom was basically a separate shower and toilet behind a glass walls. However, we didn't mind it because it was just the two of us.
title: Friendly hotel with an amazing rooftop pool area!

review: This review written by a card-carrying (actually I lost my card) homosexual. While I'm generally not one for self-segregating into gay locations for vacations etc., I have understood the appeal of a gay-aimed hotel. There have been a few instances in my life where traveling with a same sex companion raised eyebrows ("you just want one bed?!") or bringing a gentleman back to a room for the night was an issue. I've stayed at the Axel property in Berlin and there was something nice (if a bit quaint) about just being around my queer bros there. So, that's not a bad thing.However, TwoHotel, either by initial design or reorientation (ahem), is not that. From the proliferation of reviews here saying "we didn't know it was a gay themed hotel but liked it anyway" my guess is the gay theme didn't pay off at first, and they have marketed it around Europe as a fashionable discount location. Which in fact, it is. And I must say the idea of a little sheen of gay-fabulousness as just a tourist atractiion, not as a rule for entry, is kind of appealing as we queers become more and more accepted. And so, this place seemed to be about 20% gay dudes as far as I could tell, and honestly I realized pretty quickly I couldn't tell, and it really didn't matter. I stayed during a major event at FIRA, a convention center just down the street, and while other nearby hotels were charging 200 euros/night and up, TWO was still affordable. Its location is pretty perfect for Barcelona--not trapped in the overwhelming tourist and party zone of the center, but still central, perfectly located for transit, and just a 20 euro taxi to the airport. The hotel itself is charmingly designed, with a few quirks and silly decorations that were varyingly successful. The lobby does have its nude male portraits and pink/white decor, but the rooms are understated and modern. Negatives: beds are hard as rocks, bathrooms sacrifice convenience for style, toilet is not very private (not an issue for this single traveler but a new couple might feel uncomfortable). But I never heard a peep from halls or nearby rooms, which is HYUGE. Plus, air conditioning during a stifling heat wave was good, and the rain-head shower a delight. Up on the roof is the real bonus. It's a cute, fake-grass and pink chair lounge area. Every day I'd get up and head upstairs for a stretch, some sun, and jump in what is basically a "splash" pool to cool off, and gaze out at the apartments across the street and marvel to myself at my good luck. Then I'd order a fancy gin and tonic and feel even better. The rooftop was never overcrowded and was a lovely way to meet guests from all over the world, couples from France and Russia, a group of hilarious bros from the UK. Also, straight American dudes: girls totally took their tops off up there. The little gym on the roof is barely a gym, but has a pulley machine and a bench for some basics. I prepaid for breakfast and then was so busy and late to bed I missed it all but 2 of my 7 mornings. But it was varied and good quality those two happy mornings.So again, gay dudes looking for an exclusively gay experience, I don't judge you for wanting that sometimes, I get it. But TWO is just a good stylish bargain in a great location, and feels much more in the spirit of inclusion and celebration of Barcelona. Get comfier mattresses and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.
title: Not that gay, and better for it

review: My partner and I booked this hotel without realizing we were doing so during Pride Week. We aren’t really the party type and weren’t really sure what to expect. We were apprehensive, to say the least. I can absolutely recommend this hotel without hesitation. In fact, we can’t think of anywhere else we would rather stay when visiting Barcelona. The staff were extremely kind and helpful. Special shout-out to Jaime, who has an excellent sense of humor (I’m a sucker for jokes). They upgraded our room upon check-in, so we had a nice balcony overlooking the street. This was much appreciated. The facilities were modern and clean. We really enjoyed the rooftop pool in the afternoons when it was entirely too hot to walk (or generally move) around the city. Drinks are expensive up there, but it’s expected that you pay for the convenience. FYI – you have the option to pay at the bar and not charge the drink to your room. We liked this, since we didn’t incur a huge check-out charge. There’s also a nice little community park behind the hotel with plenty of places to sit and relax. We enjoyed purveying neighborhood life here. The hotel is located a bit outside of main tourist zones, but we liked that it felt more like a local neighborhood. There’s a metro station located less than a block away that will get you anywhere in the city very quickly. Still, Plaça d'Espanya, Montjuic, and the lovely restaurants in El Poble-Sec are all a quick walk away. There are also two cafes for breakfast or afternoon drinks on the same block, as well as a couple of 24-hour supermarkets to stock up on water (or, in my case, late-night double chocolate Magnum bars). The room is huge by European standards. The bed was on the firm side. I like firm beds, so I slept like a baby the entire week we were there. Your experience may differ. Our only complaints are that the toilet and shower are enclosed by frosted glass, but are open to the room. Don’t expect to shower or do any “private business” without your partner noticing. Also, this is an energy-efficient room. You stick your hotel key into a portal by the door to turn the power on in the room. In summer, it takes a bit for the room to cool off as the A/C only kicks on when your key is in that portal. This didn’t bother us, but some people (especially Americans) like to walk into a room that is constantly cooled by air conditioning. Finally, there are recycling bins right outside the hotel. One night, the recycling trucks picked them up at 2:00 AM. Being woken up by the sound of 1,000 glass bottles shattering into the back of a truck was not a pleasant experience. Otherwise, we noticed no noise at night as the hotel sits on a quiet street. Overall, it was a really nice experience – even if you’re heterosexual. I would recommend this to anyone staying in Barcelona as the value is excellent. We will return as soon as possible!
title: Pleasantly Surprised!

review: My first compliment goes to Daniel the GM! His high level of customer/employee focus permeates the entire hotel, in all departments. The hotel is pristine! It's a hip and central location, close to L1 subway. The guest composition is diverse in every sense of the word. The employees are multilingual and always eager to help. You get bank for your buck! Great value!
title: I love Two Hotel!!!

review: This hotel is for you who are looking for a gay hotel in Barcelona and a more affordable alternative than the other Axel hotel. The hotel is stylish and clean and the receptionists are really friendly and helpful. There is for sure a gay feel to the hotel, although straight-friendly. The hotel is a little more laid back than the other Axel hotel. The roof top is nice, but normally not as busy as Axel's rooftop. The hotel is located in the Sant Antonio area - just a 10-15 minute walk from the gay neighborhood of Eixample (Gaixample).
title: Excellent straight friendly hotel

review: I stayed at the hotel for four days and it was just a very good experience.When I arrived I was welcomed personally by the hotel manager (Daniel). He ensured that I had everything I needed.My room was very modern, clean and quiet. I felt at home from the beginning and enjoyed every day on the rooftop pool and at the sauna of the hotel Axel 10 min awayThe breakfast buffet was very nice too and obviously Barcelona rocks!!Thank you Daniel and Thank you Team Axel Two to make me feel home:)Robert
title: Best Hotel

review: My wife and I just checked into this hotel last night...What a treat !!!The Axel Group Hotels is apparently for gay men...However...In their advertisement they say they are "HETERO FRIENDLY" (!!!) :)And indeed, they are !Great staff, great room, great service, great location, etc. etc, etc.Indeed, there are a few gay men staying here, but plenty of hetero couples like us.The pool on the roof is open 24 hours...LOVE it !!!!!!*HIGHLY* recommend ...
title: *FANTASTIC* !!!!!!!!!!!!!

review: Loved this hotel gorgeous interior very well located the rooms are fab and the roof top pool is great during the day if ya want to cool down after a long hot day in Barcelona but wait there's more you can use the pool anytime so at 2 in the morning and you fancy a dip you can head on up and don't worry about it being cold the pool is heated at night time! Loved every second of this hotel
title: Fab

review: Great hotel with most modern facilities ,centrally located and above all they have very friendly staff .Thanks to the hotel manager Daniel Calvo who was very helpful in sorting out an issue during my stay there.Highly recommend :)
title: Friendly staff,modern hotel

review: My husband and I stay at TWO for two nights / three days and just found it to be excellent. We total enjoyed the experience and will be sure to return again and again. TWO of course is the sister hotel of Alex Hotel, who facilities were also available to us. Two is a little quieter and maybe more relaxed, with fine rooms and showers. We live in the US and prefer walking showers, with doors that close complete. All of the hotels we stayed in in Lisbon, Porto, and San Sebastian had step in tubs with petitions that did not close, so for us it was difficult to get a great show. TWO HAS GREAT SHOWERS. If you're looking for a spa the full service spa is in Alex Hotel a short walk away, where we had the best massage ever.
title: Great Time Only Wish We Had More Time To Stay

review: I have been there end of May 2017, we had a "premium room" which are slightly bigger then standard rooms. nevertheless don't believe in the name as the most standard rooms in other hotels are much bigger. For a new Hotel it is not very up to date in room size, beds especially the mattress is very uncomfortable, very poor. I would expect more from a gay Hotel. There were no Happy Hours no Music, no entertainment at all. It's not worth it to stay there because of the name... beside from above mentioned points Hotel is ok. A big Thank you to the Hote-Staff they are always friendly and saying Hi, there was only one lady which even did't look up or said Hi to guests, all other from keepers to reception to pool bar very friendly guys.
title: Friendly Staff, Small Rooms

review: My husband & I were really excited to go to this Hotel & in terms of the location, design, facilities & the room we knew we had made the right choice. Some great little places to eat and drink around as well as the convenience of Mini Marts. The roof top pool is small and unique and obviously very busy in the sunshine. The room was lovely and clean and the balcony was great to sit out at night after a day sightseeing & dinner. The welcome at the hotel wasn’t the warmest we’ve received and we did eventually get offered a welcome drink. We were lucky the room was ready early, or so we thought, however a request to have a room away from the lifts wasn’t met & out room door was opposite the lifts….not ideal when you are a light sleeper. I appreciate requests can’t always be met but a room directly opposite the lift and next door to a noisy family with a baby wasn’t quite what we wanted and couldn’t have been any further from our request. Clearly no benefit of being an H10 member at the lower levels. The biggest let down for us was the reception staff, housekeeping were great & very friendly but the receptionist seemed as though you were interrupting them if you had a query. We had a note put through our door on the 29th June stating there would be a taxi strike on the 30th June (we weren’t worried as we were checking out & going home on the 29th) foolishly we took that as gospel and enjoy the most of our last day, only to realise the hotel had misinformed us and there were no Taxi’s available on the 29th….not ideal when I was suffering in pain with my foot/ankle. when I question the receptionist on this there was no apology or no attempt to help, just told “take the Metro”…….. Lesson learned the hard way to not trust what we are told in future and to question. Such as shame to be left with a bitter taste in our mouths after what was a wonderful visit to Barcelona. We will be back but not the this hotel.
title: Great Location....lacking customer care

review: We travelled to barcelona for a wedding last October and decided to stay in this great hotel, part of H10 (all are great!), and were delighted with the hotel. The hotel is located in the Eixample, surrounded by classy restaurants and shops and very near of Passeig de Gracia and Plaza Cataluña. Great transport links and very quiet area.We arrived early in the morning and were lucky to have our room ready, on the 5th floor overlooking the nicest courtyard I have seen in a long time. Great amenities and a very tasteful decoration, which made our stay.Breakfast is served on the Ground level and gives you the option to enjoy the sun in its courtyard terrace. Great International and national buffet breakfast selection.
title: Comfortable and great location!

review: First off, the location is great as H10 is close to everything but not in the middle of all the tourists. At the end of a day of touring, all you want is to escape from the masses (stay away from the old quarter) and enjoy a glass of wine by a pool. Ahh! H10 Art Gallery has both the location and the pool (on its rooftop). If you like art, then you have a bonus as there is a gallery in the basement with exhibition as well as permanent collection throughout the hotel. In fact, each floor is named after an artist. While all of that makes for a huge winner in Barcelona, there are a few areas that could use improvement: the carpets are worn and the rooms (at least ours) had markings on the walls from wear and tear. The pool is a great escape but be forewarned that it is shallow so no diving! Either way, you'll love the view and you can order drinks and food to enjoy your rest. There is a small training room next to the pool but we never used the exercise since we walked all day. Service is fine - not over the top - but you receive a welcome glass of cava (champagne) and cleaning is very good. Breakfast is a nice buffet and most people enjoy that. Enjoy!
title: Location + Art + Pool = Winner

review: My daughter and I were very happy staying here. We were welcomed warmly by very helpful staff in reception. The hotel is in a very good central location with good access to the Touristic tour buses ,which we booked at the hotel, red and blue routes. (Three blocks away.)It is surrounded by bars and restaurants. We enjoyed a complimentary cocktail by the shallow pool in the evening. The breakfast staff were very kind, helpful and attentive. The breakfast menu was brought to us for the cooked breakfast , and there were plenty of choices for the fresh additional continental breakfast. Our room was small and kept very clean and tidy by the housekeeping staff. It was a quiet internal room on the fifth floor and had a lovely ensuite. The wifi worked very well in our room. There was a docking station for recharging my daughters phone. The complimentary coffee is quite strong espresso in small cups. I always take a travel kettle and mugs with me however the hotel says it does supply kettles on request. Room service is prompt, and friendly. The decor was delightful and we loved the themed floors and galleries. The staff left us a note in our room to warn us in advance of taxi and airport strikes and offered to help with alternative transport to the airport, we had already booked a transfer bus and the hotel confirmed our times for us. The left luggage ,after check out, is carefully ticketed in a room near reception for security (and we had been able to leave passports and cash in our room safe during our stay to comply with our travel insurance). I would certainly stay here again.
title: A warm welcome

review: As soon as you arrive you can tell the hotel is going to be special - it is beautifully air-conditioned and even smells lovely. The check in was smooth and the artfully decorated lobby is a welcome surprise. Even the corridors are decorated artistically - just providing that special touch. The room was lovely and again really good air-conditioning. The special touches, like the toiletries provided, free bottles of water on the first night, and even a little pack of biscuits on the side when we arrived, all made it even nicer. We had a problem which the staff dealt with immediately and very well - the staff were very attentive and provided us with information for how to get to the airport and let us know when there was an issue with taxis. The rooftop pool was the real highlight of the hotel - wasn't too busy, towels were provided again by attentive staff. The pool isn't very deep but was a nice way to get out of the heat, and can see a view of the mountains through the other roofs. The location is a really good way to explore Barcelona - close to a metro station and not too far to even walk to the centre. Restaurants near by as well as little supermarkets.
title: Stylish - Sophisticated - and with a rooftop pool

review: We spent a fantastic week at this lovely hotel. The room & public areas were spotless and the staff friendly & helpful.There are so many great restaurants nearby & a little off the main tourist areas but close enough to all the attractions making this the perfect base.
title: Lovely quiet hotel perfectly placed.

review: After lots of research we finally settled on this hotel and were very happy. We decided to go for the basic double room because we were planning on not being in the hotel much and it was a perfect choice. The room had everything we needed for our stay, a comfy bed, toiletries such as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, soap, toothbrush etc, hairdryer and slippers and dressing gown. There were also towels for the room and towels for around the pool. You can even borrow an iron and ironing board which was good because my husband wanted to re-iron his shirts.The hotel had everything we could need which was perfect for our city break. There were quite a few bars, restaurants and shops in walking distance from the hotel and there was a metro station within a short walking distance. We would recommend and would stay again if we were ever to return to Barcelona.
title: Fab find

review: This hotel was typical for Europe where the rooms are rather small, the room was comfortable The staff was absolutely great and the hotel is very well-located near public transportation and the restaurant district. We spend very little time in the hotel while we are traveling so our main concerns are comfortable sleep, cleanliness and location. This hotel supplied all of that very well.
title: Great Staff and Very Well-Located

review: What a great hotel this is. We loved the area and loads of nice restaurants to eat close by. Breakfast was wonderful and the pool on the roof was great after a full day out to spend an hour or so relaxing by it before going out for our evening meal.
title: Wonderful Hotel

review: Was headed to Barcelona for a convention and decided to arrive a week ahead of time. Whenevr there's a convention in town, prices seem to be very high!!! Found this place in a great location, 3 blocks away from Passeig de Gracia, at a great price. The hotel exceeded my expectations. The decor is beautiful (chic, trendy, modern and full of art). Breakfast was very good and enjoyed sitting outside on the beautiful terrace (beautiful tree in the middle). You would never think you're in the city sitting on that terrace. The room was very comfortable, nice bathroom. However, my room was on the 2nd floor and quite noisy. People in Spain seem to go to bed at 5-6 AM! So I could hear people partying outside. I went to the front desk after trying to sleep in that room for 3 nights. They right away changed my room to an upper floor at no additional cost. Very helpful and friendly staff. Also right near the Hop on Hop off bus stop (La Pedreira) which was great! Would recommend this hotel any time.
title: Great location and decor

review: What a funky hotel!!!! If you want ordinary then don't stay at the Soho. But if you want delightful extras such as mood lighting, romantic rooms, comfortable beds, excellent reception staff and a huge superior breakfast using locally sourced fresh produce, then book at Soho with confidence. And the central location tops it off. We loved visting Barcelona and staying at Soho was the cream on the cake.
title: Just fabulous

review: Our third stay at this wonderful hotel - we had a room on the 7th floor with a big terrace facing the street. It can be a bit noisy because of the traffic but it did not bother us. Roof top terrace and the small pool are great for relaxation and some sun bathing. Breakfast concept is both modern and traditional - the new detox juices and other fruity dishes make an excellent alternative for the more traditional bacon and eggs - but really there's everything you need for a full breakfast. The staff are really friendly, service with a smile. The location is very convenient - near the city centre with undergound station just a minute away, and good bus connections. We want to come back!
title: Love this hotel

review: Absolutely fantastic staff, amazing facilities, room service, lounging areas and a completely comfortable stay. Very good value for money and would reccomend to anyone ! Bus and metro stop right outside the hotel with a 24h supermarket came in very handy
title: Amazing stay

review: Have just returned from Barcelona and staying at the hotel Soho was such a good decision. The rooms are very modern, with lovely touches such as mood lighting, complimentary safe, magnetic door signs, high quality shower, amazing air con etc. The whole hotel is scrupulously clean. The design of the hotel is cool, lots of metallic finishes and so well thought out. The staff are excellent, personally remembering your room key and number after meeting you once. There is always someone on reception, 24 hours a day. They control who comes into the hotel so you feel very safe at all times. The rooftop pool is perfect for a dip to cool off in and a very relaxing place to lie in the sun as Barcelona bustles about beneath you. It is in an excellent central location, with taxis available as you soon as step outside. I would definitely return to this hotel, it really made me and my friends' holiday so much more enjoyable.
title: Amazing hotel, modern, well designed and fantastic, attentive staff

review: Great hotel in an excellent location. Spacious trendy rooms. Very good internet connection. Within walking distance to everywhere. Staff were always very polite, knowledgable and welcoming. We would definitely stay again.
title: Highly recommended

review: My wife and I have recently returned from a 5 day stay at the Barcelona Universal and have nothing but praise for the hotel.The staff are so helpful and polite and can't do enough to make your stay more enjoyable. During check in we were informed that we had been given a free room upgrade which was a very welcoming surprise!The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff work very hard to maintain it that way. Our room was on the 8th floor and looked out on to road at the front of the hotel, and although the road was busy, the double glazed windows did an excellent job at blocking out the traffic noise. Bed linen and bathroom towels were changed daily and the air conditioning in the room was probably the best I have ever encountered in a hotel - which was a godsend as the outdoor temperature was well in to the 90s.The rooftop bar is excellent with a good selection of beers, spirits and cocktails. The bar really comes alive at night and offers some great views across the city. The rooftop pool is small but ideal for cooling off in when the daytime heat gets too much.My only criticism, and which others have already mentioned, would be the occasional smell from the drains. The smell of sewage would sometimes be in the hotels corridors and also near the rooftop bar. At times it could be quite strong, but was only encountered a couple times during our stay so didn't impact too much on our total enjoyment of the hotel.
title: Fantastic hotel

review: Went here for 3 nights on my hen do. Great location and great breakfast but unfortunately that's where the positives end! Two of the group had money stolen from their rooms and the staff at reception couldn't have cared less. Rooms regularly smelt of smoke and weed which appeared to be coming through the air con. Huge stag do took over the pool and bar and staff made no attempt to keep them quiet during the day or night when they returned home screaming at around 6am. Workmen/cleaning staff were loud and inconsiderate-particularly in the inner rooms where the window looked down on to what can only be described as a dumping ground! Heard quite a few people complain on checking out and not once were we asked if we'd enjoyed our stay. Total disappointment; wouldn't go again and wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!
title: Money stolen and rooms smelt of smoke and weed!

review: We chose this hotel for its location and roof top pool.The location was excellent,very central and easy walk to the attractions of the waterfront, La Ramblas,Catalunya Plaza and Espanya Plaza. We had a room on 7 th floor, just overlooking the rooftops around us.The room had all amenities we needed, and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious but the floor could be slippery when wet. The rooftop area was lovely, nice spots to sit and relax. We did not use the pool, we went to use it one afternoon and there was a large group of men drinking around it, taking up all the space and being very loud. That would be the only complaint I would have about our stay . The breakfast buffet was excellent.
title: Great Location,enjoyable stay

review: The location of this hotel is excellent for what we wanted the staff were lovely, nothing was to much trouble they really are a credit to the hotel. Right next to the metro station so easy to access the main sights . Will defiantly book this hotel again
title: City break

review: We stayed here for 3 nights in July 2017.Wanting to spend most of our time sight seeing, this hotel was the perfect choice:- The hotel is centrally located within seconds of a tube station.- Staff were always friendly, welcoming and helpful.- The hotel felt safe with onsite security at entrance points.- Bed and breakfast represented excellent value for money. Every day breakfast was fresh and excellent variety - including soya, almond and lacto free milks, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals and hot food.- The roof top pool and bar were immaculate.- Rooms were cleaned daily to a very high standard.- The hotel is quiet and well maintained. - We stayed in a triple room which was very ample - lots of space, plenty for 3 adults.I would most certainly recommend and would stay again.
title: Perfect location, brilliant stay

review: No disappointments from our return visit to The Universal. We stayed for three nights in a superior room at the front. Room modern, great air conditioning (needed), and all the basics. Being at the front there was some street noise, but hey, it's a busy city famous for night life. The hotel was quiet, though. Loved having a pool on the roof. Also, the roof top space is well used with seating areas and a sun bathing deck. There is a bar too. Sea, city and MontJuic views made relaxing evenings. We didn't eat our evening meals there but drinks were pretty standard hotel prices. 5Euros for a large beer 8-10Euros for a cocktail. Breakfasts were v. good; lots of choice. Personally I would have preferred 'proper' tea or coffee made and served. It came from a machine and you served yourself. But it was fine really. You pretty much got on with it at breakfast. Restaurant looks new and is a pleasant environment. The lobby and reception staff were knowledgeable and helpful. The location is ace. 10 mins to La Ramblas, Placa Reial, about 20 mins walk to see the Magic Fountains and just across the road from Metro and Funicular. We enjoyed our stay very much.
title: Second Great Stay

review: Four night stay in a superior double room. Perfect location and great value. Views from the hotel were stunning and it seemed to be the only hotel with a pool terrace on offer in the local area. It was the perfect setting to relax in the evening and included a live singer one night which was superb. Reception dealt with any queries quickly and effectively. View from the room was onto the back of the hotel and local flats, but it was not an issue and probably helped guard from any noise on the main street. The hotel restaurant named the Wolf Tavern, offered a small but great menu, especially for Vegetarians. Complimentary beer tasting and afternoon tea were nice touches. All employees were helpful and made the atmosphere great, especially on the roof terrace. It is clear the hotel manager values every guest and asks for their feedback when they return home. Looking forward to returning to the hotel again!
title: Mini trip to Barcelona

review: My husband I stayed here for a week and had a beautiful stay. It is close to the Ramblas but not too close. It's a bit of a walk to the Barri Gotic but we love walking so did not mind. The breakfasts were very filling and we often didn't eat anything again until dinner. The rooftop bar and pool are a real pleasure with amazing 360 views of the city. Very memorable stay.
title: Wonderful Hotel and a great location in Barcelona

review: We arrived at the hotel after a very long delayed flight from Singapore so it was nice to be greeted and served by lovely, helpful staff who showed us where all the main attractions where on a map and gave us heaps of information. Visited the pool which was nice and seemed to be popular. Great sangria's from the pool bar- nice staff. Our room was lovely and was big, especially as we were 2 women travelling and needed twin beds, and we were able to make tea & coffee. A must for us and not found in most of the hotels on our Europe trip. The hotel was within walking distance of La Rambla and other attractions. Breakfast was wonderful catering for everyone. Highly recommend
title: A great place to stay

review: Have travelled quite extensively through Europe, so comparing apples with apples the room was slightly underwhelming for the price we paid as it had no natural light and was quite pokey. Awkward layout with both the bed & bathroom.Positive things were nice rooftop pool with 360 degree view, location is good with metro literally outside front door.About 10 minutes walk to las rambla.Also 24 hr small convenience store next to hotel.The service on check in was excellent.Ok if you just want a bed to rest your head at night but if it's a special occasion or you looking for something slightly more luxurious recommend keep looking.
title: 3 nights in Barcelona

review: Nice place! Good location. Cool rooftop pool and views. Good food from restaurant. Friendly helpful staff. Train station is right in front of hotel for convenience. Near lots good bars and restaurants as well.
title: Nice place! Good location. Cool rooftop pool and views.

review: stayed here for 4 nights (23.07.17) for my son's 18th and we got a large family room (702) which was a good size, 2 doubles and really large bathroom. Hotel is in a good location and you can stroll into La Ramblas, beach front in no time. We were out and about most of the time but did find time to chill at the roof top pool one afternoon and we used the roof top bar early evening which was comfortable, good views. Breakfasts were very good with loads of choice and even though it was really busy it didn't have a canteen feel about it. The bar staff were friendly and the receptionists were great especially as there was a taxi strike on the day we left and she gave us correct and precise directions to get a bus which we appreciated. I would recommend this Hotel and be aware that you pay E100 deposit (or is that just the Brits?)
title: Fab trip to Barcelona

review: Stayed here for 2 nights (Friday & Saturday), the hotel was in a good location. Welcomed by a friendly receptionist - be aware you have to leave a 100Euro deposit on arrival (for Bar purchases etc). As we were a party of 3 ladies, we had a triple room. The room was large and very clean, although we could hear our neighbours so not sure how soundproof the rooms are. It didnt really bother us as we literally only slept in the room. There wasn't much in the way of natural light, again not really something that bothered us. We didn't pay the 15Euro for breakfast, instead choose to visit local cafes, much more reasonably priced. We used the rooftop pool and bar, the cocktails were great as was the snack food.Would highly recommend this hotel as it is in a great location for exploring the beautiful Barcelona, the rooms were comfortable and the staff really helpful.
title: Good location, good value

review: Traveling with our 15year old boy we got the most perfect hotel room ever! Very nice suite!! Our son has his own apartment with a nice big bed. We have a nice huge bathroom and a nice balcony outside!! Just perfect! This hotel has a very nice bar on the roof with pool and sun chairs all over! We did not have time to use it in daytime,but used it every night after coming home after all exiting things to do at the day in town! The neighborhood is nice. You live close to nice breakfast places and also the tapas street 'Carrer de blei '!!
title: Veldig bra!

review: First of all what hit us square in the face upon entering was how hot and stuffy the lobby was. It would have been nice to have been greeted with a cool reception area when it was so hot outside. They very nicely secured our luggage until our rooms were ready, There is a very nice lookout from the top floor. The metro is right outside the front door - that's a plus. However, this did not appear to be best part of town to me. Upon returning after some sightseeing, we were able to get into our room. It was HOT! It would not cool down, so they moved us to another room that was cooler. The rooms themselves are adequate for a short stay. The next morning we asked if they would comp breakfast for the inconvenience of having to switch rooms. Which they did. The breakfast/bar in the basement was a nice cool temp. and had an array of things to select from. I liked the contemporary decor throughout the hotel. It felt very clean.
title: Some things were OK, but would not stay here again.

review: We stayed here for one night before our cruise. Traveled with a tween, so needed a triple room, and we were very happy with the size of the room and the amenities. Checkin in was easy, and our room was ready early. We had a corner with large windows and a street view with lots of natural light, but good light blocking curtains for sleeping. Road noise was not really an issue for us. Separate bathroom and large foyer was very nice. A problem with wifi in the room was fixed quickly upon request. We enjoyed the pool area all afternoon and had a nice snack in the evening downstairs in the restaurant. Wait staff were very nice and accommodating :) We were thrilled with the pool and rooftop terrace/bar area. The breakfast the next morning was fantastic!! Tons of fresh fruits, eggs, breads, charcuterie, cheeses, etc. Something for everyone~ even mimosas! We will definitely recommend to traveling friends~
title: Very happy with BUH

review: My husband and I had been doing some traveling prior to our stay at this hotel. Once we got to our room, we felt like we were returning to the comforts of home. The bed had a full mattress, with no splits. The decor was modern and super clean. The bathroom had a tub and lovely tile. The air conditioning worked well. Highly recommend.
title: Staying at this hotel, was a feeling of coming home...

review: Perfect location wise for a first time visitor to Barcelona. Right next to the metro station, plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, walking distance to the main areas too.We had a suite on the top floor which was superb, apart from getting woken up at 7am by staff cleaning the rooftop pool area. The breakfast was simply stunning. Highly recommend staying here.
title: Great base in Barcelona

review: Location, staff, room and the breakfast were great!Recommend to everybody!Beach is 20-30 mins. Shops and restaurants are around the corner.Even a Lidl is near. Pool is very small, but who cares if there is a great beach!
title: Great Hotel

review: Barcelona Universal hotel is a well equipped hotel located in the center of Barcelona just a few yards from Metro station Parallel. The staff is very service orientated and they were keen on making sure you as a customer feel very welcome.I can highly recommend Universal. We had rented two privileged rooms.
title: Splendid hotel in center of Barcelona

review: I booked and paid in advance for a superior room, which was rather more expensive than the standard room. However on check in we were given a standard room, these rooms do not have windows and I was aware of this which is why I booked the more expensive room. On alerting the reception staff we were given another room next the lift on another floor. The hotel is not well sound proofed and we heard people coming and going in and out of the lift all night for 5 nights. The hotel had allowed a large group of British men to book a large number of rooms at the hotel. They took over the pool and bar area and had no respect for other guests and some were staying on our floor and very loud. This was the last stop for us after an 11 week trip and we were looking forward to sitting by the pool which we were not comfortable in doing. We were required to pay a 100 euro bond on our debit card which we were told would be refunded on check out. At checkout we were told this refund would take 30 days. We stayed in 21 hotels throughout Europe and this was the only hotel that took a security bond. Reception staff were condensing and not very approachable. On the positive the breakfast was very good and the location very central.
title: Disappointing

review: We stayed here for 3 nights March/April and the hotel was perfect. A great location right next to the metro but also within walking distance of La Rambles and the main harbour. Hotel staff are all very friendly, the bar and restaurant are both good and reasonably priced. We didn't get to use the roof top pool as it wasn't that hot but the roof terrace has great views and I am sure from May onwards the pool would be great. Highly recommend this hotel if you are doing a short break to Barcelona.
title: Anniversary Stay

review: We booked this hotel fairly late notice at a great price for the location. We were very happy with the service and room etc. The rooftop pool and bar were excellent for early morning swims too. Will return again here for my 5th time in Barcelona. Thanks
title: 1 night stay

review: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for a wonderful 4 nights/5 days. We had a fantastic view of Barcelona rooftops (we could even see the Sagrada Familia and other tourist sites from our window!). The breakfast was plentiful and varied; it definitely suited my vegan daughter (with two choices of plant-based milk: oat and soya) as well as my meat-eater self. The gym, swimming pool and fresh fruit cocktails on the roof certainly provided a relaxing end to the days where we trekked around a very warm Barcelona city. Speaking of the city, the location of the hotel is perfect. Not too close to Las Ramblas, La Boqueria etc. so it wasn't too noisy or crowded. Nearby Montjuic too. The Paral-lel metro station is right outside the hotel lobby; which provides great access to every possible area you would wish to visit. (N.b. many people spend extra money on transport from the airport but we found, using the Hola transport card, the metro was an apropos, and cheaper, form of transport from the terminals)Can't recommend this hotel, and Barcelona, high enough. We wish to return soon.
title: Fantastic Stay in Beautiful Barcelona!

review: Me my Mum and my daughter stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was a handy location, by local transport, sights and shops/bars/restaurants The staff were friendly and helpful Our room was lovely, spacious and clean. There was always plenty of clean towels. In the bathroom toiletries and a hairdryer was provided. The breakfast was plentiful and yummy as was was the food we tasted from the restaurant and bar The upstairs roof top terrace with bar and pool was a lovely space and we ended up spending a lot more time there than originally planned, although only a small pool a lovely extra for a city hotel On checking in and checking out the hotel staff allowed us to check our bags into their luggage room so we could enjoy every moment of our holiday Had a lovely holiday and would definitely book into this hotel again if we re-visit Barcelona
title: Lovely hotel and stay

review: We were made to feel welcome at this hotel from we arrived till we left. Everything was to a high standard and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are great, quiet and well equipped, with a safe and a kettle, nice decor and a good cleaning service. We had a view of the beautiful green Mount Juic and from the roof terasse we enjoyed the views of the whole area. It was so pleasant and relaxing to spend time up there in the evenings with nice staff and a great selection of drinks, also non alcoholic, and snacks. The breakfast room is lovely and the breakfast is excellent with everything you can imagine. The hotel even provides you with a cup of tea or coffee in the lobby before you leave for the airport. We felt safe and very well treated at this hotel and would love to come back.
title: Fabulous hotel

review: Very good hotel. We had room on 7th floor with great panoramic view. Hotel right next to metro and funicular. Latter links with cable cars up to the fort. Easy walk to gothic area. (Great cocktail bar just behind hotel-Confectier)Clean rooms. Excellent breakfast. Small roof pool, enough for a cool down dip, with plenty of deck chairs,fresh towels and a good bar. Friendly staff. Good location for all main sites. Would happily stay here again
title: City break

review: Having read a few reviews on here and when fellow tripadvisors read my review, it will become clear that this hotel is definitely one for personal opinion....I was there for the past 7 days with a mixed group of friends for my birthday and also my niece's 30th. I go away on most birthdays and am regularly treated to an upgrade or some kind of special treatment/offer. We booked privilege rooms as that was the best available at the time of booking in May and these were located on the 8th floor, opposite side to the road.First impression of the hotel on arrival was not great as we walked into a very small 'warm' lobby...bearing in mind it was over 30c outside, the check in staff replied and said the AC is set to a reasonable temperature, we checked in sweating. However the staff were friendly, so let's not get that mistaken - I again asked if there is any special treats for birthday's and I was offered a bottle of Cava (which I did not take in the end). Upon getting out of the lift on the 8th floor and heading to our rooms, the corridor had a terrible odour. Someone on here mentions how good the AC was in the rooms, all 3 rooms we had, the AC did not go below 19c and we even had a maintenance guy come up to have a look, so not quite sure what happened there.Rooms were not amazing, we all said that if their privilege rooms are like that, what are the standard ones like? For Barcelona (our first time there), I understand the rooms are not too bad, again down to personal opinion...Corridors can be very noisy, soundproofing would go very far....did not get a good nights sleep as some kind of construction seemed to be taking place outside.Also be very careful with the wifi, which can be temperamental and seems to log you out automatically, we were using Youtube to stream music not realising that half the time our phones switched back to 4G, which after a week is a lot, so we are expecting heavy bills over our usual UK monthly allowed data usage. Let's not be totally negative and move to the roof top bar & pool....Looks great on pictures but in reality the pool is tiny and I only went in it once and that was 8.30am. Daytime you can forget about it unless you enjoy being in a small crowded/tight space, with a group of drunk English lads (yes I am English myself)....The corridor by the bar had a terrible smell of sewage that never seemed to disappear. The Gym is a bit of a joke 7 small and the roof top terrace very bland....again in pictures it all looks good.The biggest positive I will take with me upon leaving the hotel is a couple of the staff there, Augustine at the rooftop bar but the one who stood out a million miles was a barman called Nico....'He is the man!!'...once we got chatting to him, he made us so welcome and advised on great places to visit for food/drink etc and believe me he knows his stuff! His service is second to none too and always with a smile!Hotel food is above average and if you get the corner sofa's on the roof top terrace with a group of friends, you will definitely make the most playing music, chatting and drinking away...albeit the roof top is small overall.Intriguing hotel but truth be known, I don't see myself coming back there again for a long time if ever.
title: Did not live up to the expectation!

review: SKIP OVER this property and look somewhere else. I'll start this review by saying we have traveled all over North America and this is our 3rd trip to Europe. We always travel to 4 to 5 countries for as many weeks. So depending on location, season and certainly our budget we have stayed in large, small 3, 4 and 5 star properties, even in a hostel( which was more superior to this hotel)! So in fairness, we have experienced many levels of quality and service with each property. In my view, THIS IS a 3 star hotel at best!! The booking site AGODA had completely dropped the ball by not communicating our special request that "it was our 30th anniversary and we would appreciate any special consideration ". Upon checking in, they had no record of it!! When we mentioned it, no one even acknowledged or said congratulations. I do recognize that we booked a "standard" room but what we got (#201) was the absolute worse room a hotel can offer. This hotel and its parent company NN Group should be ashamed to market a room like this to its guests. The room had a small "frosted" window which you can't see through (never seen that before!!) It opened to a courtyard with full of construction junk and noise. The room is small and dilapidated(see pics). After complaining, the front desk person, said " Oh, I know 201. I'll move you". Apparently it was a room with some history! Then they moved us "one floor up" to a room that had a normal window at least! It opened however to the balconies of a run down residential neighborhood that looked liked it was in a war zone (see pics)!! The noise insulation is nonexistent. You can hear every shower, flush and step of any adjoining room. The A/C has no thermostat function so you either freeze or have to turn it off manually to moderate the room temperature. The bathroom had mold and mildew all around the tub. At our checkout, I asked a manager to look at the bathroom so at least he can do something about it!! I WILL certainly share my observations with their corporate offices. The hotel certainly tainted our impression of Barcelona and was not the stay we had envisioned by a long shot!
title: 3 star hotel at best!

review: We were supposed to stay at the Paral-el Hotel but they were having problems with their plumbing systems so we were upgraded and directed to their sister hotel the Barcelona Universal which was approx 200 metres from the Paral-el. This hotel was on the main road and quite impressive. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and we had help with our suitcases to our room. The room was very large and airy and quiet, the bathroom a decent size and the beds were extremely comfortable.The restaurant was more like a bistro - the menu was not very large but the food was very tasty and I would recommend the steaks, the best I have had in a long time. The service was quick and the staff very helpful.I would most certainly recommend this hotel and if I go to Barcelona I would book at this hotel again.
title: 1st Class Hotel.

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: We spent one night in this hotel. It is really beautiful. Room was nice and well furnished with style. Breakfast was good with plenty of choices.There is free wi-fi and it works well.It is around 20 min. away from airport by taxi.Unfortunately they were not helpful in granting an early check-in when we reached. They said check-in is at 3pm which is really too late.One issue we had with the AC, all the sudden lots of dust came out on the floor but we didn't inform them. It was only one night and we were out most of the time.
title: Nice hotel and good location

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: The staffs at the coffee shop in breakfast is very friendly , ESP the receptionists !!And SOO THANKFUL FOR THEM THAT THEY HAD PICKED UP & return a PRECIOUS RINGS TO ME !!!! After I check out THX SOOO MUCH !!
title: HONEST & NICE HOTEL ！！

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: Beautiful hotel, well equipped rooms. Very clean. The hotel is in a great location - close to activities but the room itself was very peaceful. We would definitely stay here again. Wifi service was poor to mediocre.
title: Excellent hotel

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: The services at this hotel were impeccable, from housecleaning to concierge, everyone was superbly helpful. The room was conformable, quiet and well arranged. Extra luxuries, like robes, slippers and every possible toiletry item was available. Water, tea and coffee were free on the top tray in the room. A separate closet area was a smart touch. It kept the room from looking cluttered. Breakfast was abundant in its choices and superbly fresh. There were meats, cheeses, eggs of every style, sandwiches, pancakes waffles...custom juices and a variety of cereals, yogurt and fruit. I'm sure something is missing, it was quite the cornucopia! The hotel was centrally located, which made it very easy to get to any point of interest by the Garcia metro station or by cab. By the way, cabs are much cheaper in Spain than in the USA. Don't hesitate to treat yourself if you're going to a tricky location.
title: Contemporary, clean and friendly

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: Really enjoyed our 2 night stay at the hotel. Clean and comfortable, and the rooftop bar and pool were amazing, with incredible reviews. Great location too. Definitely recommended. The only reason I didn't give it 5/5 was the service - no specific issues, but it wasn't special. I'd definitely go back though!
title: Lovely hotel, excellent location

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: We absolutely loved our 3-night stay at NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderón in Barcelona. Lovely, clean, quiet and comfortable room. Spacious bathroom with nice amenities. Quick elevators. Excellent free WiFi. Wonderful breakfast buffet (optional at additional cost - we included breakfast in our booking). Over-the-top service, especially the concierge and the hotel manager. Excellent restaurant for dinner, too (Don Giovanni).The highlight of outstanding concierge service was solving a complicated baggage problem, when on short notice, we needed to send two 50 lb. suitcases to our next hotel in Madrid. The concierge found a suitable courier service at a reasonable cost, arranged for pick-up, and took our suitcases under the hotel's care until the courier accepted them for shipment. The next time we saw the suitcases was in our hotel room in Madrid. The concierge also helped us with directions, gave us good restaurant recommendations, and provided a decent map to guide us while we toured the city on foot.The hotel manager inquired several times about how we were enjoying our stay, and even wrote a personal note thanking us for our patronage. Service from his staff was totally professional.The breakfast buffet was a joy! Extensive offerings of all sorts of meats, cheeses, breads and pastries, jams and jellies, sushi, eggs cooked to order, sandwiches, fruits, coffees, loose-leaf teas, cold beverages including juices, and even a smoothie bar. Great service, too, as you sit with the plates you filled from the buffet, then servers bring your drinks and any hot foods you ordered (like the freshly cooked omelets we enjoyed). Bring your appetite to breakfast, eat heartily, and you may not need to eat again until dinner!This hotel is very conveniently located very near Catalunya Plaza and thereby the northern end of La Rambla. It's about a 20 minute walk from the hotel via La Rambla to the waterfront where Columbus Monument is situated. If you fancy great tapas, the hotel is only a minute's walk to Ciudad Condal, (reviewed separately as well).If you are looking for top quality accommodations, great service, and convenient location, you definitely should consider NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderón as one of Barcelona's best.
title: Fabulous Stay

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel: very friendly and customer oriented front office & concierge staff, lovely junior suite (yet bathroom was somewhat small compared to the size of the room), great location, sumptuous breakfast, roof top swimming pool - it all really worked for us
title: Great stay

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: Great, revamped hotel in good location and excellent value for money. Room was huge with seperate lounge. Nice sized bathroom but just a shower and no bath. Room was quiet, free wifi. Decent breakfast, well worth a visit
title: Great value for money

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: Modern and stylish city centre - conveniently located- hotel with well equipped good sized rooms.The rooftop bar and pool are particular attractions, with pretty much 360 degree views of the city (although drinks a tad pricey).
title: Great roof top bar

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: We picked the NH as we have stayed at NH hotels before. We had a great hotel room with two balconies. Not sure about the other rooms but ours had wooden flooring and not carpets. As I prefer wooden flooring it was a big bonus for us. Location wise we had the best part of the city with great tapas bars, food market and walking distance to train stations. Staff was very friendly and everything was not too much when we needed something. Loads of taxis was outside so that it was not an issue to get to the airport.
title: Wonderful hotel, Fab location

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: Stayed in room 412. Own balcony. Clean and comfortable. Quiet. Hotel location is perfect. Good tapas etc. restaurants just steps away. Friendly staff. Breakfast buffet was terrific. Gym and rooftop pool sufficient enough.
title: July 2017

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
