review: The hotel is very nice. Stuff is amazing and always ready to help. Will solve any kind of problem very quickly. Breakfast is served from 7.00-11.00 so you will definitely manage. I strongly recommend this hotel. Only positive emotions and memories
title: 1 night experience

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: Rooms nice all well appointed, comfortable beds. Valet car parking was good.Safe was very high, I'm 182cm and could barely reach it Breakfast was quite good. Reception staff let down the hotel experience, not really good enough.
title: Nice hotel, central location

hotelName: NH Collection Barcelona Gran Hotel Calderon
review: Hotel: Fantastic!Really nice interior, nice welcoming reception with friendly and helpful staff. Free Wifi was great. Free welcome Cocktail at Hotel bar. Rooms were nice. The top floor is absolutely amazing! There is a pool and a bar on the Roof where You can chill out and enjoy a view over the whole of Barcelona. It's amazing! Location: Fantastic! It is about a 3-5 Minute walk from the Place de Catalunya, the central of Barcelona. You are right near the Ramblas, the gothic quarter and surrounded by bars and Shops. Even the Tourist bus and bus to the Airport is infront of your door!
title: Perfect

hotelLocation: Calle Roger de Lluria 28, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Good location, and affordable price. But the staff where really nonchalant. When we arrived the portier insisted to carry the bags up to the room, we travveled very light and i said "no thank its ok" but he insisted so i said "ok". But when we got up he left the bags in the room and refused to go without some tip/cash! He just stood there in the room. Thats very rude and unprofessional, and the welcome was not the best. During the stay the staff barely said "hello" or just looked down. Very unfriendly staff made the hole hotelexperience a low rating! No thanks. The room where clean and nice though.
title: Ok hotel but i would concider stay again.

hotelLocation: Calle Roger de Lluria 28, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Absolutely loved this hotel's location, the friendly staff and wonderful breakfasts. The rooms are large by European standards and the balcony is a nice touch. We asked for a late check out and they were only too happy to assist. At this price point I think this hotel is hard to beat.
title: Perfect location for this Barcelona gem

hotelLocation: Calle Roger de Lluria 28, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: The staff of this hotel was hugely helpful, kind and respectful. I was there with a group and the team accommodated us and helped us every step of the way. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! No complaints whatsoever.
title: Great Location Excellent Stafff

hotelLocation: Calle Roger de Lluria 28, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: Our experience with the Roger De Lluria was generally consistent with the positive reviews on tripadvisor. As my wife, our two adult daughters and I were going to be in Barcelona for only one night, I wanted a convenient location in the heart of Barcelona. I was already familiar with the area, having previously stayed multiple times in a nearby hotel. This time I wanted a somewhat more elegant place and the Roger De Lluria seemed to fit the bill. I booked two double rooms for a Sunday night and requested twin beds, high floor and facing the street. On the Friday before our scheduled arrival, we decided to arrive a day early. My daughter called the hotel and asked if there was availability the next day. The answer was no, but a few minutes later the desk clerk (Hakim) called back to say they could provide two rooms for the first night, although he warned they would be smaller and not as well located as the rooms we would have the second night. Unfortunately, the price would be the same as for the better and bigger rooms (200 Euros per room per night), but Hakim said he would include breakfast for the first morning. Therefore, even before our arrival, we had a sample of the friendly and helpful service provided by the hotel's staff. And after our arrival, there were other examples. I had parked my car a couple of streets away (see why below) and asked if it was ok to leave it there until our departure early Monday morning. The bellman said it should be, but went on to tell me I could park from 10 pm that night until Monday morning on Roger De Lluria. He recommended that I move my car at 10 so it would be right in front of the hotel from Saturday night until our departure. Great advice!The rooms we had were nicely furnished and the second night they were quite spacious and had balconies. The rooms we had the first night (103 and 403) had very spacious bathrooms, but the rooms were really single rooms in a corner of the hotel (i.e., with no view) with a double bed pushed into a corner (with one side against a wall). As they were provided in response to our last minute change of plans, we could not complain. There was no obvious place to temporarily park my car in front of the hotel to unload our luggage or even to stop it long enough to run into the hotel to ask about that. So, anyone driving to the hotel should ask in advance what to do with their car when checking in.
title: Pleasant

review: The hotel really is a good base for exploring Barcelona. The rooms are small but I doubt you will spend much time there with all of Barcelona at your feet. I love that the hotel owners are so community minded; they donate the profits from one hotel to charity and they offer discounts for neighbors whose family are visiting. The hotel also has a discount card for restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. I love it!
title: Good budget hotel with Community-minded owners

review: From BCN took the Aerobus and it's 8 mins walk even with our wheeled luggage- no problem. Take the La Rambla then right to after the church and it's in the left of Carme Street. Close to everything, sites, grocery, restaurants, hop-on hop off, shops, street shops, ATM, tourist info. All walking distance. We stayed overnight for pre-cruise. No problem with taxi, they can even hail for you at the front of its door. Taxi cost 13 plus tip. Breakfast is filling, staff were nice and can speak English, room looks newly painted and most of all the bathroom was clean, shower was warm. It's a small room by US standard but it's comfortable and clean and safe. This is a hidden gem- for the price we paid it's really 5 star.
title: Absolutely recommended

review: A great location just off La Rambla. The rooms were small. Our double room had the bed against two walls with a small gap to walk around. The lift is noisy and can be loud if your room is close to it.Overall a disappointing hotel, the best feature being the friendly and helpful reception staff.
title: Noisy and small

review: Hotel Curious is located just west of La Rambla (lots of people walking), the main north to south touristy thoroughfare in Barcelona. The hotel offers a great breakfast with lots of juices and coffee options. The balcony we had overlooked the street the hotel sits on and noise was not a problem at night - the balcony doors were nice and kept the sound on the outside. The room was nice and modern. My only complaint is that we could feel the springs in the bed. Despite this, we had a surprisingly good night's sleep each night. I especially liked the light switches by each side of the bed that could turn on/off the whole room's lighting and also would control a table side lamp - very nice and thoughtful. The staff was helpful and friendly.
title: Convenient, Friendly and Great Value

review: We stayed at Hotel Curious for 5 nights. The staff were welcoming and friendly , and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was very small but your in Barcelona so we were hardly in it. It was furnished well and clean. The breakfast had enough choice for us and we even had the choice of an early breakfast on the day of our departure.The hotel is in a great location being just off Les Rambles . I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again when we return to Barcelona .
title: Great stay

review: The hotel was in perfect walking distance of La Rambla, Plaça Catalunya and provided easy access to transport services to get across the whole of Barcelona. All the staff were very friendly, and someone was on the reception desk 24hours so that only hotel guests could enter or leave the hotel, making you feel very safe. Our room was a decent size for the time we spent in it, the towels were changed and the beds were made every day. The shower was also one of the best we have had! Breakfast was fresh and available each morning from 8am, there was plenty of choice and was perfect before a busy day of sightseeing in the city. It was also very helpful that we could leave our suitcases in the hotel after checking out before our flight home later in the day. It was perfect for our 3 night stay! Gracias,Kitty y Nina :)
title: Ideal hotel for our trip!

hotelLocation: Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes, 700, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
review: I love this place on one side but on the other, I really disliked it. POSITIVES: Location is really good. We booked a room ($1,000 for 3 nights) with a private terrace that was nice, the terrace was large and you could easily have a small party there if you wanted to invite over some friends. I liked the tiled floors in our room and that it also had a little living room, so the space felt like a junior suite. Room had a safe and a nice mini bar, and good space for hanging clothes and shelves for laying out your stuff. That was good. There was a shower on the terrace (not private but still nice). The bed was soft and very comfortable. Loved the pillows. Super hair dryer so leave yours at home. I liked the reception staff so much and the large lounge space downstairs (green room) was super for chilling out and hopping on wifi. The coffee shop downstairs (Satan's) had excellent coffee and donuts. The roof was my favorite spot; I loved it up there lounging on the sofas looking out over the city…NEGATIVES: Hotel is very loud on the weekends (Friday and Saturday night) and turns into a party space since they have a DJ downstairs - loud music until 3 or 4am. Had multiple occasions when drunk guests tried to get into our room between 2-4am, maybe I would have felt safer with my husband but I was with another girl and I didn’t feel safe. I went to bed around 12:30 each night but couldn't sleep until 3 or 4 because of all of the doors slamming, screaming, party noise and our doorknob being rattled a lot. I wasn't in the city to party so I think I stayed at the wrong hotel, maybe if you come to party this place would be perfect. Bathroom was tiny, shower and toilet in a small closet and the sink out in the hallway. If you like more space and privacy in a bathroom, this isn't your place. The service was terrible in the green lounge room downstairs (but to be fair, great on the roof). Cleaning staff was good, but they left our terrace door open after cleaning once and with a lot of expensive things in our room, we didn't appreciate coming back to the room with our terrace door open (we always locked the terrace intentionally before leaving each day). No A/C in the rooms and no windows, so it gets very hot in the room because opening the terrace doors would not have felt safe with all of the rowdy guests around us. I’m not sure who was in the room next to us, but they kept screaming and hitting the walls and singing loudly, it was ridiculous, I tried to call reception but no one answered. The walls are paper-thin so you'll need earplugs if you are a light sleeper.OVERALL: To be fair, it’s a nice property with many good points but I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, because for the price, you can definitely get a much better, safer, and more luxurious hotel in the city. For a first time stay for an extended weekend, it was okay. I've stayed at hotels all over the world, so maybe I'm also just more particular than the average traveler who isn't on the road each month... Overall, it was fine but sort of hyped up according to the reviews I’ve read.
title: Mixed Feelings...

review: Pros. Extremely well-placed, being right smack in the middle of Passeig De Gracia, where the metro, luxury and high street shops, and amazing tapas bars, restaurants are in abundance. Room was comfortable and spacious, toilet was clean and modern. Cleaning staff was warm, friendly and helpful.Cons.Long wait to check in and out, no clear queue system, people are just standing around fighting for attention of the staff.Staff at reception seemed irritated when we made a request for an extra dental kit (since only 1 set was provided in the room) and pillow. Even before checking with the relevant personnel, he told us that he won't be able to provide pillows. Period. But didn't bother asking how else he's able to help etc. But an overall decent experience.
title: Great location, lukewarm service.

review: Notes: Patric was extremely helpful. You must pay in full upon check in. Warm reception area upstairs with treats since we arrived before check-in. Service was impeccable. Be aware that the A/C in our street view room couldn't keep up and/or possibly because it is controlled from the hotel, they wouldn't bump it up. But they brought us a very quiet portable room A/C which worked great throughout our stay. The hotel photos on this site show the top floor (there aren't other balcony rooms and some have no windows at all) so know what you're booking. Location is AMAZING. It's like Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills. Read the fine print about booking with breakfast included. It is good but you don't want to be locked into a $30 euro breakfast every day as the selections would get stale after 1 meal there and you must eat before 10am. Also you can always eat there for $10 euros daily and I understand you could order omelettes specially made for you. The only complaint is the room was so modern and minimalistic that they didn't have major conveniences like drawers, towel bars or counter space!? The nightstand has a large lamp so you can barely use the surface. We had a street facing room and blackout shade was 100% and windows blocked ALL noise. Two of Gaudi's works are within 3 blocks of the hotel. One is next door. Safe area. Taxis everywhere. Stupid humid all day in the summer mid-80's. Terrace bar had 360 views and great drink but food is sub par for the cost so eat somewhere else. Bottom line, this hotel and everyone who worked there gave impeccable service, despite the language barrier. They were very patient and genuinely wanted to help me with my bad Spanish.
title: Great Location

review: We decided to give the Hotel Royal a try in this visit to Barcelona, fortunately we were gratefully surprised by its wonderful service at reception and the fact that we were given an upgrade in all the 3 bedrooms we had reserved. The rooms were nicely decorated, confortable and Climatized. Complimentary bottled water and Nexpresso coffee was availabe in all our rooms. I slept very comfartably that night.The hotel is exceptionaly well located on the paseo de Gracia just a Block away from the Hotel Majestic were we have stayed before but its cost is only 1/3 and the rooms rooms are very similar if no better.The breakfast which was included in our rate could be improved. Also the elevators got slow during breakfast and Checkout time. I will return and recommend the Hotel Royal
title: One Excellent night in Barcelona with Room upgrades and a great location- Great value

review: We stayed here 3 nights as part of a trip to Spain. We stayed in a comfort room, which was small, but fine for just 2 of us. Breakfast in the morning was good, with plenty of selection. Also recommend the roof top bar, lovely views of Barcelona. All the staff were helpful.Aircon was only on in the room when you were in the room, which meant our room was hot when we go back in. Not ideal when it is 30+ degree outside and you just want to be somewhere cool. Also, we were on the 7th floor, but could hear people talking outside quite loudly. We think it must of been from the bar. It was also quite expensive for what you got. I have stayed in nicer hotels for much less.
title: Okay

review: Vam tastar el menú desgustació a la terrassa de l'hotel i va ser una experiència magnífica. El cambrers van ser motl simpàtics i atents. El menjar boníssim i les vistes espectaculars. Segur que repetirem aquesta experiència a la nostra ciutat! We tasted several tapas on the hotel's terrace and it was a great experience. The waiters were friendly and attentive. Great food and spectacular view of Barcelona. Surely we will repeat this experience in our city!
title: Excel·lent vetllada / Nice evening

review: Very nice hotel in good/safe area rooms were nice and clean/comfy. If you like being in the action with all the best shopping and nice restaurants, this hotel fits the bill. Staff was friendly and helpful and they have onsite parking. We arrived early and they were able to check us into one room early and had complimentary coffee and breakfast for us while we waited. They were helpful with a map and showed us all the sites to see and where to go and eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.
title: family vacation to Barcelona

review: My friend and i stayed here from 26th-29th July 2017 and found the hotel staff very helpful. Our room was just a comfort one but was very clean and adequate for a base for our sightseeing around Barcelona.Possibly another mirror ( full length) would be helpful in the bedroom , especially for two ladies trying to put on their makeup!!!The breakfast was excellent and we enjoyed sitting outside on the sunny terrace every morning.The roof top terrace bar is great for a relaxing drink in the evening so all in all i we were impressed.
title: Excellent Location and good value for money

review: We spent one night at this hotel prior to a cruise and from the moment we arrived, all the staff were great, helpful and couldn't do enough for us. We were offered an upgrade and, when that room wouldn't open due to an issue with the lock, we were given an even better room with great views of Passeig de Gracia and a terrace. The rooftop bar is amazing, although smoking is allowed up there so stay upwind of any smokers. The breakfast is good, with everything you'd need and again super friendly, efficient staff.Checkout was quick and they ordered us a taxi for transportation to the cruise port.We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Barcelona.
title: Fabulous hotel, great staff

review: Great location and excellent service.The breakfast is good.Only the bar on the roof is little bit expensive.The city bustour (Red, hop on hop off bus) is stopping front of the hotel.I will return and recommend the Hotel Royal
title: Great location and excellent service

review: Location is perfect. Breakfast so satisfied. Clean. Helpfull staff. Just next to La Pedrera. El Nacional and Plaza Catalunya is so close.For touristic and business so good place.Has it's own garden. So big. And at the top there is a terrace bar which is popular for local people too.
title: Good

review: A very nice hotel in a great location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Best of all is the roof terrace cocktail bar. Do not miss out on a late evening drink and check out the views! They also have a great range of tapas and other bar snacks at competitive prices (although Barcelona is not a cheap place!)
title: 1st class hotel

review: Perfect location for everything that you need. Great room. Would have loved to check out the bar. Too jet lagged. Next to Gaudi home. Stroll to Gothic area and marina. Cheap taxis to everywhere.That's about it. Staff very friendly and helpful added to experience
title: A1 location

review: Stayed there for 3 days 2 night, the room was very clean and staff were very friendly. Location was great as if you want to do some sightseeing there is a bus stop right across the street from the hotel for the open top bus tour. The tour takes you to most of the major sightseeing places in Barcelona. Although this is not a big hotel but the rooms are still spacious. We got a coupon for 2 free drinks upon check in, we visited the bar on our last night...the bar could over see the most famous architecture of gaudi the La Sagrada Familia, the view is very nice from the rooftop bar. I recommend this hotel for couples, friends and families to stay and remember to go to their rooftop bar for the night view of Barcelona ! you will be amazed !!!!!!!!
title: Amazing location and nice room

review: We stayed here for 3 nights to explore Barcelona before embarking on a cruise. The hotel is in a great location perfect for sightseeing and local transport such as metro and bus.The hotel is well designed and our room was great with a garden view. The reception staff are very welcoming and Marc particularly wanted to know how we rated our stay and welcomed all feedback.Particularly enjoyed breakfast and visiting the roof terrace bar with great views over the city at night time.Many thanks for an enjoyable stay.
title: Great location and excellent service.

review: Well what can I say, after an amazing 2 week trip staying in a lovely villa in the mountains of Tarragona and traveling the historical coast visiting towns like L'Ampolla, Reus and Tortosa. The trip was for my fiance's birthday and we wanted to end the trip with a short city stay in Barcelona. We booked one night at this hotel on the last night of our trip, our flight was at 10pm the next evening and we were drawn by the good reviews and complimentary late check out giving us the opportunity to have a late night out enjoying the nightlife while still being able to rest until 2pm before check out. We arrived at 5pm via taxi after dropping our rental car at the airport. We were greeted by the worst arrival I have ever experienced at a supposedly 4* hotel. Our greeting by Mr Feran [--] consisted of a very cold reception, charging our card on arrival leaving €2 to pay on departure which was the city tax (very strange), on asking why we were told "maybe you are not used to this class of hotel" (at €180 per night I have stayed in many hotels which demand double or triple this price and we have also stayed in many hotels which were less expensive but much nicer service/standards), he then proceeded to try to joke around with us that the payment was being made off my fiances card insinuating I was being cheap or needed her to pay for it (its a joint American Express account which we have separate cards for in both our names respectively), he also tried to joke with us that we had gone for the cheaper option with no breakfast included (we arranged to meet another couple we know who live in Barcelona for lunch and planned to have a late night out enjoying the night life so didn't see the need to include a breakfast which we would not be eating). All in all it was the worst check in experience we have ever experienced. Mainly down to one staff member Feran [--] who tried to humiliate us personally and our stay at this decidedly average hotel. We may dress casually but, I run a web design company and employ 8 people and my fiance works as a junior financial advisor so we both earn very good money. Never judge a book by its cover. We had planned to get tapas and a bottle of champagne on the amazing looking roof terrace but after this welcome we couldn't wait to leave. We found THE MOST AMAZING Tapas restaurant/bar called Vivo which was a 5 minute walk from the hotel and after reading the reviews of the tapas at the hotel I'm glad in a way that Feran was such a terrible host and put us off eating at the hotel. Wow what a meal at Vivo, and the champagne service was amazing very highly recommended. Anyway, back to the hotel. The room was average. It had been nicely done but had a sterile chain hotel feel. The room we stayed in was the Superior Room which had no fresh air because it was a glass wall with no open-able window which was a little strange and made the room very stuffy even with air con at the lowest setting of 19 degrees. As we left to go out for the evening I requested Feran to write his full name on a piece of paper for the purpose of this review to which he first refused, I then requested his manager to which he wrote the name (at no point did he ask if there was a problem he could help with or if we were comfortable in our stay, which is what I expected him to do and maybe rectify the problem and apologize for his behavior) instead he aggressively wrote the name and passed it to me then stared at us as we left the hotel through the front doors and carried on staring us down as we walked off down the road (very strange). We stayed out partying till 4am and arrived back to the room to neither of our cards working in our room doors so had to go back to reception and get them to re-do our room cards.We set an alarm for 8am to call reception and request our late check out as we had been advised. When we called we were told this was not available as the hotel was "fully booked" (bearing in mind it was a Monday night out of tourist season so I wonder when the heavily advertised late check out would be available if not then). We decided to stay in bed till midday as we planned to and to check out at 1pm anyway instead of 2pm as we had planned originally according to their heavily advertised complimentary late check out. It was one of the main reasons we had booked the hotel so we could make the most of the short stay and famous nightlife. We were harassed from 12:05pm with phone call after phone call from reception threatening us with extra charges and to come to the room and take our bags out. We checked out at 1pm an hour before we originally planned. What a stay. And what a strange, terrible and dishonest hotel.Thanks,Christopher Ribeiro-Barwick.
title: Worst welcome, misleading late check-out, no window, pre charge on card.

review: We really enjoyed our stay here. Positives. Food, cleanliness, location, staff lovely.Negatives. A bit disorganised, but the hotel is still very newly opened. Staff forgot drinks at pool after we ordered on quite a few occasions. I received some skewer when I sat by the pool. Thinking they were complimentary as is usual in this calibre of hotel. I then realised no one else had them I pointed this out to the staff who snatched them away quickly. Wrong person whoops! We visited the spa to book treatments 3 times but no one was at the desk. There's no where near enough beds on the terrace we had to sit on chairs while others took more than one. There should be a reservation system or list as when one comes free everyone rushes to get one.
title: Lovely hotel. Got a few little things to polish off!

review: Loved our stay. Room was quiet and beautifully appointed. We also thought that the size of room and bathroom were larger and more luxurious than other hotels we had stayed at in Europe. Staff very welcoming and were very helpful... Location was incredible, within walking distance of most things, yet out of the hustle and bustle of las Ramblas. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and family !!!
title: very chic and tastefully decorated hotel

review: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for a week at the end of June to the beginning of July. We were extremely excited and it's safe to say we weren't disappointed.The staff were absolutely amazing from the moment we pulled up outside in our taxi. Extremely helpful from carrying all of our bags to the concierge giving amazing recommendations and advice about all things Barcelona. Peggy and Dennis were especially helpful.The rooms were extremely comfortable and had everything you need from USB ports, to remote controlled blinds to amazing bathroom facilities. The architecture of this hotel was incredible and the huge light well in the centre of the hotel just makes this hotel stand out even more.The rooftop pool doesn't have many sun loungers or beds but even if you don't get a bed, you can easily still sit there and enjoy the all day beaming sun. And if you do get a bed, it's delightful and very peaceful. The food and breakfast is expensive compared to other places but you certainly get what you pay for!All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone I speak to. Family, friends or strangers. I'd also 100% stay here again if I'm ever visiting Barcelona again. Thank you for an amazing stay, The One!
title: Best hotel in Barcelona

review: - high class and warm welcome- excellent service- nice building- beautiful rooms- perfect location/ position to start a trip through the amazing city center of BCN- amazing infinity pool and roof top bar (only negative point: The services at the roof top bar were not as excellent as they were within the other parts of the hotel) - we will come back for sure!!!
title: Amazing stay

review: The One Barcelona is a fantastic hotel located in central Barcelona near several of the Gaudi houses. I stayed here for only one day with several members of my family, but I think we all would have much enjoyed an extended trip at this beautiful place. Needless to say, I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. The staff was lovely, both at the hotel and the restaurant. The rooms were large and airy. It is located next to a fantastic bakery that I highly recommend. This hotel exceeded all of our expectations and we thank you for the lovely stay and service.
title: Brilliant hotel

review: I could not fault one thing about this hotel. The service and detail was second to none and the concierge was exceptional, recommending the best restaurants and making reservations for you. The room was spotless and decorated beautifully. The location is perfect. Would definitely return if I came back to Barcelona.
title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in

review: This hotel is new and perfectly located with a beautiful terrace (and a good resting area with a pool)the staff is attentiveThe rooms (i tried a superior/suite room) are very well equipped with nice furniture and flat screen TV. The bed is excellentThe design of such room is somehow confusing as the bathroom is located in the entrance which provokes a strange sensation to say the least.....the breakfast was nice, but some improvement should be made concerning the choices and fresh juices should be served (not canned juices as I was served)All in all an excellent value for the money.
title: Excellent hotel.. maybe some questions concerning the design of some rooms and breakfast could be improved.

review: We arrived in the early hours to be greeted by a very friendly member of the concierge who was efficient and helpful and quickly showed us to our room. We slept very well and the bed was heavenly! After we had attended a business meeting the following morning, we spent the afternoon relaxing by the pool on the roof terrace, with drink service to our sun beds. Simply stunning views over the city, will not disappoint!
title: Beautiful luxury hotel

review: The location was fantastic, with cute little cafes nearby and shopping right at your door step. The rooms were very well appointed and it was easily recognisable that there was a high level of sophistication and attention to detail. I absolutely loved the gold/brassy decor and velvet that flooded the hotel! It was amazing how the windows in your room opened up, like a balcony. The bed was super large and comfy. The bathroom was all dark and glitzy, with an excellent rainfall shower.The staff were incredible also. I will definitely be returning! xx
title: Beautiful property, amazing staff with incredible attention to detail

review: Possibly one of my favourite hotels to date... I could compare this to a boutique hotel... only for size.. the staff and knowledge of the concierge are second to none... breakfast although for some was inadequate , was for us perfect... not over facing..I love the al a carte aspect of this... and could not fault.. yes it's expensive.. but what you get for your money is justified In The area!!... if you are willing to pay for a 5 star hotel then expect nothing less than the service and facilities you receive... for relatively new hotel the experience is seamless and well worth its 5 star rating.. the rooms are beautiful,the linen immaculate and cleanliness superb...if you like the finer things in life please stay here, location is fantastic and staff are helpful to say the least!...
title: Fantastic

review: We spent three amazing nights at The One Barcelona. From the check-in that was absolutely flawless to the food and the rooftop pool and bar, we could not have asked for more! The bellmen are absolutely great, with a genuine hospitality oriented attitude and extraordinary professionalism. The room was comfortable and classy beyond words. The bathroom is gigantic with great amenities. The bed is incredibly comfortable and they add a special touch by bringing you the number of bottles of water that you need, which is always appreciated with a 30+ degree temperature. The spa and the pool are great, while the gym, albeit small, is well equipped. The only minor dislike I had was with the pool/rooftop restaurant staff as I felt they were not at par with the rest of the hotel. The hotel is walking distance to La Pedrera and Casa Batlò. My friend and I like to walk and we had no problem walking from the hotel to the port or La Sagrada Familia. There are plenty of restaurants around and it's a very safe neighborhood. I would highly recommend to stay at this magnificent property, you will not regret it as it is worth every penny!
title: Outstanding Hotel & Amazing Service

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Super nice hotel with restaurant, roof top pool in a great location - walkable to all - if you like walking. Great accommodating staff, but the room was not super clean - there were dust bunnies. (Not a big deal). It was a very enjoyable stay - although I wasn't too fond of the set up - separate Bath room and Shower - but didn't have much privacy. My friend stayed with me for 2 nights out of the 7 nights I reserved - was a bit awkward. Our room had 2 twin beds - not sure how the bigger rooms are configured. The value was great though - I would stay again - if I were traveling solo the whole time.
title: Very Cute Themed Hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Good value for money hotel in a great location. Rooms were clean and staff friendly. Nice large walk in shower. Location was great, in between Urgell and Universitat metro stations. Aerobus from airport drops off a few blocks from hotel.
title: Great Value

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Centrally located hotel in the Eixample area. First time I stayed here and was very happy with the experience. Quite small rooms, but didn't mind that as they were very functional. Very modern design. A nice pool area and gym.
title: Great option in central Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Nice and clean hotel woth good location. Aircondition was very effective, luckily temperature was adjustable in the room.. Pool was quite small, but nice to have. Great breakfast and service. Nice cafeterias nearby with also vegetarian options. Also just around the corner of the airport bus stop
title: Great location, nice rooms

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Perfect location close to everything to blocks from Aerobus stop, comfortable and very friendly staff. I'm sure I'll stay there in my next trip to Barcelona. I didn't try breakfast because I'd rather have it outside and there are many nice places very close to the hotel.
title: Nice hotel in Barcelona

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: During an unplanned stay in Barcelona after my flight was delayed and my luggage was lost, I made a late night booking at Hotel Vueling.Much to my surprise, the staff at check-in was pleasantly helpful and accommodating and the check-in process was relatively quick.To my further surprise, the room was relatively spacious, the bathroom split (toilet in one stall, shower in another), and the shower staff was exceptionally large.They offered a small amenity kit, a minibar for purchase, room service until 11pm (23:00), Sat TV with 6 dozen channels, and excellent climate control.Though my room faced the street (Gran Via), it was still relatively quiet.The beds were reasonably comfortable with sufficient pillow choices.And, the location is excellent -- cafes and restaurants within a short walking distance, 24hr small market across the street for late night snacks or drinks, and 5mins walk to the metro station, which can take you to other parts of the city within a few minutes.My stay was so pleasant, in fact, that I decided to stay a second night while I awaited my luggage to arrive from another city.
title: Unexpectedly Positive Surprise

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Convenient location, friendly staff, clean rooms and good room service. Staff are keen to provide you with any advise you ask. I have one comment about the room design itself: The toilte is kept separate from the wash basin and shower room, which I found it inconvenient
title: Brilliant choice

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Staff are so rude and the man on reception is very aggressive. If you ask any on the reception staff for anything they say that they don't understand English. Which is not true. Would not return. Only positive is the location.
title: Staff ruin this hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel was unique, helpful, fun, and wonderfully located near the university stop. Our balcony was located on the building's front on a busy street but the room was amazingly quiet with doors closed. The walking time to Placa Catalunya was a 10 minute stroll. Upon departure, the Aerobus was a five minute walk to catch for transport to the airport (30 minute drive). Loved this hotel!
title: First Time Barcelona Visitor

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Hotel very clean and located next to a metro. Staff friendly rooms spacious. Curtains black out like so sleep was brilliant as no light in room and our room was so, so quiet! Had no complaints. Pool was tiny but did not affect our stay just a late dip before a shower and out on town! A great venue and good location!
title: Barcelona trip

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: I absolutely recommend this hotel. Very great location. The staff was helpful and kind. There were only two cons: The leaking pipe (small leak) waas fixed only two days after we reported it. And the houskeepers kept taking our key that we left so the air conditioning would work while we were away. But overall it was a pleasant stay.
title: Recommed

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: Modern and clean room - great sleep! Thankful for the double window/doors for the balcony as it prevented us from hearing much of the noise from the street. We decided to eat breakfast on the 2nd morning - well done. Staff we very friendly and helpful. Great location as well with parking available in a garage close by.
title: Great 2-night stay

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: It is a simple, straightforward and small hotel if you want a nice room in a good spot.Very good location (30mins taxi from the airport) and in easy walking distance of the Gothic Quarter. A couple of metro stops are close by giving easy access to the Sagrada Familia or the beaches.The pool is tiny and at the back of the building, but it is refreshing on a hot day. The gym is also tiny with a couple of good apparatus, it is handy for a quick workout.Attention to some small details let the overall experience down a little - they didn't refill in room coffee sachets, no in-room tea making or safe in one room. But I wasn't overly disappointedI'd still recommend it for a short, good value stay.
title: Nice and easy hotel

hotelLocation: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 550, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
review: The people working at this hotel couldn't be more friendly. They love families! The breakfast is really good, good healthy vegan options. The rooms are really clean and modern. The location is very good as well and the metro is really nearby. They have a really small outdoor swimming pool, which is great for small children or a refreshing break. I love this hotel!
title: Very friendly and they love families!

review: Very nice and new hotel in the centre of the city. Clean rooms with new furniture and nice decoration. Amazing terrace with a pool and a stunning city view on the hotel roof top! Kind and helpful staff
title: Descent , clean & nice hotel in the city centre

review: As a family of 4, we booked a Familiar room, which is essentially two separate rooms accessible through one door. This was the perfect set up for a family with a 16 and 12 year old. The kids had their own ensuite bathroom and separate beds, keeping everyone happy! The rooms are quite sparse, with minimal decoration, essentially a bed, desk and wardrobe. As an environmentally friendly hotel, there weren't any bath products available, no face towels or tissues. However, it is in a very good location, just a short walk to Las Ramblas (the main street) and to the port. The hotel also offers a buffet breakfast of €12 per person which was quite reasonable, with a good selection of foods available.
title: Good location, decent sized rooms

review: Stayed two nights in Barcelona before our cruise. This Hotel is just minutes away from Las Ramblas. Many restaurants in neighborhood s well grocery stores. Andante is a very safe, clean and highly functioning hotel. Staff is fantastic. Very friendly and speak many languages. If you are looking for a clean and nice hotel near Las Ramblas and cruise port this is it!! Highly recommend.
title: Great Hotel

review: Very nice hotel w friendly front desk staff. Hip and modern although the hallways may be a bit morbid (dark and grey). Nice location although some of the surrounding streets were not exactly posh. Rooms were bright. Elevator kinda slow.
title: Hip and modern

review: Really friendly reception guy greeted us when we arrived late at night and was really chatty the next night too when we saw him.. The rooms were very modern and well set out. I found the bed uncomfortable but my friend thought the beds were good (I do struggle to be fair)The location was great, a quick walk to maremagasin, placa trial, Rambla, the beach... to name a few. The pool is more of a cooling down pool, not a swimming pool so if you are wanting a pool type holiday, this isn't for you. If you want a fab city break and a quick dip in a pool to cool down, with great views, then it's perfect..The price was really reasonable tooAll in all, I'd definitely stay there again!
title: Modern, quiet, quirky and great location

review: The room itself was nice and the front desk staff were good but the hotel lets itself down in a few areas. First off, have free water for people in the lobby instead of just ice. Fridges in the room would be nice. Also rooms on the first floor get a lot of noise from the electric doors downstairs. Gym was a bit of a joke, not much happening there. Upstairs area view is beautiful but very small. Parents let their kids loose and the pool is off limits because they've invaded the small pool. So overall an ok hotel but just lacks a lot of niceties that most other hotels have.
title: Ok place

review: We arrived in the evening and received a warm and friendly welcome which set the tone for our stay. Our room was modern, clean and a good size. Breakfast was fantastic and everything that you can want to set you up for the day ahead. All the staff we encountered were friendly and welcoming especially the guys at breakfast and on reception. If we returned to Barcelona I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Andante again.
title: Fantastic Hotel

review: Myself and four friends stayed at the Andante hotel July 2017 for 10 nights and I have to say it was pretty average - besides from the view of the pool deck. For 10 nights it cost us over £1000 for one room and the facilities in the room were very average. The hotel is very clean and the rooms were cleaned daily by some lovely ladies. No fridge or kettle is provided and the rooms themselves are very small. We were advised on the website that this was a 18-30 hotel, however was greeted by a flock of children which is not a problem, but as a group of young adults who were on a more adult holiday - we felt aware that children were around us. The hotel has very basic facilities, only vending machines and a breakfast room. The gym in the basement is pretty awful and minimalist and most of the gym equipment squeaks on movement. However, the saving grace to this hotel is the pool deck - simply amazing! We were all shocked on seeing the view for the first time. It's simply breath-taking. The pool is, again, very small and filled with salt water - but very refreshing after a long day walking. The gentleman on the front were very pleasant - special mention to Jorge who assisted me when my door broke. On the whole, it is a nice hotel but I wouldn't rush back or rave about it to friends.
title: Average

review: Our family stayed here in June 2017 in a family room. Just overnight as we were heading off on a cruise the next day.The rooms were modern and ar conditioned, clean and comfortable.Easy walking distance to las Ramblas.Also within a few minutes walk of the metro, which we used the next morning to visit Sagrada Familia.The buffet breakfast did not have a huge variety but was good for us given our early morning start - the quality of what was offered was good.For the price, a good choice for us.
title: Overnight Stay Before a Cruise

review: We stayed for 4 nights in a family suite on the 7th floor. Our teenagers loved the modern vibe and pool. The pool does however get busy when the sun is out. Great location just off las ramblas and walking distance to the beach. Loved Güell Tapas restaurant 5 min walk, torres liquor store also on Calle nou de la rambla and Carre four express across the road. Great breakfast, well run hotel. Great value.
title: Modern, eco friendly, great pool.

review: Just Wow, wasn't to sure what I was going to expect booking a Ibis as plenty of mix reviews. I guess staying at a Ibis Style added that little more for a two star. We stayed for 3 nights mid July 2017Easy to find and was well located in the centre of Barcelona, in fact couple of minutes walk from Metro and 10 mins to the luxury shops.Check in was fast and efficient and while this was being done greeted with cold water and a chocolate croissant which I've never had from some four stars hotels!! Nice touch after travelling in 29c and higher on the metro.Book direct on their site and ask for top floor which we were given room 706 that had a lovely street view. Didn't hear any street noise what so ever and I am a light sleeper.Room was small which you would except from Ibis anyone moaning on here saying rooms are to small it's a two star hotel get a grip! The room bright very clean bed was again more comfy then some 3/4 stars hotels. Bathroom spotless.We had breakfast which was included in the price, the area was bright and clean, it was continental breakfast which did us fine normal type food, and was always topped up.The management team have done a excellent job.Definitely will stay here again and Ibis styles in the future.So if on a budget and want a great few days in Barcelona then this hotel is the one for you.
title: Wow excellent hotel!

review: This hotel was recommended based on my previous experience with IBIS hotels. I was very impressed with the decor, and friendliness of the staff. Pleas know that I would stay here again if I am ever back
title: Happy customer who would stay at this hotel again. I really enjoyed everything about it.

review: Loved the hotel - really cool and funky design. Room was immaculate - very clean and well laid out. Good wardrobe space and nice bathroom with fab little funky toiletries. Nice to have a balcony although view wasn't great. Would also have liked a proper door on the bathroom - as a couple you don't want to hear your partner on the toilet. Breakfast was ok - adequate but could maybe be a little better? Good location - easy to walk to most key attractions in Barcelona - all in all we had a great stay!
title: Really cool hotel!

review: Great service and location. Cristina and Maria were very helpful and attended to our smallest needs. The Sagrada Familia was visible from our balcony on which Maria managed to install two chairs and a small table. Highly recommend this hotel!
title: Excellent stay

review: Friendly, flexible service from smiley staff. Comfortable rooms. Great location and good value for money. My teenage daughter and I and our friends had a wonderful experience. Modern furniture set in a beautiful building.
title: Barcelona in 7 Days

review: It's a lovely and friendly hotel that is not too far from the city. The city center is walking in walking distance and everything else can be walked to for those who don't mind investigating the city on foot. The metro is also not too far from the hotel.Staff is helpful and ready to help.
title: Lovely hotel

review: We had not stayed at any of the Room Mate Hotels when in Barcelona as we most often rent an apartment for a longer stay. We were only there for a fly through and boy did we love Carla. The staff were all excellent, accommodating, knowledgeable, etc. The room funky but comfy and quiet with great amenities (loved the bath products) and breakfast in the morning was enough to keep us going all day before flying out again. WILL return for sure.
title: Location, comfort, quiet, congenial, and breakfast - all great

review: Wonderful hotel with many personal touches that made us feel at home. Stayed here 8 nights in July and we really enjoyed it. Comfy bed. Great shower. Super breakfast. Location is good - not in the center of the tourist districts, but all within walking distance or a short bus ride. We definitely would recommend this hotel and the Room Mate chain.
title: Feels like home

review: I absolutely loved this hotel, and I'm very hard to please! The beds are nice and comfy. And the rooms were spacious light and pretty. The only downside is that we payed for a room with two single beds. At arrival the staff said they only had rooms with a double bed left. If we wanted two single beds we had to pay to be upgraded to another type of room with a balcony. I felt like it was bad service. From our balcony we could look down to see La sagrada familia.
title: Very nice, clean, modern rooms

review: A great place to stay in a fantastic location. Staff are really helpful (special mention for Christina at reception who was very helpful and patient in sorting out some tickets on-line and giving lots of useful advice for places to visit and routes around the city )Breakfast was excellent and well worth paying for as an extra when you arrive - cheaper to pay at the hotel.There were only small niggles with the rooms - the twin room had loads of space and a fantastic walk-in wet room but there was no light? Reported to reception but not fixed during our stay. The second room was on the 7th floor and was a double but was noticeably smaller. There was a very strong smell of drains or something similar in the room which was made worse when the air conditioning was on? The smell was present on the last couple of days on the 7th floor in general and not just in the room. The smell was less noticeable with the air-con off and the window left open. The shower was over the bath which was very slow to drain away and the cleaner started leaving the plug out of the bath. Spotlessly clean room everyday Neither issue would stop us returning as the staff are great, the building is really funky and it is in a great location with some good local bars within 5 minutes walk for great food and drink.The hotel has a luggage room which we were able to use on our last day which was free of charge and left us able to explore more of the great city before our evening flight. Definitely worth every penny and recommended.
title: Short Break

review: Very nice hotel with good location. Clean and good design, very conformable bad. Breakfast was reach and very good. Thanks for frendly staff on reception for all help and advice. Every day room was cleaned very well.
title: Recommend

review: Stayed here for a short city break having never been to Barcelona before. A great quieter location with fab rooms and a nice breakfast buffet. Staff are very attentive and knowledgeable about the city! Especially massive thank you to Cristina for helping book tickets and giving lots of great suggestions for places to visit! A wonderful hotel that cannot be missed :)
title: Fabulous! :)

review: Really nice hotel, amazing decor we had a balcony view which you could see the Sagrada Famila and it was also very modern and clean. Security at the door which is a nice touch. Staff are helpful (Cristina in particular) and friendly. Beds and pillows are super comfy. Bathroom is a little strange (sink is separate from the bathroom). The only downfall is the breakfast, the options are brilliant if you like cake and cheese,peppers and cold meats but we didn't. There was virtually no fruit or hot options so that wasn't our favourite at all. Other than that I enjoyed our stay here very much.
title: Lovely hotel

review: Remarkable entrance, warm friendly staff and wonderfully transformed palatial bedrooms with very high ceilings, smack bang where it all happens. Couldn't ask for anymore than that- wished we had longer!
title: Palatial foyer with eclectic bedrooms

review: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The decor/design was beyond gorgeous, the people were friendly, the free coffee and warm croissants every morning were insane. The location was perfect as well, since we toured in every directions from the hotel. We were in a large room for 3 people and had ample room. Just loved this hotel!!
title: Miss staying here!!

review: Great location, just a short walk away from Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. Triple room was very clean and spacious. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Loved the fresh croissants every morning!
title: Great stay in Barcelona!

review: We had a lovely stay at Praktik Rambla, only sorry we stayed for just one night. The staff were very friendly and helpful, everything was in perfect order. And the place is just so beautiful. The offer of colourful ice lollies at check in was a sweet touch and made us feel a little like in a Wes Anderson movie. Very central.
title: Ice lollies and curlie wurlies

review: The front desk staff made me feel welcome and helped guide me with directions in the area. Anything I needed, the staff were very helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The room was exceptionally clean. Great shower! I loved my morning chocolate croissant and amazing coffee on the outdoor patio every morning. I left an ID and charge card in the safe, and the cleaning staff contacted the front desk who contacted me. The documents are now safely back in my country. I will recommend the Hotel Praktik to all my friends and colleagues.
title: I loved the Hotel Praktik...

review: Barcelona is a cool city, Praktik is a cool no fuss hotel. I'd really recommend staying here - the rooms are perfectly appointed and the bathrooms are really nice. I enjoyed my stay and slept really well. The italian restaurant right next door is great for a quick bite to eat too.
title: Great Location

review: I recommend that you include breakfast. We booked at the last minute, so the price seemed high. We hope that you have a flexible price policy with advance booking. But in general everything is fine. Especially the location.
title: Excellent hotel. The best place for urban tourism.

review: A very stylish place in the middle of the city action. That said, there is no balcony as in Vinoteca or Garden which was a bit surprising, staff does not speak English very well and cleaning until 2.30 pm is a bit too early if you stay for over a couple of nights.
title: Review

review: Stayed in this hotel for the first time. Chose this hotel for it's history and character and that's what I got. Friendly personel and lovely terrace where you can bring your own food and drinks. The only one minus is the wifi. Even thou you get a transportable wifi device it is still weak and bad. Want to come back to this hotel when this would change!
title: Authentic hotel in the center of Barcelona

review: We had a great time in Barcelona recently staying at Pratik Rambla. Pros:- Very nice and helpful staff. - Great terrace area to enjoy. - Location is incredible and perfect for exploring Barcelona.- Free croissants in the morning are actually excellent, but make sure to get in by 0900 or they'll be gone. Cons:- Small rooms, very little space for luggage. - The washing subcontractor lost serveral items of my clothing - still waiting to hear from hotel if they turned up. Overall decent for price. Fantastic tapas place across the road which is great for breakfast.
title: Amazing location

review: 位置一流，环境一流，房间很大，床很舒服。没想到这个酒店是在西班牙最舒服的一家 good location and services. Love it so much! The bed is comfortable, and the coffee is free every day. There is a small garden you can have a rest with coffee and bread in the morning. Near from the Mila, Batllo and metro station.
title: Excellent

review: Beautiful hotel and excellent service in a great location. We especially loved the tile everywhere and the thoughtful decor details. The desk staff was amazingly helpful, and the amenities were a delightful surprise, including the morning croissants, paletas and candy at the desk, and free WiFi hotspot upon request.
title: Lovely stay

review: For solo traveler I had not a big room , but it was ok as I came to explore the city. But I saw a family with 2 kids, and more than sure there are big rooms also. In general, I would recommend this hotel as it it unique, trendy and has it's own charm unlike the ones in chain.
title: Great & cosy hotel, very central. Nice design and awesome entrance.

review: The hotel charged me for a no show, even though half my patty had arrived and my flight was cancelled arrived the next day to find they had given my room away. They could have confirmed or notified me about this... Even via the half if the party that had arrived? In addition to this they can't even spell the name on the reservation right. Poor customer service. Really wanted to stay here. No longer wish to. Or even to recommend.
title: GAVE MY ROOM AWAY

review: Friendly & helpful staff. Great location, 5 min walk to Plaça Catalunya and la ramblas. 20min walk from port. Breakfast croissant and hot drinks. Ice lolly on arrival. Overall completely satisfied with our stay and loved every minute!
title: Brilliant.

review: Our standard double room was small but very comfortable. The best thing about this hotel is its stunning architecture and decoration. The entire place was renovated in a way that perfectly mixes old and new by respecting the original architectural features of the building. Nicely done. Staff is also very friendly and helpful. The complimentary croissants and coffee every morning is good, but a more complete breakfast option would'nt hurt. The terrasse and the reading room are superb.
title: Style and comfort in a 19th century setting

review: We loved our stay at Praktik Rambla. The hotel was in a very convenient location. It was easy to access all the places we wanted to visit. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. And the chocolate croissants were delicious!!! Would highly recommend.
title: Great Stay in Barcelona

review: This hotel is in a brilliany location for accessing bars/restaurants and the main shopping square, where you can easily pick up the tour bus and you be at the main sights in about 10 mins. The architecture of the hotel is beautiful and has a very gothic vibe, but with a comfy modern bedroom!! The shower was heavenly and the little garden patio is incredibly peaceful and quaint. I stayed for 2 days and the staff were very friendly and efficient. They organised my taxi to the airport which was about €30. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, just so convienient to everywhere but with a traditional Barcelona vibe.
title: Lovely hotel

review: It wasn't the first time at this hotel, the customer service provided by all of their staff makes me to feel well liked and treated as a family member. Their knowledge of Barcelona communications and travel systems is outstanding
title: My staying at Praktik Ramblas

review: This hotel is a five minute from the A1 and A2 bus stop which is the only mode of transportation I would recommend from El Prat to the city. The Praktik is located on the Rambla de Cataluyna and is very central and a bit away from the main Rambla and the Place de Cataluyna where the madding crowds congregate. The property is amazing. The rooms are great and the service is friendly. The only issue we had during this our third stay at this property is that the internet did not work well at all. The hotel is also a stones throw from some really amazing restaurants. We highly recommend this property.
title: Great Hotel in an equally great location in a Great City

review: The hotel was simply beautiful! From the building to the interior design. Our room was simply gorgeous with a wonderful small balcony observing the street. Free coffee and croissants every morning are a great way to start your day.Only wish the bed was of a better quality... wasn't the most comfortable but simply ok.
title: Beautiful hotel at a great location

review: Stayed at the Hotel Praktik Rambla for 5 nights on vacation with my mom. We couldn't have been happier with our stay! Our room was always clean, and we could only hear minimal street noise (loud motorcycles). The beds were very comfortable, and they provided each guest a pair of disposable slippers for the stay. The staff were polite, courteous, and helpful. I spoke to them in both English and Spanish without any communication difficulties. Last but not least, the location was perfect. It was much quieter than the area around many of the other hotels I looked at for our stay, but it was still in the heart of the city. The Block of Dischord was only 2 blocks In one direction, and Las Ramblas is only 3 blocks to the opposite direction. There are plenty of restaurants and shops around, and there's a pharmacy nearby should the need arise. I highly recommend the hotel!
title: Praktikally Perfect

review: Praktik Rambla is the most uniquely beautiful hotel space I've ever stayed in. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating, including arranging an early morning cab for my airport departure. I only wish I could have stayed longer.
title: Beautiful space

review: We had a very pleasant stay, a comfortable and very large room for Europe standards. Shower was excellent and modernized with a rain shower head and hand-held additionally. I think the breakfast could be enhanced from just coffee and croissants, but it was very tasty. The rooms should also have ice buckets in the room (I had to request them for all of us and retrieve them). An ice freezer is available for all guests on 1st floor, so this was a nice bonus for guests. The outdoor patio and indoor sitting room/library are lovely and have nice furniture. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will stay there again without hesitation.
title: Great stay at the Praktik!

review: it is some years I use this hotel for my trips. it is located in a very excellent historical location , with new modern concept. receptions is always friendly and helps in every situation. Comfortable rooms , nice showers. there is a terrace with a small garden to relax after a day of walking or meetings. it is just on side of the shopping area paseo de Gracie and all around you have all types of restaurants. people working in the hotels are very friendly and feels you like be at home. I do recommend it
title: excellent

review: Noise from other room is so big, that i couldn't sleep well every night.Also some water that where it came from are all around my shoes, so my new shoes from barcelona became wet completly.The two things above was bad, but other things about the hotel was good.
title: noisy room condition

review: Very nice hotel at central location. Can easy travel to attractions in Barcelona. The staff of the hotel is very friendly. Hotel surrounded by a lot nice restaurant and very close to metro station. Will back and stay again :)
title: Nice Hotel

review: The room itself was tiny, the bed had access only from one side. No roomservice and no minibar, even no water in the room. The price is too high for such list of services. Though the location is good to reach touristic places, it is near a very noisy street, the windows are old and do not provide any noise insulation. The hotel is beautifully old with respectfully restored premises - for those who love it.
title: Overprised beauty

review: Loved the property and very helpful staff. Greatly decorated and really enjoyed the terrace in our down time. Only complaint was that the room A/C is terrible. Not near cool enough for summer. However, there was great coffee and pastries in the morning. It made for a wonderful stay in central Rambla.
title: Great Place to Stay!

review: I loved my 2 nights stay in the delux double room, overlooking the street of Rambla. Nicely decorated room with a comfortable bed, spacious for two person, with the balcony. Great service and 24hr access to free coffee and tea. The only thing I wish they had was a small fridge in the room, otherwise very satisfied!
title: Delux doublebroom

review: We had four nights in Barcelona so wanted to find a location that would allow us to walk to restaurants of our choosing yet not be in the mobs of people on the rambles The hotel is located approximately four blocks off the main square above the gothic portion of the city in a much quieter part of the city. The room we were in was relatively small but was very well appointed. The huge plus was the open air patio at the rear of the hotel. Again well designed with numerous group seating arrangements. This was a delightful setting for morning coffee and some of the best croissants we had in Spain. And back to the deck for evening wine before proceeding to dinner. The staff were very accommodating and helpful as we finalized our daily site visits and restaurant plans. We worked very closely with Johanes during our stay who was a wonder. It was the perfect fit for us.
title: Perfect location!

review: Great hotel. Ideal location. Beautiful common terrace with lounge chairs. Very helpful and kind staff. Family rooms available. Rather small, but comfortable bathroom with shower. Great value for money.
title: Birthday treat

review: Comfortable and clean rooms. Excellent location. Staff very helpful and friendly.Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hotel and strongly recommend this lovely hotel.Keep up the good work.Will definitely stay here again.
title: excellent stay

review: Not our first time in the Praktik. We love the vibe, location and the staff. But this time the room was tiny, noisy from the inside of the hotel and with no window at all... I've ask in advance and was willing to pay for any kind of an upgrade but really wan't expected to that room... the staff is great and helpful and everything but next time I guess we'll take the NH Collection.. sorry..
title: not exactly what we've expected

review: This is a pretty average three star hotel that could've been really great if they only got rid of a few easy to fix blemishes. Firstly, to us and for our plans it was perfectly situated. L'Eixample is a underrated part of the city and you can cover a lot of the city simply by walking from the hotel. We had a standard double room which is very small, but that is noted on the web page. No problem. The building itself is awesome and would probably be an attraction itself if it wasn't a hotel. However, we did feel it wasn't very well cleaned. I dropped something underneath the bathroom sink and it was unpleasant, to say the least, to pick it up. I didn't check underneath the bed but since the rooms are so small, I imagine it's difficult to clean properly without breaking your back. The staff didn't come across as perfectly neutral. Nothing to really mention. The air condition unit in the room was a little bit of a problem. I can't really sleep without it, but it was so old and noisy it also became a problem to sleep when it was running. There was no way to adjust the fan speed, and it didn't seem to have any other function than on and off. And "on" was pretty cold. I understand it is because it's an old building, but things never seemed to dry off properly which in turn led it to constantly feeling quite humid in the rooms. It would've helped if we could open up the window in the bathroom. We had no problems with the wifi, as others have commented on. The style, colors and bathrooms in particular are really well thought through and executed. Would I stay again? Yes, but would probably go for a larger room with an exterior view.
title: Great location, but...

review: The smallish boutique hotel is a gem. It is a historic beautiful building with great central location.One can walk anywhere. The people are lovely and very helpful.We will be back the next time we return to Spain.
title: Eclectic stay in Barcelona

review: Beautiful small hotel with a great location.Team is very friendly, rooms are a bit small as are the pillows but no big deal.I ordered a bottle of Cava with a note as I was on honeymoon with my wife but never arrived.Second day we did not receive Housekeeping service as we had a DND sign for around 3 hours during the day and apparently, if you miss your time slot your room is not cleaned.Still a nice place.
title: Beautiful Hotel with a few hiccups

review: Good helpful staff and comfortable rooms. Clean and tidy and lovely bathrooms. 2nd time we have stayed here and although this time we stayed in a normal room and not the deluxe it was absolutely fine.
title: Really good hotel & Excellent Location

review: Couldn't recommend this enough. We're a family of 5 and stayed for 3 nights. Our three sons 16/14/12 had a treble and we had a double. Such a lovely building internally and decorated accordingly. Complimentary coffee machine was really pretty good and coissants and pain au chocolate hit the spot every morning - which handsomely covered breakfast for all. Staff superb ....
title: Totally great

review: A very good and comfortable hotel with friendly staff and an excellent breakfast. Close to the historic centre and just around the corner from good bars and restaurants and the jewel of Gaudi's architecture La Pedrera !!! Book it while you can, you will be glad you did you betcha !!
title: Great hotel in central location

review: Hotel is located in a convenient neighborhood for tourists. The room is standard. Their service is excellent. I feel like I can get any help needed from them. The buffet breakfast is also excellent and worth the money.
title: Superb Service

review: Upgraded on arrival due to our length of stay, 6 nights. Smallish but functional rooms, not the smallest we've had in Europe though. Very helpful and friendly staff. Excellent value for money considering the quality of the hotel and its location, close to metro station and numerous bus stops. Would definitely stay here again!
title: Almost 4 star hotel!

review: I am a fan of Room Mate hotels and cannot rave enough about the high standards of customer care the Room Mate Emma offers. The rooms are modern and clean. The beds hard and the sheets white and crisp. The pillows were a little hard for my liking, but that's minor. The bathrooms are glorious! Modern and outfitted with the best and most up-to-date plumbing fixtures. The shower head was divine! I would suggest more lighting in the rooms, especially by the bed. Breakfasts are great and well worth the price. The reception is 24/7, which was a blessing, especially when my flight arrived at 2:09 a.m. The front desk team is passionate and quite knowledgeable. They knew everything there was to know about Barcelona, obtaining tickets, restaurants and "things to do" in and around the city. Had it not been for their suggestion, I wouldn't have discovered the quaint beach town of Sitges, which was a perfect place to spend the day. Patricio, Mar, Christina and Pilar were great, but special kudos to Issac who helped me with my original reservation in February and was at the desk to personally greet me with open arms. I will return to Barcelona and to the Room Mate Emma as well! Thank you all for a wonderful stay in your beautiful hotel and city.
title: My second visit to Barcelona and my second stay at Room Mate Emma.

review: Overall our stay at Room Mate Emma was great. The air-con was fantastic, the room was big enough and comfortable, and the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Carmen and I can't remember the guy's name, I think it started with G... We were a bit put off when we first arrived though as we were told there were only rooms with two single beds left at the level we paid for as we were checking in later in the day but we could pay an extra 15 euros for an upgrade. Our booking clearly stated a queen bed and there was no mention of conditions of availability. We argued the point and after a few minutes were upgraded at no additional charge. This was unfortunate as otherwise we had a great stay.
title: Friendly, helpful staff, good location

review: I agree with the other reviewers that the service at Room Mate Emma was quite good. I had some questions prior to my stay and they answered very quickly and helpfully. The room was small, but not ridiculously small as some european hotels can be. The location was great, close to a lot of transportation and walkable to most attractions if you don't mind walking for 30ish minutes. My only complaint was that the room completely lacked any natural light. My room was on the 3rd floor and faced the stairwell which was weirdly purple. I felt like I was on a cruise ship and not in a good way. Aside from that I don't have any complaints.
title: Nice Hotel and Good Location

review: All staff were friendly and helpful. Overall service was excellent. Suite was luxurious. Not expensive for this high level of hotel. Highly recommend. The Gaudi style of the building was really interesting .
title: Excellent service

review: The Casa Fuster is perfectly located in one of the best areas of Barcelona, near all major attractions or subway stations. Staff is friendly, rooms are large enough and very well appointed. Bed and linen were delicious! Complimentary water every night. The building is very beautiful and well maintained, having a historical fell but not old. Internet worked very well and breakfast, although not varied, very satisfying. Swimming pool on rooftop is tiny, more like an enlarged bathtub. Not really for sports but for freshening up. Although the room was spacious, bathroom had a quite odd layout where shower, toilet and bidet were all squeezed in a tiny corner of the room and felt a bit cramped. Overall I would recommend Casa Fuster to all my friends when in Barcelona!
title: Great!

review: We had already got a great price for this hotel through a price comparison site for 1 night, and arrived excited to be staying in such a nice hotel. The website stated that we could check in from 12pm however the reception said it would be 3pm before the room was ready, so we left for a few hrs disappointed we could not get to our room. However when we returned, the same receptionist apologised again for the confusion and informed us that our triple room had been upgraded to a junior suite ( sweet !)I have never seen anything like this on my otherwise budget travels in many hotels, It felt like we had won lottery !Every member of staff was courteous and professional, taking time to explain the room and the facilities on offer. The roof top bar with amazing views was fabulous but so were the prices. Thank you Casa Foster for making the last day of my kids holiday truly memorable !
title: Surprise luxury upgrade

review: My family and I spent one of our best vacation right here in Barcelona and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. It is clearly a 5-star hotel in every sense of the word and the staff were 6-star if ever there was a rating for staff services. Everyone performed at their best throughout our past four days here, helpful, full of attention, huge smiles, immaculate attires, professional and so warm. The owner of the Casa Fuster should be so proud that his hotel runs so well and his guest so well looked after. We will come back to this lovely city and we will stay at Casa Fuster and we will highly recommend it to all our friends and families who are headed this way.
title: Simply A Very Nice Hotel With Some of the Best Staff!!!!

review: We looked forward to staying at the hotel but had a terrible stay. The room was so tiny that we could not unpack our suitcases. The roof top pool is the size of a large bathtub. Service at the pool was non existent - no waiter every came up to ask us if we wanted to order a drink. The place is not cheap but we didn't even get help with taking our luggage to our room. Highly annoying stay.
title: Very disappointing.

review: Stayed at Casa Fuster a couple of nights last week with my wife on the recommendation of our Catalan friend. The hotel is right in the centre of the city, and has that real old world feel. The staff were all excellent-- friendly and helpful. Room was plush with all the amenities. Lovely bathroom, massive bed, and luxe atmosphere. The hotel is decorated in dark tones, which is not my cup of tea as i prefer a brighter and more sunny vibe, but that is just personal preference. There was a water pressure issue for a few hours, and no one could use their bathrooms, but that was not the fault of the hotel apparently, as it had something to do with the water utility service. All in all, a good hotel, and a nice intro to the city of Barcelona.
title: Old world charm

review: Casa Fuster is ideally located for visiting bustling Barcelona. We had a very nice room with excellent beds, seaparate bath and shower, dressing. The roof top bar is also very pleasant (without noisy music). The swimming pool is rather a refreshing large bath tub (80 cm of water 2 x 4m...). On Thursdays there is a pleasant jazz session in the large, nice ballroom, well attended by locals. The rather unimpressive breakfast is served in the large, well decorated cellar. Staff is very friendly !
title: In the heart of Barcelona

review: We had a lovely stay at Casa Fuster. Staff was extremely helpful and nice. Location was ideal and close proximity to many things. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices in an interesting room downstairs. Loved the bar area rooftop for the evenings with delicious drinks and snacks.
