Pool area is little small but plenty of space to get sun. Door men extremely friendly ! overall would love to come back to Casa Fuster!!
title: Wonderful Barcelona character

review: Truly a nice and a 5-starred hotel with a good and relatively calm location. Rooms are spacy enough and decor is old-fashioned as expected from the website. Staff is friendly and professional, one exception though, Wad the roof-top bar/swimmingpool areal. There, the staff was not so keen to take our orders and they sometimes left the used porcelain on the tables for hours....one time for 5 hours. Also, in contrast to all other Staff, their english language left a lot to wish for. On the other hand, the breakfast Staff was extremely competent and friendly. I recommend hvis hotel.
title: Like it

review: After cruising with old friends , our Mediterranean cruise ended in Barcelona .We decided to stay on for 2 more nights at Casa Fuster Hotel where we had stayed once before .It was as good as we'd remembered !Our room was spacious , linen and bed very comfortable.Bathroom included a good shower Separate jacuzzi and a bidet and toilet .Heated towel rail although I never found out where one switched it on .The breakfast was wonderful . Served in a very spacious and calming atmosphere.We had a wonderful snack on our arrival on the roof top with terrific views .On our last night we dined at the Galaxo restaurant . One of the. Eat meals we've had in many years on our travels .With the very best service.Will be going back there soon as o can plan another trip !
title: Best way to end a holiday

review: Spent three days at Hotel Fuster and can only talk nicely about it. Starting with the beautiful old modernist building, the staff, the rooms and meeting rooms. It is very well located in the center of Barcelona just a short 5 minutes walk to the Gaudí buildings at Paseo de Gracia.Do not miss the terrace at night. It's the place to be and have the last drink overlooking the beauty of the city
title: At the heart of Barcelona

review: This hotel looks the business. Beautifully presented and a great location. Very nicely welcomed and staff helpful. Our room was lovely. Crisp white linens and comfy bed with Complimentary tea and coffee. The reason I did not give this hotel five stars was our group took drinks on the rooftop. Beautiful views but sadly had to wait over an hour for drinks, despite many many requests. I asked to speak to the manager who came to the rooftopTo find out what had happened. He did not come over and apologise to our table and yet we waited another 15 minutes before drinks arrived. It was unbelievable!!! The empty drinks and food plates were not removed from our table all evening. Very disappointed with staff and manager.
title: Girls weekend away

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is very snazzy. The room was spacious. Breakfast ok. The service was good. Conference services were fine. Slow wifi at times. On the bad side: no irons in the room. The one they brought me had rusty stains which came off on my shirt----no good!! The rooftop pool is ridiculously tiny--why bother at all with something that can barely fit 2 people across. Every lap pool I have ever been in anywhere in the world is much wider than this one. The whole deck is so tiny that people were splayed out on the hard floor with barely a inch to step around each other and there were relatively few deck chairs. Hotel charged 20 euros for me to use an indoor spa area for one hour with a big Jacuzzi and tiny sauna.
title: Very stylish but forget the pool

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: They have a fantastic assortment for breakfast in a spacious restaurant. Service is excellent with a special mention for Karla who is courteous, polite and proactive providing great service. Little gestures like remembering your birthday and giving you a glass of Cava to celebrate the occasion. Good value.
title: Breakfast

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: I recently stayed at the NH for two nights . From the first experience at the front desk through to the lovely team who worked at breakfast all were excellent, friendly and incredibly helpful, all spoke very good English. I had the most enormous bed, room was clean and great bathroom. Coffee capsules, tea etc in the room, fresh water, fruit and sweets at reception. My only complaint (minor I could have asked for one) is that there is no ironing board already in the room, easily remedied by asking reception. The selection at breakfast was fantastic with an incredible choice of top quality food. I didn't eat in the restaurant as it was closed for refurbishment but if the food is as good as the breakfast would certainly try. Because I was working I didn't do any of the 'tourist options' but understand that the Ramblas was approx. 10 mins away with excellent transport links. If you want high street shops the hotel is right by a decent sized mall with the normal range of brands available. Great hotel and not too expensive for what you get, would certainly stay there again when next in Barcelona.
title: Excellent hotel - call out for the staff who were superb

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed in this hotel at the end of June 2017 and was very happy overall with check in, room and Breakfast. For me the only small issue was the fact that it was a good 10 minute to the nearest metro but that's not the hotels fault!!
title: a very good hotel

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Love NH Constanza as boutique with smart bedrooms, lovely roof lap pool, great breakfast & convenient location off Diagonale; some fittings are getting worn on showers & baths & we had to ask repeatedly to have TV International channels tuned in... but we will be back again in December, Ta RDG
title: BCN or Bust!

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Absolutely great hotel, location is ideal. Rooms very clean and spacious. Most importantly the staff is excellent. Patricia and Sara at the breakfast were wonderful and made our stay extra special. Highly recommended!
title: Fantastic hotel and service!

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: We spent a few wonderful days in Barcelona and the hotel where we were accommodated fully contributed to this thing The people who took care of this hotel do it with the maximum seriousness and this feels like entering the hotel.We will return anytime with pleasure to NH COLLECTION CONSTANZA BARCELONA
title: great hotel and staff

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Fantastic Hotel friendly welcoming staff, great spacious clean modern rooms. Great location, I really enjoyed the sun terrace as well . Very clean great bar and eating area overall a lovely hotel that I would stay at in the future.
title: Brilliant

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here in early June 2017 ...first time in Barcelona. Rooms were modern and of a decent size, really comfy bed and a nice bathroom. Very clean. Everything worked great ...wifi, air conditioning, tv, etc. Great breakfast room with an excellent breakfast buffet. AND great cappuccinos! Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. There's a wonderful lap pool on the rooftop that we loved. Really enjoyed the outside bar .....food was good. Very good location ...pretty quiet at night ....lots of places to eat, etc. Also an excellent shopping center right behind hotel with a good choice of boutiques and a food market below ground with a good variety of eateries ....all price levels. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Terrific!

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Lovely hotel a bit further out from the hustle and bustle of the city but within travel distance of all the main attractions. Some cute bars/cafes surrounding it and walking distance to Camp Nou!Rooftop pool is nice and quiet.
title: Lovely Quiet Location

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Nice and comfortable room in a location that perfectly suits my needs. Located in the L'illa shopping mall complex with all that it can offer and with comfortable parking. Jewish center (Chabad) and synagogue only minutes away by foot.
title: Comfort in the city

hotelLocation: C/ Deu i Mata, 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
review: Horrible experience. Reception staff accused me of trying to leave without paying at check-out, despite us having paid them the full fare at check-in. I stayed here 15-17 July, checked-in with my boyfriend but checked-out by myself.I thought it was a bit strange that they charged us at check-in, also charged us a different price then quoted on Booking.com when I booked - about 15% more - and I pointed that out and they said it was due to taxes. They also scanned both our passports and had us fill some forms with our home address and contact details. They issued us a receipt which I showed to the check-out staff as proof of payment, but the check-out staff wouldn't accept it, claiming it was for another room and that my name didn't appear on the receipt. They also refused to return the receipt I handed them and kept it. Despite the lengthy check-in process with the passport scans, reception staff at check-out 2 days later claimed they had no records of our check-in or payment. I asked them to check records of payments that day, in both their booking system and their accounting but they did not want to help, instead acting suspicious towards me and asking me questions indicating they didn't believe me. Eventually I had to pay again to end the scene and leave. This time the fee I was charged was exactly the price we were quoted on Booking.com and different from what we paid at check-in. Again, strange. There was probably a mistake somewhere and I asked the reception staff to consider this but they did not want to co-operate, had probably decided by that point that I'm attempting a fraud instead of trying to help me. My boyfriend and I came back to the hotel together later that week, when the first payment appeared in our online bank statement to try to get a refund for it (it was lucky that we were still in Barcelona). This time around there was an extra desk in the lobby where a customer relation staff person. She was polite and willing to help and agreed to look into it and they eventually refunded us one of the payments.That still doesn't make up for the horrible check-out when I was by myself, being accused of trying to leave without paying in a lobby full of people and having to defend my claim after they rejected and took away my receipt. It's the worst experience I've had in a hotel.Not that any other feature of the hotel matters much after this experience, but I thought the rooms were not that great.There was dust in the room and in the bathroom, the bathroom sink was blocked and the room looked very uninviting, like a metal cube. We asked for a double bed when we booked but we were given two single beds.The most annoying thing was that bed linen did not have a proper duvet cover, it was just two sheets with the duvet in the middle so during the night when you moved you would touch the duvet (which presumably doesn't get washed after every guest like the bed sheets are). Very unhygienic. This is marketed as a 3 star hotel, but the rooms definitely don't live up to that expectation and the reception staff attitude is not acceptable to treat a guest and a paying customer.
title: Rude and unprofessional reception staff

review: Rooms are smaller than advertised, location is ok, 8 min. walk to shops,restaurants, I won't recommend the breakfast, better food around the corner for less. No soap bars in bathrooms,only soap pumps.Room cleaning was bad.Definitely not worth $225 a night.Overall if you can book a room for the right price, may be worthy.
title: FAIR

review: Location was great was a nice area to walk around. Hotel was clean modern and very nice. Had a roof top bar which With great views food and drinks. Lots of tapas restaurants in the area. Room was on the smaller side but clean modern with balcony good for an overnight stay before our cruise.
title: Nice location nice hotel

review: Good size and comfortable family room, sofa bed + double. Friendly staff. Location great for cafes and public transport. Taxis easy outside the hotel. Breakfast is available but more fun going out to explore local cafes and eateries.
title: Family Room

review: Our daughter stayed here earlier in the month and recommended we book.I would happily go back and would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Great location for the sights. Handy for the metro.
title: Lovely !!!

review: Like many of the reviews below, I cannot believe this hotel has only review a 2 star rating!It's quite simple to get to from the airport (take the R2 train a couple of stops) from the metro it's around a ten minute walk. The hotel itself is around a 5 minute walk from the main shopping district in Barcelona. It's far enough out that you don't get traffic of transport or people, but it has plenty of great bars surrounding it.There is a lovely restaurant attached to the hotel (Bruc33). It's a tapas restaurant which is fairly priced, but great if you're in a rush or having a late dinner.The staff were lovely and friendly and swiftly checked us in when we arrived. We were provided with a map and the member of staff highlighted key places of interest and explained how far away they were.The room itself was great, we were on the second floor and even had a small balcony. There was a safe provided, hangers, a hairdryer and a mini bar. The shower was great and the room was very clean. The only fault I could find with the room was that the walls were a little thin. Luckily, we didn't hear conversations but we could hear people in the corridor and in the rooms next to us slamming their doors. The room was cleaned every day which was great and we were provided with new towels when we needed them. There is also a fantastic rooftop bar. The first night we had two drinks which cost €7. We found it really fairly priced compared to some other bars in the area. They also served food, although I didn't try any.I would absolutely stay here again when I next visit Barcelona. Fantastic location, it was very clean and the staff were very polite and helpful.
title: Excellent location!

review: Nice Hotel Good location. The staff were outgoing, the family suite was convenient.The breakfast isnt worth the price. You can do much better elsewhere.The bar on the rooftop is fun, but beware of its prices.
title: Nice Hotel Good location

review: Long black hair on the floor, some undisclosed grease on the beer cans in the minibar.Plus they charged us city taxes for our 2 and 4 year old, despite the fact you don´t have to pay it for kids under 17
title: Cleaning needs upgrade

review: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel in June for 4 nights and we are so glad that we chose this hotel.The hotel is in a perfect location - it is within a 10 minute walk of 3 different metro stations, (Urquinaona, Passeig de Garcia and Catalunya) meaning that it is easy to get to from the airport or train stations, and that it is a short walk or metro ride to anywhere in the city. It is also only a 5-10 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya, and the top of La Rambla, and a short walk from the Barri Gotic and El Born areas. Being located a short walk from all these areas also means that it is in a quieter area than some hotels in Barcelona, and we found it very peaceful each night and easy to get a good nights sleep.The room itself was spacious enough for 2 people, and had a comfortable bed, a nice bathroom with a very large shower, shower gel and shampoo and a hairdryer, a safe, and a lovely little balcony/terrace area, which had a couple of seats and was a lovely place to sit and have a snack, and overlooked a quiet courtyard type area. The room also had a minibar, which was just a small fridge which we used to put our own drinks/snacks in and was incredibly useful. The air conditioning in the room worked perfectly, making the room a lovely cool temperature to retreat in to when it was nearly 40 degrees outside!The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, and were quick to respond to emails that I had sent them before booking the hotel.There is a restaurant next door if you would like to buy breakfast or dinner. We didn't visit the restaurant though so can't say if the food was good. The hotel has a rooftop bar, which we visited on one evening and wish we had managed to visit more often. The man serving was very friendly and had a bit of a joke with us, the drinks were good and a reasonable price and the atmosphere was great. It wasn't a huge area but it was nicely done and we would recommend having at least one drink up there.As said in the title, the hotel definitely deserves more than 2 stars and we would 100% stay here again, as we could not find another hotel with a private balcony, rooftop bar, private bathrooms and minibar for the same price. It is a lovely hotel in a great location and fully recommended by us!
title: Don't let the 2 stars put you off, definitely deserves more!

review: Good rooms central in Barcelona. Good aircondition and a cosy roof terrasse. Good service. The breakfast has more potential but is ok. I would like more fresh fruit, darker bread and better coffee. Nice with youghert.
title: Central and good

review: We spend three nights in early July. The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean; it has a nice balcony with comfortable chairs to enjoy the view.Perfect location, walking distance to public transport amenities like La Rambla, Plaza Cataluñaand more. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. Nice area for shopping and eating out.
title: Nice hotel in a great location!

review: We booked this hotel for 4 nights in June as part of our month travelling round Spain. We chose this because of the good reviews and we were not disappointed. This definitely feels more than a 2 star! Check in was good with the receptionist spending a lot of time pointing out things on the map for us and answering our questions. Room was one of the best we stayed in with small balcony overlooking the front of the hotel. The location was in a quiet area just off plaza de Catalunya but within walking distance of La Ramblas and shopping area. We were 10 minutes from El Born a lovely area with good restaurants and bars. We used the metro which was a handy way to see the city and very good value if you bought the 10 ticket deal. Nearest met was Urquinaona. They have a roof top bar here which was lovely but underused which is a shame but on the plus side we always found a table.
title: Fantastic hotel in great location

review: I stayed for 2 nights and it was in a perfect location - away from the hustle and bustleof Placa Catalunya but close enough to walk to if you are feeling up to that. The hotel staff is very nice, the rooms were very roomy and mine had a little Juliette balcony facing the front - very cute. There was an issue with the bathroom - it didn't seem to flush properly - other than that, it was very enjoyable. There is a roof terrace with a bar, and the restaurant Bruc 33 Tapas was very good if you want to dine local.
title: Enjoyable Stay

review: This hotel offers a great location in the heart of Barcelona and meets all of the criteria for travellers who do not need exquisite facilities and are satisfied with a clean well maintained facility with a friendly staff. A particular bonus was an excellent Tapis bar/restaurant right next door to the hotel. Easy to walk to the hub of shopping and restaurant locations and metro transport areas. Close enough to Gaudi sites for those who don't mind walking. Would definitely stat at the Hotel Constanta again!
title: Great for all travel needs!

review: Nice, clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. My sister arrived early and they checked her in before the official "check-in" time which allowed her to explore for a few extra hours. The hotel is close to attractions and walking distance to the beach.
title: Excellent Hotel

review: We only stayed two nights at the hotel. Room was comfortable and clean. We did not eat breakfast here but chose a nearby cafe. Room service wasn't very good as our room was being cleaned/serviced the second day mid to late afternoon and we had to wait at least 1 hour until completed before we could use it. This was the only issue, otherwise a lovely hotel.
title: Lovely hotel

review: I stayed at Hôtel Constanza for three nights in July 2017.Well located, very close to Urquinaona, Catalunya and Passeig de Gracia (10 minutes walk), friendly and attentive staff and excellent bathroom and air conditioner, very appreciated when hotter weather. I enjoyed the hotel's decoration and modern style for a perfect trip in Barcelona. Highly recommended for solo or family. I would definitely come back for sure for a further travel, Constanza hotel should get three stars, those of quality and performance!
title: Perfect

review: My friend and I stayed at this hotel this weekend (mid July). The hotel is modern, clean and located in a lovely part of the city, away from the main hustle and bustle but with plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful and the facilities were good. The buffet style breakfast was really good value with an excellent range and quality of food. There is a shopping mall located right next to the hotel which was very convenient. It can be difficult to get taxis from directly outside the hotel (despite a taxi rank just opposite) we had to wait over half an hour on Saturday afternoon for one to come even after the hotel staff had called through for one. Overall, a lovely hotel with great facilities, I'd definitely stay there again.
title: Barcelona weekend trip

review: Hotel is in a good location and rooms are a good size. Some of the staff behind reception were really halpful others rude and disinterested. We stayed for 3 nights and found our room was clean when we arrived at first but they did not clean very much each day. They also forgot to replenish toilet paper and we had to ring downstairs twice for it. It's also quiet noisy.. You can hear everything going on in rooms around you. There were a few blown bulbs in lighting in room which meant totally bright or totally dark were the only options. Overall I was disappointed considering the ratings it has recieved on both TripAdvisor and booking. Com.
title: Fair

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: From the beginning I felt like my home. Helpful staff and very cozy room. Every morning in the breakfast we had fresh juice and fruits.Great location with two metro stations and two mini markets.In the street Carrer d'Asturies (next to Fontana metro station) has cheap grocery shop.I will definitely stayed again in this hotel
title: I felt like home

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: I have stayed in 5 star hotels that rate the same as this hotel. First the staff are so friendly and are really knowledgeable. The Room is comfortable and the kitchenette is really handy. The location is super, being 2 min away from the metro which is on line 3, 3 stops away from la rambla. Breakfast was included in the room rate and was a comprehensive continental spread, including freshly squeezed juice. Great stay in Barcelona!
title: Best three star hotel I have ever stayed in

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed here for few days and we are quite surprised with the hotel. Everything is Amazing. Location, staff, room and alot of great places to eat nearby. This hotel is like a service apartment we love the style. Nearest station:Fontana. We also ask the hotel to hold a parcel until we arrive and the staff followed our instructions accordingly. Good job and will definitely recommend to friends and family. I wish we can stay a little bit longer.. Thank you to all the staff of Silver aparthotel. We love our stay.
title: Good value for money, cozy, quiet and great location

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: Stayed only one night however experience was very positive. Excellent little hotel, very friendly and accommodating staff. Really appreciated having a little kitchen in the room. Altogether made for a great stay.
title: Great place

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: The location is perfect. Only a few stops away from Las Rambles but in a lovely neighbourhood. The staff are outstanding and should be congratulated. So helpful, knowledgeable and kind. My friend had to go to hospital during our stay but they told us where to go and showed real concern! I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family. The room was spotless and had a little kitchenette. Not five star luxury but very clean, comfortable and super friendly. Local shopping was good with lots of friendly shopkeepers. Bar Breton a few doors down is a great local bar with tasty paella, tapas and good wine much cheaper than in the city. Overall one of the nicest, safest and friendliest hotels around.
title: Fantastic hotel. Truly a home away from home.

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: We only had 24 hours in Barcelona and the Aparthotel Silver provided an inexpensive and excellent property in a very nice part of town. The room was small but comfy. The bathroom and especially the shower was very, very small. The premises were neat and clean. The staff were very friendly. The parking was bright and secure. The Aparthotel is down a little street that's easy to miss in the Gracia area.
title: Great stay along the way!!

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: A great little hotel in an excellent location. Close to public transport (a metro stop is only two minutes walk), shopping and tourist attractions. Rooms are clean and well looked after and the staff are friendly and helpful.
title: Excellent hotel

hotelLocation: Breton de los Herreros, 26, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
review: I had only one night in Barcelona, my daughter recommended to stay in Gràcia, a hip / artsy neighborhood with great restaurants and bars. The Hotel location was perfect, the price was very good and the staff wonderful. My room had a rooftop terrace with kitchenette and plenty of space.
title: Excellent Hotel in the beautiful Gràcia neigborhood of Barcelona

review: We would absolutely stay here again. The location, service and comfort were all wonderful. The room was also very reasonably priced. The complimentary glass of wine was a nice thought and appreciated.
title: Enjoyed our stay

review: My family and I came and got 2 double rooms to stay for 4 nights. We absolutely loved this hotel and found that the location was perfect. Very close to many popular tourist attractions and to metro and bus stops. The staff was extremely helpful in helping us make the most of our trip and providing information about the activities we wished to include in our trip. We will definitely stay here again if we return to Barcelona.
title: Love Praktik Vinoteca!

review: We've stayed in this hotel, the location is very good nearby the shops and bars and restaurants. Not far from placa de cataluyna! Not far from the metro-station also.. When we are coming back to Barcelona, I think we will come back to this hotel!
title: Nice hotel!

review: Perfectly welcoming and charming boutique hotel. Great place to base a visit to Barcelona out of. All the staff were so welcoming, it felt like coming home each time after a long day of touring Barcelona. We especially loved the welcome drink. They also provide for a small fee a daily breakfast starting early.
title: 3 glorious nights in Barcelona

review: We had a Pleasant stay at this hotel. Rooms were slightly small but very clean, and good service. The hotel is in a nice location, convenient for sightseeing and transport links. Would be happy to stay here again.
title: July 2017

review: This is a fine hotel. Rooms are nice, clean and efficient. The decor is interesting with a general wine motif in the lobby and other public areas. The courtyard is comfortable and pretty, the breakfast area is comfortable as a place to sit Hotel staff is helpful. Breakfast is wonderful, fresh fruits, pastries, bread and rolls, jams, cheese and ham and of course coffee and tea. A Delicious way to start the day. The left-over pastries are left out in the lobby for the guests to munch on during the day. The hotel is convenient to the rest of Barcelona. It is a short walk, 10 or 15 minutes to Placa Catalunya and from there to the Gothic Quarter as well as La Rambla. There is a bus stop right outside the door and two subway stations about three blocks away. Lots of restaurants nearby.
title: Wonderful Hotel

review: Friendly and welcoming staff, simple and trendy decor, clean room. Room and bathroom a little small. Non c'è il frigorifero. Luogo silenzioso. Posto ideale se frequenti la "lutier school ". Very Nice place.
title: Very Nice

review: The location of the hotel is very conveniently located close to Plaza Catalunya (the airport bus takes you there within 30 minutes). There are nice avenues and boulevards around with plenty of restaurants, gay bars and clubs. Las Ramplas is in walking distance. The staff was very friendly and always helpful. We were welcomed with a smile, a welcome drink and nice words. Whenever we had a question or passed by the reception, the statt was attentive.The room was very small, but okay for a short city trip (we stayed 4 nights). It is in an urban, but simple style. The window went to a small kind of a patio with no views at all. There was a constant noice of (probably) the air conditioning. However, closed windows kept noise outside quite well, Rooms towards the street are probably a lot louder.Unfortunately, the cleanliness of the room/bath room was not always impeccable, toilet paper and body cream had only been refilled after asked for.
title: Perfect location, very friendly staff, simple rooms

review: the welcome was very pleasent and wines were very good. the room was quiet and clean and cool with the airconditioning. nice bed. location nearby city centre. overall we were very satisfied with the room.
title: very good stay

review: I have chosen this hotel after the revies from tripAdvisor but this time unfortunately i expecting somthing else. Probably it's because of the room 510. It was in front the elevetor, so webfelt that everybody that was using the elevator were passing thrue our room, we had a view facing an inner hall, and we heard the peple from above showering. The room was so small that if you left the door from the bathroom oppened on your way out when you would return you would slam the entrance door in the bathroom door. It was the smallest room inever stayed in! The personell dosen't know Barcelona: we asked how we can get to Tibidabo they told usbit's very fay 90 mintes to get there and 3 different busses to catch. It took us 30 minutes with a direct bus from Placa Catalunia. We asked a different person how far is Sagrada church they said very far 40 minutes of walking, it took us 25 and we stoped for photos and snaks on the way. Sara is the only person from reception that can really help you out with competent and realistic information her wine suggestions were realy good and she was very friendly and nice. She suggeted Vinitus to eat and it was wright on spot we ate 3 times in 5 days. Thank you Sara!The Location off the hotel is great 5-10 minutes walk to Placa Catalunia, 2 minutes to Casa Batlo, 10 to La Pedrera. Over all i would not stay here again and not recomand it to my friends.
title: Less than expected.

review: Check in easy and nice staff. Provide parking validation at nearby garage, about a block away (30 euro discounted to 20 euro, if I remember correctly). Clean sleek room, with AC. Bathroom setup was a little odd because completely transparent shower door opens directly into hallway. There is a door you can shut to get some privacy between the hallway and the bedroom, but it means another person cannot use the hallway leading to the door. Was fine for our purposes, but slightly inconvenient (as I was traveling with my father). Breakfast is additional but only ~8 euro, and was very good. Overall great stay. Also offered a free welcome drink at registration.
title: Cute boutique, great staff, nearby parking discounted

review: Up until my last day I would have said I loved this hotel. It was clean, a great location, helpful front desk staff. I stayed here for 4 nights. On my last day I noticed money had been stolen from the safe in my room. Of course the hotel staff said this was impossible. I am 100% sure it happened. Being a solo traveller I keep close tabs on my money. I allow myself a certain amount each day and count my money every night. I was extremely upset and disappointed this happened and on my last day! Since I was catching a train early the next morning I didn't have time to report this to the police. I did fill out a complaint form at the hotel. Needless to say I wouldn't recommend this hotel. It was expensive to stay in and then I was robbed.
title: Money stolen from safe in room!

review: Everything was great about this hotel. Location is perfect, walking distance to Plaza Catalunya and Paseo de Gracia, and in the heart of a hip neighborhood with countless options nearby for good food and wine; staff was very friendly and helpful (especially Carlos); and rooms are functional and nicely decorated (tiny, but that's the rule in Europe). Breakfast could be better, I even thought it was complimentary since there is only fruit, bread, coffee and yogurt, but they charge you extra for it.
title: Fantastic hotel!

review: Perfect location, walking distance from the heart of Barcelona. The staff is super nice and friendly. Rooms are very clean not so big but average size for a city hotel. I gave 4/5 on "sleeping quality" because my room was on the street side and even if there are high quality windows you still hearing big trucks and buses.I definitely recommend it!!!
title: Great choice

review: The hotel has a great atmosphere, very friendly staff and is in a great location.We have booked to stay again when we return to Barcelona.Rooms are a little small but well set out so you don't notice. Highly recommend
title: Great Hotel

review: A very nice hotel in a good location to explore the neighborhoods just north of the city center. Easy walks to several Gaudi buildings (the cathedral is a bit of a hike). My 3rd floor single room was small and basic, but had a nice balcony over the street and the double glazed windows did a good job of keeping the noise out. The staff is very courteous and knowledgeable. Paying an additional 7 Euros for breakfast was worth it - the buffet is very extensive and there is indoor and outdoor seating. Nice complimentary glass of wine at check in.
title: Recommended

review: Small rooms (it is in the center after all) but clean and cozy. No pool or rooftop terasse. Nice personnel. Really nice how the wine theme is represented throughout the hotel. Vouchers for a glass of wine.
title: Excellent boutique-style hotel a short walk from Placa Catalunya.

review: Great discovery in Barcelona - perfect location, absolutely wonderful Reception staff! Friendly and very professional. Warm welcome with a glass of wine. Simple but clean and practical rooms. Will be back for sure
title: Wonderful stay!

review: I honestly loved everything about the hotel from the staff to morning breakfast. The location was excellent to explore the city from. Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone I know heading off to Barcelona.
title: Nice weekend getaway

review: You get what you expect with a small wine boutique hotel, great wine tastes, very welcoming and helpful staff. welcome wine + fast service.Rooms are very small but functional (need to get use to it), clean and comfortable beds.very reasonable breakfast, value for money (7 Euro per person).The hotel located close to Passig the Garcia/P. catalana/Rambla st. and there are a choice of good restaurants close by. For my next visits in Barcelona, most probably will look for this place....
title: Great Boutique hotel located perfectly! clean rooms and great service.

review: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We throughly enjoyed our stay and would return again. We had the family room on the ground floor which was really well arranged to maximise space. Only drawback was that it was quite noisy later in the evening. Staff were excellent. Good value for money in a great location.
title: Great hotel, a little noisy

review: The staff at the hotel is excellent. So helpful and friendly. The location is great and there is a lovely garden. Cons: the garden area closes at night and the rooms are quite small for the price paid. More suited for couples rather than friends.
title: Cute boutique hotel

review: Centrally located with but well soundproofed windows. Clean and modern rooms with very helpful reception staff with good local knowledge who were happy to keep our bags after checkout to continue our exploring until we went to the airport. I'd be happy to stay here again.
title: 2 Nights break in Barcelona

review: The hotel met all of our expectations. The room was clean and roomy. The service was top-notch. They even got us a cab that we needed at 4:00am. The hostess gave us great places to eat nearby. We have nothing but good things to say at this hotel.
title: Great Stay.

review: We stayed here for one night, and were very impressed with the hotel. The price / quality ratio is great and everything is clean, stylish and very modern and chic. The terrace is beautiful, the welcome drinks were great and the staff was very helpful! We will definitely stay here again.
title: Great stay at Praktik Vinoteca

review: Hotel where I was not during the day had al the things I needed.I did not use breakfast, but what I saw looked good.Rooms are simple, clean and the beds are of good quality!Garage was nice to get the rental bikes in.All I needed for a comfortable stay at Barcelona!
title: Pieter verschuur

review: It was a pleasure to stay at Hotel Praktik Vinoteca.Staff is very friendly and helpful!Rooms are clean and everything is at hand.Breakfast is great! A good variation of food (sweet, savory, ...).Wines are delicious! It is really relaxing to drink a glass of wine/cava at the terrace!Location is great, we had the feeling we were in the middle of all 'monuments'!Highly recommended!
title: Great hotel, great location!

review: We stayed at this hotel in June of this year. The attention and service in general were excellent, especially the dedication and attention of Nuria. Geographically this is very close to emblematic places, Metro stations, a few minutes walk from the city center and surrounded by good restaurants. Recomendamos este hotel 100%. We recommend this hotel 100%. No doubt it will be the place where we will sleep on our next trip to Barcelona. A toast to Praktik Vinoteca Barcelona!
title: Excelencia el Vinoteca!

review: We decided to do a quick stop in Barcelona open browsing the hotels in the gay area, I came across rhis hotel that has a wine theme, boutique style and quite unique upon entering the lobby you will be ushered with a glass of bubbly and some pastries and while finishing your drink you can relax in the lobby and be entertain with their wine inspired deco. The hotelIs neat, clean, has a modern/ urban inspired interior. Guest agent was very helpful.This hotel is very close to the subway station , Aeroport bus stop, Sagrada familia ( the famous church UNESCO stamped ) and number of attractions, further,It's also close To gay bars and bathhouse.( 20 to 30 mins. Walk)Avenue and street name are found in the building's corner edge, sometimes it's hard to find/ navigate lol!
title: Sweet quick stop in Barcelona.

review: Lovely hotel, very nice staff. Room was small but had everything we needed. Excellent location, within walking distance of most everything we wanted to see, and the rest was easily done with the metro. Favorite part was definitely the wine-themed decor!
title: Loved the wine decor

review: We stayed for three nights at Hotel Praktik Vinoteca. It's one of the best hotels (when considering the price) that we've ever stayed in.The staff are so friendly and knowledgeable about local bars/ restaurants etc... they even printed off train timetables for us to get back to the airport. Nothing was too much trouble and all members of staff went above and beyond.The location was great, off a quiet street but so close to all the major attractions with some great local places to eat. The winebar is a great touch- such good value too!!Our room was small but we expected that. Perfectly functional too with a lovely big comfy bed.We usually like to try new hotels when coming back to a city, however we will definitely come back to this one next time we're in Barcelona. Would recommend it to anyone.
title: Cannot fault the place!

review: We really enjoyed our stay at Praktik Vinoteca. It was close to walk to a couple of the Gaudi buildings, as well as only a few blocks from the Rambla streets. There were lots of shops around. They let us store our bags with them when we were there before checkin and made an effort to get us a room as soon as possible. They welcomed us with a glass of wine and the whole hotel was nicely themed. Our only complaint was that our bed while comfortable was made up of two twin beds and at times we'd fall between the gap. I've never been to a hotel that did that before, it just seems cheap when they put so much effort into the rest of the hotel.
title: Great location, modern room, but single beds?

review: Well located clean and comfortable hotel. Excellent service at check in. Manger on duty very attentive and caring for us during our stay. Wine provided on arrival. Plus useful information with respect to the problem with Barcelona airport.
title: Clean, comfortable and well Located

review: Excellent location with great service. Reasonably priced rooms but on the small size. Our room was at the front of the hotel and had some road noise although this was not a problem for us I suspect it may be for some people.Highlight was the wine selection and cost, excellent for a city centre hotel. Nice touch was a welcome glass of wine at check in. Anybody who drinks wine, this is a great choice of hotel.
title: Great Wine

review: This hotel is perfect for a quick city break. We stayed for three nights. The location is perfect, so central. The hotel is very clean and staff friendly. The room was quite small and looked onto a wall which was a bit of shame. If I returned I would definitely pay more and ask for a balcony room. Breakfast was nice with fresh bread and pastries. The only thing I would say is that there is a lack of any savoury options apart from some ham and cheese.All in all a great hotel for a short city break and we would return.
title: Great hotel for a city break

review: We stayed at Vinoteka for 6 nights and we really enjoyed it. The location, breakfast and wine selection are great. The ladies at the reception desk very friendly and helpful. I would definitely come back.
title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

review: Loved this hotel and look forward to staying there when next in Barcelona! The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was quiet, clean with comfortable beds and a super bathroom with great shower.The wine theme decor was original and the quality of the welcoming glass of wine surprisingly good.
title: Very enjoyable stay.

review: The hotel is situated in the city center. It is very easy to get around as the transport and metro stations are a two minute walk. If you like walking it is also near enough to get to the gothic district on foot. The main Gaudi monuments, La Pedera and Casa Batllo, are just a couple of blocks walk away. The rooms in the hotel are spacious and comfortable. The owner is an archeologue and it is interesting to visit the mini museum on the first floor or to admire the pieces of his collection that decorate the modern rooms. The breakfast is excellent and the staff are friendly and professional.
title: Perfect for a city break

review: I can honestly say we had WONDERFUL service ...rooms were larger than I expected...the terrace bar is very nice , although small and if pool is what you want it is 'tight' but still quite nice. Drinks and food is a little pricier than on the street but consider the accommodations...I had a message at the spa...wonderful experience ....only complaint was it got hot in our room by late morning and didn't really cool off til evening..granddaughter's room next door was fine...but at night it was perfectly cool!!! I would DEFINITELY recommend this beautiful hotel!!!
title: LOVELY HOTEL

review: The staff speak perfect English, food on roof top superb. Pool too small. Kids took over. Rooms comfortable and spacious, beds lovely, clean. Centrally located. This is a must stay in Barcelona. Boutique style hotel, built behind the old facade. Modern, well equipped rooms.
title: Lovely hotel. Spacious rooms

review: Pretty building with great doorman. Room not made up by 5 pm on day 2. Thin walls and many missing details -- drawers not properly working, no hooks for towels, few outlets, drain broken, shower door improperly attached etc...Not worth the price.
title: Not so good

review: Fantastic location and a beautiful hotel. Staying here was a real treat from the simple things such as the exceptional courtesy of the staff to the chocolates placed on the pillows each night and free bottled water which appeared daily. The millennia old Ecuadorean figures in a display case were also an interesting quirk! Highly recommended - we will definitely look to stay here again.

This hotel is a member of the Leading Hotels of the World, which is usually a good sign. But not here. It was nearly impossible to sign into the internet. The phones were fancy, but not labeled so that I had to call the hotel from a cell phone to order a wake-up time.We were supposed to be entitled to special services, like early check-in and check-out, but in fact our check-in was after 5:00 PM and we got no early check-out. At breakfast, we had to order eggs from the waiter. We did, but they never came. There was a bright light shining in the window all night and there were no shades. (See picture). The elevator sometimes failed to stop even with the floor causing the users to trip as they exited. I needed to find a space to make a business call after checking out and some of the workers were positively nasty about providing it. We couldn't get a drink on the rooftop terrace as it was only for diners. We couldn't take advantage of a $50 credit for a similar reason.
title: Pretty building superficially nice people but fails to provide adequate services

review: Very nice hotel with rooftop pool. Wish there were more seats by the pool, can be crowded.Didn't use the restaurant, so can't tell you how it was, but the seating outside was not available for food service, only drinks. We woke up in the middle of the night because the staff was clearing dishes...not a good time to do that. But mostly very good, and convenient to sights, bus, taxi, etc.
title: July Barcelona

review: On booking this hotel a few months ago online directly with hotel website, I experienced an issue which on contacting the hotel was rectified quickly and pleasantly.Was emailed by the hotel a few days before our arrival asking if we had any special requests etc. We arrived earlier than 3pm check in and our room was ready. We were very lucky to be upgraded to a junior suite. Check in was quick and easy, and we were offered a lovely chilled glass of cava, which after a morning of traveling was very welcome.Our suite was on the 6th floor and was well laid out. Super duper comfy bed, with lots of pillows! Great bathroom with separate bath and large walk in shower, with The White Company toiletries.Fabulous rooftop terrace with lovely views, and a nice pool. Didn't swim or eat in the restaurant so can't comment. But had a couple of drinks and staff were quick and efficient, and cocktails were very good.Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend and stay here again
title: Wonderful stay

review: I really enjoyed my stay at this beautifully designed hotel. My room was gorgeous and one of the most unique I have stayed in. Spent some time at the rooftop bar and pool where staff were just perfect. Great place to cool off, have a drink and get ready for the evening. The best thing was their portier mobile phone. It acts as a hot spot for your mobile and I popped it in my bag and took it with me everywhere so I didn't need to worry about wifi or mobile roaming. It also had suggestions for restaurants shops and itineraries. Such a good idea hope to see more hotels provide this service.All of the staff - front desk, porters, cleaning etc were really friendly and helpful. So many choices in this wonderful city and I am glad I chose the Claris
title: Wonderful design rooms and staff

review: Absolutely fantastic experience staying with my young son at Hotel Claris! Check in/out was simple and all staff members were very attentive. Our room was perfect and the amenities were great. We took advantage of the pool daily where we appreciated the views, service and free available towels. The terrace restaurant was great. Location was ideal -- tonnes of restaurants/cafes nearby with a 10-15 walk to Placa Catalunya or Sagrada Familia. Great shopping very close by as well as a few 24 markets for whatever essentials you may need.The absolute best part of Hotel Claris was use of a phone that acted as my personal hot spot which allowed me to go by my day as if I was still at home -- emails, phone calls, etc. This is something I've never experienced at any hotel before and it was much appreciated.
title: Hotel Claris (July 14 to 20)

review: As my maiden name before getting married was "Claris" I was intrigued to stay here . From the number of pillows you get to choose for your perfect nights sleep to the the complimentary wine and expansive upstairs lounge area along with a perfect location one could not possibly be disappointed. Breakfast was ample and served by attentive staff. On arriving at the hotel you are greeted and treated like Royalty. Definitely 5* for us.
title: Sheer opulence

review: I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff were friendly and very helpful, the breakfast excellent and the room, whilst not large, was well designed. Good wifi but a bit slow to connect on occasions. The location is excellent to get around the city. The rooftop pool was also very pleasant even if it could be a bit crowded at certain times. Free entrance to the Egyptian museum was a bonusThe flaw was the bed, which was seemingly comfortable on first feel, but the springs either demonstrated that the bed was not in its first flush of youth or a better design should have been chosen.
title: Great hotel with one flaw

review: Never stay anywhere else except the Hotel Claris when in Barcelona.From the delicious breakfast to the high end designed rooms, and the rooftop pool and bar, it was a nice place to escape after a day of sightseeing and the heat. The neighborhood is very safe and enchanting. It is centrally located to the metro plus the local train system.
title: Awesome locations and customer service

review: A high quality hotel with very helpful & friendly staff. Great if visiting Barcelona,not too big with a lovely roof top bar & pool over looking the surrounding area. Excellent location for most sights,shops & restaurants.
title: A gem in the city

review: We spent four nights at Hotel Claris late February, 2017. The property and the employees were wonderful. The inside of the hotel and the rooms are all updated and modern. The beds were extremely comfortable and with the roll down shutters you will find yourself sleeping later than you want. We were able to walk everywhere including the Sagrada Familia, the market and Casa Battlo. There are coffee shops and restaurants very close by. There is a rooftop bar and restaurant that is very nice. We would stay there again if we return to Barcelona.
title: Early Spring Trip

review: Was there for a business conference for few days. Nice hotel with excellent location! Liked the breakfast and the rooftop bar. Service was a bit confused...Good but not great. All in all would stay again if in Barcelona because of the location.
title: Nice stay

review: A nice hotel, but not a 5* hotel.We booked a Junior Suite and were allocated room 517. This room has no view because it looks out onto a brick wall just a few feet away from the window. We could not even see any sky. We were also disappointed to discover it was just a very large room with a bed, sofa and a small table with 2 chairs. We have stayed in similar sized/equipped rooms in other hotels and this room would have been sold as an ‘executive’ room. The hotel description lists ‘Two flat screen LCD TV’s’ which implies you would have two separate rooms. In fact the room has just one TV, because it is just one room. The room is supplied with a Nespresso coffee machine, but because of the positioning of the few electric points in the room, we had to balance it beside the basin in the bathroom (the alternative would be to place it on the very small designer lump of wood that served as a bedside table or place the machine on the floor). The coffee machine comes with just 4 complimentary pods and after that you are expected to pay 3 Euro’s for any additional coffee pods.The bed was comfortable, but a good night’s sleep was not achievable because the walls were very thin and noise/conversations from the neighbouring rooms and corridor were clearly audible. On Monday our neighbours had an early morning wakeup call at 6am – we really appreciated that! We also appreciated the children of another family ringing the doorbell to our room and running away!The shower got top marks but then lost a few because the hidden pipe work became noisy during peak periods. The hotel were not able to resolve this issue during our stay.The most amusing part of our stay, was a call from the customer relations the day before check out to ask if we appreciated the hotel/room. Of course, we expressed our disappointments and was then asked,‘Would you like a wakeup call tomorrow morning, to make your experience with us even better?’, ‘No, we don’t want a wakeup call, and that would not make our experience with you even better. We are disappointed with the room’Customer relations response was ‘OK. Goodbye’.We won’t be staying at Hotel Claris again.
title: Disappointed

review: We loved the Hotel Claris, and found the position to be perfect for shopping and sightseeing. Spacious room and bathroom and very good service. Breakfast was great, and the location was great for walking and exploring Barcelona. An easy city to navigate, and the Claris was a nice spot to return to at the end of a busy day. Would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Great hotel in a fabulous position, close to shops and attractions!

review: We stayed at the Hotel Claris for the last night of a 5 day trip. The location is killer (shops, restaurants, attractions), staff informative and helpful and amenities terrific. We sat on the roof top for a couple drinks to end the night/trip and it didn't disappoint!
title: All in a days stay

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Great value and llocation. We enjoyed our stay because everything felt right. The rooms were comfortable clean and very nice. A little small but space by beds but we made it work. Bathrooms very nice and hotel smelled super every time you were in lobby. Staff terrific
title: Super place

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We recently stayed 3 nights at this hotel, we found everything was excellent. From the staff, to the rooms, to the bar, there was nothing not to like. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. We were able to walk to most attractions and took advantage of the "hop on - hop off" buses to tour the area, given we had limited time in Barcelona.
title: Central Location

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a short break to Barcelona. The hotel was in an excellent location just 2 minutes from La Rambla and 5 minutes from Place De Catalunya. Lots of shopping, bars and restaurants nearby and also close to lots of sightseeing opportunities. Lovely and clean with an amazing smell to the hotel (they must blow something through the aircon but it was a treat to walk into each and every time!), friendly staff, and absolutely gorgeous decor and construction. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.
title: Beautiful hotel in an excellent location

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Enjoyed two nights at this hotel. Booked two rooms for a family of four. Both with balconies overlooking the courtyard. Nice to have a pool available for a swim after visiting. Room size good, staff very nice. Would easily recommend to other travellers.
title: Great Location

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: We stayed here for 4 nights from Wenesday 21st June to Sunday 25th June 2017In the Gothic quarter of Barcelona. Catalunya Plaza Area.This hotel was very good, staff were really helpful, giving directions on where to go and what to see. Map was provided of local sights. Many good Restaurants reasonably priced nearby, for both Breakfast and Dinner. Both also available from the hotel.Metro 200 metres away as was direct Airport Bus to and from every 15 minsLa Rambla nearby in parallel street. Highly Recommend Jasmine and Peter Gilkes Adelaide SouthAustralia
title: Location Location Location

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: A lovely hotel in a great location, close to the Las Ramblas and on the door step of a busy shopping strip. It was wonderful escaping the heat, noise and crowds by walking through the front doors and through to the lush courtyard pool area. The rooms were stylish and clean. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Oasis in the middle of the Barri Goti

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The hotel is excellently located with most touristy sites within walking distance. It is also next close to Placa Catalunya for excellent metro and bus services. The hotel itself has a wonderful lobby and room was perfect for our needs. We didn't eat in the restsurant but had a very good light dinner in the bar area. The staff were very friendly and always happy to help especially with directions. The hotel also stored our luggage on the day we were leaving which was very useful.
title: Excellent location and friendly staff

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: The staff here is the best! They went above and beyond to help us out with some difficulties (not of their making) that came up for us while visiting Barcelona. The breakfast is abundant and scrumptious in a lovely exterior setting by the relaxing pool & lounge area. Elegantly decorated & very clean, with rooms that have eveything you would desire in the perfect location in beautiful Barcelona!
title: Felt like royalty!

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel is really in an excellent location, close to the Plaça Catalunya (metro, buses around the city, and bus to the airport) and the old town (El Gothic). It was so easy to get to all of the main areas either by walking or using the bus / metro. Comfortable room, with air con, and free water every day. A really great breakfast buffet, which set us up for the day. There is also a pool if you need a dip. Friendly staff who spoke really good English and were happy to help.
title: Great Hotel - Central Location

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Great experience, friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet with a wide variety in choice!The rooms are clean and practical.And finally the hotel has an excellent location close by metro stations, the Rambla's and the shops.
title: Our stay in Barcelona

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Imagine my amazement when shown to a room with no window to the outside, only a small one in the room entrance looking on to the hotel corridor. Without lights, the room was pitch dark. I know that converting old buildings into hotels is complicated, but it seems corporate greed knows no bounds.
title: Room with.... No window!

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: My daughter and I called this hotel home for a week in June 2017. Our room was fine but warm at night. I keep my house very cool so I hesitate to judge. The staff was very accommodating, the bartender, Camillo, promised me the best mojito of my life and he delivered. Located on a pedestrian shopping street, there was easy access to buses and taxis. Las Ramblas was within walking distance as was the Gothic quarter. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Location, Location, Location

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: Realy silent hotel.Nice decoration.Very near from cathedral and historic center, but difficult to found nice restaurant very near. Bus for aeroport is at five minute walk. Computer available, but printer realy slow.
title: So quiet place !

hotelLocation: Avenida Portal de l'Angel 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
review: This hotel has a great location with a lovely pool and outside area! However, my stay here was ruined by having 50 euros stolen from my purse inside my room. We left the room for the evening and when we got back my purse had been emptied of the euros I had in it. The worst part about this was the response I got from the staff when I informed them of the theft. They were extremely rude towards me, claiming I must be making this up as no one would have been able to enter the room. It was extremely accusatory and not how anyone should expect to be spoken to as a guest in a hotel. For this reason I will not be returning, nor would recommend this hotel highly. The only thing I will recommend is to use the safe in the room!
title: Stolen money, use the safe!

review: Overall very pleasant. The staff is very kind and helpful! Just ask for help or directions and they will help you in any way you need. The room was large, bright, and clean. The hotel lies within walking distance of everything but not right in the middle of the most touristed areas. The nearby neighbourhood is very nice, full of small streets with bars and cafés where the locals also turn up.
title: A very good experience.

review: Beautiful hotel in an excellent location. I would happily recommend staying here to anyone. While the room itself and the hotel's facilities were excellent, the service was truly exceptional. Amazingly helpful staff who went above and beyond to create an unforgettable experience, special thanks to Paula for looking after my girlfriend so well on her birthday, very thoughtful.
title: The Personal Touch

review: Paula,the day staff, was fabulous and very helpful on day to day activities around citytrouble with the electricity keeping up! Two days were with out power fir prime times ..overall a great safe place to stay
title: Barcelona abroad

review: The hotel is abit far from town but it's very accessible. the front desk hotel staff is very friendly. It's very quiet and nice neighbourhood. Near to park guelle and it's about 20 mins walking distance to the park
title: Nice boutique hotel

review: Recently stayed with my family of 5 in the hotel. Overall good hotel, but nothing special. Check in was great and they even allocated us rooms next to eachother so there was a connecting door between us which was great. The rooms were excellent. They looked great, had space, was clean, large beds, the shower was great. We faced no issues with the rooms, perhaps the triple room could slightly have more space. Wifi was offered but VERY slow and poor, one night completely disconnected. Breakfast was overrated. Not many vegetarian options, and there were no teabags, which isn't required but would have been nice. Otherwise, it was ok.The staff overall were very nice, special thanks to Paula who helped us navigate around, showing us metro routes/attractions and generally being extremely welcoming and kind!! We did ask a man at reception at night time for any maps or leaflets and he seemed disinterested in telling us any, even though the next day Paula had many.Location was okay, only 3 metro stops from Catalunya, the tourist central area but it could have been closer if you are looking to be directly in the centre centre e.g. on Las Rambla. However. I just thought it was extremely overrated at 80 out of all the hotels in Barcelona. There was nothing particularly special about it, it was a good hotel but not amazing.
title: Good but overrated!

review: nice small hotel. Stayed there with family for 1 week between 15.07.17 - 20.07.17.Clean. The staff at the desk friendly and helpful. Above all the breakfast was very good - thanks to the 2 young ladies who always made sure to give the best they could. Would recommend a microwave cooker for improvement.
title: Nice small and friendly hotel

review: Fantastic, clean and stylish hotel in Grasia Barcelona, the very friendly staff are really helpful, the lobby area is a great place to work and relax. I am looking forward to coming back this September.
title: Fantastic hotel, very friendly staff, look forward to coming back this September.

review: Need tea coffee electric kettle in the room , breakfast was too basic. Nothing special .Wifi was poor , no tea bags in breakfast , average over rated hotelHowever nice place, nice staff like Paula, clean rooms.
title: Over rated hotel

review: The best check-in ever - information about hotel as well as Barcelona must-see, offer for a reservation of restaurants. The black board at the entrance with recommendations for brunches, dinners, festivals etc. (we tried some and it was so good :) Very helpful and friendly staff. Shared "hangout" area at the reception with a bookcase and free water, (loose!) tea, and coffee. Nice modern desing and light furniture. Really big double bed with big double blanket, 2 pillows per person. Room cleaning every day. The room had a window to the street so it was quite noisy even at night. Great location (for us) - still in the city, close to public transport but not in the crowded city center. Breakfasts available on daily base demand even if you book only a room. Good and stable wifi connection. We had some payment issues caused by a hotel system but the staff was very willing to handle those situations and successfully solved them immediately.
title: The best check-in ever

review: Stayed for 4 nights in July 2017. Location was excellent for me as near to the office. Plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. Huge bed and excellent air con for the warm nights you often get in Barcelona. Staff very friendly and most helpful. Highly recommended.
title: A very comfortable stay

review: Absolutely fantastic hotel, service was great and the room and communal areas were a great standard. Exactly how it looks online. Really good location out of the main tourist area, lovely restaurants within walking distance. Highly recommend.
title: Pol and Grace

review: Stayed at Pol and Grace during summer 2017 with friends. Hotel is clean and has very basic amenities which reflects their price. Small Fridge in our room did not keep anything cool. Room was cleaned daily and toileteries topped up. Air conditioning not brill. Hotel staff especially on reception were very helpful and informative ( Sasha and co thank you ) .
title: Basic hotel in plaza molina

review: The hotel is located just a few steps from the center of Barcelona, which is great. The staff was extremely kind and they helped us in everything. The room was clean and the bed was made by the time we got back. So I loved it. The only thing that bothered me was the noise. Because the walls were thin we heard the people in the room next to us and we also heard the scooters from the streets. Anyways, I give 5 stars!
title: Little bit noisy but great place to stay for a few days!

review: Staff were very friendly and helpful. They knew the local area very well and they made our stay very enjoyable. Breakfast was varied and there was a good range of food. Overall this was an extremely welcoming and comfortable hotel!
title: Excellent service

review: We stayed at Pol & Grace for a week at the end of July. Everything with our stay went smoothly. Pol & Grace is a small, modern hotel located in a more quiet, neighborhood area located ideally next to the Molina Metro stop (only 3 stops to Pl. Catalunya - very quick each time) and the bus stop for V15 to Barceloneta (beach). The hotel interior appears as pictured on their website, with a sitting area in the lobby, free coffee and water, with other drinks available at cost. Each morning an incredible breakfast is set out that ranges from fresh fruits, cheeses, yogurt, granola, local meats and breads, and with instructions of how to make traditional bread with tomato and olive oil. The staff was very attentive, available and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.
title: Wonderful small hotel!

review: Only one night stay but all as can be expected. Nice casual but very efficient style. smooth check-in and check out. Comfortable room and great breakfast. Location is convenient for town as well as travel to and from airport
title: Excellent stay

review: There are two things I look for when picking a hotel: location and bathroom cleanliness. And then there is the worthiness of the price I would have to pay for that. I'd say Pol & Grace hit the marks.Location-wise, it's not in the center of town but the metro station (L6 & L7) is right on the same block. Have had visited Barcelona already, I was very happy with this location as it is situated in a cute residential area, where I could walk with locals, pet their dogs, and just see the everyday, unembellished shops, restaurants and small parks. But you are not in any way missing out of the goods. There are quite a few restaurants near by that are really well rated and fully packed at night. Even with the metro near by, we walked home from Plaça de Catalunya anyway on many occasions for fun.The staff were all very friendly, the kind of friendliness you get from a friend who is hosting a dinner party, so you feel welcomed as you walked in.The size of the room and bathroom was in the Goldilock zone, and furnishing was well maintained. We were very comfortable. Bedding was great, towels were in great condition. Bathroom cleanliness was as expected. Really, no complaints. I'll just upload some pictures to reflect my words.
title: No Complaints

review: This hotel gives the vibe of a family owner business, although I don't know if that is the case or not. The front desk staff is outstanding and as helpful as they can possibly be. The room we had was small, but comfortable. The morning breakfast was excellent, and we took full advantage of it every day of our stay. The location on a small side street was perfect. We had easy access to cabs and 1/2 block to a subway station. Several restaurants or bars were within a short walk, as was a small supermarket and a laundry. I would stay here again if we return.
title: Pol & Grace Review

review: The Pol&Grace Hotel is recently renovated and a great place to stay. It is located a bit north of the center of Barcelona, in an upscale residential area. Great, friendly staff; nice lobby with free coffee at any time! Excellent and clean rooms; comfortable bed and bathroom. Very good breakfast. The center of Barcelona is accessible by bus or metro - about a 30 minute stroll. Nice to be away from the busy center, if you want. Good variety of restaurants in the neighborhood from fast food to upscale and trendy.
title: Great hotel, great location

review: The hotel has Friendly staff, is in a good location, with clean and fresh rooms. I lIke the decoration in the rooms. I visit Barcelona regularly and Pol and Grace is always my first choice. There is a wide variety for breakfast. Well worth it.
title: Great hotel

review: This place was very nice and the rooms were clean. Was in a quieter area but subway is close by to get closer to the activities. Staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great kept us going for the entire day.
title: Would recommend

review: In general the hotel is OK. The people at reception are not very helpful, I called twice in advance to check on storing our baggage and parking and both answers were not very helpful (if you don't offer the service at least give another option. WIth the exception of Paula who went above and beyond to find transportation to the airport (taxi strike in Bcn) and Xavi who also was collaborative when they couldn't find our reservation and created a new one (I had an email with the number) the personal was not that helpful. We arrived driving from France with a 5 year old and many bags and they didn't even stand up to help, so we had to carry all our bags into the lobby and our room. They kept looking at their computers (with no other passengers to attend), while we did this. I think the hotel still needs some adjustments (leaking ceiling at lobby, key cards deactivated daily, etc.). We don't think we will return, but we recommend it if you are in your 20's or traveling alone.
title: Just OK

review: Me and my husband stayed here 21-24 July and we booked after reading others reviews. Hotel is great. Exactly as per the pictures on the website. Good location. Very closr to the metro which will take you to la ramblas in 15 mins. And you can walk to some other attractions within 20-30 Minutes. Theres a few supermarkets nearby and restaurants to choose from. Staff were very helpful at the hotel. Especially paula.
title: Nice,clean, safe, welcoming stay

review: We had the misfortune in encountering a taxi strike the day we left Barcelona and would probably have missed our flights had Paula not alerted us to the problem and arranged a solution. This hotel is close to the Gracia neighbourhood which is a great place to eat and explore and is only 100m away from the Metro which takes you to Place Catalunya which is central. Stayed at this hotel for a week and was totally rested,
title: Great Desk Service. Comfortable Modern Room

review: Well located, clean, very helpful and friendly staff. Only negative remark is related with window insulation to outside/ street noise during the night. Nice touch the free water/coffee/ tea in the lobby area.
title: Good stay

review: We felt at home the minute we arrived :) we have never been treated so well in any hotel ! The staff are fabulous (Paula and Cesar were great), the rooms all have a personal theme that is fantastic and the breakfast was tasty ;) Can't recommend this hotel highly enough.
title: We felt at home :)

review: All the staff was more than nice and happy to assist with you name it... We had a major problem with the flight vs the hotel, and they helped us with all:Booked a hotel for the first day, and didn't charge us for the last day, a thing they didn't have to do - but they did it!I want to thank them for all of that, and for the great stay we had
title: Great people

review: I realised that I had lost my currency when I reached the airport for late flight home having spent most of the day around the hotel.Telephoned them the next day and they had found it,asked some Questions about amount and sent it by courier within a week.This was our 3rd visit and will be returning next year. Hotel could do with a bit of freshening up paint wise,otherwise perfect!
title: Wonderful staffday

review: While the entrance and lobby are wheelchair accessible, you will not be able to access the view from the rooftop lounge unless you can climb steps as the elevator does not reach that level. The elevators can only fit one wheelchair at a time as both are quite small. Breakfast is offered downstairs and the staff will offer to help bring items to your table. As for the rooms, the full size bed was the right height but only one side could fit the wheelchair. The bed was just okay as far as comfort. The room is pretty tight as far as maneuverability. However, a small manual wheelchair can turn around but a power wheelchair might have difficulty unless you move furniture. The bathroom was even more tight, but it did have one grab bar near the toilet and one grab bar in the glass enclosed shower. They did not have a fold down shower bench but did provide one to use for the stay.
title: Wheelchair Friendly but Tight Fit for Maneuverability.

review: This hotel is in a wonderful location in Barcelona. Rooms, albeit small, are extremely clean and the staff at reception are great with advice regarding transport and general enquiries. The range of food at breakfast was good and very fresh and the rooftop bar is a great location to wind down after a lot of walking, which Barcelona lends itself to.The only downside is that it takes a little while to get used to the rumblings from the underground, however after a couple of days we barely noticed it. At no time was the noise bad enough to affect our sleep.
title: Great location, pleasant hotel

review: Arrived before midday but our room was ready. The front desk staff were very helpful and also gave us some very relaible tourist advice.The room was on the small size and I'm not sure that I would want a long stay in that room but for a city break it was fine. The bathroom was well set up and well equiped.The public rooms in the hotel are stylis and comfortable. The roof top terrace bar was great place to end the day.Highly recommended.
title: Great base for a city break

review: after a weeks cruising, it was reassuring to arrive in this luxurious hotel.a quirky and posh reception, with a relaxed atmosphere.rooms were well equiped, clean and fresh and quiet - this was a concern as location is excellent ( parallel to La Rambla ) and can often be a trade off - but we had excellent sleep and were well rested....great street view of cathedral over the road. a nice boutique hotel thats private, with good service and attention to detail.
title: as good as hoped...

review: The hotel is well placed close to the old part of the city and a short(ish) walk to the harbour; there is a Metro station directly over the road from the hotel. The reception area is fairly traditional but the rest of the hotel has been well modernised.Staff generally were welcoming and helpful; facilities were as you would expect - breakfast was a generous buffet, with warm croissants and fress orange juice delivered to your table (as well as the buffet).
