Last, but not least: Hotel1898 has the finest roof terrace and restaurant I've attended so far.
title: July 2017 in Barcelona

review: Overall the hotel is tremendous. I did not give a 5 for a couple of reasons. The front desk staff is not very friendly and, in particular, Francesc was condescending both on the day we checked in, and the day we checked out. Overall, that did not affect our experience much, but it is something they could work on none the less. Also, the housekeeping staff was very pleasant, but only 3 of 6 days did we have turndown service, which, again, not a big deal, but is part of the price. Also, two of the days, we returned from our long day outside the room and at 5pm, it had not been made up. This was annoying because the cleaning cart was camped outside our room, all day, everyday--yet our room is last? I tip the cleaning service everyday, so it could not be that. It probably explains our difficulty on the first day. We got there at 11 and asked if early checkin was possible. The woman at the desk said, "the cleaning people are outside your room now, so it should be an hour or less." Well, we came back in an hour and a half, still not done. This was the time she reminded us, in a teachy, condescending way, that check-in time is 3pm. Uh, we know, you told us we could check in earlier. So, we left and came back at around 230, still not done. This is when Francesc mansplained that the check in time was 3. So, we knew that and if you had told us at 11 that it was firm, we wouldn't have checked back twice. But, on a positive side, the room was gorgeous . The staff and pool on rooftop bar is great. Many hours spent reading, swimming etc. up there. The grotto pool is peaceful and very therapeutic. We walked to almost everything we wanted to do or took very inexpensive cab rides. Our hotel was so convenient that we could do a thing, come back, rest etc, and do another thing later. Also, the bell staff was tremendous. Alex , in particular, was friendly, attentive, got us cab to airport on last day and...key, pushed the button for my floor when coming home at 1030 with gelato in both hands to bring to the room! Gelato open till 11 across the street!. Anyway, highly recommend the hotel. the beginning comments are more to suggest they work on that. I received an email from the hotel for a survey. I did it online and when I finished, I got a message that someone from that room on those dates had already responded. Hmmmm....myself and Francesc had a bit of a discussion on the check out in which his lack of people skill surfaced again. I wonder if he filled it out for me?
title: Mother/daughter vacation

review: Good pool area and the spa was excellent friendly staff good hotel would stay there again clean close to the port and shops great restaurants all in walking distance, buses and taxi are easy to catch train stations is a 5 minute walk most off the attractions are in walking distance
title: Excellent

review: Amazing hotel, staff and location. Value for your money. It is very quite and relaxing although located on the ramblas. The bed and pillows were amazing and had the best night sleep in a hotel ever! The staff is very friendly and speak perfect English. Facilities are great and they inform you about every possibility. Twice a day cleaning. On arrival complimentary fruit basket. Only thing missing is a walk-in shower. Is the only minor point I can think of!
title: Maybe the best hotel in Barcelona city

review: First the positive. Nicely decorated, modern hotel located right on La Rambla in the thick of all the energy. Lobby has lots of couches to hang out and read, play cards or whatever. There is a rooftop pool with killer views of the city. The hotel staff are all nice and helpful. Second, the negative. We were given a courtyard facing room on second floor. It was dark. Dark. Dark. When I opened the drapes, I was staring into the room across from ours, which was close enough to throw popcorn into the occupant's mouth. The bathroom was small and my wife was unhappy with the hairdryer which was incredibly weak and a waste of energy. Bring your own or suffer wet hair. The gym was tiny, and for those who lift weights kind of a joke. One set of dumbells with the heaviest at 10kg. A couple treadmills and a stair master rounds it out. It was clean but inadequate. On the bright side there were fresh towels and free bottled water. There was also a cave-pool-like-thing in spa area which seemed interesting and unique.
title: Beware courtyard facing room;fitness score 5/10

review: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1898 for 5 nights in June. We both loved this hotel. Here's some highlights:staff - very accommodating, helped with restaurants, museums and tours, but a bit surprised they don't have a conciergelobby area - spacious and elegantlocation - perfect area right on Las Ramblas, within walking distance to many great restaurants, short walk to the Gothic Quarter, 25 minute walk to the waterfrontrooms - stayed in one of the least expensive rooms available - the Classic. It was larger than many rooms we've had throughout Europe. Great bed and pillows, nice wood floors, marble bathroom, big window, faced an interior courtyard, nice and quiet restaurant - only ate there for breakfast which was included with our room, excellent variety of dishes, eggs cooked to orderrooftop bar and pool - a nice touch, lots of lounging sofas, beautiful view of the city spa area - what a treat! an oasis on the basement level, had an indoor pool (usually I don't like indoor pools - this one was really nice, very "spa-like" with a nice atmosphere), steam room and sauna and small workout room. didn't have any spa treatments, but my husband used the workout room and we both swam and used the co-ed steam room every single day. so relaxing and a nice way to end a bust day of sightseeing!
title: Beautiful Hotel in Perfect Location

review: Rude staff. No care or thought put into service or treatment of guests versus bar customers. I saw sat in the back corner of the terracing facing a wall while many other tables were open. No flexibilty of reception to do late check out. Maid's singing loudly in hallway. No latenoght room service, even for ice or water. TV didn't work well. No help with Taxi's outside. Restaurant food improperly cooked and service slow.
title: Worst hotel in BCN

review: We stayed here for one night in November for my birthday, a surprise from my partner. It was perfect, amazing location right in the heart of las ramblas. The rooftop pool and bar is gorgeous giving great views of parts of the city.The room was nice, with a big bed and a lovely bathroom. Not the biggest room I've ever seen but more than big enough!The staff were friendly and helpful, offering us tips and advice for restaurants and places to visit.Would 100% return in the future.
title: Perfect location and wonderful hotel

review: Absolutely loved this hotel!!! Location - perfect central hub on the bustling La Rambla - a stones throw from Placa de Cataluyna and full of energy!!Hotel - beautiful!! colonial decor but in a very contempary chic way.Rooms - we booked a privilege room, I think 421?? it was a great sized corner room overlooking La Rambla, huge bed and so comfortable!! bathroom was a very good size and nice powerful shower.Roof Terrace - stunning!! my wife and I spent a day on the roof sunbathing and drinking one of the many great cocktails!! we then met our friends in the evening when they got back from sight seeing (was their first time in Barcelona but our 5th so we opted out in favour of relaxation) and had dinner there too - food was exceptional - we had a mixture of the menu and shared which was a good way of getting to taste a good variety.Breakfast - really good selection with great service.Staff - Each and every member of staff is a credit to the hotel!! they always smiled, said hello, asked how we where or how our day was… concierge and reception staff where exceptional - great restaurant recommendations which they managed to get us reservations for last minute and in very busy establishments - I will review separately but, PLA restaurant (incredible) and Canete (Crazy Tapas restaurant with unbelievable food and atmosphere) where amazing…We was all so impressed with H1898 - everything about it makes it truly worth its 5 stars and more!!! Thanks for a great stay!!!
title: They should change the name to H10/10

review: Our family booked 3 rooms in July and stayed over for 5 nights at Hotel 1898 to discover Barcelona. We greatly enjoyed our stay at Hotel 1898. The location is perfect, we could easily walk to most places of interest, and find restaurants walking distance. The children loved going to the pool after a long day out and about, to relax and cool down. The rooftop bar had wonderful vistas. The staff was really welcoming and knowledgeable. Nice lounge area. Fantastic spa. The hotel is very well maintained and very clean. On our last day we were treated to a Gothic Quarter free tour by the hotel which was really interesting. Only downside was getting a bit of street noise since it is in a lively area. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel and would love to come back ourselves.
title: Great location and amenities!

review: I don't know where to start.I just love everything about this hotel...The decoration is absolutely amazing, a colonial touch ,the wood is everywhere, the lobby is just beautiful, the sofas are sumptuous..The room was just spot on.Very very friendly and helpful staff.The breakfast was just great! U can sip a cocktail in the rooftop while watching Barcelona by night..You see, I really enjoyed my stay in H1898!!!I really want to go back there soon!!
title: Just love it...

review: We love this hotel. It is stylish, the staff are great, the location on Las Ramblas couldn't be better, the rooms are extremely comfortable - especially the pillows - and there is a lovely pool and rooftop bar. What's not to like?
title: Just as good as last time

review: This is an elegantly comfortable hotel.Everything was understated yet memorable.Like a psychic courtyard haven from the bustling and centrally located Blvd Las Ramblass(sic?) The staff were particularly wonderful and truly attentive.A sign of a very fine management team. We have free breakfasts in our travel agents packet and it was the finest breakfast we have had in Europe. Wifi was free❣This made traveling with computers iPhones and iPads particularly effortless.Its dining room staff is amazing but for those who rush out early there is a Starbucks on the corner and a very fine bar and grill on the same corner. highly recommend this hotel it's near the Market and walking distance to treasures like El NaionelMy husband came earlier for a conference and we were upgraded for the duration of our stay with a Deluxe suite.A perfectly appointed and well run hotel.Two pools that our grandkids enjoyed and a beautiful rooftop terrace bar that had very tasty offerings and fabulous non alcoholic drinks that were very refreshing at the full service bar.
title: Hotel 1898 Perfect for This Century Old world Perfection in Modern Garb

review: Easy walking distance to many interesting spots in Gothic section of city. Friendly, helpful staff and comfortable rooms make this hotel a winner. Not able to take advantage of the spa but will try on my next visit.
title: Perfect Location in Barcelona

review: We stayed here for a week following time in Lisbon and Porto, Portugal in September 2015. We were in Barcelona during La Merce just by chance - we were unaware of this festival at the time we booked our trip a year earlier. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very nice. We thoroughly enjoyed ending our day with a nightcap at the rooftop lounge - view were spectacular and we loved the vibe. We did eat here one evening and the food was tasty as well. The one and only downfall was the hotel is over the underground train and it definitely shakes the hotel. We did have to change our room after the first day or two and it was much better. I have to say despite this we would definitely stay here again.
title: Perfect Location and Loved the rooftop restaurant/lounge!!!

review: My partner and I booked this hotel a couple of months ago on Expedia. We both agree it was an absolute steal!! Beautiful rooms. Very lovely staff. Amazing roof terrace and pool. We felt very lucky staying here and if made our holiday even more special. Cannot recommend this city and this hotel enough!!And definitely book to have the breakfast on the roof terrace one morning - it made for an exceptional final morning in this glorious city!!!
title: Perfect holiday!

review: I booked this hotel hoping to enjoy our first experience in Spain to be a memorable one and it sure was an unforgettable horrible experience! The manager greeted us by stating "you have 3 rooms booked". I stated "no, I tried booking the room twice, but couldn´t, so my husband booked it and he finally received an email confirmation¨. The manager charged me for the 3 rooms even though I never received an email confirmation for the room! Horrible customer service. The manager was rude to us and said there was nothing wrong with his computer system and I must have booked 3 rooms for my family when clearly I stated we were there for our anniversary. The hotel was nice, but the manager made this experience unforgettable and horrible. The area is also very loud and dirty. Stay in L"Example district..much nicer!
title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

review: We absolutely loved this hotel, but first I want to talk about the staff, who went above and beyond to make this trip great. At check in we mentioned to Monika that we were traveling for my husbands birthday, so they upgraded us to a room with a great view of Las Ramblas. We arrived a little before 12, expecting to store our bags and return at 3 to check in. Monika said they could have the room ready in a half an hour, so we left our bags and took a walk through the neighborhood. When we returned, our bags were already in our room and it was ready to go. Is there anything better after a long flight that an amazing shower? Well, this hotel has the perfect shower! Although the bed looked inviting at that point, Barcelona awaited. Monika had annotated a map for us to get our bearings (it was so helpful!) so we headed off. By the time we returned to the hotel almost 12 hours later, we we so ready to enjoy a long sleep in the hotel's amazing bed. The curtains are blackout and the lighting is completely adjustable, so we slept in until almost 10 am. The hotel is extremely quiet, despite being right where the action is. The next afternoon we spent on the rooftop deck, using the pool and having cava and snacks lounging on the Bali beds on the roof. Great views and yummy food, especially the tapas. We also utilized the spa/massage pool and sauna, which felt great on our aching muscles. This hotel doesn't miss a beat when it comes to customer service and all of those nice touches (robes, slippers, in room tea kettles, nice lighting, etc.) that jet lagged travelers appreciate. We can't wait to come back, to both Barcelona and the Hotel 1898.
title: A Charming Hotel in a great location

review: We booked 4 nights at this hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary & hoping for something special.The hotel was perfect -we booked a terrace room which is very stylish and the terrace is very spacious -overlooks the city & the street below has a couple of cafes where street musician pass.well work a visit for tapas. The hotel room is always very clean & tidy & having a champagne breakfast on the terrace was perfect.The pool area is a nice mixed and great for a relaxing afternoon but get there before 1pm as most go out in the morning and back for pm. Plenty of towels.The rooftop restuarant is very good also although on the night we booked a table the manager seemed to take a long time to recognise we were waiting (smile a little it helps) all the other staff are great & welcoming.Great evening thought & after dinner sat and had drinks .So chilled. Overall this hotel is perfectly situated to get everywhere in Barca and the hotel itself is excellent
title: Wedding anniversary fantastic

review: The Hotel 1898 on the La Rambla is a well-oiled machine. The staff is professional and courteous, and the building is grand. To me, however, the rest was lacking. I read another post where the reviewer said the hotel was lacking passion. I think that is a great way to describe it. I was genuinely disappointed, perhaps because I had expected something much better. And maybe because I've stayed in a phenomenal hotel in Barcelona and I had something else to compare it to. In the 2 times I've visited Barcelona, I've stayed at the H10 Cubik and the Hotel 1898, and I will say that I made the mistake of booking 1898 and not returning to the Cubik.The two hotels are relatively close in price. I think I paid around $300 for a room at the 1898, and the same weekend a room at the Cubik was around $265. Both hotels are within a 10-minute walking distance to Placa Catalunya, and all of the best sights. But, in my experience, the Cubik surpassed the 1898 in every way.I was returning to Barcelona after a side trip to Seville. I wanted to stay in the city for a couple of days before returning to visit friends about an hour outside the city. When my husband and I had traveled to Barcelona last Christmas Break, I had narrowed my search between the Cubik and 1898. I ended up choosing the Cubik. So, upon my return, I thought, why not try the other? I'm glad I only stayed two nights because I would have been sorely disappointed had we stayed the week there.I arrived around 9:30 off the AVE from Seville. Check-in was easy and the front desk employee was very pleasant and professional. I checked into my room on the fourth floor. It was dark, very warm, and had practically no view. They did, however, leave a nice welcome card and some desserts. I assumed the Air Conditioning was key activated, so I left my key in the slot, turned down the air to cool the room, and went up to the roof top to eat a late dinner.As soon as you step off the elevator you are almost accosted by the host of the restaurant. Are you a guest? What are you here for? They sat me at a bench table with a view of a darkened city (not at all what I had expected). The waiters all assumed I spoke English (as from what I gauge the majority of the guests use as their first language). I do speak English, but I also speak Spanish. I would've liked to converse in Spanish, seeing as I was in Spain, but never once did anyone ask for my preference. Even if I started the conversation in Spanish, the would often switch to English. Although, I wasn't 100% sure my waiter spoke Spanish. This was my first indication that I had picked a complete tourist trap. I guess I should've realized this before since the location is on La Rambla, but the hotel had such great reviews and pictures I tried it anyway. The meal on the roof was the most expensive meal I had in all of Spain. It was good, and the langostinos with tamarind sauce were delicious. I didn't finish the tomato bread (a first for me) because it was saturated in olive oil. I drank a $15 mojito and it was just ok.After dinner, I returned to my room. It was now around 11:30pm and I had an excursion leaving early the next morning. When I got to my room it was still a furnace. I called the front desk. They told me to turn down the thermostat, even though I told them I already did. She told me to look at the one in the closet. I hung up and saw that there was not another one in the closet. I called back. I waited 10 minutes for someone to return my call. An employee came up, reset the fuse, told me to wait 15 minutes and call back. I called after 15 minutes and told him it was still very warm. He told me to wait. He called after another 15 or so minutes and told me they would relocate me to another room for the night while they tried to fix the air. It was nearing midnight and I was exhausted after a long day of travel. He helped me carry my bags to a room on the third floor. It was a bit brighter than the previous, and fortunately, cooler. It also had an odor that smelled like standing water coming from the bathroom. I was so tired and didn't want to sound like one of those people who always complain, because that it definitely not me, so I just accepted the room. I asked him what I was supposed to do in the morning. He said I could take my luggage back to the old room or to the front desk because if they fixed the air they would put me back in the old room (where I had forgotten my welcome treats--I never did get to try them). I informed him that I'd be gone most of the day, and wasn't looking forward to returning and having to move rooms again. Could I not just keep this room? He said I could talk to them in the morning. He was very professional, and I think it probably wasn't his decision to make.So by 12:30, I was in bed, and already feeling regret over my choice of hotel. I will say that the bed was phenomenal. It was extremely comfortable and welcoming. There was a lot of technology in the room, but not a lot of it worked, notably the radio on the bedside. I decided to write an email to guest services in hopes that they would read it and understand the situation especially since I wasn't going to be there during the day.In the morning I advised the front desk clerk and she said I was fine to just stay in the current room and she was sorry. I did not elect to eat the $36 breakfast, and I went next door to Starbucks. Upon returning from my excursion I returned to my room but the key didn't work. It was still connected to the old room. I had to go back down and get it changed. The room still had a bad odor, and I found that high end toiletries did not include conditioner, which was a bit frustrating. Since they apparently cater to Americans, I would expect them to have conditioner. The H10 Cubik provided it.It was still bright outside so I decided to have a drink by the pool. Again, as soon as I got off the elevator, I was met with a waiter asking me (again in English) what I was doing. Was I guest? Was I going to the pool? A Drink? It was a little uncomfortable. The majority of the rooftop deck is the restaurant. The most picturesque portion included. So it's not like you can just lounge around at any old spot. The pool is a relatively small part. The actual pool was a decent size for Barcelona. The view is nice, but not nearly as nice as at the terrace of the Cubik. When I went back to my room, I heard a frustrated couple talking about how hot their room was. I assumed this was more of a widespread problem. For $300/night, you would think that this would not be an issue.So, again, I slept in the lovely bed, woke up the next day and checked out. The H1989 just left me with a bad taste in my mouth. I was definitely disappointed, especially for the level of luxury it markets itself as. If you want an amazing hotel in the heart of Barcelona with a comfortable, trendy rooftop, and a breathtaking view, go to the H10 Cubik not the 1898.
title: A Bit of a Disappointment

review: Fabulous hotel, not cheap but get what you pay for! Room was lovely and spacious (privilege double) and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, it was heaven! Booked direct with hotel and included breakfast in package and so glad we did as the breakfast was the best breakfast I've ever had, delicious fruits, ham, cheese, cakes, hot food, cava, it was endless..... The roof top pool was a welcome relief although jammed with guests in the afternoon and you are unlikely to get a bed or chair but doesn't stop you dipping in the pool. Drinks on rooftop are expensive. Service at hotel excellent and the lobby areas are beautiful. Great location as well for all the sights and despite being on the busy las ramblas, it was surprisingly quiet in the rooms at night. I would definitely stay here again although next time I would bring my own coffee for the room as the Nescafé cheap offering was pants!
title: Top hotel

review: We were pleasantly surprised when we walked into the hotel, late one night after our flight was delayed from Paris. We were even more surprised when we walked into our room and what a treat after our mediocre hotel experience in Paris. This hotel is really clean and gorgeous. The rooms are cozy, but that's pretty standard in Europe and other big cities. The breakfast is also really good. The selection is amazing and we really enjoyed everything about our stay here. If we return to Barcelona anytime soon, I would consider this hotel again. It was booked through Costco.
title: Beautiful Hotel

review: Incredible staff and beautiful hotel made for a memorable stay. The location is perfect to old quarter and La Rambla. Everyone in the hotel treated us special. The rooftop pool and bar were well appointed and well run.  Highly recommend!
title: Excellent hotel in Barcelona!

review: Stayed at the 1898 for three nights in May, my wife had been before and enjoyed Barcelona and the hotel so we returned together, The hotel is very nice we had a standard room and it was great, very comfortable bed.The Hotels roof bar and pool is really cool with some good views, we had dinner and breakfast here and the food and service is excellent, there is a good vibe in the bar at night time and it seemed popular with the young cool Barcelona crowdI would recommend this hotel and also return it is good value for the high standards you receive Oh Barcelona is quite nice too!!!
title: Awesome hotel in a great location

review: My partner and I wanted to visit a nice rooftop bar at La Ramblas for our anniversary and my 21st birthday. We had heard that Terraza La Isabela was popular as our family members are regular customers at the hotel and we have had many friends that have visited your hotel and bar.When we got there, we went to the reception at Hotel 1898 but there was no greeting and the man at the desk did not look up. He completely blanked us which was extremely rude. We then got his attention and asked where the rooftop bar was located. We went towards the lifts and another man asked us what we were doing. We said to him we were looking to go to the rooftop bar. He then grunted at us then looked me up and down before telling us 'no' and putting his hand up in a dismissive manner. There was no explanation and I was extremely offended by this. We were both dressed appropriately so we were very shocked. The service we experienced at this hotel was disgraceful and I would discourage anyone from going here. This ruined by 21st birthday and our anniversary.I think the staff at this hotel need to go on a customer service course and learn some manners.
title: Rude and Ignorant

review: So in May 2015 i was taken on a surprise trip to barcelona by my now husband and we stayed in hotel 1898 and this is where he proposed!! So now fast forward 2years later and we are just married there just over 5 weeks so we thought it would only be right if we went back for our mini-moon, well i just look this place and it will always have a special meaning to me! We stayed here for 4 nights and it is even more gorgeous and luxurious than i remember. Perfect location just step outside the doors to the lively hustle and bustle of la ramblas! The roof top bar is a must to quench your thirst while taking in the city view... i could have easily sat there all day drinking mojitos...they are a bit pricey at €14 but definitely the best in town! The staff are so friendly and welcoming they really add to the experience. And the breakfast there is no way any one could leave there with an empty stomach as the range they have is unbelievable and champagne for breakfast what more could a girl want!! Already planning on making a visit back to my favourite spot in barcelona!!
title: This hotel will always be special to me

review: We have just had a super restful weekend at 1898, the staff are amazing esp the desk staff and at the roof bar. Nacho in particular is always happy to helpThe breakfast is great although 24 Euros each is a large amount, Starbucks next door seems very popular as does the supermarket, the restaurant was delicious for Sunday night steak and excellent steak it was.What a location on las ramblas five minute walk to the plaza de Cataluna.My son age 20 and myself mid fifties would definitely stay again although would not choose the hotel for the roof pool, very few deckchairs and no cover however the spa pool and facilities make up for this . Enjoyed by both thank you 1898
title: Wonderful weekend

review: Stayed here for a girls weekend and everything was perfect from when we checked in. All the staff were super nice and helpful. The rooftop pool and bar is beautiful, We really enjoyed cocktails and dinner up there. Highly recommend
title: Amazing Hotel

review: We have stayed at H1898 a number of times now over the past five years and it has always been a pleasure. Great location, great staff, great facilities, great hotel! Highly recommended if you are visiting Barcelona!
title: Excellent

review: We are SO happy with our stay at 1898!! Everything was great! Friendly and service minded staff, everyone I passed on my way smiled and said hello. The spa was amazing, a relaxing "get away" in the hectic city. I would also recommend to book a spa appointment, they were really good. The breakfast is a bit pricy, but it was definitely worth it. I dream about coming back for another stay. Thank you for making us feel so welcome:)
title: Amazing hotel!!

review: The lobby, room, and amenities are top-notch. What makes this hotel superb is the personnel -- who are some of the most competent, efficient, and courteous front desk staff I've ever experienced.The room was quiet, very comfortable, and had the most modern finishes. The top pool/bar was an unexpected plus. the lower level spa was fun for the kids (and adults). Just a great hotel in a great area of Barcelona. An equal to fine hotels anywhere in the world.
title: Simply excellent

review: A surprise 3 night mid week stay for my husbands "significant" birthday!!! So I booked this hotel based on its reviews, position and general description and was hoping for a bit of decadent luxury in great location....we got it!!La Rambla is bustling at any time of day or night but step through the doors of the hotel and you enter a large luxurious open lobby with sofas and decor reminiscent of old colonialism (in a good way) It reflects the building's heritage as an old tobacco company building.The staff were very welcoming, professional and helpful both at check in and out and for advice on good places to eat and city transport. Our room on the 6th floor was a classic room and therefore not huge but plenty big enough and decorated in a cool and relaxing style. The bed was HUUGE and I have to say, having not been sleeping well of late, I had the best 3 nights sleep in a long time!I took advice of other reviews and asked for a quiet room which means it faces away from the noise of La Rambla. The only slight gripe I have is that we seemed to be directly under one of the roof top bar's speakers and whilst the music was by no means loud and didn't at all affect our nights ( by the time we went to bed it was off), the rather monotonous and repetitive music choice did intrude on my siesta ( yep...us over 50s like an afternoon nap!) but earplugs came to the rescue.Talking of the rooftop bar and pool, another well presented area with a selection of comfy loungers round the bar and attentive staff to seat and serve you. Great view from up on the roof. If it's a bit too hot up there, then the underground vaulted roof spa pool provides another area of quiet escape with lovely aromas ,mood lighting and a selection of water jets to soothe the mind and body, particularly the aching feet after a long day of sightseeing. We didn't eat in the hotel only because we like to explore and find new experiences. The food did look good up in Bar Isabella on the roof. Breakfast looked gorgeous but we felt a tad expensive and having usually stuffed ourselves the night beforehand, we needed nothing more than a coffee and a pastry which we picked up from the Carrefour literally 2 mins round the corner (they also do gorgeous fruit slushies there..all sorts of flavours)So would I recommend Hotel 1898? Absolutely. It's not cheap, it's not meant to be...this is a luxurious hotel in a fabulous spot and if it's a special place for a special occasion you are after, look no further.....loved it....oh and so did my surprised hubs!! You're only 50 once!!!
title: An oasis of calm on La Rambla

review: We stayed at this fantastic hotel as part of our anniversary vacation and were extremely satisfied with the choice.The front desk staff greeted spoke excellent English and made check in an absolute pleasure. They assisted with our questions about the hotel and my wife needed to see an emergency dentist which one of the reception staff even arranged for us. I'm sorry I don't recall his name but all the staff were exceptional.We had a balcony room that looked out over the side street below. It was fun to do some people watching from the balcony and this even helped with our restaurant selection, as we could see the popular places below and chose a few places to eat at just from this benefit.The room itself was large for European hotels, with a really comfortable bed and all the things I choose hotels for -a strong safe, bar fridge, kettle and coffee/tea in the room and a hairdryer for my wife. The room was pristinely clean and the bathroom was kitted with quality shampoo/ conditioner/soaps and vanity kit. We chose to have breakfast at small restaurants nearby the hotel every morning as there are many and all of them offered a variety of breakfasts. That said, I'm sure the hotel breakfasts are probably superior quality.We also had some drinks at the rooftop bar a few times and that was awesome to enjoy the views and relaxing atmosphere.The hotel is by the busy Las Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya, so very central and walking distance to all the interesting areas, as well as being about 2 minutes walk from where the tour buses depart. Special thanks to the hotel manager and front office assistant who helped with the dentist recommendation.The spa pool area and shower downstairs made it very convenient to have a few relaxing hours after checking out and being refreshed before a long flight. 10/10! Stylish quality in a perfect area!
title: Luxury hotel in Barcelona

review: After a not so great experience with GO WITH OH, we decided to book in here for a treat and spend the last night as a family group together.The service was impressive from the get go, and loved the interior of the hotel that was a luxurious escape from the city hustle. Loads of options to spend time lounging in and outdoors, with two pools, a small gym, spa and sauna, restaurant, cafe and bars. If you can manage to book a day bed on the roof - the view with a cocktail in hand is a worthy one! It's simply magical to see the sun go down and the city light up!The rooms were a little on the small side, but the plush beds made up for it. Great to get a good night's sleep!The amenities in the room were also great and really appreciated the jug and tea selection in the room, as well as bathrobes for lounging. One confusion was that the staff opened our door to come in on more than one occasion without knocking, which was a little intrusive. It happened almost 4 times during our 3 night stay, and not sure if this is the norm? Aside from that, I would highly recommend this hotel - especially if you want to give yourself a treat, and spend it with loved ones. Barcelona might be Beautiful, but it's also very busy and this was the perfect calm before (and After!) the storm.
title: Beautiful view from the terrace!

review: This hotel is lovely! A perfect location. The rooftop pool and bar had wonderful service and amazing Sangrias! The bed was comfortable, our room had pillow options so my fiance took full advantage. the curtains did a great job blocking out the sun when we wanted to sleep in. The reception staff was very helpful with proving maps, giving directions and making reservations. Our room had a small balcony that allowed us to stand and people watch over Las Ramblas. The breakfast was wonderful with made to order omlettes and many other offerings including dessert. I felt spoiled by the turn down service with chocolates. Our room (442) was facing Las Ramblas and at night we could hear some noise from the street but we loved feeling like we were really in the heart of the city
title: Perfect Stay

review: The hotel is in a great location. It is right by the Plaza de Catalunya and close distance to La Rambla street. We joined the Viator day tour and it was a short 7 mins to walk to the gathering point (musee de la musica) and 15 mins from where they left you (La Pedrera) where along the way we did great shopping. My son was asking for soccer jersey, and if you don't want to pay 90 euros for the official stuff, then the street vendors on the plaza late at the night is the way to go.We got the room with the swimming pool on the balcony. I was a bit disappointed to find out that it wasn't a jacuzzi at first, and it was too cold to use it the first day. But the 2nd day was hot, and after a long day sight-seeing, it was a good place to wind down at the roof top and chill. The key is to use the pool while the sun is still hitting the balcony (before 5:30pm in July).The part that impressed us the most is the customer service by the reception staff. There was a taxi strike from 6am to 6am on our last day, and we needed to get to the airport at 4am for our early flight. The staff suggested Cabify at first (Spain version of Uber), but my husband was cautious and wanted a Plan B. Lo and behold when we tried Cabify at 3:15am, it didn't work (couldn't locate a driver). When we talked to the front desk, they said don't worry they had Plan B ready! During the night they managed to arrange us a private car to the airport. We were so grateful for their resourcefulness and efficiency in helping us catch our flight!
title: Fantastic customer service

review: We booked a suite for 3 nights and had an amazing time. The staff is really polite and observant.The pool area is really cool and relaxing - and the pool bar is an absolute plus.Fitness room has everything you need to keep in shape when away for a few days.We will return for sure!
title: Fantastic Experience

review: Chose the Olivia Balmos primarily for the pool. A delightful space in which to relax after busy days. Extremely friendly staff added to our experience of the hotel. The location was perfect. We would visit again.
title: Delightful stay

review: We stayed at the Olivia Balmes Hotel for the second time and liked it as much as we did the first time!This time we stayed in a standard room with a small balcony on the courtyard side of the hotel - we could even keep the balcony door open during the night, it was so quiet!Again, we were impressed with the high standard of the accommodation, the extra friendly staff at reception and in the restaurant, and the fantastic buffet breakfast. On some mornings we were greeted with a glass of cava first thing. What a nice touch...
title: Wonderful hotel

review: I stayed for 3 nights Location and staff was great. I enjoyed the pool and food. My only disappointment was the bathroom, which I felt was not up to the rating. I asked for a quiet room and was given 307 - a handicap room. The room itself was quiet and clean, but the bathroom looked like it was in the middle of being renovated with bare cement walls and floor. The shower curtain was filthy at the bottom and I asked the staff to exchange, which they did. Otherwise I had a nice stay.
title: Nice Staff and location

review: Returned after a 4 night stay, highly recommend this hotel great location! Room spacious immaculate with comfortable beds. Loved the pool area lack of beds not a problem as people come and go! Breakfast great too! All in all fab place to stay and the staff really are as good as the reviews on here, attentive, helpful and friendly- thanks for for making our stay great!
title: Great Hotel

review: The bed was very comfortable and the room was nicely done, in that boutique-type style that's popular nowadays. Plenty of hot water from the obligatory rain shower head. Staff were friendly and helpful too. Didn't have time to sample breakfast unfortunately, so can't comment on that.
title: Comfy Room, Good Location

review: Our initial disappointment at a very small and narrow lobby was quickly replaced at the delight of a very convenient location, comfortable room and free snacks with beverages almost throughout the day at the Catalonia Square. My husband and I were there for 6 nights, and we will certainly not hesitate to stay there again for when we next visit Barcelona. The front desk staff deserve a pat on the back for going above and beyond their call of duty, with a friendly demeanor at all times. And the welcome bottle of champagne and fruit platter was the cherry on top!
title: Location can't be beat!

review: Perfect hotell in the center of Barcelona. Clean and freshly modern.Nice breakfast and free buffet from 14- 23 every day. Salads,fruits, cakes, sandwiches and wraps free coffie and soda. We even got 2 free bottles of water every morning to bring during our tours in Barcelona.The hotel staff gave great service and were very helpfull in any way.They gave tips and hints of what to do. Lots of smile and always a hello. We felt welcome. Stayed in juniorsuites with a terrace. No view at all, and near by the pool. Some flowers or plants would done it nicer and it could be better to close a gap against nabours terrase but really not a big deal. The good thing was it quiteness. No disturbing sounds. Not even from the poolJuniorsuites with pool are located higher up and towards placa cathalyonia with better view. Then you have the streets outside so i guess it depends on what you like.Be aware the shower and toilet are seperated and it cant bee locked. They are also behind frosted glass. Quite nice and modern. Free locker in the room and they made our beds before night. Free nespresso in juniorsuites.. Got a bottle of cava and fruits upon arrivel. Most priciated.Plenty of towels and beautiful soaps.I will recomend this for couples and even families.
title: Great hotell in the very center of Barcelona.

review: First impression, the reception staff, was really good! Very friendly and helpful, as should be expected.Came up to my room, "junior suite", and the first thing that came to my mind was how small it was. But to be honest, it was enough space, and that is what I care about in the end. Just small for being a suite, so keep that in mind when you book, and might be expecting a larger room. Room was very nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. Free WiFi was fast and reliable, and there is a Nespresso machine in the room as well. I got a welcome gift that consisted of a nice bottle of Cava and fresh fruits to go with this. Very nice of the hotel, and unexpected! The hotel is located perfectly, and you are within walking distance to most of the touristy things. As long as you don't mind walking a bit, everything is within 30min. Right opposite to the hotel there are a large shopping centre.The hotel offers ,free of charge, a buffet from 14:00 - 23:00 that has hot and cold food, sandwiches, smoothies, snacks etc etc. Really good! Breakfast was of the buffet style, with the option to order eggs anyway you want. Selection was ok, but overall I found the breakfast to be a bit of a disappointment. One thing that I find in many hotels, is design before function. And it was the same here when it came to the shower. Even tho there is a door and a ledge that is supposed to stop the water from coming out, and forming a water pool on the floor. It does not work, so every time after a shower, I had a pool of water outside the shower on the floor. Small thing, I know, but I just find it annoying that design goes before function in these kind of things. Overall I had a nice stay for a long weekend, Friday to Monday, and the hotel was all that could be expected with a super location that will be hard to beat! I would stay again without any problem!
title: Right in the centre of things

review: I stayed here with my husband. We had a good time. The hotel was very clean and neat and modern looking, and was in a good location for walking to things. We arrived before check in and they allowed us to store our luggage while we went out to get lunch. The rooftop pool and bar area was very nice. The room was nice and had a huge bathroom. The air conditioner was very cold. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.
title: Nice

review: This hotel had everything you need to make your stay in Barcelona enjoyable. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and spoke English. The roof top pool was perfect. The hotel offers free snacks from 2-10. When I heard that I thought little appetizers but they had sandwiches , salads, hot foods, fruit , yogurt and more. They were amazing. The hotels central location was perfect for walking around.
title: Lovely hotel. Lovely location

review: Lovely hotel, clean, friendly, great rooftop pool. Snacks through the day on the roof. Very relaxed. Never too busy at the pool. Staff were great. Would definitely stay again & recommend to friends in the future.
title: Great Stay

review: Very enjoyable in all aspects. Staff, decor, location. Staff could not have been more accommodating. Very clean and contemporary. Only 6 floors. Small roof-top pool/bar. Location was accessible by walking to all main thoroughfares. Cabs were easy to flag down. Would highly recommend.
title: Great Boutique Hotel

review: We just returned from a 4 night stay at this fantastic hotel. One of the best hotels we've ever stayed at. 1) Very professional staff - they go above and beyond. 2) Large room in a beautiful updated decor. We even had a balcony to step outside on. 3) The rooftop area was fantastic - bartender, complimentary snacks, lounging by the pool, full room service menu available. 4) Nice having a spa in the hotel as well - I booked a foot massage after a long day of walking. 5) The location can't be beat. Easily walk everywhere and to all the major sights. 6) Located on a quiet street! 7) Daily complimentary bottles of water in the room. On the morning we checked out, we were handed two bottles of water for our ride to the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and should we find ourselves in Barcelona again, we would stay here.
title: Unbeatable hotel!

review: The hotel is in the perfect location. It is easy to walk just about everywhere, and is surrounded by the delightful little streets of the Gothic Quarter. It is easy to catch a cab if you are going somewhere more distant as well. The room was very nice, larger than expected. We would definitely stay here again.
title: Best location in the Gothic Quarter

review: Travel all over the world and stay in all types of hotels. This one I can definitely recommend. Location and overall feeling of the hotel. The rooms are a bit small, but very clean and comfortable. Very happy with my choice
title: Choose this hotel

review: We stayed three nights at the Catalonia Magdalenes. Everything was great. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. We even had a room connecting with that of our 2 daughters.The swimming pool on the roof top is small but sufficient to cool after a day of visit and was appreciated a lot by the kids especially with its window on one side, making it look like a giant aquarium.The hotel offers free snacks every afternoon until 23:00. Great too.The rooftop was closed from 18:00 during one of the days of our stay. Not a problem for us, but we found out by chance and it would have been more courteous to inform us when we checked in.
title: Beautiful and great location

review: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at Catalonia Magdalenes in early April. We loved this hotel. Check in was friendly and informative. The room was clean and fresh. The breakfast spread was probably the best we have ever had in Europe and everything was really good and fresh. I really like the snack and drink service offered throughout the day, that was a really nice perk. The rooftop terrace and pool was also a great plus. The location could not be better as we loved being in the Gothic quarter. When I return to Barcelona I will definitely want to stay here again.
title: Awesome stay in Barcelona!

review: Lovely modern hotel with beautiful roof top and plunge pool with free tapas and refreshments from 2pm till 8 pm .good value .Excellent service and perfect location for gothic quarters and the harbour .
title: Fabulous

review: My fiance and I spent two nights here the weekend just gone (the start of the British Summer Holidays!) and had a fabulous time. The staff could not be more helpful on check-in (and throughout) for which we arrived early. Our room wasn't ready so we left our luggage and when we returned we were pleased to find out it had already been taken to our room. Rooms are average size and have everything you need. Bathroom and shower is amazing and toiletries are above average. Bed was large and very comfy! Black out blind is a great touch! Wifi is free and reliable which is always a plus. The rest of the hotel is very pretty and well maintained. Pool and terrace is small but lovely and afternoon nibbles and drinks were very much enjoyed! Location is also superb, walking distance to Plaça de Catalunya, La Rambla and many fantastic bars and restaurants in the Gothic Quarter. You can walk to the beach and harbour, as we did, but it's a little further, say a 20-30 min walk however walking through the beautiful alleyways you don't mind! We can't wait to go back! The only negatives I can think of are: 1. The noise from the hallway was bothersome at times, I think because the hallways aren't carpeted the noise is amplified although this did not affect my sleep quality but I never have a problem sleeping! A lighter sleeper may be woken up. 2. Also, a minuscule detail, my coffee cup wasn't cleaned and milk wasn't replaced which meant I couldn't have a cup of coffee before heading to the airport on our second morning. It wasn't a big deal to me and that's why I didn't call reception to ask and I feel guilty even mentioning it here and I have not let either point affect my 5* rating!
title: Fabulous Weekend!

review: We stayed for 5 nights at The Corner Hotel. The building has undergone a high-end renovation and has a luxurious modern feel. The decor is really quite lovely, especially in the reception and restaurant areas. We had a room at the front of the building on the 6th floor (Superior room), which was very bright, airy and peaceful. There is a rooftop pool on level 7, which is a really nice space and a great place to unwind after exploring Barcelona on foot. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby; we had breakfast at a local cafe each morning, but it's worth mentioning that most places do not open until 9am, so if you're an early riser it might be best to eat breakfast at the hotel. Why did I not rate the hotel 5 stars? The room is very small indeed and does feel pokey, the water pressure in the shower is terrible and there's no iron for guests to use (only a paid laundry service). On the whole however, this is a decent hotel and I would return.
title: Great boutique hotel

review: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights, and loved every minute. Staff were all very friendly, helpful and attentive. Beautifully styled - boutique style, with lots of bare brick, oak and bright furnishings. Our room had Juliette balcony, king size bed and all furnished to a high standard. Everywhere was very clean. Small rooftop pool although service on the rooftop was a bit hit and miss for us. We ate in the ground floor bar area and standard of food and service here was excellent. Breakfast was a veritable feast! Thanks to Vanessa for her cooked to order Spanish omelette too! Hotel is well located for local restaurants, and only a 10 minute walk from Metro station. Would definitely stay here again!
title: A great place to stay!

review: Barcelona is full of nice hotels, but the Corner hotel definitely worth to stop by!Nice decoration and very welcoming staff! Room are clean and good size, I've asked for a quiet one which I got! Only thing is quiet = sad view but in that case I prefer my sleep quality.It was our anniversary and I mentioned it in my booking, a bottle of wine was there for us and I want to thank the hotel for that, very kind and generous! Really appreciated!What I really liked is the terrace and the swimming pool! The waitress Serena is really nice, and she is very patient despite the group that were next to us ( almost rude and noisy). The swimming pool is good to refresh yourself but not big enough for a real swimmer who likes to do length!Only thing that I found a shame is that you can't order food for meal before 1pm in the lobby.. It was Saturday around 11am, we ordered 2 breakfast formulas ( juice coffee and sandwiches) friends joined us and ordered juice coffee and took sandwiches as well. When we went to pay, the waiter charged my friend for each order( one coffee, one juice, one sandwich) because our friend did not mentioned the breakfast formula despite the fact that they had exactly the same as us.... We tried to explained that it is not very goodwill but he ignored us...Overall it was a nice stay and except this waiter the rest of the staff is nice and efficient.
title: Nice place

review: The only thing that would make this Hotel a better experience for a mid price hotel would be a better kitchen. The room service food was disappointing. However everything else here is a winner. Lovely staff, a comfortable hipness. Totally unpretentious yet stylish. The rooms are not huge but tick all boxes, especially the comfortable beds. For a Barcelona beach weekend on a medium budget, this was a find. Oh and the pool is quite nice for a rooftop pool. I would stay here again.
title: Loved it, I'd stay here again.

review: We stayed at the Corner Hotel on the recommendation of a colleague of my wife, who had stayed there in May. The hotel was edgy (dark and black-hued) but warm and welcoming. Our room was small but comfortable, and it had my favorite shower in all of the five cities I visited on this trip!! The only thing missing were washcloths.The staff was VERY helpful with any and all of our needs. The rates were quite reasonable. The hotel was located in the heart of the Eixample neighboorhood and was no more than a 15-20 minute walk to the Metro and about a 30-40 minute walk to Sagrada Familia. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Made us feel comfortable and welcome

review: Amazing hotel located in an excellent location. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Rooms were nicely decorated and toiletries were excellent. Many great food choices within walking distance and La Familia is a $5 taxi ride down the street. Best breakfast buffet I have seen in Spain and probably ranks in top 3 of all my travels! Staff in the breakfast room were attentive and friendly and the food was excellent! Highly recommend the hotel and when in Barcelona will stay here again!
title: Amazing Hotel

review: Very clean, confortable, modern, nice hotel. Rooms and common areas are carefully designed, giving evidence on the materials used. Natural wood is present everywere. Rooms were very silent, also the one with two windows on the main street. Several products, both salt and sweet, are available for the breackfast: quality is very good and the waiters kind and available to satisfy the requests. Finally: the hotel and rooms looks to be better than in pictures.
title: Nice and confortable stay

review: We stayed at the Corner Hotel by chance; our other hotel wouldn't accept a late arrival so we needed somewhere reasonably priced for our first evening in Barcelona. I found it by chance on tripadvisor and was sold by the good reviews. It certainly didn't disappoint.The guy working on the reception desk was very welcoming and helpful, googling some food recommendations for us for a late night bite to eat (his suggestion turned out to be the best meal we had in Barcelona). Our room was clean, modern and felt like brand new and the bed was SO comfortable I never wanted to leave.We had breakfast the next day thinking it was included in our room price (it wasn't) so that was an additional price, but it was very good and our fault for not checking. The hotel even has a rooftop pool which is a nice bonus on a hot day as the location is central and not near the beach. A few more sun loungers would be good though.To summarise we had a very short but very sweet stay at this hotel and I would almost certainly recommend it to anyone coming to Barcelona, I'm glad we were able to stay there.
title: Very short and very sweet stay

review: This was our first time staying at the Corner Hotel and we were treated like old family friends. Indeed, we were treated better than most family friends. The staff were the friendliest, most genuine group of individuals I have encountered working for a hotel. Oh, by the way, did I mention the staff?;) Thank you Vanessa, Lynn and Serenna among many others!As to all the other amenities you expect you expect from a hotel of this standard, they're all present and correct. Rooms are comfortable without being spectacular, but this is Barcelona. Who spends time in their room? The breakfast is excellent. The rooftop pool is a lovely place to relax. The lobby area is a great place to try one of their amazing cocktails.All in all, a wonderful place to stay. Go and stay. You won't regret it!
title: Outstanding service on the Corner!

review: Renovation completed in 2016, this mid size boutique hotel has stylish rooms with a semi industrial chic. Excellent in-room smart TV system features helpful maps & information for the local surrounding area. Pleasant rooftop pool, very sunny, not overshadowed by other buildings, as some city rooftop pools can be. Great buffet breakfasts, but the Mercat del Nino is 200 meters down the road and that is the place for breakfast - fresh orange juice and tortilla espanola with an espresso, superb. The Corner Hotel is in a convenient location in Eixample district, easy walk to metro. Friendly staff.Only two downsides - the free wi-fi seemed to attract dozens of students who are permanently camped in the lobby, order one coffee each all day and never move from their laptops. The lobby bar is comfortable, so you can't blame them, but it is annoying for paying guests. The other downside is the large garbage bins situated just adjacent to the hotel entrance, positioned so you alight from your taxi right next to them.Not recommended for large business groups (unless maybe you are a business student needing wi-fi), as the hotel does not have extensive meeting facilities. However for a weekend break, holiday or any sort of romantic getaway, this is an excellent comfortable hotel.
title: Smart Refurbishment

review: Very comfy beds, big screen TV in room. Clean and tidy with good size toiletries. Free wifi worked fine for us. Free sweets in reception is a nice bonus. Buffet breakfast was lovely. Rooftop pool is great. Swimming pool towels are provided. Good location.Downsides: hairdryer not brilliant for thick hair. No Iron in room. Not much storage space in room. Service on rooftop a bit slow. Only 4 lay down loungers on rooftop and then just chairs. Toilet door opens straight onto toilet basin, watch your toes dont get caught underneath if your partner walks in!
title: Great hotel

review: I spent 4 nights at the Corner hotel during a business trip earlier this year and quickly fell in love! The hotel is beautifully designed and the service is impeccable. The rooms are spacious and comfortable – much like having an apartment of your own in the city. The sound system in the room completes the experience. If you should like to venture outside of your room, the roof features a small pool and great view. As for exploring Barcelona, the hotel is close to Rambla de Catalunya and the Gaudí houses on Passeig de Gracia, and a lovely walk to La Rambla and the Gothic Quarter, or the Sagrada Família in the other direction – what more could you ask for?
title: Could have moved in!

review: The atmosphere is great in this hotel, clean, quiet and the staff are smiling .. close to the city center by foot.The hotel is comfortable and distinctive in terms of design and service that is corner!!lol.....Breakfast is delicious.The hotel is really special and when you go there you will really feel my words!!
title: Special Hotel

review: Fantastic modern Eixample hotel with rooftop pool, attentive staff andy very comfortable room. 7-10 min walk to the closest metro. A little far from more historic areas for walking, but lots of lovely restaurants and shopping areas close by. Casa Batlo and La Pedrera are within easy walking distance. Had a great stay here and will gladly return.
title: Fab Hotel

review: The staff was so nice and helpful and thankfully spoke excellent English. (They even humored us when we attempted Spanish.) The rooms were roomy, comfortable, and clean. The location was close enough to tourist sites to walk, but removed enough to feel like you were getting a taste of local life. And they even gave us a free bottle of Cava to make our honeymoon extra special!
title: They made our honeymoon a dream.

review: My husband and I stayed here for four nights recently. The hotel is a 16 minute walk to the main la ramble strip so not far at all. Lots of lovely restaurants on the way.The hotel is lovely, the rooms weren't huge but well equipped for what we needed. The hotel was quiet for being on the street too.My only negative had to be the roof top pool. It is lovely up there but only has 4 sun loungers which were impossible to get and once someone did they stayed on all day. The rest of the seating is a mixture of table and chairs and deck chairs which were very uncomfortable to try and sunbathe in. I'm not sure why there aren't more sun loungers if it's for space most people were using two decks anyway. One for sitting on and one for legs!The second negative was the pool bar service, we were lucky if bar tender came up once and when he did he waited until he got a lot of orders then got the elevator down 7 floors to bring up your drink. This took about an hour from ordering! We also ordered some tapas to the roof which took about 1 hrs 30 mins to arrive. It's a silly way of doing it. Would be better to not offer the service and let people take their own drinks to the pool , which people were doing. Or have it manned from lunch time.Other than the roof top issues we would return here as everything including staff were very good with the hotel but could be amazing if the roof issues were resolved.
title: Beautiful hotel

review: We loved our stay here! The staff was super helpful & welcoming from the moment we checked in right through our stay. Roger at the front desk was awesome. He recommended some great restaurants & helped us coordinate our day trips (he showed us exactly what metro lines to take, which ticket options were the best value & printed out timetables for us). The hotel itself is great - very modern yet cozy. The beds & pillows were super comfortable & everything was very clean & well kept. The rooms even have Bluetooth speakers built in, which was a nice touch. Would definitely stay here again!
title: Lovely hotel & wonderful staff!

review: What a great hotel. Only 8 months old when we visited in July, 2017. Great decor in the common areas as well as the room. Room was well appointed. Staff was excellent–very helpful. Seems to cater to English speaking audience. I really like the location. It's walking distance to the Gran Via and la Pedrera, some good restaurants and shops and the metro. It's a manageable moderate to long walk to the city centre and Barcelonita. I liked that it was a bit away from all the craziness. Seems just the right size, too. Raul at the front desk was very helpful with suggestions on things to visit and places to eat. Natalia in the ground floor restaurant was just as helpful. The rooftop terrace with small pool was a great place for the evenings. I would stay here again.
title: Fantastic Hotel

review: Loved this trendy hotel. Very clean and nice. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic and well worth the money. The drinks were just a bit too expensive on the rooftop, although we enjoyed being up there. All in all, a great stay.
title: Fantastic Hotel

review: Stayed at this lovely hotel for 6 nights. Staff at check in was so nice, we where early, but got upgradet without extra cost and got the room right away. The room was on the 4th floor, no problem with the lifts, right at the corner of the building and had a litlle balcony. Clean, nice room and you couldn´t even hear the noice from the street. The bed was amazing and with the pillow menu, you are guaranteed a good nights sleep.Breakfast was very nice, the selection of tea could have been better (nespresso coffee, but small boring teabags?). Homemade jam, juices and eggs right of the stove. Nothing to complain about.The pool is a realy nice plus, when you have been walking around the city all day and can take a nice cooling dip. Only minus here, was that there almost never where any staff at the bar or any to clean up. People just left there towels everywhere, so you thought that all the deck chairs was taken. The hotel is located near a stop, when you come with the aerobus from the airport. Nice neighbhorhood, with good restaurants and a nice atmosphere. Short walk to main attracions.For an even better stay, a bathrope would have been nice, when going to the pool.
title: Great hotel and staff

review: We stayed at the Corner Hotel for 5 nights at the end of June 2017. We loved it. The hotel is simply amazing. Modern and stylish, great lobby with casual lounge area for relaxation and drinks, nice roof top pool and sun deck. The room was small, but well equipped and comfortable, lots of storage space and most comfortable bed I have ever slept in besides my own. Great location with close proximity to major attractions.Most friendly and helpful reception desk .Special thanks to Roger and Lynn who couldn't be more professional ans sweet, giving us directions along with a helpful map, ensuring we won't get lost in a city and facilitating in our every need. I could go on but suffice it to say I was very pleased with our stay, I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.
title: Modern, Stylish, Great Service

review: Everything was great about the hotel. Our room was spacious, well appointed and comfortable. High tech (though we never could master the Bluetooth). The staff was incredibly helpful - we had a lot of questions of where to go, what to see and they went out of their way to help. Lobby was nice - lots of people there using wifi and having coffee. The food (breakfast) was tasty - we sampled just a few of the pastries. Convenient location.
title: Fantastic place to stay

review: Stayed here for two nights before a cruise out of Barcelona. Hotel is beautiful, staff are friendly and helpful. We even got a free upgrade to the coveted corner room! The room was very large and modernly designed. Excellent closet space and large bathroom with beautiful windows overlooking the street. Best part of the room - the amazing beds!!! Best sleep I had during my entire trip. Saturday night there was live music playing in the lobby lounge area. After a long days of sightseeing we would relax in the rooftop pool and have a drink. Great location around some of the best restaurants and short walk to the sites. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona and I can't wait to be back again soon!
title: Amazing hotel!!

review: I stayed at the Corner hotel for few nights with my boyfriend and we loved it. Friendly staff, cool interior, clean and chic. Pool terrace on the rooftop was our favourite. I'll definitely wanna stay here when I next time visit Barcelona.
title: Amazing hotel

review: The whole hotel is just lovely, the decor matches all over the hotel and is beautiful. The staff were very helpful, friendly and spoke English perfectly, putting our lack of Spanish speaking to shame. The hotel is really well located, you can easily walk into the centre or get the metro (metro station is around a 10 minute stroll). The best point about the location is the vast amount of excellent restaurants situated around the hotel. Ranging from Michelin starred to delicious pizza. We visited mid price restaurants, which were all lovely. Check out trip advisor reviews of restaurants, there are a lot of 5* rated places. This will be my first choice when returning to Barcelona! Enjoy, you won't want to leave :)
title: Nicest hotel I've ever stayed in.

review: A very convenient hotel with a good location, clean rooms along with excellent service.Additionally breakfast was also nice with a good selective variety.Special thanks for the champagne on my birthday !
title: Boutique Hotel

review: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights at the end of July 2017 and were joined by our Son & Daughter for 1 night.I had seen this Hotel on a previous trip to Barcelona, but had not previously stayed and the reviews suggested that it was worth trying - it definitely was.The Corner Hotel has that perfect mix of being professional and relaxed and I would certainly want to stay there at any future visit. Service was excellent - particularly Lynn on Reception who just stood out in her desire to ensure that everything was great throughout our visit.All areas of the Hotel have clean, relaxed and modern, contemporary décor which works for anyone - you can be young and fashionable or 'more mature' and experienced and still feel comfortable at this Hotel.There is also a great pool area on the top of the Hotel to while away some relaxed time swimming, taking in the sun, enjoying a drink or all three! :-)
title: Excellent Hotel - relaxed, engaging and with great service

review: I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Barcelona whether it's for business or leisure as it has everything you need. When we arrived we were told we had a free rom upgrade which was nice and they had no trouble helping us sort out things in our room. The receptionist, Lynn, couldn't have been more helpful! She printed a booking out for us, for an event that we'd forgotten to print the tickets for, as well as help us find the best ways to get to places we wished to visit, all in all very helpful and she made our stay easy. The breakfast was nice and there was a choice of cooked breakfast, fresh fruit, breads, cheeses, meats etc the only downside was the it seemed quite expensive at €16 each when I don't normally eat a lot for breakfast, €16 seemed a lot for toast and a cup of tea, but it was still very convenient and a nice atmosphere.The roof top terrace is very nice and got very busy (no loungers left, only tables and chairs) but I wasn't bothered. Overall the hotel is very smart and sophisticated, the rooms replicate this also, big beds, lovely plush bathrooms and furniture too. We were even given a complimentary bottle of Cava on our last night which was nice. The location of the hotel is good, it's about a 5/10 minute walk to the main shopping street (if that's your thing) and about 10 minutes from the Universitat which makes it easy to catch any buses or anything. Overall get yourself a room at The Corner Hotel it is worth the visit!
title: Great stay - definitely worth a visit

review: Stayed here for 5 nights in August with my wife. From when we arrived to when we left the service was excellent. We had a superior room which while not spacious had one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in, a lovely bathroom and a large flatscreen tv (albeit every Chanel was Spanish but we were in Spain lol), the tv did have youtube and an HDMI in so you could watch stuff for the web or plug something in if you wanted. There was also a window which opened onto a small ledge. The bar done fantastic cocktails and had a well thought out selection of spirits and beers. The rooftop pool was fantastic to go and chill out on after a day of sightseeing. We didn't have dinner at the hotel but did have breakfast one morning which was excellent also, great selection of continental, cooked, pastries and even a selection of sandwiches and cakes, we pinched a couple of raspberry muffins on the way out to have with coffee in the afternoon! Location wise the hotel is in a central part of town, minutes walk from Passé de Gracie with its designer shops and Gaudi exhibits and also where the tourist buses stop. It's about 5 minutes in a cab (€7) from the hustle and busily of La Ramble and 10 minutes (€11) from the port and Barceloneta. Outstanding hotel, loved it.
title: Superb Hotel, really can't fault it.

review: Stayed three nights for our first visit to Barcelona. Found it on TA and could not have been happier. Lovely hotel with great staff......room had great bed, pillows, beautiful bathroom and shower. My husband took advantage of the rooftop pool. We did not have the breakfast buffet but opted for the smaller breakfast in the lobby bar. It was delicious. Their cakes are wonderful. As others have said "clean and chic".......it's a nice boutique hotel, feels like home. Also close to Paco Meralgo tapas restaurant where we had dinner two of our three nights in Barcelona. Lynn at the front desk had recommended it and we were not disappointed. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Highly recommend

review: We loved every minute at the Corner hotel. The staff was amazing. Friendly, attentive and willing to help. Vanessa from the bar and breakfast area was very sweet. The front desk staff was very helpful and made a reservation for us for dinner at a really great spot, 2254 restaurant. The decor is stunning, the pool area is lovely but they really need umbrellas. The drinks and breakfast were delicious. Everything is so stylish and clean. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
title: Can't wait to return

review: The hotel offers excellent services. The staff is very welcoming and always listen to the needs of the clients. The breakfast is varied and very good. The room was beautiful, very quiet (the staff agreed to gives us another room with a view on the inner courtyard - Thanks again !) and impeccably clean.Moreover, there is a small swimming pool at the top of the hotel if you want to enjoy the sun.Briefly, I would strongly recommend this hotel for your stay in Barcelona.
title: This hotel deserves its reputation

review: This is a lovely hotel steps from two of Gaudi's Casas and within walking distance of the Sagrada Familia. Very modern decor and facilities. Reception staff was young, friendly and very professional. Comfortable lounge area and excellent breakfast. Taxi stand out front. Restaurants all about. We were here one night post cruise, arrived early and left bags. They were in our room when we returned at two. We highly recommend this hotel.
title: Gem near Gaudi's Casas

review: Not only is the hotel within walking distance of well known Gaudi houses and the Sagrada Familia, it is a few strides from the underground and mainline railway station. This makes getting from and to the airport very easy. The hotel itself is modern and comfortable with helpful staff. The breakfast room was a little more like a lounge and could be busy, but the food was good with plenty of choice and cheery waiting staff. Highly recommended.
title: Perfect location for exploring Barcelona

review: The hotel is located on the premiere street of Barcelona,Passeig de Gracia., which is known for its shopping, restaurants and Spanish architecture.It is a small boutique hotel,which has an awning in front with the hotel name. Then several magnificent doors, but at first try none seem to open! It's tricky.The lobby is small, but there is a breakfast room on the next floor up which is a lounge with coffee, tea and cold flavored waters during the day and Cava from 6:00-6:30 every evening. We arrived in the early am, and since our room was not available, our luggage was stored. The front desk associates would not confirm what floor our room was on, but indicated that the Jr . Suites were only on one of two floors, one of which was the first floor, which was not acceptable to us. It was puzzling, since we were the first to check-in why we could not have the room we had requested. However, upon check-in, . We did in fact get that room.The reception associates are quite helpful with reservations and directions. The breakfast buffet was plentiful with pastries, meat, cheese yogurt, cereals and eggs on request.Our room was quite contemporary, keeping with the hotel decor. There was a king size bed,a nice television, a closet and no drawer space, if a guest weto stay more than a few days. We did not,so the space was fine.The bathroom had a tub/ shower with a ceiling rainfall shower and a handheld as well as a bidet. The toiltetry kit was pretty extensive.Our Jr. Suite had a deck with one lounge chair and a table with chairs. It looked out on the back of buildings, which was a disappointment. Somehow from previous TA comments, I was expecting a view of rhe avenue.The room was very quiet.The hotel manager sent cava to the room, as well as some candy, a very nice touch.One disapppointmeny was a bed cover that was soiled. It was obvious and should not have stayed in the room.Overall, the hotel experience was quite good. I would skip the Jr suite and just go with a nice room in the future.
title: Contemporary neighbor of Gaudi

review: Excellent location, great room and breakfast was first class. My 15 yr old daughter suffers with coeliac disease and they catered for her at breakfast very well. The staff were also very helpful with travel advice and eating out in the local area.
title: Great hotel

review: the decor and serviices were al excellent as was the hotel's central location to all sites and conveniences. If back again to Barcelona we will definitely consider it. One problem , I was quoted 68 euro for private transport to the airport . The driver demanded 80 euros at the airport. Somebody was mistaken. pleas resolve
title: 62 review

review: It was pretty impressive overall: the service, decor, comfort, every detail they have in the room. I really had a great short time in Barcelona and a lot had to do with this hotel. Kudos to the staff and management!
title: Positively impressed!

review: We stayed here in December 2016 after a NCL cruise. For an old building with a long history, this hotel was modern, welcoming, functional and for a family like us, 9 pax, it was ideal.The rooms were very modern with great features, good sized bathrooms and a small lounge and work area.One of the best features of this property, besides the perfect location, is the restaurant area that is open for breakfast and then snacks throughout the day, which made it a great meeting point for our family.Little aspects of the hotel, like the running group on Wednesday mornings, made me really enjoy this property too.
title: Favourite Hotel in Barcelona
